1.description: Beauty Lab is a wonderous place!!!!  My skin never looked/felt better!  Great service and a welcoming vibe.  Tiffany is the best!

2.description: Tiffany owns her craft! I have ultra sensitive skin and the products she uses take that into consideration. My skin looks and feels fantastic!

0.description: I can't say enough good things. I first visited beauty lab about a month ago with my sister, I got a facial she opted for a peel. Afterwards my skin felt and looked wonderful, I had an absolute glow. People kept telling my sister she looked 10 years younger so of course I had to head back for a peel and now people are telling me I look 20 years younger. Sssh don't tell my sister. This is a quaint little place, it's a one room salon so don't expect all the frills like other high priced salons but that's the beauty you also won't have to expect the high price tag that comes along with all those frills. She offers an array of services meso therapy, and an ultrasonic facial are 2 on my to do list. Do yourself a favor and set aside an hour to pamper yourself believe me your skin will thank you.

3.description: What a hidden gem, nestled on a corner in a residential neighborhood in Bridgeport. During my first visit, my objective was to score some fig Christmas cookies known as cuccidati, and unfortunately they were sold out. Not to be denied, I bought a cookie assortment of a dozen treats, and every single one was delicious, and nostalgically reminded me of my childhood, and the holiday treats my Sicilian mom would make every year at Christmastime. I will be returning to Biscotti's as soon as they have cuccidati, and will come back here with an update. In summary, though, I now have a new favorite bakery, and it's located in Bridgeport!

1.description: Bought a platter of various cookies for my daughters communion party and they were a hit.  They presented the platter very elegantly and it looked great on my dessert table.  There were a variety of homemade fresh cookies, including crescents with powered sugar, nut sugar type cookies, and lemon cookies.  The owner was very friendly and eager to share the history of the store.  I will definitely be back for more...only when I am hosting a party.  Otherwise, I wouldn't be able to control myself and eat the platter in a matter of days.

2.description: The best italian cookies I've ever had! Nut cups, biscotti and crescents are my favorite. And they're meant to be dry hence perfect for dipping in espresso or cappuccino. The staff is super nice and they make everything there! I ordered a platter and it was beautifully presentable as a centerpiece.

9.description: Amazingly yummy cookies and the guy who owns it is always really nice. He gives my kids free samples, and it's just a nice little place to rely on for party platters of pretty and scrumptious cookies!

10.description: The best cookies in the city.  This is one of those places that you must make the trip to visit and grab a tray or two.  It is so very worth it.  Very authentic.

4.description: Still five stars! I stop by here every time I'm in the area and they're open. It's almost a year now that we've been house hunting in the area. We may have found a place. The good news is it's within walking distance here, the bad news, is just the same. Well at least I'll have to walk. I can consume these cookies pretty much as a meal.Which by the way brings me to the ravioli, which is also very good by the way. However, life is short eat dessert first!

6.description: Hey Guys,This place was on the Chicago's Best TV show. The store is very small  You can order a dozen different cookies, then you've basically  tasted the store,That's what I did, But does not include cakes!  I didn't even see cakes. The Nut Cups where the featured item on the TV Show and everything I selected in my dozen, became my favorite! Sorry, I can't remember all the names. Whatever you buy, you just can't go wrong. And if  Marie is there, she will convince you with awesome samples. What a wonderful person. I spent about $8.50 for the Dozen. But I'm really confused about the store hours, Not consistent!

12.description: I live directly next door to this place, and on summer days when the windows are open i am treated to the greatest air freshener available. This place smells amazing!!!! I stop in about once a week, grab a few on the way out etc. The ravioli is also really really good, and makes for a great quick dinner when I'm in a hurry. The owner mentioned possibly adding a gelato stand next summer. it just keeps getting better.

5.description: DELICIOUS! I had the pleasure of walking in to this establishment and meeting the friendly owner and trying their tasty cookies. I bought a dozen and asked for one of each. The guy was nice enough to throw in some extra goodies for my hubby and kid. We finished all the cookies in 2 days! He recommended I eat them with coffee but they didn't make it that far. The pastry cups were our favorites and the fact that this place is down the block from my apartment is definitely a plus. They just gained 3 new fans and they will definitely be getting more of my business.

11.description: I can't wait to go back home to my folks, which is mere steps away from biscotti's galore. This is a true representation of what Bridgeport has to offer: authentic Italian food from families that made the neighborhood what it is today. You can't beat these cookies!

8.description: Love love love their cookies. I also heard a rumor that they had ravioli -- but they sold out quickly. I got mini trays for my wedding reception, and they were the talk of the night. While many of my relatives love the Cucidati and say they're the best they've had, I know several of my friends and husband's family wouldn't have cared for them. We got the lemon and brown cookies and they were a huge hit. The owner is great and very responsive! Glad to see another review for this small Bridgeport bakery.

0.description: Wonderful Biscottis for under $10, can't beat it.  It's a great place to stop by after classes.  My girlfriend and I had frequent here several times a week during finals.  The owner is the friendliest, always cheerful and glad to give samples.  Tip well!I highly recommend the "Nut Cups" with powdered sugar.  They're to die for.

7.description: Great service! Delicious cookies. I could eat them everyday.

58.description: Came here after a long day on the south side. It was late, I was hungry and crabby and someone recommended a good pizza place. Done.I would not waste my calories on this again. The restaurant was run down. I'm okay with hole in the wall type restaurants, but not when they are dirty and overall unfriendly. I was starving so asked for breadsticks while waiting for our pizza, unfortunately they never came. By the time the pizza arrived, I didn't care. The pieces of sausage were gigantic to the point that it completely took over the entire pizza. It was greasy and at times, almost inedible. We ended up taking over half of it with us and pitching it the following day.Extremely disappointing for Chicago, land of pizza.

56.description: Late night, looking for some serious south side pizza? Stop by this joint. They hooked my wife and I up! We had some veggie pizza (We had decided to forgo meat for the week), and though this was against my very being, it was actually darned tasty! Looking forward to my next journey into the city for a pizza treat!

29.description: Hmmm, I would've liked to try Phils, but they hung up on me the first time and didn't answer the second time. So I guess if they had answered the phone, I could've experienced their food. Now I just get to rate their POOR customer service.

42.description: Great pizza but RUDE and RACIST staff! I ate in and noticed how the staff (older lady) greeted every white customer with a "hello ma'am, hello sir, Yes Sir, Yes Ma'am".  Every other customer wasn't even greeted and all of their responses to them were short and cold.  Racism is alive and well in Bridgeport.

23.description: this pizza place does not give a fuck about you... understand?they do not care about customers and will eventually go out of businessno credit/debit cards accepted!!! they don't want your money!!!!!they are too LAZY to set up a simple swipe card machine to accept debit/credit cards.or they are trying to cheat on their taxes by being "cash only" they don't wanna pay taxes but screw you, you pay taxes, not them, right?

47.description: Five stars all around. The pizza here was great and the service was prompt. The sauce wasn't too sweet or spicy. We had garlic and tomatoes, great combination. I would highly recommend this great neighborhood pizza place.

8.description: I also meant to say this neighborhood pizza joint competes and beats the big Chicago names! All the marketing those places do has to compete with 4 pizza ovens and some Chicago pizza makers bar none.....throw some anchovies on there and you'll be back to age 5....Pepperoni,sausage and cheese is to DIE for!!!!

31.description: Ignorant employees that make you want to choke them out and make them do The Chicken. The sausage on their pizza is the size of golf balls. It is so delicious I endure the horrible people that work here. My favorite is the sausage and mushroom pizza.

34.description: Ordered a few weeks ago. A thick curly hair arrived to my house IN my pizza.First and last order il ever make to Phils

16.description: Hmmm, I would've liked to try Phils, but they hung up on me the first time and didn't answer the second time. So I guess if they had answered the phone, I could've experienced their food. Now I just get to rate their POOR customer service.

13.description: Best pizza, we order at least 3x a week from here either to my store or home. I am glad I work out 2x a day 6x a week. Small prize to pay just So I can indulge on their pizza.

11.description: Get the supreme. Loaded with goodness. Every time I visit Chicago I make a stop, or two, at Phil's pizza!

39.description: Phil's pizza is the best tasting pizza in bridgeport and McKinley Park. Nice, classic, cheesy, greasy. Love the retro Chicago photos in there, too. Only downside is a cash only policy.

37.description: Price is a bit high but you pay for what you get!! If you are ever in Bridgeport try it. They don't skimp on the toppings at all!

0.description: atmosphere is actually pretty cool - i think it used to be a bank. pizza was good, affordable - 14 bucks for a pepperoni pizza, garlic bread, and a liter of soda. i think the same woman who others have complained about took my order, but i thought she was pretty funny. she also had a good rapport with other people who came in, and i could tell that most of the people who were there were regulars/came in ofter and she knew them. all in all, a cool neighborhood joint that i will definitely be returning to.also, like every else has said - bring cash! there is an ATM in the restaurant but i am sure the fee is outrageous.

38.description: Really good thin crust South Side pizza. Lots of flavor... Possibly the most toppings I've ever seen (so much sausage!) The reason I can't give it five stars is that the sausage didn't have all that much flavor. As you work your way to the outside of the slice, the taste changes from savory to sweet as there is a higher sauce to cheese ratio, so the flavors change within each slice and you don't get bored. The restaurant is as no frills as it gets. No cups, no tap water, just tin foil, a pizza in paper and a bottle of soda. Classic south side pizza place.

51.description: Phil's pizza it's where it's at! Great pizza and service in my opinion. Although the cash only can be a headache at times, I don't mind because the pizza is totally worth it! Pizza is always fresh out of the oven even when delivered! I prefer a good spicy pizza and Phil's is always on the money with that. Phil's is my number 2 in Bridgeport for sure!

27.description: Phil's pizza is one of the best pizza place in Bridgeport. They put sooo much topping for such a great low price. Cash only would only be the only downside to Phil's.

32.description: Once in a very very blue moon I splurge allowing myself pizza & calories. ..... sadly mine just wasn't worth it today ; ( crust was hard and dry like cardboard.  Something wasn't right.

54.description: If I can give them a zero I would have. They messed up my order by saying it was never called in. Then, once I placed my order again, I asked if they accepted debit. Maybe I should have said debit card, because once I got there they said they ONLY accepted cash? Lames! What kind of business only accepts cash? A dirty one! Never again will I order here.

48.description: I am a fan of pizza. You might say we're involved. So I do NOT like giving a pizza place 2 stars. In fact, it should likely be less, but I just cannot bring myself to give one star to pizza.We arrived, and had to park on the street. The building looks pretty dilapidated, but that has never stopped me before. We went in and ordered a large 'za with half olives and half pepperoni. First things first... They only accept cash but did not tell us until our order was placed, and there were no signs to indicate this. I can handle that, no big deal. It took about 20 minutes for our pizza to be made, so we sat in the restaurant area at one of the tables.The entire establishment was extremely dirty. From the floors which were housing 2 buckets to catch water coming through the roof, to the tables which were absolutely filthy, to the restrooms that literally almost made me vomit.... this place was just dreadful. I am sort of a germiphobe, so it took every ounce of strength I had in me to stay.When our pizza came out, I was so excited! It looked absolutely delicious! But looks can be deceiving, and it was awful. The crust tasted like stale bread, the cheese tasted cheap and rubbery, and the pizza was literally dripping with grease. Even with all of the grease, this pizza had little taste at all to it. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants good pizza, or wants to eat in a somewhat clean environment.

44.description: Pizza night, the best night of the week!!! We wanted to try something new so we fell upon Phils pizza and ordered a simple yet delicious large sausage pizza.  We made our order for pick up and it was ready in 30 minutes as they said.  This place is NOT stingy with their sausage, just how I like it.  The crust was perfectly crisp and the sauce to cheese ratio was on point.  We ate the left overs the next morning, Breakfast of champions!!!  If you like thin crisp, greasy pizza with a lot of meat, this is the spot.  I'll be back Phil's!

24.description: I have to say that this is probably the best thin crust pizza I've had in my area, when it comes to greasy and tasty it doesn't get much better than their sausage & pepperoni, I've ordered from other places in my neighborhood (south loop) and really it comes down to Phil's unless you want deep dish. And even though they're mildly rude on the phone which is why I deducted a star the quality of their food makes up for it, they're also strictly cash but I don't mind since they're not pricey at all in my opinion. I've also tried their beef and it's pretty good as well, the fries pair up with either the pizza or the beef and if you can make all this work the way they do then I think it's a job well done. They just have to work on their customer service is all, either way I'm still ordering regularly since it's not at a make or break point for me.

7.description: All i got too say is you see it looks good taste even better. Had chesse sausage an pepperoni o my it's good

49.description: Some good solid thin crust pizza.  It's pretty damn greasy, especially if you get their sausage but so delicious.  Perfect amounts of cheese and they stack their meat on.They are pretty old school and can come off rude on the phone at first but don't let that stop you from ordering from here.  The jumbo pizza is HUGE.  I usually get the sausage with garlic.  They usually load it with both, so you should probably ask for easy garlic.

40.description: Woman at counter was incredibly rude, almost considered leaving. This place has an overwhelming smell of burnt dough. Horrible ambiance, all I can hear is the staff talking about their thyroid problems. Would give one star but the food was okay, pizza is really greasy and bland.  the menu is very underwhelming. There aren't a lot of toppings to choose from and it bugs me that it says "sandwich's" on the menu. Even if the staff had been polite this place does not earn 3 stars in my opinion.

53.description: This is my go to pizza place for take out.  Yes the dine in area is lacking.  Yes the service could use  some smiles.  But the pizza itself is the star of the show.  They lay on the toppings and the price is right.  I haven't tried any of the sides or entrees.  I can only attest to the deliciousness of what is known as their thin crust sausage and garlic.  I know it may not sound good.  I balked at that idea myself until I tried it.  Was hooked after my first bite.

30.description: Seriously???  Have had pizza all over Chicago and this is the most over rated pizza I've ever had. Not terrible, average at best.

46.description: Wow ten years living in the neighborhood and today my first time eating this pizza is like I believe in god again

1.description: The place is located in a shady like place, but the pizza is to die for. I do not know what blend of cheese they use but the pizza is good cold or hot. The generous helping of meat that Phil's pizza gives compared to other pizza joints is a difference you can notice. The tomato sauce could clearly be tasted so I am very happy about that. Overall the pizza is great, I would recommend anyone to try their pizza.The restaurant dining is much left to be desired. The tables are plain and it seems like it was not meant to have people sit down and eat. This is a place you clearly want to do a pick up and eat at home kind of place. Also be careful of the times they are busy. When they are it takes them an extra 15-20 min to get your order ready. The delivery time is not much better, expect 1hr 30 min to 2hr 30 min delivery times. I find that it is much faster picking it up.Phil's pizza only accepts cash, so be ready to have some on hand.

55.description: Phil's is really great pizza!  Very fresh ingredients!  The sausage...oh my.....huge chunks if delicious, fresh meat!  The crust is buttery and crisp.  The sauce is perfect...not too tangy/sweet/salty.  The Phil's team is very nice and cordial, and the restaurant is very clean.  I wish they would deliver to Bronzeville, as we're only 10 minutes away.  However, in the interim, I will continue to happily venture to Bridgeport to pick up my pizza.

9.description: Priced, prepared and served in your favorite style of cut (slices ir squares), Phil's Pizza is old-school pizza that takes some of us down memory lane, when mom & pop pizza joints were neighborhood fixtures. Phil's Pizza delivers on quality, quantity, and toppings and customer service a the way things were done before computers were running everything, and real people interacted, and it was a good thing!Whenever I want that thin crust pizza that completely satisfies, Phil's Pizza will get my call. Did I mention cash-only? Totally old-school.

26.description: This is a great go to pizza place. Co-workers and I always order it, and I think that it is highly underated.

25.description: Priced, prepared and served in your favorite style of cut (slices ir squares), Phil's Pizza is old-school pizza that takes some of us down memory lane, when mom & pop pizza joints were neighborhood fixtures. Phil's Pizza delivers on quality, quantity, and toppings and customer service a the way things were done before computers were running everything, and real people interacted, and it was a good thing!Whenever I want that thin crust pizza that completely satisfies, Phil's Pizza will get my call. Did I mention cash-only? Totally old-school.

12.description: The pizza is delicious here. I always order it to go, and I get it pretty quickly. The only bad thing is that sometimes the person taking the orders is rude and can rush you as well. Other than that great place. Their sausage is awesome as well.

59.description: Best pizza ever!!! My husband bought the pizza one day and took it home. Im really hard on pizzas but this one actually was great i can eat a lot of this pizza it tastes awesome. Now if i want pizza it has to be from here!!

21.description: I was introduced to Phil's Pizza by my boyfriend. I lived in the city of Chicago for awhile now and have tried multiple pizza places. Phil's by far is the best pizza I have had. We go at least twice month or even more. The staff knows us by name. They see us walk in the door and great us nicely. All these negative reviews are not very accurate. They are constantly busy from the moment they open. I love Phil's and will continue to go.

17.description: I am a fan of pizza. You might say we're involved. So I do NOT like giving a pizza place 2 stars. In fact, it should likely be less, but I just cannot bring myself to give one star to pizza.We arrived, and had to park on the street. The building looks pretty dilapidated, but that has never stopped me before. We went in and ordered a large 'za with half olives and half pepperoni. First things first... They only accept cash but did not tell us until our order was placed, and there were no signs to indicate this. I can handle that, no big deal. It took about 20 minutes for our pizza to be made, so we sat in the restaurant area at one of the tables.The entire establishment was extremely dirty. From the floors which were housing 2 buckets to catch water coming through the roof, to the tables which were absolutely filthy, to the restrooms that literally almost made me vomit.... this place was just dreadful. I am sort of a germiphobe, so it took every ounce of strength I had in me to stay.When our pizza came out, I was so excited! It looked absolutely delicious! But looks can be deceiving, and it was awful. The crust tasted like stale bread, the cheese tasted cheap and rubbery, and the pizza was literally dripping with grease. Even with all of the grease, this pizza had little taste at all to it. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants good pizza, or wants to eat in a somewhat clean environment.

10.description: Change the ignorant bad attitude cashier! Nasty attitude just to answer a simply question! Now I understand why nobody is in the restaurant eating!

5.description: On a visit to Chicago I promised my daughter we would have an original Chicago pizza, and Phil's didn't let us down.We ordered the medium cheese. The cheese and sauce were top notch. The crust was more towards a traditional "savory" style. Unlike the sweeter modern crust. There is a large simple dinning room for busy Friday and Saturday nights.The staff was friendly and easy to talk to.

3.description: The pizza speaks for itself. It's my first time eating Phils pizza. Only problem is the annoying/rude short girl who takes the orders. She has an attitude when taking orders. Regardless, I will still order pizza again. The sausage pizza is AMAZING. My family and I will probably just order delivery next time so we don't have to deal with the rude girl behind the counter.

35.description: We just got out pizza delivered to us. It was two hours late and luke warm but it was still delicious. We ordered a large three topping pizza,garlic bread and a 2 liter Pepsi plus delivery for under $25. Nice. And you ask why not 5 stars because unlike everyone else in my house I love extra pizza sauce. Otherwise delicious!!!!!

19.description: Had a craving for pizza and decided to try a new place. I had a small pepperoni pizza. I saw the reviews for best pizza in Chicago. I wouldn't go that far but it was good pizza....lol. FYI the pizza comes in a bag instead of a box so be gentle when driving.

28.description: Delicious pizza. We carried out and brought our pizza to Maria's, it was a glorious combo.

45.description: Vito and who??? Hands down! No question! Phils is the best pizza in all of Chicago! Not just from me, but everyone else who's had both agrees as well.

33.description: I love Phil's Pizza. I live in Sauganash and when I'm on the south side I'll order then pick up a pizza. What a treat.

43.description: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE....CHECK YOUR ORDER!!! I ordered a half and half pizza today and didn't receive what I ordered. When I called back the rep who took my order remembered my order and apologized. She told me that I can get a $5 credit or bring the pizza back... I brought it back not knowing I was gonna have to pay for another pizza because my family didn't want the incorrect one. ..we never touched one slice of the Wrong pizza... I brought it back and she said $14 bucks... I was lost and Mindy the rep was lost too. She knew that was Wrong and told me $10... Then when I called again after I realized I was bamboozled a guy said I should've eaten the right side since I ended up paying again... smh.... if I was Told I was gonna pay for a new pie less $5... I definitely would have eaten the correct side and only returned the wrong one.... just drove 8 miles to pay for another pizza that they made incorrectly the first time.... I ordered a pizza at 6pm didn't eat till 12am... Customer Service goes along way so I don't think I will be bragging about Phil's Pizza anymore......smh... Just didn't seem fair to cheat the customer!!! Especially if they messed up the order!! $34 for one Large pizza... yeah they got over on me and after reading other reviews... I'm just gonna take it as a loss on cash and a good pizza joint.

2.description: Going to make this short and sweet...Best pizza on the Southside! And, they were open Christmas Eve to deliver me a pizza after a long day's work. Thank you.I will come back to add more later but that made me so happy I had to post now.

18.description: Ordered a few weeks ago. A thick curly hair arrived to my house IN my pizza.First and last order il ever make to Phils

41.description: The pizza is always hot when delivered and has an enormous portion of toppings. Their hot wings are actually spicy and the delivery time has always been reasonable. We order from here regularly.

52.description: one of the best places for thin crust in the city, their crust is thick, very similar to beggar's, you get a healthy amount of toppings as well, and the peppers are sliced and not diced, in addition it's very reasonably priced for the amount you get, definitely the best pizza place in bridgeport

50.description: I write this review as my family finishes the last pizza from Phil's we'll ever buy.Here is my story.Earlier this evening, none of the adults in our house wanted to get off our chubby cabooses to cook a healthy meal. Pizza night. We have had pizza from Phil's a few times but each time had been delivery. It was a cool summer night out so we decided we would pick it up this time instead.I called in my order and spoke to a man on the phone. The time was 7:20 pm. A large special was ordered after a brief discussion. 30 minutes, he said. No, wait. He changed his mind. Better make it 40 minutes. I said, no problem.I showed up at 8:10ish pm and made my way to the counter. There was one family of 4 having their dinner at a table and 3 other customers waiting for their take-out/pick-up order. The family of 4 will come into play later.Behind the counter was a young Hispanic with her hair tied back in a pony tail. She looked busy as she called out an order for someone to come pick up. She asked me my name and I responded. "Its not ready." she said and she turned away before I could even ask her how much longer it would take. She retreated into the kitchen where it looked like there was about 4 or 5 people making pizzas frantically. I decided not to wait for her to return and grabbed a seat in the diner. Customer after customer walked in and asked about their take-out and every response from the woman was "It's not ready". And each time, she would turn away as quickly as she could to retreat to the kitchen.Now, I've worked in a restaurant before. I understand that a kitchen can get backed up and things can fall apart pretty quickly. The woman didn't handle the customers very well but at this point, I just thought she was ill-trained and maybe a little rude. This would change later.After waiting for about 15 minutes, I decided to face the rude woman behind the counter. I walked up and waited for her to come back and asked her how long it would take. She asked for my name again and before my lips could even finish forming the last syllable, she responded."It's not ready."Here's where the family of 4 comes in. The father behind me must have raised his hand to signal for her because at this point she leaned around me and asked him what he needed. Apparently, he wanted another 2 liter of Pepsi because she went to go get it for him. I waited."I understand its not ready, but how much longer will it be?"With an irritated huff, she went into the kitchen and looked on their table of order slips. Without even turning to face me, she shouted "5 minutes". Rude? What's worst than rude? Whatever it is, she's riding that border like a pro at this point. At this point, the dining room has 8 other customers waiting. I went back to my game of 2048 on my phone and just waited. At 8:40 pm, I finally heard my name called. Here's where the story actually gets uglier.There was an elderly woman there who had been waiting before I even arrived. She got up and very irately began to complain how people who arrived after her were getting their food before her. Rightly so. The young woman with the pony tail responded by saying her food wasn't ready and that phone orders were at 40 minutes. Remember, I got there at 8:10 pm and it was now 8:40 pm. This poor woman had to have been waiting for more than 40 minutes in that waiting room now. At this point, the elderly woman was visibly angry because she thinks she's being mistreated. In response, the woman with the pony tail laughs. Yah. She laughs. I was stunned. I look into the kitchen to see if anybody there was "Phil" or a manager or something had seen this. The closest man to the front was at the pizza oven. He had heard. And he was also laughing.Phil's Pizza is good. It is. But the employees/managers/owner there aren't rude. No, this isn't rudeness. It's contempt. They believe that they can laugh in an elderly woman's face because they're Phil's Pizza. They are hurtful and they are dishonorable. At some point, you have to decide whether good pizza is worth supporting a business that would hurt another person just because they can.We have leftovers. I think I'm just going to throw it away. Phil's Pizza doesn't taste so good anymore.

4.description: I really enjoyed this pizza!!! I was amazed on how delicious this pizza was.  I haven't enjoyed a good pizza in a very long time.  Had small sausage pizza.  Fries sucked though, arrived cold and they weren't tasty.  Other then that great pizza!

6.description: The Best pizza in Bridgeport, never once in many many years have they ever disappointed my Pie..I been a fan when I use to live in Canaryville and Phils was located on 43rd off Halsted St..the Beefs & Dago Sausage are done right also..now I'm getting hungry just writing this.

22.description: Not the cheeriest group you'll ever meet, and certainly nothing special when it comes to atmosphere, but they will serve you a pizza that can't be denied. My girlfriend and I were staying close to here at an Airbnb for a recent music festival and honestly, we ate dinner here two nights because of how much we enjoyed it.

15.description: Cashier/Counter person should not be dealing with customers. Horrible attitude and she just plopped pizza on counter. Will order and have it delivered next time just to avoid her or go somewhere else. Plenty of pizza joints in area.

57.description: Do NOT ever get pizza from this place. They are the rudest owners I have ever come across. They told us they would have our delivery in an hour. Long story short almost 2 hours later we did not get our pizza because they gave the driver the wrong number, the driver was still at the store, and they still wanted us to pay full price. And they gave us an attitude about it as well.Avoid!!!

20.description: Tried to order delivery.  Person on the phone was rude as heck. Never trying this place again. Sorry but I don't order from jerks.

36.description: Stopped there with friends from work for the third time in 2 months.  Pizza was great as usual.  The temp outside was in the single digits so it was really chilly in the dining area!

14.description: Its a little mom & pop joint that only accepts cash. If you are a fan of Chicago style pizza-- this is the spot!

12.description: I guess the size of the place and items on the menu is what determines the name of the place. It is express as in limited menu and small place!You can order a small fries and you'll be waiting for 15 minutes. Everyone else who ordered meals would get their food before you would even though they ordered after you. After all, you're a small fry...

7.description: Alma is the so called manager at this McD's by far the worst customer service I've ever experienced she was upset because they got my order wrong and I brought it to her attention. There after I can see and hear her complaining to the other employees in front of customers not sure what's up her butt seems to me mad at the world.....very unprofessional!!!!

3.description: What's the point of ordering an M&M's McFlurry only to have it give you an upset stomach and go right down the toilet within five minutes?How can you get one simple McFlurry order wrong? Apparently, five different ways with this location.(1) Accidentally drilling a hole through the first cup with the McFlurry machine and spilling all over your hands(2) Instead of throwing the first cup away, put it in a second cup(3) Filling the cup only halfway(4) Making the McFlurry with spoiled milk(5) M&M's dissolving in the McFlurry somehowReminds me of why I haven't been to a McDonald's in a long time.

1.description: I like the newly renovated Bridgeport McDonald's. The service is faster than what I remember and it's clean inside. I am not sure what else you can want from a McDonalds restaurant. My French fries were deliciously hot and salted. I ate a large order of fries thinking I would save some for my kids.

2.description: The name is very misleading. They are not fast. It's as fast as your standard McDonald's. They remodeled this McDonald's into more of a family restaurant. Maybe this change will work better than their "express" claim.

9.description: Was overcharged for a breakfast meal, told the person in charge. He didn't even care. Just said price went up. He didn't give me back the difference.  I even showed him the price on the receipt.

18.description: They have bad service and very rude

10.description: This McDonald compared to a regular McDonald is pretty bad. For one, it is smaller and doesn't have all the stuff that a regular McDonald have. They do not have a drive thru since it is an Express. Also, they do not have my favorite, Sweet Tea. The service here is okay at best, but I admit, sometimes it is horrible. The parking lot is tragic if you come on Monday. It sucks that this is the closest one to me, but the food for the most part is the same as any McDonald.

13.description: They forgot my order:( I was waiting 15 mins for my food.

16.description: This is a McDonald's Express, so it sadly doesn't have the entire menu at all times.  It reminds me that advertisements often include "participation and availability may vary by location" notices - this would be one of those cases.  Fortunately, the smaller menu means fewer different things for their cooks to remember how to prepare or distract them from these key menu items.Over half of the times I've been in here, no matter how busy, I've had my food handed to me in less than 2 minutes from paying for it.  That's Express, people!The only thing that drags this place down is the atmosphere.  the counter is tiny and only holds two registers, so at any busy point in time, the line of people engulfs the only walking space and makes its way to the door, and sometimes extends OUT the door, though I've only seen that during dinner times as I've passed by on my way home from Unique or something.The soda machine has once or twice been low on syrup, yielding a nasty beverage - but it's outside the counter, so you can refill it with something else on your own.  The tables for sitting are VERY close together, meaning it's difficult to eat your food in peace at this location without being bothered by someone's family issues or rampant children.  It can get very loud here.But all in all, if you're stopping in for something to go, this is a great place for that.  Just make sure to check that what you want is on their smaller menu, and take note that sometimes the sales regular McDonald's can have on menu items doesn't necessarily apply here.  So pay attention, and then you can enjoy your McDonald's food.And you'll enjoy it better at home instead of sitting in cramped quarters with rambunctious broodlings.

17.description: One time I was waiting for my meal, about 10 minutes went by, I asked the cashier where is my foods? She answered someone took it, I waited another 5 minutes for them to make another one. This has happened to me twice at this MacDonald,  I don't know who to blame, the customers who thought there is another bag of food sitting here and just grab it or the cashier who didn't care the right person get the foods. Anyway, this MacDonald is one of kind, I went to many other fast foods joints.

15.description: If I were to die and go to hell, this McDonald's would certainly provide a worthy backdrop for a nightmare imagined.Let's begin the story of my worst dinner of my life at this sad little stop in a strip mall of no particular visual appeal under a bleak and cold Chicago evening. All things being fair, the culinary experience was doomed for failure given certain personal and tragic circumstances I won't get into here.Upon stepping to the counter, I gave pause to the abbreviated menu not worthy of a McDonald's Express, which is a new concept to me all-together. I decided to play it safe with the classic cheeseburger meal with an intimidating amount of fries and drink aka "The Value Meal". My meal was served up a little too quickly with all due credit to the server. The food seemed to appear from nowhere - gremlins cooking the food? I could see the grease seeping through one of the burger wrappers. At this point I made a snap substitution request, no coke, coffee instead - a hot beverage will make the grease go down smoother. My server obligated me in silence and I acknowledged her generosity. I took my tray and chose a seat by the front windows where parked cars would treat the diner with blinding light from their headlights, but at least it was somewhat devoid of the cold glowing light emitting from the overhead florescent located in the rear of the restaurant.I sat down and emptied the contents of the bag, fries and napkins, no ketchup. I tasted one of the fries to determine if they were worthy of ketchup-free consumption, but alas no, they were slightly cold with a texture that left an unpleasant lump in your throat. I fetched several ketchup packets from the server, kept under tight security behind the counter and returned to my table.Spilling out the ketchup packets on the table, I noticed dried droplets of ketchup on the plastic packets. No turning back now, I dug into my dinner with a overwhelming sadness for humanity and myself. So, to sum up:Fries. They left an odd taste of seafood or fish to my palette. Perhaps they co-mingled food in the fryer. The luke-warm temparture made it a bit difficult to choke them down. Maybe some beer would have helped the process.Cheeseburgers. Lifting the top bun of any burger, you can tell right away if there was any love in the preparation. Though consumable, the burgers were not satisfying and tasted as if they sat under a heat lamp for too long, also lukewarm.Coffee. I have tasted better coffee from a mechanical contraption in a corporate lunch room. It was watery, lukewarm and slightly sweet in a way that amplified everything that went wrong with the coffee.Ketchup Packets. Looks like they were dropped on the floor at some point or recycled from a previous diner that did not use up all their ketchup.Customer Service. No complaints here, it's not exactly the most cheery place to work. Servers were speedy, helpful and responsive.

0.description: Living so close to this place, I love coming here for a quick bite to eat if I'm getting groceries in the area or if I'm on my way somewhere and don't have a lotta money on me. The dollar menu is my best friend. The place is pretty small - I usually get my stuff to go so I don't have to worry about that. The service is pretty standard for McDonald's and wait isn't that long.It's located in a small shopping center so there is a parking lot. Overall, it's close and convenient - win win situation.

5.description: For being a McDonalds Express, there is no "Express" about it!  The last time I was here in July, I swore it would be my last and it has been.  I would rather drive to Pilsen or South Loop to another McDonalds, than to set foot in here again.  The parking is ridiculous...be careful and grab your kids hands while crossing the lot!I was in a hurry that summer Sunday in July, so I stopped in to pick up some breakfast sandwiches to go.  Not only did I wait over a half hour in line, but the  order takers did not seem at all concerned that  there was a line out the door.  It was so crowded in there, people were breathing down my neck, actually in my personal space.   Homeless looking people were allowed to walk in and hang out and the cashier had a huge hickey on her neck.  WTF!

11.description: If I could go minus 10 I would try for minus 1000...filthy dirty, I don't know how corporate let's this place stay open...disgusting

8.description: I've been living in this neighborhood since I was 4. Back in the day, the cheapest place to get a burger and fries was Maxwell's on 31st. In my family during that time, eating at Mcdonalds was luxury item. Why was it a luxury? Because my parents highly frowned upon processed and can foods. As a rebellious child growing up, eat at a Mcdonald's was luxury. The closest place without a car had to be in McKinley Park. Fast forward a few years and the McDonald's express opened. Despite it being fastfood, it poses as a treat to all the locals in the neighborhood; after playing sports at Mcguane or just grabbing a quick bite. This Mcdonald's is very small compared to other Mcdonalds, but they do serve most items. Since they marketed their $1 menu couple of years ago, the dollar menu has never changed. McChickens and Mcdoubles were always a $1. Now with the advertised $1 breakfast menus and any size drink, there are a lot of cheap options. My only grievance is that they don't have sweet tea and salads, but unsweetened tea is available. It doesn't feel right to goto any McDonalds for a salad... it just doesn't make sense to me.I come here a couple times a month for ice coffee, hot coffee and a sandwich or two. The location is convenient to grab a quick bite, pick up my dry cleaning, or pick up a few small items from Walgreens. The occurrence of pan-handlers has increased since Pacific Garden Missions moved to Canal St and it has also died down since the new police station has been placed on 31st and Halsted. Slowly and surely this neighborhood is urbanizing. I can't wait to see more of it.

4.description: Don't we get free coffee refills at all McDonalds?  This McDonald said there is no free refills!

14.description: AVOID- Horrendous lines, horrendous customer service, horrendous parking lot.Enjoy the homeless people begging for money.

6.description: Considering their undeniable success, McDonald's is an impressive chain. They are generally known for good quality control. Unfortunately, this particular location has a lot of quality issues. The buns are not soft, and the burgers are rubbery as if prepared well in advance and nuked upon order. The fries are not fresh, and they fill the fry carton only part way. The soft drink fountain is frequently out of at least 1 drink - nobody has been paying attention and you have to tell them about it. No coffee refills here either. You get the idea.

3.description: We wandered in thinking it was Husky Hog (curious on the new yellow paint) to find it was now Gino's Steak. Didn't want to walk out we ordered a chicken  sandwich Chicago style, with grilled peppers and onions. We love cheese fries so we got an order of them to go as well. When we got home we shared it, it was just alright. Would give it two and a half but hey just opened. But I wish them well. I Might go back if someone else suggest it.

1.description: Well, to begin with.. The food is "okay" for what you're getting. I ordered through GrubHub so I didn't expect quality. If you ever do, you're crazy.Only and biggest qualm is that I have ordered twice and BOTH times were wrong, so little to say I won't be back. Luckily the phone service was good so my correction was semi-quick.. But I mean, it's not that hard to look at a printed out order and get it right, ya idiots. I'm a "street watcher" so I saw the delivery guy messing around in his truck with his homie... Which makes me that much more uncomfortable. But I mean that's that. I'd say you get what you pay for but I definitely  don't even feel that. Beware.

2.description: 2.5 star.It's alright nothing special. Doesn't really taste like a Philly cheesesteak. More like a Italian beef with onions.The steak wasn't cooked dark like it should be.The fries were so burnt I couldn't even eat them and I usually like a more cooked fry. I probably won't be back.

9.description: So happy to find out these guys have opened a restaurant. I have been a big fan of the truck for a long time. Great  Steak and cheese sandwiches. I love the Fatty and some of the special sandwiches they have. The food here is just as good as it is on the truck, (actually better I think) and they said they will be available for delivery all the time  I like supporting small and local businesses and these guys are exactly that. Good luck Gino's!!

10.description: First time my boyfriend and I ordered from this place, it was subpar at best. We happened to give it another shot and stumbled across the  "fatty". From someone in the food industry, one of the best sandwiches we have had in a while. Hope they keep getting better.

4.description: Easily the best Philly cheese steak i've had in Chicago.  I've eaten from the truck a few times but now that I can order from the new restaurant I don't have to track them down.

6.description: One of the best chicken sandwich I have tasted also great & fast customer service especially Anthony the manager was real nice & helpful as I was a newbie to this place he took the time to explain to me there sandwiches really recommend this place!

11.description: I went there hoping for the best, walked out. Maybe it's still new and working out the kinks. They definitely need a class in order taking and customer service

5.description: I got the fatty and my friend got the chicken and cheese sandwich. They both were very tasty. I will be returning sooner than later.

7.description: Just had this for lunch. Took them over an hour to deliver. Bread was stale. Fries cold and soggy. I normally let it slide but this was terrible. Close down do us all a favor

8.description: I'm a small girl and I don't usually finish a whole sandwich in one setting but this got to me. It's the BEST steak and cheese sandwich I ever tasted. Has the perfect blend of steak and cheese. Definitely lives up to their slogan that it's very addicting. Friendly staff and good prices. Glad to see that they were open late night.

0.description: This place replaced husky hog and the bbq sandwich before it. So far so good. Ordered the gyro here and have to say its the best gyro in Bridgeport! Have not tried the philly steak yet. I shall the next time I venture that area.

3.description: My wife and I came across this store when walking along Halsted in Bridgeport. As Halsted slowly changes over on the near south side, it's nice to see small businesses like this. We waited for only a few minutes while our shirts had the requested logo printed on them. Nice store overall.

1.description: AWESOME place for Chicago themed knick-knacks. I visited the store during the Blackhawks playoffs and saw some cool shirts. If you want any screen printing done, they do that as well!I might come back for a Chicago-themed baby onesie...

2.description: I've stopped in multiple times to support a locally owned business, because lord knows Halsted needs all the help it can get.  The woman behind the counter is very nice but, to be honest, most of their products are the sort of amateurish crafts you'd find at a church bazaar.

9.description: Great little gift shop with lots of locally made goods. You'll want to spend as much on yourself as you will for others. Prices are very reasonable. You'll regret ever buying a gift at another store.

10.description: Cute little store with a lot of interesting gifts with many related to Chicago.  There are many unique, handmade items not seen anywhere else.  I will definitely go back there again!

4.description: Needed some last minute gifts and they came through. Designed a t-shirt for me from scratch and did it quick. Great selection of Chicago-centric gifts. Great to have a local small business like this around. Stop in for a visit, you will not be disappointed.

6.description: I've been told that gift shops are a dying breed.  I don't believe it and I desperately hope it is not so.  Amazon efficiency be damned.  I want to browse and poke and breathe in those rare moments when I can.Thank you, Hardscrabble Gifts for giving me such a place.  I will return again and again.  I know that everybody I know needs something you have.  I just have to find it.  And I know that is really just a defense to not buy 200 things in the store for myself which would ultimately lead to a divorce.  My husband already thinks I'm a crazy cat lady in the making.  And still only 32.  Wait til I'm 60!  But seriously, it's not about me.  It's about the gift shop and what it says about me.

12.description: Affordable. gorgeous. unique. Much of it is recycled and upcycled stuff and all of it is fantastic. Seriously my favorite local shop.

5.description: I LOVE THIS SHOP!  It is SO unique.  The owner is SO nice.  I went in there for the 1st time yesterday and I did not want to leave the store.  I wanted to buy everything!  This is definitely my NEW store!  YAY!!!!

11.description: cute little shop, lots to see in there and plenty of unique gifts - many of them Chicago themed. i especially like the handmade soaps and candles!

8.description: If youre looking for a gift for anyone especially someone who is hard to shop for, from Chicago, loves Chicago (and who doesn't) or a sports fan you should stop in Hardscrabble Gifts.

0.description: I have purchased so many wonderful gifts from this little gem of a store. Instead of running to the mall I shop locally and its personalized gifts for family and friends and our course myself ,every time someone sees something in my home custom made . "Hardscrabble" .

7.description: I could LIVE inside Hardscrabble Gifts!I stopped-in today to pick-up a few, last-minute holiday gifts (shopping local!) I found perfect gifts for my friends, my friends' children, my brother, his puppy-dog, & hey... I even gifted myself. I have been good this year. I adore the Chicago & Bridgeport neighborhood-themed items in the shop (a Sox/35 Red Line stop t-shirt? Mine!) I left with so much more... Chicago flag baby-beanie & shirt, Chicago police gifts, Chicago baseball shot glasses, magnets, & even a skull-and-crossbone plush dog bone doggie toy. Lastly, the leather & chain cuff-bracelet I took home was also a little gift from Santa to me. Reality? I could have probably bought one of everything in the store. All of their items are so fun, & chosen with obvious care.I am always excited to see a new establishment open its doors in the Bridgeport neighborhood, & I am just thrilled by Hardscrabble Gifts. There is something for everyone on your list, Chicago South-sider or not.

56.description: What history.  Chicago's politicians throughout the years have used this place as their second office.  Yep, the Bridgeport Democratic ward offices are across the street and the Stockyards are a couple blocks away.  God knows how many plots were hatched within these very walls.  Also, it used to be a speakeasy during Prohibition; if you ask someone, they will show you the peephole.Mayors Daley, Daley Jr., Kennelly, Kelly, and Bilandic have all crawled out of that quaint little haven we call Bridgeport.  (I mean crawled in the best way possible.)  They've all frequented Schaller's, if that should mean anything to you.  You'll know you're there when you see the huge wall billboard that says "South Side baseball... White Sox fans welcome".It's pretty stark in here: bright lights, baseball, old tile floors, and loud Sox fans!  If you want to hear a South Side Chicago accent, come here and listen.  The help is pretty nice and the old guys abound, making it good grounds for a place to hear about "the old days".  What fascinating stories these people have.DON'T talk about that OTHER Chicago baseball team here, unless you put a curseword immediately on front of or after their name!

29.description: I am more than a fan of Schaller's Pump!  Really enjoy eating here and hanging out.  Easily accessible with bus 8 on Halstead.  As beautiful as the front door is, you need to enter from the side.  Interior is a traditional bar layout, with a tin ceiling that appears to be painted white, and several tables and chairs for dinner seating, multiple TV screens, juke box in the corner, neon light fixtures, the works!  You can feel the history of old Chicago soaking in as you sit drinking a cold beer (Old Style), eating a special order of breaded pork chops, small cup of applesauce, peas, mashed potatoes with gravy, with a side of soup and crackers, and don't forget dinner rolls and butter.  I could easily become a SOX fan if it means I could eat here before every game.  We'll be back soon.  Love this place.

42.description: This is not the Chop House and it is not the Cubby Bear. This is a Bridgeport Stock Yard blue-collar bar and restaurant(family owned and operated). Great cold tap beer, friendly service, and a meal that is the likes of a good home cooked meal. Most meals are under $10 and they have a really good prime rib dinner. Yuppies beware, most of the people here have jobs that cause them to get dirt under their finger nails. Parking lot is big. Try the fried chicken.

23.description: I came here based on rave reviews from people who obviously use no discernment when judging food.  My toddler liked his french fries and Shirley Temple drink, but nobody out of a party of 6 adults walked out of there with anything nice to say.  We still joke about it when we drive by and how bad it was.  The service was great though, I must say.  But the food was just plain wrong.  We ordered every type of food, too.  I had fish, my dad had steak, my mom had chicken, etc.  My folks are simple and easy to please, but they had a hard time even getting halfway through the plate.  I took a bite of fish (Halibut or some other high quality fish, can't remember) and could not even take another bite.  It had a weird cream sauce over top of it and was as hard as a baseball glove.  No need to overcook or spoil the taste with strange sauces.  The chef clearly had no clue whatsoever.  Sorry but it's true.  So unless you just want some fried food and beer, my advice is to go somewhere else!!

47.description: Great history and surprisingly good food.  Big parking lot.  Some families, but it's essentially an old man bar that serves beer in cans.Enter through the side.

8.description: Friendly staff, good drinks, great food! I grabbed a liver sausage sandwich and it was delicious but the ribs also looked pretty great and the feel of it is very cozy.

31.description: I come here before Sox games a couple times a year with my dad.  I don't think there is another place with good food where you can walk out leaving a $20 bill on the table.  The food is cheap, er, inexpensive... that sounds nicer.  The bar room is fun and I love the Sox memorabilia they have.The food: I recommend the fried chicken and the specials are usually good.  You'll get a good bang for your buck with the specials.  Usually big portions with a soup and don't forget the cold beets they give you when you get in.The bottom-line:  Beat the ballpark prices and come here before the game.  And, if you're a cheapskate (as am I) you can park here for free and walk to the park.  It's a decent walk, but on a nice summer night it ain't so bad.

34.description: I've lived in Bridgeport for 3 years, been a Sox fan for 20, and a lifelong Chicagoan, and had never been to Schallers. I finally got around to rectifying the situation about 3 weeks ago.It was a typical January night in Chicago - frickin freezing and full of snow. It had a been a long friday and an even longer work week and all I wanted was some comfort food that I didn't have to cook. So the fella and I head over and grab a table. Eventually our waitress came over and gave us some menus. I went with the pot roast and the boy got the prime rib. The pot roast was dry, but the potato pancake it came with was sooooo good. The prime rib was really good too, albiet a bit fatty. The portions were great for the price. Beer is served in the cans and my water was served in a solo cup. Nothing fancy here folks, just decent grub at great prices.The service left a bit to be desired, but our poor waitress was working a party in another room in addition to several tables. I liked the idea of live music, and the duo playing was very good - but far too loud. It was impossible to carry on a conversation. What I loved about this place is the vibe. You can tell that this is where the majority of the patrons grew up having dinner out with the family. This is where you go grab a Miller in a can and watch the Sox game. Where the waitresses call you "Hun". It's a little piece of history.

16.description: The oldest pub in Chicago - opened in 1881. Still has the speakeasy door with the peek hole which was used during the Prohibition.Bud Light and Miller Genuine Draft on tap. Didn't order food but looked pretty good at other tables behind us.The draw here, IMO, is that the fourth generation Schaller's still tend bar. Friendly folks that really make you feel at home in this local tavern.FYI, park in the big lot and walk in the side door rather than the front. No charge for parking - even when the White Sox are playing seven blocks away.

13.description: I eat here when I have hit the breaking point of pizza, burgers & burritos. They have great home style meals and always decent rotation of specials. It's also just a good place to take an old style to the face and watch the sox.

11.description: A great spot....filled with character and characters. This is a clean establishment run by very nice people. I just stopped in for a couple of beers as I try to hit the oldest bar in any major city I visit. This place didn't disappoint and I'd head back here in a minute the next time I'm in town.

39.description: SHOULD BE A HISTORICAL LANDMARK JUST FOR ITS SERVICE AND INTERIOR!!  (HIP FREE ZONE)Hey this place predated "hip" and "retro" long before most of us were born. It's honest and no nonsense. It seriously should get a Historical Landmark Status for it' interior. BTW yes some of the poeple are "old", but what better way to meet the REAL Chicago before Whole Foods and the word "Yummy" haha. Ok I am being cynical..bit it is a nice place and is a good way to see what Chicago in the days of the Stock Yards. You might get your Martini in a tumbler, and they don't  have hip Bohemians serving with "tude" but......It has great food and the servers are genuine and kind. They once opened up their kitchen for me! Now that isnt going to happen in Bucktown!! Ok that's my opinion.BTW I used to live on the Northside....I think we need to remember we are ALL Chicagoans and we need to venture all over the city!!!

37.description: I work about 2 minutes away and visit Schaller's every week.  If you are expecting some gourmet dish and large beer list with HD TV's then stay away.  That is not what this place is about.  This place is old school.  The food is home cooked and damn good, the beer comes in cans or out of the tap.  Staff is great and all family.  There is no ATM and you pay in cash, just like everyone has for over 100 years.  Schaller's is a gem that should be appreciated for all the reasons listed above.  And lastly, name another place you can park on private property for nothing during a game.  Here's to hoping they never change anything but their kegs.

0.description: This is not a place I would ever have gone in Chicago.  I just don't think to socialize or go out to eat in the Bridgeport area.  Don't much like the White Sox, and don't like some of the social / racial stances that some from this area have exhibited to me in my nearly 30 years of calling Chicago home.  None of this is written to reflect on Schaller's Pump, or its purveyors, owners or customers, this is merely an explanation of why I have never been here before.  My mistake.    The kids and I decided that we wanted to eat at the 10 oldest restaurants in Chicago as written about in a DNA Info article (dnainfo.com/chicago/2016…) that reviewed these Chicago eateries.  Schaller's Pump is considered the oldest of all these restaurants, currently being run by the 4th generation of Schaller's, under the 3rd generation, Jack Schaller's "supervision," with the 5th generation now helping out regularly.  We met four of the eight 4th generation the day we went, and damn, you can't find kinder people in all the world.  Same with the customers, who clearly noted we weren't from there, walking in as we did with our Green Bay Packer sportswear on.  First, I didn't know this was a cash only eatery, so know that if you go.  They do have an ATM in the bar dining room, and a bank with ATMs can be found just up the street.  I had to dash up to the bank to get cash for our meal.  I told our hostess what I had to do, that I was going to leave my two kids for a minute, would they mind?  They were totally cool with this, and my kids, at 10 & 12 can manage themselves just fine in an adult manner for a few minutes like this.  I was gone and back in 7 minutes.  AG had never had ribs, and wanted to try those, a whole slab of them.  RN had never had a corned beef sandwich, so he went for that.  I hadn't had a slab of prime rib in 5-8 years or more, and this seemed like the PERFECT place to have a "light" lunch of this for our visit.  The ribs were above average; the prime rib was fine, I enjoyed it very much; the corned beef might have been the best I ever have tasted, except for what some friends once shared with me that they made in their home.  We had a wonderful dining experience with delectable wholesome traditional fare.    Once our hostess figured out why we ended up there, they were even more kind to us for making the trip down to enjoy their hospitality, which was over the top.  You just don't find family run places like this anymore, where the customers are treated as friends, and then family if you go there often enough, and where everyone is welcomed as a valued guest.  Now we dined at Schaller's Pump on a Friday afternoon, and had no problem getting into the bar room dining room for a table for the three of us.  There is a large back dining room too.  Service was prompt and oh so courteous, and it was not rushed or busy for our visit.  But I understand that on weekend nights can change a bit as the place fills up.  Also before and after some White Sox games can make Schaller's a mad house of "good guys wear black" fans.    I also enjoyed the decor, the small things that were shared with us about the place that has been here since 1881, always in the Schaller family:  the old cash register that they still use; the side door when Schaller's was a speakeasy; the memorials to the White Sox, especially their 2005 Championship; and just the whole "Chicago" sports team pride.  You feel like you are part of what Chicago neighborhood bars and restaurants once were, family, friends and solid stick to your ribs food.  I loved it.  My thanks to the 4 Schaller's who we met, even if only briefly.  You all make this place worth visiting, and I thank you all for your hospitality for our visit.  Won't hesitate to come back again, and soon.  Just not during a White Sox homestand, or Bears game broadcast, but I am sure you understand.

38.description: Good place to go before a game with great homemade food and really cheap prices.  Try the hashbrowns instead of mashed or fries- well worth it.  everything is under $18, and all the sandwiches are around $7.  Lost a star because they dont't have much of selection.  bud and miller products served in a can for $3.  Best part is they let you park in the lot for free if you are going to the sox game, which is a 10 min walk.ps- enter through the front door on halsted.....haha

51.description: This is the kind of bar that reminds me of my childhood.  Yes, I said that.  Schaller's is the kind of place where your grandfather goes for his morning coffee and gets his fill of local news.  It's where your parents take you on a Saturday evening to eat dinner and you drink kiddie cocktails while they catch up with friends and family.  Ahh, I can smell the maraschino cherries and grenadine now.  Mr. Schaller and the staff certainly make you feel right at home.  The next time I go back, I'll keep my north-side status under my Sox hat while I enjoy a few drinks and listen to the live music.  I might even keep a close watch on the end of the bar just in case my grandfather sneaks in for his afternoon news.  You just never know who might show up here.

27.description: Early in the 1970's when the Chicago Seven were in the county jail, my new husband and I stopped in at Schaller's Pump 'cause pickeetting and marching works up quite an appetite.  My husband loved butt steak and this is one of the few places in the city that routinely has butt on the menu.  My husband converted me to butt also.  Fast forward to 2012 - my 40+ son is moving into the Bridgeport neighborhood and after a hard minute or so of hemming and hawing, I saw that Schaller's was still there - we went.  OH MY HEAVEN, this place is still absolutely impossible fantastic!  I have been there tons of times since my son first moved to Bridgeport.  IN fact, there are only two other spots around here that I have even been to - I keep returning to Schallers - the steak is flavorful, a great size, yummy.  The hash brown potatotes - I have NEVER had potatoes that were that crispy, crunchy, the size of a huge dinner plate with crisp top and bottom with cooked fluffy potatoes in the middle.  Lordy, there isn't enough ketchup - but your mouth is dancing the snoopy dance of joy.  This place has been around forever - there are regulars who live and love in the neighborhood.  They are welcoming in sort of a - we'll see how well these newbies will behave - sort of way.  Stop by - great way to see how the established neighborhoods of old chicago functioned before the onslaught of the suburban yupps.

32.description: The Yelpers have basically said it all and as usual, the 2 star people miss the point.The place isn't 5 stars for the food, although they do have a terrific prime rib on the weekends and the fried chicken can hold it's own with the best in Chicago. They also have the best hash browns in the City when they aren't too busy and can make them right.It's five stars because it is a place that many Chicagoans can count on from their birth until they are put in the ground, to be the same reliable place every time they go there.Since I am annointing myself the longest continuous patron of the place among the yelpers checking in on this place (I first went there 60 years ago as a 5 year old with my dad, whose meat packing plant was across the street), a few items clarified: The front door DOES open---I found that out last night after thinking it was ornamental for 60 years, and it is the OLDEST continuously operating restaurant in Chicago--a fact always clarified when the tribune periodically runs a story stating that Berghoff is the oldest restaurant in Chicago. Berghoff got liquor license # 1 as soon as prohibition ended, hence the source of the confusion, but Schaller's has been in operation since 1881 and Jack Schaller, the 85 or so year old owner, is the great grandson of the original. My favorite story was that it was named the Pump because there used to be a beer tap in the wall behind the bar that was connected directly to the brewery which stood on the land which is now their parking lot and I enjoyed believing it for decades until Jack told me it wasn't true. I'll still believe the beer used to flow through that wall and we Schaller's fans will believe that it's one of Chicago's great places not worthy of those 2 star people like it or not.Oh, finally, Yelper Snobs---this is the QUINTESSENTIAL (look it up) blue hair place. I hope to see some reviews taking the place to task because the place is loaded with old, fat guys and women wearing last decade fashions!

54.description: This is now the oldest bar in Chicago, so do ya think there's a little history here? It has been operated by the same family since 1881, so they have seen it all including generations of Chicago sports fans, politicians, and sports figures, not to mention prohibition. This place used to be a speakeasy-the back door still has a peephole.Everything here reflects the fact that it is a family-owned neighbrhood establishment. The service isn't just friendly, they make everyone feel like family. My first trip there, I was introduced to the lively octagenarian Mr. Schaller himself. The food is a carnivorous array of steaks, sandwiches and burgers, all well made and equally well-priced. The drinks are cheap and cold. A great place to grab a drink before a game, or dinner with the family.

48.description: I'm not sure there's another bar that could quite sum up the South Side like Schaller's.  My friends and I came here last week after the game was cancelled in search of beer, food, and a great crowd.  We found all three.We felt right at home at Schaller's.  Even though it seemed like a lot of regulars were there (and we were the outsiders), they welcomed us with open arms - even my friend wearing a Tigers hat.  Beers were cheap (5 for $12) and so was the food.  A grilled cheese & fries for $2.95? And it was SO good.  The dining area in the back is more like someone's home then a bar, and you definitely feel like you are being served by family.  There was also live music and a crowd of people singing to some old tunes.  It was like nothing my North Side friends had ever experienced and it made me proud to be from the South part of the city.   We met Mr Schaller (who is adorable) and told him just how much we loved this place.  A must visit on your next trip to a Sox game.

44.description: This has been on my list of places to check out for a while. And I really wanted to explore more places on the southside, not having many reasons to venture there.  Being one of, if not the oldest bar/restaurant in Chicago, I was expecting a ton a character. and history inside this joint. When we walked in I was pretty underwhelmed. There just wasn't much to the place. It didn't feel that old or historic. Looks like it might have been remodeled fairly recently.  The food was average at best, though cheap. You can get Miller, Old Style in a can. That was about it. Nothing special at all.If this was just any other bar, I'd probably never end up here.If you are a southsider, a Sox fan, or have nostalgic memories of this place, then I can see why you might like it. But it's lost on everyone else.

24.description: They just don't get it on the north side. Ate here recently with a friend of mine and all this Cub fan could do was cry about the facts that they don't have WiFi and they don't take credit cards. I celebrate those things and love this place with all my heart. Yes I'm a sox fan and have many great memories coming here before and after games. The schaller's treat everyone like family and take pride in their food and service. Recommend butt steak. Hash browns. Breaded veal. Cheeseburgers. You want micro brews and ferns and food w a glaze reduction?  Go away. Inexpensive friendly fair with an easy walk to the park?  Home!

7.description: Going back many years, we could always count on stopping here for a sandwich and a drink after doing our shopping on 35th and Halsted. Some of the best shopping outside of the downtown area many, many years ago. This is where I have my first 7 & 7 Seagrams and seven up if you don't know what that is. The place was always filled with politicians from the neighborhood and you never knew who you might see on a Saturday afternoon. Great place  to visit when going to the ballpark, stop for that beer and some conversation about the good old days. I agree with the one reviewer who said, if you don't like this place go back to the north side and party there. This place has history and if that does not mean any thing to the younger set, walk on by. You do not see many tin ceilings any longer, so look up and enjoy the view, it may be gone in the future.

49.description: An old, famed southside establishment.  When I moved to Bridgeport my parents really wanted to take me here.  They've been going to Bridgeport for games since the 70s and this place was one of the bars they used to go to before games.I'll say this: they had a really good time.  They thought it was awesome to be back in their old hangout for dinner and a beer with their daughter.I thought it was a good place.  It's the kind of place that serves an entire homecooked meal for a good price.  And that includes soup/salad and a dessert.  YUM.  I had a veal cutlet which, for a bar on the southside, was actually pretty good.  Not the best breaded veal of all time, but definitely not gross or disgusting.  A great southside tradition - great before and after Sox games or just to catch one on the TV.

40.description: OK now. Here was my surprise. I had for a long time heard about the bar and the butt steak, and the history. Especially the history. So I had pictured in my mind a big old 19th century bar with lot's of wood, old booths, not so much a salt-of-the-earth basement rec room that looks as if it dates back to about 1960 instead of the real date of 1881. I felt like the five of us who went there, four neophytes, and two of them unsuspecting West Coasters, had gotten into my Scion time machine and had been transported to Oconto, WI. Not that that's a BAD thing, mind you!Walking in is like entering a saloon in the Old West, where everyone turns to look at you, and you think: "Gee, I better be friendly and say "hi", or somebody might beat me up." So we all did. But a genuinely friendly crowd AND a waitress who calls you "Hon." I just love that.So we all ordered the Butt Steak. Our lovely server sold us on their famous hash browns, so we had the bean soup:  a little salty but well-spiced and flavored and with chunks of ham in it, the steak, which was around 8 oz, sitting on soggy white bread, fries, the requisite thimble of cole slaw, fries, and the hash browns. if I were you, I'd skip the must-have-been-frozen fries and get the hash Browns. They must use very sweet and fresh potatoes. Nicely browned and crunchy, too.The menu has a standard selection of other bar foods, but don't think "appetizers" because there is no such section. The subject of dessert never even came up. So it was five guys, five steaks, the side of hash browns, two pitchers of domestic beer (and two Heinies for the guy from Portland), all this for $84.50. A steak dinner with drinks for under $20 per person? That's it. My little Scion must be a magic time machine.Good food, decent steaks, excellent hospitality and salt of the earth dining with good company in Bridgeport, Chicago's own basement rec room neighborhood.

53.description: This place is a must for everyone... even if only once.I like Schaller's even if I am generally the youngest person in there.  On Friday nights you will often find older adults doing their version of karaoke with the keyboardist.  Its very, very charming and sweet.When there is a Sox game, this place is filled.  Many people eat, park in the lot, and walk to the park.The food here is very good.  My boyfriend is not convinced of this yet - because he order very poorly and got the Chicken Parmesan, fool - but I swear its good.  Try the Butt Steak.  It is what they are known for and it is excellent.  The beets and macaroni salad served with your meal are a nice addition and very good.  Also, they always have specials... try them, I have never gone wrong.Two minor complaints - 1 - they use pre-packaged rolls... which is weird and sad.2 - they pretty much just have MGD or Miller Lite.Overall, this is a good place and I am glad it is still around.  Check it out.

30.description: You gotta take this for what it is and thats a dive bar. This looks to be a  family owned , neighborhood bar, which is pretty conveinently located near Comisky Park. Don't go here looking for a "Sluggers" type experience before a Sox game. No, Schaller's is more the place to kick back, have a High Life and talk with some local Sox fans about that days game. I was here in the middle of the afternoon, so the place was pretty empty. The bartender was nice and gave my friend and I a free shot, which I can't complain about. I would definantly recommend grabbing a bite to eat BEFORE you go to Schaller's. I had the prime rib and every facet of it from the meat to the potatoes and corn tasted like a frozen meal at best. But food is not why one would go to Schaller's, go because you want a neighborhood bar, with neighborhood prices and a little flavor of Bridgeport.

46.description: It's not often I have a chance to eat dinner in a little piece of Chicago history. Yet that is what Schaller's Pump is. Open since 1881, Schaller's is billed as the oldest restaurant in Chicago. Unpretentious, full of old time regulars, good food, fast and cheap- I know I'll be back to try more on their menu. We walked in (use the side door, I hear the front one is only for show) and were immediately greeted by the bartender who told us to sit anywhere. A server who was probably my mom's age handed us a menu and quickly grabbed us a couple of the coldest Miller Lites I have had in awhile (served in cans, what else?) My friend who had suggested the place told us to go with the butt steak and so we did. Served with fries, slaw and a pickle, for $9.50 this is quite the deal. Steak was done perfectly.
