38.description: Ugh! I ate at Happiness with my family on September 17th 2011 let me tell you that I will never eat here again! My husband and I got very sick from the food we ate...my son, lucky for him, only had the chicken and rice soup, which by the way was not bad at all and I should have chosen that instead of the food I ordered.The portions are HUGE way too much food. Hubby and I could have shared one dish.The food was o.k., not great but o.k.The staff is not very friendly, no smiles, no personality whatsoever. Just plain business, take our order, serves, fill water, and get outThey speak very loudly in Chinese in front of customers, which I think is rudeThe restaurant could use a good scrubbingOver all, price-wise,the bill we paid (under $30) was not bad but the unfriendly service, quality of food, and the aftermath of being ill for a day has me promising to never eat at Happiness again

51.description: Decent enough foodThe smoothies are worth the delivery.  seriously.  best smoothies ever.  they may be putting crack in the smoothies. they are so addicting.

27.description: Not happy.  YUCK  Red sweet and sour sauce is never good.  The few veggies at the bottom of box were tough to chew.  The chicken was odd shaped and random sizes., some hard and crunchy.  Never again.

32.description: I like this place particularly for the orange chicken it's cook fresh the sauce comes on the side and not clumpy (yes I've experience that before).......parking is good right in front.......

48.description: I go here mostly cause the lunch specials are super good and cheap. I usually go there with my cop buddies and order a bunch of options and we all share.  My favs are the mongolian beef.. there will spice it to you order (I get extra spicy) and I love the BBQ pork and any of their soups are delicious. Their veggie egg foo young is really good also.. I usually scrape some gravy off of it, but other then that its awesome. I get white rice, but the fried rice seems popular also. Their smoothies are great... so all in all you can have a very good meal for a very fair price.

44.description: i love the potsickers at this place, but I have never had any other food from this restaurant, and it was a friend who brought the potstickers to me last night and I thought they were really good.

24.description: NEVER ORDERING FROM HERE AGAIN. Lo Mein is a particular kind of dish, anyone who has had it knows that the noodles are thick and very flavorful. THEY GAVE ME RAMEN NOODLES. I could've just gone and bought a cup of that garbage at a 7 eleven.  and I'm positive the chicken isn't even chicken, or they are just overcooking it because its TERRIBLE. this is NOT authentic Chinese food. if I could give 0 stars I would. screw this place.

7.description: Food is always great and when ordered for delivery or pick up they are always extremely fast. Prices are also very reasonable!  I really like the Szechuan string beans!

49.description: Why is it so hard to find a Chinese place that delivers? Oh wait, they do deliver - perhaps I should have been more specific. A Chinese place that tastes good that delivers. We ordered rather basic dishes. Everything was so drenched in sauces that it was more like soup. Bland food as well. The only good thing was that it was ridiculously cheap - if you have a lot of drunk people to feed over, you might consider ordering from here.

40.description: Got sick off their food. Really sick.

30.description: I honestly don't understand why they are still in business. I've came here about 10 times ONLY because it is close to where I work, but I promised myself I won't go back anymore. I haven't wrote a review because I usually don't write reviews, especially negative ones, but I honestly dislike this restaurant with a passion. What pushed me to write a review: They have lunch specials (which cost $7 after tax, the norm is $5 for other places). They let you choose egg rolls or BBQ pork as an extra with w/e lunch special you order. I like their BBQ pork over the egg roll, but they always put the BBQ pork in the rice box (with a lot of BBQ sauce), and the BBQ sauce mixes with the lunch special dish. The sauces mix into an awkward salty yet sweet taste which I really don't like. Knowing that, I asked them to separate the BBQ pork from the lunch special and put it in its own container. To my disbelief, they said they can't do that. I paused for a second thinking there might have been some miscommunication, so I explained to them how the sauces mixing makes the lunch special taste weird. They said they understand, but they can't separate them, and recommended me to just have the egg roll instead. I asked why not, they said they don't know, but they just can't do it. This is what pushed me over the edge with them. Only explanation I can think of is that they're trying to save some rice boxes? Needless to say, no more Happiness for me!Food:I have tried 10+ different dishes from them (mostly rice box) and the ONLY one that I actually think is decent is the Mapo Tofu. All the other ones I've tried are garbage. They are 100% Americanized Chinese food. They give you a ridiculous amount of sauce with anything dish that requires sauce. So much sauce that you'd think you ordered some sort of stew/soup. If you order Beef and Broccoli over rice, you'd get Beef and Broccoli stew. It's just disgusting. I personally like traditional Chinese food, but you may like the extra sauce. They are CHEAP:Don't be fooled by the sauce, the actual food content they give you is sparse for the price. Everywhere else, the lunch specials are in the range of $4 - $5.50, this place is $7. Their regular rice boxes (which are about $5-6) are the small cube paper ones that is about half the size of a normal rice box that cost the same. And if you want to order the normal sized rice box, it's $9-11 (once again, it's $5 elsewhere).In addition, they are the ONLY Chinese restaurant I have ever seen that actually CHARGES you for TEA! On their menu, front and center, says "Additional $1.00 for pot of tea". I laughed pretty hard when I saw that. Anywhere else they give you a pot of tea just like how American restaurants serve water. You can tell from some restaurants the the owners are skimpy out on content while emptying customers' pockets. Service: Their service is slightly above average for a Chinese restaurant. Their front desk girls are underage (probably daughters), and they don't usually show any emotions. Kind of just a blank face taking your orders. Conclusion:What else can I say? This place simply sucks. I think I've been pretty unbiased towards them, it's just that I never actually got a good experience from this place. I'm theorizing that the only reason they are still in business is because they are the only Americanized Chinese "restaurant" in the neighborhood. There are some other Americanized Chinese places around there, but they are more of a "Pick up to go rice box" joints, no waitresses. Potsticker House is the only Chinese restaurant with waitresses, but they are traditional Chinese and not Americanized.

46.description: I just dont understand why this place doesn't have higher reviews. The food here is awesome! I had the orange chicken. Some of the best ever. I admit, I would prefer it a bit spicier but I've been told that my obsession with spicy food is over the top. So here's a little story. Last week, the boyfriend and I are trying to decide on dinner. Finally I say I'll just pick up some chinese on the way to your place. Minutes after hanging up the phone, I regret the decision because now I don't want chinese anymore. Oh well, I'll just eat it, cuz its easier than going through another half hour conversation about dinner. I call in my order for pickup. The minute I walk in, I'm so glad I called for chinese. It smells great and it's ready 5 mins early. Nice. And it was delish as always. Not to mention we both ate for under $15 bucks

1.description: I have had the place a few times with some of my Coworkers as a Delivery so today was the first time that I was about to do a walk in to place my order.  The Dining room area was nice and clean the 2 ladies at the front counter was Pleasant. I order the pot stickers and then I place another order. Lunch special for later today (veggie egg foo Young with a egg roll and fried rice) When I got home I did try my food and my rice was a little cold. Other then that my food was OK.

9.description: The rudest people over the phone, for one they need a website so you wouldn't have to ask them over the phone about lunch specials! I can tell she gets aggravated and raises her voice because she doesn't speak much English. Well they should hire someone who can take orders over the phone so it can make their job easier! So aggravating when I know this place has potential their food is decent for Chinese food, but definitely needs to hire more pleasant kinder people for phone orders!

26.description: I've eaten here dozens of times, usually takeout and it has always been good.  Huge portions, cheap prices, consistent flavors.  Not a fan of their sweet and sour but honestly all the other dishes I've had have been pretty fabulous.  I agree that the service when you dine in isn't great but not many Chinese places are.  I don't live in Chicago anymore and miss the days when I could pick up some Happiness on the way home from work...

25.description: I have been going to Happiness for years. I have delivered from them and even went and eaten inside their restaurant. It is nothing fancy but the food is delicious. Our favorite is the orange chicken and my wife loves the shrimp kow. I love their crab rangoons, beef and brocolli..... just about everything I have tried form them is great. They have smoothies too. For the people on here with bad reviews, they must seriously be uptight. This is not ruth chris's where I would expect a smile and 5 star service. It is a hole in the wall dive chinese spot. I expect to be able to give my order, and get great tasting food in return. That's it. If you want a smile and all the other shit, go to P.F. Changs and pay for all that. This is a cheap chinese food place ran by people with limited skills. Don't let that shy you away from this place, it is amazing.

12.description: Scallops and shrimp with black bean and garlic sauce is to die for! Make it spicy for the extra kick and flavor. This place definitely does not disappoint!

21.description: My husband used to work near here and would regularly order lunch take out from here (Egg fu Young or General two & egg roll).  We also started ordering from here on occasion for home delivery.   Their food is consistently great and yummy!  You can't go wrong with this place.  They go above and beyond with service, quality and friendliness.   We recently moved a little outside their normal delivery zone but don't mind paying the little extra for delivery.  They are far superior to any chinese food place in our neighborhood in taylor/st./pilsen.  I have also been there for dine-in and it's nothing fancy but makes do for a quaint place to grab a casual meal if you want to dine out.

17.description: This place gets a bad rap because it's close to Chinatown, but this is my favorite American-style Chinese place of all. Their hot & sour soup is AMAZING, as is their fish filet with ginger. They're also always very friendly behind the counter!

10.description: I have lived down the street from them for a few years now.  There serve, good, fresh reasonably priced Asian cuisine.  Combination fried rice and bbq ribs are among my favorites.  Nice friendly, family atmosphere.  Lots of 9th District cops eat there, which is a good enough endorsement for me.

5.description: Best Chinese in Bridgeport. Good food. Their Potsticker and Crab Ragoon are just heavenly. Also the combination for a appetizer is huge and really really good. For the main course I have had their General Tso's, Pad Thai, Chicken Chow Main, Sesame Chicken and Sweet and Sour Chicken and all have been fantastic. Oh their homemade sweet and sour sauce is also delicious! Staff are always really friendly and it is always fast and efficient. Delivery is always quick. Is definitely my go to Chinese!

3.description: Ridiculously huge portions at great prices. The fried rice needs some things added to it, like carrots, peas, etc. The bbq pork can be a little tough. All in all, this is a good place.Here's a photo of the take-out sesame chicken lunch special I ordered earlier today. This is a lunch special--one of their smaller portioned, lower priced (less than seven bucks before tax) items. I don't know whether I'm supposed to eat it or move into it (and I mean that as a compliment).

35.description: I'm surprised at the negative reviews.  Although we are not far from Chinatown, we prefer this place over most places in Chinatown.  Their combination "George" fried rice is a favorite, as is the Mongolian Beef.  The portios are huge...the lids on the containers are never closed becuase of how full they fill them.  The staff is very friendly and you can get 5% off your order if you order online!  We've also had them deliver and they are quick and very couteous.

19.description: Don't waste your money on the sweet-and-sour shrimp!  Dried petrified barely there shrimp!

28.description: This is has become my favorite place for Chinese food! I actually drive past the more touristy "Chinatown" to eat here. The servings are plentiful, service is fast, and the staff friendly. Their lunch specials give a good bang for your buck. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because of the facility itself. It needs a bit more updating and atmosphere (IMHO). Definitely check this place out!

45.description: I had to give this place 2 stars because while the food is pretty awful, its not completely tasteless and their lunch deal gives you a hefty helping of food.  If your starving and need a lot of food and are willing to sacrifice quality for quantity, this is your spot!

33.description: My BF and I LOVE Happiness! I recommend the BBQ Pork (appetizer), orange chicken, BBQ Pork fried rice and pot stickers! Nice people work there! The smoothies are good! :D I recommend going during lunch if your on a budget, they offer awesome deals, perfect lunch specials. They serve a good amount of food so it can feed two adults and a child.  Depending you know? haha give it a try! I did and loved it! :)

43.description: I will never order from this place again. Aside from being a little pricey they are rude and disrespectful. i ordered $60 worth of food for delivery, i was charged $3 for delivery and when the driver arrived i gave him $63 and he looked at me shaking his head telling me that why i wasnt giving him any tip and that i was cheap and he said that his boss didnt pay him delivery and i should tip him. All this was said to me while I had clients in my business and he walked away shaking his head.I called the restaurant to let them know what happened and all she said was "Ok thank you and hung up". Food wasnt great and i will never recomend this place EVER!

2.description: I must give this place credit, it was the first place ever that i can remember where i literally couldnt finish my plate, it was the bbq pork shanghai chow mein, and it was so biiiig, plus only like $8! Such a deal, good have fed 2, also got an egg roll which was solid, and a mango smoothie, which was ok, not one of my favorites, but they have a lot of good reasonable priced options so i am pretty sure i will be returning (i also literally live 50 feet away XD)

18.description: This restaurant was lacking in both atmosphere and flavor. I ordered the cashew chicken and the honey chicken. The cashew dish tasted like a poorly made pot pie filling. The honey chicken was drenched in an overly sweet pink sauce that seemed more akin to sweet and sour than any other honey chicken I've had. I liked that it was close and local, and the food came quickly. But that did not overcome the negative marks in food and overall feel. I likely won't be coming here again.

41.description: I don't understand the negative reviews of this restaurant.  I've eaten here dozens of times, had many different dishes: beef, chicken, rice, vegetables, and they have all been great!  Prices are great, service is fast and friendly and the portions are huge.  Heck, even all the Chicago PD eat there!  Wish there were others like this in the neighborhood!

52.description: The food here is just "ok".  It's an average chinese restaurant.. nothing spectacular.  Oh, but I do have to give them credit for their won ton soup... yumm!  I've never eaten at the restaurant, but when I do place an order over the phone and provide my phone number to the guy..  I have to wait about 5 seconds before giving him the next digit of my phone number (i.e.: 7 (5 sec), 7 (5 sec), 3 (5 sec).  THEN, once I get there to pick up my food, he'll verify the order by asking for your phone number.  I whisper my phone number to him.. then he repeats it very very loud for the entire restaurant to hear.  LOL.  This guy cracks me up.. and it happens every time.  When you place the order for delivery, they get to your door... call you on your phone, then say, "We deliva".  So I of course, try to clarify it by asking, "are you here?"  Then he responds with, "we deliva" again.

50.description: Im surprised at the low reviews... this is my tried and true restaurant for Chinese takeout for years.  Nothing fancy or trendy, just good Chinese food that makes you want to eat until youre so stuffed you cant eat anymore.Pros: My favs have been shrimp egg foo yung (they've made me a believer), hunan shrimp, sweet and sour chicken, potstickersCons: Dont care for their noodle dishes

4.description: Not happy! ;) I've eaten here before always pleased. Called an order in for chicken teriyaki with broccoli. I was told about 10 minutes. The order ended up taking 20 minutes and it wasn't the right order. It looked nothing like how it had before neither did it match the description and picture. It had chicken, broccoli, carrots and onions. I can't do onions. I asked is this your chicken teriyaki? Then they looked at each other and said " yes chicken teriyaki, broccoli, carrots and onions." I said where is the teriyaki?....Won't goBack at least if you mess up an order try to fix it. Also don't sell chicken with mixed vegetables as chicken teriyaki.So ignorant that you think I would't know.

6.description: I am a huge fan of getting the most bang for the buck. This place always delivers on that. I have a few options closer to me by McKinley Park, but I do not mind heading out to Bridgeport for the mongolian beef lunch special, which is enough to usually feed two. Great place when you are looking for that greasy comfort Chinese food, although the menu is extensive enough to satisfy all tastes. Place might not be big enough to host large parties around lunch, considering that all the beighborhood cops eat there, but the service is pretty quick and the atmosphere very relaxed.

22.description: I must say since I have moved back to the neighborhood over four years ago they quickly became one of my favorite Chinese places. They have the best egg rolls, Crab Rangoon, and General Tso's Chicken. Steamed pot stickers are awesome too. I'm so close to China Town and prefer this food.

15.description: I have been going to Happiness for years. I have delivered from them and even went and eaten inside their restaurant. It is nothing fancy but the food is delicious. Our favorite is the orange chicken and my wife loves the shrimp kow. I love their crab rangoons, beef and brocolli..... just about everything I have tried form them is great. They have smoothies too. For the people on here with bad reviews, they must seriously be uptight. This is not ruth chris's where I would expect a smile and 5 star service. It is a hole in the wall dive chinese spot. I expect to be able to give my order, and get great tasting food in return. That's it. If you want a smile and all the other shit, go to P.F. Changs and pay for all that. This is a cheap chinese food place ran by people with limited skills. Don't let that shy you away from this place, it is amazing.

20.description: Scallops and shrimp with black bean and garlic sauce is to die for! Make it spicy for the extra kick and flavor. This place definitely does not disappoint!

36.description: The restaurant isn't much of a looker and the service is not the greatest but it's not the worst either. The food is your usual Chinese restaurant fare. It is better than a lot, plus their portions are pretty big. We are definitely frequent costumers because we always leave satisfied. Do try their Happiness noodles it is very delicious!

14.description: This place never disappoints, the food is always hot and fresh and delivery is very fast.

58.description: I really like this place.  Their beer list has over 500 beers and is like a book long.  They also have a page with all the staff favorites on it in case you are as indecisive as me.  All the beers were really good, I got a beer with Hibiscus in it, a fruity beer, and a beer the staff claims is the best IPA in the world.  All were awesome in their own ways.  I just moved back to the East Coast from Chicago, but if I am ever in the area again I will definitely be hitting that place up again!

56.description: If you're a craft beer fanatic then this is your place! I love Maria's, yeah it's has that divey hipster charm going for it but you should really try and look past it and just concentrate on the EPIC beer menu. If you've been meaning to try that ultra rare seasonal brew that people on beer advocate have been raving about then there's a good chance they've got it . Yeah it can get pricey but  for what you're drinking it goes with the territory.Oh btw, it's also a great place to hit after a Sox game since it's open until 3am :).

29.description: This place was recommended by a restaurant down the street. As there was not much else around. As we stood outside looking in. Maria was at the counter helping customers. Not an inviting atmosphere when you are peeking through beer bottles. We took a chance and went in. Maria checked our id's and we went into the backroom. Real speak easy type with old fashions and bitters on tap. The crowd was a older twenty something with a no cash to spare wardrobe. Friendly though and not loud at all given the place was packed. We finished our drinks and went up front to keep Maria company. She is a blast!!! We all spoke with her for about 15 minutes. Real salt of the earth and nothing gets by this 77 year young lady. Gave us all a hug before we left. Real class act. Her front door trade was amazing. Constant stream of people gabbing their libations to go. Everyone in the neighborhood has a respect for this kind lady. She's building an addition to the back bar to alleviate the crowd. But as of right now. It's a right sized neighborhood gin joint!

42.description: This one of my fav bars. It has a great selection of locally crafted beers. Whatever your selection for the night maybe, to go with cheap 2 dollar beers and shots or a good old-fashioned Maria's got it! It is a small place with limited sitting especially since it's behind a liquor store. They have small parking which is rare in the city. The staff is always really nice and the place has this low-key cool feel to it.

23.description: Win win win! This place rocks! They have something like 39 million beers on their menu and serve in glasses matched to the beer. Seriously a great spot for hanging out.

47.description: We stopped in for a quick, late lunch next door at the Pleasant House after hearing rave reviews. And much to our surprise, the Pleasant House delivers their food next door to Maria's! Needless to say, it didn't take much convincing for us to enjoy a beer with our meat pie so off to Maria's we went after ordering.Maria's is a perfect place for an afternoon beer, or cider in our case. The bartender was helpful but not overbearing. They had 10-15 beers on tap and patiently answered our questions before we chose ciders. There are package foods, beer, and specialty goods up front but if you continue to the back you find a perfectly dark and cozy bar with football playing on Sundays. Luckily, when we arrived there were two seats at the bar, but by the time we were leaving the place was bustling with no available seats.

8.description: they said get a bottle of malort... it'd be fun they said.it'd be good they said... it'd be fun they said... SHIIIIIZZZZZ only in chicago! this place is pretty cool though liqqy store in front - bar in back.

31.description: This was a treat after having dinner down the street. Walking in ii a liquor store with oodles of craft beers, interesting decor and Maria. we were all asked for ID's and wen tot the bar in back. Great dive bar with plenty to offer. The bar seating is smaller but works, there are tables and they were full of patrons enjoying themselves. Good standard dive bar. Bartenders are on top of there game and not shy on the pours. Friendly and fun for everyone. Good mix of people.However the best part was talking to Maria and enjoying her stories and just knowing this was one wild chick in her day. And well it is still her day. We all chatted about various things, took some pictures with her. We just plain out had a great evening and met a great lady. Dive bar, liquor store and good times. If your in the area this is a must stop. If your not you need to plan a stop.

34.description: Pretty solid place here. They have some good craft cocktails and decent seating. I went to the patio for lack of space and then moved outdoors cos the inside was so loud. It's a general bar. I found the bartenders a little short and not really friendly but they gave me what it needed so minus points for that. The bar doesn't have table service so you have to get your drink at the bar and eventually bus yourself. I had the corpse reviver- I liked it since it was fresh and not super bitter. Plus point- they let the people from pleasant house next door serve you so you can have a drink and food together.

16.description: My girlfriend and I were looking for a place a little out of the way to go unnoticed and to bring our considerable Connect Four game. Maria's caught our eye. The idea of a divey bar with cheap drinks seemed right for a Chicago Fall Saturday afternoon.What we got was not what we expected, but in the best possible way. Less dive, more hipster; more craft brew, less bottom shelf; a little more iPhone, less Android. A wide variety of board games were attractive, but we stuck with C4. We bypassed the considerable beer list for the standard selection of whiskey. As a crowd slowly trickled in, most tables were occupied, yet it still maintained a quiet cozy feel, far from the roving bands of college football ball fans bar hopping the north side. One surprise was the eager server from the bakery next door bringing in trays of hot pre-ordered meat pies for the bar patrons. Evidently, they had been featured on Check Please the night before and were struggling to keep up with the demand for flakey-crusted meat delicacies. They looked good and smelled better, and had we not binged on corn beef sandwiches earlier, we would have been in on that. Oh, and the man selling tamales out of a ziplock bag...Four stars only because bar service was slow (but still attentive) due to the overflow crowd from the bakery.

13.description: One of my friends celebrated his birthday at Maria's and I was quite impressed by the great hipster atmosphere this bar features. Not only that we had the time of our lives, but we also got the chance to drink some amazing cocktails. The bartenders surely love their job because they were pretty involved in what they were doing and the results spoke for themselves. The Heisenberg cocktail made me fall in love with this place, and when I tasted the sandwich I had ordered I knew that I would return to this bar as soon as possible.The following day I went to Maria's with my friends who were craving for a cold beer. We had a hard time choosing from the wide range of beer types featured in the menu, but this was certainly a sign that Maria's bar is designed to suit every customer's tastes. If you decide to give this bar a chance, don't forget to check out the patio. Its décor is so laid back and cozy that will certainly charm you. Just imagine a perfect summer night talking with your loved ones in a unique patio while drinking some of the finest cocktails in Chicago or simply enjoying a cold beer. That's what Maria's will offer you.

11.description: Ok, I get why this place has been featured on TV.Great beers.Great whiskey.Excellent bartenders.  NO!  I will not call them mixologists.  This is a bar.  But they sure can mix  some great cocktails from classics to trendy.Random shitty beer for $2?  Sure.  Why not?  I got a Hamms, could've been way worse.Next time I have to remember to shop up front first, take purchases to car, then visit the bar in front so I don't forget to purchase 3 Floyds to take back home.  Or Pipeworks.  Or Spiteful.  Or, well, you get the point.

39.description: Best atmosphere, good people, good selection of drinks. Running into friends is easy here because the secret has been out. Even bigger plus is you can get pizza delivered here, I mean...pizza and beer is a perf marriage.

37.description: I wanted to really love this place, based on the claim of 475+ bottles and drafts, but it fell a little short of amazing this past Saturday night. Props to Maria herself being in the front liquor store part checking IDs! Also enjoy that the front is a liquor store so you can continue the party at home! As mentioned in other reviews, there is no food served here, but there is a pot pie place close by if you're feeling peckish enough to bring food in. Close to 500 beers, and yet 3 times we managed to select a beer they were out of; almost comical by the time they go check and come back and tell you they don't have it several times...makes me question the appearance of vast choice and extensive inventory vs actual availability and seemingly sparse stock for some of these brews. I understand it's hard to keep a list that long current, but maybe you could list on the chalkboard things you know you don't have and save people some time? Mixed crowd, from the young hipsters to middle aged adults hanging around. The music was way, WAY too loud; you should be able to have a conversation with people at your table without screaming when you're at a neighborhood bar. Blaring music is for dance clubs. And I'm under 30, so it's definitely the bar's volume issue. Take it down a notch and it would be great. I also wish they had more variety of ciders; Ace cider is my personal least favorite brand and what they mostly serve, tastes flat to me. They also have 2 flavors of Vander Mill, which I think is better. I'll definitely go back on a weeknight to check it out when it's not prime-time, and hope the volume and stock experience might be improved; the beer list is great even if they're out of some kinds.

0.description: Perfect mixture of vibe, people, music and of course the beers/cocktails. I went there with a friend. You walk in, it looked like it could have been a convenient store. Fear no more, you will hear the disco house music playing from the back door. The place is small, fits in the description of a hipster bar. One complaint would be people are allowed to sit around the bar, sort of obstructing the patrons from ordering drinks. However, the bar tenders were helpful and watch full for the people who are trying to order. The age group falls in between 25 to 40s, with a skewed Gaussian distribution centered at 28. They have super long menu full of local craft beers. So these beers are not cheap.A Chicago must visit.

38.description: Adjectives: Neighborhood Find, good beer selectionDish: steak and ale pie from next door, $2 shitty beer of the weekI really like this hole-in-the-wall neighborhood find.  There is a liquor store in the front, but you can't drink purchases on the premises. Maria's is completely focused on curating a great beer selection, at the expense of any other thing you are looking for in a bar. Sparse decoration, dark lighting, and a few board games are available, and thankfully there is not TV blaring. They don't serve any food, but you can bring in food or get something from the wonderfully tasty Pleasant House bakery next door. (You can even order next door and get it delivered to Maria's.)There is a hipster, minimalist, community bar vibe to Maria's that makes it great for a serious beer connoisseur with a good conversation. However, I find that the lack of food options and a limited liquor and wine menus are limitations to my enjoyment of Maria's.

51.description: There's Something About Maria!Maria's Packaged Goods & Community Bar is a one-stop shop located in the Bridgeport neighborhood of Chicago, IL. In the front is a tiny liquor store where you can buy booze to-go & in the back is the "community bar" where locals in the neighborhood come to drink but has gained major popularity amongst hipsters & others from all-around as the bar has been featured on various TV shows & in magazine articles. Maria's offers a gemload of beer, liquor & specialty drinks. Roll the dice & order a "$2 random shitty beer" could be a goody or could be, well shitty! Maria's gets packed on the weekends & seating is sparse. There are only a few seats around the bar, a few tables & is mostly standing room only, but there's an outside patio too. FYI: Maria serves complimentary Korean-Polish BBQ on Mondays! Don't be cheap, leave a big tip!!The best part of Maria's is Maria, the owner, who is a fellow Korean! She's pint-sized but mans the place & cards you when you enter the front in the package store. She's the Korean boss of Bridgeport! I hope I have 1/2 the looks, spunk and spry she has at her age! The modest mama hugged me as I was leaving & said "I don't know why the TV shows come here & shrugged & said I read about it in an article on an airplane magazine."Maria's is one of my fave bars in Chicago. There are no bells & whistles or bright, shiny lights at Maria's. It's just your down-to-earth, neighborhood bar that sells a ton of good beer & liquor but has a certain undeniable, eclectic charm. So stop in and have a drink with the coolest Korean in Chi-town & see for yourself, there's just something about Maria's!

27.description: Very nice atmosphere, the Korean lady(Maria) who welcomes the customer at the door is iconic, you would find her pictures inside.It is nice if you live around but not worth the drive.Gibson Street Margarita-one of house cocktail- has a strong flavor of spice, I really liked it!

32.description: Maria is a wonderful person and deserves all the success her business is now enjoying. It's a clean and relaxed tavern. You can take some carry out wine or beer on your way out. People are friendly and the bar staff are nice too.

54.description: This place is nothing special, but its decent. A breeding ground for hipsters/middle aged people. The later it gets the younger and cooler the crowd gets. Limited seating, saw two hot guys and managed to chat one up so it wasnt bad. Drinks are decent. I would come back.

48.description: Went to Maria's on Friday with pretty low expectations and walked away with plans to come back ASAP! Maria's has a liquor store up front where you can find a solid selection of local craft beers to take to go, or head on back to the community bar, where everyone can find something that suits their fancy - from the $2 mystery shot, $2 shitty beer (bartender's choice) to an array of malort and ginger beer cocktails. I loved the mix of drinks available, the diversity of people in the bar (not just hipsters!), and the best part of the evening: delivery from Pleasant House Bakery next door for some steak and ale pie. Only complaint was that they only had one bartender at 5pm on a Friday and the place was hoppin'. It took awhile to get our drinks, but it was worth the wait!

44.description: This is what a local boozer should be. Really good beer selection, innovative cocktail list, friendly yet reserved bartender, dim setting without super loud music. Definitely will be back!

24.description: Very small bar, with a dark, casual local hipster atmosphere. Good beer & cocktail selection, if you're in the area definitely check it out. There's a variety of board games to play, which is fun.Personally I wouldn't make the drive from the loop like we did just to go here though. Glad we checked it out, but probably won't go out of our way To go back.

7.description: If only this bar were closer to my apartment and more accessible by el!The bouncer was super nice to my friend who needed to charge her phone. The bartender took my question about a cocktail seriously. The drinks were delicious. The shots were filled to the brim. The music was not obnoxious. There are board games. There are nuts for drunchies. I'm so glad I finally got to go. Make your Maria's Manhattan Black (with Averna).

49.description: Drinks are great, selection is good, patio is awesomeness, prices are reasonable.

40.description: Hole in the wall but the best craft brews at a very inexpensive price. I really enjoy the low key atmosphere.

53.description: The word has long been out about Maria's, which is unfortuante because at one time it was a hidden gem.  That being said unless you come at prime time on Friday or Saturday night you'll never find this place crazy packed, and the outdoor seating provides a great escape on warm nights.Everyone talks about the extensive beer list, and they're right, as it is extensive and amazing.  But check out the cocktails list, too.  It's a fun, inventive selection.269/365

30.description: Saw this place on esquires best bars in America and it looked pretty cool. Located in the middle of nowhere, there's just a coffee shop next door other then that not much. I came here after a whitesox game so it was close by. The place is behind a small liqour store. The bar is almost as small as the liqour store . It's dark but has a nice speakeasy feel. The draft list was amazing, they obviously get exclusive craft beers. People around my table were playing connect 4 and other board games.  There aren't much tables or chairs. And the bathroom was prb one of the worst I have ever used, maybe the size of one on a airplane. If your a local this place is not bad, but there are a lot better options for craft beer if u live outside of Bridgeport! Might be one of Americas unique bars, not "best".

46.description: We love Maria's atmosphere and proximity to our apartment. It's a great little neighborhood bar...but the music is so loud you can't hold a conversation! We finally went in the smoking lounge outside which was just as loud, but seemed quieter, because there weren't many people talking. Turn down the music, people come out to talk to each other, not to listen to bad music!

1.description: If I could give Marias 10 stars I would. Kind of off the beaten path in Bridgeport, this charming spot offers the best cocktails and a phenomenal beer list--it just can't be missed! I ventured out to Marias on a Sunday evening, and loved every second.  Friends kept telling me how amazing the Old Fashioned was, so I immediately ordered that.  As a whiskey lover, this was one of the best Old Fashioneds I've ever had.  Props to the bartender who made it!  Marias also offers some unique items, such as the "Random S**tty Beer" (domestics such as Natty Light or Busch ), and the "Bartenders Choice" (craft beers).  So much fun to roll the dice if you're feeling ambitious. The vibe at Marias is chill and fun.  You can belly up to the bar or grab a table and play some board games.  Something for everyone!  I cannot wait to go back to Marias!

55.description: Hipster Nirvana! It's dark, and the music is all about any band or DJ with a one syllable name, and most likely a mustache. Every time I've been there, there's been some random thing playing on the walls from a projector. Once, it was a series of odd black and white cartoons that were as dark as a Sin City novel, and another time they were showing the repeat of the Bulls/Suns NBA finals game 6. Let's talk booze. One of the best cocktail experiences you will ever have.. The bartenders may not be in shirts and ties, but they will make a cocktail as good as one. I fell in love with an old fashioned there. Huge list of awesome old school favorites, so find a corner table, and enjoy them all. HUGE craft beer list, and they bartenders are very knowledgable about them all. Grab multiple pints if different kinds, sit with a buddy, and enjoy the dark room fun. Or, order a flight of the tenders choice. They won't steer you wrong. This is NOT a bar to go watch the game, or have a bunch of rowdy buddies meet to be loud, and chest bump each other. This is not for bachelorette or bachelor parties. It's cool, chill bar. They don't even have shots, so don't even ask. It's sophisticated, and cool, and please leave it that way.

9.description: One of Chicago's Hipster bars becoming mainstream. Came here on a Thursday night & it was surprisingly crowded. The bartenders were slow thus ruining the vibe. Was disappointed to here the patio area is under construction but the DJ always plays decent tunes so we just chilled at the bar. Always stocked with great craft brews and the only thing close to domestic is PBR. Ahh yes, that delicious hipster juice. The front of the place is a retail section that carries quality bevs as well, so dont get confused when u walk in. Simply enter thru the door to the left behind the counter. You're welcome!

26.description: It was after an earlier escapade at another establishment had failed to deliver the proper amount of end of the work week inspiration, that me and my weary band of young professionals decided to take a trip to this nicely tucked in oasis of brew and good music. It was not disappointing one bit! It actually salvaged our night and gave us the needed recharge that was so desperately needed.The front end setup of the beer and spirits greatly works well as giving you the idea that this place resembles a regular storefront liqour store. Minus the elevated cashier counter top. Just past this was the bar area where you can purchase specialty beers and order mixed drinks. DON'T GET A TOM COLLINS!!!!The menu was easy to read and the bartenders were great at answering our questions about the selections. It definitely helped to encourage me to try something else after my initial selection came up short. Farther towards the back was the seating area. We were able to get a table that was open since it was first vome, first served here. We were soon given the table menus that had some inquiring selections that my compadres decided to also try. All while one of my favorite documentaries was playing on the projector (Watts-Stax).

25.description: One of the best, if not the best, craft beer bars in the city, i used to go drive up a lot when i lived in beverly, but now that i live in bridgeport i can go even more, they have like 500 beers to choose from, plus they sell beer to go in the front, its got a nice outdoor seating area too, and they always show some kind of weird movie on the projector screen, plus if you order food from the pleasant house you can bring it into marias, by far one of my favorite bars in the city

12.description: This was a treat after having dinner down the street. Walking in ii a liquor store with oodles of craft beers, interesting decor and Maria. we were all asked for ID's and wen tot the bar in back. Great dive bar with plenty to offer. The bar seating is smaller but works, there are tables and they were full of patrons enjoying themselves. Good standard dive bar. Bartenders are on top of there game and not shy on the pours. Friendly and fun for everyone. Good mix of people.However the best part was talking to Maria and enjoying her stories and just knowing this was one wild chick in her day. And well it is still her day. We all chatted about various things, took some pictures with her. We just plain out had a great evening and met a great lady. Dive bar, liquor store and good times. If your in the area this is a must stop. If your not you need to plan a stop.

59.description: I walked into this bar and didn't get carded as a newly 21 year old young lady.. (Not exactly a complaint) Anyway, I make my way to the bar and ask about the drink specials.. This bartender was having a conversation and treated me as if I was a bother to her. I ask about the prices and she further gives me an attitude and pours my drink but ignores me and continues with her conversation (which just sounded like gossip). I sit at the table with my friend and we enjoy the nice music selection but our moon was soon killed by the janitor... Who put up our chairs because it was 30 minutes before closing although everyone else seemed to be staying put and still ordering drinks. This guy had the nerve to tell us we couldn't put our chairs back down after we got another drink. The crowd seemed stuck up and pretentious (for no valid reason). I even got a "well it's more of an artist thing so you might not understand." At this point this bar became a joke to me. Also while drinking our beers we were told by the cleanup guy that it was closing so we had to leave... Only us apparently because everyone else was still put and socializing. I refused to be rushed out, so my friend and I finished our beers at our own place and left. I would give this place ZERO stars if I could because I couldn't pay attention to anything else but the crappy service and attitudes I was receiving the whole night.

21.description: One of Chicago's Hipster bars becoming mainstream. Came here on a Thursday night & it was surprisingly crowded. The bartenders were slow thus ruining the vibe. Was disappointed to here the patio area is under construction but the DJ always plays decent tunes so we just chilled at the bar. Always stocked with great craft brews and the only thing close to domestic is PBR. Ahh yes, that delicious hipster juice. The front of the place is a retail section that carries quality bevs as well, so dont get confused when u walk in. Simply enter thru the door to the left behind the counter. You're welcome!

17.description: I wanted to really love this place, based on the claim of 475+ bottles and drafts, but it fell a little short of amazing this past Saturday night. Props to Maria herself being in the front liquor store part checking IDs! Also enjoy that the front is a liquor store so you can continue the party at home! As mentioned in other reviews, there is no food served here, but there is a pot pie place close by if you're feeling peckish enough to bring food in. Close to 500 beers, and yet 3 times we managed to select a beer they were out of; almost comical by the time they go check and come back and tell you they don't have it several times...makes me question the appearance of vast choice and extensive inventory vs actual availability and seemingly sparse stock for some of these brews. I understand it's hard to keep a list that long current, but maybe you could list on the chalkboard things you know you don't have and save people some time? Mixed crowd, from the young hipsters to middle aged adults hanging around. The music was way, WAY too loud; you should be able to have a conversation with people at your table without screaming when you're at a neighborhood bar. Blaring music is for dance clubs. And I'm under 30, so it's definitely the bar's volume issue. Take it down a notch and it would be great. I also wish they had more variety of ciders; Ace cider is my personal least favorite brand and what they mostly serve, tastes flat to me. They also have 2 flavors of Vander Mill, which I think is better. I'll definitely go back on a weeknight to check it out when it's not prime-time, and hope the volume and stock experience might be improved; the beer list is great even if they're out of some kinds.

10.description: Maria's is...fine, or as my three stars say, A-OK.  It has what you're looking for in a bar: a solid list of beers on tap, knowledgeable bartenders, and a comfortable space to hang out for a while.  That being said, I'm not sure that it's worth all the hype!  When it's crowded, it can take forever to get a drink, and it's certainly a bit dingy (especially the bathroom).  I wouldn't make a special trip here, but it's a popular place with my coworkers, so I'll come for the company more than the space itself.

5.description: Best Kept secret in the City.My boyfriend will freak when he sees this review because he wants to keep it a secret.The bartenders know their stuff. The draft list is great!And the Old fashioned OMG.  I've had an Old fashioned in Australia, New Zealand, Paris, all over the states and in the City. So Far this is the best Ive ever had.Also Sunday-thursday they have happy hour from 4-7 for draft cocktails for $5 that are pretty god damn delicious.

3.description: Was excited to check out Maria's after reading so much about it in a variety of Chicago publications. I was headed down to Bridgeport for a Christmas party and figured it was a great time to go!Maria's is a combination liquor store/bar, or what they call a "Slashie" in Chicago. The liquor store is in front, and they have a great selection of craft beers and other spirits. Head through the door on the left and you'll find the bar. They have a good variety of beers on tap and hundreds more available in cans/bottles. Plenty of liquors to choose from as well in addition to some cocktails on tap too.There's a handful of tables in the back and some space by the bar itself, but overall it's pretty small. I can imagine there's a bit of a bottleneck when the place gets crowded. They have a bunch of board games available which is pretty awesome! There were some good jams playing the night we went; someone's Mac was controlling the playlist.Maria's should definitely be on your Chicago bar bucket list. It's quite different from most bars in the city and is worth the trip to Bridgeport to check it out!

35.description: A little small, but a great vibe.  The DJ was feeling it!If you're hungry, head next door for some pasty pies.  Absolutely delicious.Fantastic beer selection; well priced.  House made cocktails were a little sugary/syrupy, but other than that, very pleased.

19.description: I don't remember the name of the drink I had (twice), but there was tea in it and it was amazing.

28.description: Hidden gem of Bridgeport for sure. Best beer collection, cozy feel, casual, and in the summer they have a wonderful outdoor patio. My go-to bar for sure with little to no douchebags!

45.description: How have I not reviewed this place? Was here for New Year's 2013, and was here again last night. This is the Hopleaf of the south side, a dizzying array of beers. Usually packed. Nice bartenders and door guy. Have I mentioned a dizzying array of beers?

33.description: I sensed a bit of tension as I walk into what appears to be a nice store front with a good selection of beers, asking for where the restroom was. I had just visited the place next door and got a very inhospitable & disagreeable attitude & person (see my last review) and the lady at this counter was hesitant yet let me in. I end up walking into a bar area that was a bit divey but has an incredible tap list! I'm staying. I try a few unique beers including a rare tap of Deschutes' The Abyss and Firestone's 18th Anniv. which were both very pleasing to the taste buds. The bartender knows his stuff and was friendly and accommodating. I then got a bit more acquainted with the lady up front while buying a couple to-go items, at very reasonable prices for the city.. As always, I wish these gems were closer to where I live and in this case, didn't have to be smack in the middle of gentrified hipster central. ;) Can't have it all.

43.description: I only give this place two stars because every beer I tried I did not like. I know they have unique selections though, and it could be that I don't know my beers to well. Also, it is small and crowded, which is not really my cup of tea. I go here sometimes because  a lot of my friends enjoy it, so maybe my rating is rare for Maria's.

2.description: This place is so great, I'm bummed I don't live in the city anymore. The front room is a liquor store, so you can grab tasty drinks for later, and the bar is in the back--huge draft list, awesome cocktails, cool bartenders. They don't serve food, SO I highly recommend ordering food at Pleasant House Bakery next door, and then eating it at Maria's. Truly the best of both worlds.

18.description: HUGE selection of beers, Fun environment.  Enormous selection of bourbons and other fine spirits.  Great place.

41.description: Hipster vibes are definitely going on here but even if that's not your scene I still recommend checking this spot out. Amazing cocktails and very interesting tap menu in a pretty intimate bar setting is not the easiest thing to find but you can get all that here. Also the pot pie shop next door will deliver amazing drunk food straight to your table at the bar; fantastic.

52.description: I've been here twice and both times were a ton of fun- however, I have only been here during the week or on a Sunday.There is plenty of parking on nearby streets and is next door to Pleasant House Bakery. The shop in the front is actually neat looking, with a lot of fun stuff to try but I have yet to purchase anything from there. The fun, as usual, is in the back. There are 2 patios- one covered and one not. The bar inside of the bar has a few tables and some seats around the bar. It is not a big place so I'm not sure if I'd venture out here on a weekend.The drinks here are really tasty. I don't drink much hard alcohol, but I really like the regents park and rosemary fizz drinks. The bf likes the sazerac. If you're feeling lucky you can try your luck at the $2 random shitty beer draw. Service has always been good here.It would be nice if the patios were smoke free, perhaps the smokers could go out front? I'd like to enjoy the patio as well without the smoke.

50.description: The bar has a speakeasy type of feel. Not that I was alive when they were around, but I've seen movies. The drinks where creative and tasty. They do there job and the music is randomly awesome. The cool thing is you see the painting of the woman on the wall and when you leave you turn around and say "See ya later" to that nice lady in the painting. Only gripe... Remodel the bathroom and keep it cleaner.

4.description: I swear I wanted to like this place and give it more stars. I really did. Coming in, I had high expectations, and perhaps that's why I was underwhelmed. Esquire's Best Bars in America. Timeout Chicago. Thrillist. Yelp. Chicago Reader. You name it, they've loved this little gem as one of the best bars in the city of Chicago! Reality check: it isn't the best bar in Chicago. It isn't close. It might be the best bar in Bridgeport, but really, who are they competing with? Let's begin with the service. Disclaimer: the owner up front is very sweet and welcoming and maybe had I gone in to purchase booze my experience would have been better. But the bartenders were disinterested in my date and me. Perhaps if my appearance had been more shabby and "hipster," I would have garnered their attention throughout my evening when I needed a refill. The Marz beer I tried was original and creative, but it didn't taste very good. Obscurity only goes so far if the beer isn't tasty. My next drink, the Moscow Mule, running a cheap $7, tasted like a typical $7 Moscow Mule from River North or West Loop (trendy, overpriced neighborhoods). Well vodka, not very much of it, and a cheap taste. Pass on all fronts.In fact, pass moving forward in general. I don't live near here and it is not worth the trek. If I make the trek again, I'll be stopping into Duck Inn.

6.description: I was first introduced to Maria's a few years ago when my bestie took me to Pleasant House next door (OMG, Pleasant House! *droool*).I wouldn't even necessarily call Maria's a "dive bar". The decor, while pretty basic, isn't indicative of a dive bar. You have your bar stools and you have tables in the back. No frills. They have loads of craft beer on top, not mention a plethora of bottles, and a damn well stocked liquor section. In all the times I've been to Maria's, all the bartenders have been really cool. There's no arrogance. pretentious nor hipster attitudes at all. And I like that on nights it does get busy, you'll find a good mix of people: neighborhood folks, young and old, hipsters, people from other parts of the city, etc. I can't say I've been there when they've played great music. It's generally whatever random DJ Apple Laptop of the week. But that's not to say it's bad music that ruins someone's night. Stuff you can generally tune out.Really, just go here for the drinks. Beers, cocktails, conversations...seriously, all VERY good. And to chime in with others that have stated: best Old Fashioned in the city!

22.description: Ok, I get why this place has been featured on TV.Great beers.Great whiskey.Excellent bartenders.  NO!  I will not call them mixologists.  This is a bar.  But they sure can mix  some great cocktails from classics to trendy.Random shitty beer for $2?  Sure.  Why not?  I got a Hamms, could've been way worse.Next time I have to remember to shop up front first, take purchases to car, then visit the bar in front so I don't forget to purchase 3 Floyds to take back home.  Or Pipeworks.  Or Spiteful.  Or, well, you get the point.

15.description: Adjectives: Neighborhood Find, good beer selectionDish: steak and ale pie from next door, $2 shitty beer of the weekI really like this hole-in-the-wall neighborhood find.  There is a liquor store in the front, but you can't drink purchases on the premises. Maria's is completely focused on curating a great beer selection, at the expense of any other thing you are looking for in a bar. Sparse decoration, dark lighting, and a few board games are available, and thankfully there is not TV blaring. They don't serve any food, but you can bring in food or get something from the wonderfully tasty Pleasant House bakery next door. (You can even order next door and get it delivered to Maria's.)There is a hipster, minimalist, community bar vibe to Maria's that makes it great for a serious beer connoisseur with a good conversation. However, I find that the lack of food options and a limited liquor and wine menus are limitations to my enjoyment of Maria's.

57.description: Best bar in chicago.  Maria's is always doing something cool - be it showing some weird foreign films on the wall, having complimentary koreon polish bbq out back or hosting big name distillers and brewers for tastings - sometimes of some pretty rare stuff.  The bartenders are all fantastic drink makers, and I don't think you can find a better old fashioned or manhattan anywhere in the city - if you can, let me know.

20.description: It's a neighbor dive. Beer bar. Dark and bunch of hippies and posers. Not into it. But it's better than before they remodeled.

36.description: How can you not love this place? Great beer, great staff, great cocktails, and a liquor store open till two in the front that is often staffed by the duchess de Bridgeport herself. Can't wait for the expansion. With Marz brewing killing it and the growth of the bar, only great things are in the horizon for Maria's and the neighborhood of the future it calls home.

14.description: Saw this place on esquires best bars in America and it looked pretty cool. Located in the middle of nowhere, there's just a coffee shop next door other then that not much. I came here after a whitesox game so it was close by. The place is behind a small liqour store. The bar is almost as small as the liqour store . It's dark but has a nice speakeasy feel. The draft list was amazing, they obviously get exclusive craft beers. People around my table were playing connect 4 and other board games.  There aren't much tables or chairs. And the bathroom was prb one of the worst I have ever used, maybe the size of one on a airplane. If your a local this place is not bad, but there are a lot better options for craft beer if u live outside of Bridgeport! Might be one of Americas unique bars, not "best".

3.description: Recently enlisted Kevin and the Flower Cottage to do the floral pieces for our wedding. He was great to work with, rather laid back. Even though our order was small he was very accommodating and created very pretty arrangements. They pride themselves on not making substitutions for flowers as other florists may do for arrangements.

1.description: They did a great job on a bouquet for my wife.   Our daughter was born and I wanted to take something to the hospital room.     They completed my order 90 min after I called it in.   Thanks!

2.description: Kevin and the girls at the Flower cottage did my wedding bouqets and flowers for the parents and I can not begin to say what a wonderful job they did. The flowers were beautiful but more importantly Kevin was great, he was such a pleasure to work with and truly cares about his customers. Definitely not just in it for the money like some places are. He personally delivered my flowers to me at my ceremony site and to me, that means a lot. I would highly recommend them to everyone for any occasion big or small.

0.description: Just received a birthday delivery from the Flower Cottage. I wasn't home when the delivery person showed up, so he left me a nice message stating that he'd leave my flowers in the building foyer for when I returned. The flower arrangement is absolutely stunning, and the cute balloon and custom wine glass were a nice added touch. I'm so glad they're in the neighborhood and plan on making them my go-to flower shop.

I went to the White Sox game a few weeks ago on a Friday night and we ended up in the Miller Light Bullpen Sports Bar. We had bought 500 level tickets to the game for a mere $8 but we never made it to our seats because we got seats out on the Patio. If you've ever been to the cell you'll recognize The Patio as the restaurant located in right field that is at field level. To get there you simply need to arrive at the Miller Light Bullpen Sports bar early enough that there is still seating available and then enjoy the major upgrade. Our waitress was wonderful, and did a great job of checking up on us throughout the 3 hour baseball game. The food was decent, although I wish they had some more options. It's a fairly limited list of pub grub especially when you compare it to the many other options located throughout the ball park on the 100 level.  The beer list though was surprisingly extensive for a baseball park, and they also had a full bar and wine. I recommend going for the 20 oz drafts for the best value, and I also recommend trying the Comiskey Ale as it was very good and you can't find it anywhere else. Even better is that as the night goes on and the game gets cooler the indoor part of the bar is heated, and they have their own bathrooms that don't develop the lines you'll see in the rest of the park. Now that I have discovered this gem I know exactly where I'll be watching White Sox games from from now on!

3.description: This is my first time reviewing the company. The people who run it are nice but this is about their business.I have only been to Glo On Braids twice and unfortunately I won't be returning because they are getting too expensive. Don't get me wrong, they do a good job on the hair but I am not made of money and at some point you have to question what you are really getting for your money. The first time I went the cost for mid back Senegalese twists was $200 in September or October of 2013. The cost for the same hair-do in February 2014 is $250 which is now really out of my price range. I understand that prices have to increase for inflation but a $50 increase is ridiculous. Now I don't have a lot of experience with getting my hair braided/twisted  and so I went with Glo On because they had really good reviews. Everyone seems to have an opinion of what makes a hair braider good and all I knew was that this place had good reviews and they weren't too difficult to get to. Something else that bugged me besides the price was willing to write off is the experience. When you have someone sitting in a chair for up to 6 hours and the client is paying you a lot of money I think it is courteous to offer them refreshments such as water and it also can't hurt to apologize if you are delayed by something.The last time I went I think that my spot was overbooked because at one point there were 3 people at once waiting to have there hair done including myself (though she did have an assistant). At some times I was left sitting waiting for long periods of time because she was working on other people. Shavon started doing my hair at 9:30 but I didn't get out of her office until 6pm. It is in the south loop off of Wabash and Roosevelt Road.I don't have a lot of experience with hair braiders so I thought I had found a winner that I would return to for years to come. That all changed when she increased her prices. I recently found an alternative that I can use next time who can do it for much cheaper for the same result.

1.description: I had a great experience at Glo On and will be returning to her for braids in the future. Shavon was pleasant and we had friendly conversation. I didn't get my hair washed and tried to blow dry it but I do wish it was blown out more because my hair (which is kinky curly) cam be seen through the braids. I know for next time to get it washed/blown out there.Other than that, I love my braids and the location is SUPER convenient, in the south loop. I'll be back!

2.description: I was happy to be in Shavon's chair again. I love my yarn twists. The atmosphere is peaceful and easy to relax in. Shavon truly works her magic and takes care of your hair.

5.description: My cousin has been natural for almost 10 years but never went to a professional stylist. She was getting married and I insisted that she have her hair done professionally. We went to 3 consultations. Glo On won hands down! They we're very patient during the free consult and used her hair to show samples of different styles they could achieve. Upon leaving they set up a tentative appointment with us in their computer system and said they would follow up to see what we decided. We had a horrible experience at another natural hair salon named Chatoo, which charged us a consultation fee knowing they wouldn't be available for the date we needed the hair done and the simple style we requested was going to cost a ridiculous amount. We hurriedly left and finally confirmed our appointment with Glo On. From that time on they were constantly in communication with us. They confirmed different hairstyles and hair accessories. The appointment they gave us started exactly on time and they finished 2 hours earlier than the initial estimate. But with the speed they did not sacrifice the quality. The hair turned out beautiful!! It was exactly like our vision and the price was so reasonable. Thank you Glo On for a wonderful experience. We will be back!

6.description: I had a great experience today. I moved from CA looking for someone to do loc maintenance with a latch hook for micro-locs and Glo On came to the rescue. The products smelled great, the conversation was friendly, and my hair looks great!

7.description: Customer service SUCKS!!!!! I had a consultation with Shavon and was very excited about getting my hair done...After the consultation, I got no response from her. I called and left a message on her VM then I reached out to her on Facebook - NO RESPONSE. What I found funny is, FB will let you know when a person reads your messages and needless to say she read my message 20 minutes after I reached out to her. I'm very glad that I didn't purchase the hair from her ($200), because I would be stuck in a rut being that she won't return calls. Good luck to anyone needing to get their hair done by her, I guess she's too busy for new clients.

8.description: I have been going to Glo on Braids for about 6 months now and will look no further for anyone else to care for my hair. Shavon is every efficient and works at a speedy rate. She braids very neat and does not pull tight. I have been consistently getting my hair braided for 6 months and still have strong healthy edges. Shavon does a beautiful job and I recommend her for natural hair care and styling services.

0.description: Shavon is my go to natural hair stylist because she is creative and gentle. She's the best around in my opinion.

4.description: "I really enjoyed my visit to Glo On Braids. The environment was relaxing and my finished style looked great. My braids were neatly done but not too tight such as my past experiences with braided styles. I will be a returning customer. Thanks Shavon for a job well done!

58.description: Ordered a pizza for delivery at 8:30. Told it would be there within an hour. 10:00 called to check status. Told there was a ticket made, but it was blank, but not to worry a 20% off pizza will be there within thirty minutes. 11:30, pizza arrives, cold, nothing special.  Gee thanks for the $4 off, 3 hours later. Would not recommend for delivery.

56.description: Breaded steak sandwich with mozz and hot peppers is divine. You got the mix of cheesy sloppy goodness with crunchy peppers and amazing sauce. If you manage to finish the big size, you may not need to eat again. Ever.

29.description: I order about $100.00 dollars a month from Freddie's and I will never order there again. Worst customer service ever. I ordered a salad with blue cheese and onions on the side. When my order comes there is blue cheese on my salad. This has happened Before a few times and not a big deal they just bring another salad that is correct. But this time was different. They said the needed the salad back in order to replace it. When I asked why and what they are going to do with it, I was shocked. They said it was there standard procedure which like I said before they have always just brought me a correct salad and have never asked for the old one back and that they are just going to throw the old one away. Why do I need to return a salad that was already opened just so they could throw it away? Makes no sense to me but I will never spend my hard earned money at Freddie's again. There a thousand of other places to purchase basic Italian food. Not to mention I am a city of Chicago employee and I have been telling everybody I know not to eat there. Hopefully there business will suffer because of lack of customer service.

42.description: I guess I should have read some reviews beforehand, but I didn't since we've been here before. However, one of the reviews says, seems they've gone goofy with their prices, they really have, I'll agree. I wonder if it also can be said for the sizes too.We go to "another" place nearby and for a similar price get what they call a king beef, and we split it, it's just slightly under the size of two good sized regular beefs. So I placed an order to go, for a large beef and some poppers. My order was called and I grabbed the bag and made off to the car. I figured the beef was standing upright in the bag because it can't be as long as the width of the bag, well it was. So then I thought must be a mistake.I really didn't want to go back in the place was jammed, but I thought I better because this isn't what we were planning on splitting. As I walked back I was lucky to run into one of the workers just coming out for his break. Nice guy BTW, and he gladly confirmed, yeah that is a large beef. All I can say is, "oh wow" and told him about the other place. Oddly enough, the poppers were half the size of what I've seen at other places.I will say, the food was good, not great. We both agreed that our other place had the better tasting beef sandwiches, and at a better value too. Our order was 17 bucks and some change. For a beef and poppers, no drink. Sort of pricey (imo).

23.description: I ordered a stuffed pepperoni pizza, and the crust was raw. The tomatoes on top tasted canned. I had it delivered, so now I have to deal with calling to get a refund. I do not recommend.

47.description: On April 10th I placed an order for delivery for me and 3 other guest. its was an hour to deliver. I met the driver in front of my house and he handed me the food. (am i the only one on this planet who doesn't check the pizza? because im going to start) the wings were right, the pizza wasn't. it was a small sausage when I ordered a large half cheese (vegetarians) & half pepperoni. I immediately called the driver (he might have my pizza) but he gave our pizza away. he offered me a free calzone. eh no thanks. i called freddies who then offered to get me my right pizza (kind at first) but the time was too long (2 hours) so i declined. THEY OFFERED ME A FULL REFUND! YAY! RIGHT? WRONG! got my monthly statement and they never refunded me. for a pizza i didn't eat? not cool. gave a call on may 1st when i checked my statement, they said they'll call me back (never did) called back may 3rd, gave me the run around again.  called again may 4th, spoke to a manager, Christie, telling me since i didn't get the name of the manager who i spoke to in April, they cant help me. because you guys don't keep schedules or time stamps? im sure if an employee stole money from you instead of me then you will know who was working? right? she was extremely unhelpful asking me why i didn't call before? because this should not be a problem. if you mess up and order & i cancel, that means i receive a refund!! she then offered to call me back. AGAIN! of course no one called me back so today i called again, & she tells me she doesn't believe me, & once i sign the credit slip, im wrong their right. she continues to be rude, talk over me, & call me a liar. great customer service, NOT! i got a number for cooperate, who surprisingly only has voice mail & will give me a call back. Wasted $40+ on nothing. food: the wings, meh. pizza: no idea.

8.description: Price increase on 10" subs. They are in the process of increasing prices. So call ahead. Food is still good. How's the thin crust pizza? Any opinions regarding thin crust here?

31.description: One of the worst pizza and wings I have had in a long time. Had a cheese pizza and wings delivered. The pizza was cold, the dough was tough and lacked flavor. The wings were tiny and undercooked. The fries were cold, mushy and had absolutely no flavor. There are far better restaurants in the area. Don't waste your time or money.

34.description: Freddies has never disappointed me. My son loves getting a slice from here and I've enjoyed everything from the burgers to the salads. Service is pretty quick considering everything is made to order and delivery has always been less then 45 min. Favorite place to order from in the neighborhood.

16.description: I'm from Bridgeport so I've been going to Freddies for 10+ years.  This was always mine and my friends' hangout spot in highschool and to this day, it has remained consistent in the food and service provided.  I love their pizza and I always have to get the lemon italian ice.  I have never had any issues here and I swear, if anybody is passing through and looking for some good, quick Italian food, Freddies is the place to be!

13.description: Not too much to say. I was hungry. It was 3 pm on a Monday afternoon. I wanted a slice of pizza. Make that starving, and make that two slices. Thin crust sausage or thin crust cheese? Or the special of the day, the stuffed sausage and pepperoni? I told the polite, efficient, counter guy that I'd like one of each of the thin crust. Before I could say, "Aren't there any child labor laws in Bridgeport, because this kid seems like he's a tween!" my slices were ready. And the glass for water that they gave me was full-size, not one of those "penalty cups" some places stick you with for not buying into the high-fructose corn syrup industrial complex. The pizza was hot, fresh and perfectly crisp, even straight out of the little rotating holding bin. The sausage was tasty, with no trace of extra grease on the cheese. The sauce was delicious, with the perfect amount of tang (though I do recommend some dried red pepper flakes). This pizza ain't gourmet, and they don't tell you the name of the farm where they got the pork and cheese, or even where the wheat was separated from the chaff. That must be one of the reasons that the sausage slice was 3 bucks; the cheese was less.When I first saw the place, my mind thought "Fast Freddies" and not "Fabulous Freddies." I don't know what makes Freddie "fabulous," but the place sure is fast, friendly and fairly priced.

11.description: EXCELLENT!!!! Today was my 1st time trying Freddie's and I must say I will definitely be back! I tried the breaded steak with mozzarella cheese with a slice of chicken, sun dried tomato and spinach pizza with an order of fries. My mom had a deep dish slice of sausage & cheese with a double cheese burger and my aunt had a grilled chicken on wheat with cheese fries and onion rings. We all swapped so that we could taste a variety and now I'm stuffed!!! It was very crowded but they managed the lines well. I would've given 5 stars but so many people ordered after me got there food 1st while I looked at my food sit on the counter top.Overall great food!!!!

39.description: Do not get the pasta w meat sauce, they put bacon in it, which changes the flavor of the sauce completely, in a bad way.  Thin crust cheeses is fabulous!!!

37.description: Pro: Late night snacks; Tiramisu, Italian Ice, Cheese Fries, and more. Check out their menu.Con: N / AFinal verdict: Recommend.

0.description: We ordered 2 large pizzas for a party that we were hosting for the NAACP Awards.The pizzas were hot, delicious & satisfying. I'm a picky eater and usually can find something for which to complain. What a wonderful EXPERIENCE ! The sausage & cheese pie was scrumptious! The spinach, ground beef & cheese pie was OTHER worldly. I now believe that HOME RUN INN has met it's match !!!!  I even had an Italian ice, half strawberry & half lemon...Ohhhhhhh, MAMA YUMMY !!!                                                               La Brown

38.description: This review is for my rehearsal dinner, which was in the upstairs party room at Freddies. Christie, one of the owners, helped me plan a menu. Christie was very easy to reach and responsive to my emails. I tried not to be a bridezilla, but I'm sure I emailed her a little bit more than the average guest. Still, she responded quickly and answered all of my questions.Although much fancier options were available, we went with Italian beef and sausage, salad, and fries! We had a lot of former Chicagoans visiting for the wedding, and we wanted to make sure they had a chance to eat some Italian beef while they were in town.The party room is so bright and comfortable and clean. All of our guests loved their dinners, and everyone went back for seconds (or thirds). Our bartender and server were very helpful and kind, and made sure everyone was happy - they brought extra hot peppers and even flipped on our Pandora station of choice.If you want to throw a party, Freddies has great food at a reasonable price with wonderful service! Highly recommended.
