51.description: This place has changed I was unhappy with the service. My food was not good like a rush job. None of us really  enjoyed our food. But I can't get over the face that this was a game night and the place was just nasty. The floors look like a broom and mop had not been used all day. How could you be told about the trash and don't send anyone to get it Asap. Its little bugs flying around and you have people seating trying to eat. Really sad.Other will see it. So if the lobby is looking like this then what is the kitchen looking like???How about the health inspector come give y'all a pop up on a game night. We saw a couple that had spent plenty of money and had to move to another table bye to the bugs by the trash and the food trays stacked up high. When all you thinking about is money, money and more money.I have be really enjoying this place but after seeing how y'all really get down..Good night and Good Bye.

27.description: Great place for a quick bite. The food is good, and you cant go wrong with their italian ice. Definitely check it out.They recently came out with an adult italian ice. Not sure how good but its worth a try.

32.description: Great breaded steak sandwich, pizza, eggplant Parmesan and Italian ice. We love everything that we have ever tried here! Service is good.

54.description: One of the great places in Bridgeport or anywhere for that matter. Great homemade food. Great family and Service. The price is right and the food is authentic. Real neighborhood authenticity.

48.description: I bookmarked this place because I heard they had a great Italian Beef sandwich.   I'm not a big Italian beef fan, but my parents are, so we went to check them out one night.  You order and pick up your food from the counter, but it's very clean and well kept.  We got the Italian Beef, Buffalo chicken wrap and sausage pizza.  The pizza was by far the best of the 3.  The italian beef was dry, even with the jus.  The buffalo chicken wrap was good, but nothing special.  The pizza, however was 14" and it was $10 for any 1-topping.  There were a lot of sausages on the pizza and it was delicious.  Overall, a nice, family owned establishment with a great pizza deal.  I'll be back.

44.description: After searching for a place that was open on a Monday (not much is open) we chose this place. I have been here on and off for years and always remember it being a solid good. This time I have to say that the sauce was pretty tasteless and left something to the imagination.  The Italian ice was yummy as always, but I would skip dinner and move right to dessert.

24.description: They have the best hot dogs, hands down. Even better than Portillo's. I always tell them to put my hot dog on the grill. It takes a bit longer, but it's worth the wait. If you're low on cash, you can get a hot dog and fries for $3 and some change. Sometimes they are stingy with the fries.  I'm sure the prices went up since the last time I've been there. Their customer service needs improvement. When I go in to pick up my order, the cashiers have an attitude like they don't want me there. Their delivery is even worst than the customer service! They take easily over an HOUR to bring your food, they're always leaving something out of your order, and half of the food is cold. Then the driver has the nerve to get mad at you when you tell them what's wrong or if something is missing. That's what you get paid to do, so why get mad? Their delivery is always a hit and miss. More misses than hits. Their pizza is good and their fries are awesome. They just need an overhaul on their staff. I'm sure they have lost some customers based on their bad customer service alone. If I'm in the area, MAYBE I'll stop in for a grilled hot dog, MAYBE NOT.

7.description: Sadly, their prices have done up. However, the food remains the same, AWESOME! Their cheese fries and italian ice are a must have, especially in the summer!

49.description: Good food, friendly staff.. Always busy, with all the business they have at this location, I don't see why they haven't tried to expand to other areas of the city.

40.description: We order from them a lot. So far we've only gotten their Italian beef and bread steak sandwich, both of which are pretty great. The reason I'm knocking it a star is for their online ordering system. It never fails, when I order from their online system I am always missing something. Most of the time it is the natural beef gravy that I ask for on the side. This is not limited to the online ordering system, this has happened many times when I order over the phone. Usually, I don't care too much if items are forgotten, but I order from them enough that it actually deters me from ordering from their restaurant.

53.description: This place is so much better than it needs to be. Go there with friends and order thirty things off the menu and sample all of the fried and/or cheesy and/or meaty glory. The pizza-of-the-week is always an interesting mix of toppings and it never disappoints, because they use good cheese and don't skimp. Their fried wings are perfect, and they'll coat 'em in buffalo for you. Their Italian beef is some of the best I've had. They have full pasta dishes, too. And gigantic salads. And big sub sandwiches. And they'll make you a booze-y italian ice. Really, the menu is huge, and the kitchen area looks very clean.But you better love dining with cops!

30.description: OBSESSED with their lemon Italian ice. Seriously my favorite thing to eat. Sometimes the consistency is a little off (too watery) but most of the time it's like this perfect icy texture. I'm such a huge fan. I don't really like the other flavors as much only because I think they're a bit too sweet. The lemon has a nice tartness that cuts through the sugar.Besides their Italian ice, I really haven't had much else on the menu besides their Italian beef and fries, which are also fantastic! I guess every time I go to Freddie's I just get the same thing because I like it so much. They're both nice hefty portions. I usually get a regular size Italian beef and a half size of fries, and that's PLENTY. Love their portions here, it's great. Two thumbs up!

46.description: Everything was great about this place excellent service great food and good prices. Definitely worth the drive you can't lose here everything on the menu was good especially the infused Italian ice.

1.description: Been eating here for years and i was so disappointed...did they change the Italian beef recipe? The meat was thinly sliced not like I remember it and the meat was so full of fat I couldn't enjoy it! The Au jus was blah...the giarniera peppers had no kick...really, what happened Fabulous Freddies? It was a NO for me and hubby!The special slice of eggplant and meat ball pizza...was there any eggplant also very salty! Not happy on this trip!The two stars are for the creamy rich mozzarella cheese on the beef

55.description: I have been coming to Freddie's since I was a kid. I admit that the food tasted a lot better back then, but I assume that they have just made it healthier since. The pan pizza is large and cheap. It is great for parties and I don't think you can find a better place in Bridgeport. Since they re-opened, I really enjoy the load tater tots. Nothing but bacon and cheesy goodness.If you are in the area or hungry after a Sox game, give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

9.description: They have the best salads.  My kids beg to come here either to eat in our for take out.   You can't beat their $10 pizza and their italian ice in the summer.  The burgers and beef sandwiches are out favorites and the cross are great.

26.description: Just picked up a Big Breaded Steak with red sauce, mozzarella and sweet peppers to go.  When I got back to the office...no mozzarella.  That kind a messes it up.  I'm too far away to go back so I ate it and enjoyed it but I was really looking forward to the cheese too.I'll be back because I like a good Breaded Steak but hopefully they will have improved their quality control by then.

25.description: The Italian is the best in Chicago hands down. Better then Marios. I also have tried the cheeseburger special and Italian beef which both were good. Not a big fan of the lasagna. The prices are cheap and fast service. They are open late and always packed. Pizza looks good too.

12.description: We live right down the street and constantly order out from here, mainly pizza, it's classic thin crust, but also some sides like the loaded fries, nachos and mozzarella sticks, it's always dependable and never lets us down, they have alcoholic italian ice for dine in, one of these days I'll try it, in addition to their breakfast menu

59.description: We ended up here because of a school dinner night. I was unhappy about clutter in the seating area but was happy to see it was cleaned up in 15 mins after we sat at our table. Although i cant vouch for the food, my kids seem to like it and portion size is big. I have to mention i forgot my wristlet in the ladies room and 30 mins later when we were leaving i realized didnt have my car keys, lucky for me someone turned it in at the cash register.

21.description: Not impressed my sandwich was a very very small it had not enough needs it was on a real hard Bun and I threw it out their delivery is too high priced there Pizza I will give is good but that wasn't worth the $20 I spend I won't come here again go elsewhere

17.description: Everything was great about this place excellent service great food and good prices. Definitely worth the drive you can't lose here everything on the menu was good especially the infused Italian ice.

10.description: Just picked up a Big Breaded Steak with red sauce, mozzarella and sweet peppers to go.  When I got back to the office...no mozzarella.  That kind a messes it up.  I'm too far away to go back so I ate it and enjoyed it but I was really looking forward to the cheese too.I'll be back because I like a good Breaded Steak but hopefully they will have improved their quality control by then.

5.description: I just ordered delivery from there and was quite impressed with the food quantity as well as quality.Delivery time took almost 45 minutes but it was worth it as I was unable to go to their location.I ordered the turkey burger and a pizza slice and made everybody jealous as soon as they saw it!

3.description: Oh my lord! The turkey burgers are cooked really bad. The quality of the meat is worse than McDonald's. The turkey burger tasted like charcoal. The meat looks like a old wrinkled hand that's been microwaved ten times.The only thing that saves Freddie's is their Italian ice. This is sad to say since I live in Bridgeport.

35.description: Where do you begin with Freddie's? Everything on their menu is delicious! They have some of the best pizza in Chicago. Which they always have available by the slice if you stop in for lunch. Even though they never have the pepperoni as ready as much as they do the sausage because I'm a pepperoni guy.Their dipped Italian beef with mozzarella and hot peppers is mouthwatering. And their Italian ice(especially the strawberry) is the best in all of Chicago! So unless you're an extremely picky eater, I know you will absolutely love Freddie's. So give them a try if you've never been there before.

19.description: My husband and I had had Freddies before and today we were craving a sub. I called and placed our order for delivery, 2 subs and a side of tater tots. The guy who took our order said it'll be an hour. We're not far from Freddies but for the convenience,  we're fine with it.An hour passes, no sign of our delivery.  I let 10 more mins pass before checking on our order-nothing. I call to check on the status they put me on hold and, this time a woman, says she called the driver and he got held up on another delivery but would arrive in 8-9mins. 15 minutes pass and still no sign of our delivery.  I know we pay extra for convenience and it could take a little longer but an hour and a half? For 2 subs? My husband was tired of waiting and I called to cancel the order. I'm not sure if it was the same woman who answered the 3rd time but I explained to her that we've been waiting over an hour and a half and last time I checked in the driver should of already been here and I want to cancel the order. She puts me on hold, and then gets on the line and says "okay, that's fine" and hangs up.She did not try to offer any type of apology and simply dismissed me. I can understand some type of delay with deliveries but this was a bit much and then to not offer an apology? That's basic customer service, they didn't demonstrate any type of respect to me as a customer or for my time wasted. I could of honestly let it go if there had been some type of apology but now I'll won't be returning to freddies.

28.description: EXCELLENT!!!! Today was my 1st time trying Freddie's and I must say I will definitely be back! I tried the breaded steak with mozzarella cheese with a slice of chicken, sun dried tomato and spinach pizza with an order of fries. My mom had a deep dish slice of sausage & cheese with a double cheese burger and my aunt had a grilled chicken on wheat with cheese fries and onion rings. We all swapped so that we could taste a variety and now I'm stuffed!!! It was very crowded but they managed the lines well. I would've given 5 stars but so many people ordered after me got there food 1st while I looked at my food sit on the counter top.Overall great food!!!!

45.description: I ordered the rib dinner from Freddie's today for lunch.  When I called in the order I asked what comes with the rib dinner, which I was told coleslaw, bread,  & fries with the ribs. The total came to about $20. When I came into pick up the order the bag seemed small for what I was getting. I asked the girl at the counter if everything was in the bag, which she told me it was. I was in a hurry to get back to my job site, so I left and when I got back and opened my lunch there were only ribs in the bag. No coleslaw, no bread, no fries.  I paid $20 for ribs and a drink. I called the restaurant to let them know and was told to "next time check your bag." Not even an apology was offered. Horrible customer service.

33.description: I have ordered from here on two separate occasions and been very pleased both times. The Italian beef, loaded fries and cob salad were very good. I called ahead to place my order for pick up and both times it was hot, fresh and ready when I arrived just minutes later. However, pick up/loading zone tendd to be busy but thats because they have a great business. The prices are a little higher when compared to similar places, but worth it!

43.description: Not too much to say. I was hungry. It was 3 pm on a Monday afternoon. I wanted a slice of pizza. Make that starving, and make that two slices. Thin crust sausage or thin crust cheese? Or the special of the day, the stuffed sausage and pepperoni? I told the polite, efficient, counter guy that I'd like one of each of the thin crust. Before I could say, "Aren't there any child labor laws in Bridgeport, because this kid seems like he's a tween!" my slices were ready. And the glass for water that they gave me was full-size, not one of those "penalty cups" some places stick you with for not buying into the high-fructose corn syrup industrial complex. The pizza was hot, fresh and perfectly crisp, even straight out of the little rotating holding bin. The sausage was tasty, with no trace of extra grease on the cheese. The sauce was delicious, with the perfect amount of tang (though I do recommend some dried red pepper flakes). This pizza ain't gourmet, and they don't tell you the name of the farm where they got the pork and cheese, or even where the wheat was separated from the chaff. That must be one of the reasons that the sausage slice was 3 bucks; the cheese was less.When I first saw the place, my mind thought "Fast Freddies" and not "Fabulous Freddies." I don't know what makes Freddie "fabulous," but the place sure is fast, friendly and fairly priced.

2.description: Came here because word on the street is they have a better breaded steak sandwich than Ricobenes. We ordered the "big" sandwich, which we thought would be more than enough to share. However, the sandwich wasn't big all. What does the regular size look like i Wonder? At $11.20 with hot peppers and mozzerella, we were disappointed.The only thing I would go back for is the Italian ice. We got a small mango flavored ice and for $2.75 with tax, it was a steal. They really filled that cup up! Not to mention you could really taste the mango, it was really refreshing. Definitely could tell it was house made. Overall, in my opinion Ricobenes holds the title for Chicago's best breaded steak sandwich, hands down. Sad I missed out on it by giving Freddie's a try.

18.description: I bookmarked this place because I heard they had a great Italian Beef sandwich.   I'm not a big Italian beef fan, but my parents are, so we went to check them out one night.  You order and pick up your food from the counter, but it's very clean and well kept.  We got the Italian Beef, Buffalo chicken wrap and sausage pizza.  The pizza was by far the best of the 3.  The italian beef was dry, even with the jus.  The buffalo chicken wrap was good, but nothing special.  The pizza, however was 14" and it was $10 for any 1-topping.  There were a lot of sausages on the pizza and it was delicious.  Overall, a nice, family owned establishment with a great pizza deal.  I'll be back.

41.description: The pizza was ok, I've had better, they wait is long, the people don't pay attention when orders are up, I had my food in the warmer for 15 minutes before she decided to look in it. So unprofessional so no I won't be returning.

52.description: Stopped off and got an Italian Beef dipped.  Not as good as Al's but still pretty decent.  Wife got the chicago dog.  Nice neighbor and family restaurant.

50.description: I love Freddies!  It's my favorite pizza place to order from in the Bridgeport area.I like their $10 pizza deals, their deep dish, basically all their appetizers are delicious fried food and never over or under cooked, so you can't go wrong with fried mushrooms or mac and cheese bites.  They have good soups, wingies, Italian beefs, fries, etc.  Their meatball sub is amazing, as well as on their pasta sides.  I'm not saying its like straight from Italy, but it hits the spot on a Friday night when you don't want to leave your house.  Delivery always seems to be "within the hour"  so just call before you hit hangry.  I see most people go for the Italian Ice, but that's still on the list of things to try.

4.description: Their $10 pizza is delicious. They also have a great chopped salad. We recently tried their stuffed pizza, they made a mistake and had to redo our pizza. It's a reasonable price though, I believe we paid $14. I suggest calling in your order because the wait time can be long.

6.description: I've ordered from Freddies several times over the years.  The food used to be run of the mill, but recently it has taken a turn for the worse.The meat on the Italian beef was tough and the juice had no flavor.  Wings (which used to be quite good) were overly salted.  French fries were undercooked.  In my last 3 orders, I literally have not had one item there that came out as expected.  Sorry Freddies, you've lost me forever.

22.description: This place is named Freddie's pizza so you have to get the pizza. Another favorite is the wing ding. Don't forget to ask for ranch or you'll regret it.

15.description: Italian ice is to die for. Breaded steak sandwiches are to die for. And their pizza of the week was delicious. My husband grew up eating this pizza and finally brought me here. Couldn't have been happier with service and prices.

57.description: Used to go to Freddies years ago when the food was actually good.   Now, I refuse to eat there.   I had ordered an eggplant parmesan sandwich and it tasted like someone dropped toothache medicine on the sandwich.   It was horrible.   The pizza has definitely changed and looks horrible.   The menu has gotten bigger and the food has definitely gotten a lot worst.   Too bad.   I used to like this place.

20.description: I've ordered from Freddies several times over the years.  The food used to be run of the mill, but recently it has taken a turn for the worse.The meat on the Italian beef was tough and the juice had no flavor.  Wings (which used to be quite good) were overly salted.  French fries were undercooked.  In my last 3 orders, I literally have not had one item there that came out as expected.  Sorry Freddies, you've lost me forever.

36.description: This review is strictly for delivered calzones.  A large amount were catered for an event, and they were tasty.  Having tasted the whole gamut (baked, fried, cheese, pepperoni, sausage in all possible combinations), the best (by a good margin) was the baked pepperoni calzones.  The fried calzones had a different bread-feel, and the baked were just nicer to hold and eat.  Cheese on its own is boring, and the sausage was piled on but had a lot of seasoning in it.  Thus pepperoni shown out above the rest and I would get it again in a heartbeat.

14.description: This place has changed I was unhappy with the service. My food was not good like a rush job. None of us really  enjoyed our food. But I can't get over the face that this was a game night and the place was just nasty. The floors look like a broom and mop had not been used all day. How could you be told about the trash and don't send anyone to get it Asap. Its little bugs flying around and you have people seating trying to eat. Really sad.Other will see it. So if the lobby is looking like this then what is the kitchen looking like???How about the health inspector come give y'all a pop up on a game night. We saw a couple that had spent plenty of money and had to move to another table bye to the bugs by the trash and the food trays stacked up high. When all you thinking about is money, money and more money.I have be really enjoying this place but after seeing how y'all really get down..Good night and Good Bye.

29.description: Super friendly, helpful and knowledgeable-no bike snobbery. Great range of products with good prices too! P.s. They may be interested in your old internal gear system..

42.description: I was so excited to hear that a bike shop had moved in to Bridgeport. After visiting the shop a couple times I have not been disappointed. The first thing I noticed when walking in was the openness of the shop. You walk in the door and there is a group of new bikes available for sale and on the other wall is various bike parts and accessories. With an open mechanic area behind the counter. There are no walls between the sales floor and shop which allows for you to catch a glimpse at how the 'pros' do bike repair. The in store selection might not be as extensive as some of the larger north side stores but they have a great mix of common parts and accessories. If by chance you need a part that they don't have in store they will be happy to order it for you.Another factor of a good bike shop is quality mechanic work and the Blue City crew has this locked down. I went in there to get a new set of brake levers installed on my trusty steed. Not only did they do a great job but they also were quick to install them. What really helps set this bike shop above the others in my mind is its great charm. When you walk up to the counter you notice a chalk board listing the flat rates for most mechanic work and part installs. This helps make sure you don't get any surprises when the service bill comes. The whole crew at Blue City is extremely helpful with any questions. Also keep an eye out and try to catch a glimpse of their shop cat protecting the store.

23.description: I've been back a few times now and everything has been stellar. Five stars all around!

47.description: Not quite in my neighborhood, but a very welcome addition indeed!  Claire (sp?) was super friendly, knowledgeable and skilled.  We stopped by a little more than 1/2 an hour before closing, and she was so great about getting us back on the road quickly.  I'm sure someone (that is, a more experienced cyclist) will post a more informed review than myself, but I am a big fan, and plan to stop by for all my repair needs.

8.description: Blue City has been my go-to bike shop since it opened some years ago. Owen is a bike god, and the rest of the people there are super friendly, knowledgeable, and downright cool. I just got got a custom build from the shop a few weeks ago, and it's completely flawless. Some years ago, I bought a bike form Cozy's, and most components ended up coming loose after a few dozen miles. I've yet to have any issues after any repairs or builds bluecity has done for me. My hope is that blue city remains a neighborhood fixture, and that their business continues to be successful. Also, they have cats if that is something that you're into.

31.description: I haven't had a lot of experience in bike shops.  I did try to buy a bike in the middle of the summer and encountered some bad customer service at other shops.  Didn't feel that way about BCC and I've been in a few times.  Pros: -Both owners were patient in showing me bikes on 2 separate occasions.  They even were honest enough to say that Working Bikes might suit my needs better (I didn't want to spend a lot).  -Had a flat repaired and my wheel trued for a decent price (about on par with Rapid Transit which is also close by, I think wheel truing was $5 cheaper at BCC, but like an auto mechanics, you're really at their mercy).  -Bought fenders here and had it installed pretty quickly.Cons:I did buy a used bike that I loved there.  I also gave them a used bike I came in with, but didn't get a discount on the bike I purchased.  Later, I found out this is common practice.  The second time I went in to shop, the owner even mentioned not having a lot of used bikes at the time because people usually turn them in for a discount on a new bike.  Although if it was my shop and a customer didn't ask for a discount, I wouldn't have just freely offered up that information either.   Bottom line: Definitely come in for repairs, they're at a fair price and get quickly done.  For bike shopping, do your homework so you make an informed purchase!

34.description: Owen and Clare are some great dudes.  I have no idea how you knew I needed an extra-long 13/16" diameter Schwinn-style seat post, but you did, 'cause you had it in stock.I wouldn't think twice about sending any crazy hard bike emergency your way.  Thanks, guys.

16.description: If you're gunna buy a bike/gear, want fantastic customer service, but don't wanna deal with the standard bullshit salesman speak (OR the elitist atmosphere of some recent pop-up cycle boutique)--Blue City Cycles is your one stop shop. Atmosphere is laid back, honest, and approachable and by the time you've made your purchase you'll wanna take at least one owner out for a beer. Why? Everyone behind the counter is patient and straightforward. The prices are fair and there's not a question Clare, Charlie or Owen can't answer.  I respect that there's nothing pretentious about the place and that they'll get you exactly what you need after you put them through some hellaciously long description of what you think you want. I've purchased one bike from the place and multiple accessories to date. Though it's nowhere near my apartment, I look forward to the long seasonal tune up ride south because it brings me back to the type of business I respect and allows me to check out the ever-changing wide range of cycles they keep in that crowded (yet, comfy) corner shop

13.description: I read a lot of the reviews before I came here and decided to give Blue City Cycles a try as I was in the market for a bike. This was going to be my first bike since I was about 10 years old, so I had a lot of questions.Molly, one of the bike experts there, was EXTREMELY patient with me. She answered all my questions, even the really dumb ones. She made sure I had everything I wanted for the bike, without being "sales-y." She suggested that I test try a few bikes in order to decide what I wanted. VERY HELPFUL.I was also helped by someone else (didn't get her name) the next day when I came back to actually buy the bike, and she was also very helpful.I left feeling very happy with my purchase. I will have a year of free labor, and that, for someone who doesn't know that much about bikes yet, is a BIG deal!

11.description: Very nice shop on the south side. Nice collection of velo orange, axiom, and other "better than entry level components" for the utility/commuter crowd.Owen, owner, performed a nice weld/repair job on my Nitto M-12 front rack. Also very helpful and responsive via email while I was on a "new bike" search.Would be my LBS if I lived closer.  No question.

39.description: Super great Bike shop, great staff, and reasonable prices. Super great addition to the neighborhood!

37.description: I went to Blue City Cycles to try out a new bike shop near enough to where I live. Owen, one of the owners, was very helpful in helping me pick out a rack to go over my back wheel. After that, I asked if I could put it on in the shop, and not only did he say yes, but he quickly provided me with the tools I needed to perform the operation.After about fifteen minutes of feeling slightly inept and painting my fingers black, he came over to check on me after the store cleared out of customers a bit. Apparently, I had done well, but the anatomy of my bike wasn't working with the screw the manufacturer of the rack provided. Owen promptly found a screw that was more compatible and gave it to me with advice on how to put it on. Yeah, these guys are great.

0.description: These guys are great! I took my bike in with brakes that were completely shot and some serious alignment issues. They had the bike ready within 24 hours for a very reasonable cost

38.description: I have had two very positive experiences with Owen, the bike mechanic at Blue City Cycles. On both occasions, I had gone to other bike shops and they turned me away! I needed a specific part for a tandem bike, and Owen ended up just  making it for me. Recently, I needed another difficult-to-find part and three bike shops in my neighborhood wouldn't even go out of their way to find it. I was told I should just go on ebay myself to find the part. After calling Owen on a Friday, he had found the part by Saturday and my bike was in the shop on Sunday. It was worth the long Halsted bus ride down to Blue City Bikes.. and this place is cheap!

27.description: I give this place 5 stars b/c unlike a lot of other bike shops in the city they are not pretentious. I got good service. They were fast. And their cat is very cuddly.

32.description: My husband and I have been to Blue City Cycles a few times, and each time has been a great experience.  We live close to the shop, and it is really nice to have a local bike shop nearby.  The employees are super helpful, knowledgeable, and efficient.

48.description: Friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and well-stocked. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.

44.description: If I'm not mistaken, Owen is the only (or at least one of few) certified frame builders in the city.  A beautiful neighborhood shop with a good selection of new bikes for sale in a solid range of prices.   Mechanic work is extremely reasonable and flawless.  Good luck guys and gals!

24.description: I'm happy with a service that I paid a fair price for. Edited selection of bikes and accessories, knowledgeable service, friendly people, and pet-able cats too!? Not next door (I'm in Kenwood) but not too far. I'll be back.

7.description: fire the asian dude who was working today, ive been to blue city numerous times and never have i dealt with someone so stupid. shit ass service, wasnt even worth the $5 of labor.

40.description: These people walk on water. I've visiting a few times for repairs or purchases and received friendly competent service and advice. They are experts and professionals.

30.description: If you're gunna buy a bike/gear, want fantastic customer service, but don't wanna deal with the standard bullshit salesman speak (OR the elitist atmosphere of some recent pop-up cycle boutique)--Blue City Cycles is your one stop shop. Atmosphere is laid back, honest, and approachable and by the time you've made your purchase you'll wanna take at least one owner out for a beer. Why? Everyone behind the counter is patient and straightforward. The prices are fair and there's not a question Clare, Charlie or Owen can't answer.  I respect that there's nothing pretentious about the place and that they'll get you exactly what you need after you put them through some hellaciously long description of what you think you want. I've purchased one bike from the place and multiple accessories to date. Though it's nowhere near my apartment, I look forward to the long seasonal tune up ride south because it brings me back to the type of business I respect and allows me to check out the ever-changing wide range of cycles they keep in that crowded (yet, comfy) corner shop

46.description: I've been a few times so far, for both repairs and purchases.  Good, friendly service (no bike shop attitude), and a good selection of products for the place's size.A very welcome addition to the neighborhood... previously, the closest bike shop was in Pilsen.

1.description: I had to replace a tube in my back tire and do a quick seat adjustment on my Giant bike, and these guys took care of me in less than 10 minutes.Everyone in the shop was super friendly, and they acknowledged me right away. A new tube and labor for my rear 25 was $16. Great service!

9.description: I like the shop over all but sometimes they gives me attitude for no reason. A friend of mine that I recommend that shop to had the same experience.

26.description: In a bout of drunken eBay bidding last year I bought myself a carbon fiber frame, after only occasionally riding a hybrid or a mountain bike (both steel and very heavy) for the past ten years.  When I finally got the money and the time to start building my bike, I took the frame and the few parts I'd already purchased to Claire and she immediately started helping me.  I know next to nothing about bikes and she took the time to really explain all the parts he was ordering, the different benefits and costs of different models, even talked to me about the wheels I was looking at online.  The work was done really quickly, the parts she ordered were within the budget that I shared with her, and both she and Owen immediately picked up that I was sticking with a color scheme and took the time to look for parts in gold and black (instead of silver or chrome) to fit with the bike.  Owen also showed me how what he'd done to redisc my back wheel, let me watch and help a little as he put my chain on, the whole bit.  I felt like they were just as happy to teach me as to build for me, and more importantly like I was really welcome there.  I'm moving away from the neighborhood soon, but I will be coming back to Blue City over and over again because they've been so awesome.

25.description: A single speed bike I purchased off of craigslist had an extremely creaky crank and a few other goofy things going on with it--probably as a result of some modding gone wrong.I took the bike in and after 5-10 minutes it was given a quick diagnosis (bottom bracket issues) along with an estimate. The estimate was spot-on and I picked the bike up after leaving work.  Everyone working there was friendly and patient--willing to explain and help answer my questions.Very convenient to have a place like this in Bridgeport ... I'll be back!

12.description: I've had good experiences with Blue City but a while back I asked my husband to drop my bike off to have a specific issue looked at. In addition to what I asked for the person who served him told him my bike needed a whole slew of expensive repairs, totaling more than the original cost I paid for the (used and in decent condition) bike.  When I went to pick it up I asked about this and was told they were suggestions. The person I spoke with was understanding when I explained my needs and budget but still seemed to be pushing hard for more on the bike. This encounter changed my thoughts on the shop and made me feel like they were trying to hard upsell my husband for additional business and like they are less sensitive to the needs of the regular bike owner.

21.description: These folks were the nicest! I went in needing a presta valve for my bike (I bought a pump at Home Depot that came with like 5 valves, presta NOT being one of them...) and also to see if they could diagnose why my brake alignment was off. The gentleman told me he could fix it in ten minutes, for ten bucks. Sold!  I rode off on a pumped-up, well-aligned bike ten minutes later. These guys made the task of fixing my bike (which I'd been delaying for a while) quick and easy. Totally unrelated reason they're cool: they fully supported my good friends at Forgotten Chicago when they led a Bridgeport-by-bike tour last summer. I should've gone in much, much sooner since that was a clear indication they were good people.

17.description: They are really expensive compared to Windy City Hardware down the street. They were nice and professional though.

10.description: For a new rider, I don't know how to change my flat... My BF searched this place up since it is also nearby. We had an inner tube replacement for two tires so the bill rounded to $30. It took about 10-15 minutes for both bikes to be fixed.I'm not sure if this place will be friendly to people with allergies. There are two store cats. They're free to lounge around and can be found at unpredictable places.

5.description: This shop is great! I am inexperienced when it comes to riding in Chicago and some bike shops can be a bit intimidating. Claire made me feel totally at ease when I came in to get a new tube and was super helpful.

3.description: I just love this cycle shop! Everyone there has always been super friendly and helpful. They are ever so slightly cheaper than another (good) cycle shop on Halsted. They explain what work is being done and why. Helped me get my bike back in my car. The shop cat is a the epitome of a "cool cat" - he (she?) just hangs there and chills. My son is allergic so I don't need a cat rubbing on him for attention. I've recommended them to other friends and they were happy as well.

35.description: I've visited Blue City Cycles a few times.  Initially I stopped in to check out some bike accessories and noticed that everything in this shop was reasonably priced.  Since then, I've been in this shop for two repairs (one on my bike and one on my friend's).  Not only did they fix my bike quickly and accurately (my bike hasn't ridden this well in months), when she finished, the girl fixing my bike taught me how to properly put my tire back on.  She oiled the chain for free too.  For an example of their great prices, got a flat?  They're repair it for $15, including the tube!I will definitely shop at Blue City Cycles for all my biking needs.

19.description: I haven't had a lot of experience in bike shops.  I did try to buy a bike in the middle of the summer and encountered some bad customer service at other shops.  Didn't feel that way about BCC and I've been in a few times.  Pros: -Both owners were patient in showing me bikes on 2 separate occasions.  They even were honest enough to say that Working Bikes might suit my needs better (I didn't want to spend a lot).  -Had a flat repaired and my wheel trued for a decent price (about on par with Rapid Transit which is also close by, I think wheel truing was $5 cheaper at BCC, but like an auto mechanics, you're really at their mercy).  -Bought fenders here and had it installed pretty quickly.Cons:I did buy a used bike that I loved there.  I also gave them a used bike I came in with, but didn't get a discount on the bike I purchased.  Later, I found out this is common practice.  The second time I went in to shop, the owner even mentioned not having a lot of used bikes at the time because people usually turn them in for a discount on a new bike.  Although if it was my shop and a customer didn't ask for a discount, I wouldn't have just freely offered up that information either.   Bottom line: Definitely come in for repairs, they're at a fair price and get quickly done.  For bike shopping, do your homework so you make an informed purchase!

28.description: I had a flat tire that every time I tried to fix it, it would do the same thing again. I took my bike to Irv's in Pilsen and the same thing happened after I paid them $40+ for a tune up and tire repair. I decided not to take it back to Irv's and try a new place--Blue City Cycles. The guy was super cool with me and fixed it in no time. It ended up being a rim issue, so he sanded it down and had it all ready for me within minutes. I can't remember how much I paid, but I know it was cheap. If I have any bicycle issues in the future I will definitely take it to Blue City Cycles!

45.description: I took my bicycle in for a spring tune up & it was a great experience. When I originally made my appointment for the following afternoon, I asked for some air before I left and was very appreciative that they were very accommodating and friendly. Not only was the staff helpful but they also made some great suggestions and offered great tips.  I'm also very excited about an additional purchase of a new double handled quick release basket for my bike. I was shopping around everywhere including amazon for a great basket and I found it there for a great bargain. It even feels more substantial than a grocery store basket. Wonderful selection of quality bike accessories.

33.description: Also, the shop cats are adorable and dignified.

43.description: When I first noticed that the art shop in this spot closed, I kept my fingers crossed that something useful would open up here, I was thrilled when I noticed it was a bike shop. My poor bike was out of order for dammed near a full season last year, and with no bike shop within a reasonable distance from house it was just left to sit in our pantry. I have heard way too many horror stores about the bike racks on buses to risk putting my baby on one. Now this little shop opens up about four blocks from where I live? Of course I'm going to check it out. First thing walking in I see that they have an awesome selection even though they are in a small space. Second thing, the lady that was there was super friendly and helpful. The first thing I said was "Do you fix broken bikes?" She said "We sure do, Is that bike broken?" She took a very quick, very through look at it,  Within view, which was awesome because I could see exactly what was happening to it. A lot places take it away and so stuff in the back and you don't even know if they are even looking at the problem! She told me exactly what was wrong with and my options to fix it, One of which was just to find another gear and see if that solves things. Which it did. I also was not charged for air and for a look-see. Which a lot shops do. I also saw the pricing list for repairs, very reasonable indeed! I am so glad they are here, Bridgeport needs this place! (I am going here for all my bike needs)

2.description: Sadly this shop did not fit me with the  Schwinn bike  I needed.  Although Mike O. was pleasant, he did not have the model he claimed I would like, nor did he or Claire  Knipper, co owner,  care to check out the height or the bike seat or handle bars to see if my short arms and legs would reach them safely.  The shop claims "full service", which should  include correctly fitting a customer to  a bike, which are not cheap these days.  The Schwinn step down bike had  an extra bar swinging toward the bottom of the bike,  unlike a ladies usual bike.Claire Knipper was  more interested in getting the order in,  regardless of the fact there was no Schwinn model to try out.   When the bike came in I went to the shop to try it out.  could not safely get on the high seat and fell backwards getting off the bike.  No one in the shop tried to help me up, nor did they suggest maybe this was not a safe fit for my short limbs.  No one was concerned at all,  sad for a neighborhood  shop.  Claire promptly lowered the seat as far as possible and we left the store.  I could not use the bike again for a couple of months, healing from the fall.  I once again tried to get on the bike safely,  with my husband assisting me.  The seat  and handlebars were still too high  and the bike's  frame too heavy to hold,  in addition to still not being able to reach the ground.  The bike was not a safe fit and I could not ride it.   I returned the bike for a full refund.  Clalire stated she  would charge me 10 percent as a restock fee.  I told her she needed  to keep the bike to show people who might be interested  in the future.  She agreed to waive the 10 percent so I would not write this review.   I brought the bike in the next day.   She only returned the 90 percent of  the bike's price,  which  means she went back on her word.  She  was very ill tempered and  left her seat at the register threatening to walk out, that she was  'done".Considering I was not  fitted for a bike and  I fell in her shop and was not  helped up by r staff ,  returning  the full amount should be the least  she could 've done for a  customer, especially from the shops neighborhood .  This is why this shop deserves  a one star review.

18.description: These folks were the nicest! I went in needing a presta valve for my bike (I bought a pump at Home Depot that came with like 5 valves, presta NOT being one of them...) and also to see if they could diagnose why my brake alignment was off. The gentleman told me he could fix it in ten minutes, for ten bucks. Sold!  I rode off on a pumped-up, well-aligned bike ten minutes later. These guys made the task of fixing my bike (which I'd been delaying for a while) quick and easy. Totally unrelated reason they're cool: they fully supported my good friends at Forgotten Chicago when they led a Bridgeport-by-bike tour last summer. I should've gone in much, much sooner since that was a clear indication they were good people.

41.description: Hooray for Blue City Cycles coming to our neighborhood!  I know this review is a little late in coming, since they've been here for a while, but somehow it slipped my mind.  This place has an amazing, friendly, extremely talented staff that is very efficient, and even nice enough show you how to better take care of your ride if you have the time to learn a few things.Also wonderful is the selection of bike accessories.  I am the proud owner of a really cute wicker basket for my old cruiser, and have my eyes on a sweet set of panniers.  Welcome to the neighborhood, BCC, and your lovely shop kitty!

4.description: Good Price. Cheaper than Online.

6.description: I just moved into Bridgeport and I am so glad that a bike shop like this is so close. I just started riding my bike again for work after a 3 year hiatus and I needed a tuneup badly. Took my bike in on a Friday evening and it was done Saturday afternoon. I just picked it up and I am ecstatic over the quality of work that was done. Not only that but their staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful when purchasing accessories and will work with your budget. Most importantly- for a novice like me - they keep it at a level where I know what they are talking about and don't try to talk over your head.

22.description: These people know there bikes and are fair. They are also great neighbors-helping educate cub scouts and even adults

15.description: A single speed bike I purchased off of craigslist had an extremely creaky crank and a few other goofy things going on with it--probably as a result of some modding gone wrong.I took the bike in and after 5-10 minutes it was given a quick diagnosis (bottom bracket issues) along with an estimate. The estimate was spot-on and I picked the bike up after leaving work.  Everyone working there was friendly and patient--willing to explain and help answer my questions.Very convenient to have a place like this in Bridgeport ... I'll be back!

20.description: I went in knowing NOTHING about bikes and they were awesome! Clair helped me and was very nice and knowlagable! Wonderful place and very cute too!

36.description: Owen and Claire (and Charlie) care about bicycles and people at a deep level, and will do everything in their power to give you what serves you best.  Their mechanical skills are top notch, their prices are great, and they have great shop cats.  Seriously, what's not to like?

14.description: There are shop cats. I trust a shop with shop cats.This is my local bike shop, even tho local for me is 20 miles away. It's everything a local bike shop should be: fast, often on the spot repair for those easy fixes, knowledgable (like, framebuilder knowledgable) mechanics for harder stuff, super fair prices... and honestly, they talk me out of buying crap I really don't need (and will gently, kindly, convince me of it - 5 stars for honesty). It's not a very big storefront, but they manage to carry a small line of new bikes, usually have some used bikes too. I've bought both here. They offer classes if you want to learn more about bike repair for yourself. They have a lot of hip stuff and a lot of practical stuff, from PDW racks to Seagull bags to VO vintage goodness to Brooks to lights to locks to grips to pedals to tires to tools to etc. I've gotten a little bit of everything here. My favorite ride is 100% Blue City.If you're browsing online and see something you like, drop Blue City a line and they'll order if for you. They're great with special orders.Stop in and hang out for a bit, it's a great place to soak up bike culture. All sorts of people walk through the doors, from messengers to neighborhood regulars. Everyone is treated fairly - something I appreciate, as I don't always know as much about bikes as I wish I did. They've never made me feel like an idiot... that's saying a lot for a bike shop these days. They offer Active Trans discount. They support the bike community and are super generous with their time. They've put up with me more than any bike shop should, and have made me a smarter, more passionate cyclist along the way. Visit the Bike Shop of the Future... today!

28.description: The fact that they have fresh cut fries should be enough reason to go!  Every time I go, I want to use the fry cutter.  They're hot dogs are delicious, although I wish they had tomatoes.  What I love/hate is that they wrap the hot dog with the fries in an easy to carry roll... except sometimes the mustard gets on the fries and it grosses me out, but I still eat them.  What I especially love about Red Hots is that they priced their items so everything comes to a nice even dollar or $0.50 after tax... seriously smart

1.description: Simple menu hot dog stand with counter seating.  The same worker prepares the food and works the cash register.  Today, a customer brought that to his attention.  The worker (according to the tip jar, his name is Teddy) replied that he first prepares the order, then he washes his hands after handling the money.  It's difficult to imagine he washes his hands after every purchase.  The other draw back is the manner in which the hot dog and fries are wrapped. The fries are placed inside the hot dog buns. It makes for a sloppy hot dog when removing the large amount of fries from in between the hot dog bun.

39.description: $2.15 cents (approximately) gets you a made in front of your eyes Vienna Beef dog and hand cut fries, rolled together in one waxed paper, artery clogging, bundle of love.  Coke - not  Pepsi - within 3 minutes of Comiskey, so you can get your non-icky soda fix in before or after the game without too much effort. Bonus - free entertainment.  Watch hapless out of town fans desperately try to score a cab after the game.  Highly entertaining.Good fried shrimp, too, if you have $13 to spare.  Sure, it's a shack, but patronize this place without fear. This is where Comiskey vendors and Chicago's Finest eat after the game. Good, honest, delicious, Chicago eats. It's a classic.

9.description: This is simply the best short style Chicago hot dog you can get. And it's paired with perfect fries. Our peoples proudest traditions of ketchup foofooery is strictly enforced. Bravo

29.description: The proximity of this hot dog stand to Comiskey is undeniably excellent.  I like stopping here for a dog and a drink on my way from Halsted to the stadium for a game.  There's also game day parking here for $2 cheaper than the Sox lots, so why not?  Warning: they double park cars, so sometimes you have to wait for someone to drive away so you can get your car.Anyway, back to the food.  It's good food and cheap, so you can't really go wrong.  The menu is really, really small.  They pretty much sell hot dogs, fries and Italian ice.  If you're looking for beef or anything else complicated, go down the street to O'Malley's.  The fries are hand cut right in the shop (you can watch) and they're always served piping hot.  There's a few seats available, but it's mostly take and go on game days.  If you work across the street at TAMS (which I did for about five months), you'll be here everyday because the pop is cheap and the food is tasty.

42.description: Ok, hot dog and polish sausage lovers, you're walking east on 35th Street toward Comiskular Park after drinking a bunch of Delirium at Puffer's and you're starving.   And you realize that if you want any food and drink at the park that you're going to pay dearly for it.  You want a dog or a Polish Sausage before the game?  Stop at 35th Street Red Hots hot dog shack.  I believe all they have on the menu are hot dogs and polishes, and maybe an iced cream sannich.  Hard to tell after a few Deliriums.  I took a picture and will post it later.No, it isn't Maxwell Street nor is it Henry's, but it is damn satisfying before watching the game.  And yes, they serve their dogs Chicago style, and yes, the fries are served on top of the Polishes....only way to eat a Polish!

23.description: This place is a more convenient Gene & Judes near Sox Park very very good hotdogs.

5.description: This place is fantastic in that they're exactly what they bill themselves as - a tiny little hot dog stand that does one thing exceptionally well.  Chicago dog and mound of fries for about $3.50?  Sold!  The locals know to walk down here before Sox games to avoid the bloated ballpark prices.  We came here about four or five times during our last Chicago trip and were never disappointed.  The fries they serve are honestly some of the best I've ever had.  Crispy, creamy potato goodness.And yes, if you order ketchup on your dog you have to ring the bell and yell "Go Sox!".  If you are an absolutely pathetic human being with no self-confidence whatsoever, you can ask for ketchup for your fries - they'll hand you a squirt bottle and you can use that on your dog as you wallow in your self-pity.  Sorry that they're trying to have a little lighthearted fun.

31.description: small menu and limited seating.  only have a few menu items, but don't overlook the 1/2 lb of fried shrimp.  A double dog means 2 hot dogs in one bun and everything comes with fries stuffed in the bun.  Good option for food to take into the cell because of the proximity.  right across the street from lot G.

25.description: 3.5* Depression Dog (mustard, onion, relish, hot peppers)4* fries

12.description: Imagine a place that offers a hot dog and fries like Jean & Jude's without the lines or overblown hype. That's what you get here. The people are cool and the location is ideal to stop in there before and after the White Sox game! (hot dogs in the cell are overpriced and not very good - stop here instead). Highly recommend you eat the dog and fries right there on the spot. Don't even try to order ketchup on your dog or they will ring the bell of shame (yes, it's an actual bell). Awesome!!!

37.description: One of the few times I've randomly stopped into a location without researching beforehand, but I was feeling adventurous and decided to try a double dog with fries (ordered them well-done, like most good fries should be cooked), since the price seemed alright.What I got was kind of a shocker to me.  I can understand that grease + grease = more tastiness, but throwing the dog and fries in the same paper wrap just puzzles me.  I'm not a neurotic or obsessive-compulsive who can't have food items touching, but when bagging food for take-out, one should really consider the logistics of the equation.When I arrived home, I discovered one paper wrap.  I worried that they had simply forgotten my fries, but opened the wrapper to discover that they were in there - mangled with the double dog.  There were hot dog condiments in my fries and french fry salt all over my hot dog bun.  It was disappointing.The double dog itself was average.  Nothing spectacular, and it tasted like something I could make at home with a discount package of hot dog buns and dumping a package of dogs in some boiling water.  The fries were pretty good, other than being slathered in the mustard, onion and relish from my hot dog.If I ever wind up there again on a long walk and decide another attempt, I'll ask them to wrap them separately.  And if they raise an eyebrow or make a stink about it - it'll be the last time I journey inside, wriggling past the guy hocking Sox merchandise practically blocking the entrance.(Oh, and I'm completely aware that it's a hot dog joint, but most hot dog joints have the decency to also make burgers - though I'm not penalizing them for their decision.)

21.description: I could really care less about the hot dogs and french fries here.  It's not that they're not good it's just there's really no reason I would ever get them since I've had the fried shrimp! The fried shrimp are gorgeous! I will get a half a pound if it's just me and a pound if I'm sharing.  The shrimp are large, lightly breaded and cooked to perfection. They are peeled, deveined AND detailed!  You couldn't possibly ask for more.  Although ... I could ask for a little better cocktail/dipping sauce.  The sauce they give is just okay (I get the spicy) but I could imagine a lot of better things to go with them.Hot Dogs and fries are decent but I I prefer other places in the neighborhood.

16.description: I could really care less about the hot dogs and french fries here.  It's not that they're not good it's just there's really no reason I would ever get them since I've had the fried shrimp! The fried shrimp are gorgeous! I will get a half a pound if it's just me and a pound if I'm sharing.  The shrimp are large, lightly breaded and cooked to perfection. They are peeled, deveined AND detailed!  You couldn't possibly ask for more.  Although ... I could ask for a little better cocktail/dipping sauce.  The sauce they give is just okay (I get the spicy) but I could imagine a lot of better things to go with them.Hot Dogs and fries are decent but I I prefer other places in the neighborhood.

17.description: The proximity of this hot dog stand to Comiskey is undeniably excellent.  I like stopping here for a dog and a drink on my way from Halsted to the stadium for a game.  There's also game day parking here for $2 cheaper than the Sox lots, so why not?  Warning: they double park cars, so sometimes you have to wait for someone to drive away so you can get your car.Anyway, back to the food.  It's good food and cheap, so you can't really go wrong.  The menu is really, really small.  They pretty much sell hot dogs, fries and Italian ice.  If you're looking for beef or anything else complicated, go down the street to O'Malley's.  The fries are hand cut right in the shop (you can watch) and they're always served piping hot.  There's a few seats available, but it's mostly take and go on game days.  If you work across the street at TAMS (which I did for about five months), you'll be here everyday because the pop is cheap and the food is tasty.

10.description: I've been in Bridgeport my entire life and these are easily the best fries in the whole neighborhood and the best ones I've ever had. I walked in and a guy named Orlando who's been there for a decade told me you've got to "really know how to blanch them". That's when I knew this place was legit. 5/5, 100% now you know they take their food seriously

11.description: Wonderful. No-ketchup-on-hotdog militants that put you on blast for ordering a hot dog with ketchup. They have people do the walk of shame by ringing a loud bell on the wall near the register when anybody asks for ketchup on their hog dog. So that's what I had to deal with because my nieces are 10 and under and enjoy ketchup. The whole thing is just silly and tired. Perhaps if the hot dogs were better, I wouldn't find this annoying. But they were lacking. I ordered onions on my dog, yet I didn't taste any. Apparently you have to tell them to go hard on ingredients if you want flavor to accompany these puny dogs. The fries were actually good though. One for the "plus" column. Average and annoying. Two adjectives which result in me thinking you kind of suck. Work on your food and stop relying on played out gimmicks, you dopes. I paid these fools with a reality check.

26.description: I stopped in here on a whim and I have to say I was disappointed.  Normally I love places that have streamlined the menu into just three or four items.  I certainly don't need fancy to help me enjoy my meal either.  What I do need is a hot dog or polish that is actually warm and not soggy to the point where the meat has become almost gooey in texture.  Unfortunately that is what I got at 35th street red hots.  Before today I can't recall the last time I ordered a hot dog someplace that I couldn't finish because it was so unappealing in texture, flavor, and temperature.  Frankly it was disgusting.

27.description: This place is only in business because it is so close to Sox Park. My dog had mustard, relish, and onion. That's it. Sure I got fries with it, but because I went before a game and therefore was packed, I couldn't get any ketchup for them. And don't just order a side of fries with no hot dog. My wife is a veg head and just wanted some fried potatoes but I guess that mucked up their whole assembly line production, added confusion, and caused the cashier to get annoyed and visibly upset with us. If you want a Chicago hot dog walk a few blocks west to O'Malley's. If you want something less then join the many others who have chosen convenience over quality.

35.description: Closest Hot Dog stand to the Home of the 2008 American League Central Champion White Sox. Also home of  the closest non-sox parking lot as well. Used to be open only during the season, but is now open year roud(YAY!)Dogs are of the Vienna persuasion, and the fries are fresh cut potatoes that are oh so yummy.Very moderately priced, especially considering that they are a mere 2 blocks from a stadium that charges $3.25 for a substandard ball park frank.Food's great to bring into games(yes, you CAN bring in food and bottled water into Comiskey Park), but good enough for that off day when you're in the neighborhood.BTW, no credit cards, but there is an ATM on site.

8.description: cheap (price) alternative to food at the cell.  we usually buy a few dogs, bring them into the park and snicker at the people around us spending major $$ on ballpark hot dogs - with no fries - inevitably, someone will ask us if we got them at the park - NOPE, sorry dude, next time bring your own food.  the hotdogs taste fine to me, the fries are good, but only when they are hot - cold fries are definitely not my cup of tea.

0.description: Its really hard to take these Yelp reviews seriously. Like come on...people giving bad reviews because they say Vienna Beef makes a bad hot dog? Or because they like ketchup on their hot dogs?? Or complaining that they don't have a big enough menu?....This is a hot dog stand. A Chicago style hot dog stand that serves depression style Vienna Beef hot dogs. You CAN NOT get any better!! This place has a small menu because they execute everything 100%. They even broke off and have other locations up north( Redhot Ranch). The burgers, the fries, the polishes, and even the shrimp...all excellent.Go hit an ATM, grab a $20 and head down there ASAP to get yourself a true taste of Chicago fast food.

38.description: If you're lookin' for a great dog ... and you're a fan of Gene & Jude's ...  and you're in the Bridgeport area ... get right over to 35th St. Red Hots!Fresh cut fries!  Vienna beef dogs!  Everything = Mustard, Onion, Relish & Sport Peppers (notice the lack of ketchup in that list ... the way it should be, well unless you're 5) ... what more do ya need?

20.description: I've never eaten at Red Hots, but parking here for White Sox games in their lot is is only (yea, only!) $20 versus the stadium lot at $25. It is a short walk to the ticket gates, just point your nose under the underpass.

19.description: This was my first time eating @ 35th St. Red Hots and I cant say I was blown away. I had the hot dog and fries which was okay but definitely nothing to write home about. At first glance the portion size seemed really small but it was filling and for $3.50 I guess it was an ok size. The hot dog wasn't that tasty and the fries seemed to be slightly under cooked. Plus the fries were stuck together and to the hot dog.Wasn't a horrible experience but I probably will never eat there again.

33.description: I liked this place.  The sausage was good and the fries were great.  The couple running this place work hard, keep the place kinda clean and are nice enough people.If you want char, get a sausage.

2.description: July 28th 2015Me and my gf decided to do a hotdog hooping and we start at south side. 1st stop is reds. Vienna dogs has a bland taste on it. I give it a 3 for nice presentation and fries taste

34.description: Sad little grayish pink, limp little wee wee wiener, sparsely dressed in like four chopped onion cubes and a weak smear of mustard on a crumbling bun. No charring dogs? Boo - that's the only thing that whoulda saved it, too.If you are at all lucky, your gag reflex will kick in and save you from finishing it - worked for me! I gave the rest of mine to the nearest handy White Sox fan, who probably thought it tasted like a fancy unicorn snout dog from Hot Doug's or something, since this place is directly in the shadow of - U.S. Cellul- ummm...Comis--uuhh...where the Sox play their baseball, so he was happy with it. Which brought me some momentary joy - Live it up, baby! But the fries are fresh cut, skin-on, cheap fun perfection. This junk is all cheap and cash only. Tastes like it, too.

32.description: This place has great fries.  They cut the potatoes on site and immediately cook them, etc.  Then they stuff them in with the hotdog which rocks.  I also love the fact that the hot dogs have that all important "snap" when you bite into them.  This is a must for a hot dog fan.  (Also, they do a great fried shrimp basket)Anyway, great place with good cheap road dogs.  no complaints.

18.description: Dumb ring the bell routine when you want ketchup.Cash only restaurant (who carries cash anymore?)Worst of all?  Handling food without using gloves.  I remarked to the guy "Oh you don't wear gloves?"  he replied "I wash my hands."  Is that even allowed according to food inspections in Chicago?  Needless to say, that was my last time eating there.

41.description: I love me some soggy fries....and oh yes this place shows me greasey love.The menu is short and sweet, a hot dog/double dog and fries.  I don't remember there being a polish option, but I'll check on that. They wrap your hot dog and fires togther so that they can now bring you a delightful experience in eating in unity.  Sitting nicely atop the dog just increases the sog factor in which I dig so much.Good stuff, just make sure you have cash...I don't think they take credit.

13.description: The hot dog was ok. The fries were great. I would go there again if I was in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to get there.

4.description: Great location right next to the sox stadium, the fries are good and hand cut. The only issue is the dogs are okay. They're good, don't get me wrong, but they lack a certain taste to them. I would totally come back though.

24.description: Only a Cub Fan would say anything bad about this place. LOL Just kidding, had to throw my 1 dig into you guys/Gals. Seriously though, Fresh Cut Fries (Great Flavor), Hot dogs and fries all wrapped together to get all the flavor in there MMMMMMMM!  You probably wont want to come here if you want a Fancier place with nice sit down area and beer etc though. They are about Hot dogs and Fries and they are cheaply priced and Very good at what they do! Just a very short walk from the ballpark, you wont regret it!Man..... I have to get there NOW! Good thing Spring Training is starting and soon, i will be there almost 80 times just on game days alone! Ahhhhh.

6.description: Being right down the street from Cellular Field (and on a game day) this place was pretty full. Still, they were really fast to get our order and get us our food and out the door. The fresh cut fries were tasty and the hotdogs were good too. Prices were reasonable - 2 Double Dogs (including fries) and a coke for $10.75. FYI - if you order a hotdog with just ketchup (Cubby Special) there's a lovely set of bells you've got to ring and then yell 'Go Sox!' All in all though, it's a decent little stand with good dogs and friendly fun staff. Service is good, prices are decent. I'd hit 'em up again.

22.description: This place might look small and yes they only serve Hot Dogs and Fried Shrimp and amazingly french fries hot out of the fryer, but it is very good food! They somehow make great hot dogs, fries and amazing Fried Shrimp. I like the mild sauce that comes with the fried shrimp, it's breaded lightly and you can taste the nice size shrimp!

15.description: Hotdogs are good just don't understand why they don't sell anything else besides hotdogs.

40.description: Since Jimbo's doesn't serve food (well, unless if Joycey's up to cooking), I stop by here before heading over there after I get off work.  It's a pretty solid place for all the Chicago staples, and the prices are pretty decent too!

7.description: Good, quick service and food! Simple menu...Dog, Polish, Fries. LOVE the Fresh-Cut Fries...way better than In And Out Burger's! Gotta also try their Italian Lemon Ice...during the spring and summer of course! Use to have good parking but not any longer.

36.description: I work across the street from a heart attack. A cheap one at that. Though I know it is sacrilege to write a review for a hot dog stand without tasting their dogs - I have had their fries and been in the presence of wiener consumers too many times to doubt my assessment. I don't eat fast food much - but this is my exception. They cut their potatoes in front of your eyes in the most intriguing of contraptions. The workers are super friendly and delightful locals. And the fries are $1.75. Perfect. Five star status? Only, if they let me bring in sweet potatoes.

30.description: As a veggie loving person, Red Hots makes it very hard for me to say no to a hot dog.   A must stop before A Sox game.  Small, no fuss, outdoor seating to watch the crowds coming in.  People complain about a limited menu but I would rather they have a few items and do them all very well than have a 100 and do them poorly.  Staff is always friendly and ready to serve.  Love the snap of the casing on this dog!  Love that other people mention it too!  A little onions, a little mustard and a few fries stuck on make this the perfect breakfast pre-ballgame.  Cold drink and a dog with fries will run you less than $5.  Bargain buys.  Can't beat it.  Make sure  you hit the ATM before coming here too.  Cash only.

3.description: I have to say I never knew this place was here, the many times I have been to U.S. Cellular Field. And only discovered this place by chance, because of approaching the ballpark from a different angle. To be honest it was thirst that initially made walk in here. Once inside the smell of the hot dogs made me realize I was hungry, lol. They have a very simple menu, only serving hot dogs, polishes, fries and fried shrimp. After seeing this, I figured why not give them a try. I got the double dog and it was delicious, tasted much better than the dogs they sell inside the ballpark. And here they were much cheaper too, I could've gotten two of them and for less than it would've cost me at the ballpark. I'm actually looking forward to going to another game because I will definitely be stopping by here. And after finding out I can take them into the park with me, that is exactly what I'll do.

14.description: Great place to grab a dog if you want to save a few bucks on ballpark concessions by filling up here first. Dogs are decent, but the fresh-cut fries are amazing. Funny how all the negative reviews here are whining about the ketchup policy. Sorry, I don't feel sorry for you. Ketchup on a hotdog (especially a Vienna beef dog) should be publicly shunned for the abomination it truly is!

28.description: I'm a Cubs fan, but the food here is awesome.  They feature a wide spectrum of high quality food, for a decent price.  Beware that they will charge you for each beverage, meaning there are no free refills on any soda.  Be sure to come hungry!!!

1.description: This place is hilarious! Like a white trash country club. It's weird that this place is a "VIP" thing 'cos to me it looked like an aging suburban banquet hall.The decor is horrible, but the staff is great. The beer selection is predictable, but no matter, the drinks are chilly and the view is fantastic! GO SOX!

9.description: Good food for a ball park stadium club buffet. I've been to several over the years, and I would rate it highest. I'm not sure about the costs, as I went as a group and did not see the bill.

29.description: *Read my review of US Cellular*  One Question:  If it rains at Wrigley, what do you do?  No need for garbage bag rain coats at The Cell.  Step into Stadium Club, enjoy some good eats, have a beer, and wait for the game to restart.  There's plenty of room for everyone....except kids.  I love my White Sox and US Cellular.

23.description: Spent a few minutes here before the game. A little pricey, but really a nice vibe. Lots of food laid out, including a carvery and salad bar. Nice to be able to get a Guinness before the game -- too bad it was in a bottle...

5.description: The Stadium club at US Cellular is an exclusive restaurant in the park and I had a guest pass to get in. We sat at the lower level so there was a very good view of the park and they have a great selection of beer and wine to choose from as well as a full bar for mixed drinks. Their menu choices are fair...the burgers with fries looked okay. I ordered the Italian Beef which was dry and tasteless, but the Garlic potato chips were good. The pulled pork sandwich looked better. Their french fries are fresh cut so I liked them but I prefer to eat in the park...a good grilled hot dog with mustard and grilled onions and nachos with cheese. The park also served great elotes (corn) and churros and just great junk food and that's what going to a ballpark is for! Next time I come to the park, I will skip the Stadium Club and stick with some good old fashioned hot dogs done just right and nachos!

31.description: GREAT BUFFET!!!  the buffet at the stadium club has about 6 different stations, all different kinds of cuisine.  There was an asian table, a meat carving station, and I can't remember what else.  There was just a great selection, w/ all the foods being high-quality and delicious.  This is a perfect place to start at, before heading to your seats.  The staff in the Stadium Club are also very nice and accomodating.  I hope to be back!

25.description: I don't get how everyone is saying the food is "good" or "excellent." The food is terrible. I couldn't finish my burger and my friend couldn't finish his nachos because they were both awful. The service is okay. There are very good views of the stadium, but there are good views of the stadium from your normal seats and the concession stands serve better food.

12.description: Great place for "protection" when you're wearing a visiting team's jersey.  Go Tigers!Seriously, all around good experience.  I would totally try for these seats again.  Great service, had the wings then it was time to go to our seats.  Nice bathrooms, hardly a line, nice cozy area and plenty of TV's all around to watch the game if you don't want to be on the outside.  Everyone was very nice, made you feel exclusive.  Hey, even got to ride in the elevator with Jim Rose, bonus!

21.description: Service - TerribleTable - wiped if off with a dirty ragFood - TerribleBurger was like a burnt hockey puck.  Asked for a new burger, and it took an additional 20 minutes?  Why, they just gave me another burger that was cooked hours earlier and sat under a heat lamp.  The tiny pretzel bun.....you've got to be kidding me.You'd think that the fans that can afford to be in the Stadium Club would at least have some class.....nope.  Listening to grown men talk like high school kids, what a joke.The server brought the wrong beers both times.  The second time she didn't even want to go back to the bar to replace a Bud with a Bud Light.  What a bad attitude.  2 crappy burgers, 1 crappy turkey burger and 1 beef sandwich with chips, 8 beers......our bill was over $90.  Unless we get 'free' passes again, I can't see any reason to return here.....I guess when you don't have any restaurants within walking distance, this is what people have to settle for if they want to eat before the game.

16.description: The food is relatively cheap and accordingly bland and disappointing.The server was nice at least, and probably earned her automatically applied "service charge".I wouldn't eat here again.

17.description: The added micro brews was a good call.

10.description: We had lunch here today before the White Sox game.  Fabulous food!!  Highly recommend.

11.description: This was the perfect spot to get a bird's eye view of the game and keep track of the hawks playoff game at the same time. Fabulous beer selection and great dessert choices on the menu. We'll be back!
