26.description: Classy, good food, mixed review on service, expensive!I got stadium club passes with some tickets I purchased off ebay.   The club is an exclusive area in the ballpark and looks like a nice private club.   I wouldn't want to have to extra to get in though or pay a yearly fee.  If someone else were taking me or the passes were free/cheap, it is worth checking out.Dining Room:Call to make reservations before the game to guarantee your table is  available and waiting for you.Food - $29 "buffet" where you only get to fill your plate once.   The food is high quality for food at the ballpark.   It is mediocre food when comparing to a nice restaurant or a place that can charge $30 for a plate.   Contrary to what another reviewer says, I don't think food here is as good as a high cost / high quality hotel buffet.  If you don't care about dollars or have someone else treating, this is worth checking out.   If you like regular ballpark food and want to save a few dollars, don't eat here!The landslide ice cream pie I had for dessert fed four of us and we still had some left over.   It is huge and looks intimidating.   It was good though.Service- They tack on a 18% service charge automatically so beware you are not tipping extra by accident.   The server I had on my one visit here was a bit pushy and rubbed me the wrong way with multiple comments.   One of my dining companions felt the same way and neither of us is easily offended.Bar:The bar is an extra level up from the restaurant.   It has lots of tables and sandwiches for ~10.   I didn't get to try the sandwiches because I was stuffed from the restaurant buffet downstairs, but next time I come, I will try one of the juicy looking sandwiches.I did have a drink at the bar and took advantage of their free bar snack mix.   The bartender was also very friendly and attentive.

27.description: Excellent food.Solid service.Oh, and a World Champion Class Facilty.Downside: NO free refills on soda. YOU MUST pay 18% tip.Pluses: Kick ass food. Excellent sightlines. You can stay in the "bar" portion of the club the entire game. When I go to a game up here, I get cheap upper deck tickets and stay up here the whole time.The Bar buffet is great, but only one and a 1/2  plates(you get a large oval plate as well as a small bread plate, but I always fill it up to the top on both)The sandwich station serves killer yet pricey hand carved meats with a plate full of chips and as many pickles as you want!If you can go up here for a game, do it. I recommend it.BTW, no cash. Only CC.

0.description: The Stadium Club is a class act.  Great staff,  good food, cold beer with growing craft beer selection and oh yes. .. air conditioning!

20.description: The cold food items were luke warm and the hot food items were cool. Not a good combination! Although the taste of some items was decent (white fish with garlic spinach, smoked turkey, smoked brisket) it just didn't quite match up to the hype.  The view is ok-not as great as some people think. You do not get the ambiance of the stadium at all when you are in there.  The price is ok for kids aged around 11-14 if you take into consideration the cost of 2 hotdogs etc.  Standard 18% gratuity is fine too. But something they neglect to tell you is that you are charged $5 per person per inning after the game starts. All you can eat dinner for four with gratuity, 4 pepsi's and 2 Grey Goose with 7 up was $248!!!! Are you freaking kidding me?? Absolutely not worth it due to the $60 seat charge. Another reason for me to hate this stupid stadium.

19.description: Service - TerribleTable - wiped if off with a dirty ragFood - TerribleBurger was like a burnt hockey puck.  Asked for a new burger, and it took an additional 20 minutes?  Why, they just gave me another burger that was cooked hours earlier and sat under a heat lamp.  The tiny pretzel bun.....you've got to be kidding me.You'd think that the fans that can afford to be in the Stadium Club would at least have some class.....nope.  Listening to grown men talk like high school kids, what a joke.The server brought the wrong beers both times.  The second time she didn't even want to go back to the bar to replace a Bud with a Bud Light.  What a bad attitude.  2 crappy burgers, 1 crappy turkey burger and 1 beef sandwich with chips, 8 beers......our bill was over $90.  Unless we get 'free' passes again, I can't see any reason to return here.....I guess when you don't have any restaurants within walking distance, this is what people have to settle for if they want to eat before the game.

33.description: First, admission to the Stadium Club at U.S. Cellular Field during Chicago White Sox home games requires membership, only available to full season ticket holders for $1,000 for the 2007 season.  However, one-game passes are frequently for sale at secondary markets such as ticket brokers or websites like StubHub, selling from a couple of bucks each to as much as $100 each for big games.  It's also available on non-game days for private parties, and it's apparently a popular destination for wedding receptions, believe it or not... oddly, I was not aware it  was a girl's dream growing up to have her reception at the ballpark?I have loved coming here before, during, or after a game for a while now.  I went on 2007 opening day, and it's largely the same as previous years.  There are essentially three parts  to the Stadium Club that are very different, a dining room downstairs and a bar upstairs with a main bar area and a recessed bar window seat area.Dining Room:Want to impress someone before or during a White Sox game?  Take them to the dining room at the Stadium Club.  It's a white tablecloth dining room on multiple tiers with a fantastic view of the field from the right-field corner.  The basic meal is a very good $29/person ($13 for children) all-you-can-eat buffet by Levy Restaurants that's comparable to a four-star hotel buffet, with drinks and desserts costing extra.  Opening day, the buffet had seared scallops (fantastic) and ahi tuna, duck confit, and carving stations with great roasted turkey and veal.  In the past, I've had very good roast beef and prime rib, and for 1:05pm Sunday games they have brunch including an omelet station.  Reservations are recommended in the dining room, but they usually have some open tables except for the really popular games.Bar Window Seats:This is the front section of the upstairs bar, along the glass facing the field.  It's the same food and service as the rest of the bar, but less crowded and with a great view.  Technically, reservations are required to sit here, but sometimes they're not that strict about this rule.  If you bring kids, this is probably the best place in the Stadium Club for them, fully isolated from the bar atmosphere with a view and they have a kid's meal for $6.  It may be worth noting that last year the entire Stadium Club become totally smoke free.Bar:The bar is essentially a typical sports bar, with much better food.  A scaled back version of the dining room buffet is available for $18/person although they only let you fill your plate once.  There's a sandwich station where they carve a phenomenal sandwich for you for $11, and a variety of other items on the menu.  There's not much of a view of the park from most of the bar, although there's an abundance of good televisions around just like the rest of the Stadium Club.Something really odd happened on opening day after the game, in that my friend and I realized that the 2005 World Series trophy was sitting behind us on a barstool!  We naturally posed for a couple of pictures with it before someone official-looking came by and took it away.  It's amazing who and what you can run into at the Stadium Club!In general, throughout the Stadium Club, service is great and the employees very attentive.  They handle the problem of waiting for your bill at the end as you're impatiently waiting to run to your game seats by asking you to sign once using a credit card (no cash!) before the end, adding an 18% gratuity plus 9.25% tax.  That way you have paid for everything in case you dash to your seats and don't have to deal with tipping unless you want to add more.  Also, there's a $5/person charge for the dining room or bar window area if you want to watch the game from there.It opens two hours before game-time, although for the dining room the buffet opens one hour before day games and Saturday 6:05pm games.  It tends to have last call at about an hour or so after each game, although after big games you may have to wait to get in.  Note there is a dress code, but it's pretty lax as most people are wearing all manner of White Sox attire and jeans, I believe the types of things they prohibit are cutoffs, torn clothes, and tank-tops.All-in-all, if you get a chance to go, you should, as it makes for a great experience.

2.description: I don't get to be VIP very often, so getting access to the Stadium Club was quite the treat. Everything from the elevator, to the air conditioning, to the tables, bartenders, wait staff and view was super nice! I like that they have tables to eat at close and further from the windows, but also many long skinny high tops that face the field so you can eat/drink and watch the game easily. I felt like the beer selection was more affordable up here than down on the concourses, plus they had a lot of fun signature cocktails to order up. Also, they actually give you glass pints to drink from up here, which is nice.The food selection looked good, and reasonable. There was a pretzel option for $15, for example, and the pretzel came with 3 dipping options and was HUGE. Seemed fair because you could easily split it between 3 people! We did not order food, but I would love to come back to do so, especially seeing their nachos and the fact that they have a BACON FLIGHT.

32.description: I am the furthest thing from a sports fan but when my companion got all expense paid tickets to the white sox game including the stadium club, you can expect to see me waving a foam finger like a lunatic.  Now I can't say that the stadium club has the most upscale dining fare (perhaps the dining room does!) but it is a fun place to hang out and drink mixed drinks rather then beer out of plastic bottles.  We split an order of the italian bake (a hot dip that involved lots of cheese and italian sausage) and a massive plate of nachos.  It was all just the perfect amount of gooey cheesy grease.  Perhaps I could get used to be this kind of sports fan...

18.description: Classy, good food, mixed review on service, expensive!I got stadium club passes with some tickets I purchased off ebay.   The club is an exclusive area in the ballpark and looks like a nice private club.   I wouldn't want to have to extra to get in though or pay a yearly fee.  If someone else were taking me or the passes were free/cheap, it is worth checking out.Dining Room:Call to make reservations before the game to guarantee your table is  available and waiting for you.Food - $29 "buffet" where you only get to fill your plate once.   The food is high quality for food at the ballpark.   It is mediocre food when comparing to a nice restaurant or a place that can charge $30 for a plate.   Contrary to what another reviewer says, I don't think food here is as good as a high cost / high quality hotel buffet.  If you don't care about dollars or have someone else treating, this is worth checking out.   If you like regular ballpark food and want to save a few dollars, don't eat here!The landslide ice cream pie I had for dessert fed four of us and we still had some left over.   It is huge and looks intimidating.   It was good though.Service- They tack on a 18% service charge automatically so beware you are not tipping extra by accident.   The server I had on my one visit here was a bit pushy and rubbed me the wrong way with multiple comments.   One of my dining companions felt the same way and neither of us is easily offended.Bar:The bar is an extra level up from the restaurant.   It has lots of tables and sandwiches for ~10.   I didn't get to try the sandwiches because I was stuffed from the restaurant buffet downstairs, but next time I come, I will try one of the juicy looking sandwiches.I did have a drink at the bar and took advantage of their free bar snack mix.   The bartender was also very friendly and attentive.

13.description: Came the Stadium Club under guest pass. The service and attendants are extremely pleasant and attentive. Venue is nicely appointed and some seating areas have great views of the field. In the upper level bar, a reservation is required to sit at the rail right at the windows, though. We sat on the next level up and could see the field well. There are plenty of TV monitors although you cannot hear anything on the field nor the TV broadcasts in the eating area. In the lobby you can hear Sox radio. The venue is a great place to relax to get away from the hot sun and heat. Credit cards only, no cash and there is a dress code although this late in the season, it was pretty lax.However, we were disappointed in the quality of the food. We didn't go for the buffets b/c none in our group is a big eater. A turkey burger was thin and the french fries almost tasteless. BBQ chicken sandwich had very little meat and was almost all sauce. Hot brownie sundae was a major disappointment - small brownie, a bit of ice cream and mostly all whipped cream and we waited a long time for it, too. For the prices we expected better and especially because the concession food outside of the Stadium Club is rather good. The soft serve swirl is much better than the ice cream we had on the brownie sundae. Food needed to match the ambiance. For a first-time experience it was enjoyable, though. If you want to sit in comfortable place and have low expectations for dining, the Stadium Club fits the bill.

4.description: Annual Sox game today baby, loved every minute of it. The park was filled with the smell of delicious goodies!!!

24.description: Got lucky one night as my sister's friend had access to this place.  Don't remember how.  Either way, once we came up here around the 3rd there was no reason to go back to our seats.  Awesome view of the game, lots of TVs if you wanna catch another game.  Good food, albeit pricey.

6.description: My group had never been to the stadium club before, so we were excited to get to see what it was all about. First off, it's a definite maze to get to. The hype going up made us really pumped. We had 4 sets of people check our tickets on the way up, and were so excited to get in there! However our bubble was quickly deflated. Not nearly as exclusive as we are lead to believe. We find a table and wait 10 min for a waitress to acknowledge our presence. Our friends decided to head back to the seats, but the man and I decided to stick it out and try some food. Now our server Amanda was so nice, but I don't think any amount of niceness could have made up for the sad sad food we got. We ordered the south side dippers and what we were given was legit day old pizza cut into strips. It was lukewarm and yet still burnt. I could barely eat more than 2 bites before giving up. This place definitely could use some improvement. Staff was nice but everything else was a huge let down.

22.description: After having eaten at the Stadium Club at the United Center several times, I thought I knew what this experience would be like.  Usually a buffet, usually a table for 4, in a clubby type atmosphere.Therefore, imagine my surprise when we got to the Club before our hosts and went through a variety of missteps before finding our "table".The Stadium Club is split into two distinct levels- the downstairs level which is more of what I have experienced at the other stadium with it's large buffets and seating that turns over every hour and a half.  Upstairs is the bar.  It's like a sports bar- except the sports is live through huge floor to ceiling windows overlooking the field.  Here the food is casual bar food- with the plus being someone actually waits on you versus the buffet area downstairs.The hostess at the upper area checked her list and then led us to our "table"  Imagine my surprise when that table turned out to be a series of backless stools lined up along a wall facing away from the game!  While there was a small shelf area on which to place my beer- no one wanted to sit facing away from the game so we decided a little improvisation was needed.With beers on the shelf, we sat with our backs to the shelf and our food balanced on our laps.  Not ideal, obviously.  If you go- insist on one of the many tables they have, or to sit by the windows facing OUT!The food was okay.  Nachos were nachos and the burger on a pretzel roll was fine.  Other items on the bar menu were a "Carving board" for deli sandwiches and a small list of bar appetizers.  Our server, Melissa, was personable and friendly and quick with our drinks, which I am sure was no small feat given how crowded this place was.  And know, if you go, that credit cards rule here so you must present one when you first arrive.I guess the benefit here is that if you don't want to sit in your seats outside, you can stay in the bar area in air conditioned comfort and watch the game through the glass.  We stayed long enough for the sun to move from our seats and headed out for a more traditional night at the ball game.For me?  Part of the fun of a game is a hot dog and beer balanced on my lap in my seat hoping not to spill it as I scream for my team.  The Stadium Club has the balancing act down . . . .it just lacks the "fun" of what is on the other side of the glass.

15.description: After having eaten at the Stadium Club at the United Center several times, I thought I knew what this experience would be like.  Usually a buffet, usually a table for 4, in a clubby type atmosphere.Therefore, imagine my surprise when we got to the Club before our hosts and went through a variety of missteps before finding our "table".The Stadium Club is split into two distinct levels- the downstairs level which is more of what I have experienced at the other stadium with it's large buffets and seating that turns over every hour and a half.  Upstairs is the bar.  It's like a sports bar- except the sports is live through huge floor to ceiling windows overlooking the field.  Here the food is casual bar food- with the plus being someone actually waits on you versus the buffet area downstairs.The hostess at the upper area checked her list and then led us to our "table"  Imagine my surprise when that table turned out to be a series of backless stools lined up along a wall facing away from the game!  While there was a small shelf area on which to place my beer- no one wanted to sit facing away from the game so we decided a little improvisation was needed.With beers on the shelf, we sat with our backs to the shelf and our food balanced on our laps.  Not ideal, obviously.  If you go- insist on one of the many tables they have, or to sit by the windows facing OUT!The food was okay.  Nachos were nachos and the burger on a pretzel roll was fine.  Other items on the bar menu were a "Carving board" for deli sandwiches and a small list of bar appetizers.  Our server, Melissa, was personable and friendly and quick with our drinks, which I am sure was no small feat given how crowded this place was.  And know, if you go, that credit cards rule here so you must present one when you first arrive.I guess the benefit here is that if you don't want to sit in your seats outside, you can stay in the bar area in air conditioned comfort and watch the game through the glass.  We stayed long enough for the sun to move from our seats and headed out for a more traditional night at the ball game.For me?  Part of the fun of a game is a hot dog and beer balanced on my lap in my seat hoping not to spill it as I scream for my team.  The Stadium Club has the balancing act down . . . .it just lacks the "fun" of what is on the other side of the glass.

7.description: There are 2 levels in The Stadium Club.  Personally, I enjoy the second level with the bar area.  Sandwiches are very tasty and if you order off the menu, the food is pretty decent. They also offer a smaller buffet.The level with the big buffet is usually pretty crowded and depending on the day and how the team is doing, reservations may be difficult if you want to be out in time to enjoy the game from your seats.  However, you can also order off the menu.It gets crazy crowded after the game when everyone wants to enjoy one last cocktail.

8.description: I went to the Club last night, somewhat crowded as the weather was cold. We easily found a table and sat down upon entering the club. The ambience was great as both the Sox game and the Bulls playoff game was on TV, lot of cheering and camaraderie in the restaurant. The service was just OK although our server was very nice. It took awhile to get his attention and once we ordered, the meals took awhile to be delivered. Our first drink did not come very quickly and the second round took longer. The food was excellent, a heaping beef brisket and Italian beef sandwich, better than the typical bar food. Overall, a very good experience and a very nice way to watch the game when the weather outside is not optimal.

30.description: Hot tip to any restaurant, regardless of where you are located:When a customer is half-way through a plate of chicken wings -- good ones, but not cheap -- "now" is not the time to walk to his table and shout "Alright folks, time to get out. Wrap'er up!" After paying a mandatory gratuity (a.k.a. "Service Charge"), it's even less of an appropriate time to repeat such a violation in service multiple times in a two minute span.After spending over a hundred bones at the ol' ballpark on overpriced beer and Italian beef (it was a pretty good Italian beef), I joined two friends upstairs for stiffer drinks and "nicer" food during an evening rainout.I give the Stadium Club massive credit for gorgeous views, friendly waitstaff, good food, great selection and huge TV's in every trajectory. But as soon as our game was "called" due to rain, all of the above was washed away with the torrential downpour as bar managers began sweeping through and rudely interrupting what, for some, might have been dinner. Yes, there are rules. But there is also common courtesy. Without checks already wrapped up and clearly in the middle of our meal, these guys felt it was perfectly cool to bully us out of our seats.I should have asked for our mandatory gratuity (for a group of three???) back, but the server was perfectly nice.Sorry Stadium Club. Above ambiance, above showering your customers with variety, above being the slickest place to watch a game, courtesy is always king.

3.description: It's fun to come and hang out. Even though I'm not a sports fan, especially baseball. I do like doc uniforms. And the food isn't bad, but I would rather wait and go to Chinatown after. They do have or had a nice fireworks display after.

14.description: *Yawn* Yes, that's what I think of this place. Other than getting away from the heat in some air conditioning I'm not that impressed. The food is overpriced and not that good and unless you have reserved seats you're likely not going to be sitting close enough to really see the game, if at all. Plus it's in the outfield so unless your seats are in a worse location you're better off sitting in the seats you paid for instead of coming here.Visited: June 24, 2012

58.description: Finally, CP Halsted is open, and has lived up to my expectations. No, that's wrong, it exceeded them.Today was the opening day, so it was kind of pandemonium in the aisles, but the staff was completely on it re-stocking and cleaning up the shelves. I was greatly impressed by the variety of produce, fish, meat, and deli selections, clearly stocked with the cultural groups living in the area in mind: Mexican, Chinese, Italian, and even a bit of Indian. There were even specials on live lobsters, live conch, and some other live crustaceans I hadn't even seen before.The renovation of the store was done really nicely, making it look much more upscale than the other CP locations. Thankfully the prices of the items for sale didn't reflect this approach.Needless to say, I will never go out of my way to grocery shop again - everything I need is right down the street at a very reasonable price. To give you an idea, I walked out with two large bags of produce, dried fruits, nuts, deli items, and chips for under $40.

56.description: Yay! Cermak produce is awesome and whats best about it is the location. conveniently located around 30th and halsted. it reminds me a lot like petes market. huge selection, very clean, and well stocked.  they have all types of food from different cultures.  the only thing that i know they don't carry is block tofu.  i asked a worker and he was kind enough to look it up and even ask someone from the back and then come back to me to report that they don't carry it.  its all good though.  there is always great deals on seasonal fruits, which make me really excited for summer.  I believe this is the most diverse market in chicago.  the people are friendly, great service, and prices are incredible for fresh fruits and veggies. cermak produce, your a life saver :)

29.description: I thought I was in Chinatown away from Chinatown here. I like the layout here, seems to just flow.Produce didn't look the best. I bought guacamole and a little browning and there was big chunks of avocado in it still.

42.description: impressive! my new one stop grocery shop. and i don't have to travel far to get here!i walk into an arena of fresh produce for great prices and i want to take a whole forest full home. 4 huge ears of corn for 99 cents?! fresh herbs? find em here for the fairest prices. eat predominantly ethnic foods? find a unique selection that offers the most produce with names i cannot pronounce or have no idea how to cook. i am inspired to try new things here especially while i don't have to pay an entire paycheck on the gamble.take a stroll over to the bakery section and practice resistance to the ultimate temptations. cannolis, tiramisu, coffee cheesecake, fudge, cookies, house made power bars... the list goes on... what's jaw dropping is you get the goodies at such sweet prices! dairy section has a great variety and it's my staple go to. i can rest assured the dairy i buy here won't expire tomorrow like other grocery stores in the area.it feels clean here. and it doesn't smell! what a change of pace for the standards of grocery stores around here! every time i have come here so far, my time is limited and must grab whatever goods i can see and reach within 15 mins and go... every time i come here i could honestly have stayed for an hour plotting on how to stock my fridge to the brim and impress my beau with a quality dinner.

23.description: Good selection of vegetables and fruits you wouldn't find in your big box stores like Jewels, etc. They also carry meats and desserts, this store will remind you of Pete ' s Fresh Produce. The prices are very reasonable,  my only reason for 4 stars is the quarter you have to put in to retrieve a cart

47.description: The best thing for me about this place is the location.  It's closer to my place than the other neighborhood grocery stores and for some reason always seems like a less stressful trip.Like many of the other reviewers have said, the produce and deli sections are killer and VERY affordable.  Everything I've had from both departments have always been super fresh and easy on my wallet.In the meat section they have different taco and fajita packages that are already cut up and seasoned so you can just stop and throw it in the pan when you get home.  I really love this about this store.  It saves me a ton of time on dinner when I work late and couldn't be any more economical.  (A 1.5 lb package of Al Pastor cost me about $2.75 and fed 3 people with some left to mix with my eggs on Saturday morning.)Obviously with a store this size you will not be able to get all of the necessities so you won't be able to fully replace your other grocery with this.  Also, some of the prices can be a bit higher than competitors ($8 for Breyers Ice Cream?!?!  Really, CFM?)All in all it's a great spot that i like to visit a couple times a week.  Make sure to remember to bring a quarter so you can get a shopping cart!

8.description: The only grocery option in Bridgeport.  A little more expensive but it's very organized and a lot cleaner than it's predecessor JEWEL back in the day.

31.description: Pretty good for a grocery store. The prices in produce were very reasonable and the selection was good.  I don't know why this grocery store came up under my search for Asian grocery stores. The selection of Asian ingredients was scarce to non-existent.  Still it was a pretty good store in general so I didn't want to give it a poor rating.

34.description: I honestly wish I could keep this place a secret.  It's always super busy, and for good reason.  Rainy Tuesday evening and you decide to take advantage of the inevitably slow day at the Market?  Think again.  But I digress.  The produce selection is great (and -- shhhh -- it's cheap!).  It's fresh most of the time (what do you expect? perfection?), and there's a mini bakery that serves pastries, cakes, and makes fresh bread onsite.  They also serve Abuelita hot chocolate.  I mean, seriously?  This is a Mexican's paradise.  We needed this Market so badly in this neighborhood.  Apparently, everyone took notice of that as well.  I guess that's great for business, right?  Lol.  But seriously, it's a really great place, and I love how diverse it is.  I've never seen that kind of diversity in any other Mexican market, and it's really refreshing.  Oh, and they prepare food in-house by the meat counter in the back -- it's outstanding!  There's genuine Mexican food and some American options, and it's perfect if you're in a time crunch, don't feel like cooking, or if you want family style Mexican food without the Mexican restaurant price tag.  Oooh, last thing, since Chinatown is a hop and a skip away, they also have some oriental groceries, condiments and products to cater to those who are so inclined.

16.description: I love this place. My neighborhood grocery store and go to place. Inexpensive with a wide variety. I'm sure they're sick of me.

13.description: Cermak Produce is good for just running in and grabbing something you've forgotten at another store, maybe I'm just cheap. Haha I can't see paying some of the prices here with Food-4-Less nearby. The Good- The produce is well stocked and their spelling of "beats" as opposed to "beets" made my day. Their meat department is impressive though with pristine displays of various seafood. The Bad- I feel this market is grossly overpriced for everyday items. $5+ for things like chips and juice is just outrageous. The Ugly- The parking lot is a nightmare, no joke. That and having to pay a quarter, yes .25¢ to rent a freaking grocery cart is just absurd.

11.description: You that saying "  you get what you pay for," well that is how I feel about Cermak Fresh Market. I hope here frequently because it's close by the house, the produce is cheap and the meat is a decent price. The big problem we had Cermak is that we fell for their sale on liter Coke and Sprite $1.00 a liter which our fault to have fallen for such a deal. When we used it a few days later for a birthday party the soda was flat and tasted old. We never opened the soda and it was nasty.Be careful of what you buy at Cermak Fresh market, I for the most part it does the trick when it comes to getting items for dinner and lunch. I wouldn't get of their liter soda ever again.

39.description: They have a really good variety of produce, and great prices!  It's a full supermarket, but I haven't done much shopping there aside from the produce.  But the produce prices are great, and quality is excellent!

37.description: Well-stocked and helpful staff.I can't believe they have a wall of shame (right on the entrance doors)... this is embarrassing to people...

0.description: Always have what you need and right around the corner from my boyfriend. They have a lot asian products because of the area they are in so that's good for me. The cashiers are really nice and there's this one manager  that is there all the time. He's so nice. Good place!

38.description: Clean, well-stocked, lots of fresh food (fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, bakery). I like that they have lots of staffed counters so you can make specialized requests and get your food portioned for . Prices are very good and there is lots of variety. Strongly recommended.

51.description: Absolutely, 100% in love with Cermak Fresh Market.Prices are excellent, especially on their selection of produce. Definitely worth a visit for the fresh produce alone. Was very pleased by the deli selection as well. Cermak Fresh Market pays attention to the diverse nature of this neighborhood & stocks their shelves & produce in accordance. Might I mention... they have a WALL OF HOT SAUCES. Seriously. An entire section of an aisle dedicated to hot sauce.

27.description: I've been buying produce here for a while that's the only items I've purchased from here other than my favorite EVOO. The prices of the produce is very attractive but you pay for what you get. The veggie's are mediocre but the fruit is questionable?????? Cherries not sweet most had brown gooey stuff coming out, plums, peaches not juicy the skin texture rough looking and tough when you bite, fuji apple not fragrant nor crunchy and juicy like I'm use to. I have purchase produce over and over again and nothing has change I tried to like the produce here but I don't .Lemon and limes are good and the papaya was OK. Friendly staff and owner. Three stars for the produce.

32.description: This is my go to place for groceries. I live close by so it's incredibly convenient and the prices are as cheap as it gets!There are always different specials and sales going on everyday, which is great. Cermak market is pretty huge, so odds are you're gonna be able to find whatever you need here without having to drive all around town for groceries. Cermak has an amazing selection of fresh fruits and vegetables (did I mention it's cheap?). I always get tempted by the bakery area. There are a variety of pastries, cakes and drinks. They make fresh french baguettes that are hot and crusty on the outside and soft on the inside - I find myself shamelessly snacking on it while on shopping, lol. The deli is great as well with different fresh cheeses and meats. There is also a wide variety of seafood and meats too.I'll definitely be back over and over again!

54.description: Fresh produce and quality meats.  Asian and Latin specialty items.  This was badly needed and an immense improvement over the crappy Jewel that once haunted this site.

48.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE! huge selection, clean AND cheap! What more could you ask for in a grocery store?! yup, enough said. I guess there are perks to not living in Lakeview anymore.

44.description: I was happy to see this open in my neighborhood.  I was more impressed with it when it first opened.  Now, it seems like the produce is substandard and rots very quickly.  I hope it doesn't turn into the Cermak Produce on Archer and Damen...that one is gross.

24.description: Cermak Produce is good for just running in and grabbing something you've forgotten at another store, maybe I'm just cheap. Haha I can't see paying some of the prices here with Food-4-Less nearby. The Good- The produce is well stocked and their spelling of "beats" as opposed to "beets" made my day. Their meat department is impressive though with pristine displays of various seafood. The Bad- I feel this market is grossly overpriced for everyday items. $5+ for things like chips and juice is just outrageous. The Ugly- The parking lot is a nightmare, no joke. That and having to pay a quarter, yes .25¢ to rent a freaking grocery cart is just absurd.

7.description: This a great place to get inexpensive produce and meats. The store is a pretty good size so there is a good variety of fruits and vegetables as well as all types of meats. You can even pick up some marinaded meat if you're sometimes lazy like me. The store workers are always nice and attentive. I would only say that the parking lot is a bit small and sometimes gets congested.

49.description: Several people recommended Cermak Market to me after I complained about the pain/prices of buying fresh produce in an attempt to have a more balanced diet.  I decided to check it out and I've been a fan ever since! Great vegetable and fruit selection at low prices. I was really surprised by how much cheaper (yet fresh) the meat and seafood is here than at the typical chain stores... I try to buy everything here. Alas, there are some things missing (i.e. doesn't have as robust a personal care aisle/selection as other stores--I still have to go to another store for lotions, soaps, etc.) but you do luck up on some items: I needed to replace my facial moisturizer and at Cermak, I found an extra large bottle of the brand I already use, for the same price I've paid at other stores for the smaller bottle!

40.description: I love love love Cermak Produce! Talk about getting the most bang for your buck...for produce (obviously). I'd still go to Dominick's for everything else though.

53.description: A great store.  I can see a day when the independent grocers in Chicago run Jewel and Dominick's out of town.   Cermak Fresh Market (and Pete's Market) know who their customer is.   Jewel and Dominick's unbelievably have decided to get rid of a lot of ethnics food, eventhough their stores are located in ethic areas.  Amazing!!

30.description: It's coming to a year since this place has been open and the honeymoon is over.  The selection of Asian vegetables have gone down in variety and up in price.  I prefer to buy the Asian stuff at another grocery store that has gotten better in the last year.  I'll write a review for Hong Kong Market later.  This place is still the best in the area to get your limes, avocados, and other fruits.

46.description: Finally, a grocery store in the neighborhood after the Jewel closed years ago. This grocery store is new, clean, and cheap.Although a few items maybe alittle more pricier than other grocery stores, but when they're on sale, it's pretty cheap. Occasionally, steaks are on sale for $2.99 a lb and seedless watermelon also for $2.99 a lb. I don't know where else you can find it, and it may or may not be Prime, Choice, or Select, but it's cheap beef! They have a variety of ethnic foods in the store. The convenience of walking and buying groceries is a nice plus.

1.description: This isn't the worst grocery store that I've ever been to, but it's certainly not very good. I don't have a car so I kind of have to shop here because it's the closest to my apartment. Oh well, here's what I've noticed about it. Cons:1. You have to use a quarter to get a shopping cart (like Aldi) but most of the carts are broken (like Aldi). The carts and the baskets are also extremely dirty. 2. What ever produce is on sale is going to go bad the next day. This may be true for other grocery stores but it never fails at this one. They also consistently have bad apples and leave rotten fruit on displays (why doesn't anyone throw it away?? I mean if something is covered in mold it'll make the other produce bad, right?)3. Milk, eggs, and anything in the frozen section is consistently high priced.4. The store is actually smaller than you'd think and they don't always have what I'm looking for (marsala spice, sweet and sour sauce, and not much in their coffee section). Pros:1. The produce is a toss-up sometimes but it's generally pretty cheap. 2. Frozen grocery items are expensive but meats and cold cuts are cheap. 3. They don't sell hard liquor but they have a really large selection of beers and a decent selection of wines. 4. I appreciate that they have a decent selection of Asian and Mexican cooking ingredients (usually). 5. Finally, why I keep coming back, the cashiers are really nice. This place is what it is. Take it or leave it.

55.description: It's been a along time since Bridgeport had a decent store that sells fresh veggies and more. I was glad to see someone move in to the old run down Jewel that went out of business a few years back.I love the great selection of vegetable and the meat market has a large variety to choose from. I was even surprised to see a small selection of fish here. The store reminds me of Caputo's (Suburban fresh market), Stanley's (Fruit and Vegetable) and Aldi (for the quarter shopping carts). They have a large parking lot , if you're lucky you find a empty spot.

9.description: Cermak's everyday low pricing is great, particularly in the produce and deli departments, where product goes on sale at unbeatable prices. Deli associates are very good at weighing up what you need, which may sound expected, but I can't tell you how many encounters have been off at other stores.  Since this is a smaller market, the brands are limited, but they serve basic needs in other departments although those prices are slightly higher.During weekday nights, the parking lot and lines are wide open, and cashiers are pleasant and efficient.  My only qualm is that the house made guacamole pales in comparison to the location on 34th and Archer.  Unfortunately, they are not made the same, and I have to go to the other location or Jewel to find good guac.  Cermak Produce is my go-to for fresh groceries at excellent prices but may not be the best one-stop shop.

26.description: No matter what time I come here, it seems it's always very crowded. Some of the people are pretty rude also and will not think about cutting in front of you in the check out line or bumping into you t get you out of the way.  Be careful in the parking lot since there really aren't any "one way" signs or arrows anywhere, and people seem to think they can drive however they want, disregarding other cars and pedestrians.  I avoid the store mainly because of the parking lot.  If I do have to come here, I park as far away as possible to the entrance and walk on the curbed medium.  Hold onto your children's hands.  They do carry fresh fruit and veggies, but not a very big selection of other items.  They didn't have Oscar Meyer hot dogs last time I went in but they did carry some lesser quality ones that I had never heard of before.  Oscars Meyers should have been carried as they are pretty common...I wasn't asking for Hebrew Nationals.

25.description: I love this place. My neighborhood grocery store and go to place. Inexpensive with a wide variety. I'm sure they're sick of me.

12.description: The produce store is one of the cheapest out of all the grocery stores in Chicago. Also, their meat section is pretty cheap too. I like going to their bakery and getting some bolillos and some original cheesecake. The store also has a decent selection of cheese (to go with the bolillos). The parking is a bit crazy during peak hours. There is one way to enter and exit the lot as the painted arrows indicate, but people are driving all over the place.

21.description: I was shopping for pears.  1 out of the 3 pears was not price.  The other 2 was priced.  At checkout, the cashier ring me up for HIGHER PRICE...  The manager say it is different kind of pear.  We went to see the price tag and THE MANAGER say "THAT IS HOW WE DO THINGS FOR MANY YEARS."  He still charge me for the higher price even when all other pears was less price and the higher price is not marked.

17.description: This place has decent pricing and the lettuce I bought from here lasted forever. They seem to be a little lacking in the selection of brands that they carry, but I guess that is probably expected considering that it is a smaller store. There is only one way in and out of the parking lot, so sometimes it can get a little backed up.

10.description: Still four stars, however disappointed that they stopped carrying Hunts no salt added tomato products, I did ask management about it and he said he'd check on it, if it was because Hunt's doesn't have it or if enough people didn't purchase it. The other product I love that they do still have is Brad's Organic Chicken broth, in contrast with other broths that are 400-600mg per serving, I pulled the following from the website if you need broth buy Brad's so they don't stop carrying it. Please and thank you.    USDA Organic    Gluten Free    No MSG    No Preservatives    All Natural    Fat FreeLOW SODIUM: Only 140mg per serving (1 cup)

5.description: If you are looking for cheap meat, this is the place to be. Produce is better and cheaper at Mariano's. Come here for meat. They have the cheapest meat I've found so far in Chicago, though I haven't been to any of the Asian markets yet. #meat #wow #portioncontrol

3.description: Great little grocery store, good prices on produce.The beverages and the cheese selection are pretty good. Half the price of most non Mexican stores. No joke this is the flagship store. The meat selection is great, a lot of hard to find cuts at great prices. The deli is decent with some pretty good buys when they are on sale. Try the Barbacoa from the hot section, you will be pleased. This is a staple in the neighborhood always busy.

35.description: Still likin' it! Just want to share some of the cool things that have popped from time to time, as well as some perennial favorites: giant fresh shrimp! Beef cheeks in 3# packs! Sweetbreads (had to order them)! Delicious sashimi salmon! Skate wing (the fish guy will trim)! Great fresh swordfish! They carry Dean's half and half which is a plus. Also Swanson's broths. Haven't had good luck with their steaks so far. As many others have noted the produce is a wonderland. Keep it comin'!

19.description: The perfect little neighborhood grocery store. Great selection of produce with a wide variety of fruits and vegetables.The meat counter is incredible, it's so clean and well stocked and the prices are just great. Seafood selection is great too, and you really can expect a clean cut here. The deli counter is also pretty solid. The new beer selection makes it convenient, too.The only real issue I have with this place is that the floors are always being bleached, and the smell is pretty intense. But I'd rather have that problem than the other end of the spectrum, I suppose.

28.description: This is a great addition to the Bridgeport neighborhood. It's nice to be able to walk to get groceries!! It's a bit like a lower class while foods with their set up which is cool. The missing star is because the market is mostly based on Mexican goods but Bridgeport is a very diverse neighborhood. Even still, it's a great and local place to shop.

45.description: Amazing, I love this place.  Bigger selection than the Jewel or Dominicks nearby.As others have mentioned, I was super impressed with the produce selection and price.  It was a dream for a poor student like myself who loves fresh fruit & veg but often can't buy what I want because of the prices.  I was able to get a ton of fruit, veggies, and even got a box of cheap couscous which will make for some fantastic meals.

33.description: For a while, Cermak was the grocery store I needed.  Great produce, great meat, great prices... for a while.  My visit tonight was pretty typical of how it goes now.  I spent about five minutes searching for two honeycrisp apples that did not have some kind of break in the skin or bruise.  Then I found that they were out of regular (not instant) oatmeal, again.  Then I waited for about 10 minutes for help at the deli counter while one person helped a customer and the other cleaned a machine.  When I went to check out, both lines were fairly long.  The teenage girl who checked me out did not speak to me, or make eye contact.  She did, however, speak to the other young lady who bagged my groceries in a language that I don't happen to speak, but somehow I still knew was gossip.  After I paid I had to reach around the person who bagged my groceries to get them.  When I got to the car I noticed that there was a bag of grapes in my bag that I did not buy.  So I brought the grapes back in, gave them to the manager and explained that I had not bought them and someone might come looking for them.  He seemed to think that was rather funny.I will continue to shop there because they are the best option in the area, but I am not going to like it!

43.description: Far better than Jewel's or Dominick's.The produce and meat departments are unbeatable!  Such a wide array of choices.   I have never seen anything like this!

2.description: So many fresh veggies and great pre prepared meals from the butcher and deli area. Also, if you are looking for specifics for cooking Caribbean, Spanish, or Chinese dishes. They are more likely to carry it vrs Jewel or Mariano's. Great grocer.

18.description: Can't beat these prices! Selection is pretty on point as well. However, quality and service leave much to be desired. The produce especially ranges from decomposing to firm. I once ended up going two days in a row and the grapefruit went from 3/$1.50 to 3/$1.00 because they were trying to get rid of the last bits of bad fruit. Shelves are stocked with tons of great Latin-American options, and there's a bakery in the back with fresh treats. There's a pretty decent beer selection and lots of cheap wine in the back too.As for service, workers range from nice to rude. I'm usually greeted with a smile from the stockers. One time I ended up shopping until 10 pm (their closing time... I know, I suck) and the cashier and bagger were making unrefined comments about us in Spanish... in front of my Latina friend. Don't know if they didn't care or acted out of spite, but it was very unprofesh and we were trying our best to hurry up and get out of there. But, I go for the cheap food, not the human interaction, so I will be returning.

41.description: We never go to Jewel or Dominick's anymore. There is such a huge variety of produce and fruits here, all at a really reasonable price. We are always surprised at how little we spend here vs. how much we would have spent at the other chains. The quality seems a little better too. Staples are pretty cheap also. Meat is kinda hit or miss. Haven't had much problems with the chicken or pork we buy from here but the beef is iffy. We just had to throw away a pack of ground beef because it turned brown....in the freezer. Yesterday I took it out for dinner but thought, "That doesn't look right." We also like to pick up a tub of their pico de gallo. That's some good shiznit right there. I remember when this was a pretty run-down Jewel. Glad it's now Cermak Produce.

52.description: This store was sorely needed in this neighborhood.  I hope that they keep quality and sales up long after the opening day hoopla.  Although I still do the multiple store shopping thing, I do make it a point to stop into a Cermak Fresh Market to check their produce sales, often time they have the best sales, and since this place is new, they have the freshest product (for now).  I also like that they carry Sofrito - so I don't have to make it myself!  I use to go to the one on Damen/Archer, but since this one is closer to my BF's house, it will be much more convenient.  Hope more stores follow suit and open on Halsted soon!

50.description: Love this market.  First thing first, good parking lot, clean and bright interior.  They carry a mix of Asian and Mexican groceries, plus large fruit and veggies section.  It's kind of a Stanley's plus meat, ethnic sauces, and deli.  You can tell who lives in the neighborhood by what ethnic items are on the shelves.  Let's support our neighborhood business!

4.description: This location is bigger than the Cermak on North Avenue. Therefore, the selection is better and there are more services. However, I miss having a dried nuts, fruit, etc selection. I didn't see a freshly made bread section either. However, be aware of severe markups on certain things like ice cream, oatmeal, etc. Nice to have a neighborhood grocery store after Jewel left.

6.description: I like coming to this store. The fruit's and veggies are always fresh. The meat counter has plenty of meats to choose from. Great prices for your budget. I can come to this store on any day of the week and find a great deal. The staff is nice and when you are checking out don't worry you will be in and out.Happy shopping.

22.description: This  place can have all my money.  Variety of produce, love their prices and it has parking!

15.description: Cermak has been my go-to supermarket since about a month after it opened. Everything is of good quality, and the prices are very fair. I mostly just come here because of it's proximity to my apartment. I once tried to shop at 'food for less' down at 34th & halsted, and hated it. So, I come here.While cermak fresh market is the best low-to-middle class grocery store in the area, deserving of a whole lot of praise, the most notable feature of the grocery store is the woman who sells tamales outside. I think she's independent, but that doesn't matter. What matters is the tamales. They are juicy, have a beautiful texture, and are packed with a whole lot of meat & flavor. At $12 for 12 tamales, they can't really be beat. I recommend getting a sack of pork tamales. I asked for verde (green), and she gave me a combination pack, both green and red. She was also kind enough to let me grab a  sack for $10 under the condition that i'd pay her back the next week, but you shouldn't expect this of her. Just come prepared with your $12, get the tamales, eat them as soon as you get home, and write a review on yelp. Throw out whatever dinner plans you have. Eat tamales for dinner, maybe have a beer with your tamales, and enjoy your mexico-themed food coma.

57.description: It's evident that someone has invested a lot of money into modernizing and tweaking to squeeze every useable crevice out of this small format, neighborhood grocery store.  There's a plethora of live seafood, meats, Asian, Caribbean and Mexican vegetables and other products.  Hell they even have different flavors of Perrier, which -impresses- me.  You just don't find Perrier often in Bridgeport, especially not in the large, glass bottles!  There's a variety of extra virgin olive oils, frozen dinners and niche snack foods, along with a decent-sized dairy section. Maybe this will make the Walgreens store across the street finally quit dicking around, remodel and get serious about serving this community.2007. That's how long it's been since we Bridgeportonians (terrians? ites?) have gone sans a walkable fresh grocery store in these parts.  Does anyone remember the tiny, ancient Jewel that was in this same space, cobwebs in betwixt the grapes and all? Ew.  It's been a longgggggg time and many sore, struggling train and bus rides later for a lot of us in this former food desert. Who can believe that it's been since September 2007 that people in Mayor Daley's old hood have gone without a local fresh grocery store, so close to McGuane Park??

20.description: Can't beat these prices! Selection is pretty on point as well. However, quality and service leave much to be desired. The produce especially ranges from decomposing to firm. I once ended up going two days in a row and the grapefruit went from 3/$1.50 to 3/$1.00 because they were trying to get rid of the last bits of bad fruit. Shelves are stocked with tons of great Latin-American options, and there's a bakery in the back with fresh treats. There's a pretty decent beer selection and lots of cheap wine in the back too.As for service, workers range from nice to rude. I'm usually greeted with a smile from the stockers. One time I ended up shopping until 10 pm (their closing time... I know, I suck) and the cashier and bagger were making unrefined comments about us in Spanish... in front of my Latina friend. Don't know if they didn't care or acted out of spite, but it was very unprofesh and we were trying our best to hurry up and get out of there. But, I go for the cheap food, not the human interaction, so I will be returning.

36.description: Awesome produce section! There are so many types of everything! And it's fair priced so I can afford enough avocados to rock out with my guac out.

14.description: Rotten fruit and vegetables - now charge for bags and a parking lot that's an insane assylum. PASS!

1.description: What a NIGHTMARE! Don't be fooled by the nice website, their customer service is a joke. 3 weeks and I have no idea where my item is. They don't return calls or respond to emails. AVOID!

0.description: I placed an order on their web store for a shopping cart that fell apart on me a year later I hadn't used it more than a few times). They were helpful and shipped me a new one without any problem at all. Great service for me.

3.description: The selection is just ok and the service is horrible. I asked for women's Bears and Hawks stuff when I walked in and the women said "Upstairs" and pointed at the other employee. The other employee took me upstairs and then sulked. I was struggling to reach a shirt hanging on one of the high racks and she just sat there sulking. I wanted to say "Don't worry, I'll get it, I'm freakishly tall and have monkey arms. You just sit there and sulk" but instead I was polite. Then I asked "is there a fitting room" and she pointed to the closet that had a curtain over it, a desk lamp sitting on the floor, a chair, and no hooks or anything. I had a lot of trouble keeping my coat, shirt, the shirts I wanted to try on, and my purse on the chair while changing. By the end I gave up and didn't pick up the shirts when they fell to the floor. I really didn't want to give them my money, but I found a shirt I liked and I've been having trouble finding a Bears shirt that I really liked. So I begrudgingly gave them my business. That will be the last time though. On my way out the bouncer looking guy was standing outside the store in front of the door. I opened the door, he stood there. I said "'scuse me", he stood there. I said "Excuse Me!" a little louder, he stood there. I said "EXCUSE ME!" louder, he looked at me, moved over two inches, then stood there. I literally had to squeeze around him.

1.description: Great selection of shirts, prices aren't crazy. Picked up a couple of shirts from there, and would go back in the future.

2.description: Got all the Chicago sports gear but not enough options for women :(

5.description: Excellent selection and prices.A little too much cub crap vs. Sox gear, but plenty of deals to make it worth it.These guys operate the Merchandise trucks outside Sox games, so if you cant find it at the game, they have it.Home of the $5 ex sox players tshirts.

6.description: For Chicago sports fans this is a great place to pick up all kinds of logo items - Bears jerseys, Sox caps, Bulls T-shirts, or Cub pennants (for the wall - not the one that really counts!).Staff is friendly and helpful, and the prices are reasonable.

7.description: Been shopping here for years... they rock.  They just moved to bigger digs 2 doors down with 2 levels now... Very good selection and always the best on every team.  Good selection of Chicago Gear for the out of towners as well.  And, they have a great email list that sends me notices of the latest team merchandise (got my Bears XLI gear notice minutes after they clinched!).  Lastly, I just learned that the are also at the games outside of Wrigley and The Cell.  Look for the gray trailers.  Haven't seen 'em yet, but will look next time I go to a game.

8.description: Somewhat conveniently located on one of the darker streets of downtown, this place is not to be missed for sports fans.  T-shirts, caps and towels are sold at very reasonable prices.  And best of all?  Everything here concerns the Bulls, the Bears, the Sox and the Cubs.  So if you couldn't see them live, buy a souvenir here and tell your friends in Boise that you did.

0.description: I was at first hesitant to go here.  I thought it would be a small, outdated store with jacked up prices for Chicago sports wear...especially since it's on Michigan and Wacker.  I was so wrong!  The store is very clean and is 2 floors.  I walked in and asked where women's was (totally missing the huge sign pointing upstairs).  The security guard pointed me upstairs.  Once I got up there they had a ton of options for women.  I was looking for a Bulls shirt and found so many I liked but finally settled on just one and swore I'd be back for more.  They do have a fitting room... yes it's basically a large closet with a mirror but it has a chair, a door, lighting and a mirror so that's really all I needed.  I was suprised at how reasonable the prices were too.  Most items I liked/tried on were under $30.  Everyone I encountered was very nice and courteous.  I will definitely be back here for all my Chicago sporting needs in the future. I would recommend stopping here before anywhere else.  Great selection, prices and people.

4.description: Pretty good/great selection, lots of stuff shoved on the walls so you have to browse for a while before finding anything. Prices are reasonable, much better then stadiums/arenas. I knocked off a star because of the poor Bears selection. I know it's off season, but the Bears are one of the most popular teams in America and they were carrying ONE style adult men's Bears t-shirt! And judging by the Bulls selection (if you are looking for a Taj Gibson shirt, this is your place!), I'm sure the variety of Bears stuff is outstanding when the season comes around!

28.description: Another Chicago favorite of mine!  Everytime I get a chance to come to Chicago, I eat here.  California Mexican food can not compare to this restaurant.  I have been eating here for over 20 years, and I miss it dearly.  I try to visit "home" as often as I can, not to just see my family and friends, but to eat at this fabulous restaurant.  The carne asada is to die for!!!

1.description: A lady should never age herself, but I have no shame in admitting that I have eaten here for over 30 years. It was my Mexican grandfather's favorite restaurant by his house and we would have Sunday brunch there at least twice a month through out the course of my childhood. I recently returned this past Father's Day, and everything was exactly how I remember. Excellent chips and guacamole. Delicious chorizo and eggs. And, my favorite, super flavorful carne asada. Do not expect anything more than good Mexican food and you will not be disappointed.

39.description: this place is so great....its not fancy..its just a nice family friendly place....the enchiladas, flautas, steak, soup..its all very  flavorful.....no liquor lisc. they have a cool orange juicer-contraption....extremely friendly staff......

9.description: I dont like giving negative reviews but I feel that you should be warned. I ordered the pork taco salad and was charged for the steak. I asked about it and they did not correct the price. The pork was very tender and juicy by the way. You also get a cup of noodle soup with your order which was great! My co-worker ordered bistec al la mexicana and he got a dish with chunks of beef rather than skirt steak. Typically this dish has jalapeno cooked with it, this did not. I think this dish should be called chunky beef with onion stew because that is what it looked like. I am sorry to say this place will not be my first choice next time I'm in the area.

29.description: Stopped in here cuz my girlfriend and I was working out close by. The place is definitely a restaurant. We sat in and got a tray of chips and salsa. One green and one red. Good, but not great. I wished the green sauce was spicier...to me it only had mediocre flavor. I did not care much for the red sauce; tasted as if it came straight out of a bottle rather than being homemade. I ordered the chicken tostadas. There were three heaping tostadas on my plate with some rice and some beans. I was only able to finish 2 of the tostadas. Not much flavor to them so I poured the entire serving dish of the green salsa on them to give it some flavor. Eh, it was still just ok. And it was $8 for my dinner.However, I enjoyed my horchata. They put a pinch of cinnamon on top of the horchata which doesn't mix in that well with the drink. Regardless, after a good workout, it was a perfect thirst quencher at the time. Service was friendly. And there was no one in the restaurant with us on a Sunday evening, 7pm-ish? Interesting.Would I go back to this place again? Considering there are so many mexican joints everywhere... ummm, probably not.

42.description: I've been coming here since I was a child. Mexico Steakhouse's menu includes everything from burgers and sandwiches, salads and pasta, steak and chicken...all of your favorites Mexican or American. I recommend anything with the Skirt Steak.Its a great little sit down family run restaurant.

23.description: I gave it 4 star based on their chocolate cake. The dinner itself is just OK. I ordered skirt steak dinner. They gave you a lot of food, 1 dinner order is enough for 2 people. You have to try the chocolate cake, the frosting is creamy, soft, not too sweet, and I would go again just to buy the chocolate cake to go.

5.description: I have been coming here more than ten years. Watch your receipt. They like to charge you more than the listed price. You can order the same exact order in the same week and pay 5 dollars more the next time. The pork tacos taste delicious. The beef tacos and chicken are good also. Food overall is very good. Just watch out for their price changing at the register. They will sneakily hammer you.

31.description: Another Mexican place within walking distance of our new apartment - I'm beginning to get concerned that there are no junk Chinese places and yet at least 4 little Mexican joints.  I stepped inside and could tell that this is a REAL restaurant and that means it comes with all of the fixin's and service and atmosphere.And the prices that come with it.So you enter and there's a nice setup with rows of tables and flatware and glasses and one of those jukebox things in the back with songs that nobody's going to pay money to hear while they eat their taco platter.  I made my way down the rows to the counter where I placed a quick to-go order.  I was planning on trying the namesake items from anywhere I visited today, but I wasn't in the mood to pick up an entire Carne Asada strip steak with all the trimmings.  So I went for one asada steak taco.Highest price for the day of "one taco, please" out of all of the tacos I'd ordered.The quality though?  I can say it was some of the best steakmeat found in the tacos I purchased.  But is the higher price really worth it?  Perhaps if I'm actually going to sit down and eat and I'll wind up with a real platter with the side items I don't know what to do with (that whole "Fat American Can't Figure Out Foreign Cuisines" nickname is something I've EARNED, people) and I also feel like treating my dinner guests to some jukebox tunes - I'm certainly going to pay the premium price.But if it's "dear god just get me a taco i don't friggin' care how good it is" time, I'll likely go elsewhere.  After all, Mexico Steakhouse has a lot of competition in the neighborhood when it comes to Taco Time and I'm out wandering about.Especially once we get settled into our new kitchen and they have to compete with Char O.'s Taco Tuesdays!

25.description: The tacos here are pretty good. My favorite ones are the pork, they're served in a red sauce with a hint of spiciness. The rice can be a hit or miss at times - some days they're as delicious as god intended, other days some grains are slightly undercooked. Overall, it's a good Mexican restaurant. My only complaint is that the pricing can be a little steep if you're used to cheaper Mexican food.

12.description: Not very good, and I should know since I eat authentic Mexican at home often. I live right by here and not only is it pricey, but the tacos are far from worth it. The only decent stuff was the rice and beans. Oh and they sell Mexican coke in a bottle, which is always a plus. Aside from that, we're right by it for the last three years and have only gone once. Will never be going back.

37.description: Mexico Steakhouse is one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to in Chicago... the place is relaxed, informal and the service is terrific. No booze available but the food makes up for it!!!Parking on the street is usually easy to find and their food is fantastic!

21.description: keeping it short and simple..great friendly service.. the steak itself was ok.. but i would say the food is below average compare to other mexican restaurants around the neighborhood... the taco shell was nasty... the beans doesn't taste good.. the rice is oily.. and it seems like they cheap out on the amount of fillings in my tacos..

16.description: Good service, love the soup that comes with the meal.  Food has only disappointed once, when I found a bone in my chicken tacos, but I continue to come back

17.description: If I could give zero stars I would. I ordered nachos and I've never seen anything so disgusting in my life. It was 9 individual nachos each with a dollop of refried beans, a slice of kraft singles, and a dollop of sour cream. I wouldn't feed this to my dog. Never again will I eat here.

10.description: Thought is was time for an update since '09. This place is still going strong in my list of places to go on the south side, and it stands up to any north side comparable Mexican restaurant.Keep in mind, this place is about those standbys that you'd expect, tacos, enchiladas, tostados and a really good skirt steak. If you're a foodie looking for pork cheeks or snouts or whatever little delicacy you want, keep driving...yes I'll say it, keep driving north. Had dinner here last night, enjoyed it as we usually do.

11.description: The Mexico Steakhouse is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants.  This restaurant offers a large assortment of basic Mexican food in a utilitarian dining room and is BYO.  It is open daily for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Each lunch and diner is automatically started with a cup of soup and chips and tangy salsa verde and salsa rojo at no charge. I recommend the carne asada, either the dinner (full or half order) or in tacos.  The skirt steak is always served in large portions with the meat being very juicy and flavorful.  The dinner is accompanied by decent rice and frijoles and either flour or corn tortillas that are always hot and appetizing.  Two other dishes that are highly recommended are the pork and beef stews.  The meats in both are very tender and tasty and work very well with the other ingredients.The cost is very reasonable and the service is always efficient and friendly.  Also, free street parking is always available.

26.description: This is my favorite place for steak tortas!! Unfortunately, 1 out of 10 times, the steak will be too greasy.... I haven't figured why this is the case as I've been there on the weekends and week days and it's just an occasional hit or miss. Otherwise it would be 5 stars all the way!!

27.description: This is my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Chicago and has been for going on 30 years.   The quality of everything, especially the steak is excellent.    I also love the Swiss chicken enchiladas with onions, green peppers, mild red sauce and covered in cheese.   The mole sauce is excellent too.   It's not 5 star Rick Bayless style Mexican, and it's not supposed to be, but I've been to Topolobampo and this is still my favorite.   It's an excellent family owned restaurant.Another poster said that tacos would cost them $25.   That is not true.  You can get the steak burrito dinner or 3 steak taco dinner for under $10 with rice, beans, soup, and chips and salsa.  You won't leave hungry.If you're not real hungry or on a budget, try the steak tostada grande.  It's a large tostada with steak, beans, cheese, guacamole and sour cream.   I think it's around $4.50 and one of my favorites.   The guacamole and the nachos here are excellent too.  And hi to Tina, Blanca, and everyone else at the Steakhouse.   They've treated me like family for as long as I've been going there.   My ONLY complaints about the Steakhouse is that they're not open later and don't offer delivery.  Bob

35.description: I came here on my B-day because I've heard lots of good things. Well I was sad to find out that, to mine and my wife's standards it was just ok. Parking was easy, maybe because it was a Monday but no complaints there. Restaurant is clean and casual. Service was kind of slow due to the fact that there was one busboy and server who also took phone orders. Other then that server was friendly and was efficient. They brought out a basket of homemade chips and soup which was oily. Both me and my wife ordered carne asada. I was very pleased that the steak was top grade arrachera. Too bad they don't bother to season it. I tried to add some flavor with the salsa but that too had no flavor. The rice AND the beans were also flavorless. The beans actually tasted like it came from a can. I'll GLADLY pay $15, hell even $20 for good food but this, never again. I've been to many Mexican restaurants owned by Mexicans and it surprises me how many of them take short cuts. This place could benefit with putting some salt and lime on their steak, a little salt or chicken stock in their rice and refrying their own beans with chicharron, onion or both. Also they should get creative with the salsa. Put some cilantro, chiles de arbol, something to give it character and to appease latinos and people who love authentic Mexican food too. Just don't cater to gringos!

8.description: On August 14th I order from here again. Delivery is still slow and takes well over an hour.  I ordered the Carne Asada Dinner and some nachos.The carne was like chewing on a piece of shoe leather. $31.09 down the drain. I ended up having to order from another place as the nachos were the only thing that was ok... and I say ok, because the little square of cheese they put on wasn't even melted.

0.description: Best service and authentic Mexican food. Tina, Blanca and the others are terrific and always very friendly and professional. This has been ours and our family's go to for over 25years! Awesome!

38.description: We came here at least once a week when I was a kid, and I remember it was the highlight of my week! It has been my favorite restaurant for 20 years.The food is cheap, fresh, and delicious. The family that owns the restaurant is very warm and friendly. I'm a little sad that the decor has changed (they had a fire, so gone is the old jukebox and velvet paintings).  I recommend their enchiladas potosinas, chilaquiles, and pepper steak.I had breakfast here on Paczki Day, before braving the line at the Brigeport Bakery.  The portion was HUGE, and fortified me well for the two-hour wait ahead...

20.description: We ordered Horchata and it was the worse horchata I ever had stay away from their horchata.....

19.description: This was one of the better stake house I have visited lately.  I wish more Chicago restaurants would follow the standards that they apply here. I had the steak here and it was perfectly seasoned and very well cooked. The ambiance was very connected to menu. I would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

33.description: This is a reasonable, if uninspiring, place to grab a bite to eat.Having checked it out once, I don't know if I'll bother making a return trip.  As noted, there are much better places to grab Mexican food in Chicago.  Sorry, Mexico Steak House, I wanted to like you a whole lot more than I do.

2.description: My bf has literally been coming here all his life for Mexican food, and he quickly turned me onto this amazing place! The owners know him by name, every time we order take out or come to dine in, we are always greeted with a smile and kind words. When you dine in, you get free soup, salsa, and chips, and the soup is THE BEST SOUP EVER. I'm not even exaggerating. It's like this delicious veggie filled vat of goodness and omg when we order take out we usually need a quart of the soup!!!Their steak is amazing, but I love veggie Mexican dishes, and they make me the best veggie quesadillas I've had. Avacado tacos are also to die for. Hidden gem that makes everything taste even 10x better: the Ranchero sauce. It's a warm, salsa-like sauce that you can dip chips into or spread over your tacos or meal. So flavorful and delicious. This is our favorite Mexican spot in the neighborhood, well worth every penny!!!!! So yummy!!!

34.description: Mediocre by Chicago standards, but Chicago standards for Mexican food are really high.The only real standout item is the carne asada.

32.description: I really wanted to like this place because it is so close to my house and gym.  However, I didn't think it was that good at all. The worst part is the price.  I'm glad I only got two tacos because if I got a plate, the meal would have been over $25 easily.  The service is wonderful and so is the salsa.  However, as I opened the menu, I was trying to think of ways to split a plate and still be full. The prices are high in comparison to other places.  We both ordered 2 tacos.  I was expecting a taste of this amazing steak, but it really was...meh.  I'm not in a  hurry to go back.

18.description: Hands down the best skirt steak I've had in a long time not to be overshadowed by the tasty soup you get after you sir down.

41.description: Mexico Steakhouse is a great place to enjoy decently authentic mexican food. One of my favorites is the Menudo (but I'm pretty adventurous). The carne asada is very good here as well, but I do prefer Panchos Pistolas' a little bit more.But you can't beat the family atmosphere at Mexico Steakhouse. It's nice and quiet and caters mostly to the neighborhood. Although totally random, they also serve "alphabet soup". I wouldn't say it's the most gourmet thing they could do, but it brings you back to childhood.It also is good for friends who are not big on Mexican (i.e. burgers, salads, pastas) or thinks that Pepes is quality mexican food (i.e. they'll fry the soft shell tortillas to make hard shells).

13.description: This place is as good a mexican restaurant can get. Their Pozole, Fajitas De Pollo and Avocado Tacos are my favorite. Their Fried Ice Cream is also very good.I'm generally a very demanding and fastidious person. Nevertheless, this place continues to impress me.The service is very good too. The people who run this place (Tina, and the others!) are very welcoming, courteous and nice.All in all, if you're in Chicago and looking for a good Mexican restaurant, this is a MUST-GO!

4.description: Love this place!!  Had my husband's surprise birthday party here and it was the best!  The staff was wonderful - they even helped my daughter decorate for the big event!  Everything about this place is great.  BYOB if you want a drink with the great food!

24.description: We've eaten here quite a bit.  The complimentary soup is really good and the steak is cooked right and priced reasonably!   The place seems to always be crowded, which is a good thing.  My young kids love this place.  The best part is it's a couple blocks away.  Can't beat that.
