6.description: Sorry, but don't think I would return. Service was nice and friendly, but the food wasn't that great. They give you chips and salsa and a little bowl of soup. I had the chicken tostados and thought the chicken was a bit dry and not much flavor. The salsa didn't really add much to help it.They are a smidge more expensive than some places. I don't mind paying if it was good, but it just wasn't.

22.description: Sorry, but don't think I would return. Service was nice and friendly, but the food wasn't that great. They give you chips and salsa and a little bowl of soup. I had the chicken tostados and thought the chicken was a bit dry and not much flavor. The salsa didn't really add much to help it.They are a smidge more expensive than some places. I don't mind paying if it was good, but it just wasn't.

15.description: From the name to the outside appearance, this place looks questionable...but it's really good. Just a tiny diner style restaurant with cooks that know Mexican food. Our waitress was super nice too. Ordered the skirt steak tacos and they were awesome.

40.description: Great food! I typically go here when I want a relaxed/low key dinner! The menu has a nice selection (although the avocado tacos are my favorite) and you get a yummy cup of soup with every meal. They also have a really good iced tea that they serve with a slice of lime. Street parking is usually available on Archer and seating has always been readily available when I go in for dinner. One downside - they have no liquor license (or at least they didn't the last time I checked) so do not go in with the expectation of having a margarita. Despite this - this an awesome place for an affordable and tasty meal!

7.description: I have been coming here for YEARS!!  YEARS!!  Now they have some "art" hanging from their walls.  Well I came here this past weekend and this "art" is hanging so low that my daughter got up from her chair and a piece of their "art" fell off of the wall and hit her head and back and fell to the ground.  THEY MADE ME PAY FOR IT!  They did not ask if my daughter was OK or anything - they just came to me and said I had to pay for their "art" that fell on the floor and broke.  THIS IS A RESTAURANT NOT AN ART GALLERY!!  I am contacting the BBB and an attorney as well.  THIS IS CRAZY!!!

36.description: Good food, GREAT service and overall a wonderful, casual place.

30.description: I stopped in here really quickly today after a really insanely long walk. I was super thirsty and needed an orchata(sp?) to quench that thirst. I also grabbed a steak taco, just to try a menu item. I gotta say, next time I am going to ask the waitress to not throw an extra dash of cinnamon to my orchata (I wish yelp had spell check for more food related words, even the non English ones.) because it was just way too much cinnamon. It was still tasty enough to drink and still refreshing, but it tasted more of cinnamon than anything else. My steak taco that i grabbed to go? Really tasty. Not hard or chewy like some places make them. I would come back seeing as its so close. I just wish that they hadn't put so much cinnamon on my beverage, and the prices weren't so high...It wasn't insane, and probably fair seeing as the steak seemed much higher quality than other places,..just not what one expects to pay for a taco, yanno?

3.description: This place is a-maz-ing! The food is so flavorful, with subtle Mexican influences in everything from the entrees to the atmosphere.  I ordered the seasonal fish, and my boyfriend ordered the braised short ribs.  Add the margaritas and chips/guacamole...heaven!  Easily one of the best meals we've ever had, and will be on the list next time we visit Chicago!  You won't be disappointed, I promise.

14.description: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but the food at Mexico Steakhouse isn't bad.

1.description: These guys advertise manicures but don't do them. False advertising to lure in customers drives me nuts!

0.description: A very clean and secured place and both lady's are very well trained in this field of massage except no table shower

58.description: For me to go out of my way (I live in Portage Park) for a salon experience is BIG! But Modern Wave is a rare, warm & welcoming (no snooty attitudes) environment to get ala carte services (recession busting plans) or spend the whole day getting beautified and rejuvenated (great for madhousewives, brides to stressed out men:) inside and out! Laura Duarte gave me the most incredible "Extreme" facial w/area message, for over an hour...it put me in another world. She also put me at great ease and humor w/my first Brazilian wax! The sweet and charming Mayra did my very thorough pedicure with gentle and soothing care...my feet & polish still looks fresh a week later . Ted, "the man of the house"  and a true gentleman, is a master colorist (does correction) and knows how to maximize your style with an expertise cut...so that's why everyday folks like me to models, will go out of their neighborhood, for Ted's Modern Wave Experience.!

56.description: Awesome service. Didn't have an appointment, but Alex took care of me. Real nice and friendly. Seemed sincere with his conversation. Everyone was friendly. Gives change in good bills for tipping.

29.description: Just went in on a whim because I was in dire need of a cut and color and didn't want to trek to the North Side. I was very happy to get a same day appointment with a time that was convenient for me after work.  Nat was my stylist and I couldn't have been happier. She really took her time to give me all of my options and talk me through the way certain colors would compliment my skin tone. I liked her honest approach to the things I needed to make sure my hair left looking glossy, polished and under control. I have ridiculously long hair, ok, not like Crystal Gayle long hair, but it's definitely long, so my process was pretty lengthy, she assured me that my next time around wouldn't take as long and I believe her because she's pretty quick withe product applications etc. I never felt rushed or a bother, even when I asked her to add some more layers for definition, we were WAY past closing time and I just wanted some more ooph, she happily obliged and I really love the result. I've received many compliments today and it's all to say I am thankful that I stepped out of my comfort zone and took a chance on a new place. Definitely ask for Nat she's a stylist that really cares! P.S. Tips are cash only! But they do accept cards for the services.

42.description: Wonderful!! Kelly gave me an amazing cut & color. Very happy with my hair!

23.description: Ashley did an amazing job on my foil!  I would definitely recommend her to anyone!! She did highlights and lowlights for me and I am very happy with how it looks. She is extremely nice and very concerned about giving you exactly what you want.

47.description: I had been coming here years ago, even though i didn't live in Bridgeport.  I was always happy with the haircuts.  About three years ago, after moving into the neighborhood, I came in, and on the owner's recommendation, I decided to get my hair colored.  He wanted to try a color that would not clash with my face color (???) and I told him to do whatever he wanted...AS LONG AS I DIDN'T HAVE TO COME IN EVERY 2 WEEKS TO TOUCH UP THE ROOTS.  I worked, had two young kids at home, a husband working the afternoon shift and I didn't have time to come in that often...at the time, getting into the salon every 6 months was a treat!  Well, he did his magic and my hair looked BEAUTIFUL!!!  The style, the color was great, although it seemed really light.  I was only used to getting subtle highlights prior to this.  He assured me I would be able to go a couple of months before having to get a touch up.  The cost was pricey because it included a cut, de-color (?), and color.  I came home and my husband almost jumped me when I walked in.  He loved it!  Well, 2 weeks go by and I start to see these really dark roots coming out.  After the third week, I couldn't stand it anymore, went to the drugstore, got an over the counter hair coloring kit, and dyed my hair back to my natural color.  Don't get me wrong, if I had the time (like I do now) I would have kept up the look.  But because I didn't and I specified I didn't, I was angry and didn't come back for about 3 years.  I found a new place on North Ave. that was awesome, but a trek for me, especially if there was traffic.  I tried to get a last minute appt. there one day and couldn't get in and so I decided to try Modern Wave again.  I am glad I did.  I left happy, came back again, and let Ted work his magic AGAIN.  I explained the past situation to him and he found a color for me (that also covered the grey) and now I'm coming in on a regular basis.  Everyone is really nice, the conversation is nice, and it is so close to home!

8.description: Can't say enough great things about this place and most importantly, Natalie!!! I am quite implusive and of course woke up thinking I MUST chop off all of my hair!!! It was a Saturday morning and my stylist for years just recently moved to Texas. I of course went straight to Yelp! I called based on all the great review! I called in and much to my surprise, I was able to get an appointment that same day!!!I arrived just on time to sign in and Natalie was already waiting for me! She studied my hair and asked about my hair routine and immediately suggested I switch products due to state of my hair. She mentioned she would use the suggested products so I could see the difference once all was said and done. I told her I wanted to get a bob, but that she could do as she saw fit! She was amazing at just about everything!!! I absolutely LOVE my haircut!!! This is hard for me to say since I have very VERY curly hair that frizzes once it is dry. She did wonders! I will definitely be back and I am sooooo glad its in the neighborhood! Don't hesitate to walk in and come out absolutely glamorous!

31.description: Nat gave me a wonderful new haircut and style! I showed her a few pics of what i had in mind and she was very honest and helpful in explaining how she was going to adjust the style to my face and hair type. She is attentive and wonderful!! I recommend Nat for anyone looking for a wonderful and relaxing experience at Modern Wave!

34.description: After years of cutting my own hair (and poorly), I caved and scheduled an appointment at another hair salon. The entire experience was awful, and I didn't even get my hair cut, so I knew I needed to go to a reputable place. I scoured yelp and found Modern Wave, read the reviews, and immediately scheduled my appointment with Alex.There was no wait time (the other experience was half an hour), and I was greeted very warmly. He took my coat, and talked with me about my options, and how I wanted things done. After getting a great shampoo, conditioning, and head massage, he did his magic. He showed me how my hair works, areas where my hair wouldn't match the picture I showed him, and walked me through the entire process.The cut is fantastic, the process was amazing and quick (and painless), and I'll definitely be scheduling my next haircut here in a couple months.Thanks again for a great experience, Alex!

16.description: Went in for a routine cut (after a bad dye job at another salon) and came out with a new color and style. Ted specializes in color fixes and will give you the best advice/service regarding what hair color works for you and how to transform the look and (if needed) the health of your hair!The stylists at Modern Wave stay up to date by experimenting (on themselves and props) and learning new techniques. They truly keep up with a constantly changing market and products. They are passionate stylists who are also very good conversationalist, friendly, and pleasant to be around! Also, as a first time client, you do receive some really great coupons and rewards for any future referrals!UPDATE, 1/21/15This place is definitely a gem, but after some more thought, here was the only con of my experience: If you're easily talked into things and on a budget, I would suggest to either be prepared to be strong with the sales pitches or just not go here. I did end up spending 2Xs what I'd planned. Don't get me wrong: the prices are definitely worth the value, if not a steal for the expertise that is offered--Just FYI for those of you (like me) who need to be a little wiser with finances and not make decisions on the fly.

13.description: There are a couple of things I look for in a hairdresser, and Natalie not only met, but exceeded my requirements.  Before going near the chair she just sat and talked to me about what my hair routine was and what look I was going for (and how I could join the two).  I'm a wash and go kind of girl, so I wanted a cut that would give me reasonable volume without me having to fuss with it too much and bangs that would frame my face naturally.  She gave me a couple of ideas before we decided on a cut and also made sure to check in with me when she was cutting my bangs to make sure that she didn't cut them too short.  On top of all that, she gave me quick and simple tips for how to get the style that I want on special occasions-I was so impressed that I booked my appointment for next month right away.  Definitely check it out!

11.description: I LOVE Modern Wave. I am a very unique person when it comes to my hair and have very vague ways of explaining what i want and how I want it to look (Basically I am unhelpful) However, Ashley nails it every time. I can not say one bad word. You walk in and everyone is super friendly. Even if your not their customer everyone there shows interest and is just super nice. I always get a big hug from Ashley when I come in and it feels like going to a friends house but getting an awesome service. They also have a deal or offer every time I go in, and as a saver this is really helpful. The salon is clean and the products they use are excellent. Definitely check them out!

39.description: I went here to get a haircut from Alex after a recommendation from my girlfriend. He was very friendly and attentive, making sure that I liked where the haircut was going at all times. He even gave me cards to give my friends as discount for a haircut. The place itself was clean, and I couldn't find anything to complain about. Overall my experience with him was wonderful and I'd recommend anyone to get an appointment with Alex at Modern Wave salon.

37.description: This place was great. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. I had Nelly work on my hair and she was great. The owner came and helped texture my hair. At first I was sad that it was too short, but I grew into it in 2 weeks. They take their work very seriously and want you to look good. Also I've noticed that a lot of salons are closed during the week or have very weird hours. This is a reliable place if you don't want to make an appointment or have had it with your hair.

0.description: Great hidden gem on Cermak Road. I had my appointment with Natalie and she was awesome! She had a lot of good advice. She worked with me to determine a good short hairstyle for my curly hair.I will be returning!

38.description: I went in for a hair cut with Ted and was talked into a color which my hair did need.  I told him that I wanted it light so that when my grey hair comes in it would not be so noticeable.  I had several people working and helping with my hair that day and they also did a de-color on me.  I have a lot of hair and know that it does take time but didn't expect 5 1/2 hour, if I was prepared for it, it would have been so bad but my whole day was shot.  The color turned out very nice but it is a lot darker than I thought it would be, especially have to go through a de-coloring which made my hair even more dry.  Will be interested to see what happens when my grey starts coming in.  The people at Modern waves are very very nice and helpful and was very happy but a little disappointed that it was not lighter.

51.description: Ted is the best! I was bored on a Saturday afternoon, it was gorgeous outside, and I have been contemplating chopping my hair off. This was a major decision for me because my hair was super long. Ted definitely has an eye for shape, form, and texture. While I showed him a pic of what I was going for, he told me to trust him and did something a little different. I wanted to cry at first because I thought he was done when he wasn't! ( I looked like a mushroom cap ) But once he blew out and styled, it was AMAZING. Ted is a genious. I highly recommend him to all you Yelpers having a hard time deciding where to go to get your next doo.Yelp def helped me out on this one. 5 stars well deserved.

27.description: I like to support our local neighborhood businesses.Its what we should do to keep our community thriving.I love coming to Modern Wave Salon, because they treat you like family.I came last December for a loose spiral perm. Ted has been doing perms for a long time and knew exactly how to perm my hair.The perm lasted for almost a year!I'm back  to Modern Wace again today to have another perm done. I wouldn't trust anyone else to do a perm to my hair.I have had highlights and also a few hair cuts here a MW as well.I love it here, you will too!

32.description: Nat is the best stylist at Modern Wave! She takes the time to really spend quality time with her clients. She has never steered me in the wrong direction. Go see Nat!

54.description: The lady that did my facial was ok.Pros: My face feels and looks great.They were accommadating. My appt was at 8pm. They close at 7pm. They stayed open. That was great.Cons: She had bad breath. So, when she would speak to me (while I'm laying on the bed receiving my facial, I wanted to gag).It was so cold in the room.The lady seemed desperate (offering her other services, once every 5 minutes, it seemed).

48.description: I love Modern Wave!  They are always so nice there and not an overly talkative nosy salon.  I have had a few of their stylists including Ted (who I believe is the owner) do my hair and I have never had a bad cut and color.  I am so happy I found them and will continue to go back over and over :)

44.description: I have been a happy customer of Modern Wave for at least 18 years. Alex usually cuts my hair, but Ted is also a master and I've always gotten a good cut that works well with my hair type and is easy to care for.Although reasonably priced, my budget is limited so I can't go as often as I would like or try other services. ...someday.The salon is always clean and the staff friendly and helpful.

24.description: The reviews for this place had me walking in with high hopes of a good experience. Unfortunately, I can't say that my actual experience matched what I hoped for. Maybe I hit Modern Wave on an off day.I showed up about 10 minutes before my appointment but ended up waiting until almost 45 minutes past my appointed time. They knew that I was a new client, but during my wait time, no one introduced themselves; no one told me who my stylist would be. They assured me that someone would be with me soon, but I felt lost as to who that would be. There was no explanation on the delay. Also, while I'm sure assigning different people to different roles can help with efficiency, I felt like it made for an impersonal experience. One person washed my hair; another cut my hair; another straightened my hair. When my stylist passed me off to the straightener, she said she would be back after my hair was done; never came back, so I had no clue what to do next. My overall experience just felt...I'm not sure how to say it...discombobulated, I guess. It really wasn't terrible, but I didn't feel like a lot of time or energy was spent trying to figure out what I wanted from my haircut. I had hoped this place would work out because it's a little closer to my home than my previous salon, but I think I'll be making the extra drive for a more personal experience.

7.description: This place feels like home! First off, I've been part of this family of great stylists for YEARS. The services they provide accommodate my busy schedule, as well as my budget. Aside of all this, Esmeralda (my hairstylists) impresses me all the time. She is very professional and takes her job to a whole new level, I am a very picky girl when it comes to trimming my hair but this gal knows her stuff! I've never felt unsatisfied with her work. Esmeralda will make you look like the Queen of the Ball. Her experience has placed her in my book as one of the best, and this is proven by all the training and certifications she has accomplished over the years. There is no way I would go with anyone else, she's on point with all the hot trends and best of all answers any and all questions you might have at the end of your experience.I love being able to unwind and have some "me" time with this hard working crew.  Diana

49.description: My boyfriend's family has been coming to the salon for years so I decided to get my haircut by Alex. He really took his time and gave me a great cut that I love.  I scheduled my next haircut before leaving!

40.description: This will be my fourth time coming to Modern Wave. Times before I just got my hair cut from Esmeralda and I loved it each time. This time i was going for a dye, and I have never dyed my hair before so this was a big deal. Ive heard that TED was the man I needed to see. Im glad I did. I was unsure of what I wanted and he talked me through it and the end results was more then I expected! I LOVE IT! I was there so a while but my hair is so dark he wanted the color to stay in just a little longer. I recommend everyone to go here! Everyone is nice and they are willing to help. I had more then two people tend to me and I loved that. Also everyone was excited as I was to see the end product. Great service, great product, good conversations,and beautiful results! what more can you ask for?

53.description: A great haircut by Alex once again!Hadn't gotten a haircut for more than 4-5 months and finally decided it was time to get a new do when my hair remained flatter than flat no matter what I did to it! Yes, I'm a lazy bum and major procrastinator, but that's why I need a great stylist to give me a boost when I need it! I had a great cut the last time from Alex, so of course I had to go back. I know they're normally quite busy on Friday and Saturdays, so i picked an off peak time in the middle of the week and was relieved that there was no wait. Staff was great. Got my hair washed right away and the girl who was doing it was very friendly.I tried to describe the style I wanted and Alex got it pronto. As always, we had some fun chatter while he snipped snipped away. It's been a while since I've had short hair, and I was a bit nervous as to how it would come out after I've been used to shoulder length hair . But my goodness! The stacked-bob as he called it, came out wonderfully! He took his time and cut it perfectly to the length I specified and even went through how I should maintain it even before i opened my mouth to ask him. The new haircut makes me feel younger and more energetic if you can believe it. My family loved it and I've been receiving compliments from men and women alike at work.     I've been to a number of different salons in the past few years, but always tend to venture back to Modern Wave (a few times to fix some awful cut from another place!). So I'd highly recommend this place if you like a casual atmosphere with the feel of a neighborhood salon. They are clean, people are friendly and the price is right with a woman's cut starting at around $40.

30.description: Ted was wonderful! Truly took an interest in my hair and was excited to get it looking healthier. Educated me on how to care for my hair without being pushy or lecturing. I got a great haircut and scheduled my appointment for color before I left. I'm really looking forward to it! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the wait. It was worth it though.

46.description: Everyone was right about this place...the owner Ted cut my hair and spent a good 45 min on it. I was impressed and will make a point to come back.

1.description: I am reluctant to tell all of Yelp how great Modern Wave is as would rather keep them my secret so I can make appointments with my gals, but that are so good that everyone should have the chance to feel as awesome as I do. Ashley is AMAZING!  I trust her to tell me if what I want isn't going to work well with my hair or complexion. I trust her suggestions for color and cut. I won't go to anyone else again. Natalie is so GREAT! She has me covered with my eyebrows and completely know how to do a natural looking brow (I am not into skinny brows personally). I have sent several friends here and everyone is so happy with every experience. Xoxox! Love you, Ashley and Natalie!

55.description: I wanted to add my hair-correcting experience:...after having what felt like a extra 5-alarm fire on my head at ANOTHER SALON nearby, I was skeptical that Ted (or anyone else for that matter) would be able to do anything with my super black dyed hair.I went in for a consultation and was reassured that there was indeed hope for me! I basically wanted the black color removed from my hair. In addition to that, I wanted another color PLUS highlights.I came in on a Saturday morning, and 7 hours (and over 7 color removing treatments) later...I was freed from that black hair color! If 7 treatments seems excessive, trust me it's not. I had been dying my hair black for years and yearsI had experienced NO BURNING WHATSOEVER, was never uncomfortable. They were all very accommodating, even offering to grab some lunch for me seeing as how I was there that long!I walked out with a beautiful medium golden brown color, with caramel highlights. Ted knows what he is doing. He truly is a color specialist/master. Don't hesitate. I would definitely go back to Ted again.

9.description: Great place to go. Came in for an updo and makeup, Natalie & Ashley did a great job. I asked if I could bring my (mild, quiet) 3 year old and they said sure. I brought he snacks and her tablet and she was perfect and I got all fixed up! Everyone was so sweet to her and to me. Will definitely be back.

26.description: .. ... I've been seeing Natalie for my hair since she was at Paul Mitchell, and followed her to Modern Wave. I love what she has done with my hair, cut's, color and even straightening. My hair isn't the easiest to work with, but she's always made me feel comfortable and has always given me a honest opinion. I appreciate that, and plan on her being my hair stylist for a long time. Thank You! :)

25.description: Love Natalie from Modern Wave. After seeing some of her cuts/styles and colors decided to go see her. After showing her some styles I wanted. She explained what would fit me best and even showed me some tricks when fixing it's Best decision ever!

12.description: I've been coming in for years to get my hair cut with Ted. Love him and all his staff. Everyone is always polite and so joyous. Ted has a lot of knowledge and is always happy to share hair tips with us.

59.description: I've been getting my hair done by Esmeralda for yrs. now And let me tell you. This woman knows hair. I've had long hair forever and she finally convinced me to chop my hair off and I get compliments everyday by men and woman.She also does a great job with color and the overall service is outstanding I couldn't ask for better place to get my hair done and would never go anywhere else bottom line if you wanna walk out of a salon feeling like a million bucks definitely check this place out!!!!

21.description: Rosa at Modern Wave is the best for any kind of waxing. She's a wonderful and kind person who cares about each and every one of her clients.   She is well loved by her clients.   She has been around in the Bridgeport community for years.  I wouldn't go to anyone but Rosa!!!!

17.description: I visited modern wave for the first time yesterday, I was in desperate need of a haircut! I had a great experience. All of the staff are very nice and friendly. They have a nice assortment of products and deals but are not pushy about selling them. Natalie was my stylist and she gave me a great haircut! We had a brief consultation beforehand so she could understand my hair type and what I was looking for. She gave honest advice that I appreciated and gave me some tips for how to achieve my desired look at home.  My cut was great when we were all done; exactly what I was looking for! Went to dinner afterwards and was complimented twice on my pretty hair from complete strangers. I'll definitely be back! Thanks Natalie, Ted and Tatiana!

10.description: So happy I finally decided to give this place a try after following them in Facebook and going by on runs in the neighborhood. Natalie did a really nice job asking about my hair routine, what I wanted done, and also gave me suggestions with styling and products. This place will definitely become my go to!

5.description: I try to make it in every two weeks or so to get serviced by Alex, the men's haircut expert. I started coming to Modern Wave after I asked a friend about who cuts his hair because it looked great. He referred me to Alex who promptly set me up with an appointment with very short notice.When coming for my appointment, all I said was, "Make me look good." And he immediately knew what would work for me.Now, after being traumatized after years of horrible haircuts as a child, I was nervous to have anyone touch my hair.The final product was amazing. AMAZING. I looked like a new person. I finally found a barber who knew how to cut my hair.Every time I go in, I don't think the haircut could get any more perfect. It does, my hair looks better and better each time. Highly recommended.TL;DR: Very flexible, hospitable, clean environment, great haircuts. Just go, trust me.

3.description: What is not to love about Modern Wave Salon! Everyone is friendly and it is extremely affordable. Ted is fantastic! I love being able to trust a stylist and know I will look great when I leave. They also recommend products, which I appreciate as I am extremely terrible with picking products that are good for my hair.

35.description: Ever since I can decide for myself (as opposed to my mom's choosing when I was small), I've had the same haircut, shoulder-length and layered, no frills. No work required daily. My hair is coarse and thick.  I've been to many different stylists so I know what to expect as they all turn out the same.  Well, there's something magical that Esmeralda does because with the same request my haircut comes out looking so much better!  My hair no longer flips out in the wrong way which I've accepted all the years before.  The layering is so nice that it keeps it's shape for months after.  Esmeralda is very detailed oriented and a perfectionist.  She really takes pride in her work and is a very nice person.

19.description: Ashley did an amazing job on my foil!  I would definitely recommend her to anyone!! She did highlights and lowlights for me and I am very happy with how it looks. She is extremely nice and very concerned about giving you exactly what you want.

28.description: Went in for a routine cut (after a bad dye job at another salon) and came out with a new color and style. Ted specializes in color fixes and will give you the best advice/service regarding what hair color works for you and how to transform the look and (if needed) the health of your hair!The stylists at Modern Wave stay up to date by experimenting (on themselves and props) and learning new techniques. They truly keep up with a constantly changing market and products. They are passionate stylists who are also very good conversationalist, friendly, and pleasant to be around! Also, as a first time client, you do receive some really great coupons and rewards for any future referrals!UPDATE, 1/21/15This place is definitely a gem, but after some more thought, here was the only con of my experience: If you're easily talked into things and on a budget, I would suggest to either be prepared to be strong with the sales pitches or just not go here. I did end up spending 2Xs what I'd planned. Don't get me wrong: the prices are definitely worth the value, if not a steal for the expertise that is offered--Just FYI for those of you (like me) who need to be a little wiser with finances and not make decisions on the fly.

45.description: I got a bad haircut a month ago and went to Alex to get it fixed. I am not hair literate at all, but Alex was very patient when I explained what I thought was wrong with my hair. He explained what he was doing each step of the way and gave me useful tips on what I could do to style my hair the way I wanted. I love my new haircut and will definitely return to Modern Wave for my next one!

33.description: After years of getting my hair done in Lincoln Park, I decided to give this Salon a try when I moved to the area.  Ted really fixed the entire situation I had going on!  I have never had someone take my entire look so seriously.  He recommended that I go much lighter and took me a little shorter than I had in mind, but turns out, he knew what he was doing 100%!  I could not be happier with the results!The salon is great for total transformations, like mine, but it is also a bustling Bridgeport salon with regulars of all ages coming in and out all day long.  Clients there Saturday ranged from ten years old to 96 years old!  Many male clients coming in and out as well.  If you are looking for a salon with really thoughtful stylists who care about your personal image, this is a great one.  Pricing is reasonable, too.  Highly recommend this place!

43.description: Once again, I walked out of the Modern Wave salon with what I call fabulous "Hair by Gilbert."  Gilbert has moved to Modern Wave from a salon in the Loop and I would seriously follow him anywhere in Chicago.  The salon is a great neighborhood spot where you feel welcome.  And Gilbert is beyond words wonderful.  He has taken me from an uber-short brunette cut to Ellen Barkin blonde and I look and feel incredible.  My cut lets me go no-maintenance for days and the color stays and stays.  He's there Wednesday through Sunday.  I can't believe how lucky I have been to have him color, cut and style my hair for the past two years.  It's like finding a high-end NYC stylist in Bridgeport!!!!!

2.description: I absolutely LOVE Modern Wave Salon!It's a struggle to tame this mane, & I have travelled all around the city just trying to find a cut that didn't completely destroy my 'do. North & south, east & west, I have had questionable cuts & was met with loads of inconvenience.Enter Modern Wave. I had passed by this green-awning storefront time & again... not much to look at from the outside. In a moment of I-haven't-cut-my-hair-in-six-months-help-me desperation, I called Modern Wave on a whim (with thanks to my fellow Yelpers for their reviews.) Modern Wave is located easily just steps from the Halsted bus, the Orange Line, & just blocks from my place. Lo! I was granted a perfect after-work appointment with a fabulously friendly & knowledgeable stylist.I was nervous trying to communicate my haircut desires, so I came armed with a photo of myself from better hair days, & my stylist patiently listened to my concerns. She assured me she'd cut my hair exactly as she saw it in the photo, & even went light on the length, so I didn't feel like too much was removed.She then finished off my perfect cut with a sleek style & gloss. My hair had never looked better.I appreciate that Modern Wave confirms your appointment a day before via text message... no phone call to miss, no interruptions. I've continued to go back to the same stylist at Modern Wave, & I wish I could hire her to do my hair every day! I always walk out of Modern Wave feeling like a million bucks (without even coming close to putting a dent in my purse).

18.description: I like to support our local neighborhood businesses.Its what we should do to keep our community thriving.I love coming to Modern Wave Salon, because they treat you like family.I came last December for a loose spiral perm. Ted has been doing perms for a long time and knew exactly how to perm my hair.The perm lasted for almost a year!I'm back  to Modern Wace again today to have another perm done. I wouldn't trust anyone else to do a perm to my hair.I have had highlights and also a few hair cuts here a MW as well.I love it here, you will too!

41.description: I love this Salon! Everyone is super sweet and personable!  Tea and refreshments during your service! Mani/Pedi downstairs by Nina she's awesome, Gilbert Valdez is an AMAzing stylist, pays attention to detail and is the best with scissors in the city!

52.description: I've been going here for almost a year to get my bikini area waxed and I love this salon, but I feel I need to make this public service announcement.  It's killing me to write this review, so that's why I can't bring myself to leave only 1 star.  Recently I became aware of the dangers of "double-dipping" - where the wooden stick used to apply wax to your skin is dipped back into the wax pot which spreads diseases such as HPV and Herpes.  The woman who waxes me at Modern Wave Salon double-dips.  I am horrified and disgusted and simply cannot go back.  Please be aware of that if you go here.

50.description: I decided I wanted to add a wave to my hair.  I found Modern Wave through Groupon.  The owner Ted was the one who worked on my hair.  The result was great, but the experience was even better.  A wave can take a long time, but they moved me swiftly through the process.  Everyone was friendly.  I will go back again.

4.description: This is my second time coming back to get a haircut. I really enjoy it first time now I am in love with this place. The price are reasonable, I myself don't care about the price. What's matter is the service are fantastic..I have Natalie Balestri as my stylist. She is the greatest..give good comments and advices about my hair plus she's funny. I love her and the salon. I book for hair color treatment. If you are reading my comment book or go to this salon!

6.description: The reviews for this place had me walking in with high hopes of a good experience. Unfortunately, I can't say that my actual experience matched what I hoped for. Maybe I hit Modern Wave on an off day.I showed up about 10 minutes before my appointment but ended up waiting until almost 45 minutes past my appointed time. They knew that I was a new client, but during my wait time, no one introduced themselves; no one told me who my stylist would be. They assured me that someone would be with me soon, but I felt lost as to who that would be. There was no explanation on the delay. Also, while I'm sure assigning different people to different roles can help with efficiency, I felt like it made for an impersonal experience. One person washed my hair; another cut my hair; another straightened my hair. When my stylist passed me off to the straightener, she said she would be back after my hair was done; never came back, so I had no clue what to do next. My overall experience just felt...I'm not sure how to say it...discombobulated, I guess. It really wasn't terrible, but I didn't feel like a lot of time or energy was spent trying to figure out what I wanted from my haircut. I had hoped this place would work out because it's a little closer to my home than my previous salon, but I think I'll be making the extra drive for a more personal experience.

22.description: The only place I'll trust with my hair now. I saw Ashley for the second time this past Saturday and she genuinely cares about the health of my hair. The first time I saw her, we discussed growing my hair out and I bought a few products. I'm usually very skeptical when it comes to people trying to sell me things, but my hair has honestly never felt better. It's even growing faster! I used to tie my hair up all day because I was embarrassed by the dryness, but now it's very manageable. I will be a long time client!

15.description: I have been going to Modern Wave for years. It's a great salon with a friendly, professional and talented staff.  They are very accommodating and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Esmirelda is my stylist and she is the BEST!!  She is an awesome colorist. My color and highlights always look so natural. I have very fine, thin hair. Esmirelda knows exactly how to cut and color my hair to make it thicker and fuller!  I trust her completely!  I highly recommend this salon and particularly Esmirelda.  You will not be disappointed!

57.description: Wonderful experience!!  Best waxing ever- it looked great even right after.  Hardly hurt at all.

20.description: This was an impulse visit. Came in for a standard hair cut. This was my first time here. Natalie was fantastic. She let me ramble on about what I had in mind for my hair, and worked exactly around what I'd asked.  Great conversationalist too. Enjoyed the friendly atmosphere. I even committed to my next appointment (very uncharacteristic of me). Absolutely love my new haircut!

36.description: Received a wonderful color touch up and diamond oil hair treatment (my hair was as smooth as silk)!! My stylist Natalie was very professional and knowledgable.  The salon has a very warm and friendly feeling to it and I had a wonderful experience there.  I ended up taking my children back there for their haircuts with Natalie also.

14.description: Coming back here to do my prom hair and make up was an excellent idea. Ashley and Natalie were very nice and accommodating. Ashely searched for a hairstyle suitable for me just like she told me she would and it turned out amazing! I got so many compliments from my friends. My friend even told me my make up was better than hers and she got hers done from Mac. The service here is exceptional and their work is always a piece of art. I got my nails done this time as well and the person who did my nails was very friendly and created nice conversation. I can't wait to come back here again. Ashley and Natalie made me a goodie bag full of hair products and they're just amazing people. Since it was on a Saturday, they had a prom special: hair + make up + nails = $100 which is pretty cheap. They do an amazing job and they're very friendly and the service is incredible.

3.description: Cabana tan is my go to tanning place..CleanGreat bedsThey dont push product or promotions on youFriendly and most all i get a GREAT TAN!! WOOT WOOT

1.description: It's the cleanest best tanning salon in the city. They always give the greatest advice and don't try to sell you packages you don't need. I always look like I just came back from a vacation people say.

2.description: Well, what bad is there? You come here to tan and that's exactly what you get. A tan. The girls who work here are wonderful and truly give their honest opinion of how the new lotions are and which bed they think is better than another.  But let's be serious, all the beds are phenomenal. The prices are great and their packages are even better. Even if I haven't been there in months I'm still treated as if I am one of their most frequent customers. A huge thing for me is customer service and they hit the nail on the head with it. You won't be disappointed!

0.description: Cabana Tan helped me go from hella pale to hella bronze!! So maybe I'm bias because I live nearby but this is the best tanning salon I've seen in the city. As every savvy shopper would do, my tanning search started with Groupon and the likes thereof. There were some good deals but many with no parking. You native Chicagoans are all about public transit, this SoCal Gal is not. Besides, taking the bus to tan for 10 minutes or so is silly. The best part about this place is the staff. They don't treat you like you're buying a used car and try to up-sell you lotions or higher priced packages and actually take the time to ask you about your skin to pick the bed level that is best for you. I don't tan easily so I started off in a level 2 bed and it is amazing!! The brand is Sting Bee. Super high fans and radio speakers in every room. Now when you walk in you're gonna be like "Umm wtf is up with the decor in here?" Just relax and trust me that their beds are legit. I went from the color of paper to being the color of umm... Well... Whatever I'm tan! Definitely recommend a package deal (30 days unlimited). Remember, your tan will develop over 24/48 hours so don't be discouraged if you don't get out of the bed tan!

4.description: I love this tanning salon. I have been on the north to south side searching for great tanning and this happens to be near my work. I walk in and they remember my name.Is a great deal, especially for the quality of tan you are getting. I have been to salons that try to short you on time. Here they let you go as long as you want and will tell you that a bed is hot. If you are a tanner you know what an effect that can have on it.Either way a couple times of year they have a 50% off sale, I think students get 20% all the time. Worth every penny either way. Can't wait to get myself back in there and get rid of these summer tan lines!

58.description: This is one of my favorite places in Chicago to get a real Chicago-style hot dog, and the only one I've found that still puts the cucumber slice on with everything else.  The prices are insanely cheap, making it the perfect place to eat before heading up to Sox Park for a game (you can feed 2 people for the price of feeding one at the park!).  Aside from great dogs, their malts are pretty great also.

56.description: Decent food, but pricey. AND despite the modern building, it's NOT open year round.(only open from april-late october)This place mostly serves the sox game crowd.

29.description: decided to give this place a try since i pass by here from time to time.. it wasn't busy at all when i went and they have a decent size parking lot in the back.. there's no tables or chairs inside, only on the outside if you were to eat there.. the service was average.. workers didn't smile or greet but i expect that from a hot dog joint..i ordered 2 hot dogs and a order of fries.. yes.. the hot dog doesn't come with fries like most places.. the hot dogs tasted a bit on the salty side but it wasn't bad.. i would say it is a little above average.. for the fries.. it was horrible! it looked good but it was nasty.. for some reason, it tasted kind of rubberish? not crispy.. not soggy.. not over or under fried.. but the outside taste rubberish...for 2 hot dogs and fries, it cost me 8 bucks.. but i guess its because its close to US Cellular Field.. i just didn't find this place that great..

42.description: Fantastic Chicago Style Hot Dogs! Need I say more?Wish they were open year-round!

23.description: Perfect Chicago hot dog and good fries for pretty cheap. They don't accept credit cards which is annoying, but overall it's a good place.

47.description: Yesterday afternoon an unexplained craving for a hot dog hit me. Who knows why but there it was. So biked the extra few blocks on my way home just to stop here to pick up a dog. (I hear from a lot of people in the hood that this is the best hot dog joint). I wound up getting the "Double Dog" with everything and charred please. It tasted perfect. It had a perfect snap to it and the toppings were fresh and it was topped well. The staff was friendly enough and they had a few items that are not standard hot dog stand offerings. They do have a couple drawbacks.They have no combo deals and the fries are extra (I'm with G.R. on that one plain  fries should come with the dog) Cash only, I think since they are on the pricey side of the hot dog and burger world they really should offer a plastic money option. (they do have an ATM inside though)And as already mentioned their prices are a little high for being a hot dog stand., but I will say not as high as a couple of northside hot dog stands I've been to.

8.description: The dogs are just like a Chicago dog should be: poppy seed bun, Vienna, tomatoes and pickles bursting out the top. Loved it.

31.description: Love this place! Seriously good, cheap (compared to inside the park) eats. This is a definite stop before any Sox game. They're 100 times better than anything in the Cell. The hot dogs cannot be beat. This is how a Chicago dog should be made, so listen up all you competitors. I usually order two and scarf them down. This use to be the place to eat before the game, now I'm traveling on non-Sox days just to grab a bite. Service is great and friendly. Yes it's still cash only. And the best part of this place: not a hint of Cubbie crap anywhere. Who doesn't love the old bleacher seats from Comiskey? Go Sox!

34.description: great place to go sit before a game, or for a great brat during a warm day.

16.description: Everything is FANTASTIC about this place. Must admit...possibly the best Chicago Dog I've had since coming back from Cali. Reminds me of the dogs I ate when I was a kid! Thanks for the memories!

13.description: Location is kind of sketchy.  I locked the door of my car since it was in kind of hood-ish neighborhood.  I don't usually eat hot dogs unless I'm in Chicago or New York.  I ordered polish for me and regular hotdog for my son.  It was a great cheap eats.  ;)

11.description: This place definitely might be the best traditional hot dog in town. Hidden gem in the southside.

39.description: Food is fantastic and made fresh to order. I'm a hot dog and cheese fry girl and I must come here too much because they know my order. If you're here for a Sox great, great place before a game. Patio seating, weather permitting. Otherwise you can eat at the counter or take it to go. Cash only but they do have an ATM on site.

37.description: O'Malley's rocks my socks.  Best hot dogs in the city, hands down.  Authentic Chicago Style dogs in an authentic Chicago neighborhood.  My fiance prefers the char-dog, while I go with the old fashioned boiled dog.  The grilled bun is the perfect finishing touch.Willie B must not know a good hot dog because this place is the tippity tops.

0.description: Tried to hit this place up while heading out of the city. Not sure how many stars to give. They are closed on Sundays, Yelp. Get it right.

38.description: the hot dog i had was OK but nothing to write home about. the fries were ok too, but the portion was extremely small, i`d say 10 fries in a small little box.i think it`s a bit over priced for the quality and quantity.

51.description: SOlid burgers but a bit greasy. Cash-only is a minus.

27.description: Visiting this place makes me feel like a real Chicagoan. Right near Cellular field, I found this place through Yelp reviews.I highly recommend trying this place. The Chicago Dog is my favorite type of hot dog and this place does it just right.Light, flavorful and bursting with flavor!

32.description: This is the BEST HOT DOG in the CITY. PERIOD. A true Chicago style hot dog that looks like it comes from a VIENNA BEEF poster itself. Omallys has other items that are just as amazing. The burgers are phenomenal and everything is cooked right in front of you. The staff is so friendly and polite these ladies have been at it for YEARS. Every year they close for the season which sucks but the incredible food makes up for it when the season opens up. Go Sox!

54.description: Great stop off-love the dogs-authentic Chicago style, fries are awesome too. Friend and I stopped off after the Sox on a Thursday, love the place. Very small, nice Sout Side ladies workin the joint too. Love the fries, mmmmmm. No bathroom which is apparently pretty common in Bridgeport. Oh well, piss off the side.

48.description: Stopped here amid our "Exploring Bridgeport "adventure. It is a cute little spot  and full of charm. The dogs were good. They add an extra to the mix, which is a spear of cucumber. It didn't do anything to enhance my Chicago dog experience, but didn't detract either. The fries were ok, but not great and they only serve Pepsi products, so I had root beer. We had planned to stop at Filbert's Root beer Factory, but they were closed, so it filled the craving! It was a beautiful day to sit outside, and the row of old Comisky Park bleacher seats added a touch of ambiance to the place.

44.description: Love this little hotdog stand. If your looking for a straight up south side chicago style hotdog, this is it. Not only is there hotdogs great but what a great burgar and steak sandwich too. The sevice is great, theses old ladys all have been working there for more then 15yrs and are the best. love love love this spot, and it's right by my house too.

24.description: As a die hard sox fan since a kid, I get to omalleys  only once a year. Unfortunately I live in Pasadena, CA.  This place is the bomb. I always get two steak sandwiches with the works...sports peppers, grilled onions on garlic toasted buns. I go on baseball trips every year with a bud of mine and last stop is always sox park. Told my friend from la about it and he was like yeah, ok, whatever. After he ate one steak sandwich he got two more. No joke. True story. Now he tells me he can't wait to hit the spot. The staff friendly and the owner Mr. Omalleys even works the grill. Love this place. Looking forward to my trip to sox park in August with my family. My wife is now a loyal fan and its time to get my daughters hooked. To those of you complaining about pricing get real. Come to LA. and you will pay double for half the quality. Go and enjoy. Trust me you will be coming back!

7.description: Excellent Chicago hot dog here and with fries and a soda for $5, this is the perfect place to go before or after a White Sox game. Service was fast and friendly and there is parking in the back during Sox games for $15.The dog had the traditional toppings of green relish, yellow mustard, diced onions, a pickle spear, and the tomato slices were bigger than what you may find at other spots. To top it off, they throw in a cucumber slice which is the only place I've found thus far in the city that does that.Would certainly make this place a must whenever I'm in the area for a game.

49.description: I love to go here for a hot dog and a hamburger before a Sox game. Me and every one else - it gets crowded before a game! Their ice cream is also quite good. And their fries. And everything else! This is your standard hot dog - beef - hamburger joint, but I'd say it's pretty high quality. And the folks that work here are real nice. I kinda wish they were open later than 8, and year round, because Morrie's sure beats Maxwell's.

40.description: I love this place!  I've been going here since I was a kid.  I remember    when it was just a small hot dog stand.  Hot dogs are pure awesome.  Char burgers are mouthwatering.  Perfect spot to park and eat before the game.See those benefits here:blog.spothero.com/2011/0…So happy this place exists!!!

53.description: Really good burger/dog joint! They make the burgers fresh while you wait.  The mushrooms are good, beer battered.  Soft serve icecream and god vienna beef hotdogs on a rosens bun.  Great place to stop if you live in the neighborhood like me or your in town for a sox game.

30.description: Walking distance to US Cellular field. I had to order the Tamale boat on the menu to find out what it was, turns out it was a tamale in a chili tray. Pretty good too, not the best ever but still nothing to sneeze at.  They had outdoor dining, no indoor seating and the hot dogs looked good, didn't have them though. No waiters, just fast food style perfect for a quick bite before the game.

46.description: The rudiest workers I have ever encountered and the food was so-so.I will definely pass this place up next time I'm going to a Sox game.  I'd rather pay the extra money for better service and the so-so food in the Park.

1.description: July 28th 20152nd stop with our hotdog hoopingPoopy seed bun  with tomato and pickle. Nice presentation  but lack of better flavor

55.description: Oh holy crap, this place is awesome.  I used to live right down the block and it would call to me.  The food is awesome.  I will even eat and enjoy the hot dogs, which is not something I do often.  The cheese fries ans pizza puff were my go to, I mean how do  you not order a pizza puff when that option is presented?  I don't know if you can.  The staff is very friendly, very fast and just plain awesome.  It sucks that it's only open in the summer, for the baseball season, but that just makes me cherish the little time I get with O'Malleys even more.  Because it's open only in nice weather, there's only outdoor seating, it's very nice and on a not-game-day you can have a very relaxed meal here.If you're not looking to eat a meal you can always just grab a shake or some ice cream.  The soft serve reminds me of my childhood ice cream shop (I miss you Stop-N-Chat).  The shakes are really good.  yum!

9.description: I stepped in a few weeks back for a soft serve ice cream cone. I stood around for a good 3 minutes before all 4 staff behind the counter greeted me after they all saw me walked in. Worst service ever. Will never go back

26.description: Best cheese fries and chocolate shakes!

25.description: phone in your order during a home game (go whitesox).Im a sucker for the softserved icecream/shakes/flurries.The people who run this place are cool.open during white sox season/spring-late summer.

12.description: Fresh dogs and delicious condiments. Ignorant employees who ignore you while you're standing right in front of them. Service here is in the serious decline. I was a customer here for 24 years. Ugh

59.description: O'Malley's is my favorite hot dog joint in the entire city.  Pros:Great hot dogs (traditional Chicago style with a pickle!)Yummy cheese friesIce cream goodies!Big menuItalian BeefParking lotParking for Sox gamesGreat StaffCheapFriendly, neighborhood feelCons:None.  Seriously.  There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place.  I have been here a lot (it was around the corner from my apartment) and they have never messed up an order, it's always quick, it's convenient, the owner is in the shop hanging out and everyone is super nice.  It's a great Bridgeport staple and I still eat there on my way to Sox games.  I LOVE O'Malley's!

21.description: If it weren't for the convenience of being so close to home, I probably wouldn't come here. Just "ok." Nothing to brag about or recommend.

17.description: Visiting this place makes me feel like a real Chicagoan. Right near Cellular field, I found this place through Yelp reviews.I highly recommend trying this place. The Chicago Dog is my favorite type of hot dog and this place does it just right.Light, flavorful and bursting with flavor!

10.description: Very friendly folks here, family owned business and it's got great seating outdoors. The char burger is yummy and they also have soft serve which is perfect in the summer. Plus it's about half a mile from the Sox park so it's a perfect place to come and eat before heading to the game.

5.description: It finally happened:  I got suckered into going somewhere just because it was on Chicago's Best.  Well, not really.  We were headed to a Sox game and knew we'd want to eat.  As much as I don't mind ballpark food, I'm a bit of a priss when it comes to eating while standing or on my lap, squished next to people.  Morrie OMalley's is definitely a good spot for ballpark/fast food if you're heading to a game.The Steak Sandwich was YUM - served on garlic bread with mozzarella cheese and A1 sauce (hold the grilled onions), what's not to like?  I also had the Dreamsicle shake, which is to die for.  It's straw-collapsing thick, but melted nicely in the humidity that day.The cheese fries were standard.  My husband liked his hot dog and Polish sausage, he would've given Morrie OMalleys three stars, but I thought my meal was more deserving of four.  All of our food, drinks, and fries added up to only $27, a steal compared to ballpark prices!There are several tables outside, where we ate as we watched the storm start to roll in before heading to the game.  There are also a few stools and a counter inside, but it was super hot inside the tiny restaurant, with only a few windows open for ventilation.They also score extra points with me for having a free parking lot.  I think it's $15 if you want to park here for the Sox game.Good to know:  CASH ONLY!  But there is an ATM inside.

3.description: Solid eats, cheap, and great toppings at Morrie O'Malley's.  Not on the top tier for me personally (Devil Dawgs, Hot Doug's, Flub-a-Dub-Chub's, Franks N' Dawgs) but a solid option if you are close by or trying to get away from White Sox traffic after a game.Spartan space inside but great staff; they were kind enough to stay open a few extra minutes last Thursday night to feed our group of four.  Tried the regular dog Chicago-style and one of the chili-cheese dogs, two orders of fries, and a chocolate shake.  I think we dropped $17 or $18 for all of it.  Tasty, the dog was a little small (had Flub the day before, so really, it's just that Morrie's serves a normal-sized hot dog), fries were perfectly cooked.If I need chow after a baseball game, I'll be back!

35.description: 5 STARS and from a VEGETARIAN!!I really don't want to write this review because I want to keep this gem myself but, well, they deserve the cudos.I've lived in Bridgeport  for 30 years, drove by this place frequently, and never gave it a thought. (I don't eat meat).About a month ago, I wound up there with some carnivores and figured I'd just get something to drink.  But the place smelled so good that I asked for a Chicago Dog without the dog.  It turns out that they get asked for that a lot, so they even have a name for it, the "UnDog".  Gotta love that; gotta love the price: $1.00.There is no place in creation that's that reasonable.  Most places charge you the same price even when you don't get meat, which really pi$$es me off.  This place is onto something.   A Chicago tradition and taste to die for without the meat. The cucumber slice makes this a salad on a bun, but better. Their fries are EXCELLENT home-cut and their ketchup is DELICIOUS (no small thing)!  They also have ice-cold DIET Mountain Dew, which you NEVER find!!Fantastic looking little place with a LARGE free parking lot just west (enter from the alley).  Eating outside under the umbrella tables in nice weather is THE best.Right now, I'm going back 2-3 times a week.I'm pretty sure their 2011 season ends 11/18 and they reopen May 5, 2012.  (Check their website).   I'm not sure I can make it that long.ps: They got the first "10" rating ever at hotdogchicagostyle(dot)com.  They're not kidding.

19.description: So I went off my diet for this? Had a steak sandwich . Why bother to ask me how I want it done, if your going to over cook it anyway. .I asked for medium rare. Med well is what I got. They asked me if I wanted everything,  guess i missed the forward to a steak with grilled onions and cheese on garlic bread. .oooh what a disappointment. . the only time I use a-1is, if it is a crap piece of meat. . I asked for very well done cheese fries( cause of your going to cheat on your diet, go big or go home).Anyway, they were almost raw. Guess I should have stayed on my diet. .I gave it 2 stars because they were very polite, which seems to be a rarity nowadays.

28.description: Great quality food.  Higher than average prices.  Great, convenient location.  No public restroom....that is just not right!

45.description: O'Malley's and White Sox games go hand in hand. Because of this I try to stop by before every game I see and make sure to get their charred bratwurst with mustard and grilled onions. Their hot dogs are great but I find that their brat is far superior. If I'm feeling a little spendy I'll pick up their steak sandwich with mozzarella cheese, grilled onions, and A1 sauce all on garlic bread. One of the best steak sandwiches in the neighborhood. For something sweet I'll finish the meal with a vanilla soft serve cone. Their ice cream is one of the most surprising things about this place. It's quite good. I just always assumed if you want good soft serve you need to go an ice cream shop but nope, you can get it here. The one thing that they lack in quality is their fries. I've stopped even getting them. But last weekend I thought I saw them serving a fry that looked different so hopefully they have changed their premade frozen fry ways and moved onto the fresh cut route. If this change is indeed true then I'll have no more excuses. I'll finally be able to proclaim them as the best hot dog stand in Chicago.

33.description: Good but pricey for a neighborhood joint where kids go to often.  Of course, they don't have to come down on their prices because they have a good flow of customers coming in.  Still, when the kids want to go here 3 times a week, and after every local sports event, it's starts to add up.  Whatever happened to the 3 hot dogs and fries for $1.89?  OK, these hot dogs are a much better quality than those were, but still...maybe one dog and fries for $1.89?

43.description: Okay, so I'm liking this Morrie O'Malley's spot! I called ahead and gave them my order (chili cheese fries and a charbroiled steak sandwich - or something like that). When I got there they hadn't even made my chili cheese fries yet and I was like, "hmmm... WTF?" But... the fact that they made em in about 2 minutes and it was FRESH, made it a good thing. So the food... they use real steak! Real stuff people!! I was surprised, because usually its the ground shit and they call it steak. Nope not here it was steak! And the fries? All I have to say is, Maury can drip and splatter his chili all over my fries any time he wants. Mmmmmm... mmmm.... good.  I love my Maury! Oh shit... missing star? Well. People... This is 2011! We have motherfuckers vacationing on the damn moon. So, why is it that businesses still opt out of having credit card machines!? It just doesn't make sense to me. That's my only gripe.

2.description: Great chili dog. Went here before a game and had a chili dog and a double dog. My 11 year old son ate the same. Great fries too

18.description: Probably the best Chi-style grilled hot dog in Bridgeport. Steak sandwhich also great. Try the mint milkshake. Cash only can be inconvenient, and they close for part of the winter. Otherwise awesome place for fast food.

41.description: Go here for a Chicago-style hot dog, something not quite as easy to find in Chicago as one might imagine.  You won't have to explain yourself, and you won't get anything other than a natural casing Vienna Beef hot dog served on a steamed poppy seed bun topped with bright, fresh, and tasty ingredients!  $5 cash for the hot dog special can't be beat.

52.description: Cute place, good fast food menu all the essentials. You can even order your dog grilled, they have a sign up that there's no extra charge to have it grilled, well thanks I guess, I've never heard of a charge for having that done. You do have the grill going for burgers anyhow, so what's the deal?The food is good, I'll give them that, however no forth star because they charge for fries. I can understand charging extra if you want that liquid what they call cheese stuff put on them, but plan ole fries, no way! This place is expensive Lucy.Well at least it is the way they do it. But for this old time Chicagoan, fries always come with the dog for free. WTH, why so much about the fries, I guess it just rubs me the wrong way. And if you're a native it should bug you too.So if you need some good fast food, and don't mind paying up, this will do.

50.description: We've been going to Morrie O'Malleys for  six years and the  burgers and dogs are  good, but the stand out here is the steak sandwich for $6.75. You can get it  on garlic bread, which is the only way they should make it.  The steak sandwich is  5 stars. I had one 7/23/09 and each bite was golden toasted garlic bread, with medium rare steak that was tender and flavorful . You can get cheese, grilled onions and all kinds of other toppings, but the quality of the garlic bread and the meat are best savoried straight up.Over the years the parade of neighborhood kids getting their soft serve fix finally convinced me to try it last year, that is also highly reccomended. I think they do shakes and sundaes too, but not certain.The only drawback to Morrie's is that after baseball season ends their hours tend to hit and miss.

4.description: Its a Bridgeport institution, family owned place. The kids liked their hotdogs a quick after school meal and the staff were really friendly.

6.description: After all these years of going to Sox games and I had never gone to this place until yesterday.  Excellent strip steak sandwich with everything (served on a garlic bread roll with A! sauce, grilled onions and mozzarella). This place is a home run. Way better than eating the mass produced stadium food. And it's just a 4 block walk (dues west) of US Cellular Field on 35th street. It's a no brainer.

22.description: Wonderful, family-run staff creates a fun and unique atmosphere with great food and convenient parking. This is the Chicago Dog done the right way -- don't try to order a dog with ketchup on it.

15.description: Love this place! Seriously good, cheap (compared to inside the park) eats. This is a definite stop before any Sox game. They're 100 times better than anything in the Cell. The hot dogs cannot be beat. This is how a Chicago dog should be made, so listen up all you competitors. I usually order two and scarf them down. This use to be the place to eat before the game, now I'm traveling on non-Sox days just to grab a bite. Service is great and friendly. Yes it's still cash only. And the best part of this place: not a hint of Cubbie crap anywhere. Who doesn't love the old bleacher seats from Comiskey? Go Sox!

57.description: Hm...where to begin. I'm torn with O'malleys simply because they've been around for so long.  This being said, they have some room for improvement...First, I have no idea when this place is opened because they have no times listed.  Yes, i know they're "Open" March - November, but there have been quite a few nites i've walked to this joint and they're closed.  There is no rhyme or reason to when they choose to open their business, although every sox game they are jumping.Besides that, this is just a typical hot dog joint.  There is nothing really amazing about any of their food.  True, the hot dogs are good, the burgers are good, the shakes are good, but nothing truly stands out.  It's the same stuff you can get from a lot restaurants in the city.  Also, I find they are a bit pricey.  Last time I was there a hot dog, cheese fries, and a soda came out to about $10 - that's a bit much, in my humble opinion.However, I do love when I stop into O'Malley's.  The owner is often behind the counter with the ladies, chatting it up with the customers.  It is one of the friendliest quick stop diners I have ever been too.  I always leave with a smile and a little bit of neighborhood gossip.  Also, the location is perfect -- right on 35th street on your way to Comiskey.  However, it's kind of hard to find parking, so if you're driving make sure you have a friend to jump out and pick up the food.

20.description: At first I thought it was a typical vienna hotdog place but closer look at the menu and I saw they had some interesting sandwiches..I got the strip steak sandwich served on garlic bread and it was a good sandwich. Wasnt the best ive ever had in my short life but ill definitely stop by if im around :)

36.description: This is a must-stop before a game or if you're in the neighborhood. The food is phenomenal (as far as stadium food goes) and the service is excellent. Chicago-style dogs, chili-cheese (homemade chili) dogs, cheese fries, iced cream...all delicious. The place looks immaculate and there is always someone cleaning. You could make a weak argument that the food is expensive BUT the quality is well worth it. I saw some reviews talked about the workers being rude, on the contrary. I inquired on the empty 5-gallon buckets they sell when I was putting in my order - while eating outside the a worker brought out TWO 5-gallon buckets and said to take them for free. Does that sound like rude customer service to you? Also, some individuals are reviewing O'Malley's sorely because of its parking fee during Sox games - why? This establishment's review on this particular site asks about the food, not where you can park your car when you have tickets to the game. Its unbelievable how ridiculously incompetent some reviewers are. Go buy a parking pass from the Cell.

14.description: Holy cow!  Great chili dog, awesome service and the best steak sandwich I have ever had.  So good we had to buy a couple more for the kids at home!  Sooooo glad we found you and we will be back!!!

58.description: Never gotten lashes done so I was a little nervous but the end result, so worth it! Look amazing, they are reasonably priced and can find good deals on here! Definitely check then out if you are looking for some lashes =]

56.description: Beauty queens & actors/ newscasters alike come here to make them look picture perfect for weeks on end w/ no effort on their own part!!! I've seen their hair extensions & they look AMAZING & sooo natural/ expertly done!!! Come here and you too can wake up beautiful w/ no makeup, or work even if you're no longer 16!!! All the technicians here are top notch and extremely accommodating, nice and friendly! It's very affordable, even more so after your 1st visit and you no longer need to buy mascara ever again! Fare warning entirely addictive and you will receive a ton of compliments from EVERYONE!!! So if you do not want attention/ comments on how beautiful/ refreshed you look even after studying/ doing an allnighter, then do not come here!;) This business is extremely well run by a thoughtful and wonderful woman who goes above and beyond to accommodate you! They're extremely clean & sanitary, use the best products/ product lines, listen to your thoughts/ needs & their decor is girly & adorable to go along with your new beauty queen status (sporting the all time great beauties on their walls)! Chicago Lashes will even come to your house and perform their beauty services if you're short on time. The owner provides bottled water, nuts, snacks, etc and you even leave w/ a special brush, along w/ a newfound education on how to treat your extensions. Love supporting a woman owned small local business, especially when the owner really is a deserving sweetheart!!! I've never, ever had a problem in the years of coming here (and I'm hyper allergic/sensitive to everything), but if you ever have any problems, & I've overheard some extremely high maintenance/difficult clients here sadly, they will fix it in a jiffy no hassle/questions asked! They definitively take pride in their customer service & being at the forefront/ superb in their field of the beauty industry. They are extremely accomplished/ educated in their field/arena and it's a privilege/ rarity to get such professional services at such an affordable price point!!! Give Chicago Lashes a try & you'll thank me & them later after you've landed your Brad Pitt equivalent, as he cowers with your newfound beauty!!!

29.description: Got hair extensions for the first time , Jennifer did my hair. LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! She did the most amazing job. Everyone I know and meet compliments me on my hair. They can't even tell it is extensions. The prices are unbeatable too. HIGHLY recommend

42.description: Really good service, the lashes look like Kim K style. Easy to make an appointment, very professional. I will definitely go back.

23.description: Every women's dream is to have full, thick, beautiful lashes. Well, I don't know about you.. But buying the cheap little eyelash strips from wall-mart are always a pain in the butt to get on and off! So, I decided to do some research about professional eyelash extensions. The one eyelash salon that kept appearing everywhere was the one and only Chicago Lashes. Thanks to the wonderful Yelp reviews here, and recommendations amongst those who know a thing or two about eyelashes, I decided to try this place: and the end results are PHENOMENAL.I called this salon to book an appointment on Tuesday and was very fortunate to be able to get an appointment two days later at 9:00AM (Which is great because this salon is always very busy!)The receptionist, James (Who I believe is also the store manager as well) Greeted me  with enthusiasm and cheerfulness the moment I walked into the door. He told me to have a seat, and that Moon (the lash technician) would be with me momentarily. He offered me tea, water, and even coffee too while waiting. I got a chance to look around- and this place was not only very clean, but very well decorated! The cute chairs at the front of the shop were super comfy as well. Moon greeted me with a warm smile, and inquired if I had lashes before. I informed her this would be my first time, and she grabbed a book (that contained pictures of various lashes) and we sat down for several minutes discussing the options at hand. She didn't rush me at all, and was very comforting to converse with. We decided for a semi natural look- which would add just the amount of 'glam' I wanted, while keeping it natural looking as well.I laid down and Moon began her work, explaining every little detail- every process of the way. Eventually, I fell asleep, and the next thing I knew, my lashes were complete! I believe it took about a full 2 hours- which is great! Moon handed me the mirror and I FELL IN LOVE WITH MY LASHES! They were perfect! The experience at Chicago Lashes was absolutely wonderful! Park was a breeze (a whole bunch of spots right outside the salon). I will definitely be back as a continuing customer and I highly recommend this salon!!

47.description: I don't always get eyelash extensions, but when I do, I look like my eyes are open.I was in town at the right time; Chicago Lashes had a $75 full-set special, which was great because I didn't have one eyelash left in my head. You can pay a little more on their deal, and get 'glamorous' eyelashes but I stayed with the $75 'natural' lashes. The gal that did my lashes was late for my appt and seemed a little addlepated upon arrival, but she was really quick putting on the lashes, which I appreciated. I can barely feel the glue still, and it's 2 1/2 weeks later. She did a great application! When I left, they gave me a little swag bag with a candy, eyelash brush, and a business card. Nice touch AND the other day, I received a card mailed to my HOME with more business cards and a thank you note. Talk about going the extra mile.Good price, great application, and uncommon customer service. This will be my lash spot when I'm back in the neighborhood.

8.description: So this is my 2nd review for Chicago lash eyelash extension. I know the first one will not count once i update my review but just Want to let you all know to make sure you choose your tech wisely! ! I am not taking back my first review because it was really a horrible experience for me.last night I came back to their place so that they can remove and re attach the lashes that's stuck in my waterline eyelids.
