This one was a doozy- disassembling and re-assembing  the pole system, adding more pieces, rearranging everything, and also moving some very ungainly furniture. He and his team handled the whole task efficiently and professionally, and best of all, safely... I don't have to worry about the thing falling on someone.I would recommend Pagoda Studios without any hesitation if you are looking for a professional, innovative contractor who will go above and beyond your expectations. And best of all: the cost was very reasonable each time, which makes a big difference to me as a independent business owner.

4.description: We hired Joseph to install somethings around the house (new sink, thermostat etc.) as well as fix the grouting in our bathroom. He did an amazing job and our bathroom looks better than ever. He was prompt and professional. Highly recommend.

28.description: i like this place. its cheap and you get a lot for your money. the vegetables used in their meals are very fresh. delivery is quick and friendly. what more can i ask for?

1.description: I love this place because it's in Bridgeport it has rice boxes for about fair price $6.50 or a little under that price. You get meat dish over rice some times the depending on what you order vegetables come with it. I like their Peking style pork chops with onions over rice, it's delicious! They also have fish fillet with egg drop corn gravy over rice, and Salt and pepper pork chops over rice it's spicy and delicious!They have your typical American style fair of Chinese food too. However, I like the real stuff. So I always go for the foods I would order if I were in Chinatown. The food is good it taste great and it is easy to order and pick up your food. I would recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want to go out to Chinatown for rice boxes or Chinese food in general. It's really good and fast service!

9.description: Like the fan haps. Only come here for takeout and it's generally good and inexpensive.

29.description: They are incredibly fast, I ordered my food and they delivered within 15 minutes. I like the orange beef. They are cheap too.

23.description: Lunch under $5?TOTALLY doable here.  I usually order the chicken rice soup ($2) and an eggroll ($1.50).  Deal alert, yessir.  Always hits the spot.  Tons of soup options, too - wonton, egg drop, hot and sour.  I'm a fan, especially when I don't have to drop more than $5 on a meal. If you want something more substantial, they have a pretty good lunch deal, too!  Any of the combos come with two crab rangoon, fried rice and your choice of entree.  From what I've seen, they give you a HUGE plate of food, probably enough to last two meals. Suggestion?  Call ahead for pick-up.  The parking lot here is a madhouse, so you'll spend some time circling looking for parking.

5.description: Their crab rangoon is very delicious and taste the way it should be. Compared to the ayce at the buffet these rangoons topped it by alot. This place is great for both lunch and dinner. I come here quite often at least twice a month.

31.description: It's been a while since I've been here, but I used to be a frequent customer of the place.  Of course, this place is always going to take a backseat on my list of options since Chinese Kitchen and I have an on-again-off-again relationship but I'll always come crawling back to them.  When I feel like cheating on my favorite, I come here.  And often feel guilty afterward.Their Governor's Chicken - not so great.  They just take the worst nitpicks I have and throw them all in one dish.The chicken pieces are too large - which leads to pieces I can't (or rather SHOULDN'T) pop into my mouth one at a time.  Also, it worries me when they're that big because that means they're either undercooked or overcooked.  So they're usually tougher and overcooked, which I suppose it the better of the two options (and less hazardous to the public's health).The vegetables in the dish includes giant hunks of green peppers.  Again, large pieces.  To enjoy a piece of pepper with a piece of chicken at the same time could lead to choking.  The worst part about their usage of green peppers would be the fact that they fail to remove all of the little white seeds, leading to my having to spit out the buggers while eating.  If a major part of eating a food involves spitting, something's wrong (and I believe that's why a crack team of scientists had to invent the seedless watermelon).Lastly, the sauce is more like a glaze, barely hanging on to the monstrous hunks of chicken.  It pools in the bottom and acts more like a dip, although it has trouble clinging (like it's afraid of serving its purpose) to the chicken bits and requires a spoon if it's to be enjoyed at the same time as the chicken.This is a dish that fights to be eaten with its many self-defense mechanisms.Still, the service is great.  On the few occasions that I remember about the green pepper nightmare, they'll gladly not add them.  Their service is also speedy.  I can order food at the counter and not get through two full songs on my iPod before it's ready.Despite the many failures with my favorite dish (and pretty much my ONLY dish), I still find this place to be average in the end.  Maybe Chinese Kitchen is just the bar I've set and the benchmark I compare all others to, but I admit that I'm a fat of the fat lazy American menu.  Maybe if they bothered to translate the giant Chinese menu (even if it meant hilarious Engrish mistranslations), I'd be willing to risk it here because others I talk to (and reviews I've read here) suggest that they're really good.  And I'll consider eating in, because rumor has it they give you soup and supposedly bigger portions than the takeout containers.I'm just not daring enough yet to point to one of the many Chinese menu items and say "gimme one o' them", because that's when they bring out the "Stir-Fried Pork Stomach & Liver with Garlic" and I run from the establishment screaming....with a doggie-bag.  Because I don't like to waste food.

25.description: love it. Its pricey that normal rice boxes, but its worth the extra bucks.

12.description: Lunch under $5?TOTALLY doable here.  I usually order the chicken rice soup ($2) and an eggroll ($1.50).  Deal alert, yessir.  Always hits the spot.  Tons of soup options, too - wonton, egg drop, hot and sour.  I'm a fan, especially when I don't have to drop more than $5 on a meal. If you want something more substantial, they have a pretty good lunch deal, too!  Any of the combos come with two crab rangoon, fried rice and your choice of entree.  From what I've seen, they give you a HUGE plate of food, probably enough to last two meals. Suggestion?  Call ahead for pick-up.  The parking lot here is a madhouse, so you'll spend some time circling looking for parking.

21.description: It's not the best chinese take out but if you want decent chinese food and don't want to drive into chinatown, give the TC express a chance. I love it for its convenience. It's down the block and quick. They have great lunch combos for about $5 - entree comes with fried rice and an appetizer.   I do love the egg rolls here because they're the typical greasy pork egg rolls found at take out joints (i love pork egg rolls)!In addition to the typical chinese american menu, they have a chinese menu (unfortunately i cannot read chinese!).  However, I know how to order the typical chinese rice boxes and i'm not sure if its because i ordered off the "chinese" menu or because i ordered it speaking chinese, but i always get free soup!  When BF orders in english though, we get no free soup... hence I am usually the one who gets to order the food.

16.description: Worst Chinese place I've been to. Place said they don't have CUPS OF WATER!!  r u serious......inexcusable!

17.description: I was just here on 9/26/11 I order from them every couple of month when I feel like walking up the street.Shame on me for coming here knowing it's Garbage! The place looks dirtythe people are unfriendlythe food is badthe price is okNext time I will just drive to JoyE on halsted and maxwell.

10.description: My family and I decided to give this place a go. Being Chinese, we decided to skip out on the fake Chinese food and go for the actual Chinese food: stir fried snow peas with chicken, XO stir fried seafood, stir fried noodles, and sparerib rice. The food was really good. I enjoyed the spice that each food had, and the flavor was really on point. Really, though, I didn't like the way the owners were taking the restaurant. The remodeled restaurant was a good idea, but you have to use a key to open the bathroom. This just might be me, but I don't appreciate bathrooms like that, because you get a feel that it might not be safe. Also, our table was dirty when we sat down. There was a grain of rice on the table and old napkins just lying there. I think that the worst part of the restaurant is the service. The workers there don't really seem like they care about the place and the image that they set up. I wanted a few cups of water (because all they had was soda, and I just wanted tap water so I didn't have to buy bottled), went up to ask the lady. She said something along the lines of, "You don't need water, we give you soup with the dishes." Need I remind you that restaurants are required BY LAW to give free water to anyone who requests it. I was pissed.Overall, the food is good, but the service is bad. If I really wanted their food, I would only order take out. Beware their indifferent cashiers.

11.description: Good food here but the only criticism is that if you're going to deviate from the menu and ask for some item changed even slightly - make sure that the person helping you speaks some English.  Still check your bag before you leave.  It will save headaches & potential stomach aches!

26.description: When I'm craving real Chinese food and want it fast, this is the place for it.  Give them a ring and it'll be ready in 15 minutes.  Everything is really reasonably priced and tasty.I'm a big fan of the pepper beef and tomato over rice noodles.  It's my favorite dish there, by far.  My sister loves their salt and pepper pork chops over rice.  When I'm craving a not-so-authentic fare, I order their lunch specials.  The Hunan Shrimp lunch special is awesome, I love all the veggies in it.

27.description: I'm just about ready to give up.  I went back last week after playing some tennis about a block away and was hungry and thirsty.To quench my thirst, I ordered a watermelon slushie.  I don't normally want tapioca in my drink but my friend wanted some and they were out!second, I ordered a dish off the chinese menu, which is described as sliced pork with chinese mustard greens over vermicelli.  it's one of my favorite chinese dishes but they got it all wrong here.  I don't consider hair in my food as a bonus either.tasteless. and there was a HAIR in my food.  Huge giant portion for $5.50 but this might be the last time I come.

35.description: I agree with Donna....this is a great place for Chinese food without actually going to Chinatown.  Plus, they're super quick when it comes to making your food.  3 orders will take a  measly 15 minutes :) Not only are the portions huge, each order even comes with a small container of soup. yummy.  :P

8.description: Ordered from here so many times.... I have to say their salt and pepper squid (calamari, if you please), fish, pork chops,  or even their eggplants in garlic sauce is delicious. Steer away from the mandarin style pork chops unless you like sweet pork chops.

0.description: First time order review. We ordered through grub hub, so we didn't actually speak to or deal with the business in anyway. So I cannot comment on customer service. The food (most important part in my eyes) was firstly a giant portion. It was enough for two dinners and a lunch. The quality was fine, for what your paying, in fact I would say you are getting a lot of bang for your buck. The potstickers especially were delicious. Delivery was in the window provided so no complaints there either.

20.description: First time there was yesterday.  Ordered the Mongolian Beef.  The menu said it was "hot" but the person taking my order described it as mild.  I was a bit apprehensive but I think they cooked it to order and did a great job.  I'm so glad to have found this place.  It is nearby, they are fast without calling ahead, and treated me courteously.  I'm sure I'll return!

19.description: It's not the best chinese take out but if you want decent chinese food and don't want to drive into chinatown, give the TC express a chance. I love it for its convenience. It's down the block and quick. They have great lunch combos for about $5 - entree comes with fried rice and an appetizer.   I do love the egg rolls here because they're the typical greasy pork egg rolls found at take out joints (i love pork egg rolls)!In addition to the typical chinese american menu, they have a chinese menu (unfortunately i cannot read chinese!).  However, I know how to order the typical chinese rice boxes and i'm not sure if its because i ordered off the "chinese" menu or because i ordered it speaking chinese, but i always get free soup!  When BF orders in english though, we get no free soup... hence I am usually the one who gets to order the food.

33.description: I love them! First time I went in there I didn't know what to expect for a wait time for pickup so I brought a magazine to read. I swear I almost didn't need it, the food was ready in under ten minutes, it might have even been closer to five. And that was for two appetizers and two entrees. And the food is fantastic, at least as good as my fav in Chinatown, Royal Dragon but without leaving the neighborhood. They are a bit pricier than some take out places but the portions are large and the packaging sturdy (and reusable!), one entree is easily two meals if you get an appetizer too.

2.description: Their food are horrible. I really can't say anything. I will not order food from there again. Never!

34.description: Stop in here for the first time yesterday. There is traditional dishes with the more Americanized Chinese meals.I opted to have a Sweet and Sour Chicken with a Strawberry/Pineapple Smoothie. Usually a meal for my first time places since its something really hard to mess up. :)I was really happy they made it to my liking I asked to keep the tomatoes out of the sauce and I don't get the usual, "Great I have to do work" look. They were happy to help here.I was very hungry since I skipped breakfast and I been running around for about 6 hours at this point. The sauce wasn't watery and it was quite tasteful. The whole meal was plenty to fill me up and I barely finished it. The smootie was just that smooth. Full of taste from the REAL FRUIT! I looked around the dinning area and everyone else seemed to be happy with their meals and everyone had a large plate of everything you could imagine. YOU GET YOUR MONEY'S WORTH!!!

32.description: I think I can live off of Triple Crown Express for about $20 a week ... Yup.  Just $20 a week.  The portions are always generous ... and if you can read the "Chinese" side of the menu, you're set!  There would not be need to fight for a parking space in Chinatown.Everytime I go to TCE, I always order something from every food category: seafood, a meat, a veggie and a stir-fry noodle dish. Yuuuummmmmm.  Every order comes with a house soup just like mom makes.  Faves are the fish fillets with leeks, Chinese-style beef tenderloins, stir-fried seafood with rice noodles in an X.O. sauce, Beijing-style pork chops.

18.description: I think I can live off of Triple Crown Express for about $20 a week ... Yup.  Just $20 a week.  The portions are always generous ... and if you can read the "Chinese" side of the menu, you're set!  There would not be need to fight for a parking space in Chinatown.Everytime I go to TCE, I always order something from every food category: seafood, a meat, a veggie and a stir-fry noodle dish. Yuuuummmmmm.  Every order comes with a house soup just like mom makes.  Faves are the fish fillets with leeks, Chinese-style beef tenderloins, stir-fried seafood with rice noodles in an X.O. sauce, Beijing-style pork chops.

13.description: I come here a lot since I live in Bridgeport.  This is a more convenient place to go to for Chinese carryout vs Chinatown.  Food is not bad either.

4.description: This an express version of the Triple Crown in Chinatown. They have a big menu and they are quick with your order. I got their chicken noodle soup because I was feeling a little sick. The soup was really bland. It was just chicken broth and boiled noodles. They could have at least added salt. The other Chinese-American standards (i.e. Orange Chicken and Crab Rangoon) were good. It's a hit and miss here but I mainly go for convenience.

24.description: So maybe the food isn't worth four stars. But it's decent Chinese food, delivered hot, fresh and in a TIMELY fashion. They have one of those magical things that keeps track of your phone number and address so that I don't have to repeat myself every time I call. I'm telling you, on a Friday night, after the longest week in recent history, when every muscle hurts and all I want to do is melt into a puddle, it's the little things like not having to dictate my address over the phone that count.I love their lo mein and egg fried rice (I'm easy) but I've never had anything on their menu that I don't like. Again, not amazing, but good, filling and fast delivery.Oh and when the delivery man comments that I haven't ordered from them in a while, that makes me feel happy and loved. Even if they only know that because of their nifty magic computer thing.

6.description: We use to come here occasionally when I lived in the neighborhood, but since we moved it's not that close anymore. Got carryout since we were in the area.Food was good and plentiful. I'll pass on the egg rolls next time, not much flavor to them.Cheap and quick chinese food.

22.description: Cheap lunch with lots of rice, not enough of anything else.

15.description: So maybe the food isn't worth four stars. But it's decent Chinese food, delivered hot, fresh and in a TIMELY fashion. They have one of those magical things that keeps track of your phone number and address so that I don't have to repeat myself every time I call. I'm telling you, on a Friday night, after the longest week in recent history, when every muscle hurts and all I want to do is melt into a puddle, it's the little things like not having to dictate my address over the phone that count.I love their lo mein and egg fried rice (I'm easy) but I've never had anything on their menu that I don't like. Again, not amazing, but good, filling and fast delivery.Oh and when the delivery man comments that I haven't ordered from them in a while, that makes me feel happy and loved. Even if they only know that because of their nifty magic computer thing.

7.description: Mongolian combination (chicken, beef, and shrimp) and Beef and Tomato are two of my favorite dishes. Prompt delivery and good portions for the price. They are nice and friendly and are willing to make substitutions on your behalf.

36.description: EXCELLENT stop when you just don't feel like driving all the way to Chinatown to the real deal Triple Crown, and worth 5 stars for a carry-out restaurant. Try the "yee peen gai lan",  "sing jao chow mai", and "kgnow yolk chow fun" for some yummy favorites (trust me on this one). I've gotta give credit to Triple Crown Express for understanding my not-so-perfect Chinese... I always throw them off guard... white chicks aren't supposed to speak Cantonese! Expect generous servings, Chinatown selection, and even some "tong soy" to drink with your meal.

30.description: Great choice for cheap eats.  Quick food, close to my boyfriend's place.  And BIG portions.  Can't go wrong.  I would have given another star if they made the tofu casserole they make at the original Triple Crown.

3.description: I've been here a couple of times. The food is hot or miss-I feel. I ordered a beef dish w pan fried noodles and when I got home I realized they had given me some beef fatty tissue dish. I didn't gave the energy to drive all the way back to complain. What isn't hit or miss are these two things: 1. Staff isn't very friendly to say the least (no welcome, no thank you). 2. The parking lot is always full.

14.description: A neighborhood eatery that serves up some tasty delights. I usually come here when I have a taste for one of my favorite dishes (Beef and vegetable fried flat noodles) they fry up the noodles nice and crispy and the best part is it is cheaper than other Chinese restaurants nearby and in Chinatown. You can dine in or get it to go and the most convenient part of this is free parking which I like because  they have a shared lot with other store fronts.

3.description: Gianni has always had a great selection and cozy ambiance if you choose to stay and smoke in their lounge. Recently they started carrying hookah products as well. Nice place.

1.description: Definitely my new favorite place to buy tobacco products. I started coming here with my dad when they first moved to 31st. My dad is a regular cigar smoker and he really loved how fresh the cigars are and how cheap they are considering the amazing quality they are. They have such a HUGE selection too. We've been going there ever since!I am a hookah smoker &I recently found out they started selling hookah products like my favorite brand, Starbuzz. One of Bridgeport's best shops, for sure!

2.description: As a cigar connoisseur who has visited this store many times when it was on 31st and Canal and as recently as last weekI can give you advice. If you like cigars that peel and crunch when you bite them check this place out. My last two trips here resulted in terribly stale cigars at $10.00 apiece.  No more.

5.description: I was in town on business from Boise, Idaho. Went to Chinatown and eventually wanted to get a Cigar. I was shocked there weren't any to be found in Chinatown, so I found Gianni's via Yelp. Not only did they have the best cigar I've ever had (not kidding) at a very reasonable price, the owners and the locals hanging around the shop were the best. I smoked my cigar there for a couple of hours. They all introduced themselves and we had a great time. I'll be back as soon as I get back in town. Thanks guys...and lady too.

0.description: Perfectly Bridgeport, Gianni Cigars & Smoke Shop offers you more than just a diverse selection of cigars.Located on the busy intersection of 31st Street & Union, Gianni Cigars is a little oasis of cigars (no cigarettes!), neighbors, cold sodas, & friendly atmosphere.I have enjoyed a cigar (or two...) at Gianni Cigars. Round tables with large ashtrays fill the room, with floor-to-ceiling cigars showcased behind glass.There is something at Gianni Cigars for everyone (including a lady like myself). The range of cigars is impressive, & they even offer better cigars at low prices. You can grab a nice cigar for $4 or $5 at Gianni Cigars. Just ask the owner for advice if you need help choosing a cigar; he has the expertise!I enjoy taking a break from my day, biting into a nice smoke, & sharing in some neighborhood conversation inside the shop. Gianni Cigars & Smoke Shop is a must-visit, & the owner is knowledgeable & friendly.

4.description: Good conversation? Old school neighborly vibe? I love it! Grab a cigar and sit down and shoot the shit for a while! THE owner and regulars are quite the blast! I had a garcia vega! Tasted good!

28.description: I just had my bike tuned up by Adam today.  I have to say, the bike feels like it did the day I bought it.  Adam is a real laid back guy, and will answer any question, even if you think its something stupid.  I would definitely call him again!

1.description: I made the mistake of leaving my bike in a parking garage cage over the winter.  Adam had set up a bike to work event at my office building so I decided to take advantage of the convenience.  He showed up though the weather was atrocious and provided a superb tune-up on a bike that was not functional when I rolled it out. Very friendly and professional. Hoping to post the before and after pix.

9.description: Thank you youswoop for introducing me to Adam and his amazing business!  I've had a bike sitting in my garage for 3 summers and when I finally decided to start using it this summer there were a few things that were definitely off.  Enter Adam and his magical bicycle cart!  He showed up right on time for our appointment even though it was a torrential downpour.   Luckily I had an empty garage he was able to work in.  In 1 hour he had my bike pedaling like a charm, gear issues fixed, tires inflated, good to go for some long rides along the lakeshore path.  Not only is he super convenient, he does a great job and is super friendly and helpful.  I would not hesitate to recommend his services to anyone!

29.description: Seriously.  Adam is great.  I'm new to biking.  I ride a boys mountain bike that has been sitting in my parent's garage since 1995.  I decided to take it home with me when my mom asked me to throw it in my Jeep and take it to goodwill.It seriously needed a tune up, but I was sort of embarrassed to take it to a bike shop.  The handle grips are made of duct tape...  Its rusty....  Its a tweenaged boys bike.  (I'm a short girl, it works great).My biggest fear was that they would try to sell me a bike at a bike shop.  I secretly love my bike, you know, like you loved your first beater car.  You didn't care if you backed into a mail box, or someone dinged you in a parking lot.  Someone would have to be real desperate to steal my bike....and honestly I couldn't be too upset if they did because its so awful.But...I love it regardless.  I purchased a tune-up through you swoop and made my appointment.  Adam sent a text and asked if he could come a little later, he was running behind.  You have to realize with what he is doing, he can get a little backed up.  If a bike needs a little extra TLC, or traffic sucks etc.  But it was totally OK with me.  I didn't have to "come back later"...I just sat around.Anyway, Adam is amazing with bikes.  I sat and talked to him for the whole tune up.  He can carry on a full conversation (and actually listen) while working on a bike, without slowing down.  He certainly knows bikes. He really just wants to bring cycling to everyone.  He's not about getting rich.  Just making a living doing what he enjoys.  He is just as excited to teach you how to fix your bike, as to have you pay him to do it.  He has no problem giving the "secrets" away.  That's what's great.  He loves this, and honestly wants to bring it to people.He wants to eventually have bike "workshops" at his shop where people can come in and learn how to work on their own bike.  As someone new to riding my bike in the city (~1 month) I was glad that I didn't feel like I wasn't "cool" because of my beginner status, or shitty bike.If my bike needs repairs...pedal to the people it is!

23.description: A note of caution: I am the kind of person who buys her bike from a sketchy guy in Danville. This sketchy guy may or may not know why the brakes are acting funny. Luckily, Adam totally does!Adam showed up with his mobile bike service contraption and went to work on my front lawn. I was a little worried my landlord would be upset, but Adam explained that this was part of his advertising. And as he worked, people stopped by and asked questions. He helpfully answered their questions as well as mine. Now my bike works great! If only Adam could give me confidence with riding on the scary city streets...was that included in the YouSwoop?

5.description: tl;dr - Adam is friendly, his rates are reasonable, he's punctual, and he does good work.When the spokes in my back wheel got snagged in the derailleur on my morning ride, the damage was pretty impressive - the wheel got out of true, part of the derailleur broke, and part of my frame actually got bent from the stress. I threw it on a bus, and contacted Adam when I got in. He actually came out to my place of work that afternoon and, while he didn't have a replacement part with him, did monkey my bike back into good enough shape for me to ride home. He was back two days later with the replacement part and his mobile workbench. Trued the wheel, straightened the frame, replaced the derailleur, and got me back up and rolling.

31.description: Heads up - this is not just a glowing review.   There is an agenda here.  I want you to call Pedal to the People.  I hope you work with Adam soon.  Why?  Because I love bike people.  I love bike culture.  I love when people start to get into riding.  Maybe they decide to go along the lake more frequently or (even more exciting!) to commute to work.   So, if you are reading this review - chances are that I already like you.  I want you, someone I like, to have a great, positive experience that will make you enjoy biking even more.  And, that's what you'll get if you call Adam. If you are already entrenched in the bike community, you'll be psyched for some qt with one of your own.I met Adam on Easter Sunday.  I was walking down Damen, carrying a wheel. (It's tube just popped near Armitage.)  I was on the phone, grease up the elbows, bummed I just missed getting to the store on time.  Then, Adam, a bike angel, rolled by and asked if he needed a hand.  Behind him, I-kid-you-not: a mini-repair-shop, attached to his bike . If that sounds dramatic, it kinda was - in a great waySo, Adam fixed up my tire. Then, it got even better.  He talked to me about my bike. (I love bikes but I adore my own; it's a favorite topic.)  Adam is invested in working with owners; it's important to him. He's got some awesome training and is a great teacher.  It pays off immediately.  For instance, I was cursing this year's epic potholes for my popping tires, which Adam didn't contest.  But he also explained how the type of tires I had (skinny, vintage touring) are more likely to pop and how the air pressure plays in. I felt like the smartest kid on the block and now understand how to pick tires for the appropriate city. I took the opportunity to talk with Adam about a short list of items that needed tending. (Seat, racks, locks, lights, etc.) I'd gone to the store a couple times but the sticker shock made me realize that Suze O  would want me to process - ask myself, are these things that I needed or that I wanted?  Adam, who also has a store in Bridgeport, broke out a catalogue and helped me order everything I needed (wanted) at prices that Suze O would ok.  (I replaced a my roommate's light for $12 bucks less than she paid, etc.) Adam used a rad device to scan my credit card, sent me a receipt immediately and delivered the items to my house when they came in. Since that epic Sunday,  three of my friends have asked Adam to work on their bikes.  I've learned more about Adam's approach, training and gotten to know my bike better. So, give a ring!  Have fun.  Enjoy your bike!  773-355-0882Email: adam@pedaltothepeople.com

25.description: What a great idea--bike repair comes to you. I recently moved downtown, leaving my neighborhood bike shop behind. I blew a tire on the lakefront and faced having to go quite a distance to get it fixed. Instead I called Adam, and he pedaled over with his cool bike shop on wheels, promptly did the repair, and took my credit card to pay his very reasonable charges.  Adam loves bikes and helping riders and it shows. Great experience...highly recommended. Love the name too.

12.description: What a great service, I'm super impressed.  I'm a fair weather rider who gets an annual tuneup, so my bike really doesn't need anything fancy.  I saw Pedal to the People on YouSwoop and gave it a shot.  I mean, HE COMES TO YOUR DOOR!  How great is that?Adam, the owner and operator, is super friendly.  He chatted happily as he cleaned, tuned, oiled and generally did some reassuring poking around my bike.  He educated me on some safety measures and looked at a couple of things that are not part of a regular tuneup (my speedometer and air pump) at no extra charge.  He was very helpful, trustworthy and didn't push me to buy any upgraded services/parts.  Great job Pedal to the People!

21.description: Adam is a solid person with solid skills.  My green Schwinn is happy and so am I.  Thanks YouSwoop, for introducing me to Pedal for the People.   The prices are comparable to any shop but he travels to you which makes it a super sweet deal.

16.description: A note of caution: I am the kind of person who buys her bike from a sketchy guy in Danville. This sketchy guy may or may not know why the brakes are acting funny. Luckily, Adam totally does!Adam showed up with his mobile bike service contraption and went to work on my front lawn. I was a little worried my landlord would be upset, but Adam explained that this was part of his advertising. And as he worked, people stopped by and asked questions. He helpfully answered their questions as well as mine. Now my bike works great! If only Adam could give me confidence with riding on the scary city streets...was that included in the YouSwoop?

17.description: I heard about Pedal to the People through a You Swoop a while back. I held on to the coupon for a while and it eventually expired. I got a flat tire and called to schedule an appointment. Adam honored my coupon and provided incredible service. He arrived at my building and I brought my bike down to his fully stocked mobile workshop. He walked me through each part of the tune up and taught me about the different parts on my bike. I learned a lot about how to maintain my bike and keep it in great shape. Adam was very friendly and fun to talk to. After he was finished, I took the bike for a spin and it felt brand new!! He tightened everything up and the bike rides beautifully! He has a true passion for his work and it shows. I will definitely be calling Pedal to the People for my next tune up. Thanks Adam!

10.description: Got the "Sampler" and a new set of wheels for my bike last week. Adam rode over and was able to do the job in about an hour. Was very friendly and answered my questions during the service. Gave me free inner tubes. I'm now riding to work daily and enjoying my bike. Excellent service, easy booking process online. Highly recommend!

11.description: i got a flat on my way to work this morning and didn't have time to fix it - i locked my bike up at the nearest train station, and then started to run through all my options. none of them were good. I could take the tire on the super crowded rush hour train. uh, no. get my husband to fix it? we really didn't have the time. walk  it to the nearest bike shop? that would take forever. then a ray of light hit me and i remembered pedal to the people! i called adam, and he came and fixed it while i was at work. it was like magic! most times i'll just fix my own flat, or my husband will be nice enough to do it - but today, i was super glad that adam existed, and that it all worked out as smoothly as you would hope it might.also, his prices were reasonable, and i could pay over the phone, which was super easy.

26.description: Thank you youswoop for introducing me to Adam and his amazing business!  I've had a bike sitting in my garage for 3 summers and when I finally decided to start using it this summer there were a few things that were definitely off.  Enter Adam and his magical bicycle cart!  He showed up right on time for our appointment even though it was a torrential downpour.   Luckily I had an empty garage he was able to work in.  In 1 hour he had my bike pedaling like a charm, gear issues fixed, tires inflated, good to go for some long rides along the lakeshore path.  Not only is he super convenient, he does a great job and is super friendly and helpful.  I would not hesitate to recommend his services to anyone!

27.description: If you like your bike and you like riding it save Adam's number in your phone. Adam is very personable and helpful throughout the entire tune-up/flat repair/etc. I got a YouSwoop for a tune-up and wasn't sure what to expect. I'm a newer city rider and didn't know very much about my bike. Adam was able to explain many different features I wasn't aware of on my bike and show me what's adjustable. Although Adam had a catalog for additional parts (helmets, baskets, lights, etc) he didn't push any purchases on me, which was great because I wasn't ready to make any decisions. Overall it was a great experience from yet another up and coming Chicago startup. If you have a bike you should call Adam... whether you get a flat tomorrow 3 miles from home or if you just need a tune-up!

0.description: Great guys.  My bike broke down thanks to a large pot hole in the loop.  I was lucky to bump into Adam while walking my bike down Randolph on my way to dinner.   He fixed my bike in minutes (I was in a hurry) & I had him come back to my office the next day for a proper tune up/repair.  I'll definitely use them again & cannot say enough great things about these guys!

20.description: We had a great experience with them. It couldn't have been more convenient with it being at the house. The tuneup was was thorough and Adam was super friendly. Highly recommend!!

19.description: The name says it all - Adam brings his bike servicing station to you. My apartment building hosted him this weekend and I was able to have him do a diagnostics test for any issues, pump m'tires, lube the chain and give me little hints and tips to keeping my bike fresh and bad to the motha flappin bone. He charged me $5 which for some might sound steep since the air is free at all bike shops and the can of lube probably costs less than $5, but I appreciate the service and love to support a good biz. I almost want to ghost ride my bike down a hill so I can bring it to him to fix it!

2.description: My bike had been sitting in storage for 10 years, I have no car and no bike repair close by. Heard about Pedal To The People on DNA and made an appointment. Adam was great, friendly and professional; tuned up my bike right in front of my building. Bike rides like dream. Incredibly reasonable rates for door to door service. Highly recommended.

18.description: Seriously.  Adam is great.  I'm new to biking.  I ride a boys mountain bike that has been sitting in my parent's garage since 1995.  I decided to take it home with me when my mom asked me to throw it in my Jeep and take it to goodwill.It seriously needed a tune up, but I was sort of embarrassed to take it to a bike shop.  The handle grips are made of duct tape...  Its rusty....  Its a tweenaged boys bike.  (I'm a short girl, it works great).My biggest fear was that they would try to sell me a bike at a bike shop.  I secretly love my bike, you know, like you loved your first beater car.  You didn't care if you backed into a mail box, or someone dinged you in a parking lot.  Someone would have to be real desperate to steal my bike....and honestly I couldn't be too upset if they did because its so awful.But...I love it regardless.  I purchased a tune-up through you swoop and made my appointment.  Adam sent a text and asked if he could come a little later, he was running behind.  You have to realize with what he is doing, he can get a little backed up.  If a bike needs a little extra TLC, or traffic sucks etc.  But it was totally OK with me.  I didn't have to "come back later"...I just sat around.Anyway, Adam is amazing with bikes.  I sat and talked to him for the whole tune up.  He can carry on a full conversation (and actually listen) while working on a bike, without slowing down.  He certainly knows bikes. He really just wants to bring cycling to everyone.  He's not about getting rich.  Just making a living doing what he enjoys.  He is just as excited to teach you how to fix your bike, as to have you pay him to do it.  He has no problem giving the "secrets" away.  That's what's great.  He loves this, and honestly wants to bring it to people.He wants to eventually have bike "workshops" at his shop where people can come in and learn how to work on their own bike.  As someone new to riding my bike in the city (~1 month) I was glad that I didn't feel like I wasn't "cool" because of my beginner status, or shitty bike.If my bike needs repairs...pedal to the people it is!

13.description: Call Adam for U-lock removal .  much less pricey than locksmith.  he will cut your u-lock off in 5min

4.description: Like everybody who rides pretty regularly in the city of Chicago, a few weeks ago my bike tire was stolen. It sucks but it happens. I had a spare tire at home so I lugged it to where I left my bike to fix it.  What do you know?  Pedal to the People is set up right there. Not only did they attach my new tire but gave me a full tune up and some much needed sympathy. Now my bike is chugging along better than before. I got my gears greased and my brakes tightened, the whole deal for a reasonable price. Great friendly service. I highly recommend them

24.description: I bought a bike last summer that I don't know much about. At all. Rode a couple of times, and just when I was getting comfy with it BLAMMO! Flat tire. Too demoralized by my complete lack of bike knowledge to bring it to a bike shop, I hung up my wheels for the winter with a single tear of defeat. As the weather's been warming up, I've been working up the courage to drag my poor bike to a shop and confess that I don't know anything about it.... until today. I came out of my apartment to find Adam and his mobile bike shop helping someone else from my building. I told him about my predicament, and, even though I didn't have an appointment he kindly agreed to fix the tire! He was so kind and patient with me, explaining how my bike works and answering my questions. He even adjusted my brake pad things (you can see I've really mastered the bike lingo) so that they are no longer on there backwards. He knows so much about all different kinds of bikes, and really knows what he's doing!! He is the definition of convenience (he even accepts credit cards!), but also provides great service. I will definitely be calling him again!

6.description: I scheduled this service online the day before. Adam came to my building right on time riding his garage on wheels. He served me the Platter Deluxe Tuneup. I have a 2010 TREK FX 7.3 which had been left outside for several weeks, thick dirty buildup everywhere, shifts non-functional, break pads gone. I used my bike daily for work-home commute. OMG, I have an amazing bike again that rides like NEW. He even changed my winter tires to summer ones for the same price! And the whole process was under 90 minutes.Adam is very personable, professional and thorough. I highly recumbent his service. By far worth every penny compared to any other service shop.

22.description: What a great service, I'm super impressed.  I'm a fair weather rider who gets an annual tuneup, so my bike really doesn't need anything fancy.  I saw Pedal to the People on YouSwoop and gave it a shot.  I mean, HE COMES TO YOUR DOOR!  How great is that?Adam, the owner and operator, is super friendly.  He chatted happily as he cleaned, tuned, oiled and generally did some reassuring poking around my bike.  He educated me on some safety measures and looked at a couple of things that are not part of a regular tuneup (my speedometer and air pump) at no extra charge.  He was very helpful, trustworthy and didn't push me to buy any upgraded services/parts.  Great job Pedal to the People!

15.description: Pedal to the People is an awesome service.  My bike needed to be rescued (dummy lost the key to my cable lock) and required some basic TLC / a tune up.  I scheduled with Adam online a day in advance.  He was on time (in fact, called to say he had a cancellation and could come earlier.)  He provided great, efficient service and is a nice dude to boot.  Freed my bike, sold me a replacement lock at a discount, gave me a tune-up - all for a crazy reasonable price and within about 30 minutes.  I will absolutely utilize Pedal to the People again - and recommend them to anyone.  Totally beats finding a shop, dropping your baby off and hoping for the best.

7.description: I had my bike shipped from Brooklyn to Chicago and it showed up in pieces that I could not haul to a bike shop on my own. I googled and found Pedal to the People. He showed up and put the bike together in my foyer! Really nice guy and did great work! I just popped a tire and will be calling them again to help me out!

8.description: People are always asking me how I can ride right through the winter, but after being bike-less for nearly two days in a crazy busy week my question would have to be how on earth I'd manage NOT to! I was in a bit of a panic when I started having problems with my brakes, wondering how on earth I was going to get to a bike shop to get it fixed. Finally I remembered someone mentioning Pedal to the People and am so glad I tracked them down. Called mid-afternoon and got an appointment first thing the next morning. On time, quick, friendly, knowledgeable, and gave me plenty of tips on tweaking the brakes next time I have problems. Thanksgiving is saved (I can get to the store for supplies!), and I'm going to be able to pick up my bridesmaids dress before the tailor closes so I won't be hopping on a plane in two days without it!!I'd give P2P six stars if I could...

30.description: Wow! What an excellent service and intelligent business model! I love this door to door service. Adam was great, professional and got my bike all fixed up. Thanks Adam!

3.description: I had a tuneup done by Adam the week of Jan 15th. I left my bike with him (as opposed to having him pedal to me) and he took the time to explain everything he was going to do.  After he was done with the tuneup he gave me a point-by-point sheet explaining everything that was done.  Top notch service.  This was at their 2030 W Hubbard location.  My only question is when are they going to hang a sign outside?!  That should bring in more business.

14.description: Heads up - this is not just a glowing review.   There is an agenda here.  I want you to call Pedal to the People.  I hope you work with Adam soon.  Why?  Because I love bike people.  I love bike culture.  I love when people start to get into riding.  Maybe they decide to go along the lake more frequently or (even more exciting!) to commute to work.   So, if you are reading this review - chances are that I already like you.  I want you, someone I like, to have a great, positive experience that will make you enjoy biking even more.  And, that's what you'll get if you call Adam. If you are already entrenched in the bike community, you'll be psyched for some qt with one of your own.I met Adam on Easter Sunday.  I was walking down Damen, carrying a wheel. (It's tube just popped near Armitage.)  I was on the phone, grease up the elbows, bummed I just missed getting to the store on time.  Then, Adam, a bike angel, rolled by and asked if he needed a hand.  Behind him, I-kid-you-not: a mini-repair-shop, attached to his bike . If that sounds dramatic, it kinda was - in a great waySo, Adam fixed up my tire. Then, it got even better.  He talked to me about my bike. (I love bikes but I adore my own; it's a favorite topic.)  Adam is invested in working with owners; it's important to him. He's got some awesome training and is a great teacher.  It pays off immediately.  For instance, I was cursing this year's epic potholes for my popping tires, which Adam didn't contest.  But he also explained how the type of tires I had (skinny, vintage touring) are more likely to pop and how the air pressure plays in. I felt like the smartest kid on the block and now understand how to pick tires for the appropriate city. I took the opportunity to talk with Adam about a short list of items that needed tending. (Seat, racks, locks, lights, etc.) I'd gone to the store a couple times but the sticker shock made me realize that Suze O  would want me to process - ask myself, are these things that I needed or that I wanted?  Adam, who also has a store in Bridgeport, broke out a catalogue and helped me order everything I needed (wanted) at prices that Suze O would ok.  (I replaced a my roommate's light for $12 bucks less than she paid, etc.) Adam used a rad device to scan my credit card, sent me a receipt immediately and delivered the items to my house when they came in. Since that epic Sunday,  three of my friends have asked Adam to work on their bikes.  I've learned more about Adam's approach, training and gotten to know my bike better. So, give a ring!  Have fun.  Enjoy your bike!  773-355-0882Email: adam@pedaltothepeople.com

3.description: Even the Feng Shui squad shrugged and walked out.  Only the owner  knows where anything is, and she's not telling. Once inside, you find a little calm in the organized chaos. After all, anyone who sees you in here would have to be here themselves, right? And suddenly, there is it, like a true destiny moment: that discontinued shade of lipstick you've been pining away for. You buy a case and borrow a mirror. You can hardly wait to wear your red badge of courage.

1.description: I'm not quite sure how this place functions. I came in here several times and apparently there's a hidden system of being able to call and hold products. I purchased a gift for my mom from this place and there was a promotion where they give away hair dryers and wristlets for designated items. There's little flexibility when the product runs out. If the products run out then the promotion is basically over. I rarely see this place packed. The service is pretty much out of question for me. I'm not a professional and apparently asked stupid questions. They gave me an insulting look that sliced my face off....I did purchase quite a few items though.

2.description: You may miss this very tiny location tucked into the strip mall here, but it is definitely work a quick stop.  They cater mainly toward the gazillions of hair salons and barber shops in the area, but you can find some good deals for personal grooming as well.  I found a brand name ceramic straightening iron, and an ionic hair dryer for both under $25 each (The retail prices on both were over $55 each).  They also have every hair dye color that is known to man.  I think I will be trying pink streaks next week!   And they have an assortment of cosmetics and nail products as well.  Like I said the shop is tiny, so the aisles are very narrow, and very cluttered.  The customer service is friendly, that is when you can get their attention.

0.description: I received great customer service here (well I was the only customer in the store at the time) by the associate. She assisted me with selecting a permanent hair color along with a developer. In addition, she explain the mixing process of the two. She reviewed other colors I could select from if I wanted a lighter color. The store was clean and well organized and the check out counter was not cluttered with cheap items to buy (cluttered check out counters really annoy me). I was offered to join the Sally's Club for $5 and was explained the savings program. I chose to join the club and have the opportunity to recoup my $5 within a month on items in the store. The store is located in a strip mall next to Ace Hardware. They have a huge shared parking lot which is great. My only tif is that the OPI nail polish did not have a price but the other brand selections such as China Glaze had prices. Not sure why it was not priced, but I was considering buying it but skipped it due to this. I may go back and use my $5 credit for the polish before it expires. I do recommend this location because they have a great selection of hair and beauty products.

3.description: Project Onward is one of the gems in Chicago's cultural crown. Next time you're near Millennium Park, stop in to the Cultural Center to see the gallery and studio. Whether you've been before or not, you'll wonder how you stayed away for so long.

1.description: Feel the creativity, feel the love!  This place is doing great work helping great people make great art!  Start a collection now!

2.description: Located on the first floor of the Chicago Cultural Center (free admission).  This place is so cool -- it's a studio/gallery for artists with developmental/mental disabilities.  You can purchase things ranging from notecards to having your own portrait done by one of the resident artists.  It's neat to catch a glimpse of the artists' workspaces, too.

0.description: I ended up at the Cultural Center today and stumbled upon the Project Onward studio + gallery on my way out.  WOW, what an amazing place!  The artwork is unique to each artist - many focus on a certain theme or style.  I was admiring an awesome Jimi Hendrix piece on the wall (sadly, far out of my price range) when the artist greeted me and told me more about his work and how he got started.  His focus is memorial portraits, which he began 7 years ago after experiencing a loss of a family member who was close to him.  I felt touched that he shared his story and passion with me.There is definitely something in everyone's price range - many $10, $20, and $35 pieces (many on corrugated cardboard - interesting!).  Others were in the hundreds, like the Hendrix piece I was admiring.  I ended up going back and picking up a $20 Chicago-themed piece for my new apartment.  70% of sales go back to the artist.As another reviewer said, you also see some artists at work.  Their stations are seemingly as unique as the artwork.  The artist who uses glitter...wow!  Loved that station!I spoke with one of the managers on my return trip today, and he said they have around 40 artists.  I'm looking forward to telling some of my students about Project Onward as well.  Overall a very positive place focused on community and art appreciation.

29.description: The go to place for drunk food in Bridgeport, it's super cheap and you get a lot for your money, Ive had the cheeseburger, hot dog, fries, chicken nuggets and the mother in law (chili on a tamale) all were great and hit the spot, always look forward to going

42.description: since I'm local and i love greasy food, i just have to try this place out! the kitchen looks really small and kind of dirty from what i see standing by the window.. they have a pretty big menu selection to order from... i have came here a total of 2 times because i was pretty disappointed the first time i came here..  1st time i came i ordered the chopped steak sandwich and it tasted like a cheap quality hamburger... 2nd time i ordered the breaded steak.. the red sauce taste weird, mozzarella didn't look or taste like anything like it , the red sauce was ok...and the meat was weird with a few pieces that i have to spit out because it was very chewy..... i had given this place a chance already and it still disappointed me... i rather drive a little farther and get me some Maxwell's or something...

23.description: It was just OK but I will happily give them 2 more stars than I intended based upon their phenomenal customer service.... So my husband and I stopped by one night after work and ordered a bunch of food and all of it was good, not amazing, but nonetheless it was good cheap food. We wanted to check it out because they were featured on TLC for having the best sandwich in the country, the "Mother-in-Law" So if you YouTube this segment, you will see customers telling you this sandwich causes pain.... Helllllllo heartburn. I basically chugged a gallon of milk throughout the night trying to sleep. Mother-in-Law is a beast of a woman and a sandwich. Not my mother-in-law though, she is amazing. (Ha ha) So anyway, the customer service.... this wretched beast of a woman ordered $3 worth of food and left.... She returned about 15 minutes later complaining of cold stale fries and a flavorless Sierra Mist. The guy at the counter made every effort to appease the gal and she acted like he had personally shoved her grandmother down a flight of stairs. Seriously, she was LIVID that she had surely been purposely mistreated due to her race and this guy handled it like a champ! We watched in horror as she threw her fries at his cook and demanded to know if she would eat such disgusting things. You ordered a deep fried pizza puff and french fries, made a huge scene, scared pedestrians walking by, and threatened to call the police over this injustice.... He not only refunded her money, he remade her whole order and smiled THE ENTIRE TIME!!!! It. Was. Golden. I shall return with Mylanta in tow!They also serve breakfast!

47.description: Great place! Stopped in yesterday for the first time. Everything is super cheap! Amazing value.  They have a fairly large menu for a hot dog stand and its open 24hrs! I just moved into the neiboorhood. The employees spent ten minutes pointing out all the great local spots to check out.  I think I found my new liquor store/hot dog stand.

8.description: We ordered a chili cheese dog and burger, and both were pretty darn good! The prices are very reasonable and the people were nice. The only downside is the location, which seemed like a bad neighborhood and we had to drive in circles to find parking. Great #StreetMeat though so I'm happy!

31.description: Saw this place on netflix, decided to try it out.  Came here with a few friends on New Year's Day and got "The Mother in Law". It was very delicious. Messy and greasy, it was exactly what I wanted. The Johnny himself was here and made us feel very welcome. Very awesome place, I would recommend!

34.description: I love this place and come her at times when I visit my brother in Bridgeport.  The mother-in-law is awesome! And many of nights I keep thinking about that Mother-in-law and want one so bad.  The hotdogs and sausages are very good and their fries are great.  And did I mention they are 24-7!?

16.description: This place is ultra friendly and the food is actually prepared with care. Loved the old school atmosphere and back room area. Def. a reliable place for iconic Chicago eats.

13.description: Stopped in to the dining room this afternoon for lunch. Double cheeseburger & fries for $3.99 is hard to beat. And while it isn't exactly gourmet fare, it was right for the price.Thumbs up to the customer service. Because it was my first time there, I had no idea where the "dining room" was or how to order. You have to give your order at the counter in the liquor store, pay, and then go around the corner and up the stairs to where the tables are. The woman at the counter was very nice and polite as she explained what I was supposed to do. And as a bonus, I met whom I assume is Johnny O himself, who was a very nice guy (and if I hadn't been in a hurry to get back to work, I woulda chatted with him some).

11.description: Good decently priced food. Johnny o is extremely nice and they have been rated all over! Had the Chicago dog and it was delicious!

39.description: Probably my favorite greasy terrible for you double cheeseburger in the city. I work a block away from it and have to restrict myself from going more than once a month as that is the path to an early death but otherwise check these guys out if you pass them by, it's a neighborhood institution.

37.description: When it comes to dives, these guys are one of my favorites, namely for the experience more than anything. The food is pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary. They flaunt their Mother-In-Law tamale, but their real bragging right lies in their breakfast plates. Big portions of your favorite bacon, eggs, toast, etc. combo places, and they're not shy around the frier. What makes this place so cool though is the fact that they really do care about their customers. Every time I go in, they seem to remember me, and I always end up having long talks with the manager. He pointed us in the direction of a killer art gallery and some other pretty cool places to check out. If you really get him going he'll even hook it up with some free food every now and then.

0.description: Johnny O's...O how I love you.Get the chicken nuggets. They're homemade and they're fucking awesome. They also have the best BBQ sauce to go with them.Hot dogs, fries, and cheese sticks are all great as well. And oh yeah, you can get 20 fried shrimp with fries and a pop for about 5 bucks...yeah, they're popcorn shrimp, but delicious nonetheless. Their walk up window is open 24/7 and has saved me on many drunken nights. This is just a cool, old school spot that I hope never goes away. Now go give them your money!

38.description: Another place I make my sister take me to whenever I visit her in Chicago. This place is definitely a great find and the greasy dive thing really works for them. They serve up the classics...chili, hot dogs, burgers, fries and steak sandwiches...they also serve tamales which it is very hard to find a tasty tamale this side of the border. And everything is DIRT CHEAP...so even if you don't like one thing its no big loss...you can go ahead and buy something else and it won't set you back too far. Located in Chicago's south side we have to travel a tiny bit to get there but it is worth EVERY mile we go. The mother in law sandwich is where it's at...and at 2 bucks and some change you just can't go wrong. I leave off the onions(I am not a fan) but the flavors with the chili and the tamale really please my taste buds. My sister got a double cheese burger and I had a bite and they are really juicy and the flavorful as well. But of course if you are going to go to Johnny O's you must get the mother in law. Other places serve it but it's not as good as Johnny O's. It's also a great local, mom and pop place so the atmosphere is friendly and cozy. I make my sister take me here the first time I arrive. Sometimes we go for two meals in a day..I can't really say I know many places I would have multiple meals daily at...Johnny O's is the exception. It's also a liquor store if you need to get your Jack Daniels or Smirnoff refill.

27.description: Had the mother-in-law today. I learned about this while watching some "10 Ten Food" documentary on Netflix. The documentary had me thinking about the mother-in-law all week. It was pretty good, but a little overrated in my opinion. Very creative though considering I love Tamales! One of the owners took my sister and I in the back to chat while we waited for the food. Told use all about the history of the place and that part of Chicago. Items Purchased:Mother-in-lawCheese SticksItalian Beef

32.description: Jonny was in the restaurant with us and making sure we had a great experience. The mother in law was delicious.

48.description: Good food, cheap. Friendly staff. Work relatively close so I call in my orders and they have it ready within 5-10 minutes depending on how busy they get. Have a ordering window right on the street, so you can walk up and continue on your way. Convience is key when in a hurry.

44.description: Much closer to my apartment than CVS. Plus great prices and quick service.

24.description: Review for occasional late night Breaded Steak sandwich. While I've known the family since a little over knee-high I heard review on WGN late-night and have to agree about regarding Johnnie O's (go to) Breaded Steak with red sauce and like with hot giardiniera.  As a local i would like to Johnnie O's to see John and Sons (Alex and Pete) his sons (5 stars) as Alex's comedic short bits are that making stopping by for convenience(day store) and fun. Thankful to Johnnie O that there's a 24 hr place to grab hot dog special etc and early hours 7ish am til 10pm lotto tickets and conv store/beers/soda staples.  I've read and heard reviews were talking about stand not Greek Islands Drake and Palmer House food nor their prices though JO and Sons and  Crew are quality good people and would be missed by many if they weren't around.  Support local Ma and Pa businesses as it keeps community stronger and their uniqueness is something franchises lack in character.

7.description: It was just OK but I will happily give them 2 more stars than I intended based upon their phenomenal customer service.... So my husband and I stopped by one night after work and ordered a bunch of food and all of it was good, not amazing, but nonetheless it was good cheap food. We wanted to check it out because they were featured on TLC for having the best sandwich in the country, the "Mother-in-Law" So if you YouTube this segment, you will see customers telling you this sandwich causes pain.... Helllllllo heartburn. I basically chugged a gallon of milk throughout the night trying to sleep. Mother-in-Law is a beast of a woman and a sandwich. Not my mother-in-law though, she is amazing. (Ha ha) So anyway, the customer service.... this wretched beast of a woman ordered $3 worth of food and left.... She returned about 15 minutes later complaining of cold stale fries and a flavorless Sierra Mist. The guy at the counter made every effort to appease the gal and she acted like he had personally shoved her grandmother down a flight of stairs. Seriously, she was LIVID that she had surely been purposely mistreated due to her race and this guy handled it like a champ! We watched in horror as she threw her fries at his cook and demanded to know if she would eat such disgusting things. You ordered a deep fried pizza puff and french fries, made a huge scene, scared pedestrians walking by, and threatened to call the police over this injustice.... He not only refunded her money, he remade her whole order and smiled THE ENTIRE TIME!!!! It. Was. Golden. I shall return with Mylanta in tow!They also serve breakfast!

49.description: I roller-bladed around Bridgeport today, and when we went past Johnny O's the cheap hot dogs caught my fiance's attention.  We stopped for a snack and got 2 hot dogs, 2 fries (maybe 1 set split into 2 packages?) and 2 bottles of water for just about $5.  That is a really great deal.  The hot dogs were good all beef dogs.  The fries were fresh.  All in all the food stand is a really great deal.  I think I will try to avoid this place on future trips, otherwise my fiance will want to stop again.  (And I don't really need to eat fries while I'm out getting some exercise).

40.description: my man working at 3am today was the best. he was telling me about being in the vietnam war, getting ass, bench pressing 575, and some other stories. Good guy. Anyways, I just got a beef taco, not the best, but it was big as hell and cheap.

30.description: What a lovely place.  I just moved in down the street and was looking for a cheap place to get some cheese fries and a dog.  I also had some homemade chicken nuggets.  These nuggets are not the kind where processed, ground up chicken is put into a meat-mold to look like a "nugget" like they do at McDonald's.  They're full chunks of chicken that are hand-breaded.  The owner, Johnny O, was in the restaurant and stopped to chat with me.  Just a genuine, awesome person...told me about the history of the neighborhood, about the process of unwittingly getting mentioned on various TV shows, etc.  Even the clerks in the convenience store portion were friendly when I got a pint of vodka to go!This place is charming and I will definitely be a regular here.  Next time I'll have to try the infamous "mother-in-law."

46.description: Good select of beers and awesome guys and gals behind the counter.  Breaded steak sandwich...yum! I also liked their polish.

1.description: Super nice guy at the counter.Made the sandwich while I waited. I had to have the infamous Mother-in-Law. Unique sandwich that's for sure. I destroyed it!Great fries too.

9.description: Ohhh, Johnny O's, thank you for being across the street for all my drunken and/or hungover meals. No, this is nothing fancy, but if you want a super cheap deal for pizza puffs, chili dogs, or a bacon egg & cheese, this is the place to go on 35th.  Also, it's like a bodega.  You can get beer, liquor, and other random corner store items in a pinch.  The staff is also pretty friendly.  Thanks for always hookin it up!

26.description: Johnny O's looks like a dump from the outside but there's more than meets the eye. Picture a place that's part liquor store and part hot dog stand. They make one delicious double cheese burger - everything includes sport peppers! And they're even open 24/7. This place is one of the neighborhood go-to spots after the White Sox clobber whoever. Long live O's!

25.description: The food here is great, and Johnny is a really nice guy to talk to. The location looks sketch, but it gives you a classic, old feel when you go inside the place (there is a restaurant inside). Highly recommended for hotdogs!

12.description: I love you Johnny O's, and for so much more than just the Mother-In-Law!  If you're from the area, I'm sure you've heard of their famous MIL sandwich featuring a tamale/chili concoction (proudly noted on their sign, "as featured on TLC!").  I highly recommend trying that before anything else here, but oh is the rest of their food good.  Inside Johnny O's is actually a small food and liquor store where you can load up on snacks and drinks for your crazy night.  This portion of the store closes at 10 PM, but Johnny knows you'll be back at 3 in the morning to the 24-hour takeout window attached to the store!  In the back of this main area is also a very cool, retro dining room, usually showing local sports and news.  Johnny is there during the day, be sure to meet him, he is a real swell guy and a proud owner (started slingin' dogs when he was 12!).  I can't review this place without mentioning their beef, too.  Dipped beef with hot giardiniera became one of my most eaten foods (unfortunately) after discovering this place.  Throw in a nice 40 oz. of King Cobra from inside and you, sir, have a meal.

21.description: Great breakfast sandwiches and OK coffee. The people are super friendly and you can order ahead to make picking up at the outdoor counter really convenient.

17.description: My colleagues and I went to Johnny O's today for the first time today, and it was awesome! I had the famous Mother In Law, he had two chili cheese dogs, and she had the chicken sandwich. Johnny was kind enough to come by and talk to us for a few too. He's a great guy and he has stories for days! You can tell he genuinely cares about his customers too. We will definitely be back in the future.

10.description: What can I say that hasn't already been said. Well, here, it's open 24 hours and serves some of the best dogs and pizza puffs and fries in all of Bridgeport. I walk my dog here and they love him. Their outdoor seating is a great place for a quick bite or to hang while they make your food. The staff are really cool and always remember me when I come by. I am so glad that I finally tried them!

5.description: So I just ordered here , she was soooo damn happy about her work , but then I got this .... Look at picture , I saved a few buck after the ball game to have some good food . But God I could had died. I've herd of medium rare stakes and what not but pork chops? Might as well ask for a damn raw chicken . I'm actually really upset about it it cause I love this place , I guess they though I was drunk n send me off with this bomb shell . Tsk tsk , food is my life yo

3.description: While in Chicago we wanted to try Johnny O's! We ordered an Italian beef sub with fries. This was an awesome tasting, messy, finger licking good sandwich! The owner - Johnny O himself came out to say hello and chat with us. What a friendly crew - great service!

35.description: I just had the breaded steak and I was pleasantly surprised.  I know the polish, dogs and breakfast sandwiches have always been great but I went out on a limb and I'm glad I did. Apparently Johnny O can do anything.

19.description: My experience here was not very good. We even gave it a try another time and our second experience is not good either. I will say this the best thing about Johnny o's is their zucchini chips they are excellent. I had chicken wings from here that were just okay and the fries that came with them were disgusting I don't know if they needed to change the oil but the oil taste was very strange. I also have a cup of soup from here that made me very sick and had me throwing up. I was sick all day long.

28.description: My experience here was not very good. We even gave it a try another time and our second experience is not good either. I will say this the best thing about Johnny o's is their zucchini chips they are excellent. I had chicken wings from here that were just okay and the fries that came with them were disgusting I don't know if they needed to change the oil but the oil taste was very strange. I also have a cup of soup from here that made me very sick and had me throwing up. I was sick all day long.

45.description: After my first trip to Johnny O's I can confidently say: 'Alex, you will be seeing a lot of us....' My son says this is the best Bridgeport burger yet, and he is already asking when we can come back to eat pancakes at the picnic tables. I am thrilled to have found a place where I can pop in for a bottle of pinot grigio, a six pack of goose island,.AND a giant pickle. Thank god for Johnny O's. I will never have to step foot in the skeezy Bridgeport CVS ever again.

33.description: You have to try the house made chicken nuggets!!  Great for breakfast, too...not the nuggets, but their breakfast menu! ;)

43.description: Decided to come give them a try:Cheese Fries - These were ok.Fried Mushrooms - These were nice and cispy.Mother in Law - I only had a little and thought it was ok, but not really my thing.Chopped Steak Sandwich - I didn't have this, but I was surprised it looks like a hamburger.Italian Beef - We got this with sweet/hot giardiniera. My cousin and BIL split this and they both thought it was pretty good.Breaded Steak - I thought this was more tender than Rico's, but think it needed some sweet pepper or something to give it that extra kick.Overall, everything was good and the prices are right. Glad they are open 24/7 and not too far from me.

2.description: JOHNNY O's!!!This place rules. Truly old school Chicago fast food done right. Gotta get the chicken nuggets they have there! Real pieces of chicken homemade goodness. Me personally, i go with that, a pizza puff meal, and a lil half pint of whiskey from the liquor store. Cant go wrong!!!!

18.description: Great Chicago Personalities from all of the staff and Great Chicago Food. Go for the Triple Burger!

41.description: Good for a late night snack. Food is very good, but the menu sates all sandwich come with fries and the last 2 times i went there I did not get any fries with my hot dog and the person at the counter just argued with, so a little piece of advice if you want fries make sure you mention it.

50.description: This place cracks me up!  I had to try it because I have been told by more than one life long Bridgeport resident that Johnny O can do anything and is the neighborhood resource for all things (security systems, side walks shoveled, hot dogs, liquor, etc.).  I have purchased wine and beer from their convenience store, they have a nice selection; and I stopped by the window counter along 35th Street to order 3 hot dogs with fries for something like 5.99 - crazy cheap.

4.description: After reading all of the yelp reviews, I decided to hit this joint on the way home from Comiskey. It was cute, really, a reminiscent of the ol' lean to's of days past. The cashier lady was really nice and polite, though the cook looked at me like I slapped his Momma. Speaking of Momma's, I brought mine, since we attended the "Mother Son" Sox game. We agreed that we needed to tackle a couple of MILs, and I wanted to try their regular hot dog and fries. So!Service was quick and polite.The MIL was okay. I love the uniqueness of it, but my particular tamale was barely luke warm. I will give it another go sometime after I've had a few more brewskis.The regular hot dog was disappointing. I'm a sucker for poppy seed buns and celery salt. Theirs has little circle pickle-thingies too, which kind of scared me.Their fries were hot and fresh!Overall, I love the ambiance of this little shack. Also, the price is right, this place is cheaaaaaaap. What a welcome relief in this day and age.

6.description: Well this place was a let down!It has all the hallmarks of a good hot dog place, but when it comes to the product, the hot dog was just average. I asked for celery salt, and got none. There is no cucumber offered like some of my favorite places, and finally the fries were a huge miss. They were pretty much tasteless and way under-cooked. I could do a better job with frozen fries for Oreida. All in all a big disappointment..

22.description: Had a hot dog special here on Tuesday, October 21 for the princely sum of $3.81, including tax. Hot dog was good with somewhat slim trimming, but the gargantuan amount of fine fries and soft drink made up for it nicely. After walking through a store I made it up some steps behind a counter to sit inside the restaurant seeing news by Fox...It was a very special Bridgeport experience and well worth a stop at 35th and Morgan.

15.description: The mother-in-law sandwich was superb as well as the breakfast combos (great portion sizes too) but what really made this place special was the owner and restaurant's namesake, Johnny O. My friends and I were in town for the Taste of Chicago and staying in the Pilsen area. While visiting the attached liquor store, another staff member mentioned that the restaurant next door was great and that the MIL had won several awards and had even been featured on TLC. He invited us back for breakfast or lunch the next day and we are all so glad that we took him up on that offer. After taking our orders, we began to converse with Johnny and learned that one of his staff members had family in the part of Kansas that we're from. He offered us complimentary fountain drinks since we ordered so much food. By the end of our dining experience we had developed such a relationship with Johnny that he gave us all menus signed with our names and a message of "good luck, good health, and safe travels back to Kansas." As a foodie and lover of hole-in-the-wall gems, this place is at the top of my list for the food and hospitality.

20.description: This place is ultra friendly and the food is actually prepared with care. Loved the old school atmosphere and back room area. Def. a reliable place for iconic Chicago eats.
