36.description: Johnny O's is my main place for drunk food after Maria's or Bernice's, or if I'm too lazy to go buy groceries.  As a liquor store it's pretty poor.  The booze is overpriced compared to CVS, especially if it's refrigerated (yes, they charge more for cold beer.)  But as a greasy food joint it's fantastic.  Cheeseburgers, dogs, fried shrimp, breaded steak - it's all there.  The best part is it's open 24 hours, so no matter how debaucherous your night has been, Johnny O's will be there for you.Protip: call your order in ahead.  If you order $5 or more they give a free can of pop, $10 nets you 2 cans of pop.  I think if you call in orders over $15 they start throwing in free dogs too, but I'm not entirely sure about that because when I'm at the point that I'm ordering $15+ worth of Johnny O's, I'm definitely not going to remember that night.Edit: They have discontinued their free pop deal.  Kind of bummed about this.  I gotta drop them down to 4 stars in the hope that they'll see this and reinstitute the policy.

14.description: My go to corner store/beer store/good greasy food that's bad for me but oh so good to me place. It's quick, it's greasy but it's cheap, it's a Johnny O's triple cheese burger. I love this place. Staff are all great , always treat you nice every time you go in. They are reasonable prices on beer and smokes bearing in mind they are a small business. Love it!

12.description: Do you want a tattoo that you will love the rest of your life? Go here. Fong is an ARTIST. If it's going to be on you forever you want the best not good enough. Prices are totally affordable.  Other artist Tony is super nice too!

3.description: Amazing job I went in for a cover up and fong nailed it. If you want an amazing piece of art go here !!!!

1.description: Yesterday was my first time having Fong do my tattoo and I can honestly say I am 100% satisfied. I showed him a picture of this lotus that I wanted done on my neck and even though he sketched out a different kind of lotus it still looked so good. He was very quick and attentive. My tattoo only took about 45 minutes. It came out so pretty I'm still obsessed about it haha. Will definately be back!

2.description: I came in as a walk-in with a friend of mine. We didn't get tattooed by the head artist, but one of the others who work in the shop. The artist took multiple smoke breaks between tattoos (with no visit to the washroom to wash his hands) and smelled of smoke the entire time he tattooed me. He also kept calling me "princess".Any lines that were supposed to be straight were anything but.But the worst part of the entire experience is that he MAJORLY blew out my tattoo. I could tell it was going to happen the moment he did it. He went way too deep into a pretty basic line, and I'm very unhappy with the whole thing.

9.description: Great overall experience. This was my first i was a little worried but after walking in and a short conversation i was felt at home.  All of the artists seem very skilled.  I was really impressed by the cleanliness of of the location and the artists.  I came in with an idea but after a short discussion they improved on my original vision.  The tattoo they did for me was AWESOME! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!  Thanks again guys!

10.description: Fong is an awesome artist! Came in on recommendations from several friends who have had work done by him, when I asked them about tattoo artists who were good with more traditional Chinese designs.Facebooked in the area on where my cover-up would be going along with some general info. The next week my outline session was set and Fong had basically pulled my tattoo out if ny brain! When he tattoos you, he is good about making sure you're okay. Can get dry during the process, so if you are ticklish, BEWARE! Usually I don't notice anything until the end of my session nears  (5-6 hours). Fong has a lot of patience for all my stretch wiggles, book dropping, and bagel chumping as he tattoos me, which is FAR more than what i can say about some previous artists. One more session and my tattoo will be complete! So far it is stunning and everyone has gone from the "omg! That had to hurt" face to the amazed face.  I have already told them they need to head here and see him, let's hope they listen!Very clean shop, very friendly, good work, and EXCELLENT prices!Anyone who would say otherwise, clearly should head north for the more expensive and less friendly shops!Best to find the shop on facebook and send in a heads up so when you go in to talk he will have some ideas for you. DON'T BE A NEWB! If you come in all confused,  chances are, if I am tthere, I might be laughing at you in my head. Tattoos are forever (unless you go through more pain to remove) so get the tattoo you KNOW for sure that you want to live with....oh and bring snacks if you're in for a long session! Never get inked hungry or on pain killers, while drunk or stoned! You just make your artist's life difficult. :D

4.description: Got my first tattoo done here by Tony. Great environment and awesome people. Would recommend it 100%. I'm sure coming back soon.

6.description: The worst tattoo ever! I came in with a pic from his own gallery and he couldn't find the stencil he previously used. Since he couldn't find it, he told me to choose a different font. I chose a one. He started the tattoo and when he was done and showed it to me in the mirror it wasn't clear. He had to go over it. Well after the tattoo healed, the ink bleed together and it became a mess! I emailed them on FB he ignored me. So now I am here to warn you.

0.description: Fong is an amazing artist, after receiving my first tattoo from him I went back for another one in a different style and he nailed it. He specializes in many different styles. The place is clean with a bunch of tattoo books/magazines to browse if you're waiting for a friend. There's also a TV strategically placed so his customers can watch TV as they get tattooed. He's very patient with people who have never gotten a tattoo and never rushes, ensuring high quality.So far I've went here 4 times, definitely satisfied each time and can't think of going to another tattoo shop.

5.description: After hearing so many good feedback about this place, i finally made a visit to get my tattoo done by Fong. The tattoo i choose was a rose with my grandma name wrap around the stem. I was unsure how it would all fit together, but Fong took his time and drew several samples. It was my first tattoo and Fong took his time to explain the process to ease my mind.  The samples were all very detailed and better than i could have imagine it. Fong is a talented artist that does not over charge.

13.description: Very well done! I've been looking for a good tattoo shop to fix my horribly done tattoo. Tattoo Union did just the thing. Fong is a AWESOME artist. He covered up my tattoo with exactly what i wanted. He didn't give me the run around like some other places did. He told me exactly how my new tattoo would look and i'm completly satisfied. I would recommend Fong! He's definitly your guy you want to do any type of tattoo.

11.description: This place is dope! A clean Friendly environment and great artists! Highly recommended.

8.description: It was my first time to tattoo. I did had a great time there in Tattoo Union. The artists there were professional and patient. I strongly recommended the founder of this shop----Fong L to help you finish your tattooing.

14.description: Excellent service & artistry, Tattoo Union is much more than meets the eye.Enter inside the small store front at the SE corner of S Halsted & 26th & you find yourself at once in a standard tattoo parlor. Their artists are anything but standard; they are friendly, steady-handed & gifted at their craft.I visited with my brother to get matching tatts & we both had the pleasure of having our work done at the same time.Tattoo artist Jose did my work; he was efficient but thorough. My tatt called for small lines & Jose's steady hand saw to it that my tatt was perfect.I am very pleased to have a new tattoo from this excellent South-Side Chicago establishment.

7.description: Went there for what I thought would be a simple compass rose tattoo and left with something I extremely regret. My artist was Tony, at the time I didn't know he wasn't the main artist, so I thought all the good reviews was for his work as well. It seems I had the same problem as another reviewer that his lines were shaky and didn't have points to them. Also the whole image was unsymmetrical which really bothers me because I believe that's unfixable. Currently looking for a way to salvage this.

1.description: I've been a religious client of Nanda's for close to 2 years. I see her every 2-3 weeks to get my lashes refilled. I would never dream of going anywhere else!I'm not really sure what I could add that other Yelpers haven't covered, but she's so amazing, I feel the need to reiterate it all!Nanda is super warm & engaging. I ALWAYS fall asleep in less than 10 minutes, thanks to the perfect music & white noise. Nanda has such a gentle touch that it is impossible to stay awake. She's just the best, as good as it gets. Make an appointment - you won't regret it. :-)

9.description: I've been seeing Nanda religiously now for 2 years and I'm proud to also now call her a friend of mine. Nanda branched out from Spa on Oak and started her own business but still rented a room from them. Now she has finally gotten away from that mess and is renting a room from O Sixty Five. She is still her own entity and is still running an amazing business, despite all of the challenges that can occur when you're running your company from someone else's space.This girl can do everything - facials, lashes, waxing, the works. Not only have I been seeing her over two years but now MULTIPLE of my girlfriends swear by Nanda's magical hands. She does an amazing job with lashes and I am constantly getting different facials from her - oxygenating, dermaplaning, exfoliating, whatever we're in the mood for that day. She is funny, sweet, and knows her boundaries. Some days all I want to do is chat while she extends my lashes and other times it's nice just to have some peace and quiet and Nanda can always tell what sort of day that is. Her space is friendly, warm, inviting, but also sterile and clean. It's so comfortable to be in a room like that with a person like her. She has become a good friend of mine but  even if she wasn't, I would still tout her services to anyone who will listen. I'm so happy she's out on her own, doing it big, and making all of us just a little more beautiful.

23.description: yayyyy I love Nanda! She has been doing my lashes and my facials for over TWO years now! my how time flies. She does an amazing job and her prices are amazing. making an appointment with her is always so easy and she's very flexible with her hours. Check her out! You wont regret it :)

25.description: Nanda is amazing! I have been going to her for facials for 2 years. She really knows how to give some TLC to your face! Every time I have left my face felt like a baby's bottom. Plus, she is easy and fun to talk to! I would never go anywhere else for my facials!

12.description: Nanda rocks. I've seen her for a year and even had her do facials and lashes for everyone at my best friend's bachelorette party. Every single girl who went in raved about how relaxed and good Nanda made them feel. Everyone was literally glowing. Nanda has a way of making your natural beauty shine through. I highly recommend her (especially getting lashes with her).

21.description: Moved my review over from Spa on Oak, You should make an appointment immediately, Nanda is amazing!! She doesn't try to sell you anything, and you should just let her pick which facial is best for you, she will do the perfect combo.  And if you have ever been curious about lashes, you should let her do a set for you, I have had them for almost a year, they are addictive and they are so fun, plus you always look like you have makeup on.  She does the best job for the most reasonable price, and the best compliment is everyone thinks they are my own! styleseat.com/nanda

16.description: yayyyy I love Nanda! She has been doing my lashes and my facials for over TWO years now! my how time flies. She does an amazing job and her prices are amazing. making an appointment with her is always so easy and she's very flexible with her hours. Check her out! You wont regret it :)

17.description: I absolutely love Nanda!!!!  I can't imagine my life and lashes without her!  She does an excellent job and has graciously come to my rescue when I've had a lash emergency.    Try her once and you'll be hooked!

10.description: Nanda does an absolutely amazing job with lashes and facials. She takes her time and pays attention to every detail. I highly recommend visiting Nanda!

5.description: Nanda is the best! She's got the magic touch. Seriously, she does the best lash extensions in the city! She plays cool music and makes the whole experience so relaxing. I fall asleep every time and then wake up feeling like a celebrity. She can give you a natural look or going out glam. I couldn't be happier with her work. I refer all my friends and colleagues to her and they all feel the same way! She's really sweet, cool, quick, professional, and super good!Highly recommend!;)

11.description: I stumbled upon Nanda almost 3 years ago and I haven't left her since!  Not only does she keep my eye lashes on "fleek" but she has also become a great friend.  She's fantastic at what she does and is the sweetest and most kind-hearted person ever.

22.description: Nanda is by far the most amazing esthetician Ive met in a long time... her facials are inredible and her lash extensions are to perfection!She is a face magician...she is a lash wizard...you are so fresh faced and photoready after your time with her...you leave with fresh dewy skin and lashes to die for... you are ready for anything...she is truly an artist...and as if her fantastic work wasn't enough to make you keep coming back...she is the sweetest, most down to earth girl you would ever meet.

0.description: I go here to get my eye lashes done and could not be happier with the services and the quality of the work. It is very easy to book appointments both online and in person.  I get many compliments on my eyelashes and I wouldn't go anywhere else to get them done. I tried a few places before here and they never looked both good and not fake until I came here.Location is very convenient, and prices are very reasonable as well. I am very happy I found Nanda and am looking forward to trying more services!

20.description: I've been seeing Nanda religiously now for 2 years and I'm proud to also now call her a friend of mine. Nanda branched out from Spa on Oak and started her own business but still rented a room from them. Now she has finally gotten away from that mess and is renting a room from O Sixty Five. She is still her own entity and is still running an amazing business, despite all of the challenges that can occur when you're running your company from someone else's space.This girl can do everything - facials, lashes, waxing, the works. Not only have I been seeing her over two years but now MULTIPLE of my girlfriends swear by Nanda's magical hands. She does an amazing job with lashes and I am constantly getting different facials from her - oxygenating, dermaplaning, exfoliating, whatever we're in the mood for that day. She is funny, sweet, and knows her boundaries. Some days all I want to do is chat while she extends my lashes and other times it's nice just to have some peace and quiet and Nanda can always tell what sort of day that is. Her space is friendly, warm, inviting, but also sterile and clean. It's so comfortable to be in a room like that with a person like her. She has become a good friend of mine but  even if she wasn't, I would still tout her services to anyone who will listen. I'm so happy she's out on her own, doing it big, and making all of us just a little more beautiful.

19.description: Moved my review over from Spa on Oak, You should make an appointment immediately, Nanda is amazing!! She doesn't try to sell you anything, and you should just let her pick which facial is best for you, she will do the perfect combo.  And if you have ever been curious about lashes, you should let her do a set for you, I have had them for almost a year, they are addictive and they are so fun, plus you always look like you have makeup on.  She does the best job for the most reasonable price, and the best compliment is everyone thinks they are my own! styleseat.com/nanda

2.description: Thanks to the strong recommendations from Yelpers, I can't be happier about my lashes!  Living in Gold Coast, one should probably get used to paying high prices for everything but not if you go to Nanda; you'll walk out feeling confident and not feeling guilty about it.  Say goodbye to Ardell lashes that I constantly worry if the ends are detaching from the lids looking like two caterpillars crawling on my eyes and no more mascara that makes it looks like I only have 5 eyelashes all sticking together... ack!  Many people get turn off by lash extension fearing it damages their natural eyelashes causing it to break off.  I don't blame them since I've been there but only because the esthetician does a bad job attaching the extension, which becomes itchy and irritating so you rub your eyes a lot and ending having to pull the extension off.  With Nanda's mad skill, they don't shed easy and your natural eyelashes continue to grow with the extensions on top of them.  Give it a try and you will not be disappointed; you'll wake up looking refreshed as if you already applied makeup!  While at it, add-on a facial from time to time since Nanda offers amazing combo price and your skin will love you for it.  Nanda responds super fast to appointment requests and/or questions so what are you waiting for?

18.description: Nanda is by far the most amazing esthetician Ive met in a long time... her facials are inredible and her lash extensions are to perfection!She is a face magician...she is a lash wizard...you are so fresh faced and photoready after your time with her...you leave with fresh dewy skin and lashes to die for... you are ready for anything...she is truly an artist...and as if her fantastic work wasn't enough to make you keep coming back...she is the sweetest, most down to earth girl you would ever meet.

13.description: I've heard of people not having a good experience with lash extensions at other salons. But if you go to Nanda, she will take care of you and you will love your lashes. I also had never gotten a facial ever until this past year and again, Nanda, made it so relaxing and it felt great. She educated me on my skin and when I need to get facials, etc... I have a lot of anxiety and it's hard for me to relax I even felt nervous before going in for the facial, but it was AMAZING!!!

4.description: Had my lashes done by Nanda for the first time this week. I'm super impressed! At previous places, my eyelids would be itchy throughout the service (to the point of being uncomfortable) and I experienced none of that with her. She was very quick and she used the perfect lengths. Her book fills up very quickly, so I definitely suggest booking your appointment in advance -- I've already booked my appointments every three weeks into September! Prices are very reasonable, which is very hard to find in this area -- especially for someone who has Xtreme Lash training. You are cheating yourself if you don't go to her!

24.description: Five stars+. Nanda simply is the best. She is an outstanding esthetician. I highly recommend Nanda for all of your lash and skincare needs.

6.description: My friends have been going to Nanda for years, and after lots of sun and sand this summer, my face needed some major love. And love it got. Why has it taken me so long to see her?!Nanda is incredible! I think I said "I feel like a new human being!" when she was finished with my facial. My skin is bright, firm and glowing the day after. She was kind on the extractions, and the entire experience was heavenly.Recommend highly!

15.description: Got reconnected with Nanda in 2012 after getting a facial from her from Peace Spa back in 2010!  Now she's the only facialist I am consistently happy with. The room she rents from Salon O Sixty Five (a hair salon) is cozy and full of Nanda's personal touches.  She uses very natural products and truly customizes her facials.  She doesn't just use whatever products based on what skin type I say I am.  I usually try to go when the seasons change, and she uses different products according to how my skin is during that season!  Two things that must be noted that differentiate Nanda: 1) She doesn't position the steamer so that the steam is going right up your nose, making it uncomfortable for you to breathe (trust me, many facialists do this without knowing!), and 2) Her blackhead extractions are nearly painless.  Anyway, you can easily book an appointment with her via StyleSeat.  She does facials & lashes.  I highly recommend her!

7.description: Best eyelashes in Chicago. If I lived here I would go all the time. I was here visiting and needed to get a fill, and truly they were amazing and beautiful. Thank you

8.description: Nanda is incredibly nice, professional, and does such a great job!  And I believe her pricing is very reasonable.  She makes the whole experience really wonderful.  Thanks Nanda!  See you soon!

3.description: Nanda is amazing !!! She got sick the day of my appoinment so we rescheduled it for the following week. (She is super good at answering texts)She did an amazing job with my skin, played the most relaxing music and the facial ended up being free (for the inconvenience). Isn't this amazing? I won't go anywhere else from now on.

14.description: I've had a standing appointment with Nanda for over a year and cannot imagine going anywhere else! Not only is she thorough and professional, she goes out of her way to make sure you're comfortable and pleased with the results. She's a pro when it comes to lashes and offers amazing facials! Nanda's pricing also keeps me loyal! She even makes her own lavender sea salt scrub that she gave away during the holidays and it was heaven!! Do yourself a favor and get to her ASAP!

58.description: Such a fun atmosphere! Definitely an up-scale, modern Mexican restaurant. The food was great and service was spot on. Margaritas on the rocks were well worth the price. It's so nice to see such a thriving restaurant, especially during lunch hours.

56.description: One of my favorite Mexican Restaurants. My favorite is Chicken Gordita's... so crispy and delicious, with a side of rice and beans. The margaritas are also great, great amount of tequila in the margarita.

29.description: I debated on 1 or 2 stars. The complete dining experience is not to be had here. I cannot express enough how bad the service is. I have several instances that I could refer to. Trying to compartmentalize the experience I will separate the service from the average food. Carne Asada deserves a mention, but nothing else on the menu. I have been a customer for the last 15 plus years, but with so many other choices I will never be back.

42.description: I visited this restaurant for the first time a couple of weeks ago.  I enjoyed their tacos Al Pastor, steak taco, and gordita de carne asada.  In order to receive the traditional taco with only cebolla and cilantro, you must request it.  I was disappointed when the tacos arrived with lettuce and cheese toppings.  I returned the following day and ordered the tacos with only cebolla and cilantro.  The taste made a big difference for the better.  The queso fundido with chorizo is a must have.  The menu includes Buffalo Wings...don't ask me why.  That particular item made me a little skeptical at first.  The quality of the meat is great.  No free refills with Iced Tea.

23.description: Good food good prices good delivery never ate at the actual restaurant. Got the chicken burrito which tasted good but could have used more sauce I felt the burrito was great.

47.description: I love their Tampiqueña! It is nice and tender and they never disappoint. Well worth the price.

8.description: Good food but way overpriced.  I feel like they nickel and dime you for every little thing.

31.description: Packed on Tuesday, lucky to get a table right away. The frozen margarita was strong! I saw another lady ordered it, but w/ 2 flavors! I'll def do that next time. I got combo plate and it was AWESOME! Steak is their signature item for sure. We also got the shrimp soup - it was very mild but loaded with shrimp.

34.description: This place has become my go to when in Bridgeport. Guacamole is on point and the serving sizes are perfect for the price. The frozen margarita is my favorite!

16.description: This is where I had my first date with boyfriend so it'll always have a spot in my heart. I got the chicken fajitas and and he got the enchilada dinner. Both were great. The service is good too. They were happy to greet you and they were fast with our food. We came back for Valentine's day and we will be going there this weekend.

13.description: So here's my story and I hope everyone reads it. My friend who has been a patron of this establishment for 10+yrs was accused of "walking out on a bill". The owner himself said that he has them on video walking out on a bill. I know what you're thinking, this has to be a huge bill. Wrong, this is a $16 dollar bill we are talking about people! My friend could not believe that after years and years of going to this restaurant that they would be accused of such thing. Of course the owner offered to "show the tape" and once my friend agreed he declined. Yes, maybe there was a mistake on the bill but last I checked it's the servers job to make sure it adds up. After I heard of this I have urged my friends and family to boycott this place. Thanks for reading.

11.description: It is good good good prices and the place feels warm and welcoming. The margaritas they have taste good. I have had the burritos and they are good

39.description: Their margarita was very good! Delicious. The place is clean and staff is friendly.  The food was decent but it didn't leave a great impression on me so I don't think I'll be returning.

37.description: Ordered steak queso fundido and they charged $4.00 more.  I was given the one with chorizo I had them deliver the right one to the house and she asked for the chorizo one back. Just wondering what they did with the one I have them back. This place has the worst customer service.  Surprised it has the business it does.   Go to Gio's Mexican.  Good food and great customer service.

0.description: Living in the Bronzeville neighborhood, it's difficult finding any decent Mexican restaurants south of Pilsen. You can imagine my excitement when I discovered Pancho Pistolas being not too far from the area in Bridgeport!Pancho Pistolas is not far off the Dan Ryan Expressway, which makes it easy for me to pick up food to-go on my way home from work downtown.I've eaten here a few times now, and have yet to be disappointed. I usually get a steak taco dinner, where you get the option of onion/cilantro, tomato/lettuce, or both. As an appetizer the Coctel de Cameron (Shrimp in a cocktail sauce, filled with diced onion,avocado, fresh cilantro.) is a great dish to share.I highly recommend checking out the house specials section of the menu, as the skirt steak that comes with the Carne Asada is phenomenal.

38.description: What I love about this place is that it's just a pretty typical Mexican place, but they are always SWAMPED with customers. Bridgeport supports its restaurants like no other community. I had no idea this place had an upstairs -- and it's even bigger than the downstairs area! On the weekend, both floors will be totally packed. This place only gets 4 stars because I think all Mexican places should have at least 5 different types of meat for tacos. This place does not. But their tampiquena is so good that it doesn't matter.

51.description: I'm from the Northwest side and I travel all the way here for the Mexican food,  that speaks highly of this place. We originally started coming here this past summer after watching a White Sox game and now just come when we have a taste for some delicious food. So worth the drive. The restaurant is small, contemporary,  and has a small bar.  The food is pretty authentic. They are best known for their huge burrito.  I tried but I had to share there was no way I could finish it.  Now I get the chicken tampiquena. It's a large portion and comes with salad, tortillas guacamole, a cheese enchilada, refried beans, rice,  grilled scallions and jalapeno. It's now my favorite entree and I have enough for two days.  I've also had the hochata and omg I absolutely loved it.  It's sweet, but not to sweet and just enough cinnamon. I've also had the strawberry margarita.  It's just like I like it,  nice and strong. To finish off,  I had a slice of tres leches cake. The slice is small but great after a large meal. Parking is mostly metered on 31st street. You can park one the residential with the exception of game day. The wait staff is pleasant. They don't overdue it with checking in on you, but notice when you need say another glass of water or more salsa. I definitely recommend coming here if your in the area. Great for a date, after a White Sox game,  or an outing on the Southside.

27.description: The strawberry/peach margaritas are the best. I love the steak burritos, the meat is well seasoned and tender. I visit this place regularly with family and friends. Highly recommended.

32.description: More like 3.5 stars. It's times like these I wish there was a half star rating. This is a casual, clean corner eatery with a few tables for outside seating in the summer. Service is quick, and lunch time usually draws a crowd, they do get full. You get complimentary chips along with a pico de gallo and a salsa. They are fine, but I prefer mine with a little more heat. They make the chips there which is a plus. The margarita's are good! They go down too fast and smooth. I ask for the strawberry/peach combo. The chicken fajitas and steak tacos are my usual and they are good. The steak, even though its's skirt is a quality steak. Not tough or stringy and seasoned well, sometimes a little too seasoned. Just a bit. The beans are fine, the rice on the bland side. That you can skip. You can also ask for your tacos to be made with cebolla and cilantro instead of the Americanized version with lettuce, cheese and tomato. Great for a quick or longer lunch with good quality Mexican food and great frozen margarita's. What you won't get here is greasy or sloppy food. You'll get quality meat and leftovers for home because the portions are large.

54.description: The Margaritas are killer and the food is excellent. Well worth a visit.

48.description: Let's go 3.5 stars at this joint.... Awesome Chips/Salsa to start out.. Really fresh!  Inside is nice and warm/ comfortable.  Ordered the Carne Asada which was good but portion size was a tad on the small side.  Great Beans/ OK Rice/ Great Jalapeño Pepper!  Hated the cheap flour tortillas, you can usually judge a Mexican Joint by the tortillas and these are horrible!  Only drawback of the whole meal.  Service from Vanessa was outstanding! Get Dat Did

44.description: Love this little Mexican spot. Great Food, Great Ambiance you wont

24.description: Came here with my friend because we wanted to avoid traffic in the city. I chose poncho pistolas because they had semi decent reviews. We chose to sit outdoors because it was a pretty nice day.  I ordered a chimichanga since I haven't had one in quite awhile, and my friend ordered the chicken tostadas.  They serve complimentary chips and salsa, I enjoyed the pico de gallo very much.  The food here looked very tasty, upon delivery and tasting of it I was completely underwhelmed, the food had great texture and was warm, but just completely tasteless.  I don't think they used any seasoning at all. I don't think I would come here again, because the food didn't impress me one bit.

7.description: This is a nice cozy quaint little spot family friendly. The first time I went the Tilapia Tacos were amazing. The pitcher of Mango Margaritas were good, even with the house tequila. The second time I went the tacos were a little on the dry side, but the shrimp tacos were good. I would go back because the service is prompt and the staff is very friendly.

49.description: I liked the place. Its on a convenient location, ambiance is nice with two floors so hardly any space problems. Service is quick and staff is courteous.Food is good but not many vegetarian options. They serve complementary nachos though :)For people who like spicy food it might be a little bland...overall nice place to go.

40.description: I had a taste for fish tacos, a friend suggested this place that's suppose to be "authentic Mexican" I'm not Mexican however I do know that, that's as far away from the truth as Mexico is from Chicago. Anyway I ordered my tacos and was anxious to get back to my office to devour them. I was EXTREMELY disappointed at the Hard fried fish strips and shredded cabbage on awful dry flour tortillas. Needless to say my friend that suggested this overpriced imposter of a Mexican (authentic) restaurant has some making up to do (a lot) and I will never step foot in this place again...

53.description: This is one of the nicest Mexican food joints in the Bridgeport area. This food here is kind of unique and authentic. They have good sangria in house. Nachos and Guacamole rocks ! their Jalapeño poppers are good as well. Their Gorditas & Chiles Relleno are one of the best tasting foods. Fajita wrap and Burrito is something you choose if you are really hungry.The quality of the food is very genuine and tastes really good. Some times you will a decent wait time to get a table in the weekend. Especially during winters. Don;t forget the fried ice cream for your desert. It just tastes awesome !! I really miss the place after moving out of this area.

30.description: Our order has been incorrect 3x in a row now and the quality is poor. This used to be our go to spot. What happened Pancho's?

46.description: I decided to check out Pancho's one night on a whim and I'm glad that I did. it was pretty good.I arrived with a friend about ten minutes before 5pm. The restaurant was crowded and there were only two tables left up front by the window. The hostess informed us that the adjacent second floor area would be opening at 5pm and that we could wait if we preferred. We waited and was subsequently seated just after the five o'clock hour.You have to exit the first floor dining area and walk next door to get to the adjacent second floor. Once inside you walk upstairs to a large dining area. The restaurant has a warm, inviting atmosphere and nice decor. Our waitress was wasn't extremely engaging but she was pleasant and efficient. I'd originally ordered the combo platter that consisted of tacos, tostadas and an enchilada. I don't like enchiladas so I'd asked for two tacos and one tostadas instead. But the waitress came back and said that she was informed that no substitutions were allowed. Huh? You mean you can't substitute an enchilada for a taco?? Seriously? That makes absolutely NO sense to me. What difference does it make? Since I wasn't allowed to make the substitution I changed my order to the taco dinner. I ended up getting the three beef tacos with rice and beans.The food was hot, fresh and flavorful. My only complaint is that the rice was a bit salty. My friend ordered the flauntas and he liked his food too. We also had margaritas which were delicious. Based on my first impression of Pancho's I'd most definitely go back.

1.description: Ordinary at best.Ordinary everything.Chips: hard, rough and oily.Salsa: nice.Picco de gallo: good.Guacamole: meh to the max.Carne Asada: nothing to write home about.Enchilada: blah.soft tortillas: felt cheap store bought.Jalapeno battered with flour and cheese inside: awful.Service: nice and friendly. Thanks.No idea what the fuss about this place is all about.A Mexican restaurant, so flavor unfriendly.

55.description: Food was pretty good. I ate it so quick I forgot to take a picture for the review. Food seems authentic and fresh. Servers were very nice. Prices are great as well.

9.description: In my neighborhood so I stop by often. My favorite thing from here is anything with the AL Pastor in it, tacos , burrito whatever. It's the best meat that I have tried, you won't be disappointed. Also the margaritas are delish. Enjoy.

26.description: Soo disappointed. This place used to be amazing. I'd always get the burrito dinners and they would be huge burritos so I'd get my money's worth. Last few times I have came, I ordered the same thing and the burritos have gotten smaller, a lot smaller, but the same price. 2 burritos for $23; howver, when I went to San Jose I could get 4 burritos of the same size as Pancho's for the same price - $23 and they are just as good. They also started skimping out on the avocado and add wayy too much beans where I could not even enjoy the meat. Never going there again.

25.description: I was told I was going to get corn tortillas. I was served flour tortillas. And the service was good and so were the margaritas. I just don't understand how they get away with charging so much money. This is not authentic Mexican food and is way way way overpriced. Myself and my date ate one taco dinner +2 gordita's +2 margaritas equals $58. Disgusting! These people should be ashamed of themselves charging so much money. I'll never be back being that I can get authentic food at way cheaper prices at a billion other Mexican restaurants in the city.

12.description: More like 3.5 stars. It's times like these I wish there was a half star rating. This is a casual, clean corner eatery with a few tables for outside seating in the summer. Service is quick, and lunch time usually draws a crowd, they do get full. You get complimentary chips along with a pico de gallo and a salsa. They are fine, but I prefer mine with a little more heat. They make the chips there which is a plus. The margarita's are good! They go down too fast and smooth. I ask for the strawberry/peach combo. The chicken fajitas and steak tacos are my usual and they are good. The steak, even though its's skirt is a quality steak. Not tough or stringy and seasoned well, sometimes a little too seasoned. Just a bit. The beans are fine, the rice on the bland side. That you can skip. You can also ask for your tacos to be made with cebolla and cilantro instead of the Americanized version with lettuce, cheese and tomato. Great for a quick or longer lunch with good quality Mexican food and great frozen margarita's. What you won't get here is greasy or sloppy food. You'll get quality meat and leftovers for home because the portions are large.

59.description: Panchos is the best! Their steak is always well flavored and on point! Their margaraitas are the best hands down, and you definitely can't beat the price!

21.description: A great place. Portions are large and the waitresses are nice. Been there several times ,food is always consistent. Known for their carne asada.

17.description: I will definitely be coming back. Nice environment with a large selection of the classic Mexican selection.  Our waitress was a little neglectful but it did t ruin our evening. There is no parking lot so you have to drive around the neighborhood a bit to find street parking.

10.description: Very good food in a great neighborhood.  Every dish and drink we have ordered thus far has been delicious. Awesome spot for a casual dinner when I visit my daughter and son-in-law.

5.description: Worst service for a single client if they have 4 seat tables available they make wait for a 2 seat table, very rude, food is very average nothing great, but service the worst service in all my restaurant experience.

3.description: I don't know how a Mexican restaurant can churn out dishes that lack any flavor whatsoever, but somehow Pancho Pistolas manages this remarkable feat.A breakdown of tonight's steak taco salad:Steak - no flavorTomatoes - no flavorRefried beans - no flavorWeird oversized shell/bowl - no flavorAvocado- no flavorSour cream - no flavorLettuce - no flavor (in fairness, iceberg lettuce doesn't really have much flavor to begin with)Even the salsa added little spark to the dish.  I'm slowly beginning to realize that if you want good (or even decent) Mexican food, you should head a bit south to Pilsen, cause there's none to be found in Bridgeport.

35.description: I have been here before and the food has always been good.  however tonight was not so good.  normally the salsa given with chips is somewhat spicy and tasty.  tonight it was diluted with too much tomato and was not spicy at all.  when I asked the server if they had any other spicier salsa. she said that was the hottest.  she said they had a green sauce but was not spicy.  I decided to try it only to find out that I was charged $1.50 for the additional sauce.  I ordered the taco dinner vegetarian.  my suggestion is to grill some veggies such as peppers,  onions,  mushrooms, etc...  instead it came with more rice & beans which already comes on the plate.  lettuce, tomato, sour cream, guac and cheese.  honestly I hate complaining about too much food but the tacos were impossible to pick up and eat without getting very messy.  keep it simple with the suggestion I made and cilantro & onion like an authentic Mexican taco should be.  finally the bistec a la Mexicana was great as always according to my father.  service is always great.  one more recommendation * they have Agua de Jamaíca but is not on the menu.  I may come back since it's close to my house and usually quick in and out.

19.description: Good service... Urban upscale decor...best of the best margarita. I'm always happy with the steak tacos our fajitas. Definitely a regular spot.

28.description: I've been coming here for years and the service we received tonight was poor enough to keep me from coming back. We waited for ten minutes for a waitress who only came to our table after she waited on people who walked in after us. The meal came quickly; however, two out of the three meals were wrong. We ate in two shifts because we had to wait for the food to be corrected. They sure didn't skimp on the bill though and charged full price even with all the mistakes!! When I expressed my disbelief, the nonchalant attitude is what angered me most. Plenty of other options in this city and they just lost a loyal customer.

45.description: This is where I had my first date with boyfriend so it'll always have a spot in my heart. I got the chicken fajitas and and he got the enchilada dinner. Both were great. The service is good too. They were happy to greet you and they were fast with our food. We came back for Valentine's day and we will be going there this weekend.

33.description: Not bad. Kind of expensive for a Pilsen mexican restaurant.

43.description: Such a good place. Good food and good service. I highly recommend the carne asada.drinks are very good as well

2.description: A place we like to go to treat ourselves!My husband has lived in Bridgeport his entire life, and when we started dating he made sure to take me here. The food is always outstanding! Try the jalapeño poppers, which are my husband's favorite. I switch between the chicken gordita dinner or their tilapia tacos - both are filling and delicious!But the real reason we go there, is for the drinks! Their margaritas kick my butt everytime! We always order a pitcher for the 2 of us (gets you about 2-3 glasses each) and it goes down waaaayyy to easy! I'd also recommend their Sangria which is so refreshing and sweet.A bit pricey, which is why it's only a place we go when we want to treat ourselves but sometimes we just can't help it!

18.description: Such a good place. Good food and good service. I highly recommend the carne asada.drinks are very good as well

41.description: I have been to this place multiple times and it has never disappointed me. Whether it is two people or in a large group, it is always a nice experience. The staff is always so friendly and nice. The food is great and in large portions. The combo platter is a nice option to try for first time visitors. The fried ice cream is good but way too sweet for my palate. The place is quite good, and love the ambiance, and the price is actually very reasonable. Definitely will recommend it.

52.description: Tried twice this month to have a change of heart here. The first time we went this month I thought that things changed, but I was wrong the second time I took a chance on this place this month. The fajitas had little meat, servers are rude and want you to leave ASAP. Also, the place doesn't have a hostess stand, but I hear that customers are punished when they seat themselves. Goodbye.

50.description: Hot staff, but overpriced crappy food. Pretty much everything here is overpriced, but their drinks are good. Try Carbón on 26th instead-their tacos and burritos are much better, and they're more affordable!

4.description: Came here with my friend because we wanted to avoid traffic in the city. I chose poncho pistolas because they had semi decent reviews. We chose to sit outdoors because it was a pretty nice day.  I ordered a chimichanga since I haven't had one in quite awhile, and my friend ordered the chicken tostadas.  They serve complimentary chips and salsa, I enjoyed the pico de gallo very much.  The food here looked very tasty, upon delivery and tasting of it I was completely underwhelmed, the food had great texture and was warm, but just completely tasteless.  I don't think they used any seasoning at all. I don't think I would come here again, because the food didn't impress me one bit.

6.description: I've lived in Bridgeport for a year and finally got around to trying this place. My boyfriend and I try as many new places as possible, Mexican food being a popular favorite. Needless to say we had high expectations. We were seated quickly & the margarita was good and strong. He got a chimichanga and enjoyed it. Aside from that nothing was really good. The rice and beans were the absolute most bland rice and beans I've ever had!Nothing is customizable. I don't eat meat so I tried to order 3 different things with either shrimp or fish, none of which were allowed. A bit frustrating.This place has nothing on the small authentic places in the neighborhood.

22.description: Snapshot:Food - Delicious, not greasy, good portion sizes.Cost - A tad bit high, but probably worth it.Service - Nice, made a big mistake, but fixed it.Recommendation : Everything's good, but the Bistec a la Mexicana is amazing!Recommendation: If ordering a large takeout order, make sure all food is accounted for before leaving.I came here on 8/23/2015. I ordered 4 things: a Chicken Taco Salad, Nachos, a Burrito, and the Bistec a la Mexicana. I was surprised that it cost me about $50 for those four items, I was hoping more around 35-40. I ordered the food for takeout, and it was ready very quickly. It seemed like a nice casual spot to sit down and eat, and they were busy when I came in to pickup my food. I paid for it, left, and went downtown to my event. When I got there I noticed they didn't give me my Bistec a la Mexicana! That was the most expensive item I had gotten, and it was very frustrating because that one was for me to eat.  I called and told them about it, and they apologized and said the cashier forgot to give me the second bag.  On my way back home, I went back to the restaurant (5 hours later) since they were open until midnight, I had to explain what happened again to the manager on duty since the person I talked to on the phone didn't leave any note for them. They almost tried to give me that same order that had been sitting out for 5 hours. But, quickly, the manager decided to refund my money for the Bistec a la Mexicana and remake it so that I could have it fresh. Since this was my first time trying this restaurant, I believe this was a good decision, and I appreciated the show of good faith. While I waited for them to remake the order, I was offered water and chips and salsa. The food was finished quickly and they apologized again for the confusion and mix-up. He promised that I would like the food.I DID! That Bistec a la Mexicana boosts my rating of this experience back up to a 4-star. (along with the refund and apologies). I'll more than likely be back to this place. It was spicy and well seasoned, dripping with flavor, and a good sized portion. All of the food was very tasty, and the people were nice. I would just recommend they modify their system of giving people their take-out orders, especially if there are multiple bags, and especially when they get busy.

15.description: Not bad. Kind of expensive for a Pilsen mexican restaurant.

57.description: Carne Asada is really the best Ive ever had. I ordered a Torta de Asada and it was delicious. Compared to other Tacos/Mexican joints like Zacatacos, Atotonilco or El Alpastor. This place is my new favorite Mexican restaurant .

20.description: I've lived in Bridgeport for a year and finally got around to trying this place. My boyfriend and I try as many new places as possible, Mexican food being a popular favorite. Needless to say we had high expectations. We were seated quickly & the margarita was good and strong. He got a chimichanga and enjoyed it. Aside from that nothing was really good. The rice and beans were the absolute most bland rice and beans I've ever had!Nothing is customizable. I don't eat meat so I tried to order 3 different things with either shrimp or fish, none of which were allowed. A bit frustrating.This place has nothing on the small authentic places in the neighborhood.

36.description: Great Food Great Service !!!!!!The chips and salsa was very fresh and good !I order the chicken torta sandwich. It was so good. Definitely recommend this Restaurant !!!

14.description: Worst customer service I've experienced I call to place an order for pick up and later decided I had to to eat in so I decided I would do that instead, but I was rudely denied by LIZ said that I could not stay and dine in!! When I asked to speak with manager her rude response was he's not available when I asked when would he be available she said don't know try looking for him another time...very unprofessional!!! THANKS LIZ!!! Keep up the great customer service !!!

28.description: I don't know that I would even give it one star. Awful. Sloppy. Dirty. Broken chairs and half ass job on nails. Polish came off the same night! Are you kidding? Never again! Go somewhere else! Don't waste your time or money.

1.description: Service was OK here. I came in when it wasn't that busy. Some things that got me questioning was the facial I received. It was itchy afterwards and I remembered my allergies from the use of safflower oil. I asked about the ingredients used and they ensured me that it was H2O products so I shouldn't have any allergies. They claimed it was the dry weather that caused my face to be itchy. I applied moisturizers on my face every morning and night and never had that itchiness before I came over for a facial.I also got a pedicure (no-chip) and it was OK. The color was nice. They do have a small collection of colors to choose from. Parking was easy to find since it was a cold day?I am not sure about coming back for anything more than a basic manicure or pedicure since I feel it is a tad overpriced for the amount of choices available here. I'm also questioning the hygiene since the floor and sofa was pretty dirty.

39.description: I love this place and have been coming here for a long time.  Staff is super friendly, and the facility is very clean.  I have always walked in with no problem, but the place can get kind of crowded at peaks times and they do take appointments.   The pedicures/manicures are well done and last for a while.    I love getting my eyebrows waxed here as well...they are very meticulous and it is well worth it for $8.  Highly recommend for those who like quality service at a reasonable price.

9.description: So i went on Valentine's Day to get my nails refilled and all I have to say is CRAPPY JOB! I went home after I sat and let my nails dry for about 20+ minutes, took a shower and they got completely messed up! They put too much clear nail polish so I had to take the nail polish off and I noticed how thin they had put the acrylic on my nail! It's completely sloppy and dented everywhere! I will NEVER go to this nail salon ever again! If I could put no stars I would!

29.description: Went here on a Sunday around 4pm after my regular place was real busy. I was seen by two different people for one manicure. I don't like being switched around. However, the girl who finished off spoke English so that was a plus.  Two stars only for these reasons-1. Had to ask for have my cuticles cut more 2. Bad job with the polish (maybe she was new)3. Base coat was used as top coat as well4. After all- the actual polish job was ehh, as if I had done them myself and the nails were rough on the edges.May not return. Sad, the place is actually pretty descent.

23.description: So I get a pedicures periodically and I have gone to plenty of nail spots. This is my favorite because they are always kind and remember me which in any business is a breathe of fresh air! My experience right now is beyond amazing so i felt the need to create an account and tell everyone!My flight was changed last minute to 7am vs 7pm so I have been cramming to get all my to do list done. I finally got home and noticed I forgot to get my feet done. I'm headed to Florida so I need to make sure I get my feet in order. I called at 940p and they were closed but Aimee the owner answered and as always she was beyond kind. I explained my situation and she offered to open the shop for me! What!?! Yes I am sitting here as I am typing this review 1005p and she is getting my feet together! Seriously more businesses need to be as customer friendly as this place!  They have gained a loyal customer for life. I can't guarantee your experience will be like mine but give them a shot to impress you!

5.description: This is place is the worst nail salon I HAVE EVER BEEN TOO!Pedicure was horrible, the girl didn't even clean my feet or apply my nail polish correctly. I complained to the owner, the owner blames my light colored nail polish ....my light colored nail polish caused my feet to still have dead skin??? So she said she would do my nails, I requested a no-chip. Not only was she slapping my hands and throwing them everywhere, she allowed my no chip to bleed into my nail beds and didn't clean it. I've gotten my nails done every week for oh so many years...I have never been treated so badly and experienced such horrible service. I would honestly advise no one to go here!Also they need to clean the place! Its dusty, nails clippings everywhere, dirt and dead skin on the floor I hope I don't get fungus.

31.description: I live in the neighborhood and this was my first time. The front desk gentleman was very nice. Also, Ruby, the salon assistant was extremely warm and friendly. The reason I know Ruby's name is because the women that work there as the nail technicians were beckoning her and barking at her the entire time I was getting my pedicure. Dear chubby girl that was mean to Ruby: Leave Ruby alone meanie piggy dog face.The end.

25.description: I really like the Nail Station.  I've been getting mani/pedi's there for a couple of years and have had no complaints about them. I have had someone leave in the middle of my services and replaced by someone else, which makes me wonder how and who to tip!  I've been getting the no-chip mani's for about a year or so and can't think of why I would ever go back to a regular polish.  My only complaint about the no-chip is I get french and it lasts so long and since the outgrowth isn't real noticeable I tend to put off going back.  Today I went i for my regular mani/pedi and noticed a couple of new services to the salon on the wall. microdermabrasion and Collegian Facial. I asked Amy about them and decided to give them a try. Always want to try the microdermabrasion....WOW...I think the results surprised everyone working there. It was all very relaxing and my face looks better than it has in years.  I'm going to find a way to add these to my budget every 2 -3 weeks!  Overall the prices are decent, the staff is friendly and I can't think of a reason to elsewhere for what I get done there.

12.description: Due to nursing school, I have not been able to get a no chip manicure. That ended yesterday evening when my boyfriend took me to this wonderful place.The wait was about five minutes, since the ladies were busy. (good for them! business is always a good sign!)The owner was the sweetest, very friendly and nice to my boyfriend and I. As she did my nails I was given a mimosa! How awesome is that?! They have been open for fifteen years and from the looks of it they know how to take care of their customers! (There was a lady there who has been going to this place for many years!) I will definitely be coming back for this place! My nails look beautiful! :)

37.description: I got my second pedicure here today.  My last one lasted for over 2 weeks!  The massage to the leg is average, nothing special.  They have those massage chairs that massage your entire back.  Decent, clean place, nice staff.  As long as I get some mileage out of the pedicure, i'm a happy gal.

21.description: I really wanted to like this place.  The people are friendly but that's about it.  I got the no chip manicure and three of my nails have bubbled already. I just left this place, I left 2 hours ago.   While in the salon, I noticed the my cuticles were painted.. wth! and asked the nail technician to fix it but she couldnt. Definitely definitely never coming back. I regret wasting my time and money.

16.description: 2 horrible no-chip manicures within one week....  My sister and I went to the Nail Station because my usual salon didn't have an appointment for two people and we were very pressed for time.  I called ahead of time to see if they had an opening for two people, and they did.  We get there and there was only one manicurist available, the other one was on her way.  So, the colors... not a good selection... at all.  Some were empty, you couldn't really see what the color was for most of them.  On to the actual manicure...I think the woman who did my manicure was the owner, her name was Amy.  The entire manicure took 25 minutes!!!  I have never been out of a salon in less than 45 with a no-chip!  My usual girl takes an hour and does an amazing job! (Chocolate for your Body!)  She never used a cuticle gel, she barely pushed them back.  She didn't cut any of my hangnails, which weren't bad but could have used some TLC.  After filing, she didn't have me wash my hands so they were full of dust.   A few swift strokes of the polish and she was done.  In the meantime the other manicurist came in and started my sisters nails.  I was done a good 15 minutes before her.  And in that time I noticed the woman who did my nails took the tools that she used threw them in the sink, rinsed them, and then proceeded to put them back in her station to use for the next guest!!!!! NO SANITIZER, NO BAKING, NOTHING BUT WATER!!!!  My sisters manicure was ok.  I haven't talked to her to see how they are holding up.fast forward 5 days...9 out of 10 nails are peeling! not chipping, but peeling off.  Some were really bad, some were just starting to peel on the sides.  I called the nail station and let them know what was going on with my nails.  They were very nice and told me to come in to have them fixed.  I get there, show the same woman who did my nails how bad they were and she says she'll fix them.  No I'm sorry... that's so strange... I've never seen this before.  I sit down for her to fix them, and she starts peeling the polish off my nails.  I asked her if she could use the acetone to get them off so she didn't damage my nails, and she said she didn't have to because they were peeling right off.  Same as last time... no love just polish.  She filed off what was left on my nails after she ripped the polish off and started painting.  25 minutes later I was in my car on my way home.  fast forward 3 days...2 nails are already peeling.  You can see that the topcoat does not cover the color coat on most nails.  It's really bad.  If you notice, this is my first yelp review.  It's that bad!!   I will not be calling her this time.  Instead, I will take my voice to yelp.  I can not understand how an owner pushes out such low quality work and still has a business.  If you have been to a quality nail salon and know what to expect from a business, than I would suggest you stay as far away from this place as possible.

17.description: This is a great local nail shop with excellent hours, open to 9PM!!! Thank you!! I have been here three times now and each time I am treated very well. The first time I went I was given a mimosa!They have a good selection of OPI, ESSIE and other nail polishes, not necessarily the newest trending collections but certainly a good selection, I like to bring my own colors because I like to be able to touch up when needed. The owner is very friendly and is always making sure everyone is satisfied. It is a little hard to communicate with the staff if the owner is not there, but again, she usually always is, or comes in shortly after I get there so it's not a big problem. Examples of tricky conversations were getting more hot water for the pedicure and asking for a specific nail design, both requests were handled by the owner without a problem. This place has a steady flow of customers but the wait is never too long. They offer other services like massage, facials and hair removal. I am really interested in the ear candling special!Parking is super easy in front, check this place out if you're in the area!

10.description: I've visited this place a few times and each time have been disappointed, I'm not sure why I even went back to give it more chances. This place could very well be clean but I just feel like its dirty. It's not very presentable and is always messy looking. They don't have a very good color selection either.This review is about my most recent visit this past Tuesday. When I left on Tuesday the polish on my nails had so many dents in it from it not being fully dry yet and her putting stuff on them etc. I didn't have the time to sit there and have her redo it so I just left, I had already been in there for a while. By Thursday I already had two broken nails on my hand, I've never had nails break on me like this before. I decided to get a pedicure because they had a $19 special. This was the worst pedicure I've ever received. Pedicure was short and my feet didn't even feel like I got a pedicure afterwards, so much dead skin, etc. they were the same as when I entered. My visit Tuesday was a complete waste of money and I won't be returning here ever again.

11.description: I use to live in Bridgeport and went to this place a number of times.  It depends what you are going there to get. The people who work there were always very nice and friendly. Facial: for microdurm it's a good deal.Nails: my no chip manures always were fineWaxing: Eyebrow and underarm always was fineMassage: it's a relaxing, feel good rub. Obviously not a licensed massage therapist so if you have a delicate body or need a massage to address a physical issue I'd go else where.    NEVER NEVER NEVER get a Brazilian at this place.  My normal estatition wasn't available one afternoon and I was impatient so I went here.  BIG MISTAKE. Bad technique, REALLY painful and TONS of bruising, which was an issue as I was in a show where I had to wear a swimsuit on stage.

26.description: I had the non-chip manicure yesterday by Sarah (spelling?) at the Nail Station in Bridgeport, because i could not get an appointment at my regular salon which is in the Gold Coast.  She did a fantastic job and my nails look perfect-however, I will see how long the non-chip lasts.  When I have the non-chip manicure at my regular salon, it will last over 2 weeks and my nails need to be done simply because of outgrowth from the cuticle-no peeling or wear on the tips.   I will check back in 2 weeks.  I do plan on going back to the Nail Station in the near future and try the eyelash enhancer.   A  regular client was there at the time I was getting my non-chip  and referred me to Sarah to do eyelashes.  Her eyelashes were gorgeous!   What I saw with this client, coupled with the price, it is my opinion that it is definitely worth the try!!

27.description: Just ok...polish peeled in 2 days while on vacation!  The staff is nice and the price is fairly cheap, but my polish peeled in 2 days!!!  I may have gotten in the pool and beach, but I've done that before with no problem.  This isn't the only time this has happened after getting my nails polished here though.  Maybe they don't put on a base coat...I am going to have to check next time I go in.  I want to like them and have this be my regular place, but there are other nail salons in the neighborhood.

35.description: Definitely not my favorite.  The place didn't really seem that clean, which is a big issue for me.  The pedicure itself was fine - very efficient - and the brief foot massage was good.  But...it just didn't seem that sanitary.  I'm sure the tools were sanitary, but because the rest of the place was a little dirty, it made me nervous.   Although it was cheap, there are far cleaner, comparable price places.  I don't think I'll be back again.

8.description: Horrible!! They made my nail polish too thick, they didn't clean the nails up after they were finished and they didn't massage my feet for the pedicure. They are more expensive than downtown salons and not nearly as nice. I'm frustrated because I have to find a new place tomorrow to have my nails fixed and polished chanhed .

0.description: The only place that opens early and closes late near my home!Went on a Friday at 9am with my niece. She got a pedi and a full set ballerina shaped nails and she loved it. I got the mani pedi and they were both fantastic. The girl did an awesome job and didn't comment on us bringing our own base coat top coat and polish.. Unlike other places I have been to. They were very welcoming and served me a mimosa :)

38.description: After shopping around many times at other salons & spas because of a competitor coupon or a referral, I always come back to this place and kick myself for going elsewhere. Not only do they offer a friendly, very attentive and fine pedicure and manicure that looks great even after a week and a half but their hook is the complimentary acupressure foot & hand message. It is unbelievable! There's a few manicurist there that are better than the others but when they get the pressure points in your foot and hand so accurately you get a wave of tingling sensations at the crown of your head. Not sure how they do it but it is strangely divine. Also, I have received the eyebrow wax service. They go the extra step for a bit of a trim to make sure it is finished off perfectly. Very pleased with the Nail Station and highly recommend it over any place I've tried.

20.description: This is a great local nail shop with excellent hours, open to 9PM!!! Thank you!! I have been here three times now and each time I am treated very well. The first time I went I was given a mimosa!They have a good selection of OPI, ESSIE and other nail polishes, not necessarily the newest trending collections but certainly a good selection, I like to bring my own colors because I like to be able to touch up when needed. The owner is very friendly and is always making sure everyone is satisfied. It is a little hard to communicate with the staff if the owner is not there, but again, she usually always is, or comes in shortly after I get there so it's not a big problem. Examples of tricky conversations were getting more hot water for the pedicure and asking for a specific nail design, both requests were handled by the owner without a problem. This place has a steady flow of customers but the wait is never too long. They offer other services like massage, facials and hair removal. I am really interested in the ear candling special!Parking is super easy in front, check this place out if you're in the area!

19.description: Amy and her team are always amazing. I've been going to them since 2007 when I moved to the neighborhood.  I tried a few other places in the neighborhood before going to them.  Since going there I haven't been elsewhere.  They go above and beyond for your business.  They provide drinks, stay open late, open early, tip you off to where they have a discount, and even occasionally deep discount a new service just to get you to try it.  Sometimes accidents happen and a cuticle get cut or a nail not filed straight, but they're always willing to fix it and apologize for the mishap and it's only happened to me when it's someone new to working at the shop.  I think it's great that Amy's a trainer and helping girls to learn new things.They always have a great selection of polish and never give me a hard time when I really want to use my own.Actually I was recently on vacation and got my nails done while I was there, but can't wait to go back to Nail Station for the maintenance.In Chicago it isn't often that you can go a place where people remember your name even if you haven't been there in a few months - at Nail Station that's standard.  Also, in the almost 7 full years I've been a customer I've never once heard anyone there talk about another staff member or customer, no matter how difficult a customer may have been. I've been to plenty of shops where when a difficult customer leaves everyone in the store is chatting negatively.  I've never had that experience at Nail Station. They're the best.  You should totally try them.

33.description: I went here for a pedicure yesterday after attempting to get one at a horrible place in Chinatown.  I can't remember the name but it's the only salon in the "mall" part on the north side of Archer.  I can only comment on the customer service there but it was beyond awful.So I kept looking.  I vaguely remembered seeing Nail Station on Yelp so drove over here.  I needed a quick pedi and just wanted to get in somewhere.  I found this place, saw it was open, and walked in holding my breath.  Nobody was in there when a worker came out.  She said she could take me right then.  Yea!!It wasn't the best pedi I've ever had -- I just got a regular one for $24 -- but after my annoying & bad experience in Chinatown I was very happy with the customer service (very friendly & quick service).  I also liked the space itself (I didn't think it smelled at all & it was bright, airy, and comfortable), the pricing, and their hours.  They are open until 8pm during the week and take appointments until 9pm.  That means I might actually be able to get a pedi after putting my toddler to bed for the night (with my husband staying at home, of course)!!  Very exciting.This isn't a place to drive out of your way for, but if you want an inexpensive mani or pedi in a nice shop, this is definitely your place.

2.description: I came here because my usual nail salon was booked so I figured why not? One, I'm not a bratty customer and two I only leave reviews if I feel strongly about something. So I walk in, no greeting. Fine. They tell me "pick color" before even knowing what I wanted, which was a fill. I picked one shade, they didn't have it. I picked another, they didn't have it. I picked a THIRD COLOR and they didn't have it, and the FOURTH they didn't have either. Mind you, I was picking from colors they already had on their wheel. Now I end up settling for a green color even though it looked dry and clumpy. Now, the work begins. Terrible file job, terrible buff job. The acrylic was so thin and mushy and just terrible. The shape on each nail was crooked and every time I stopped to look at them the nail tech janked my hand back. As she's filing my nail on my thumb she cuts me. There's blood. Blood? Yes. I was LIVID and did not receive not one apology. FROM ANYONE. I paid $16, stormed out. My thumb was burning all night. I don't know how this place is still open. And by the way, check out my fill, after a little over 24 hours. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

34.description: I was thrilled to find this place as it is close to where I live.  I was so impressed with the time and care the manicurist took with me. She was very efficient and did a great job.  I was not rushed and this experience was very pleasant.  There is a wide range of choices of colors and the cost is very economical.  The best part was I got out of the door without smooshing my nails.  I will definitely go there again.

32.description: I've been to this place 3 times and I wasn't very happy any of those times but the last time was the worst. I went for eyebrow waxing and I'm not very fussy about it. I don't even care if they don't get every hair. Lately I've been waxing my own and I don't do a great job but the last time I visited the nail station, the girl got such a huge glob of wax in my hair and I had to cut it out and live with the bald spot it left for a while. So I just want anyone who goes in for waxing to be careful.

18.description: I'm sorry to see the bad reviews, this place has always been great! I've been going there for about 2 years. There's a wide variety of unique services- diabetic pedicures, ear candling, hot stone pedi's, specialty facials, waxing, massage, and the usual mani-pedi offerings. I have always had friendly service and been happy with the prices and results!

41.description: For the money, its definitely worth it!!! Its bright and clean and there's a TV for you to spend your time while you're waiting.. I did a walk-in for my manicure ($12 - color, not French) and it didn't take too long! They claim the best pedicures in their flyer (~$25).. haven't tried that one yet, but will surely do the next time I go. The staff is pretty nice, and getting your message across isn't tough at all!

13.description: Great service!  Ask Amy for a fill in or a full set! She's very personable and does great work!

4.description: I use to live in Bridgeport and went to this place a number of times.  It depends what you are going there to get. The people who work there were always very nice and friendly. Facial: for microdurm it's a good deal.Nails: my no chip manures always were fineWaxing: Eyebrow and underarm always was fineMassage: it's a relaxing, feel good rub. Obviously not a licensed massage therapist so if you have a delicate body or need a massage to address a physical issue I'd go else where.    NEVER NEVER NEVER get a Brazilian at this place.  My normal estatition wasn't available one afternoon and I was impatient so I went here.  BIG MISTAKE. Bad technique, REALLY painful and TONS of bruising, which was an issue as I was in a show where I had to wear a swimsuit on stage.

24.description: Oh, how I miss Nail Station. This used to be my go-to place when I lived nearby. But alas, since moving it's a bit too far. I love the staff. Super friendly and very helpful and talkative. They all speak English which is always nice and they always have the newest trends in nail design. And I'm not talking about the elaborate kind, just like magnetic nail polish and gel colors and stuff like that. Their gelish application is the best in the city, I think. It lasts FOREVER. And they have a great selection of colors. They're also pretty affordable and have GREAT half off deals during the holidays.

6.description: Do NOT get a Brazilian wax they have NO clue what they are doing.  Wax all over me & patches of hair left.. worst wax I ever had!!!!!

22.description: Amy and her staff are top notch.  I became a regular there about a year ago and never sat down to write a review.  I have watched these artists create some beautiful nails on women.  Amy is always looking for new processes and services to offer her clients.  She is always upgrading equipment and the shop is extremely clean.Amy and her staff are very friendly, highly skilled, and make sure the customer is happy with the service.  While I only do a regular manicure and pedicure, I have tried their facials, and very recently they added haircuts to the list of services.  Michelle has been doing my nails for the past few months and on Monday gave me a very nice haircut.  I can highly recommend her.  Of course, any of Amy's staff will make sure your service is completed to your satisfaction.

15.description: My friend and I were looking for a place open on Labor Day (and there weren't many) to do a girls day. She found Nail Station conveniently located a walking distance from her place. She scheduled an appointment for us to do a mani/pedi. I recommend the appointment setting because a girl walked in and walked out after waiting a half hour. (they were busy....patience is a virtue)This was my second pedicure and my only lack of a star was the water was really hot, I was afraid I was going to burn my feet. But I ended up being okay and I found out they serve MIMOSAS!!! What?! YES PLEASE!!!! They did a great job on the pedicure and my friend is still trying to figure out the lotion they used on both our hands and feet because it smells amazing. I brought my own polish and they were okay with that, usually I get a dirty look. Everyone there was really nice though and we definitely plan to make this our go to for girls day. I'm very interested in some of the other services they offer like the Ear Candles and Aromatherapy Facials. Keyword here though: MIMOSAS!

40.description: This place is great.  I've tried tons of other nail shops in the area and regret it every time I spend my money elsewhere.  They use great products and my nails always look great for a week - I hate spending money on a mani/pedi that's only presentable for a few days!  Their massage therapist is awesome, the facials are awesome, the waxing is awesome.  I've done it all there and am always happy with the service and the results.

7.description: Decided to give this place a try today after I called to confirm availability. Came in 5 mins later and was told there'd be a 30 min wait. My friend and I opted to wait, not really thinking it would take that long since two patrons were being attended to and we were next. An hour later, with no acknowledgements or apologies for twice the wait time we were given, we were told to have a seat in the pedi chairs. I said "it took too long, we waited for over an hour. Unless you can give me a discount, no thank you." She responded, "ok, thank you, bye." Wow. See ya. My impression is that it is unprofessional, but obviously it's only based on this initial interaction, so take that with a grain of salt.

36.description: So I tried this place cause it was super close to my house. The place is wallpapered with all kinds of services that they provide.. but I was just gonna try the basics first before I add anything fancy.  The people were very friendly.. I guess they aren't used to people coming in when they first open...
