I freaked them out a little haha.  So they did my pedi first and it was nice.. good massage chairs, sanitized tools and a warm bath.. what more could a girl ask for. OH YES AND DID I MENTION THE OPI COLLECTION THEY HAVE IS TO DIE FOR!! Some shops have a few OPI, but that is the majority of what they have here .. so YAY!!  I was very pleased with all the services I had (pedi and gel set).. this place is a little pricey, but well worth it. They kept asking me if everything is ok and said if I wasn't happy with something they would change it.  Parking is best on the side streets since you don't have to pay..

30.description: I live in Hyde Park and since we are completely devoid of decent nail places, I decided to give Nail Station a try. I went with my roommate and although there was only one other person there, they said they could only take one of us right away. I don't mind waiting, I only find it strange since there were many other employees there at that time who weren't with customers.There was nothing grossly wrong with the manicure, but that is about the best I can say. It seemed like a polish change. There was almost no "manicure," no cuticle cutting, massage, filing. She did fine polishing my nails, but that's not what I paid for. The ambiance of the place left much to be desired. They didn't have any magazines I'd ever heard of to read while I waited and it was cold, brr! Also, I had a strange encounter with the other nail technician. While my nails were being soaked, she asked what color I was getting and I told her dark purple and showed her the bottle. She said, "oh that's going to be blue" and walked away. No offer to get me a color that would be purple or follow up. My poor roommate had to find me another color, while hoping her semi-wet nails didn't smudge. If I was hard up for some nail color, I might come here again, but I think it's worth traveling farther and getting a better nail service.

3.description: I have been going to Nail Station for a while now. The staff is usually always friendly and they offer you a drink before your service. But the last three months the quality of my services have declined. Today, I received services with Amy and I felt completely unheard and rushed. I get fill-ins with gel overlay. Lets get into the service: I had a broken thumb nail that needed to be replaced. Amy pulled a plastic nail tip and proceeded to try and pry the bonded nail off. I flinched in pain and asked if she could soak it off. After a slight sigh, she pulled out the acetone to let my nail soak. I am not a fan of using drills to file nails, but I understand for the cheap price, it is the quickest way to get the service done. Before starting, Amy put on old used gloves that were too large for her hands. As she was sloppily and aggressively drilling my nails, her gloves would get caught in the drill and cause it to slightly nick me. I would think the jumping of my hand would let you know you are being to rough. By the end of the service, she appeared to be annoyed with me as she asked, "Is everything okay." No, it's not and I will be taking my business elsewhere.

14.description: The people there are very friendly but the job is not so good. I've went about 3 times wanting to give them a chance because they were so nice and the prices are reasonable, but the amount of acrylic is so small. My nail bent after a couple days the second time I went and this last time I asked the girl to trim my nails down and she didn't. She kept cutting skin off the sides of my nails and it took her 45 mins to file my nails for ONE HAND! I asked for the coffin shaped nails and they came out lopsided. There's bumps on my nails as well. Very friendly but I do not recommend for acrylic nails.

28.description: I needed to get something White Sox for one person on my list and some type of Bears gifts for some other people on the list. I called Grandstand and they were open Sundays in December for Christmas so I cruised over last weekend. The selection of White Sox paraphernalia is extensive. There were a lot of things I wanted for myself, but I practiced some restrain. However, I found perfect gifts for the sports enthusiasts some of which were on clearance. BEWARE the clearance merchandise is not returnable, exchangeable or anyhitng so if the recipients don't like the gifts be prepared to keep it yourself or re gift. The price range is from high to low so it can fit all budgets. Also I got a free tee shirt for the amount I spent and it was an offical MLB tee shirt with Crede's name and number on it, which is going to be a birthday gift for an uncle in 2010- what a deal!

1.description: Called ahead for something specific, assured they looked, had it in my size and would hold it.  Drove 40 minutes for nothing, they tried to give me a different color in the wrong size.  This was after waiting in line behind another disgruntled customer.  I won't go there again.

39.description: I am currently in a mixed relationship.  I am a White Sox fan while my BF is a Cubs fan.  More often than not I will go with him to some sporting goods store and sit, depressed, while he flips through racks and racks of Cubs gear (some of it really cool looking too), while I am left staring at a couple of cheap, poorly designed, borderline ghetto-looking shirts for my beloved team.  Sensing my distress over this, and knowing I just wanted one thing, just one shirt or hat to be able to wear, he took me the Grandstand.  Wow, how great was this!  Now it was me that had a problem with too much selection and the obligatory Cubs stuff was relegated to a few choices in the back corner!  I got my shirt, finally, and am so pleased I might even wear it to the next Cubs game I am taken to, haha.   Thanks Grandstand!

9.description: In town getting married so I only had a sliver of time to get a White Sox jersey. Came in and Rosemary was absolutely great, she helped get me an authentic Sox jersey personalized with the stitching on the same day! I've always been a fan of Grandstands but this experience just reinforces the great rep they already have.

29.description: As a White Sox-obsessed kid growing up 3 hours from Chicago, Grandstand was always some sort of magical, far-away store that I imagined spending entire days in.Now that I live in Chicago and can get there fairly-easily, Grandstand has managed to maintain their mystique. As other Yelpers have mentioned, no one can touch Grandstand's inventory. There are items that are literally only available there, as the store has contracts with many manufacturers to create merchandise specifically for the store.I'm a huge jersey nerd, and Grandstand has a great selection of authentic Sox, Cubs, Bears, Bulls and Hawks jerseys. The majority of lettering is done in-house, and they do it better than their competitors (Triple Threat Sports, I'm looking at you).Grandstand's biggest strength is their customer service. It's a family-run business that will bend over backwards to help you, just as long as you're not a self-important jerk. I've spent many hours discussing sports with everyone there to the point where I consider them friends.Prices can be high on some items, but jerseys and hats are fairly consistent with online shops and stores you'll find in the mall. After games, you can expect to wait in line for 5-10 minutes or so, so I always try to make my trips before first pitch.Forget picking up gear at the ballpark or from MLB's website; just head to Grandstand and you'll find everything you need...and then some.

23.description: Grandstand offers an unbeatable selection of White Sox, Bears, Hawks, Bulls, and even Cubs gear.  Its proximity to The Cell has helped Grandstand earn its place in the hearts of White Sox fans everywhere.  They have items to fit every fans' style, whether you are a little girl or a fearsome gangbanger.  They also have some rather unique items for sale, such as a line of White Sox caps with various nation's flags sewn into the side, in lieu of, say, an All-Star or World Series patch.  In typical Bridgeport fashion, the cap with Israel's flag on it had a price tag labeled "Jewish".  I get sort of a "who sent ya?" vibe from some of the staff there.  At least one guy told me a flat out lie when I inquired about a hat they didn't have in stock.  It's okay if he didn't know the answer, but I didn't appreciate him just making things up.  These are annoyances- annoying enough to mention, but not so much to drop Grandstand down to A-OK status.  They are the store for White Sox fans, after all.  At some point in the next year or so I'll ruin the hat I recently bought there, and I'll be happy to give Grandstand my business again.

5.description: This shop was great and really active and busy. Great looking at all the jerseys and NBA merchandise.

31.description: Would be five stars, but it can be very pricey. And they dont discount all the older merchandise like other chicago sports stores.BUT, it has on site parking, accepts the WHITE SOX gift cards, and has a LOT of Sox stuff. The website(grandstandsox.com) has more stuff as well as more clearance items.One of the few local stores to have a DREAMSEAT on display.(dreamseat.com)

25.description: As a Sox fan I might be biased but this place is great.  A+ on customer services.  And it has everything that a sports fan would want, it can be a bit pricey but you get what you pay for.  It stays open late after Sox games so stop over sometime.

12.description: The positive: They really do have pretty much every White Sox related thing you could possibly dream up.The negative: The whole time I was browsing caps I was stared at and followed (dogged!) around like I was a suspicious petty thief looking for something to shoplift. Needless to say, I left without spending any money on the cap I had deliberately come there to buy. This pains me too, as I always try to shop mom and pop stores and try to keep money in our communities.

37.description: Holy Crap.  The first time I walked into this place was like the first time I walked into Sam's Wine and Liquors.  Definitely a Sox fan's dream.  Especially a North Side Sox fan's dream!!  No more picking through racks of blue and red to find the one black and gray Sox shirt.  This place is all Sox, all the time.  For me, dangerous.  But definitely the only place to go for Sox apparel.  Check it out, and bring your credit card.

21.description: Not to sure about the "Limited" part in the store's name. It did not seem at all limited when it came to White Sox merchandise. This somewhat small corner store is filled to the brim with any kind of Sox gear imaginable. From retro to today, you can find it here, I'm"m sure. Also thrown in is a bit of Blackhawks, Bulls, and (unfortunately) Cubs paraphernalia. You can get authentic game jerseys with your own name stitched on, but. like anywhere, it's going to cost a bit. On average though, everything found in this store is on par, or even a little less than the prices you would pay in the ballpark. One thing this place has, that you will not find at the Cell, though, is a clearance rack! It may be hard to find, and it's only one rack, but the discounts are drastic. I was able to get a 1/2 way to St. Paddy's day warm-up jacket, and a white polo with the black logo, all for just $40. I don't think I could beat that deal anywhere else. The hours posted show the place closed on Sunday, but if there is a game going on on Sunday, damned sure this place will be open and doing a good business.

16.description: Nice place, great selection, but a bit pricey. My only realy issue is the location. Not the best area to visit.

17.description: Chicago Sox, Cubs, Bulls, Bears, Blackhawks fans...Grandstand has got you covered.  There is so much merch packed in this place its nuts.  Right as you step into the store its quite overwhelming.  You dont know exactly where to begin.  Like a kid in a candystore.Regardless of what you need the staff here is plenty friendly.  And definitely knowledgeable and helpful.  I, on this certain occasion had my sights set on a black blackhawks jersey.  Replica or authentic?  As if thats even a question...go big or go home!  Luckily they had a blank in my size.  Im not exactly the xxl hockey fan.  Got all my customizing filled out and was quoted at most a 2 week turnaround.  I had put in the order on a wednesday and low and behold..I receive a phone call saturday morning of that same week; "your jersey is ready!"  I was thrilled though I wouldnt be able to pick it up til the following weekend.  Living on the northside and a full week of work..making a trek down to the southside isnt exactly a stop over.  Early birthday present to myself..CHECK!5 stars for the staff!  The layout is great and everything is always neat, together and easily accessible.  -0.5 : Prices can be beaten.  Dont get me wrong..I love to support local business.  Its places like grand stand that make it a pleasure.  But I guess its the price you pay to be a fan. -0.5 : The customizing is not in house and has to be sent out.  Yes, they do amazing work.  That is undeniable..and turnaround times are always hit or miss anywhere you go.  But the rate is almost twice the average charge for customizing a jersey.  Im not complaining because this place totally rocks.  Just trying to be a fair 4 star.

10.description: I've been coming to grandstand before or after Sox games since I was a kid, and it's always had the best selection of sports gear in the city. The owners are extremely nice and helpful, and if you're a jersey geek like me, they'll gladly talk your ear off. The prices are about the same as you'd fine anywhere else, but you won't really find team apparel discounted unless you're buying a knockoff jersey on eBay anyway. This is the place to buy a Sox jersey though, as they do the lettering for the team.Personally, one thing I miss is the wider range of teams Grandstand used to stock. They always had jerseys from almost every MLB team, which set them apart from newer stores like the Chicago Sports Depot, but at some point they switched to offering only stuff from Chicago teams. I guess the wider availability of gear for any team online made it less viable to carry the stuff in-store, but as someone who buys other teams' jerseys, I always liked having a place to go check them out in person.

11.description: Huge selection of Chicago sports apparel. You're bound to find something unique that you'll love.

26.description: I am a fitted hat fiend, and this is my place to go for Sox caps. All colorways, all styles, and exclusives you won't find anywhere else. If you're looking for other teams, you can find every authentic MLB cap here. The owners are always incredibly nice, even though I get the feeling they aren't too crazy about people like me who are not huge sports fans but just want their caps for fashion purposes. Regardless, I have never had a bad experience here. Helpful staff and a great selection. If you are on the market for a fitted, go here before a mainstream place like Lids.

27.description: I love going to Grandstand.  Its not cheap there, but there is quality to there merchandise.  The employee's are friendly and helpful.  The store has a huge inventory, something for every Sox fan.  Yes, they do carry some Cubs items.  If your going to the game, stop in and take a look.  Yes, they do have security and there usually off duty cops.  I am glad to see that they have another parking lot.  Parking can be hard around there.

35.description: This is the absolute best place on earth for White Sox gear. I am a die-hard White Sox baseball fan, but live on the North Side. Going to Grandstand, and being surrounded by huge amounts of Sox gear of all types, is a real event. In fact, my friend and I call our trips to Grandstand going to Mecca. (Grandstand also carries Chicago Bear and Chicago Blackhawks gear, and a small amount of Chicago Cub apparel.) Grandstand is located just a few blocks west of U.S. Cellular Field/Comiskey. If you go after a game, be prepared to stand in line for a short time before you get in. Yes, it's that popular. A better time to go is a non-game Saturday. (They have a small parking lot behind the store.) LOVE IT!

8.description: This is a great place with a great selection of sports apparel. I love coming here.

0.description: This place is badass,I'm a huge BLACKHAWKS,WHITESOX,BEARS,BULLS Fan.an they have everything that I want in there.its too dangerous for me to be in there too long,because I can easily spend over $300 just getting kool stuff.they have everything you need.

38.description: This is the absolute best place on earth for White Sox gear.  I am a die-hard Sox fan, but live on the North Side.  Going to Grandstand, and being surrounded by huge amounts of Sox gear of all types, is a real event.  In fact, my friend and I call our trips to Grandstand "going to Mecca".    If you go after a game, be prepared to stand in line for a short time before you get in.  Yes, it's that popular.  A better time to go is a non-game Saturday.  (They have a small parking lot behind the store.)   LOVE IT!

20.description: White Sox heaven! There is literally so much Sox merchandise that you can't comprehend it. I was blown away when I walked in. License plate holders, flags and beer mugs, oh my!Yeah some things run higher but I like giving my cash to the ma and pa places rather than the cheesy sporting good stores. They have probably every Sox t-shirt and cap imaginable to mankind. Plus the collection of unique items are unbeatable. I lucked out and found a clearance priced fitted Sox cap for $15! Pretty awesome considering it was the same exact one I had my eye on at another store for double the price. I love this place and it's a nice change of pace to see decent Sox merch and not be bombarded with tons of Cubbies crap. I will definitely will be back!

19.description: Grandstand was great about my lack of knowledge of jerseys. They answered all my questions and even called me when the correct size of the jersey I wanted came in. Their customer service is excellent and I would recommend Grandstand Limited to everyone!

33.description: They have stuff here you can't find anywhere else on earth it seems. When you first walk in it is overwhelming. Tons of Sox gear, and lots of other Chicago teams gear. They have an amazing selection of fitted hats and jerseys. Authentics and replicas alike. They have a huge selection for the ladies and kids as well. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They can put a name and number any jersey here. They also have millions of collectable items. Flags, mats, glasses, pens, pins, magnets, pictures, you name it. A must for any Chicago sports fan (especially White Sox fans).

2.description: I love how much Blackhawks stuff this store has. I've been to Grandstand a few times and have a spent a few hundred dollars here. Unfortunately when my friend and I visited today so that I could buy him a jersey for his birthday, one of the clerks was up our ass the entire time. I get it, you don't want people stealing from you, but it's extremely off-putting to look up and see someone stalking you no matter where in the store you go. It almost made we want to rip them off!

34.description: Yes.  Everyone on Yelp knows my love and devotion for the Cubs.  It's true.  I bleed blue.  HOWEVER, this store, has the greatest collection of ALL things sports!  I was amazed by the size, selection, and prices in this store.  Everything you could possibly imagine is in this store!  Water bottles, socks, shirts, jerseys, key chains, knick-knacks, you name it!  It is heavily stocked with Sox merchandise, however, they have a great selection of Cubs, Bears, Blackhawks and Bulls gear too! I'll be back, even in the off season!

32.description: Seriously, if you're going to get a Sox fan a gift, GO HERE. Don't even waste your time looking anywhere else.They have everything Sox--apparel, bottle openers, clocks, frosty mugs, flags, thongs, license plate holders, etc. The older man, who sits by the front door and greets and thanks you, is too cute.A round trip drive from Uptown took me an hour.

18.description: After years of hearing about this place, I've finally got chance to go to Grandstand. After my first time there, I wish I had been to this place sooner. They have almost everything a White Sox fan should ever need! Yeah, they do have things for the other sports teams, but it is majority White Sox stuff. They have A LOT of hats, jerseys and other apparel that would make you wish you have a lot of money to buy it all. Price wise, it is not too bad. Definitely cheaper than at the ballpark.The parking is good. There's some in the rear of the store and some in a parking lot in front of it. If you are in the mood, you can walk there from the Sox-35th Red Line stop. Although, you can take the bus there as well.The people inside seem to be nice and they know their stuff. Overall, I enjoyed my time there. I would definitely go back for all my White Sox shopping. If you are or you know someone that is a White Sox fan, then this is THE place to get anything a Sox fan can ask!

41.description: This is a must stop for any White Sox fan.  Just a few blocks west of Sox Park.  The store has just about anything and everything you could want that has a Sox logo on it.  From White Sox decorations to White Sox baby clothes and everything in between.  They have lots of different styles of White Sox hats and have a great collection of retro White Sox gear.  Besides White Sox merchandise they also carry Bulls, Bears, Blackhawks, and Cubs items as well.  Next time you are at a game or just in the area stop by this place.

13.description: Not to sure about the "Limited" part in the store's name. It did not seem at all limited when it came to White Sox merchandise. This somewhat small corner store is filled to the brim with any kind of Sox gear imaginable. From retro to today, you can find it here, I'm"m sure. Also thrown in is a bit of Blackhawks, Bulls, and (unfortunately) Cubs paraphernalia. You can get authentic game jerseys with your own name stitched on, but. like anywhere, it's going to cost a bit. On average though, everything found in this store is on par, or even a little less than the prices you would pay in the ballpark. One thing this place has, that you will not find at the Cell, though, is a clearance rack! It may be hard to find, and it's only one rack, but the discounts are drastic. I was able to get a 1/2 way to St. Paddy's day warm-up jacket, and a white polo with the black logo, all for just $40. I don't think I could beat that deal anywhere else. The hours posted show the place closed on Sunday, but if there is a game going on on Sunday, damned sure this place will be open and doing a good business.

4.description: I have been going to Grandstand for at least 15 years and they always have a great selection of gear. I don't always remember the prices being as high as they are but that could just be a sign of the times. They have everything you could ever want for not just the a Whitesox but any of the Chicago teams. There is parking out back and across the street so it's easy to get in and out of. Of course on game days it gets very crowded.

24.description: Chicago Sox, Cubs, Bulls, Bears, Blackhawks fans...Grandstand has got you covered.  There is so much merch packed in this place its nuts.  Right as you step into the store its quite overwhelming.  You dont know exactly where to begin.  Like a kid in a candystore.Regardless of what you need the staff here is plenty friendly.  And definitely knowledgeable and helpful.  I, on this certain occasion had my sights set on a black blackhawks jersey.  Replica or authentic?  As if thats even a question...go big or go home!  Luckily they had a blank in my size.  Im not exactly the xxl hockey fan.  Got all my customizing filled out and was quoted at most a 2 week turnaround.  I had put in the order on a wednesday and low and behold..I receive a phone call saturday morning of that same week; "your jersey is ready!"  I was thrilled though I wouldnt be able to pick it up til the following weekend.  Living on the northside and a full week of work..making a trek down to the southside isnt exactly a stop over.  Early birthday present to myself..CHECK!5 stars for the staff!  The layout is great and everything is always neat, together and easily accessible.  -0.5 : Prices can be beaten.  Dont get me wrong..I love to support local business.  Its places like grand stand that make it a pleasure.  But I guess its the price you pay to be a fan. -0.5 : The customizing is not in house and has to be sent out.  Yes, they do amazing work.  That is undeniable..and turnaround times are always hit or miss anywhere you go.  But the rate is almost twice the average charge for customizing a jersey.  Im not complaining because this place totally rocks.  Just trying to be a fair 4 star.

6.description: BUYERS!!   BEWARE!!!   There is a lot of great stuff in Grandstand but ifyou ever try and exchange it, you will be out of luck.  The things there arepricey too.  It is a family-owned store but they are not going to lose anymoney.  Just try and exchange something or ask for a refund even if youhave your receipt.  You will see the friendliness and customer servicego out the window.  GO SOMEPLACE ELSE TO BUY!!!

22.description: If you're a Chicago sports fan, Grandstand's got you covered! They're a family-run business, and it shows in the service they provide. Stephanie (the owner's daughter) was beyond helpful a couple years ago when I purchased a green White Sox jersey for my beau just a few days before St. Patricks Day. I found their site online, but it seemed like they were updating it so I couldn't place my order through their website. I called and Stephanie helped me over the phone--she gave me multiple options, and in the end I got exactly what I was looking for (even though I didn't know it was even possible before I called), and it was more affordable than I expected! I also wanted to get a hat to match the jersey, but hadn't seen the "ideal" one on their website. When I described to her what I was looking for, she said, "Oh yeah, we have that!". She really knew their inventory well and was so accommodating in all of my requests. I knew I waited to the last minute to purchase a St. Patty's inspired jersey, so I wasn't expecting it to show up in time for my beau to wear it on 3/17. But low and behold, it did! Without me even asking, Stephanie took it upon herself to get the jersey personalized and shipped out the very next day...knowing it would really make someone's day, and it did! It's because of service like that--always going the extra mile--that Grandstand is our go-to place for all of our White Sox gear. When Stephanie heard we were headed to Chicago to catch a game that summer, she told us to stop by and introduce ourselves...so we did. We were able to chat with her and her mom for a while, and they even suggested a place for us to eat dinner and called to make a reservation for us! We came back a few days later to stock up on some gear before leaving town, and they ended up giving me one of my hats for free--they totally didn't have to do that, but I think it was their way of showing how much they appreciated our business.Like many other Yelpers have mentioned, they don't only have White Sox stuff--they have sports apparel and memorabilia for all Chicago pro sports teams, and a lot of it. I've never seen a store with a greater selection than Grandstand. They have way more than what you see on their website, so if you're ever in the area, I recommend stopping by. Something they really seem to specialize in are jerseys of the past. I got a red & white 1970s style Sox jersey, and they have tons of others to choose from.Remember: besides their daily hours, they're always open after every White Sox home game.

15.description: Don't go on game day because parking is a hassle. Place has a ton of stuff just a little pricy. Walking distance from the sox stadium.

40.description: This is THE shop to get all your Sox merchandise. Located about a home run's distance from U.S. Cellular, Grandstand has just about any type of Sox memorabilia you could dream up. On top of that, the store is run by a very friendly staff, and the prices are surprisingly cheap. Also, they have a fair share of Blackhawks gear as well as other MLB teams. They're even diplomatic enough to supply a few Cubs merch. However, the less said about that the better (JK). So forget the high prices at the ballpark and head over to the good folks at Grandstand!

7.description: I'd give this place 10,000 stars if I could. Very nice people. A family owned store, and every time I go in, they always say thank you and tell me they appreciate my business. If you ever need a jersey customized, this is the place to go. Reasonable prices, and they get it done quick. I can't recommend them enough. Most of the stuff they sell is White Sox related, but they do have things for other Chicago teams also. You can't go wrong here.

36.description: Greatest Sox store in the city.  They have EVERYTHING you could possibly imagine for a White Sox fan.  Also pretty reasonably priced for a store (you can always find cheaper stuff on the Internet, but it's definitely better than the MLB store and ballpark prices).  They even have other Chicago sports merchandise (Bears and Blackhawks) and they have anything you could possibly imagine with the Sox logo on it.  Jerseys, shirts, hats, outdoor gear, chairs, shoes, bobble heads... everything!I always go before Sox games just to check the place out and I almost always end up buying something.  Especially on cold days at the very beginning of the season, the Sox hats and gloves come in handy!

30.description: This place stays open really late after Sox games, so head over after the game!  I don't like how you have to check your bags/purses at the door.  Sorry I am not leaving my entire purse with some guy who just puts them on the floor by the front door.  If you don't trust me not to take it in the store, why should I trust you?  Lame.If you do make it past the big bad "security" guy - this place has TONS of sporting merchandise.  However, WTF are Cubs items doing here??My husband bought a Sox Jersey for $100.  Pretty sweet.  Everyone who works here is friendly and helpful.

3.description: I'll start by noting I am not a white sox (nor really a cubs) fan. But damn, you have to be impressed by this store. I couldnt imagine a white sox item that isnt in this store. Its that impressive. They have everything from your everyday t-shirts to fancy tshirts to hoodies, jerseys, and on and on. Thats just the clothing. They have about 200 or so different sox hats, clocks, watches, thinga-majiggers and whatnot.Whats more appealing is a rather large bears and blackhawks section. They have an impressive area of things in this arena as well. All told you could spend a few hours here and not examine all the items.Dudes working were cool, not high pressure, very helpful. I'll be coming back to buy a wedding gift soon so look for an update!

14.description: White Sox heaven! There is literally so much Sox merchandise that you can't comprehend it. I was blown away when I walked in. License plate holders, flags and beer mugs, oh my!Yeah some things run higher but I like giving my cash to the ma and pa places rather than the cheesy sporting good stores. They have probably every Sox t-shirt and cap imaginable to mankind. Plus the collection of unique items are unbeatable. I lucked out and found a clearance priced fitted Sox cap for $15! Pretty awesome considering it was the same exact one I had my eye on at another store for double the price. I love this place and it's a nice change of pace to see decent Sox merch and not be bombarded with tons of Cubbies crap. I will definitely will be back!

1.description: The ladies were very rude and not helpful with my questions. I don't think they were trained or knew the products.

0.description: Great location, nice staff, and the reason why I give it 3 stars and not 4 or 5 is that it's a small store with limited product. I'll have to drive to the other side of Chicago to look for something I may be interested in. Raffles for limited kicks should be made at all foot lockers with the winning people picking up their shoes at a different location. I would give 5 stars to the employees as I have never been offended or forced into making a purchase I wasn't interested in. Very friendly people. It would be much easier for this location to pick up more of what is actually being sold so they don't have shoes sitting on the shelves for months.

3.description: Floated out of Relaxing Center on a cloud after enjoying 30 minutes of reflexology & acupressure each. I can't believe I've never tried this type of massage therapy, & I now understand why so many athletes swear by it! As a runner, dancer, & rock climber, a treatment of reflexology & acupressure was everything I've needed. The fantastic people at Relaxing Center have an amazing & unique understanding of muscular anatomy & reflexology. My session started off with a warm foot soak that left my feet feeling invigorated. We then moved into a meticulous & methodical reflexology series. Special attention was paid to pressure points & areas of movement. The acupressure massage was intense & relieving at the same time. I loved the style - unlike any other professional massage I've ever had before. Again, obvious attention was paid to pressure points with a great understanding of anatomy. Once the session was complete, I felt like I was floating on a cloud of awesomeness. I really can't wait to go back & treat myself again!

1.description: Today i woke up with a horrible migraine and i decided today there will be no excuse i will go for a massage. I have been looking for a place near my place that isn't high class expensive.  RELAXING CENTER had good reviews even though just 5 of them but the price and distance was perfect. I called, today being labor day, i thought it may  e closed but it was open and excepted a request for a noon appt. When i walked in 2 gentleman greeted me and one asked if i had an appt., i said i called earlier and they pointed me to a door with curtain on it. I walked inside and it was dimmly lit and there was a massage table there ready. One gentleman put towel on the face rest part and the other gentleman man was there telling me to lay down face down...this is where i thought it was odd.. i asked fully dressed (i had on shorts and a tank top) the one gentleman said yes (this is odd cuz im used to getting down to my undies and having privacy while doing that) so i laid down fully dressed and the guy put a towel on top of me and proceeded to give me an excellent Swedish Massage. The Therapist's name is Sun and i will recommend him to anyone. $50 for an hour massage is a deal, and i am feeling fabulous as well. The decor is nothing to write home about but its welcoming.  They have relaxing music playing but if someone walks in for an appt. you'll hear the conversation. I was okay with it since i was basically asleep. I am thinking of going back for the foot massage with one of my girlfriends, it would be a nice girl night experience.  I'm giving for stars only because i think if i didnt have the clothes on i could of relaxed a little more, but again it was all fabulous. .

2.description: I have tried many places before and so far this is the place knows their craft.  I even took my husband with me once and he said it is even better than China.  So happy that I found a place close to home and can afford on a regular bases.

5.description: The highlight of this place is the full back massage after the foot part. They start off w/ a general tea soak, followed by a facial/head massage... then a very mild foot massage. Then, this is the only place i've been that does a lay down full back massage. I've been here twice, and both time it was a full hour, not a minute less! Remember to get a reward card because every 8th time, you get 20min free!

6.description: Oh my goodness!!! I absolutely loved them. The husband and I went to this at 9pm and they were just phenomenal. At first I thought they were a little soft with my feet but then I realized that the points they were hitting were not actually an issue. The second they got to my right foot a whole different story. Every point was pain. But towards the end I felt the relief of those points. I will be going every week.

7.description: Very professional techniques. The price is very reasonable.  Been open a couple of months only. Owner is very friendly. It's a no thrill type of massage place but you will feel the "works" after! Would def come back.

0.description: This place is really amazing. The massage was nice and left me very relaxed from a streasful day!

4.description: Having had a foot massage while visiting NYC I was curious how this would compare.   I was pleasantly surprised with the attention paid to my feet vs other places.   I really enjoyed my massage and my only gripe is all of the talking going on in the next room.  They talked the entire hour & I would have preferred some quiet time.

58.description: Best Chinese food I have ever had.  Be warned the portions are huge. One plate will easily feed 2 adults. Home style = Huge portions. Delicious!The staff are friendly too. I recommend this place highly.

56.description: Finally, after attempt after attempt, we have found some good Chinese food in Chicago! The portions are large, delivery came within the time slot they estimated, and everything was still hot when it got here. The beef and broccoli tasted fresh and the crab Rangoon was great. Overall, a good experience!

29.description: Saw their AD in some free Chinese paper a while back and finally had a chance to give it a try. All 4 lunch special dishes were good and nice portion for us. Only wish they had  used less salt!Next time we'd definitely try some of their Northern Chinese style boa, scallion cake, etc. that are made of flour.

42.description: Quantity was great, quality was ok.  Perhaps my expectations were set very high after reading the Yelp reviews, but I actually found several of the entrees to be too sweet and loaded with sauce.  Scallion pancakes were delicious and really inexpensive at $3.95 for an appetizer.

23.description: The best restaurant in Chicago, and I don't just mean Chinese. My boyfriend and I like to think this is "our place."We discovered it almost a year ago and we try and go at least once a month. We have our usual dish- squid with pepper sauce (ORDER IT, trust me) and switch it up with two other dishes every time we're there.I could talk forever about this hidden gem and the great service and, obviously, even better food. Run, don't walk.

47.description: Good overall. Too much msg and salt even when requested to go gentle on the salt.The potato and beef stew was delicious and so was the beef scallion pancake. Unfortunately there was some confusion on the delivery contact information and I was not able to eat until 2 hours later;(

8.description: I was let down. My husband ordered the pork bun appetizer and they were bigger than we've ever seen. He enjoyed them, but even if I was eating them we couldn't have eaten more than half. I ordered the scallion pancakes and they were below average, very dense, not much scallion. I ordered the spicy eggplant and it was not spicy not even in the slightest. Not only was it not spicy, it was SO sweet that I couldn't even eat it. The goopy gravy seemed like pure corn starch. Uneatable. My husband got the fried beef noodles and those were actually not too bad. The flavor was nice and simple. But overall, I was so disappointed I picked up food elsewhere on the way home.

31.description: Have not had one bad dish here. There's one really good waitress that is a little more proficient in English and can give good recommendations. "Dank Q"

34.description: Beef noodle soup. Rich beef broth, baby book Choy cilantro homemade noodles , a hint of anise with a little red pepper kick . Was the star of the night servers were very attentive and sweet. Beef was so tender. Excited to come back and try the beef noodle soup. Dumplings come with thinly threads of ginger in black vinegar . I'll be back!Great servers very attentive.

16.description: Homestyle Taste is a restaurant that continues to reinforce what I've been trying to tell people for years now - There is a lot of great Chinese food outside of Chinatown, you just have to look for it (good thing we have Yelp to help us with that!).Unfortunately, the dishes at this restaurant aren't fancy looking, the decor isn't flashy, the restaurant isn't huge -- however, this restaurant shines where it really matters: The quality of the food. One of the great things here is that you can order pretty much anything off the menu and have faith that it will be executed to at least good quality. There are too many Chinese restaurants out there that specialize in just a few excellent dishes and have mediocre offerings for the remainng items. Add in surprisingly good service for a small restaurant and inexpensive prices (considering that this is a Michelin recommended restaurant that serves gourmet food) and you have a winning combination.Here's what I thought about some of the dishes I tried:Stir-Fried Cumin Flavor Lamb 孜然羊肉: Very strong cumin flavor, very tender lamb that was fatty and had just the right amount of salt and seasoning. The chilis here add more aroma than they do spiciness. Probably the best I've had since TL's Four Seasons.Fried Fish Fillet with Special Sauce 滑溜魚片: The nice garlic flavor really makes this a comfortable dish to eat with rice (like what you'd eat all day to relax while you're snowed in). The vegetables in the dish were really crisp and juicy to provide perfect contrast to the soft-as-tofu fish. Probably the best I've had since Yilin.Shredded Chicken with Basil 九層塔雞柳: A very strong basil flavor comes through in this dish. The chicken is cut thin but very tender (more like pork than like shredded chicken texture). The juicy bell peppers go excellently with the chicken. Strong contender to Mapo's version of this dish.Beef Roll 牛肉卷餅: Very well balanced, the beef flavor could come out a bit more but that doesn't really detract much from the dish. The pancake is perfectly crisp on the outside with a nice bouncy texture within. Strong contender to Hing Kee and Mapo's version of this dish.Grilled Lamb Skewer 烤羊肉串 and Grilled Chicken Skewer 烤雞肉串: Personally I prefered the lamb a bit more than the chicken since it was more flavorful but they were both cooked very well, very flavorful with a little more aggression on the saltiness (other dishes were generally pretty light, so this is closer to what you'd normally expect from Chinese food), with an excellent bouncy texture and slightly crispy outside.Overall, excellent food at excellent prices. Don't confuse homestyle taste with home cooking -- the flavors are authentic but definitely prepared by an trained chef. None of the items were the best of each dish I've ever had, but overall each dish was well above average. As the quality is close to the signature items at other restaurants, this will definitely save you a lot of travelling and adventures if you are short on time (but I strongly encourage you to explore and Yelp about other restaurants if you have the time!). Definitely a hidden gem and a quiet rival to the quality of other better known restaurants.

13.description: Great Chinese food! I got Sesame Chicken with fried rice (instead of white) as a lunch special and it came out to $6. The chicken was delicious and the breading was still crispy after 20 mins. It had a great portion of sauce and the fried rice was very flavorful. Also, the crab rangoon might've been the best I've had.They did not include soy sauce with my take-out which at first upset me, but the food was so good that I didn't even need it. I usually have to use 3+ packets on my Chinese food. Will definitely come again!

11.description: Very good service. Food taste great. Would drive out from the suburbs to eat here again. Lunch menu until has fair pricing, dinner menu has a great selection. The green tea was not very good, but the lamb and chicken skewers where out of this world.

39.description: Honestly don't know why this place has so many stars.  Got to try 6 different things on the menu and go me nothing was good just made average.  The best thing I got to try was the beef appetizers in my picture and the sour cabbage soup - I love cabbage.  Other than that the spicy beef was basically old frozen tofu, bean sprouts, cabbage, beef and chili oil.. Too salty.  The dumplings were nothing to rave about but they were not bad.  Also service was slow to order and i know we were in Chinatown but when you can't even ask questions about the menu or ask for spicy peppers cause NO ONE knows English it can get a little irritating.  Defiantly won't ever come back to this place!

37.description: I am from south china but I think the food here is pretty good.   It's quite tasty.  酸菜白肉（stewed pork with sour cabbage ) is soup style. Perfect for winter. lamb skewer (羊肉串） is the best in Chicago. Fat and lean meat portion is very nice. It also has strong cumin flavor.   Stir-fried cumin flavor lamb with bone is a must-order! It has onion and green pepper.  Eggplant and pork with brown sauce is sweet and sour. They are deep fried. A little greasy.  The cold noodle (五彩大拉皮） has wasabi and peanut sauce.  It does not impress us that much. Stewed beef with potato is good only of you ask for add spicy !  In general It is a good place especially in winter ! And it is not pricy.

0.description: Yes! Yes! Yes! AAaaaallllll the YES!Home Style Taste has been our new go-to for a few months now. We eat Chinese take-out way more than I like to admit and have created a pretty solid circuit of restaurants over time. Home Style Taste has not only made it into the regular rotation but has also replaced several restaurants we've been frequenting for years. The restaurant is simple and laid back and the service is pretty good. Our takeout orders are always executed perfectly. I can't even think of a time when we got the food home to find a mistake. That in and of itself is a pretty incredible feat in the Chinese takeout game. The real star here is the food. Everything we've had is spectacular. - Xia Long Bao (soup dumplings) - Best I've had. Obviously these are a little difficult for takeout anywhere as the soup may end up leaking out but everything about it is excellent. Order while dining in for best experience. - Shrimp and chive steamed dumplings - Best I've had in the area. The dough on the dumpling is perfect. Just the right amount of bite to the noodle and the proportion of shrimp, pork, and chives is spot on.- Long shape pot sticker - Best I've had in the area. I think  because these are pan fried they have a tendency to come out greasy but not at Home Style Taste. The outside is perfectly crisp with the juiciest pork filling. - Chive pie - Yum! A lovely little pocket of green freshness. - Beef fried noodle - Really any fried noodle (we also order shrimp fried noodle from time to time). The noodles are excellent. With a mix of noodles, beef, cabbage, and onions this dish is one that I'm constantly craving. Excellent comfort food and one of my favorite things to eat while sitting on the couch in my pajamas binge watching Netflix. The only thing that's slightly disappointing is the crab rangoon. It's a guilty pleasure of mine but I just can't get down with these 'goons. I noticed a lot of other reviewers raving about them but I seriously don't understand why. These are WAY too sweet for me. If sweet rangoons are your thing then maybe these are winners for you but I avoid them after a couple of tries. We've eaten many other dishes from Home Style Taste and all have been equally as good. If you haven't had the chance to experience Home Style taste just message me and I'll meet you there. I'm pretty sure I'll be craving those noodles.

38.description: I have no idea why there are 5 star reviews for this place.  We walk in and the waitress is prepping raw chicken skewers at the table next to us, I should have known better and left then. The atmosphere was uncomfortable, bright lights, stark quietness expect for the TV was on- not a restaurant atmosphere that I want.  The food was salty and terrible, and the waitress didn't tell us that all the portions are family style and huge.  The potsticker order included 10 potstickers, I am just use to 2-4. Kung pow chicken was overly salty and sweet. Overall an uncomfortable and bad experience.

51.description: I've tasted the restaurants in Chinatown here, but I wasn't impressed.  That's why Yelp has become my trusty guide for "authentic" Chinese food.  I'm glad I've found one in Chicago.  To be honest, I was about to give up on this quest.  I was warmly greeted in Chinese, and all the patrons, except my hubby, were Chinese and spoke Mandarin, myself included.  I'm quite familiar with Northern Chinese cuisines, because that was the kind of food Mom cooked for the entire household growing up.  Daddy likes it because my paternal grandparents came from Northern China before emigrating to Taiwan in the 1940s.  Perhaps I was a little too excited and ordered more than what two (2) people could consume, but the extra were taken home and saved for lunch at work.  Since I'm fluent in Chinese, I called the shots for ordering.  I chose the veggie medley (sautéed eggplants, green peppers, and potatoes), beef with basil, shrimp and chive dumplings, and crispy chicken and eggplants.  Obviously, all of the dishes were done in the Northern Chinese style.  The dumplings were outstanding.  The aroma of "chive" was prominent and almost "smelly," of course in a good way.  I appreciated that they brought out the soy sauce, hot sauce, and the black vinegar.  This shows that this restaurant is legit and a real deal.  I enjoyed the crispy chicken.  The breading was light and not too heavy or powdery.  The eggplants in the veggie medley were delicious and not too salty.  The beef was tender and flavorful.  Like what other yelpers mentioned, if you're not a native Mandarin Chinese speaker, yes you will probably face a difficult time dining in here.  I didn't even look at the English translation on each menu item, but hubby said the English part was slightly awkward.  In other words, communication will be 100-percent useful in Chinese, so leave your "English language" at home.  The young lady kindly informed us that there was a ten (10) percent discount when paying with cash.  Unfortunately, we didn't bring enough cash for this meal.  The total came to $40, and I will have at least one (1)-meal worth of leftovers.  There are ample street parking spots available, and the meters don't run on the weekends, but double-check that to be sure.  Otherwise, CTA bus 8 (Halstad) runs by it. The location is also very close to U.S. Cellular Field, so if you would like to forgo the Chicago-style hotdog and go for the Chinese...

27.description: Most real authentic Chinese food in Chicago no doubt.

32.description: Went here this past week with someone who knows this kind of restaurant. I had the cumin lamb and it was wonderful! Very tender, spicy, served on the bone, but very easy to eat. A real favorite.  The tenderest most juicy cumin lamb I have found to date! Often the lamb in deep fried, so that it is crunchy, and this is great, too. But the cumin lamb at the Home Style Taste restaurant is truly special. The Eggplant and Bok Choi dishes were also great. I had them boxed and they provided a whole meal later that day at my Airbnb. Check with the staff about parking. They have it and it is free, but sometimes a little tricky to get to. Really happy to find this restaurant!

Definitely a hidden gem and a quiet rival to the quality of other better known restaurants.

48.description: Definitely this place will become my "personal canteen" lol i love the beef pancake. It is the best that i have ever had and their lychee tea with grass jelly...man... i wanna try every dish on that menu

44.description: During a cold winter night, I was craving for some authentic Chinese food for dinner.  I didn't want to go too far to get food, so my sister suggested that we try out Homestyle Taste in Bridgeport.  I never noticed this restaurant, probably due to the run down exterior.  The interior was not much better either due to the dingy lighting, old furniture, and dirty menus.  You can say this is a true hole in a wall type of restaurant.  For food, we ordered a couple of things to share:Lamb Skewers: WARNING! Do not order these.  The skewers were mostly fat and were over seasoned with cumin and other spices.  It was probably to cover up the bad cut of meat used to make this dish.Deep Fried Sautéed String Beans:  nothing too special about this string bean dish.  It tastes similar to many string bean dishes I have eaten in the past.  If you enjoy string beans then I would recommend giving these a try.Sizzling Beef in Sweet and Sour Sauce: I have never seen or heard of beef in sweet and sour sauce before; it's usually cooked with pork.  This was delicious! The cuts of beef were tender and the sauce was really well balanced between the acidity and the sweetness.  Definitely order this if you enjoy sweet and sour dishes.Xiao Long Bao (Pork Dumplings): if you don't know what xiao long baos are, then you are in for a treat.  Xiao long baos are steamed pork dumplings filled with soup.  WARNING: do not put the whole dumpling in your mouth once it comes out.  It is extremely hot.  These are some decent dumplings because some places the pork isn't flavorful enough or the soup is dried up, but at Homestyle the flavor and the cook on the dumplings were perfect.Homestyle Taste is definitely a winner in my books.  The entrees lean more towards Northern Chinese style cuisine, so if that is not what you are looking for then this is not the place for you.  The servers here are very prompt and attentive.  The only thing is that they speak Mandarin (not Cantonese which is the dialect I speak) and their English isn't the greatest.  Either way, the location is convenient and the food is delicious.  I will definitely be back to try out other dishes from here.

24.description: Surprised by the great reviews. I ordered takeout: shrimp chive steamed dumplings I ended up throwing out because they were undercooked. The filling was almost raw! The lamb w cumin was just ok, with the lamb not cooked well either. Not going back despite the fact that its in my 'hood'.

7.description: I heard about Home Style Taste when it was aired on Chicago's Best.  I have eaten Chinese food 100's of times, but never anything like what they have at this restaurant.  The restaurant was featured both in 2014 & 2015 by Michelin.  The quality of the food was excellent.  The waitresses were very friendly and helpful in guiding our selection of the different dishes.This restaurant is located off the beaten path south of Chinatown @ 3205 S Halsted Street.  This area has a couple of other Chinese restaurants opening up (Chinatown South?) The cuisine is from the NE part of China & frequented by Chinese from the region because of the authenticity of the cuisine from that region of China.  The interior decor is nothing note worthy, but the food is excellent.  When we arrived there were people standing outside the door waiting to be seated (mostly young people).  I went with my sister & wife.  We ordered 2 beef soups @ the waitresses suggestion (1 to go), 2 appetizers & one main dish for a bill less then $40.00.  We also had left overs to go.Beef Noodle Soup had an excellent flavor of beef broth seasoned with garlic & cilantro, with large very tender pieces of perfectly seasoned beef, large udon like noodles, & Bok Choy.  Potstickers W/Shrimp & chives, dipped in soy, vinegar and hot chili oil - deliciousDumplings - seasoned pork also dipped in soy vinegar with gingerFried tofu pieces perfectly cooked with peas, diced carrots with Spicy Yu Xian sauceI can't wait to go back and try some other dishes.  They also have a lunch menu for around $5.95 which I plan on checking out.  It beats the hell out of McDonalds

49.description: Homestyle is an oasis south of the Chinatown wasteland. I've finally found fantastic Chinese in Chicago. We ordered the deep fried sautéed string beans, Yu Xian style eggplant, homemade stewed tofu, and lychee iced tea. Everything was amazing and full of flavor. All the dishes complimented each other. The prices were very fair too. tl;dr: Go here if you want possibly the best Chinese food in Chicago.

40.description: This is exactly the kind of place I love to discover when I'm traveling - major shout out to my Yelp peeps.  We do NOT have anything like this in Charleston.  Very authentic and delicious Chinese cuisine.  Casual atmosphere.  Signs all over the place are in Chinese, as is the menu, but there is an English translation that will give you the jist of the dish.  There were a couple of servers who spoke good English too, and they helped us out.I ordered a lamb dish that I saw brought out to another table...wasn't sure exactly what it was but it was tasty. Cumin spiced lamb with mild and spicy peppers.  The only gripe I had was that there were A LOT of fatty pieces on the lamb I had to eat around.Hubs got the kung pao chicken and it did not disappoint.  Totally worth a stop if you're in the area and craving some awesome Chinese food.

53.description: Wow, this place is the real deal. It was small and full of many Chinese patrons, which is usually a good sign. The food was some of the best Chinese I've had, and unique to boot (Northern style).We ordered quite a bit of food, the standouts were the iron pot duck, lamb skewers, spicy pig ear, and a kidney dish that was so tasty we ordered extra rice to enjoy the last few drops of the sauce. The hot pot was seemingly endless, filled with chunks of tender duck, marinated tofu, a shredded soybean "pasta", thin white mushrooms, and potato chunks. The pork bao buns were huge, with a nice lemongrass spice to the juicy pork filling. It was busy, but we were able to easily flag servers for occasional help. I'd recommend the food to anyone looking to expand their horizons, it was a great experience here.

30.description: I recommend the beef roll and the stewed beef and tendon. Awesome!

46.description: Ok so we've had a ton of their dishes now:Long Potstickers - decent.  Not better or worse than other places.Spicy Beef Tendon - Really good.  It's actually a mix of tendon, sliced beef, and tripe.Braised Tofu - Ok so throughout the menu there's a "brown sauce."  This is a generic (not Chinese takeout style) soy sugar cornstarch thing.  I wouldn't be surprised if this also includes some beef braising liquid too so if you're vegetarian I'd check first.Twice Cooked Pork Belly - This is just ok.  Still worth giving a shot if you haven't found your favorite yet.Stir Fried Pork Intestine - This is also in the generic Brown sauce.  Really good.Green Onion Pancake - Meh.  This was just ok.  It's actually not as oil/flaky as other places, which a lot of people would consider a good thing.Pork Buns - If this place delivered to me, I'd be ordering this all the freaking time.  The wrapping is not like Wow Bao, this is Northern style where it isn't as delicate.Pork Soup Dumplings - Yeah you know what I like this as much as Hing Kee's now.Stir Fried Green Beans - A Stalwart dish.Meatball Cabbage Tofu Soup - If you're feeling under the weather, this is the dish to get.  It's light and delicious and is just the type of stuff Asian grandmas would make you eat.Beef Noodle Stew - Right now this is my favorite Beef Noodle Stew in Chicago.  The noodles are Q-y, the beef is tender, and broth packs a ton of flavor.Basil Chicken - You can choose between dark or white meat!  Crazy talk, no?  By default it's dark meat.  Also with the brown sauce, but with BASIL and EXTRA garlic in clay pot.  I'm usually not that big a fan of this dish but I liked it a lot here.

1.description: I want to give this place 5 stars but the service was so terrible that I can't. I studied abroad in Beijing and the food here is the real deal! Two of us ordered dumplings, Kung pao chicken, and sweet and sour chicken -- all of which were insanely delicious. The first two items came out relatively quickly, but it took about 30 minutes after that to get the last dish. The waitress swiftly ran the dish over to us, whispered "sorry about that" and then ran away without asking if we needed anything. After we finished eating we sat for another 30 minutes, constantly trying to get the waitress's attention....to no avail. She literally cleaned the table next to us, made eye contact with me and then walked away at one point. I had to finally get up and go over to her to ask for the check. It was extremely frustrating. First rate job by the back of the house. Hire some new waitstaff and all will be well. Definitely good for carry out, but beware if you try and dine in!

55.description: Fellow yelpers recommended this place so I went when I was hankering for some Chinese food. I was a little reluctant at first because someone mentioned that you needed to take a native speaker to order, but I went anyway because I naively thought I could just point at a picture and order that way.Parking is metered but plentiful and the place is small but can accommodate large groups. I walked in and was greeted by a waiter, in English, and was asked if I wanted a table. When I asked for carry out I was handed a menu, also in English with a list of foods that I had never heard of before. He foodie in me was definitely excited. The waiter kinda stood in front of me the whole time which made me nervous(I'm weird like that) so I ordered a beef, egg and rice plate. They were quite quick with my order. I took my plate to my mother in laws house and shared it with her and my sister in law. The plate had some greens and some other type of veggie(?) something I had never seen or eaten but it was glorious! All of us enjoyed the plentiful meal and could not figure out what that thing was. Lol we liked it so much that we are planning on coming back and dining in.

9.description: Beef noodle soup. Rich beef broth, baby book Choy cilantro homemade noodles , a hint of anise with a little red pepper kick . Was the star of the night servers were very attentive and sweet. Beef was so tender. Excited to come back and try the beef noodle soup. Dumplings come with thinly threads of ginger in black vinegar . I'll be back!Great servers very attentive.

26.description: IT FEELS LIKE CHINA!! (Minus the Americanized prices haha).I grew up in Beijing with my mother, grandmother, and eventually myself all being excellent cooks. Needless to say I have super high standards for Chinese homestyle cooking, especially Northern style. Most of the places in Chinatown are either very mediocre and I can make better dishes myself, or are decent but too commercialized that they don't feel homely. Then of course there are some "fusion" or too Americanized places that I don't even consider to be Chinese food anymore.This place however is really the jackpot. It is very Chinesey from the decor to the staff to the menu to of course, the actual dishes. The range of menu items is already a delight. They have all kinds of original and delicious dishes like beef tendons, pork ears, pig intestines etc. that most other restaurants don't carry (to not scare off the Americans?). Well this place doesn't seem to care too much about that - they have positioned themselves very well, as the name suggested, as a place that tastes like home for Chinese people. Too bad they still serve some very Americanized dishes like General Tso's Chicken or Wings with Coke sauce, but I guess that's just for survival.Their dishes are all very delicious and tastes exactly like what I'd expect from a diner in China. I especially recommend their "dim sum" items such as dumplings and fried pancakes. A relative of mine had nanny that was very good at making scallion pancakes and it's always been a crowd pleaser at family gatherings. I haven't been able to find anything that comes close to it until I got introduced to this place. Their eggplant dishes are phenomenal too!What I especially like about this place is that despite how Chinesey they are, both times I've been there we've gotten stellar service. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. It is quite a bonus since I've had to resort to semi-self serving at most Chinese places.

25.description: We get take out here often for their noodle soups! My favs are the beef noodle soups and the pork and cabbage noodle soups! Very generous with the amount of soup and noodles. Really does taste like homestyle comfort food! :) Good prices too!

12.description: IT FEELS LIKE CHINA!! (Minus the Americanized prices haha).I grew up in Beijing with my mother, grandmother, and eventually myself all being excellent cooks. Needless to say I have super high standards for Chinese homestyle cooking, especially Northern style. Most of the places in Chinatown are either very mediocre and I can make better dishes myself, or are decent but too commercialized that they don't feel homely. I especially recommend their "dim sum" items such as dumplings and fried pancakes. I haven't been able to find anything that comes close to it until I got introduced to this place. Their eggplant dishes are phenomenal too!What I especially like about this place is that despite how Chinesey they are, both times I've been there we've gotten stellar service. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. It is quite a bonus since I've had to resort to semi-self serving at most Chinese places.

59.description: How are there only 10 reviews for this place??? Oh yeah, cuz they really only speak Chinese. Very authentic food. Very good. Bring a native speaker when you come or just ask the server to choose the dishes. We've done this before and have never been disappointed.

21.description: We were searching for a legitimate Chinese restaurant that wasn't in Chinatown or any of the touristy areas, and decided to stop by for a Northern fare. We arrived right at opening, and had the place to ourselves the entire time. The quiet interior encompassed wall-to-wall cultural artifacts and tables with white linens vertically arranged. The menu was extensive and enticing. The Beef Tendon with Hot and Chili Sauce ($5.95) was stacked high with sliced tendon that came with great texture, and well seasoned with balanced spicy flavors. This was one of the best beef tendons I have encountered. Recommended.The Chive Pie ($1.95) had a firm exterior that was easy to cut into. It was completely filled with chives that were fresh and flavorful. We really enjoyed this appetizer as well.The Cumin Lamb ($6.95) came with slices of lamb stir fried with onions, cumin seeds, chili, and red and green peppers. There was plenty of lamb, and the cumin seeds were able to deepen the flavors to contrast the bright and sweet peppers. Love it!We had minor disappointment with the Homestyle Steam Soup Buns ($6.95). As a rendition of Xiao Long Bao, the buns were plump and nicely filled with ground pork along with a solid wrapper. However, the level of juiciness was inconsistent. There were some noticeable hits and misses.Otherwise, the traditional flavors across each dish were striking, had great form, and wow factor. Service was friendly, kind, and attentive. We were also offered complimentary Egg Drop Soup to add to this memorable meal. So far, this is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the U.S. I hope to return to try the Iron Pot items, Spicy Pork Ears, Flavored Spicy Bean Curd, and Smoked Rabbit.

17.description: Incredibly solid Chinese at great prices. I got the dry chili chicken which was just as good as the much-lauded Tony Hu version. The long style pot stickers are NOT soup dumplings but were quite good as well. The scallion pancakes were thick and fluffy - definitely a new experience but a pleasant one (if you're looking for what you usually get as scallion pancakes order the "thin pancakes"). They offered a kung pao tofu my friend seemed to enjoy quite a bit. My only complaint was the tea didn't have a ton of flavor. But really, everything was very good and I would definitely return!

10.description: We went there a few days ago. I had a very high expectation because of the exceedingly high Yelp score. However, the food was ok, slightly disappointing. The 3 of us ordered 5 dishes, our unanimous favorite was the cold noodle, it was amazing! The lamb skewer and eggplants were delicious too. However, the Xiao Long Bao and iron pot beef was just average, nothing stood out at all. I might go back for their cold noodle and skewer.

5.description: We were searching for a legitimate Chinese restaurant that wasn't in Chinatown or any of the touristy areas, and decided to stop by for a Northern fare. We arrived right at opening, and had the place to ourselves the entire time. The quiet interior encompassed wall-to-wall cultural artifacts and tables with white linens vertically arranged. The menu was extensive and enticing. The Beef Tendon with Hot and Chili Sauce ($5.95) was stacked high with sliced tendon that came with great texture, and well seasoned with balanced spicy flavors. This was one of the best beef tendons I have encountered. Recommended.The Chive Pie ($1.95) had a firm exterior that was easy to cut into. It was completely filled with chives that were fresh and flavorful. We really enjoyed this appetizer as well.The Cumin Lamb ($6.95) came with slices of lamb stir fried with onions, cumin seeds, chili, and red and green peppers. There was plenty of lamb, and the cumin seeds were able to deepen the flavors to contrast the bright and sweet peppers. Love it!We had minor disappointment with the Homestyle Steam Soup Buns ($6.95). As a rendition of Xiao Long Bao, the buns were plump and nicely filled with ground pork along with a solid wrapper. However, the level of juiciness was inconsistent. There were some noticeable hits and misses.Otherwise, the traditional flavors across each dish were striking, had great form, and wow factor. Service was friendly, kind, and attentive. We were also offered complimentary Egg Drop Soup to add to this memorable meal. So far, this is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in the U.S. I hope to return to try the Iron Pot items, Spicy Pork Ears, Flavored Spicy Bean Curd, and Smoked Rabbit.

3.description: This is now my favorite Chinese restaurant. We've been twice in the past 3 weeks and given the number of restaurants in Chicago, that's rare! Get the stir-fried bing (stir fry with pieces of dough) and dumplings. The wide noodles are excellent too. Cumin flavor lamb with bone was fork tender and immensely flavorful on our first visit but we overheard complaints about chewiness on our second visit. Let go of your fears and be adventurous here, you'll be rewarded! Unlike many Chinese restaurants in Chinatown, service here is super friendly, but may be a tad slow because they get busy, especially on weekends.

35.description: I heard about Home Style Taste when it was aired on Chicago's Best.  I have eaten Chinese food 100's of times, but never anything like what they have at this restaurant.  The restaurant was featured both in 2014 & 2015 by Michelin.  The quality of the food was excellent.  The waitresses were very friendly and helpful in guiding our selection of the different dishes.This restaurant is located off the beaten path south of Chinatown @ 3205 S Halsted Street.  This area has a couple of other Chinese restaurants opening up (Chinatown South?) The cuisine is from the NE part of China & frequented by Chinese from the region because of the authenticity of the cuisine from that region of China.  The interior decor is nothing note worthy, but the food is excellent.  When we arrived there were people standing outside the door waiting to be seated (mostly young people).  I went with my sister & wife.  We ordered 2 beef soups @ the waitresses suggestion (1 to go), 2 appetizers & one main dish for a bill less then $40.00.  We also had left overs to go.Beef Noodle Soup had an excellent flavor of beef broth seasoned with garlic & cilantro, with large very tender pieces of perfectly seasoned beef, large udon like noodles, & Bok Choy.  Potstickers W/Shrimp & chives, dipped in soy, vinegar and hot chili oil - deliciousDumplings - seasoned pork also dipped in soy vinegar with gingerFried tofu pieces perfectly cooked with peas, diced carrots with Spicy Yu Xian sauceI can't wait to go back and try some other dishes.  They also have a lunch menu for around $5.95 which I plan on checking out.  It beats the hell out of McDonalds

19.description: We had an excellent time at Homestyle Taste.  We made a reservation for two on a Saturday night but we didn't really need it--it wasn't totally full around 7 when we arrived.  However, it got busier as the night progressed.  The restaurant is quite small and not super fancy, but it was clean and the service was great.We ordered way too much food.  We started off with an order of beef rolls (mmmm) and dumplings rolled in a long cylinder (mmmmmmmmm).  We also ate some sweet and sour pork (my favorite), sauteed green beans (totally delicious), and cumin stir fried lamb (our least favorite--tasted a bit sweaty).  Overall, we had a lovely meal and left feeling very full and sleepy.  Wasn't the most romantic date night for me and my husband, but sometimes cheap Chinese food is just what the doctor ordered.

28.description: Authentic, big portion, inexpensive.I would come more often if I lived closer.

45.description: Hole-in-the-wall place that is incredibly good. The best crab Rangoon I've had in my life, seriously. Also well above average orange and Kung Pao chicken, excellent service and very affordable prices if you can snag a lunch special. I will definitely be returning to this awesome Bridgeport gem!

33.description: Out of all the Chinese places I've been to around Chicago, this has had to rank the best. Their chives pancakes and scallion pancakes are very authentic. The best dish I've had though is their beef stew noodles. Their noodles are done perfectly and the beef is so tender! They have a good variety of dishes for those who can eat spicy food and those that prefer less spicy dishes. The one disappointment is their service. I had to ask 3 times just to get some water! However, as long as the food continues to be this good, I'm definitely going to be back.

43.description: good spicy fish fillet on white rice with soup. but the sesame chicken was not crispy and fresh enough. overall okay place for chinese food.

2.description: A tasty choice for a Chinese restaurant Christmas outing.Cold noodle was delicious: tangy, slightly sweet and spicyNoodle soup with beef was hearty and hit the spotBamboo shoots with beancurd: savory and fillingPork cakes: kind of dry

18.description: Have not had one bad dish here. There's one really good waitress that is a little more proficient in English and can give good recommendations. "Dank Q"

41.description: The 4th star is for for authentic and unique food. I came here at about 530 and it was pretty quiet. I had the bean curd cold app and I liked the presentation, they were kind enough to offer me rice with it since they said the scallion pancake would take awhile. I liked the bean curd a lot but you have to be prepared for the spice that comes with Sichuan food. The scallion pancake was good too but needed salt, which the restaurant didn't have, but they gave me soy sauce instead. Agree with the other reviews that they don't speak very good English, speak slowly, use actions and be nice and you typically get your point across. They offered me free tea and it's 10% off the bill if you pay cash.

52.description: Staff's English is limited but the menu has numbers for a reason. Very tasty food, reasonably priced. Staff is extremely nice, service is fast. BYOB.

50.description: We had an excellent time at Homestyle Taste.  We made a reservation for two on a Saturday night but we didn't really need it--it wasn't totally full around 7 when we arrived.  However, it got busier as the night progressed.  The restaurant is quite small and not super fancy, but it was clean and the service was great.We ordered way too much food.  We started off with an order of beef rolls (mmmm) and dumplings rolled in a long cylinder (mmmmmmmmm).  We also ate some sweet and sour pork (my favorite), sauteed green beans (totally delicious), and cumin stir fried lamb (our least favorite--tasted a bit sweaty).  Overall, we had a lovely meal and left feeling very full and sleepy.  Wasn't the most romantic date night for me and my husband, but sometimes cheap Chinese food is just what the doctor ordered.

4.description: Went for a group-dinner with friends. What a fantastic HOME STYLE northern Chinese style menu. My fav's were the Green onion pancake with beef and green onions and Squirrel Fish.BYOB too without any hassle. Will be coming back.

6.description: Good price & food. Crab rangoon is really good and there was no line so I recommendThere is also plenty of space for parking

22.description: This is probably the BEST Chinese food restaurant in ALL of the Midwest! It's phenomenal! One of my favorite dishes is the tendon which I ordered by accident and then ended up loving it. Also their sauce for the crab Rangoon is unlike anything I've ever had before. It's sooooo good. Forget Chinatown! Head to this place! I've been to the country of china and this seriously competes with the food I had there.

15.description: I've tasted the restaurants in Chinatown here, but I wasn't impressed.  That's why Yelp has become my trusty guide for "authentic" Chinese food.  I'm glad I've found one in Chicago.  To be honest, I was about to give up on this quest.  I was warmly greeted in Chinese, and all the patrons, except my hubby, were Chinese and spoke Mandarin, myself included.  I'm quite familiar with Northern Chinese cuisines, because that was the kind of food Mom cooked for the entire household growing up.  Daddy likes it because my paternal grandparents came from Northern China before emigrating to Taiwan in the 1940s.  Perhaps I was a little too excited and ordered more than what two (2) people could consume, but the extra were taken home and saved for lunch at work.  Since I'm fluent in Chinese, I called the shots for ordering.  I chose the veggie medley (sautéed eggplants, green peppers, and potatoes), beef with basil, shrimp and chive dumplings, and crispy chicken and eggplants.  Obviously, all of the dishes were done in the Northern Chinese style.  The dumplings were outstanding.  The aroma of "chive" was prominent and almost "smelly," of course in a good way.  I appreciated that they brought out the soy sauce, hot sauce, and the black vinegar.  This shows that this restaurant is legit and a real deal.  I enjoyed the crispy chicken.  The breading was light and not too heavy or powdery.  The eggplants in the veggie medley were delicious and not too salty.  The beef was tender and flavorful.  Like what other yelpers mentioned, if you're not a native Mandarin Chinese speaker, yes you will probably face a difficult time dining in here.  I didn't even look at the English translation on each menu item, but hubby said the English part was slightly awkward.  In other
