words, communication will be 100-percent useful in Chinese, so leave your "English language" at home.  The young lady kindly informed us that there was a ten (10) percent discount when paying with cash.  Unfortunately, we didn't bring enough cash for this meal.  The total came to $40, and I will have at least one (1)-meal worth of leftovers.  There are ample street parking spots available, and the meters don't run on the weekends, but double-check that to be sure.  Otherwise, CTA bus 8 (Halstad) runs by it. The location is also very close to U.S. Cellular Field, so if you would like to forgo the Chicago-style hotdog and go for the Chinese...

57.description: Nice place with good service, around here there are three places to have northeastern Chinese food, this one is good for skewers and some traditional dishes on stir fried, not steamed or boiled, or said spicy food.

20.description: My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for a while now. We love the food because it really feels and tastes like home cooking. The boiled beef in hot pepper sauce is very tasty if you like spicy dishes. Their spicy dish is not overly spicy and you can always ask for extra spicy if you prefer. I personally love the beef stew soup. It has alot of favor and it is served with a generous portion. Service is usually outstanding until the last visit. They always have all female servers but this time we noticed a new face, a male server. I know that we are not the only table that sensed his weirdness. First, he kept saying 'anything else' when he takes your order. It gets pretty annoying. He also does not seem to be very familiar with the menu when one diner asked for suggestions for a dish with pea pods. Another customer came in and asked for a carryout menu, he responded that they don't have a carryout menu available. Really?? During our dinner, the next table stepped outside and clearly left the keys on the table to indicate that they are not running the bill. The male server ran out right after them. Luckily, another server saw the key and stopped him to avoid additional embarrassing moments. When it was time to pay our bill, my husband asked the male server for the bill. He came back with the doggy bag and 'the bill' by itself without the bill cover. My husband handed him the credit card and the male server came back with the bill, cc receipt and cc in the bill cover. Weird. Why not bring one in the first place? I told my husband that I will tip in cash as he signed the cc receipt. The male server rushed over to our table as he watched my husband closes the bill cover. He stopped himself as my husband handed me the bill cover so I can put cash tip inside. The last draw for me was when the male server came over to pick up the bill as soon as I placed it on the corner of our table. I used to work as a waitress in the past and i believe in taking care of our servers. The male server is such a weirdo and I can tell the surrounding non-Asian diners are somewhat offended by his behavior. The one star was deducted because of the odd male server.This is supposed to be a Michelin star restaurant and this type of service is not acceptable.

36.description: We moved back from China about 6 months ago after living there for five years.   And miss the food greatly.  Don't get many opportunities to come into Chicago and knew there is many good Chinese restaurants there.  Saw the reviews on Yelp for Homestyle Taste and wanted to give it a try.  We were not disappointed, it was the flavors that we missed so much.   Had the chef's iron pot with duck with the added items.  Very tasty.Great service also.

14.description: Great price and food. I got 8 roasted lamb and iron pot stewed duck. Tastes good with rice.

58.description: Great food! BYOB.The grilled calamari is a must!Will definitely go back to explore the rest of the menu!

56.description: Excellent food and service.  Went with a large group of seven today for Mothers Day.  Called ahead by fifteen minutes and when we arrived the tables were arranged to accommodate us.  The service was top notch and the food was excellent.  We had a combination of specials, items off the menu and a favorite request for one in our group who had the dish before that wasn't listed. Chicken and Italian sausage combination with roasted vegetables and potatoes, cavatelli with a red white wine sauce, veal scaloppini,  a fantastic "unstuffed"  ravioli with a red cream wine sauce with spicy sausage crumbles and and grilled pork chops with sauteed spinach and mushrooms in a delicate white wine sauce.  Everything seasoned perfectly. A fantastic cafe, friendly staff and accommodating for all.  If you haven't been, you must try.  Byob

29.description: Gio's is and will always be my number one favorite restaurant around. It has an adorable atmosphere and the food is amazing. I am half Italian and am used to homemade Italian food. Gio's cooking is the closest I've ever had to homemade!The owner Nacio is so wonderful. He is always friendly and accommodating to his customers. I love Gio's and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

42.description: A perfect place for my 100th review!! Gio's is a magical hidden gem in Bridgeport, totally authentic Italian in a quaint little space. That being said, the dining area is quite small and you may need a reservation on a Friday or Saturday evening. The wait staff is very friendly and helpful. A huge plus for people driving in, free neighborhood parking!! Try anything, try everything you won't be disappointed.

23.description: Great little Italian restaurant tucked into a small corner in Chicago. Staff is very friendly and accommodating to customizations of their menu. I was here for lunch, I think its more suited for dinner. BYOB is very interesting as well. We had a party of 7 and they were able to serve us all quickly and easily.

47.description: Came here a little after 4pm on a beautiful Saturday and snagged the only outdoor table.  This is a charming neighborhood italian joint in a homey corner of the city. The olive oil was fabulous, and had basil leaves infused in it. The cheese sticks are a must: HUGE cheesy wedges with fantastic tomato sauce. My pepper and egg sandwich was perfect - cooked exactly the way it should be. Waiter recommended the tiramisu because, in his words, "it's the best," and it was. Service was prompt. Overall, a fantastic, relaxing, and delectable dining experience.

8.description: I heard some good things from people that live in the area, its byob which is cool, the dining area is kind of small, there isn't a whole lot of space, plus it's also like a grocery store. We got the bruschetta app, and then i got the special of rigatoni and sausage, both were really good, as was the bread n butter even lol maybe a little pricier than i was expecting, but i still liked everything i had and wouldnt mind going back

31.description: Four letters BYOB!! My boyfriend took me here to try real authentic Italian food from the heart of Bridgeport. We can't stop recommending it to people in the area! Vodka Pasta is scrumptous along with the tiramisu. its decently priced and a great place to have a dinner and a few bottles of Vino. Its a hidden Gem!!

34.description: WE eat here at least 3 times a month. Its a BYOB, the food is OUTSTANDING and so are the servers. We often ask for recommendations from our favorite server when trying something new or different, We excitedly bring our freinds and neighbors to enjoy the good food too for celebrations. Small neighborhood experience with Downtown Food selections.

16.description: Great little Italian restaurant tucked into a small corner in Chicago. Staff is very friendly and accommodating to customizations of their menu. I was here for lunch, I think its more suited for dinner. BYOB is very interesting as well. We had a party of 7 and they were able to serve us all quickly and easily.

13.description: We read the reviews and were very excited about trying. The waitstaff was pleasant and talkative. The place looked like what it is - a deli.Unfortunately, the food was okay. Not bad, but not terribly flavorful. It was just not really worth the prices paid.

11.description: I love that this place has groceries and fine dining. This spot is byob so please take advantage of that. The service is great very helpful and accommodating . The food is awesome I love the pasta that comes with peas and prosciutto, it's creamy deliciousness. This place is close to me and I will be coming again.

39.description: Gio's is strong, very strong. 5 stars.  Eat the good Italian stuff: breaded egg plant, tripe soup, eye-Talian sawsage, meat balls, syuff with onions and peppers, and such. It is very tasty.

37.description: Absolutely delicious! Best Italian food I have had! Although the location & scenery is a bit off the food makes all the difference!The staff was extremely helpful and nice I will definitely go back. The shrimp diavolo was amazing best I have ever had!

0.description: It always seems crowded when I go!I have tried various pastas and loved everything.  Look for the specials on the board above the kitchen.  I also like that it is a store too so you can buy some Italian goodies to go.

38.description: My friends brought me to Gio's which was their favorite Italian restaurant. I had the shrimp Diavolo linguine. The dish was perfectly tasty and spicy but I was a little disappointed as the pasta was noticeably overcooked. The setting is very casual and you could BYOB. I'd recommend it for a good casual meal.

51.description: Neat little old school Italian place that screams Chicago. Tasty arranccini and flavorful sausage and peppers. This really is a neighborhood joint that functions as both specialty deli and casual restaurant. It can get busy at night, but lunch is a blast. Street parking can get tricky. Lots of Mayor Daley lookalikes and your stereotypical broad -shouldered Chicagoans. BYOB so bring your best wine to go with this little Italian gem.

27.description: This was a great place! Some of the absolute best Italian food I've ever eaten! Really great atmosphere and the waitress was super helpful. Be prepared to be there for a while. One waitress, few tables, and lots of people wanting to eat there! I will definitely go again and would highly recommend this place!

32.description: I really wanted the food to be good after seeing the reviews I had high expectations. Sorry to say my experience was not an enjoyable one. I ordered delivery and bought 3 dishes and 1 cannoli over $50... the meal size was pretty big unfortunately they lacked in flavor and only one of the 3 dishes had meat and very little at that. The chicken marsala which I sampled tasted weird. The sauce was not appetizing and had strange flavor and the chicken was practically paper thin almost non existent. I bought the tortiglioni carbonara for myself and it was decent but depended to much on heavy cream and not enough seasoning. And finally I sampled the baked cavatelli dish which was surprisingly the best in flavor of the 3. The best thing about the pasta in the dishes were that they were absolutely perfectly aldente. Oh the cannoli was yummy when slightly heated in the toaster oven! My overall opinion.....taste wise needs some more effort....quantity pretty good....quality hit or miss.

54.description: Gio's is amazing!  The food is so good, the service is fabulous and the prices are reasonable.  I had the arancini and the chicken parmigiana.  Their marinara sauce is delicious; possibly some of the best I've ever had.  I am still day dreaming about the arancini: a large rice ball filled with meat and cheese, deep fried and covered in that amazing sauce.  My friend had the baked cavatelli and she really liked that as well.  The portions are generous but not overwhelming like some Italian places.  I wish I lived closer, I'd be here everyday!

48.description: i went here about 4 years ago and it was just okay. i heard people say how awesome it was. but then i had to go because my sister didn't use her groupon. i have to say my opinion changed. i read a lot of the reviews on here so i tried the grilled calamari which were okay. if you never had it i would say try it, but if it's not your thing i say pass it. i been here twice within a month. i had the rigatoni vodka and added sausage it was really good (it was creamy, but not too creamy). my fiance ordered tortiglioni carbonara and i had to try it, it was delicious!!! i actually ate his plate and he ate mine. the next time i came in i had tortiglioni and the only thing i would would ask next time is not to add the prosciutto, it tastes like old dried ham. my fiance got the shrimp alfredo that was good and creamy and i do agree with other reviews it only has 4 pieces of shrimp which is disappointing. i would definitely be back.

44.description: Gio's is great!  Perfect place for a small group.  The grilled calamari and sausage and peppers were delicious.  The prices were reasonable, but lots of little extra charges that I was not aware of until we received the bill.  I will definitely be back soon.  Remember Gio's is BYOB.

24.description: One of my favorite things about Bridgeport. And a big thanks for having gluten free options.

7.description: Had the pleasure of dining at Gio's tonight.Its one of those "hidden" neighborhood places that most people never get to see.Its on a side street and if it wasnt  of my trusty Yelp app I wouldnt of been lucky enough to find it.Its a charming little spot.It also has the added bonus of being BYOB.I really enjoyed my experience there.One of my favorite Italian dishes is Zuppa di Pesce.Theirs was really good.I wasnt disappointed with my meal not one bit.Really savored their Tiramisu!!!! It was a nice big juicy slice that I didnt even think I would finish by just looking at it.But OMG!!!!! I SURE AS HELL DID!!!! THUMBS UP!!!!!!! I look forward to dining in more often since I had such a good experience there with my meal and service.Has like a homey feel to it if you end up going downstairs.Not a bad thing.I kinda liked it!!!!!

49.description: Gio's is great!  I love eating in a setting like this. Very quaint & casual. The arancini are so good. I always get the spinach & ricotta stuffed one.  The gravy is pretty good too. Everything tastes homemade. I got the Mona Lisa salad today with spinach, peas, and chicken. I wish there were more peas but all in all it was very good, spinach was tender, and dressing was perfect and not overwhelming.

40.description: Terrific neighborhood gem for authentic Italian food from a friendly wait staff/family.   A friend introduced this small restaurant to me this week and I loved it.   This restaurant/ market should not be missed and you can shop after your done eating!  Don't forget to BYOB too!

53.description: I had the salmon with broccoli and potato wedges. Very tasty, but would have has gnocchi with the meal. My husband had veal parmesan/pasta average meal could have had more italian spices. All and all they are very nice and the portion was great.

30.description: Was here for a friends birthday... We have been dozens of times.. They must have new cooks cause things have changed. Grilled calamari was great as always... But the chicken dishes left a bad taste in our mouths. They were over sauced to the point that you could fill a soup bowl. Also we ordered 2 totally different dishes and they tasted exactly alike. What a shame... Luckily the tiramisu was still the same. I hate the idea that I must find a new Italian place..

46.description: Great food and great small spot in the middle of the neighborhood. Loved the food but not so much my waiter, he look like he had a bad day but that didn't really ruin my experience so will def will be back and BYOB how great is that.

1.description: Gio's is a great semi hidden Italian restaurant in Bridgeport, all of the locals know about it. I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad meal. It's a smaller place, probably seats 50, that can get loud depending who is there. They have great pasta and sauces (gravy, im not here to debate this), im not a big fan of gnocchi, but there is one of the few places I will eat it. The vodka sauce is amazing as well. They usually have fish specials, I've had some very good fishes dishes here, look out for the specials!It used to be BYOB im not sure, I haven't brought any the last two times I have eaten here. The owner is always around he is very friendly. The staff is great about explaining dishes and giving recommendations. The baked clams are amazing, a little smaller but well worth it.  Definitely try the soup and a side of the sausage.It's also a deli with shelves around the walls where you can buy pasta, cheeses, sausage and your other needs.

55.description: Gem. Every time I go food has been consistently exquisite. Service is good, and at dinner time on weekends it is full.  Love it when they have groupons for their restaurant! Can't get enough of this place~ vesuvio potatoes, calamari, tortiglioni carbonara, rigatoni vodka, fettuccine with shrimp, my god. Let me wipe the drop off my face before I continue typing!!!! I believe their noodles are homemade as well? Not sure.... Texture is just different than other places I've had~. Can't wait to go back again!!!!!!!

9.description: This was a great place! Some of the absolute best Italian food I've ever eaten! Really great atmosphere and the waitress was super helpful. Be prepared to be there for a while. One waitress, few tables, and lots of people wanting to eat there! I will definitely go again and would highly recommend this place!

26.description: The bad thing is their location, used to be an all Italian neighborhood. originally from Bridgeport, heard about Gio's, was looking forward to eating there, what a disappointment!!! went for lunch 2 PM on a Friday, had their Italian beef sandwich, my wife had the Italian Salad, the Salad was the only reason I gave it one star.nothing to write home about, the Beef had absolutely no taste to it what so ever, like the Italians    don't know about spices? I saw two tables of kitchen staff eating after the rush hour,, 8 in all, all hispanic, speaking in Spanish, love Spanish, Mexican food but, I was there for ITALIAN food!!! after we left, I told my wife "what a waste of time and money! Do yourself a favor, don't eat there, buy yourself a hotdog, you'll be much happier.

25.description: Had the breaded steak and stuffed artichoke. Very tasty! Love the food! Always very friendly and always busy. I am not very fancy so I haven't ordered pasta dishes but they look great also! Love how they sell the peppers and things to take home!

12.description: Was a huge fan of their fried calamari and spaghetti. Hubby was not too impressed,  but I would love to go back.

59.description: Me and my partner went here for a change of pace to get out of my neighborhood restaurants and I must say we had a great time! The good was tasty and the service was good. I will say they initially served me a glass that had lipstick on it and clearly I wasn't wearing that shade...lol overall a great place to eat.

21.description: Decadent, homestyle Italian in the cutest little shop. Instant food coma every time. Dieters not welcome.

17.description: Interesting atmosphere, you are in the middle of a store.  Food is good, service friendly.  BYOB which was awesome, since the food in on the expensive side.

10.description: I didn't even want to give this place one star can you put no stars. I would give it stardust if measurement more  precise. For starters the bruchetta was soggy as a mop that sucked sponge dried the sewers of chicago. The acidic tomatoes burned the whoooole way down... and out. I ordered rigatoni vodka, and was surprised to find brown cream sauce, dry noodle totally overcooked. It was a smugglers sauce that lacked richness, frugle with cheese. I could hardly tolerate the taste and never finished. $40.00 usThos is a definite pass.Onle Positive: impromptu dog treat

5.description: It might look like a plain Italian grocery from the outside, but once you go in and try their food you'll be surprised. Well, I was. The portions are pretty big so i recommend sharing with your friends/family. Will come back for sure. I get some pasta cravings.

3.description: Came in on Christmas Eve for dinner and it got pretty busy. Never even knew this existed till we came in with a couple of friends. It's a grocery store but it is also a restaurant. It has a family feel to it and everything we ordered came in huge portions and I recommend people splitting two to a plate. Everything seems it's good for family style. We all had 4 different types of pasta and they all had their own unique taste. The waitress kindly gave us plates so we can try one another's dishes. I like mine the most (pictured). We also had some appetizer: calamari & mozzarella. Both were pretty great but very oily due to it being deep fried. It's also BYOB too! Family friendly and more family style.

35.description: Found this on yelp. Reviews are right. Great, surprising little gem. It looks like a corner store from outside but it's a delicious little Restsurant. Fast friendly service. Reasonably priced. I had the meat ravioli. It was great.

19.description: Terrific neighborhood gem for authentic Italian food from a friendly wait staff/family.   A friend introduced this small restaurant to me this week and I loved it.   This restaurant/ market should not be missed and you can shop after your done eating!  Don't forget to BYOB too!

28.description: Outstanding find off the beaten path.  Service was phenomenal and Alfredo made super recommendations and was very attentive making our dining experience the best.  Thanks Jan for the recommendation.  We met her at draft town and she recommended Gio's so we gave it a try and very glad we did. The checkered table cloths and BYOB (and yes we took our own vino) combined with great homemade food was perfect.  And by the way the tiramisu was to die for.  Give this place a try - worth the trip.

45.description: I've lived in Bridgeport the last five years & have gone to Gio's many of times. I will honestly say that the food was a lot better when I first moved but but I still go there. The sandwiches are good & big if that's what your looking for but the dinners are a little overpriced for the portions and quality that they present. I know other Italian places in the city that I can pay the same and get bigger & better portions . With that saying though it's a great corner neighborhood deli store/restaurant for Bridgeport to have. That's why I gave it above average stars.

33.description: This is a very unassuming place.  The owner is user friendly and they will accommodate requests that are not on the menu.  It is also BYOB and a deli with small amount of groceries to purchase.  The food tho is the star..the meat aricini are the best I've ever had.  I have tried many many items on their menu and they don't miss a beat.  Staff is wonderful and attentive as well.  If you are looking for a real relaxing casual experience this is the place. Stop in And check it out!  It's one of Bridgeports hidden gems!

43.description: You can't go wrong at this place. Great Food and BYOB!

2.description: Nice staff and decent menu. I love the comfortable feel this place has to offer, but I unfortunately have to deduct two stars. The food is too salty. It's to salty that It gives you that super salty after taste an hour later. Maybe I came on a bad night. They WERE about to close. Maybe next time it will be better.

18.description: Gio's is and will always be my number one favorite restaurant around. It has an adorable atmosphere and the food is amazing. I am half Italian and am used to homemade Italian food. Gio's cooking is the closest I've ever had to homemade!The owner Nacio is so wonderful. He is always friendly and accommodating to his customers. I love Gio's and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

41.description: Authentic Italian food!!! Everything is cooked to perfection and the service is fantastic. Everybody there is extremely nice and helpful. There's nothing to complain about. Love this place!

52.description: This little Italian restaurant is a hidden gem in the heart of Bridgeport. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. Definitely order the grilled calamari for starters! The calamari was so fresh! We also ordered the sausage and peppers appetizer, cream of sausage and potato soup, chicken Parmesan, chicken vesuvio, and tortiglioni pasta, and of course Tiramisu! You won't be disappointed with any of their dishes.  Side note: the  bathroom is in the basement, but it is very clean! Staff is very friendly and attentive as well.

50.description: This place is outstanding ! what a great beef sandwich ..WOW is all ..the Italian salad was amazing ...I was amazed that it was open later then I expected a place like this to be open .. I will be back!

4.description: Visited after the autoshow with my girlfriend.  Service is great and was getting busier the longer we stayed. Started off with the fried calamari, was very good. I ordered capellini alle scoglie and my gf ordered clams over linguini. Both were good but noodles were a touch over cooked. Didn't have dessert this time but there will be a next.

6.description: This place is a perfect example that you can't judge a book by its cover!!!I was recommended Gio's by a friend, so glad I tried it.I've tried several dishes here and honestly can't pinpoint a favorite... All fresh and delicious.Don't let the lack of ambience deter you from coming here! Not only can you eat here, but you can pick up a few Italian kitchen staples too!BTW.... BYOB***** Only beer and wine, no hard liquor***

22.description: This place makes my favorite carbonara pasta. It's heavy,  so expect that.  But the flavors and texture is the best.  The mona Lisa salad is good and very fresh.  The dessert option is off the charts.  Tons to choose from.  But my fave is the mocchiato gelato. I can eat a whole point in one sitting.  Couldn't even stop if I tried.

15.description: From the outside, Gio's looks like a corner store.  Inside its a little bit different.Came in on a Wednesday night and was lucky to find a table.  The place has about 8-10 tables so its easy to see why it can get packed.  Walk in, seat yourself and immediately someone comes out to serve you bread to start your order.  Our waiter was very helpful.  Told us everything that was on the menu and they also have about 8 other specials on the chalk board as well.  Now to the food.  I order the Chicken Parmesan, which was delicious.  Chicken was breaded perfectly and cooked perfectly.   And the portion size is huge.  2nd plate ordered was the Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp.  Pros - Shrimp was great and so was the pasta sauce.  Cons - It needed more shrimp.  It was basically a plate of Fettuccine and 4 shrimps.  Funny part about our visit is we saw the couple next to us order the calamari and it looked delicious.  So our waiter decided to give us a small order of it (their order was huge) and its definitely one of their specialty plates.   You can almost order that and 1 dish and be satisfied for 2 people. Don't forget its...BYOBBYOBBYOBBottle of wine or some beers if you are there for lunch, you're good to go!  Also check Groupon for a deal as well.

57.description: The food is delicious!! Everything is fresh tasting and made to order. My friends and I each ordered a dish to share. It was all sooo good. The tiramisu was to die for but not very tasty as a leftover. Alcohol was too strong for me. If you like arancini rice balls, they do not disappoint!! For the price and the size it is well worth it. A stand alone meal. It's a must try!! I will be back.

20.description: I had the clams and linguine. It was really tasty but perhaps a bit under-seasoned. Also, I wish they gave you more clams because they only give you four. I loved the basil infused olive oil though. My boyfriend had the rigatoni with vodka sauce. It was pretty good but he liked my plate better. Overall, a good experience and i will be back!

36.description: Man, anyone that says the best Italian food in Chicago is downtown is just... wrong. This joint makes their own pasta, operates a legit Italian deli, serves up fresh and beautiful salads and have a corkage fee free BYOB. Dining here is a pleasure on the palate and the budget.

14.description: A perfect place for my 100th review!! Gio's is a magical hidden gem in Bridgeport, totally authentic Italian in a quaint little space. That being said, the dining area is quite small and you may need a reservation on a Friday or Saturday evening. The wait staff is very friendly and helpful. A huge plus for people driving in, free neighborhood parking!! Try anything, try everything you won't be disappointed.

3.description: This morning I wanted to picked some allergy meds at pharmacy where only one person was waiting for a prescription to be filled, my wait was 25 minutes.  pharmacist and store manager decided to have a lengthy conversation about store hours!

1.description: I seriously hate this Walgreens. I hate everything about it. I hate how old and outdated it is. I hate how it feels like I am walking into a Hoarders house when I visit things sloppily arranged and dusty. I hate how things are always 'out', and how long I have to wait at the pharmacy newsflash get some more staff at the pharmacy and maybe some that speak Mandarin to help out the customers who primarily shop here. I hate the overwhelming feeling of depression and how sloppy the staff and managers usually look. I hate the chatty male cashier with glasses who seems to work every single shift slowing down the line to an exasperating halt with incoherent small talk about things that are none of his business i.e. if you are a Christian and repent to Jesus.  I hate that there are guards who make you feel like you are entering a military compound when all you really want is some deodorant and toothpaste, oh and by the way the deodorant is behind lock and key so good luck getting someone to help you in the aisle. Also, stay away from the 'fresh' food because it looks slimy and old. I hate that no one knows how to work Apple Pay here and they look at you like YOU'RE crazy for even attempting to use it.The only nice people in this whole place are the ladies that work in the photo area I wish I knew their names but they are usually okay (again it is hit or miss, sometimes they're great and sometimes there's someone back there who really doesn't understand what they are doing and will look everywhere for your photos EXCEPT the box with your last name letter on it, and then when they find your photos there they will say, oops should have checked there first). I hate the lighting and the floors. I just hate my life when I shop here honestly. The only reason I go here is because of my prescription but I swear if my prescriptions weren't with Walgreens I would go somewhere else. Hey corporate if you're reading this SERIOUSLY look into this store, it needs a gut rehab and a complete overhaul of it's staff.

2.description: I am frustrated with this Walgreens. I am aware that my home number is probably listed with them; However, Walgreens should not be discussing my prescription with someone other than myself. My dad picked up the phone and he has a manly voice, so there is no mistaking him for me. The fact that they were specific with the medication name makes me angry because I am the only person that knows I am taking the medication. Luckily, my dad didn't remember what medication they said. I feel like what they did was a breach of my privacy and I believe illegal. I am on my own insurance and over 18 years old. I do not understand why they would do that. I have had previous positive experiences with them, but because my parents could have found out, I will be filing a customer complaint to corporate.

9.description: Gotta say... Been previously frustrated with long lines, not having my medications in-stock, difficult parking, weird intersection, etc etc etc... however...Tonight a Pharmacy Tech personally called me to tell me my asthma medication was ready. She knew I was without my medication for a couple days & made the extra effort to get it to me pronto. Such kindness!

10.description: While this may not be the BEST Walgreens out there, they've come through for me on numerous occasions when the one specific thing I needed was easily located, attained and purchased here.Perhaps it's the medication talking, but I had a very pleasant experience here today that I felt deserved a full review - especially since my day today involved a root canal that was highly unpleasant and the last of my numbness was slowly wearing off as I waited for my prescription.The pharmacists there were very polite and helpful, answered my random dumbass questions (I'm really not much for medicines, so on the rare event that I have to take them, I'm pretty much clueless) and were able to process everything and get me my pills in like 15 minutes.  Again, I don't know how good that is compared to whatever, but I found it to be helpful in the midst of a crappy day, and I don't know about the previous reviewer, but everyone I talked to was all smiles and helpfulness.My only complaint about this Walgreens is that they allow a drove of panhandlers to loiter outside the store to harass every customer who enters and leaves.  Maybe if they had someone coming out every hour or so to rustle the bums away and make their patrons feel safer about shopping there, they'd earn that 5th star.Of course, I'm feeling pretty generous...  (The Vicodin helps...)

4.description: This was my go to Walgreens when I use to live in the neighborhood. The area a few years back was sketchy, but seems to be better now.They have the Starbucks K-cups locked up and the security guard had to help me get them and he didn't seem too pleased.Still an older Walgreens compared to all the other ones in Chicago.Parking lot can get hectic sometimes.

6.description: I go to this Walgreen's primarily for the pharmacy, they're pretty fast and efficient. The other item I usually buy is milk, they carry Dean's and it's on sale often enough and usually cheaper than the grocery store or Cermak Produce across the street.Other than that, even with their recent rehab, they seem stuck somewhere in the 80s.

11.description: Echk!  Don't ever come to this Walgreens.  Their employees are extremely rude and their photo center will always screw up your photos in developing.  I'd rather go to the Walgreens just west on 35th than this one.

5.description: This location lacks the frills of its downtown counterpart, but it's to be expected being a neighborhood location and all. The parking lot is a major plus and really the only reason I stop in. Good luck trying to find an associate to help you or even finding the products that you want in stock.

7.description: This place is fucked. It is very uncommon for me to find an individual store so horrible that I find myself avoiding the chain itself, but this Walgreens has somehow managed that feat. The pharmacy is just, intolerable. Dropping off a prescription has taken me over an hour. And that's long after I've given up on them to fill it while I'm waiting. On more than one occasion they've told me it'll be 15 minutes, and an hour later when I wait in line again and ask the status, they just grab the prescription that's been sitting there the whole time and hand it to me. On top of that, I once tried to fill a prescription a couple weeks early as I was leaving town for a month. They denied it and "red flagged" my account. Basically accusing me of writing my own prescriptions. After an embarrassing verbal argument and calls to my doctor, there was not even an apology. So why do I still get my prescriptions filled at Walgreens? Because the incident above led me to call their corporate office, and receive a card that has a huge discount on prescriptions for life. The store hasn't changed though. The last time I walked in, I looked at the lines and the mess, and just walked out and drove to a different one.Pro tip: They will tow your car while you wait for prescriptions. This place is fucked.

8.description: Nothing special to write about, just a local pharmacy and last minute stuff you forgot to get at your favorite store. The only thing I like to get here is the red box movie rentals.

0.description: Busy day, Friday afternoon rush-hour traffic ... I was expecting to regret stopping in here for something quick. But despite my dire expectations, my stop was painless and hassle-free: Parking spot right off the street, a courteous and helpful security guard, even a sale on the pack of gum I bought as an impulse buy. In Chicago at rush hour, I've been at stoplights that take more time!

12.description: Binta's place is great-- clean, friendly, customer oriented. They started on time and did a solid job.

7.description: Great experience! Binta and her sister twisted my hair this week.  My experience was really wonderful.  We started on time and the laides twisted my hair until we were done! No breaks.  Binta answered all of my questions and executed on my request. The shop is very clean with free street parking right in front. She never pressured me to write a review, but I wanted to share my positve experience.

3.description: Friendly, warm & professional staff; comfortable and inviting salon, conveniently located just off the Red line in a lovely neighborhood. Reasonable price, respectful of clients time. Beautiful work. Highly recommend!

1.description: Great service here! The staff is very kind and they work fast. I'm very satisfied with my hair. My small senegalese twists were finished in under 6 hours. Make sure you wash your hair before visiting. There's an additional fee for that.

2.description: Binta is so nice and so talented. She did my marley twists very quickly and they were still beautiful the day I took them down. I plan to go back very soon!

9.description: After reading the reviews, I really wanted to like this place. However, my experience was less than delightful. I try to be fair with my feedback. Which is why I created a list of pros and cons:Pros:Very cleanStreet parkingPolite (at first)Flexible schedulingPrice commensurate with the competition (hair is included with the cost of service)Cons:VERY CHEAP QUALITY HAIRLack of focus on instruction when stylingInterns working on hairArgumentativeRude behavior (if you are not satisfied with their work)Scheduling the appointment was a very pleasant process. She was willing to discuss what I was looking for and provided suggestions.As mentioned above, the quality of hair is extremely cheap. I recommend buying your own hair instead of using the "free hair". I texted the owner twice Nd asked about the quality/brand of hair she uses. Each time, my question was ignored with no response. Ironically, any other question I had, she did not hesitate to answer.The installation of the braids I wanted was very professional. However, my satisfaction quickly turned into disgust when they could execute on the style after I showed them pictures before the appointment and three times during the appointment. Needless to say, I hated the outcome of my hair. The good news is, they offered to do it over for free. I did however, have to take the braids down myself; which was not a problem. When I came back to get my hair redone. I was greeted with attitude and cynicism from the owner and her workers. They had the nerve to be at me. I'm the one who had to sit for 6hrs for the first installation, take it down for  four hours, drive an hour back to the location, and sit there to get it done again another eight hours.  Overall,I would not recommend them if you have a moderate or high expectation for competency in understanding and providing exactly what the customer request.

10.description: I have searched high and low for a CLEAN braid shop and Binta's is it!!! I was so pleased with Binta and her staffs professionalism. I called at the last minute so I didn't think i could get in, but Binta called me right back with an appointment that she was able to plug me in. Everyone was so kind and courteous. Binta welcomed me in with her warm smile. Right then I knew I was in the right place. I am so sorry that I don't recall the young ladies' names that did my hair. But they were awesome. I didn't realize my twist would be so tiny, but still, it only took them 5 1/2 - 6 hrs to do. Normally this style would be 10 hrs plus, easy. I am very pleased and definitely recommend to any one. Thank you again ladies! And the little cutie too!

13.description: Last minute calling to make an appt. Binta fit me in with no problem. It was an easy place to find, with free parking, and the person she had to work on me started immediately. I got cornrows and they look very nice.

16.description: Went to Binta about 2 weeks ago for the first time and I am still loving my box braids. She was very knowledgeable and accommodating.

17.description: I have been getting my dreads done at Binta's for a little over 2 years now everytime is like the first time, the lady that does my hair does a great job with everything, The shop is clean and they make you feel like family. The lady who has been doing my hair is very professional and doesnt spend several hours like most shops I have been to in the past, I recommend Binta's to everyone.

15.description: I got hair done at Binta's today as always she did an awesome job. I love my hair and she's the only person that I allow to braid my hair. She is nice and professional and her shop is clean with a nice atmosphere. Thanks Binta.

0.description: Binta was fantastic and very welcoming to this first timer.  She did my braids in prep for an MMA style event I have and it is perfect! She was quick and very reasonably priced. Thank you!

5.description: Binta was the nicest, most personable, most accommodating hair stylist I've ever been to. She kept making sure I was comfortable and that I liked the style before she continued. Hands down the best Havana twists ever. Will be back again and again and AGAIN!!! And she has fast fingers!!! This woman/shop is legit!!

11.description: I am new to Chicago and had horrible experiences with salons in the past...and then I found Binta! I have gotten microbraids and box braids multiple times...and I loooooove them (pictures coming soon). I even have a friend that traveled from Memphis and got her hair braided. She always accommodates my crazy schedule and prices are more than fair. If you are looking for a pleasant and professional experience...give her a call. You will not be disappointed.

8.description: My nine-year-old daughter has long, thick hair, and had been asking me about doing micro braids for a while. I found Binta's not too far from us & called, and at first Binta didn't think she could get us in same day, which was understandable...yet she said she'd call me back in 15 minutes, and she did and was able to. The stylist who was doing my daughter's hair wasn't there when we arrived and she was over an hour late, which we weren't happy about, but once she started, she was really fast!! After they realized just how thick my daughter's hair was they called for help, LOL, so she had two ladies working on her and it got done much faster. (3 1/2 hours instead of 5). The second lady was starting to do it like hers was (going straight back with no part), and I had to tell her that we wanted it with a part (I thought they should have asked instead of just assuming), but that was not a problem and they were able to do it how we wanted it.  Overall we are very pleased. These braids are not cheap, but they are well worth it. Binta is super nice, very professional, and we would definitely use her service again.

4.description: Visited for the first time today to get Senegalese twist and I will definitely be going back. They did a beautiful job. It's a little pricey but well worth it. The shop is clean and the women work so fast. And the chairs are comfy.

14.description: I was looking for someone to do my Senegalese Twist and I found bintas hair braiding she is so wonderful and she made me very comfortable. I hadn't got my hair braided in a while because I had a bad experience at another shop so I did a bunch of research since my hair is natural I want someone to do my hair who knows how to manage my hair binta took her time and was very gentle. I am definitely going to go back to her. And my hair looks great

6.description: These ladies were absolutely amazing and super fast! I contacted Binta two days earlier for saving on my hair and she was able to get me in. I laughed and talked the entire time. It is not often you feel at home when trying a new stylist. The attention to detail and atmosphere will have me coming back. Thanks again ladies!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair

58.description: HAHA the Tamale Guy has a yelp page. Amazing! I heard about a twitter account too. This guy is literally EVERYWHERE in the city. Ravenswood, Wicker Park, doesn't matter. He is my hero and he gets my business every single time. I chase after his tamales like a kid chases an ice cream truck. Fabulous! Keep an eye for him and his coolers, he is a sneaky one when he walks in. But is it worth it. psssh YEA! And all his varieties are good too.

56.description: YES, YES, YES! I was heading to a bar to watch UFC and I ran into tamale guy outside on the street. Unfortunately for me on that go around I had just eaten a giant slice of pizza. Thankfully he came around again and one of the guys in the bar watching UFC bought several bags of them. All I can say when I found that out was: SHIP IT!So, my chance didn't pass afterall. And boy was I happy. These were flat out some bangin tamales. Actually, they were the best tamales I've had. These tamales were somewhat spicy and I'm not sure what the actual tamales were since I wasn't the one who bought them. Thankfully I was just a lucky bystander and got to sample the wares. Hopefully I run into tamale guy again and have not just gorged down some pizza. I knew it was him the second he was offering tamales an rued my  luck (at the moment at least). At his price these were great, at the free price I got, they were even better! So, if you're drinking around bucktown/logan sq/wicker park and a guy asks you if you want tamales, you say yes and bust out the cash as fast as possible.

44.description: Hark! The Tamale Guy sings. Advertising wondrous things...."Tamale! Tamale! Tamale!"You don't find him. He finds you. A mystical Chicago legend that just appears making you realize you are in the midst of something unusual yet, compelling like: Puppet Bike, The Singing Cabdriver, Ferrari Guy, the silver painted mime who's a living statue, the guy who rides a dog sled in Lakeview....Anyhow, he pops up and you are instantly impressed by his efficiency and business acumen. He doesn't mess around and skates through tons of places quickly. He hits all the bars that don't serve food in the many neighborhoods each evening with his cooler full of bags of piping hot "Tamale!"Speaking of the treats they are temperature wise HOT! $5 for 6. Pork, chicken, or cheese in Oaxacan banana leaves made by his wife. I always get the chicken. They're meaty and the masa smooth. My dining partner finds them bland, but I find them satisfactory.  The green sauce is the shining star! Oh sooo hot and delicious. It is a touch strange for some maybe to buy food from a stranger in a bar but infinity people ate them over the years, as well as me several times so it's legit. Don't be fooled though there are more than one Tamale Guy. Claudio is the one with curly hair and not as thin as the other guy. Next time I'm trying the cheese and pork "Tamale!"

29.description: I love you Tamale Man!

42.description: Man, I haven't had one of these in years, since I don't really do the Damen Av. weekend warrior thing anymore, but I still remember how great they are, way beyond any typical late-night drunk grub. I once joked about harassing every Mexican man on Damen Av. who carries his lunch in an Igloo cooler in search of awesome tamales. I want one now!

23.description: Perfection!

47.description: I wonder if this guy knows he's famous yet.

31.description: I remembered every fall my great grandmother would be slaving away until spring making tamales, hundreds of tamales for our large family and friends. Growing up in California, you could have your door knocked on by a kid asking if you want tamales, who'd run and gather however many you were asking for.My girlfriend, of German descent, has never ever had tamales. I kept telling her how amazing they are, how great they are, and that when we get the chance, I'll make sure she gets them. We had read on the Tamale Guy before, so we were always anxious for the chance that he may show up at a bar we are at..Fast forward, nine months later, the night of my girlfriend's birthday. As we are leaving the bar, I spot a man half my size with a bag and an ice chest. I knew who he was before his word left my lips. He spoke first, "Tamales." My girlfriend screamed in excitement. I gave him twenty dollars.We ate half of them, her drunk, and myself partly sober. She was in love.We ate the other half for breakfast and they were still great. So they passed the sobriety test.It isn't my great grandmother's tamales, it isn't the best, but god damn when you need tamales and you see him, you're a fool to not take that chance. They're small, but tasty.The verde is only spicy if you think taco bell hot sauce packets are spicy. It is flavorable, but spicy? No.Should it be covered in sour cream? Do you think desecrating all that is holy is okay?The only thing that needs to be on those tamales other than ingredients is my mouth.It is roughly a dollar a tamale, maybe like seven five cents. Worth it. So worth it.He's also really nice. We came across him in the Innertown Pub.

34.description: I always save $5 in the off chance I'll run into the Tamale Guy.

16.description: Hark! The Tamale Guy sings. Advertising wondrous things...."Tamale! Tamale! Tamale!"You don't find him. He finds you. A mystical Chicago legend that just appears making you realize you are in the midst of something unusual yet, compelling like: Puppet Bike, The Singing Cabdriver, Ferrari Guy, the silver painted mime who's a living statue, the guy who rides a dog sled in Lakeview....Anyhow, he pops up and you are instantly impressed by his efficiency and business acumen. He doesn't mess around and skates through tons of places quickly. He hits all the bars that don't serve food in the many neighborhoods each evening with his cooler full of bags of piping hot "Tamale!"Speaking of the treats they are temperature wise HOT! $5 for 6. Pork, chicken, or cheese in Oaxacan banana leaves made by his wife. I always get the chicken. They're meaty and the masa smooth. My dining partner finds them bland, but I find them satisfactory.  The green sauce is the shining star! Oh sooo hot and delicious. It is a touch strange for some maybe to buy food from a stranger in a bar but infinity people ate them over the years, as well as me several times so it's legit. Don't be fooled though there are more than one Tamale Guy. Claudio is the one with curly hair and not as thin as the other guy. Next time I'm trying the cheese and pork "Tamale!"

8.description: The tamale man has saved me in my direst of times. You never know when he's going to show up, if at all, but when he does it's as if the heavens open up and the angels sing down 'hallelujah'.There are many other tamale men with coolers, but there is only one tamale guy.

11.description: Tamale Guy, you make me proud to be a Chicagoan. My fiancee and I love your tamales so much, we'd be honored if you made an appearance at our wedding reception on Sept. 6th at the Zhou B. Art Center in Bridgeport. I know you don't typically make house calls, but it would make our day complete, so I thought I'd just put it out there and see what happens! There will be plenty of tamale-hungry, tipsy folks there come 9:00 or 10:00. So, consider this your official invitation to our reception! Hope to see you there! :)

26.description: We were going out, and we were all like 'I HOPE WE SEE THE TAMALE GUY TONIGHT, HE HAS THE BEST TAMALES!'And then the universe, in her all powerful and caring way, said 'Children, I shall align you and the tamale guy at the California Clipper this wonderous evening'. And so it came to be. And we had tameles and whiskey and listened to the sweet twang of an old beat up six string.

39.description: This, in my opinion is all bullshit. It is a classic example of food tasting way better when you're drunk and should not be this highly regarded on Yelp. One night at the Innertown Pub in Ukie Village, my friend bit into her tamale and there was a metal shard like spring inside?!? Thankfully, she did not pierce her cheek or slice the roof of her mouth.However, being that we were beyond intoxicated, she continued eating her mysterious mechanically-powered Mexican meal anyway. Alas, the paradox of the drunk food from the Tamale Guy.

37.description: I don't understand all the love for this guy.  I mean other than how he pops up when you are drunk hungry and least expecting it.  Also, his tamales are reasonably priced.  But they are coming out of a cooler... so they better be.  However, I find his tamales to be dry and lacking in taste.  Maybe I will buy them again if they come smothered in sour cream next time, because they need it!!

0.description: Ever been drunk in a Chicago bar that doesn't serve food and thought " Man i'm hungry AF and I'm drunk " well guess who walks in just moments after that  thought ? His name is Claudio (just like my late fathers ) and he is some kind of a magical tamale fairy god father who magically appears if you wish for him hard enough (Its happened to me twice ).Not only are his tamales ALL that and a bag of taki's but hes a super cool dude . Beware of the imposter (he exist !) who kinda looks like him and sells tamales in bars as well .There is only One Tamale guy ...and his name is CLAUDIO !

38.description: Wasn't even drunk and it was still delicious (and cheap). Very much appreciated at Map Room.

51.description: just had my 30th bday.  the last thing I said (to a bunch of out of towners and locals) before going out for an expensive, fancy dinner and lots of drinks to follow it up was, "the one thing that would complete my bday evening and end it with a bang, would be I'm drinking cheap beer and the tamale guy would show up at whatever bar we're in at the end of the night".  Well, guess who's 30th ended perfectly?!?!  MINE!!  Was at Inner Town Pub to end the night, and like Jesus descending upon his disciples, lo and behold the Tamale Guy appeared....and I said unto him, "I would like 2 packs of queso tamales, por favor".  And he then bestowed upon me the greatest of the lords gifts....12 tamales with salsa verde (for a mere $10).  And I lived happily ever after.  The end. Moral to the story: Never pass this sh*t up people.  Never.

22.description: Claudio is the man!  Beware of the imposters. He's around the corner bar at 10-11 pm almost everyday.

32.description: My savior!

54.description: I lived next to an amazing tamalería in Mexico for a year.  I didn't have a properly working stove.  Or refrigerator.  I am ashamed to admit the quantity of tamales I consumed for basic sustenance mostly every day.  But it does make me something of a connoisseur.Don Claudio is one of the best things about Chicago.  He is the jovial benevolent cherub of greasy salty spicy carbs who appears when you've had just enough beverages (PBR, probably) to need him.  He knows, and he'll be there.  His tamales are not gourmet, but they are awesome.  And you do not need gourmet when he shows up and saves you from blathering too much about the new Animal Collective (though it is pretty good).  You need him.(Although Claudio is El Rey, I do want to give props to the "other" guy José [Juan?].  His tamales are just fine, and if he happens to show up before Claudio does when I am in need, Claudio does not have my sword that evening.  I will say that his "TAMALES TAMALES JEFES JEFES TAMALES MISS" battle cry can be pretty fucking grating, though.)Claudio and I talk sometimes.  Usually it's just pleasantries: "¿Qué onda?" "¿Como estás?" "¿Algún día vas a traer tamales de frijol negro o tal vez champiñon o calabaza?"  And though I admire his consistency, since I went vegan my relationship with Claudio has been strained.  It is totally possible to rock vegan tamales, and unfortunately there's just not enough drunk demand for it.  Seriously, though.  Black bean tamales.  Mushroom tamales.  Zucchini tamales.  Oaxacan banana leaf tamales with silky-ass masa.  Daiya tamales (be still my heart)??  Maybe one day he and his wife will relent and we'll reap the spoils.That said, I will love Don Claudio forever.  He is the goddamn patron saint of Wicker Park (and its surrounding areas) and I hope he always will be.  I hope murals and tattoos of his visage will sprout up all over the place.I have to get this one thing off my chest though.  The singular of the food item we're talking about is: TAMAL.  The plural is TAMALES.  He's either The Tamal Guy or The Tamales Guy.  Claudio probably doesn't give a shit just like most of America but I can't help but whine.  Sorry.Also, this one time in the Hungry Brain Claudio stopped in for a drink.  I mentioned to him (in Spanish) that he had a Yelp page.  He didn't know what Yelp was since he didn't have internet.  I explained it was a website where people reviewed businesses and that there were lots of people extolling his virtues, including many women soliciting marriage.  He chuckled sagely, "Ay, gringos..."

48.description: The Tamale Guy is always there when you need him.  Personally, I never know I need him until he appears in the bar at 1am chanting "tamales tamales!"  But at that moment, he becomes my favorite person in the bar.Don't hesitate to bum a dollar off of a friend or coworker because you know you need a tamale.

13.description: We were going out, and we were all like 'I HOPE WE SEE THE TAMALE GUY TONIGHT, HE HAS THE BEST TAMALES!'And then the universe, in her all powerful and caring way, said 'Children, I shall align you and the tamale guy at the California Clipper this wonderous evening'. And so it came to be. And we had tameles and whiskey and listened to the sweet twang of an old beat up six string.

24.description: I've just experienced the magic of the tamale man for the first time.  Yes, I am at a bar.  No, I am not drunk.  Honestly, I'm not a fan of tamales.  But I've heard of this tamale legend and have sought to find him.  It's true what they say.... If you seek him out, you won't find him.  Let him come to you.  My rating of 5 stars is based on a few things.  This is, of course, not a Michelin rated meal.  For what if is- a tamale when your out at a bar- it's pretty delicious.  The sauce gives it a little more spice and has a garlic flavor.  The legend, the man, the setting, the tamale. These are the mystical elements that merit a score of this stature.  Kudos tamale man... Brava!

7.description: Who doesn't want a delicious tamale after a night of drinking or bars? He's always there when you need him with delicious tamales and salsas.

27.description: Every time I am at a bar, I hope the good Tamale Guy walks in with plenty of tamales rajas con queso.

49.description: TAMALE GUY FOR (tam)ALDERMAN! Minus one star, because sometimes I long for him to appear and he doesn't. What gives?

53.description: When you are drunk at a bar and the Tamale Guy arrives, it's a great thing.That is all there is to say.  Just buy them.

30.description: Yep, This review is more like a thank you! You have always been my savior! Delish and cheap with a side of spicy salsa. Please continue to do what you do best, which is delivering tasty treats all over the Chicago-land area!

46.description: I can't even count how many times this man has saved my life.

1.description: The tamale Guy is the superman of the NorthSide hahahaahahahaha

9.description: OK if I'm lying I'm dying. We were at the HIDEOUT tonight and a guy named bob called a guy named tim cause we needed the tamale guy. Tim says I'm kind of busy cause katie and I are meeting the president tomorrow, I'll see what I can do. 7 minutes later, we're in chicken, cheese and pork tamale heaven - big clue here my friends. He shows up in a blue 4 door beat to shit car with 4 spare tires and no hub caps. He only speaks spanish so of course I give him all of my money cause I do not have clue what the bill is. If this is what does not make Chicago COOL, then I have no idea what does.

40.description: I love you. You are amazing.

25.description: The tamale guy is one of the reasons I enjoy living in Chicago. Twice I have gone to the California Clipper late after some drinking and having fun, and both times he appears as if by magic as soon as I am really wanting to have a late night snack.  We get the cheese tamale's and they are moist and flavorful.  They even come with sauces.  Our table was much happier after his visit.  We even took a couple home and warmed up the next day.

12.description: Love the tamales. Especially the cheese one. Yummm. I had them sober and I've had them  under the influence. Boooo to all the hater's negative comments made and Yey to the tamale guy!

59.description: After years of hearing of the "mysterious tamale guy" and keeping my eyes peeled for him, I FINALLY ran into him last night. My boyfriend and I were about to leave The Long Room and I was in line to the restroom. He walked in with a cooler yelling "Tamales!!" and immediately caught my attention. Me, standing in line, wide-eyed and mouth gaping, points at the guy and manages to yell two words--my boyfriend's name (DREW!) and tamales (TAMALES!). I rush in and out of the bathroom in a manner of seconds to dash back to the bar and pull out $5 for the pork tamales.For some reason we didn't know that we'd be getting more than two tamales, so we were pleasantly surprised when we had seven in the bag! We immediately sat down at  a table and opened up the bag of tamales. They were piping hot (how does he keep them so hot?!) and we dipped them in the green salsa. These tamales were absolutely fantastic, and they reminded me of the authentic tamales of my childhood when I lived in New Mexico. They were wrapped in corn husks, and the meat packed a spicy punch and was well flavored. The spiciness seemed to grow with every bite and definitely stuck with you, but in a good way. I would've loved to have gone back for more, but the Tamale Guy made a quiet exit.The next time I run into this guy (which I hope isn't in another 5 years) I'd love to try the cheese and the chicken.No matter how full you are, if you see this guy do yourself a favor and buy some tamales.

21.description: I ate a large dinner before heading out with friends, and then... The Tamale man appeared. I couldn't resist his tamales and they were just what I needed. I thought he was a legend, but he is real.

17.description: I've just experienced the magic of the tamale man for the first time.  Yes, I am at a bar.  No, I am not drunk.  Honestly, I'm not a fan of tamales.  But I've heard of this tamale legend and have sought to find him.  It's true what they say.... If you seek him out, you won't find him.  Let him come to you.  My rating of 5 stars is based on a few things.  This is, of course, not a Michelin rated meal.  For what if is- a tamale when your out at a bar- it's pretty delicious.  The sauce gives it a little more spice and has a garlic flavor.  The legend, the man, the setting, the tamale. These are the mystical elements that merit a score of this stature.  Kudos tamale man... Brava!

10.description: It's Friday night.  You've been out drinking with your friends for the last few hours, and you feel yourself getting to that point in the night where there is that perfect balance of alcohol in your body, and you think to yourself, "I am starving.  I could really go for some--" SUDDENLY...The Tamale Guy appears like an angel from heaven with a cooler full of tamales!  He politely enters the bar, wielding his handheld cooler like how the mighty Thor wields his powerful hammer, Mjölnir.Faintly, you hear his call from the front of the bar, "Tamales...? Tamales...?" and you scramble for your wallet in the hopes that you have some cash left.  Behold! There is a five dollar bill, just waiting to bring endless amounts of joy and deliciousness to your alcohol-filled stomach!  You stumble up to The Tamale Guy, with a smiling Abraham Lincoln in hand, and you exchange it for a warm bag of homemade tamales.As you take that first bite in to a warm, steaming tamale, you look up with a single tear in your eye, as the magical Tamale Guy walks off in to the night to spread joy to others.  He's the hero we need.  The hero we deserve.  He is...The Tamale Guy.So, yeah.  He makes good tamales.

5.description: I have seen a vision. A vision of hope and joy. Of life and happiness. I have seen a light shine in the darkest of times. Times when my stomach aches and the hangry takes hold. It's these times my champion, my hero appears. His red cooler is a beacon of glee. His wares a symbol of unfettered bliss. TAMALES! TAMALES! It is sweet music that calms my fury and fills my soul. Tamale guy, may you ever be blessed and live on forever, for all of us.

35.description: Consider your night complete once the Tamale Guy shows up.  It's one of those things that you can't plan and it is all up to chance.  But if you frequent the Wicker Park area enough you will be lucky to run into the late night tamale that you desire.  Stocked with tamales, sauces, napkins and more this Tamale Guy has got the system down. I don't understand how these bars just let him in as there is no real benefit to them but maybe he just slips a few tamales to the guys at the front door.

19.description: One of my favorite places in the city is The Hideout.  They have great music, cheap beverages, and is simply a great place to be with friends.  One of the things I have enjoyed the most is I can always depend on the Tamale Guy to show up around ten each night.  I get 12 tamales for $10 and my friends and I can enjoy these tasty treats together.  There truly is not better food deal in Chicago.

28.description: Whenever the Tamale man finds you, always get some if you're hungry. His tamales are awesome! Making me hungry just thinking about it..

3.description: The Tamale Guy is an underground legend in Chicago. He's just as legendary as The Walking Dude, The Bright Suit Guy (Vincent P. Falk) and the Downtown Black Preacher who stands in front of the Old Navy on State Street.

33.description: Always there when I need him. Pleasant and fast. Good quality tamales.

43.description: The Tamale man is everyones best friend. He's short, chubby, and just a round ball of laughter.He will bring you hot goodies when you least expect it, and on the cheap. I have learned that you cannot summon him though as I have tried for many years, but that you have to just keep drinking and not even think about his existence in order for him to appear. When he does, even if you have just eaten a late dinner, don't be fooled into thinking you are full and just buy a sack of Tamales with verde and rojo, preferably the pork. At this point you should hold out and try to save them for home as they go great with a cold coke in front of the t.v. If you are truly forward thinking, buy an extra sack and cook up some eggs in the morning and have them on the side. Straight money way to go!!Enjoy Suckas'!!!

2.description: I must say, for a street vendor, The Tamale Guy offers up quite the delectable treat. As a fan of Mexican food (both fine dining as well as smaller establishments) the Tamale Guy stands up quite well to many sit down restaurants. For street fare, you simply cannot go wrong with a delicious pork tamale.

45.description: you my hero

18.description: When you hear that "TAMALE TAMALE!" you know you 'bout to put $5 on it.

41.description: Aptly named.  This guy, whoever he is, knows his tamales.  I almost never order tamales in restaurants because nobody seems to be able to make a real tamale in a restaurant setting.  Not enough of  a cook to understand why but so it seems.Not true any longer.  Enter the Tamale Guy.  I suppose it helps to specialize.  All kinds of tamales.  I went here with a group of 8.  We were all soon stealing bites off of one another's plates to taste them all.  Delicious and priced right.  I will return repeatedly.

52.description: I first heard about this "Tamale Guy" a few weeks ago when browsing for new restaurants on Yelp.  So many five star reviews piqued my interest, but the lack of any definitive location had my hopes for actually meeting this legendary master in the gutter.Enter the Map Room on a Thursday night, an impromptu stop to say hi to a friend on her birthday.  I'm sitting at the table drinking the only beer I plan on having there before going home.  A man enters the bar touting a small cooler, takes a few steps, glances around before uttering the word "tamales" twice.  My hand sprung up into the air and I yelled for him to come over.  My friends looked at  me like had gone nuts.  Buying tamales from a stranger at 11:30 without any hesitation?  I told them that we must show this man respect, that he is a legend spoken of far and wide, and that they should be happy to just be in the vicinity of his box of Mexican greatness.  It was awesome, definitely lived up to all of the hype, something that just doesn't seem to happen very often these days.

50.description: A few friends were in town for the weekend when I had my back turned to grab our beers. "A guy just walked back with a case of tamales...." My roommate and I took one second to look at each other before running after him screaming TAMALE GUY!!! Literally stalking him outside of the bathroom, waiting, waantinggggg. Because that's what you need to sop up that whiskey you're already regretting. Because if the tamale guy shows up, it's much less likely that you're going to have to go home and try and figure out how long pizza rolls take in the microwave, if you have the patience to get them out of the bag. Because they are delicious and beautiful and everything you wanted all night.

4.description: Has saved my life multiple times. I saw him once pull a baby from a car wreck. One time, his tamales stopped a gang war. It was the al pastor, both sides stopped arguing and started eating. I'd highly recommend it. Anyways, flag him down. Tamales are life changing, and they support world peace.

6.description: Everyone knows about the Tamale Guy's superpower of bringing magical tamales to the drunken and wretched of Chicago. But what many people don't know is that his magical tamales respond to the individual soul of the person eating them. Look at the reviews: Good people loved their tamales. Douchebros (of both genders) hated them. Such is the power of the magic tamales!So if your a good guy or good gal, get yourself twelve great magical tamales for just $10. But don't waste your money if you're a douche.

55.description: Tamales! Tamales!  Music to my ears and stomach.I wish I could give him 1,000,000 stars...or his own restaurant. Latest run-in was on Saturday - Wicker Park on Milwaukee.This was just one of many, many times throughout my barhopping career, but it's been a while since our last encounter, years actually.  And the tamales are still that great and Claudio just as friendly.He was out of cheese, though, and those are the best ones.  No complaints on the pork/chicken that we had on this night though.1,000,000 stars.

15.description: I met my fiance thanks in part to the Tamale Guy. If Claudio hadn't been outside the Continental that night, I wouldn't have gone in.

57.description: The equivalent of the Tamale Guy when I was at SIU was the Bagel Man and you can scarce tell the difference. Different foods obvi but the outcome is always the same....and you're always a victim of circumstance in that it's impossible to pass up when you happen to be at an establishment when he arrives.  Inebriated or not, they are very good tamales imho.  When I think of what a tamale should taste like, this would be it.

20.description: One of my favorite places in the city is The Hideout.  They have great music, cheap beverages, and is simply a great place to be with friends.  One of the things I have enjoyed the most is I can always depend on the Tamale Guy to show up around ten each night.  I get 12 tamales for $10 and my friends and I can enjoy these tasty treats together.  There truly is not better food deal in Chicago.

36.description: Yes! This guy is a Chicago legend! Few things make me happier than when I am out at the Tamale Guy shows up.

14.description: Consider your night complete once the Tamale Guy shows up.  It's one of those things that you can't plan and it is all up to chance.  But if you frequent the Wicker Park area enough you will be lucky to run into the late night tamale that you desire.  Stocked with tamales, sauces, napkins and more this Tamale Guy has got the system down. I don't understand how these bars just let him in as there is no real benefit to them but maybe he just slips a few tamales to the guys at the front door.

29.description: This is THE place to go in Chinatown for Northern Chinese cuisine. It used to be Potsticker House, but since the chef and staff moved away (to Northern City and Homestyle Taste), this place has become that go to place.The food is superb. Ingredients are fresh and local and the portions are HUGE. A $12 casserole would be enough to fill 3 people with relatively good appetites. The noodles and rice cake are hearty delights and lamb with cumin, one of the restaurant's specialties will have you coming back for more. If you're into Southern cuisine, this place does not forgo Mapo Tofu or Pork with garlic sauce (or sesame chicken if you're into that American Chinese scene)On the weekends, they even offer Chinese of Youtiao, fried pancake, and Fresh Soymilk. My only complaint would be that the soymilk often tastes a bit burnt, but everything else is hearty and superb.Service here is consistently great. The girls are friendly and the owner is welcoming. If you want a bang for your buck, Northern City should be on the top of your list.

42.description: I live right by this place and since it just opened, I figured I would give it a try. I got a hold of the menu and browsed through it to see if anything special caught my eyes. My first impression from looking at the regular menu was that it is pretty expensive. I noticed the lunch special was a good deal because it was $5.00 and it comes with soup and an egg roll as well. The egg roll is horrible by the way. I decided to order the hot and spicy chicken lunch special because this is one of my favorite dish from another restaurant that I have tried in the past. It is pretty good, but definitely not as good as the one from any of the Lao's restaurant in Chinatown. For $5.00, I will definitely come here just for the lunch special. I wish it came with fried rice instead of white rice though.

23.description: One of the best Chinese restaurants we've ordered from.. those Northern Style Steamed Buns are the best and the flavor is awesome in all their foods.. and the prices are great also.. they give you a lot for your money and inexpensive.. we order from them all the time.. I just wished they stayed open a little later like 11pm on the weekdays!! the funny part is we don't live that far from Chinatown either lol..

47.description: For reference, I'm a Hong Kong Chinese so a true northerner may have a different point of view. For me, it was ok, We had the Noodles with ground pork aka "Dan Dan Mein" and it was tasty but they overdid the Szechuan peppers a little...Our taste buds were blown directly after. Lamb Skewers with Cumin were a bit gamey because of the size of the chunks. My fiance Amy ordered a pork belly and string bean w/ cellophane noodles  that was bland, or maybe the Szechuan peppers did us in.Their menu also has Chi-American-ese dishes like Hunan and Mongolian beef and Hot and Sour Soup for those not adventurous enough to go authentic.Service was somewhat friendly, but Amy speaks mandarin and not sure how it would be if I went with only English or Cantonese at my disposal.15% off grand opening discount until 12/8 if you try it. The other new place on Halsted called Homestyle taste is better for Northern food.

8.description: I ordered the lunch special pork in garlic sauces, it was too salty, not eatable. I threw it out.

31.description: Rounding up to five stars from four and a half because I would like to support this business. The best time to come to this place is a weekend morning to order the Northern Chinese style breakfast, listed under "Appetizers." Folks, don't come here for orange chicken, Mongolian beef, or that ilk -- this is one of the few authentic Northern Chinese cuisine establishments in the U.S (along with Ed's Potsticker House and Homestyle Taste), so before you come here, ask any friend from Beijing and verse yourself a bit in "Dongbei" food. The you tiao here is awesome. The cong you bing is also spectacular.

34.description: Better than I thought it would be. When we arrived on a Friday evening, there were a number of tables occupied, so that was pleasing. We had the Northern Style steamed dumplings, sauteed lamb, and Northern Style braised eggplant. The dumplings weren't that good, as the dough was too thick and the filling was simply just pork and leek. The sauteed lamb was pretty good and was quite a generous serving. The eggplant had a nice crispy texture to it. However, the accompanied vegetables like green peppers and onions were nearly raw and hard to digest. All of the dishes came freakishly fast. We also had the tofu dessert with sweet syrup (don't know the exact name), but the tofu should have been thinner and slippier like at other places (Gourmet in Chinatown). What was the most disappointing was the accompanied pot of tea. It honestly tasted just like hot water just with a light brown coloring. When I opened the pot, there were no tea leaves in there so they must have brewed it elsewhere, which explains the lack of flavor.Service was okay. The young waitresses were friendly, but clearly inexperienced. They had trouble and took a long time to clear off our table. They also didn't really check up on us and we had to signal them, especially when clearly we were done eating. The place itself is decent and looks pretty clean. Prices are a tad expensive, but understandable, especially as some of the dishes are pretty generous.Overall, not bad. Probably will return sometime especially as it is in my neighborhood, but definitely not a go-to.

16.description: This is our favorite restaurant serving delicious dishes from north of China. Authentic, clean (especially their restroom), bright, and with friendly service. We ordered Crispy fried pork, Stir-fried pork kidney w. spicy sauce (not very spicy actually, highly recommend! so authentic), Shredded pork w. garlic sauce, and Candied sweet potato.
