I love the potato dish, it's good for people who carving dessert after dinner.Although I pressed five stars here, I sill want to mention that the paper table cover was stained with grease...Anyway, still is a good place to having Chinese food!

13.description: Ordered the shredded pork with garlic sauce lunch special for take out and was slightly disappointed. Half an hour before I wanted to pick up my order, I called them and asked if they used MSG. The man on the phone assured me that they did not. So I went ahead and ordered; my entree came with jasmine rice and delicious hot soymilk. They offered egg drop soup as an alternative to the soymilk, and according to their website, an eggroll. They didn't offer me an eggroll on the phone :( but honestly there was so much food I forgot about it. Pickup was prompt, and they had my order waiting within the specified half hour.The food was just ok, very Americanized. I was led to believe that they were somewhat authentic and placed my order in Mandarin in the hopes that they would up the authenticity factor. Alas, that was not the case, and the copious amounts of oil was a major turn-off. It was ridiculously sweet... they must have used at least a tablespoon of sugar. What really sealed the deal on me never returning was that they used MSG!! When they assured me they didn't!!! I was sleepy and parched for the rest of the afternoon.Northern City is a cheap pick (at least for lunch), but not healthy or up to par on taste. I'm still a little annoyed that the guy lied about their use of MSG, but I guess that's how they rope you in, at least once.

11.description: I wanted to try a restaurant away from Chinatown. I left this restaurant still felling hungry, because I could not eat much the food they served me. I also want to point out I usually eat Cantonese food in Chinatown, so I am NOT very familiar with northern Chinese cuisines.I pretty much ordered from the Yelp recommendations.We had the cumin lamb with bone, the meat is great, sweet and tender but way to gamey for my taste. I have had lamb and goat before, but this dish is really gamey.crispy pork, not good. pork was chewy, sauce was neither spicy nor sweet enough. I thought it would be closer bejing ribs (king do quach/ornage beef/pork) (which is a deep fried crispy pork with the sweet plum sauce). This dish tastes very uninteresting.smoked pork pancake - tastes very dry and bland. I took 1 bite, tried another bite on a different piece.... could not get myself to try a 3rd bite.The portions are big. The service was ok.

39.description: I go to Potsticker House often cause I live so close but Word on the street is Northern City is the new Potsticker House cause the cooks left, I decided to give it a try and it tasted great! I got an order of Crab Rangoon and the first few I ate we're very tasty, until I took a bite of one and there was A LONG WHITE HAIR in my mouth. I instantly puked and it ruined my whole meal. I couldn't even eat the rest of the food. It was a take out order so I didn't think they would do anything about it. Buts its gross to think that it got made with the hair inside of it!! Yuck! The prices are way to extreme, theres nothing special on the menu. It's going to be hard to go back to Northern City.

37.description: Restaurant reviewUnfortunately I did not write this review sooner so I will have to say that I can't remember all of the dishes we had at the restaurants, however the dumplings were so so. Maybe I cannot appreciate the finer points of dumplings, but I found them fatty. The noodle dishes also were quite oily along with the northern pancakes which also were nice but on the oily side. Afterward the meal I felt thirsty which may mean some MSG.... Well maybe next time I'll try some other dishesPro: Northern type asian cuisineCons: oily and some of the dishes possibly had MSGHidden gem: none that I know of

0.description: I've had a number of dishes here. Lamb with cumin flavor and mapo tofu are some personal favorites. The Mapo tofu is particularly highly spiced with sichuan peppercorn, and I just love that.The lamb with cumin flavor while, yes, a bit salty, is also completely delicious. Flavorful, filling.The service is pretty good too. I recommend their lunch specials if you're around there, which is certainly the best deal they have.

38.description: I decided to try Northern City yesterday since it's so close to home. Ordered: chicken fried rice, pepper steak and ma po tofu. I wouldn't recommend the ma po tofu from here, but everything else we ordered was ok. Portions and price are comparable to Joy Yee. I'd be willing to order from here again just to be able to get a better idea of what works and what doesn't.

27.description: Food came in large portion, but we were also a large group. We had the hot and sour soup, which I thought was ok. It wasn't great. The service was ok. It is a small restaurant. We didn't have enough bowls and the servers were busy. Food portion is large. I liked the egg plant and mapo tofu. We have two other soup dishes too. They were decent. I didn't feel like anything was specifically too salty or lacked salt. I am also very use to Southern Chinese food, so this might be something new I am not quite use to yet.

32.description: Northern City Pork for the most mind blowing fabulous lamb with coriander in world history. Ribs with Sour Cabbage soup is also merely fantastic. The chef came from Potsticker House where he was extraordinary but now that he has his own place Jack is really making it happen. Portion are generous, staff are courteous and efficient. I love this place.

48.description: I was excited to see that another restaurant open in Bridgeport. We ordered a hot and sour soup, spicy lamb with cumin (bone in), kimchi fried rice, shredded pork stir fry and another spicy appetizer. Pro:Lamb DishService was decent if you spoke MandarinCon:Limited EnglishFood was bland. The hot and sour soup was just sour. We asked them about it and they adjusted the soup by added "hot oil" which made is greasy sour soup. Spicy oil that they gave us had no heatFried rice was mushy and again not spicy*sigh* maybe I'm asking too much. Next time I'll bring my own hot sauce.

44.description: I am glad I looked past the prior reviews and decided to try this place on my own. I mean yes, I am not of Mandarin decent and honestly people, we are in America. You want authentic Chinese food, go to China. You want authentic Mexican food, go to Mexico. If you want something that will be more than good enough to give you that fix you are craving for, then don't hesitate on this place. We ordered a hot and sour soup and it was HUGE! For only $5 too. I couldn't believe it. Then we ordered potstickers, which are shaped like a stick instead of the little ears shaped ones that you normally find. Then we ordered an orange chicken and some drinks. The menu is huge and has a variety for everyone. We never had an issue communicating with any of the workers and they understood us very well. The price was great, the food was great, the atmosphere was great. I think they are also BYOB from what we could see. There were alot of older people in there that looked like they would expect authentic chinese food and they were all very happy while eating and after paying. I did not see one reason to give this place anything less than 5 stars. Again, this is America and it is going to be hard to find an authentic anything here, especially in the Bridgeport area.

24.description: You must go to the South Side to eat Northern Chinese Cuisine.  It is great winter food.  Large portions, liberal amounts (for Chinese cooking) of tasty seasoned meat, a fun vibe and friendly service.  This place is for serious eaters of Chinese food - many of the customers there are from northern Chinese cities.  The restaurant has more of a neighborhoody feel v. a typical Chinatown restaurant.  Dumplings highly recommended.

7.description: Fast delivery and $1.50 for 2 solid pork buns.  That's pretty awesome.Their spicy tendons is tender AND has a mild option.  Who doesn't that?!  Nobody else.  That's who.  Their "Northern Steamed Dumplings" weren't super soupy but were delicious, nonetheless.  I only saw their English menu online so I couldn't verify whether they were labeled as Xiao Long Bao.  Either way they were the best delivery buns I've had here in Chicago.

40.description: My husband and I frequent Ed's Potsticker House to get our Northern Chinese cuisine fix. However, the past couple of times I've left Ed's disappointed. Dishes were too salty, disgusting thick layers of oil sit at the top of the dish. Things just didn't taste the same. The first time I thought to myself, maybe it's a different chef on Sunday nights. Let's not go there anymore on Sundays.  But then it kept happening on other nights.FF a few months later, a Chinese co-worker informs me that a couple of old Ed's Potsticker House cooks left to start their own restaurant around the corner! So typical Chinese. So of course we check it out. Now this is the tofu in home style sauce I remember! They nailed it!  Everything was fresh and clean. No thick layer of re-used oil. All the dishes are the same as Ed's and just as good as they were before. The tofu in home style sauce is our fav. We got the beef with two types of mushrooms, very tender, super yummy. We tried the rice cake and pickled snow cabbage. Their pickled snow cabbage is out of a can. I'm used to eating my mom's home made pickled snow cabbage. Once you've had it fresh, you can't go back to the can.  I'm not sure the next time we'll be back at Ed's, but Northern City, we'll see you tonight!

30.description: I really enjoy Northern Style Chinese food.  It's hard to find this kind of food in Chicago.  I'm glad to have been referred to Northern City.  This place is fantastic.  The food has a good kick of spice and wonderfully rich flavor.  I've not had anything I don't like here.  If you aren't spice friendly, you'll probably want to order what you know.  If you're an adventurous eater, you just let your eyes do the wandering and I'm sure you'll find something delicious (everything I've had here is).As the other reviewers have stated, I'd love to see this local neighborhood restaurant thrive.

46.description: Have a wide selection of food - from Northern to Cantonese to American Chinese. A little pricy for that oily and bland pork belly with dried string beans - $15! It looked like pig food in reality - my new phone did a good job with that photo. I have to admit that I have been making a lot of wrong choices when ordering food:(I wanted to try some of the desert, but it is priced $10! The service was pretty good. The girls work there are very friendly and nice. The decor feels very cold, not welcoming. They need to fix that entrance door. We sat next to it and whenever people open it, it sounded like they were breaking it.The 15% grand opening discount was nice.Oh, our stomachs were kind upset after dinner...

1.description: This is Potsticker House's sister restaurant. The restaurant specializes in Northern Chinese cuisine, hence the name. They do share similar foods like the steamed dumplings and crab ragoon. The other food I tried was the beef tendon with spicy sauce. It was so good. I ate and saved the rest for next day's dinner. I think it's just as good as the sister restaurant; it was definitely popular.

9.description: I just... I can't. Every time I order from Northern City, I'm reminded that I promised myself I wouldn't do it again. Every order, without fail, has something weird about it. My latest & least favorite was crafted with a sodium content that was just off the charts. I picked up a mapo tofu lunch special a few weeks ago that was like a tofu salt lick. I'm not exaggerating, I'm not trying to be a mean ol' Yelper here, but really it was disgusting. My teeth actually ached like I had wrapped my lips around a salt shaker. It was the strangest thing. I threw away an entire box of food.Yesterday I was out running errands & all I wanted was some crab rangoon. Major craving, so I figured I'd just swing on by Northern City on my way home. Can't mess up some cream cheese & pastry deep fried, right? Wrong. The pastry dough was so obviously stale, I had to rip & tear with my teeth just to get a very chewy bite. Second successful bite revealed a whole mess of spoiled cream cheese. Into the trash this wasted $$ went, just like that lunch special a few weeks earlier...I used to really enjoy getting noodle dishes from Northern City. From what I understand, their noodles are actually homemade. They were always thick & plentiful, if only a bit on the greasy side, but they were tasty. I'm not sure I can risk trying their noodles again!I'm so sorry, Northern City! You're just not the most reliable Chinese joint in the Bridgeport neighborhood! :(

26.description: This place is horrible. Delivery charge is outrageous. Almost $5.00. I had to explain my order and address like 5 times. Delivery took waaaaaaaay to long. Over an hour. Food gets here and there's no condiments, silverware or napkins. Crab Rangoon tastes life it's microwaved. They didn't give us our white rice and the fried rice is super salty. Everything was over priced and the food is crap. Everything about this experience is crap.

25.description: This is our favorite restaurant serving delicious dishes from north of China. Authentic, clean (especially their restroom), bright, and with friendly service. We ordered Crispy fried pork, Stir-fried pork kidney w. spicy sauce (not very spicy actually, highly recommend! so authentic), Shredded pork w. garlic sauce, and Candied sweet potato. I love the potato dish, it's good for people who carving dessert after dinner.Although I pressed five stars here, I sill want to mention that the paper table cover was stained with grease...Anyway, still is a good place to having Chinese food!

12.description: Restaurant reviewUnfortunately I did not write this review sooner so I will have to say that I can't remember all of the dishes we had at the restaurants, however the dumplings were so so. Maybe I cannot appreciate the finer points of dumplings, but I found them fatty. The noodle dishes also were quite oily along with the northern pancakes which also were nice but on the oily side. Afterward the meal I felt thirsty which may mean some MSG.... Well maybe next time I'll try some other dishesPro: Northern type asian cuisineCons: oily and some of the dishes possibly had MSGHidden gem: none that I know of

21.description: Had the ma Po tofu, Mongolian beef and crispy pork. Great portion sizes. All the dishes were very flavorful. The best was the Mongolian beef. It's a great Chinese restaurant on the outskirts of Chinatown.

17.description: Beef was so greasy , swimming in oil!Rice pudding is not a pudding by any mean , yuk

10.description: Very good food here, probably better than the main Chinese restaurant everyone in Bridgeport tends to go to. The food is not nearly as greasy but still has plenty of flavor. The waitstaff is very attentive from the moment you walk in until the time you leave. This place used to be one of those old school movie rental places (the video return slot is still on the side of the building lol) but they did an amazing job rehabbing it. If you want some good Chinese food with quick service, you should definitely check this place out.

5.description: Quite authentic northern Chinese food. 煎饼果子 is huge and 小笼汤包 is very yummy and juicy. Lunch special also comes with spring rolls which is a plus!

3.description: First time here. We were Really hungry! Stopped on a Sunday afternoon around 3:30. All Asians eating here, at the time. Took that as a good sign. Most reviews were good.Service was good. Pot stickers were excellent, soup was good. The entrees were WAY TOO SALTY! OMG!Be careful. Was it because were ordered everything spicy?We couldn't finish our shared spicy cabbage and shared Dry Pot Chicken due to the high salt. When we complained about the crazy overboard salt and said we didn't want to take the food home, since there was most of it still in the serving bowls...they took 15% off the bill but didn't offer to change the meal.We should have gone to Chinatown in the first place.

35.description: Please support this amazing business.We held a baby shower for my sister and 30 family & friends here last weekend. Our party had 4-5 tables in the front of the restaurant and the rest of the space was open for walk-in customers. The owner and staff could not have been more accommodating. They let us bring in our own desserts and set up an entire dessert table, complete with balloons. We also played baby bingo and opened presents. I kind of felt bad for the other diners because our group was really boisterous and there were a few kids running around too. The servers were so humble that when we gave them an extra cash tip over and above the 15% gratuity included with the bill, they told us we gave them too much money! They deserved it for going above and beyond for us.Regarding the food, our family eats Chinese often and Northern City's cuisine is different from most. The dishes have a unique twist on the traditional--such as fried rice with bacon and long, burrito-like potstickers. The party had a pre-set menu of wonton soup, eggrolls, crab rangoon, sesame chicken, fish with stringbeans, fried rice, noodles, and eggplant. Everything was superb and our guests really enjoyed it too. You can tell the chef prides himself on the preparation and presentation of the food. It's not as greasy as other Chinese places and the meat and veggies are very fresh.If you want a delicious, cheap lunch, this place has lunch specials for $5.50 including soup, an eggroll, rice, and a generous portion of an entree. I recommend the peapod beef.

19.description: I live right by this place and since it just opened, I figured I would give it a try. I got a hold of the menu and browsed through it to see if anything special caught my eyes. My first impression from looking at the regular menu was that it is pretty expensive. I noticed the lunch special was a good deal because it was $5.00 and it comes with soup and an egg roll as well. The egg roll is horrible by the way. I decided to order the hot and spicy chicken lunch special because this is one of my favorite dish from another restaurant that I have tried in the past. It is pretty good, but definitely not as good as the one from any of the Lao's restaurant in Chinatown. For $5.00, I will definitely come here just for the lunch special. I wish it came with fried rice instead of white rice though.

28.description: The food here is decent, however, the service is poor.When I made the reservation for this restaurant, the lady who took the reservation didn't sound like she wanted to take the reservation. You can tell there is a bad vibe from the other end as shes taking down your name, party size, time, etc.When we got there, we were shortly seated at our table. They gave us one menu for our party of 11 people..hm, that's going to be tough to order, so we asked for more menus. We ordered about 11 dishes or so. My favorite was the fish fillet with green beans, the northern style stir fry noodles, and the ox tail. Most of the food here are spicy and a bit greasy but I feel it is not as greasy compared to the other Northern China restaurants so that is a plus. Most of the food were decent. The complaint I have is the service. I felt they treated us as kids, when most of us are near 30 yrs old. We were done eating for awhile, and they didn't come over to clean our table up, so we ended up doing it for them because we had cupcakes to open. It was one of my best friend's birthday so we wanted to celebrate with cake. Our friends helped cleaned the table and cleared parts of the table away so we can take out the cakes. Good thing I brought cupcakes because they didnt serve us forks or plates for the cupcakes. Seriously, no service at all. When we were all done, we had to ask for boxes to pack the leftovers. Yay! They helped us boxed our foods. Overall, service is bad. You might as well serve yourself.

45.description: i wish i could give a negative score. Being a native northern Chinese myself and having spent more than 10 years in the states I know my Chinese food well. I have enjoyed going to Ed's potsticker house as well as the other new Dongbei restaurant down the street from Ed's on halsted. They are both legit and well worth visiting. However, going to northern city today left me disgusted and feeling sick. We ordered one of the famous casserole dishes as well as a fish dish. the meat in the dish taste so bad I had to spit it out right away it's has a nasty smell as well. we asked the chef and he claimed that it was an extra ingredient.. he was not very understanding and a bit rude. (grand it Chinese restaurants are not known for customer service but I have definitely seen better). we left the giant pot of the pork casserole there. Then the fish came, although they claim it's live catch from the tank, it tasted so fishy and had a strong dirt taste which generally means it's not fresh. On top of all this, we were sitting right next to the tank, no one has come by and got the fish since we got in the restaurant! urgh I was so upset and disgusted at that point I decided to just pay and leave. All the waiting staff realizes that I am upset but no one said anything.. all in all a terrible experience, ruined my day for sure! I was so excited to try it but left sick to my stomach!

33.description: I really wanted to like this place, I waited awhile after they opened to iron any issues out as most new joints inevitably have, and it just wasn't good. I ordered Crab Rangoon which was bland and soggy, no crunch at all. In fairness this may have been a result of me getting a text saying food was ready at 846 but it didn't arrive til 935 but a little flavor still would have been nice.  I also got the Mongolian beef . The sauce was very tasty and delicious, but my meat was chewy and fatty, so much so that I spit some out. Yuck.  I wish them the best, but they need to make some improvements.

43.description: First time here. :)I wasn't holding much hopes when I came. This is like the second new restaurant within two blocks of where I usually eat.When I came in, the waitress opened the door and everything. We were able to order tea and ice water. After 10 minutes of deciding what to eat, we ordered two lamb skewer sticks, a Northern Lamb soup, beef tummy noodles, and two chili chicken. The environment feels clean due to the plain walls (some decorations) and had two colors. It felt odd noticing the people here used to work at a business still currently in business....The waitress warned that the two chili chicken will be spicy.Pros: service was good, BYOBCons: food was mediocre. The soup came out bland (plain water with ingredients... I should say lamb fat and chicken fat? We sent it back to the kitchen and they just added MSG). The lamb skewer sticks were pretty good, though all lard once again. It had an even layer of spices and cumin powder. The beef noodle soup was plain weird to me. It just didn't have the soup quality that makes me crave for it. As for the two chili chicken it was a disappointment. It was a plateful of chili and around 1 cup of chicken meat (diced). For the price of $11, I felt gyped. After the whole meal, I doubt I will come back. There's nothing on the menu special enough for me to decide to come back anyway. I still prefer the other Mandarin restaurants over this one.For the price, it seems like the meal was served on a boat. I wasn't ill or anything, but I was nauseated by the rockiness of the booths. The people leaning back and forth.... moving on the seat. It's kind of awkward to feel the other person creep up from the seat and then sit back down forcefully. Don't want to get raped going back to this place (by the booth seats) and food.

2.description: Good service and excellent food.food was cheap and big.Yummy yummy .will come back again...

18.description: I had the hot and spicy tofu lunch special. It was awful. The restaurant smelled so nice and the woman who took my order was so pleasant so I REALLY wanted to like this place. The tofu was breaded but it wasn't cooked properly or something because it was slimy... I have never seen breading turn to slime in my life. Also it was soaking in like half a cup of grease. It came with soup, egg drop soup.... that was disgusting... I put a spoonful in my mouth and gagged. I don't know if this is worse or not, probably for me because it's the reason I ordered it.... I LOVE hot food and this dish is just onion, tofu, and pepper so it should've been hot.... it wasn't.... at all.... like not at all.So sad. Thankfully it was super cheap for lunch. If I would've paid full price for that slop... I would not have been a happy Brittany at all.

41.description: I'm glad I didn't look at these reviews before I ate here because I never would have checked this joint out...they have the best orange chicken I have eaten in a long time!! Finally found a good spot in the chinatown Bridgeport area!!! You would think there would be many of them but there are not! This place beats the potsticker house happiness mayflower china kitchen all these places around here hands down! They have pretty decent size portions at a fair price I definitely found my go to Chinese restaurant:)

4.description: Came here with my mom for dinner, since I heard a lot about the Lamb and Northern Chinese cuisine. Overall, the cumin lamb was very savory and almost too spicy for me. This dish is a 4/5 for me. The rice tasted old and we picked up a few appetizers and dishes but nothing really stuck out.  Then, the service felt extremely awkward as the waitress seem to be so sad about her life that I would say that she was an indentured servant. The restaurant layout was like a disco style and terrible mix and match of everything.  Overall, I probably would not come back because even if the food was super tasty, the atmosphere would definitely kill it for me.

6.description: I was under the weather, and wanted soup, boyfriend wanted noodles. my tendency of ordering the weirdest things on the menu got me to inquire this "homemade soup with flour and pork", the server said it in mandarin to me that it is her favorite soup....gosh...def. didn't go wrong with going with a "local"'s suggestion...sooo good...it's a bit on the thick and heavy (coz of the flour dumplings thing) side bf ordered the spicy beef noodle soup...that's probably one of the best noodles soup i have ever had...it's spicy, but i can still taste the food, the beef was perfectly favour and tender, the noodles's chewiness was just about right....i swear...the hotness (spicy level) from the noodle soup and the hotness (temperature) from the flour soup def. helped sweat my fever away! i am not kidding...i literally went in with 100F and went home and it was down to 98.X F that night! Now, that is medicine!!!

22.description: Whether dine in or take out, the food here Northern City has always been consistent and delightfully delicious. Couple of my favorite is their Dom Dom Mein and Siu Loon Bao. The Dom Dom Mein has a sweet and tangy flavor mixed with their home made noodles tasted much like the traditional Northern China's dishes. The servers are well mannered and friendly, which is refreshing relative to other Chinese restaurants in the area.

15.description: Nice Chinese restaurants! Genuine dishes from northeastern part of China! If you wanna try some genuine Chinese food from northeastern China, just ask them!Lunch special is good! Most services are so friendly.Skewers need to be improved.

20.description: I had the hot and spicy tofu lunch special. It was awful. The restaurant smelled so nice and the woman who took my order was so pleasant so I REALLY wanted to like this place. The tofu was breaded but it wasn't cooked properly or something because it was slimy... I have never seen breading turn to slime in my life. Also it was soaking in like half a cup of grease. It came with soup, egg drop soup.... that was disgusting... I put a spoonful in my mouth and gagged. I don't know if this is worse or not, probably for me because it's the reason I ordered it.... I LOVE hot food and this dish is just onion, tofu, and pepper so it should've been hot.... it wasn't.... at all.... like not at all.So sad. Thankfully it was super cheap for lunch. If I would've paid full price for that slop... I would not have been a happy Brittany at all.

36.description: I'm giving this 5 stars because I ordered the Mongolian Beef the first time I went and since then have been back more times than I can count for the same dish! It is SO GOOD and the beef is tender and the sauce spicy yet delicious. One of my new favorite bridgeport takeout spots. We did dine in and had a pleasant experience as well. I'd love to order other dishes but I love the Mongolian beef so much I doubt I will...the egg rolls are particularly yummy as well.I'd like to add they make their own hot sauce (which doesn't need to be added to the Mongolian Beef for spiciness) which is also outstanding.

14.description: Very tasty, authentic Chinese food. I've only gotten takeout a couple of times, but every time I stop in this place is pretty busy. The have live, fresh fish in here, if you're seeking something like that. The dishes can be quite spicy, just a heads up. Wonderful service and solid food.

28.description: I was so excited that a cafe was opening up on the south side, but after trying it out, I left feeling less than satisfied.The decor is very nice and classy enough to bring someone for a date.Prices aren't prohibitively expensive, but I think the portions are small for what you pay.Service was ok.  We walked in and were greeted promptly, but as we looked at the pastry case they didn't offer any suggestions or ask if we needed any help etc.  We then proceeded to seat ourselves because they didn't say anything to us. I was hoping that they would come around to ask us what we wanted to order or just to check up on us, but they didn't so we walked up to the counter to order.We got the plain egg waffle, vanilla and green tea panna cotta, and potato bacon soup.The plain egg waffle was the worst.  I practically came for the egg waffle and left so disappointed.  A good egg waffle should be crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Our egg waffle was practically hollow.  It was basically a crispy shell with no insides. The barista? poured a good amount of batter in the waffle iron, but a lot of it oozed out. I'm thinking maybe they heated it too quickly or put too much baking powder in the mix?Panna Cotta was tasty although I wish it was bigger.Potato Bacon soup was a bit watery and didn't have a lot of chunks in it.  I also wished it was cream of potato with bacon.The other desserts looked tasty, but I feel like I can get creme brulee or macaroons anywhere with better service.  I might come again if I get invited here, but I won't come of my own volition.

1.description: This place is OK. I just wasn't a fan of the menu for lunch on weekdays. The cakes are OK, but the aftertaste and texture was not pleasant for me. I tried the blood orange and ginger mousse cake and it wasn't that good. First off, the blood orange topping wasn't fresh and was shriveled up, which made it unappealing (I ordered to try the interesting combination). The taste was good, don't get me wrong. I just didn't like the film of oil in my mouth after every bite. It felt really heavy. I also tried the cheesecake and it was the same thing. It's just not impressive. Though the looks of some dessert does look good.On a separate occasion, I came for a salad and the dressing was disgusting. I think the choice of dressing was balsamic vinaigrette. When I opened my mouth for the bite of salad, I felt like I was in a dissection lab and the smell was formaldehyde. I was disgusted. I stopped eating after three bites. The salad mix wasn't that fresh since I found some rotting leaves in there, though in small quantities. Thankfully I didn't get sick from it. It just felt like a waste of money for the salad here. The others from the party had a delicious egg waffle and the other person ordered the waffle with ice cream. It looks doable. I might have to come try it some other time... but not sure how willing I am.

9.description: I love the atmosphere of this cute dessert cafe. I tried a few different desserts including the bananas foster which was pretty good although very gelatinous. I also had the chocolate mousee cake . Beautiful presentation overall.

29.description: Service was excellent most of the food was good highly recommend Egg waffle and French chocolate mousse cake

23.description: Wow! Was walking in the around and had to stop in because it looks so cool inside. Would be very popular in Chinatown. Ordered Vanilla Latte to warm myself from the cold. The place has cakes and other sorts of desserts. I would have ordered more if I were hungry. The cashier was very friendly and the place is clean. Would stop by again!

5.description: It's a great place just to sit and hangout when it's not busy. But the food and desserts aren't consistent. And it's a lil over priced. I had the green tea and sesame cake before which was $4.59 but this month had raised to $5.59, with tax it's over $6 for a small piece of cake, I don't think it's worth it. It's even more expensive than Artopolis.The first time I had egg waffle plus was so delicious, it was crispy outside and soft inside. But the second time I ordered it was hollow inside, so prob not enough flour. The worst was what my sister ordered and brought back for me tonight. First I thought it's chocolate flavor egg waffle, look at the pic. It wasn't yellow skin on the outside, it was dark. Then inside was hard... Ehhhh if for the price and they can't keep the quality consistent then I don't think it is worth going.

31.description: Great cafe!  Wonderful deserts, the word decadent comes to mind when looking at the assortment in the display case. I loved the chocolate Carmel tart and the creme brûlée Tart. I haven't tried anything else yet.  I am so excited that we finally have a quality coffee cafe in this area.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Please stop in and check it out, you won't be disappointed.

25.description: Stopped by here on a Monday night after dinner because we were craving desserts. This place just opened and it is at a convenient location, so we decided to give it a try. We ordered the Egg Waffle Plus with superman ice-cream and strawberry sauce. This was my favorite thing there! The superman ice-cream, which is like sherbet was so good. I am craving it as I type this review. We also ordered the Honey Toast Deluxe, which was pretty huge and filling. They cut the toast into square bites and this was good too. Unfortunately, I am not fat enough to eat both by myself, so if I had to pick I will go with the Egg Waffles. We also tried Jasmine tea and Premium Flower Tea, but they were just okay. Kinda bland, but at least I tried it once so I know to cross that off my list next time.

12.description: Cool new little dessert place that just opened up in Bridgeport. Me and my friend got the key lime and chocolate caramel tarts, both were good though I liked the key lime one more. Also got the cappucino, which was made with inteligentsia coffee if I'm not mistaken. I'll prolly be in the area more since I live in the neighborhood

21.description: The desserts are cute and delicious, but they are not consistent. Some days are better than others. I've seen different chefs working for them. They have EGG WAFFLES (ji dan zai), which is a huge plus. Most of the time it's pretty good. I recommend getting the Green Tea Vanilla Panna Cotta and Green Tea Sesame Mousse Cake. It's very light and flavors are well balanced. The store was kind of hard to find. It's on this corner off Archer. First time getting there, we drove way too far and missed the store. So keep an eye out. Thank god for free parking though.

16.description: I came here once and I didn't really like it. My waffle tasted like something that was put out too long. The ice cream was good though.

17.description: I came for the much-acclaimed egg waffle, but found it and the whole experience disappointing. First off, the employee that served us was unknowlegeable about the menu. I asked for a Latte Zuccherato and she didn't even know what that was. I pointed it out to her on their menu, and asked her how she pronunced it and she just shrugged. Second, don't come expecting a quiet, cafe environment. There was a family of 3 kids that arrived and with their kid voices, the place got so loud. This has good desserts (the mousse and panna cottas were good) at decent prices, but it won't be a place I would visit unless I was in the area and no other options were open.

10.description: What a great addition to the neighborhood! My husband and I went to try it out this evening after seeing many positive things on Everyblock and here on Yelp. It did not disappoint! We got two desserts - lemon meringue tart and a pumpkin caramel panna cotta. Both were not only delicious but just really beautiful. They were sweet but not overly so - in a way that doesn't make you feel guilty for eating them, and makes you want another! The total was a little over ten dollars, which I feel is comparable to any other coffee/pastry shop. The staff was friendly, the owner spoke to us several times and was very attentive.The ambiance is really nice. It's cool enough to not make you feel lame for being there on a weekend evening, but I can definitely see it as a nice quiet place to relax/study/work during the day.All in all, I would most certainly recommend you go try it out. I'm eager to go back and try some of their savory items!

11.description: The desserts are cute and delicious, but they are not consistent. Some days are better than others. I've seen different chefs working for them. They have EGG WAFFLES (ji dan zai), which is a huge plus. Most of the time it's pretty good. I recommend getting the Green Tea Vanilla Panna Cotta and Green Tea Sesame Mousse Cake. It's very light and flavors are well balanced. The store was kind of hard to find. It's on this corner off Archer. First time getting there, we drove way too far and missed the store. So keep an eye out. Thank god for free parking though.

26.description: What a cute spot with super friendly and attentive staff! We got coffee, a pot of tea, and EGG WAFFLES!!!The egg waffles were a bit on the crunchy side. I would have liked them to a bit softer and fluffier on the inside and maybe have more flavors like green tea or chocolate. But I was just so excited to find egg waffles in Chicago!This place was the perfect spot to get some work done on a Sunday afternoon.  Free wi-fi, but I think there are only outlets on one side.

27.description: Tonight I got a salad, two macarons, and panna cotta. I can't say if the salad is any good because I immediately came home and put that in the fridge for later; dessert is for dinner tonight!!! The vanilla macaron was a great macaron, but the green tea macaron was outstanding!!! The panna cotta i got is their coffee and caramel variety and is quite good as well. I'm very excited about having this new restaurant in the neighborhood. :)

35.description: Delicious desserts  :) also good place to go for Brunch, large portion and good price.

0.description: I'll round up, even though I think it's closer to 3 (the staff is pretty nice and I do want to give them props because there aren't many dessert cafe options down near Bridgeport.) I would come back but wish they would be more consistent! (as mentioned by other reviewers).The first time I came here, the trio French crepes were super delicious (although the salad was bitter).I also had the egg waffle with toppings and a green sesame cake.  The egg waffle also had fluffy insides (some were hollow but most of them were fluffy). The sesame green tea cake didn't taste much of green tea (mostly of sesame) and maybe I'm spoiled by artropolis but the mouse also wasn't smooth enough either.  The second time the crepes weren't as good; it's as if the chef didn't put as much care/taste into them, and they fell apart super easily. The salad was much better though. But the soup I got (cream of chicken) tasted like cream of mushroom as noted even by the table next to me and super watery. If the soup was thicker it would be much better - taste wise, it was ok but probably best to call it cream of mushroom. The egg waffle also was hollow inside which made me sad.  The ice peach tea was the same, normal peach tea (kinda tastes the Starbucks one).

20.description: Really great food here. The employees are helpful and knowledgeable. Get the breakfast food. It's delish.

19.description: The things were good though, but not the owner or maybe the manager, her attitude is bad

33.description: Very nice desserts and pleasant, smart décor. They're new so still smoothing out their act. So nice to finally have "north side" quality classy desserts around here! And their hours are awesome - real working people can go! We'll be back and try their savories as well.

2.description: My sister told me about this place that just opened in Bridgeport and I'm thinking that I definitely must try it. I went in the shop and ordered:Plain egg waffle: So growing up in New York I am used to getting these egg waffles from street vendors in a cart where it is made to order. Now, although these were made to order they came out dry. I believe they tried to make it so that the outer part was kind of crispy or crunchy or something, but it ended up being very dry. I've concluded that those waffles were in egg waffle machine too long because they really were. Rum Chocolate flan (in a small glass jar): Besides it being in a unique jar, the flavor was nothing spectacular. Green tea sesame mousse: Now this is an acquire taste dessert. Had I not known there were sesame in it, I would have spit it out. Nonetheless, I ended it liking it although my friend did not. I liked the lightness of it and the combination of the green tea and sesame. Chocolate mousse? (something like that) This was my favorite one. First off, I love all things chocolate. This was rich enough yet the mousse made it light enough. I got the best of both worlds!Blood orange ginger dessert: In my opinion, this tasted like bubble gum. No, thank you. Creme Brûlée Tart: This was particularly too sweet for me. And this is not to mention the cookie tart on the bottom being pretty much unbreakable with a spoon. Great tip: Use a knife.Overall, I've experienced better.

34.description: OMGAH yes!! Finally a cafe that opens late in Bridgeport and we no longer have to drive to K-town for some sweet treat and its conveniently nearby. Such a cute little cafe with a variety of items. They have cafe food and breakfast option but what I love the most is that's there's dessert options. I have a crazy sweet tooth and love eating dessert all day. It's great that their hours are open till midnight and when I have a sweet tooth, I can just go over. We came in last night looking for something sweet to fulfill my craving and I never ever had an egg waffle before so I gave that a try and it was pretty good. They give you some options for toppings like what kind of ice cream along with a wet and dry topping. We got an egg waffle with fudge & chocolate which was great. The tiramisu ice cream was perfect! There were other dessert options in the display and we gave the green tea mousse a try as well and it came in a little cute container with JSmile51 logo. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The set up of the cafe is very cute and cozy. Great place to hang out or just study. Definitely need to come back to give other items on the menu a try. Also, it's affordable too!

32.description: What a great addition to the neighborhood! My husband and I went to try it out this evening after seeing many positive things on Everyblock and here on Yelp. It did not disappoint! We got two desserts - lemon meringue tart and a pumpkin caramel panna cotta. Both were not only delicious but just really beautiful. They were sweet but not overly so - in a way that doesn't make you feel guilty for eating them, and makes you want another! The total was a little over ten dollars, which I feel is comparable to any other coffee/pastry shop. The staff was friendly, the owner spoke to us several times and was very attentive.The ambiance is really nice. It's cool enough to not make you feel lame for being there on a weekend evening, but I can definitely see it as a nice quiet place to relax/study/work during the day.All in all, I would most certainly recommend you go try it out. I'm eager to go back and try some of their savory items!

18.description: 1st time there. Bad experience. Bad customer service. They forgot to serve our dine in order (coffee and a mocha). It's not like they were busy. We had to request a refund. This messed up our night.

13.description: Great place for dessert for they offer a nice variety of scrumptious mousse cakes! Their honey toast was exceptionally delicious with a nice blend of crunchiness of the toast and the smoothness of the ice cream. Was a little upset that they ran out of crepes at around 7pm. But the staff was nice enough to let me substitute that for two mousse cakes and I'm glad it happened. :) they don't have waiters but will bring the food out to you and are very courteous. Will definitely come back

4.description: OMGAH yes!! Finally a cafe that opens late in Bridgeport and we no longer have to drive to K-town for some sweet treat and its conveniently nearby. Such a cute little cafe with a variety of items. They have cafe food and breakfast option but what I love the most is that's there's dessert options. I have a crazy sweet tooth and love eating dessert all day. It's great that their hours are open till midnight and when I have a sweet tooth, I can just go over. We came in last night looking for something sweet to fulfill my craving and I never ever had an egg waffle before so I gave that a try and it was pretty good. They give you some options for toppings like what kind of ice cream along with a wet and dry topping. We got an egg waffle with fudge & chocolate which was great. The tiramisu ice cream was perfect! There were other dessert options in the display and we gave the green tea mousse a try as well and it came in a little cute container with JSmile51 logo. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The set up of the cafe is very cute and cozy. Great place to hang out or just study. Definitely need to come back to give other items on the menu a try. Also, it's affordable too!

24.description: A dedicated dessert spot in Bridgeport! Yes! Late night spot for when those cravings hit. We came after a show at the Icon on Roosevelt on our way home. We had a very rich, sumptuous chocolate mousse. It was dense and very chocolate-y, dark chocolate. We also too some macarrons home which were light and fluffy with great flavor. This is a great date spot. Their menu has brunch and lunch items which we will definitely be back for.Great, friendly service too. Thanks for opening this special place in an area that desperately needs options like J Smile!

6.description: Stopped by here on a Monday night after dinner because we were craving desserts. This place just opened and it is at a convenient location, so we decided to give it a try. We ordered the Egg Waffle Plus with superman ice-cream and strawberry sauce. This was my favorite thing there! The superman ice-cream, which is like sherbet was so good. I am craving it as I type this review. We also ordered the Honey Toast Deluxe, which was pretty huge and filling. They cut the toast into square bites and this was good too. Unfortunately, I am not fat enough to eat both by myself, so if I had to pick I will go with the Egg Waffles. We also tried Jasmine tea and Premium Flower Tea, but they were just okay. Kinda bland, but at least I tried it once so I know to cross that off my list next time.

22.description: The honey toast is good. Espresso drinks are decent. Other things are very meh

15.description: I live nearby and have a sweet tooth like a child on Halloween so I thought I'd stop by. I wasn't sure what to expect there were some mixed reviews but I felt obliged  given the location and specialty. With that said I was blown away. We ordered the honey toast, egg waffles and a panini. We enjoyed everything. The honey toast was crispy on the outside and a perfect flavor texture combo for the creamy ice cream. Covered in caramel and peanuts the only thing I would do to improve is drizzle the caramel down to the bottom slice of toast so that I didn't have cut and smear it off the plate. I bit into everything and was happy, no complaints and am planning another trip soon. I recommend it. Good for families.

7.description: Had the 3 crepes and egg waffles plus.  Overall good. The chicken crepe was good - too bad you can't order it alone.  Green tea in ice cream and panna cotta could be stronger.

8.description: Delicious desserts  :) also good place to go for Brunch, large portion and good price.

30.description: took my family to this place for a quick bite，really good cupcake。great place for brunch。the portion was very good as well。would be back again soon。

3.description: It was 23rd of January, my first time here, yesterday was the second time, I'm not really planning to be here  It's just that I'm a bit depress and I want to eat something sweet so I trying to find a place until I reached this one so I came in.Place is cozy, so I ordered Honey tossed deluxe for only $9, crème brulee tart $4 and raspberry lime.  Sooooooooo damn good. I surely come again.

14.description: A dedicated dessert spot in Bridgeport! Yes! Late night spot for when those cravings hit. We came after a show at the Icon on Roosevelt on our way home. We had a very rich, sumptuous chocolate mousse. It was dense and very chocolate-y, dark chocolate. We also too some macarrons home which were light and fluffy with great flavor. This is a great date spot. Their menu has brunch and lunch items which we will definitely be back for.Great, friendly service too. Thanks for opening this special place in an area that desperately needs options like J Smile!

58.description: always the spot for northern chinese, and it is packed with white people

56.description: My friend and I were craving chinese food so we came here, the menu was fairly large with lots of selections.We got the xiao long Bao (soup dumplings) that were supposedly famous here but they were not good. The skin was too thick and they dried out too fast. We also ordered peapod vegetables, pork belly with fried tofu, and lamb in cumin. Everything was delicious except that you need to make sure that you tell them EXACTLY what you want because they got our order wrong. Service was par, but I would suggest This place, especially the pork belly dish!!

29.description: We ve been here a lot of times and this place never disappoints. We both grew up in China and this place feels like home. The servers are friendly, the atmosphere is casual, and the food make you doubt if you are actually in China.Our favorite includes Pan Fried Smoked Pork Cake, Dried Tofu with Pork and Fresh Chili, and Clear  Wide Noodle with Pork and Vegetable. If you have a big party, call them ahead to check if they have the big table.

42.description: The single greatest Chinese restaurant I have ever eaten at.If you order sweet & sour chicken, go down the street to Happiness. That'll be much more your speed. If you're remotely adventurous, though, come here. The extensive menu has very helpful English descriptions, so don't be daunted. Just go here. Garlic eggplant. Smoked pork pancake. Shanghai soup dumpling. My godddddd.

23.description: I thought this place was some dinky place on Halsted, but I was wrong and I wish I had given this place a try sooner. It was such a beautiful day outside so I sat outside and enjoyed the fresh breeze. The server brought out our menus and there were some delicious looking pictures. The pictures aren't under the food item though, so I just pointed to whatever food picture looked delicious. I got a crab meat and cucumber salad, dim sum, and crab rangoon. Everything was so amazing. The salad was light and flavorful- had a lot of garlic. Yummy. Then my side of crab rangoon came out. I mean that's a favorite at any Chinese place and this restaurant did not fail on these. The last and main dish I was looking forward to was the best. They were tiny little pouches of meat and meat juice. When you bit into it, the juices would flow out. I poured ginger soy sauce on it and was so sad when the juices slipped onto the place and not into my Chinese soup spoon. I couldn't drink up the deliciousness. I can't wait to go back and point at some other pictures.

47.description: Maybe it's because we're laowai and, as non-Chinese, don't deserve good food, or maybe it was because we didn't eat in, but we were very, very, very disappointed with our take-out. And, this place used to be good. Not anymore...

8.description: My second visit to this place.Came here once for the dinner service, but this review will be about the Sunday afternoon service. Lunch was busy and we waited a few minutes for our seats. The host was courteous, so that is always a plus (especially at a Chinese restaurant). Potsticker house provides a beans with soy sauce appetizer. The pot stickers were probably were memorable for the its size and shape, but I wish that there was more meat in mine. The pork soup dumplings were bigger than the soup spoon and very juicy. The skin is thicker than usual but nonetheless the flavors of the soup were the star of the show. Best of the meal was the wonton in spicy oil, as the spiciness was subtle and the skin of the wrappers were delicate on the mouth. Even though the skin was thick, the wontons and the seasoning complemented one another.  I will definitely be back to have more or any his dish. Definitely come here for the odd shaped potstickers and spicy wontons. My last words are to try to grab the attention of the waiters when you can, and don't be intimidated if you are not fluent in Chinese.

31.description: 本人山东长大，在东北生活过3年，地地道道的北方人。。。。但是，还是说一句，这菜实在是太咸了，北方菜可没这么咸啊。。。这完完全全就是堆味精堆出来的。。。就这样生意还很红火。。也就是在芝加哥。。。放在纽约加州估计早就被挤下去了。。。。你要是重口你来吃。。。我今后是不来了。。。。

34.description: Change in chef? Management ? I used to love the filings here. Came here last for beef noodle. The beef is very fatty and dumplings v Oily.

16.description: Absolutely amazing place. Very authentic northern Chinese food. Very difficult to find food this authentic even in big cities like Chicago. Very reasonably priced too. I rarely give 5 stars on any review. This is a first time.

13.description: Their pancakes are a must try! We tried the chive pancake and also the smoke port pancake, which perhaps should not be called "pan cakes" but more like "fried dough with delicious stuff inside"? The potstickers were pretty good as well. The amuse bouche of pickled cabbage is, however, what left the most long lasting impression on us, id get a whole can to go home if I could.

11.description: Overall, the food was surprisingly good especially in Chicago.The waitress was nice and her recommendations were good and my taste buds agreed. If I come back to Chicago, I would come back for breakfast/lunch. I would recommend sour touf bowl.

39.description: Overrated .... soup dumpling was not good. The skin was too thick and hard. the soup inside is mostly dry. It's reasonably priced for $6 ? I would only come here for the beef noodle soup with the spice, which the noodle is handmade with a good texture.

37.description: Bad experienced!we got there and sat down for atleast 5 mins and they didnt even give us a menu or asked us for a drink!!!i have to try to get their attention so they can serve us and they act like their busy but they only had 2-3 table people eating.the food was ok it was not all that.my husband ordered 106 (beef noodles) and it was just a sprinkled beef like wtf was that?!?!??it wasnt even real meat!!! and another thing i asked for extra rice and the lady just walked away like really?!??i dont know if its because of our race or their just plain stupid and slow but i will never recommend this place or ever going back there.

0.description: Great new find! Very friendly staff and the booths were nice.  The menu is pretty confusing for a first-timer as the waitress even had to tell us that the pictures didn't correspond with what we had ordered.  The smoked pork pancakes were amazing! The chive pie was good too.  The shrimp dumplings weren't impressive, but the garlic pork was very tasty.Great price points and plenty of food! Will probably come back to try more dishes.

38.description: Very nice traditional Chinese dishes and they are not expensive at all.Fried rice cake is the best. Soy milk and dumplings are good too.Waiters are all very polite.

51.description: Love this place! Food is great. I recommend the potstickers and go over the weekend do so you can try their amazing fried dough!

27.description: Great lunch special for under $6 includes egg roll, soup. I had Mongolian beef. Everything was delicious! Definitely will be back as I do biz in area. Wait staff was very good. Clean place too.

32.description: Overall, the food was surprisingly good especially in Chicago.The waitress was nice and her recommendations were good and my taste buds agreed. If I come back to Chicago, I would come back for breakfast/lunch. I would recommend sour touf bowl.

54.description: Five star Shanghai Soup Dumplings (be sure to use the sauces they give you). We also ordered fried rice and found it quite flavorless. The pork cutlets were similar to what you might get as Sweet and Sour chicken elsewhere - deep fried, very crunchy. I tried the cumin lamb and didn't love it - there was something in the texture of a few of the lamb bites that didn't work for me. Overall, nothing deeply problematic, but I would stick to the dim sum menu if I were you.

48.description: We went here for dumplings!! We ordered xiao long bao, dumplings, potstickers, soy milk, and pork intestine. The skin of xiao long bao is too thick but it's still delicious; Potsticker looks like fried dumplings...; Pork intestine is really great and not too salty! Although there's some minor cons, it is so far the best dumplings restaurant in Chicago with free parking space!!

44.description: Order right, and Potsticker House is fantastic. Order wrong, and it's not so great. We tried:Wonton in chili oil ($4.95): didn't expect this classic Sichuan dish in a Northern Chinese restaurant, but the wontons skins were perfect and coated in fragrant chili oil. I was a little surprised they weren't as spicy as I'd hoped, but after all, Potsticker House isn't a Sichuan place.Beef noodle soup ($7.95): A huge, fragrant bowl of noodle soup. The noodles were definitely more cooked than I like, but the soup itself was good. Very flavorful, not overly salty or oily.Smoked pork cake ($6.95): Think of a traditional scallion pancake, except filled with sliced, smoked pork. This turned out to be a good choice as a side dish, the pancake was perfectly done, crispy and a little chewy without being too oily. Didn't think the pork added too much.Xiaolongbao ($5.95): I'm surprised the XLB are so popular judging by other Yelp reviews, because these were just not good. Skins were too thick and dense, the pork filling lacked flavor, and there wasn't enough soup in the dumpling. You can see the northern Chinese influence in the XLB and it's not a good thing.Boiled jiaozi ($5.95): We tried both varieties, pork and sanxian (shrimp and chive) and both were good. The dumplings weren't spectacular, but the skins were clearly handmade and pleasantly chewy, a simple dish done right.House special potstickers ($5.95): Meh. The long rectangular shape was interesting and I've never had potstickers like that, but the filling was unremarkable and there wasn't much meat in them. Very greasy.Tianjin style baozi ($5.95): This, on the other hand, was a definite winner. The baozi were perfectly fluffy, warm, and just slightly sweet with a tasty pork meatball inside. Compare these with the xiaolongbao, and you can tell this is really a northern Chinese restaurant.Beijing style eggplant ($8.95): My favorite dish of the night, the eggplant was just firm enough and sauteed perfectly. Another very simple northern dish with lots of eggplant and strong flavors of ginger, garlic, and soy sauce.Service was polite but inattentive (not unexpected.) Almost no tables were occupied when we got there around 6pm on a Thursday night, but it filled up rapidly. Definitely a solid choice for tasty, no-nonsense Beijing/Tianjin cuisine, but stick to the classics and skip the soup dumplings.

24.description: Went for lunch.  Outstanding chili oil wontons, pork bao buns, onion pancakes and house potstickers.  I will seriously be craving these for weeks until I get back to Chicago and stop in again.  Also tried veggie buns and shrimp shumai which were above average but not as great as the other food.

7.description: I've been coming to Ed's for years. It's been a favorite of my family for a long time. However, I really think you have to know what to order when you go there otherwise your experience may not be so good. Here are the dishes that I think Ed's does especially well: (they are mostly Northern Chinese dishes because that's really what Ed's is good at - e.g. noodles and pancakes): - Beef noodle soup: I love the beef noodle soup. Sometimes the quality is inconsistent but even when I would say the quality is not the best, it's still pretty darn good. The soup is really flavorful and the noodles are the perfect chewy texture because they are hand-pulled. It's also huge so you can share. I would say that generally, Ed's noodle dishes are pretty good because of the texture of those hand-pulled noodles. I've tried a number of them, but I always go back to the beef noodle soup because that soup is so tasty. The fried rice is generally pretty tasty here too.- A lot of people like the house potstickers. These are not really potstickers in the traditional sense, but long pieces of dough with ground meat in them. I like these too, but I really prefer the pan fried pancake with smoked pork. It's kind of like a green onion pancake sandwich with smoked pork, sauce, and green onions inside. One of the best things you'll ever eat. - Clear wide cold noodles with pork and vegetables (liang pi). This is a Northern Chinese specialty and I think Ed's makes it well. Not everyone likes this dish however, so if you've never had it before - note that you might not like it. - Salt & Pepper Seafood Dish: I don't know if they still have this. I think they still have the Salt & Pepper Shrimp, but they might still  have the version of this dish with squid, shrimp, fish. My brother loves this dish, and it is quite tasty. One thing I would NOT recommend. The dumplings are passable here, which is funny because it's called Ed's Potsticker House. I have high standards for dumplings because my grandmother makes the best dumplings in the world, and I'm always comparing restaurant dumplings to hers. Ed's are just ok, especially compared to other items that are more delicious on the menu. Also, I don't know why people rave about the Shanghai soup dumplings here. I've tried these multiple times hoping to like them, and they have no soup. How can they be soup dumplings WITHOUT SOUP?? Plus, this is a restaurant that specializes in Northern Chinese cuisine. Soup dumplings are a Shanghainese/Wuxi food, so it's not suprising that Ed's doesn't make them that well.Also, Ed's is great to come to for a traditional Chinese breakfast. You can get the mung bean flour roll with egg (jian bing guo zi), which is basically like a fried savory cruller with an egg pancake with green onions wrapped around. Inside the pancake are some savory sauces, like chili paste. This is one of my favorite types of Chinese breakfast, and it's hard to come by in Chicago. They also have good soy milk (dou jiang) and plain fried crullers (you tiao). The savory tofu soup is also quite good (dou fu nao).

49.description: The quality of service at this place has really dropped as it has become too popular for its own good. Tea is not complimentary, and also a required gratuity of 15% is now required for all diners. The xiaolongbao here is good, but there are places with similar offerings with better service.

40.description: Delicious! First time here service was meh, but food and price made up for it. Noodles are great and pot stickers are the best.

53.description: After living in LA for years I have to admit this is The most authentic Chinese restaurant in Chicago yet. They do a good job on not just northern Chinese food, but also traditional breakfast as well as Sichuan /spicy dishes. Their cumin lamb, sourkrauet pork belly tofu soup, and cold noodle mix (with pork,veggies and wasabi peanut sauce) dish never disappoint! Also try the pancakes(cong you bing) , fish aroma eggplant, and sweet potato dish as dessert!

30.description: The potstickers were good as one would expect, but the two noodle dishes we got were so bland it as as if they just showed some pork to a pot of water.

46.description: Ordered 4 things, delivery to loop cost $6.5 which is the most expensive delivery charge I've ever seen. Food is completely cold, and size is exceptionally small for what I paid for. And the delivery man asked for more tips? For your reference, I am from Beijing, and the food taste just so-so, not even close to being good. And it cost me $60 total for 4 small dishes (only with 1 box of rice), go figure if I will ever order again from them.

1.description: There is PARKING right next to the restaurant, you have to enter via the alley around the block!Best Northern food I have had in the US.  They have some very traditional dishes like Chive Pie and Scallion Pancakes that are my go to favorites.  Their lamb on bone is also one of my favorites!

55.description: After eating at Homestyle just down the block and loving it, I knew I had to try Potsticker House since one of Potsticker House's old chefs started Homestyle. I thought the food here was excellent. The eggplant in garlic sauce was crispy, full of flavor, and the highlight of my meal. The fried tofu with house special sauce was a nice compliment to the eggplant since it had a simple flavor - this was done well, but I didn't find it as mind blowing as my girlfriend did but I prefer more flavorful dishes. The sauteed hot and sour lotus root was another dish with a more complex flavor that I enjoyed, and was definitely a new thing for me that I haven't found elsewhere. The waitress was very nice and gave us a lot of extra rice at no charge for our leftovers. Overall, this place was excellent, and with Homestyle just down the block, the residents of Bridgeport are lucky to have these two Halsted giants so close.

9.description: I come here with my friend on a Friday. We were told the wait time is 15 min for 2 people, but we ended up waiting for half an hour before we were seated. We ordered mini steamed dragon bao (小籠包), one stir fry veggie and fried marinated fish. The steamed bao was average and did not taste good once it's cold, clearly the wrap needs more preparation. The fish seemed fresh but the chef seemed to have over served the salt without tasting it. The stir-fry veggie was good. There could be better choices if we go near Chinatown, but the food and service was OK

26.description: I think when the boss is here, the service is better and faster and while she is out its a mass.

25.description: Awesome food. The potstickers are very nice.

12.description: My friend and I were craving chinese food so we came here, the menu was fairly large with lots of selections.We got the xiao long Bao (soup dumplings) that were supposedly famous here but they were not good. The skin was too thick and they dried out too fast. We also ordered peapod vegetables, pork belly with fried tofu, and lamb in cumin. Everything was delicious except that you need to make sure that you tell them EXACTLY what you want because they got our order wrong. Service was par, but I would suggest This place, especially the pork belly dish!!

59.description: If you want truly authentic Chinese food,  this is the place you want to go! They have the best buns (肉包) in Chicago. The other dishes are also very delicious. We ordered the pan fried onion cakes (手抓餅) and it was very good too. It was so good I brought my friends from Michigan here for lunch and they came back for dinner on the same night!

21.description: my favorite restaurant in chicago. Everything is authentic. I can never be tired coming here.

17.description: My wife is VERY picky when it comes to Chinese food. We drive 90 minutes because this is the only place she likes. The food is very authentic and EXTREMELY good. You will love it here.

10.description: Never come here again. I don't know why they can get approval by FDA and health department of the city. I see the worker there don't even know what is clean. I saw they take a mice out of kitchen use back door. Please don't come this fucking place again for you and your family health. Also I don't wanna talk about price there. If you been there before you should know.

5.description: It was fairly traditional in taste, cooked perfectly and yet lacking in flavor. We had the onion pancake, dumplings, potstickers and shrimp fried rice. They also serve a complimentary bean appetizer that I personally liked.

3.description: I've been told by some that it's the go to place for Chinese in Bridgeport, I will say the menu is a bit different than other chinese places i've been to, it may be a different part of China, anyways we got the titular potstickers, pork, and those were very good, very moist and not too soft or crispy, and then for the first time I had jellyfish salad, it's good if you want something lighter, it's served on cucumbers, and honestly didn't have much of a taste, but at least I can say I've tried it, it's BYOB too which was cool, there's a parking lot next to it, but you have to enter via the alley behind it and not from Halsted, I live down the block so I could see myself going back

35.description: I don't know why the rating is kinda low for this restaurant but the food here is awesome!! They have really authentic (aka. Not Americanized) Northern Chinese food! Every dish here is good.

19.description: I thought this place was some dinky place on Halsted, but I was wrong and I wish I had given this place a try sooner. It was such a beautiful day outside so I sat outside and enjoyed the fresh breeze. The server brought out our menus and there were some delicious looking pictures. The pictures aren't under the food item though, so I just pointed to whatever food picture looked delicious. I got a crab meat and cucumber salad, dim sum, and crab rangoon. Everything was so amazing. The salad was light and flavorful- had a lot of garlic. Yummy. Then my side of crab rangoon came out. I mean that's a favorite at any Chinese place and this restaurant did not fail on these. The last and main dish I was looking forward to was the best. They were tiny little pouches of meat and meat juice. When you bit into it, the juices would flow out. I poured ginger soy sauce on it and was so sad when the juices slipped onto the place and not into my Chinese soup spoon. I couldn't drink up the deliciousness. I can't wait to go back and point at some other pictures.

28.description: No rice come with the dish!!!!!!! They charge $1 for the small bowl of rice!!!!!!!!! That is ridiculous!!!!!!! I never been the Chinese restaurant that does not serve the rice with the dish

45.description: The xiao long bao (soup dumplings) are sub-par. The flavor just isn't there. Get their eggplant dish and bao zi instead. Their dumplings are also pretty good and probably hand made, judging by the skins. Overall, I'd still say they're a pretty authentic place, just know that the chef is better at northern style dishes, like dumplings and steamed buns (note that soup dumplings are a shanghainese dish).

33.description: as someone from San Francisco, I find it's incredibly difficult to find good Chinese food in Chicago. Potsticker house is one of the better restaurants I've been to - love the soup dumplings (although I'd say they're on par with Lao Sze Chuan) and the scallion pancakes were delicious. The best part is the price- I went with a group of 4, we ordered soup dumplings, scallion cakes, pea pod leaves, lamb entree, and pork belly and it was only $50!!

43.description: Don't get me wrong the food is very good.  Best chicken fried rice I've ever had and the Shangahi soup dumplings are amazing.  But the customer service here is terrible I was told my order would be ready in 20 minuted when I arrived they told me my order wasn't ready after waiting another 15 minutes I asked the server if my order was ready yet she went to go check in the back turns out my order had been sitting on a table the whole time.  Don't even get me started on the delivery terrible and disorganized establishment,

2.description: Mung bean flour roll with egg (jian bing guo zi) live to my expectation, but it was the only satisfying dish among the five that we ordered. Shanghai Buns (xiao long bao) was just okay:  the dough was not thin enough and the juice was oily. Hot soymilk came lukewarm. Sour lotus  root was also thick and without putting in too much thought or effort. The famous lamb dish (yang xie zi) had very strong flavor and so if you are not a big fan of cumin, I would not recommend either. I strongly suggest the restaurant owner to add "chef recommended" to the menu, so that the first time comers can enjoy a good combo of orders.

18.description: Good food ,waited awhile no one came out to greet me I had to go to the kitchen and then waited another 2o minutes

41.description: My second visit to this place.Came here once for the dinner service, but this review will be about the Sunday afternoon service. Lunch was busy and we waited a few minutes for our seats. The host was courteous, so that is always a plus (especially at a Chinese restaurant). Potsticker house provides a beans with soy sauce appetizer. The pot stickers were probably were memorable for the its size and shape, but I wish that there was more meat in mine. The pork soup dumplings were bigger than the soup spoon and very juicy. The skin is thicker than usual but nonetheless the flavors of the soup were the star of the show. Best of the meal was the wonton in spicy oil, as the spiciness was subtle and the skin of the wrappers were delicate on the mouth. Even though the skin was thick, the wontons and the seasoning complemented one another.  I will definitely be back to have more or any his dish. Definitely come here for the odd shaped potstickers and spicy wontons. My last words are to try to grab the attention of the waiters when you can, and don't be intimidated if you are not fluent in Chinese.

52.description: Only guylow in party of 10. Food tasty. Excellent pot stickers. Mostly Asians but a few guylows like myself. Free parking in lot North is a lifesaver with Halsted closed due to construction. South on Emerald, west on 32nd left North into alley. Parking lot compressed dirt on the left as you head North.

50.description: This might be my favorite Chinese restaurant in Chicago that I keep coming back. Most northern style dishes are exactly the same taste as back in China and I highly recommend their dessert, Cui Pi Xian Nai.

4.description: Only reason why 3 star because the potstickers were amazing and that would be the only thing that I would actually come back for. The service was horrible! It took awhile for our server to take our order when we knew exactly what we wanted as soon as we were seated. Even for our drinks, it took awhile for the server to bring us water. Everything else on the menu just seem so average compares to every other restaurant. What left me really impress was how amazing the potstickers were and I can't wait to get some more.

6.description: So I used to come to this place when it first opened.  The restaurant was really slow but the food was good.  Now,  it's super busy,  packed house on a Saturday afternoon.  20 min wait for a table but I didn't mind.  The food,  the soup dumplings were poor. No soup in it. Completely dry. Only 3 had soup. The potsticker and pancake bread are still good.  But I solely came for the fried fish with sweet and sour sauce. It has always been my favorite but it has gone disappointing. The fish was really small and it was chewy. The sauce was too sour. I wanted to cry cause I looked so forward to it.  We also order a fried pork dish that has a little sauce on it and a bit sour. It was terrible.  Very small amount of meat inside. Cut very thin and way TOO much breading. The plate was dry,  we each ate one piece and didn't bother with it again. My husband ordered this cold veggie plate that was really good.  Huge plate and then u mix it on and eat.  Really good,  best Asian salad I've had.  Overall,  I might come back again.  But the next time will be the final straw.  I hope they will improve.

22.description: Waited for 73 minutes for a two course takeout. Clearly they forgot about me.

15.description: The restaurant is big and clean. When the weather permits, they have outside seating. Food is not good. ordered a lunch lo mein and some potstickers. Both were bland, the service was ghostly.

57.description: They deliver.Their XLB are not as delicate as Hing Kee but I like the flavor of the filling more.Their green onion pancakes are delicious.On Sundays they serve tortilla/egg wrapped around fried dough.  Couple that with very polite service you got yourself a super solid Northern Chinese style option that, for some moronic reason, is right next to the other super solid non-Canto option in Chicago.I can't help but compare this place with Homestyle Taste by the fact that they're a block from each other and they're both not Cantonese.  However, they're both quite different.  Definitely give this place a shot.

20.description: So I used to come to this place when it first opened.  The restaurant was really slow but the food was good.  Now,  it's super busy,  packed house on a Saturday afternoon.  20 min wait for a table but I didn't mind.  The food,  the soup dumplings were poor. No soup in it. Completely dry. Only 3 had soup. The potsticker and pancake bread are still good.  But I solely came for the fried fish with sweet and sour sauce. It has always been my favorite but it has gone disappointing. The fish was really small and it was chewy. The sauce was too sour. I wanted to cry cause I looked so forward to it.  We also order a fried pork dish that has a little sauce on it and a bit sour. It was terrible.  Very small amount of meat inside. Cut very thin and way TOO much breading. The plate was dry,  we each ate one piece and didn't bother with it again. My husband ordered this cold veggie plate that was really good.  Huge plate and then u mix it on and eat.  Really good,  best Asian salad I've had.  Overall,  I might come back again.  But the next time will be the final straw.  I hope they will improve.
