36.description: MSG loaded!!!Soy milk is very rich n tasty. Hand tossed pancake is good. Xiao Lon bao is not Xiao, it's humongous big with 5 spice seasoning, really?? N the wrap is thick. Ordered the fat pork, n the tendon tripe appetizer dish, noo!!!That's it!

14.description: Sat here for waiting for my food and being more than patience. The server keeps telling me 2 me minutes, 2 more minutes, 2 more minutes. So 40 minutes after, I left and cancelled the order.  Horrible service

58.description: Zaytune has fantastic steak shawerma!  The meat is high quality and flavorful.  I've tried the chicken and it's also good, but not as good as the steak.  They can be ordered in a sandwich, wrap, salad or plate with rice and veggies.  The restaurant is tiny and set up for fast casual dining so I've only gotten take-out.  Food is an excellent value for the quality and portion.  Based on other reviews, I'm looking forward to trying the braised lamb next time.

56.description: I went a few times for the Chicken Shwarma and in those few times, the food was good. However, the last few times were bad. My co-worker ordered the Chicken Shwarma and the chicken was still raw in the inside of her pita. Then, my boyfriend ate their twice and he told me he got the runs both times. I'm not sure if there was a change in cooks, but Zaytunes is heading south. I'm not going back there because I'm afraid that I'm going to end up sick there too.

29.description: Nice place, friendly cooks and good food that won't break the wallet. Had the stake wrap a d Falafels very good! Cook recommend I get the herd fries next time.

42.description: This is a nice small place. Prices are reasonable and portion is good. I recommend the steak shawerma platter. The problem is that this place is not good for groups.

23.description: Great neighborhood restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. Always a good place to grab a quick bite to eat. The menu is limited but everything is freshly prepared and delicious. I always get the chicken shwarma wrap. It has chicken, hummus, tahini sauce, along with wonderful veges (cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce, parsley, radishes, onions) all perfectly wrapped in a soft grilled Flatbread. The wrapping is always important and can make or break the overall experience of the wrap. Here they daily prepare their Flatbread and they aren't stingy at all on the amount of chicken and veges they give you. Definitely enough that you don't even need a side..but if you prefer one I recommend their herb fries that comes with a Kalamata sauce. I can't eat the sauce due to my allergies, but it's smells wonderful and my boyfriend says it's really good. The fries are wonderful though without the sauce and are always freshly prepared per order and they are crispy. Make sure you don't forgot to ask for extra hot sauce on the side if you want to spice up your wrap a little. I easily run through 2-3 cups of their wonderful tomatoe based hot sauce every time. I knocked them one star because their location isn't the easiest to get to if u don't have a car and I've had their hummus and wasn't impressed. Other then that love this place and recommend everyone to try it!

47.description: They do a good job. Nice lean cuts of meat and great service. Prices are fair, would also recommend to anyone who likes to eat healthy.

8.description: Pretty good food. The wraps are pretty huge, so order those instead of the platters. You get about the same amount of food. Decor is mediocre. Service and speed are good!

31.description: Think....Mediterranean style Chipotle. The prices are all very reasonable and you are going to get a decent amount of food. The servers are very helpful if you are trying to figure out what to order as well. I had the braised lamb wrap which was fantastic. Definitely will come again to try the other meats. Hummus was a bit creamier than I am used to but still good. Basically, bold flavors at a good price with a Mediterranean theme.

34.description: This place was a last minute choice after a nearby restaurant was closed due to the construction on Morgan. I'm so glad we went, the food was fabulous! We tried their Greek yogurt marinated chicken. It was full of flavor and not at all greasy. Their pita bread was my fav! It was thin and grilled, best compared to nann bread. If you can, call ahead to order, for either dine in or carry out.They're crazy busy and it takes a while to get your food.

16.description: Great neighborhood restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. Always a good place to grab a quick bite to eat. The menu is limited but everything is freshly prepared and delicious. I always get the chicken shwarma wrap. It has chicken, hummus, tahini sauce, along with wonderful veges (cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce, parsley, radishes, onions) all perfectly wrapped in a soft grilled Flatbread. The wrapping is always important and can make or break the overall experience of the wrap. Here they daily prepare their Flatbread and they aren't stingy at all on the amount of chicken and veges they give you. Definitely enough that you don't even need a side..but if you prefer one I recommend their herb fries that comes with a Kalamata sauce. I can't eat the sauce due to my allergies, but it's smells wonderful and my boyfriend says it's really good. The fries are wonderful though without the sauce and are always freshly prepared per order and they are crispy. Make sure you don't forgot to ask for extra hot sauce on the side if you want to spice up your wrap a little. I easily run through 2-3 cups of their wonderful tomatoe based hot sauce every time. I knocked them one star because their location isn't the easiest to get to if u don't have a car and I've had their hummus and wasn't impressed. Other then that love this place and recommend everyone to try it!

13.description: Love this place! My favorite spot in bridgeport! The seasonings for their schwarma is so flagrant! I usually order the steak salad bowl. Portion is good and everything is fresh. Herb fries are great too! The flatbread and pita is homemade.

11.description: First, the food here is really delicious and full of flavor.  We were really enjoying our entrees until we noticed some sanitation habits....it's not right and just gross.  On the night we were here, Alberto, the guy handling the phone, the register, and the money also handles the pitas and assembles some of the food with his phone-register-money fingers....how nasty!  Someone will eventually get really sick.  I think they need more help behind the counter...maybe someone only handling the phone and money.They store the baby high chairs in the bathroom.   We saw a server bring out a high chair from the bathroom for someone to use.  Later, when we went to use the unisex bathroom ourselves...there was a whole stack in there....jesus!  Would you want your child in one?  Would you sit in one....hell no.  Won't be back anytime soon to this particular location.

39.description: Love this restaurant! Just wish there was one closer in the suburbs.  Everything i have tried has been absolutely amazing. They have a wonderful staff, & a cute location to relax, enjoy the view, & east some amazing food.  You won't be disappointed!

37.description: THE BEST!  We had the BEST lunch here (and nearly everything on their menu)!  Very fresh, ABSOLUTELY delicious! The staff were all very very pleasant and the restaurant was very clean. The amount of food per order was extremely generous, too!

0.description: This place is simple yet soooo good. I've been to other Mediterranean restaurants where they try to be simple but end up being waaaay too simple without anything special. However, within each menu item there's a lot of deliciousness in the little details. My go to is the chicken swarma platter and herb fries. The chicken swarma platter looks like a pretty classic dish but it is next level here. The grilled veggie skewer has amazing flavor with nice caramelization for just a few pieces of veggies. The pepper they have is fantastic with the kick of spiciness. At first I thought the chicken would be good but might need a douse of their dressing, BUT don't do it! Or a least, don't drown the chicken. There is this char on the chicken that NEEDS to be tasted. You also get a small serving of salad with the platter and it's good and fresh. Lastly, I always get some herb fries that are a new experience of fries. The dip that comes with the fries is really, really good and I would actual love to just have a bottle of it to put over my next 10 meals.Don't sleep on Zaytune. It's a hot joint. I'm glad it's in Bridgeport and I hope I'll be satisfying my herb fries cravings for the foreseeable future.

38.description: I used to go here every week when I had an apartment down the street, and when I moved this didn't change much. Zaytune serves the best mediterranean food of anywhere I've ever gone.  The people here really know what they are doing.  The workers are friendly and prompt.  The ambiance is lovely, and it's a great place to get take out!Everything I've had here has been delicious.  It's a great place for vegetarians too.  The sauces are the tastiest culinary items ever invented perhaps.  I think at some point I've tried about everything on the menu and it's safe to say that you can order pretty much anything here and be overwhelmingly pleased.  My favorite is the roast veg salad.  The bread is excellent.  The chef's knack for blending flavors and spices is without parallel.

51.description: I can't even begin to express how I feel about this place. My boyfriend brought me here today for the fist time ever and right from the gecko I knew it was going to be bad. We order the platters in a specific way yet we got the way that was easier for them and don't get me started on the bathroom it was not clean on top of that they had water for soap. Like really go to a dollar store and buy one the water didn't even have bubbles. I would never refer this place to friends family not even my enemies.P.s I had to give them a start because it wouldn't let me post my review without it.

27.description: Amazing. The food was so perfectly seasoned and delicious! We got the steak wrap and chicken schwarma platter with cucumber salad and hummus. Great portions, the best flavors. We will be back to try the rest!

32.description: Good food, especially the herb fries. They didn't have kafta and offered no reason why. The workers were more focused on ogling certain customers than helping all. The pita is made fresh and was very nice as were the sauces.

54.description: Love the food and service! Shout out to Javier who was on point and had a lot of good info about the food and the restaurant. Although im a picky eater, this place has great steak and rice. The leg of lamb is also tender and juicy!

48.description: Falafels are salty as fuck. I used to get them all the time and as of December/January, something changed in the recipe to make them completely inedible.

44.description: My husband and I decided to drive from South Bend, just to try Zaytune, after watching an episode of Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  This place did not disappoint at all!!! We both ordered the steak Shawarma and falafel.  Everyhting was so delicious...the steak shawarma melts is delightful!!!  I highly recommend this place!

24.description: Definitely a better than average Mediterranean restaurant. Grabbed some take-out when I was in Chicago and staying the area. It was the day after some very hard partying and all that was needed was some comfort food that was healthier than junk food.Zaytune hit the spot with a delicious and huge falafel wrap. It was wrapped in bread that they made and would be better called flat bread than pita. I also ordered some homemade tasting baba ghanoush that was delicious and came with more flat bread. The bread really isn't like typical pita. It is much bigger and flakier and not as thick....and better. My wife had a falafel salad (unfortunately they were out of tabouli) which had romaine lettuce and tomatoes dressed with a tahini dressing and piled with falafel. She wanted some fries and I have to say that the fries here are some of the best ever, flavored with herbs and with a Mediterranean style dipping sauce that was better than the typical ketchup or aioli. So tasty! They also threw in some salsa that was good with a nice zing to it and came with homemade pita chips.This was so tasty and exactly what was needed. I will definitely eat here again if I am ever in the Bridgeport area. The portions are also quite big so we ended up saving half of it and enjoying a second meal out of it.

7.description: I had been wanting to check out Bridgeport for a while and when I looked up lunch spots, this one looked great. I came in with a friend around 1:30 on a week day. It wasn't too busy, but a few people came and went as we sat outside for an hour and a half and chatted and ate. Both my friend and I decided on the GRILLED STEAK SHAWARMA wrap and we split some of the Herb Fries with Kalmata sauce. Both were incredible. Seriously, incredible. I couldn't finish all my wrap so I brought it home and had it for dinner...still just as good! The wrap itself was excellent; the meat was tender and juicy and the marinade on the meat was delicious. I can't wait to come back!

49.description: You sometimes have to wait 10-20 minutes for food, but trust me it is so worth it! Everything is made fresh to order, and delicious!!

40.description: haven't been disappointed here. try the chicken shawarma, and ask to mix in a little falafel to get that extra yummified, over the top deliciousness.

53.description: Saw this place on Chicago's Best  Great food! Decently priced! Everything on that menu is good! A little small & crowded at times but the food makes it worth it!

30.description: Yesterday was my first time here and it was fantastic! My mom and I order the Grilled chicken wrap with a side of fries. The amount of food you get is definitely worth every dollar. My God!! Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu

46.description: Fries were epicness. Had the chicken grill platter and it was quite good. Will get this next time I'm in the area.

1.description: Zaytune is EVERYTHING. Located on Morgan just north of 31st street, this place is a gem on the south side. There's usually some free street parking, but you may have to walk a little bit depending on what time you go.  It's pretty small inside; I'd say that there are about 12 tables so don't bring a huge group. It's a very casual restaurant where you order at the counter and pick up your own meal. The service is friendly, fast, and they do a great job preparing every meal perfectly and the food is always beautiful. The food is also always delicious. If you eat red meat, trust me, you want the steak wrap. You may want to pair it with the fattoush salad, it's ah-mazing. Like lots of fresh vegetables with some kind of delicious dressing that makes it amazing. Beware, the large salad is very large. My boyfriend and I were starving and split a wrap and large salad and had salad to spare. That meal set us back $20, but it was fresh, delicious, and we were both happily full after.  I also really like the chicken wrap, and am looking forward to trying the baklava.

55.description: First, the food here is really delicious and full of flavor.  We were really enjoying our entrees until we noticed some sanitation habits....it's not right and just gross.  On the night we were here, Alberto, the guy handling the phone, the register, and the money also handles the pitas and assembles some of the food with his phone-register-money fingers....how nasty!  Someone will eventually get really sick.  I think they need more help behind the counter...maybe someone only handling the phone and money.They store the baby high chairs in the bathroom.   We saw a server bring out a high chair from the bathroom for someone to use.  Later, when we went to use the unisex bathroom ourselves...there was a whole stack in there....jesus!  Would you want your child in one?  Would you sit in one....hell no.  Won't be back anytime soon to this particular location.

9.description: Definitely a better than average Mediterranean restaurant. Grabbed some take-out when I was in Chicago and staying the area. It was the day after some very hard partying and all that was needed was some comfort food that was healthier than junk food.Zaytune hit the spot with a delicious and huge falafel wrap. It was wrapped in bread that they made and would be better called flat bread than pita. I also ordered some homemade tasting baba ghanoush that was delicious and came with more flat bread. The bread really isn't like typical pita. It is much bigger and flakier and not as thick....and better. My wife had a falafel salad (unfortunately they were out of tabouli) which had romaine lettuce and tomatoes dressed with a tahini dressing and piled with falafel. She wanted some fries and I have to say that the fries here are some of the best ever, flavored with herbs and with a Mediterranean style dipping sauce that was better than the typical ketchup or aioli. So tasty! They also threw in some salsa that was good with a nice zing to it and came with homemade pita chips.This was so tasty and exactly what was needed. I will definitely eat here again if I am ever in the Bridgeport area. The portions are also quite big so we ended up saving half of it and enjoying a second meal out of it.

26.description: I've ordered from here a couple times, but today me and my dad went and ate out on there patio. The food was amazing, the staff was super friendly and the patio is so cute. Check this place if you are ever in the neighborhood :)

25.description: We have yet to have a bad experience here.  Great "fast food" Mediterranean.  The wraps are the way to go ... much better value than the platters.  My husband and I usual order one and split it.  Herb french fries are delicious!  Always nice and crispy and served with a wonderful kalamata olive dip.  Red pepper humus is also a must have.  Fresh made pita served with the wraps and humus have just the right softness and chew and hold up to the ingredients in the wraps.  Down side is the place is small and you have to clear your own tables.

12.description: This place can get real busy at lunch particularly at noon.  The steak and chicken shawarma are great. The pita is made fresh on site daily, by order when they are run out and they are phenomenal.  Its a nice little quick service place that has some great healthy options.  Everyone I bring there unfamiliar with Mediterranean food loves it. Dont forget to try the hot sauce.

59.description: I came here on an off afternoon when I was early for an appointment. I had the lamb grill wrap and it was definitely well made. The tastes mix well though the lamb did have the smell that only lamb has. To do them credit, they had flavoured it well with the marinate. I didn't know if I wanted the fava bean soup so they were kind enough to give me a taste, it was well made and lemony but rather forgettable. I would say this is a little diner for quick food, in and out and carry out options. The food seems fresh and healthy but I wouldn't stay here for dinner. I give props to the wait staff for being good with service and making recommendations but the food is strictly ok. Given the area, it's the one quick fresh grab and go spot in the vicinity. That being said, they did take a good 5 mins to make the wrap so you know it's not been sitting on some counter

21.description: Tried Zaytune on a Tuesday night. The atmosphere is cozy. The service is fast. And the food is amazing! I had the chicken shawarma wrap, humus and the seasoned fries. Everything was delicious! Will be going back very soon.

17.description: We found this place by accident on a Monday night looking for a place to get some fast food. We found a hidden gem instead. The menu is very simple. You pick either a salad or wrap and your choice of meat. We had the humus, falafel, steak schwarma Salad and chicken shwarma wrap. All of the food items were fresh and delicious. This was some of the best Mediterranean food I have had anywhere. The prices are a steal for the quality that you get. The only minor downside is the slow service, but they were slammed when we got there. Overall I give this place 5 stars for quality versus price.

10.description: Pros: food is delicious and freshly prepared. Cons: the visible hygiene of the prep process is sketchy at best. On my most recent visit I witnessed the worker who prepares the bulk of the food stop, answer the phone, write down an order, then return to assembling the orders (salads/wraps) without any involvement of gloves or hand washing. If you weigh these pros/cons this location is somewhat of a gamble. After about a dozen visits I won't be rolling the dice again.

5.description: Another gem in Bridgeport! So simple yet so delicious. Great price for the amount of food you get. Parking around the area is easy (and free!). Honestly what could be better then yummy, affordable priced food, at a convenient location?! I got the braised lamb salad, and really enjoyed it. The meat was very flavorful and definitely got a lot of it!

3.description: The food was surprisingly delicious. We ordered the herb fries with two wraps one chicken and the other braised lamb. The herb fries were perfectly seasoned where it was not overpowering your taste buds. The sauce was an olive dipping sauce aka "awesome sauce" that provided the perfect balance to the herbs. I only wish they offered more fry sauce since the bag of fries is big enough for two people. The wraps were huge. My wrap was the length of a chimichanga packed with meat and veggies. The meat was properly seasoned. Each wrap has its' own spicy sauce to drizzle on your wrap. This place gives off the vibe of Mediterranean fast food or in other words "local gyro hut". If you need something quick and tasty to eat this place would be perfect. This restaurant would not be ideal for a romantic date night can you say #epicfail. One of the guys working behind the counter thought it was wise to clean storage counters while orders were being prepared. I am not sure how I feel about that. BTW we did not develop any food related issues. Cheers!

35.description: I've been going to this place since they opened the doors years ago. It's still as good as ever. My only complaint is that I wish I could get over there more often.  The staff is super friendly and always remembers my name. One of the best places to eat in the BP.

19.description: Not impressed at all. Prices must have gone up. The shwarma meal was like 12 or 13 bucks. So I got a chicken shwarma wrap and fountain drink. Still spent like 12 bucks. What a rip off. Food was ok but not for that price. Won't be back. Can't always trust yelp reviews.

28.description: I had been wanting to check out Bridgeport for a while and when I looked up lunch spots, this one looked great. I came in with a friend around 1:30 on a week day. It wasn't too busy, but a few people came and went as we sat outside for an hour and a half and chatted and ate. Both my friend and I decided on the GRILLED STEAK SHAWARMA wrap and we split some of the Herb Fries with Kalmata sauce. Both were incredible. Seriously, incredible. I couldn't finish all my wrap so I brought it home and had it for dinner...still just as good! The wrap itself was excellent; the meat was tender and juicy and the marinade on the meat was delicious. I can't wait to come back!

45.description: I'm so pleased with my food that I'm writing this as I eat. Great food , good portions and reasonably priced. My options are limited around the office but this is a welcomed change from the usual Bridgeport eats.

33.description: I had about 45 minutes before an appointment to pick up keys for a new apartment I was getting in the area. I ordered a SINGLE lamb grill wrap to eat in at the restaurant (which had no other customers at the time) and then planned to head over to my appointment afterwards. 5 minutes later a couple comes in and starts their order which included a two salads and 2 shawarmas. The couple got everyone one of there menu items first before my single order (mine took almost 20 minutes). Since I didn't have time to eat in anymore I quickly changed to have the food to go and I would eat when I got home after I picked up the keys. I got home almost an hour later and opened my food to find that they gave me a salad. There were literally only two sets of orders and they still managed to mess it up and give me the other couple's salad. I hope the other couple enjoyed my lamb wrap because I did not enjoy their stupid salad. I hate that this restaurant is going to be so close to where I'm going to live now....

43.description: Everything is fresh grilled and incredible. I even like fries again...I'd go with the salad bowl half chicken half steak.

2.description: Just had some great take out.  Roasted red pepper hummus dip that came with plenty of pita.Very good Steak Shawarma Platter with rice and a couple of dipping sauces.  Also got the 3 piece dessert.  Only thing listed so we thought we'd try it out.A little pricey but I'd order again.

18.description: Yesterday was my first time here and it was fantastic! My mom and I order the Grilled chicken wrap with a side of fries. The amount of food you get is definitely worth every dollar. My God!! Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu

41.description: WOW. I can't believe I haven't written a review of this amazing place. It doesn't look like much, but the food packs a punch. Not the easiest place to get to without a car, but worth the drive and effort. A gigantic wrap with homemade flat bread (you see them making it behind the counter!), fresh veggies, well-seasoned protein (meat, lamb, shrimp, kafta, chicken, or falafal) served with a delicious condiment on the side. The food is consistent each and every time. I like going to a place that you know exactly what to expect.

52.description: I originally was very happy this restaurant opened in Bridgeport.  Granted, the food is still basically good.  Unfortunately, when I ordered the Chicken shawerma grill platter, I noticed what tasted like regular rice with butter instead of  basmati rice.  The portions have been cut in half for the salad bowl and grill platter in addition to the prices increasing.   I thought this would be the start of a great restaurant(s).   Now, it's like so many of the other restaurants in Chicago.  I doubt I'll go back.

50.description: This place is THEBOMB! It's so fresh, so delicious and is a great option if you're avoiding carbs which I sometimes am! The steak and chicken are grilled order and the shawarma  are amazing in any option! They have wraps (in their soft, pillowy, grilled flatbread) and salads. They also have all the usual sides for Mediterranean- hummus, lentil soup, etc. The falafel is on point and is another option for the wraps. They also have fries done with a Mediterranean flare. I haven't tried them yet though.Price point is fair, but be warned, there's a $10 minimum for card.

4.description: I was a long time patron of Zaytune's until today.  I purchased a large hummus to go on 2/12/16,  and after my first few bites bit down into something hard which I thought was an olive pit.  I was shocked to find it was a piece of glass!  I saved the remaining hummus and the glass.  I contacted the Bridgeport location the next day when they opened and they took my info.  2 days later I still had not been contacted.  I called another location on 2/15/16 and was able to be put in touch with the owner Daniel.  Daniel told me to stop by the Bridgeport location that evening to discuss the situation.  He didn't show up and spoke to me on the phone.  He told me they didn't use glass and insinuated that I put the glass in myself. I was never asked if I or anyone else was injured who consumed the hummus.  I was appalled at the lack of customer service and insinuation.  I have been  a loyal customer since 2009 and believe that the handling of the situation was extremely discourteous.  I will never give my business to establishments that show no concern for its patrons health and provide subpar service.

6.description: Think....Mediterranean style Chipotle. The prices are all very reasonable and you are going to get a decent amount of food. The servers are very helpful if you are trying to figure out what to order as well. I had the braised lamb wrap which was fantastic. Definitely will come again to try the other meats. Hummus was a bit creamier than I am used to but still good. Basically, bold flavors at a good price with a Mediterranean theme.

22.description: Seen the reviews and decided to try it out today. They have great grilled chicken breast wraps and herb fries.

15.description: I came here on an off afternoon when I was early for an appointment. I had the lamb grill wrap and it was definitely well made. The tastes mix well though the lamb did have the smell that only lamb has. To do them credit, they had flavoured it well with the marinate. I didn't know if I wanted the fava bean soup so they were kind enough to give me a taste, it was well made and lemony but rather forgettable. I would say this is a little diner for quick food, in and out and carry out options. The food seems fresh and healthy but I wouldn't stay here for dinner. I give props to the wait staff for being good with service and making recommendations but the food is strictly ok. Given the area, it's the one quick fresh grab and go spot in the vicinity. That being said, they did take a good 5 mins to make the wrap so you know it's not been sitting on some counter

57.description: My advice is to call in and order then pick up because every time I walk in to order for carry out as lunch it takes a long time. I usually order several items (wrap, platter) but I feel like by the time I get the food and eat it, it's already cold waiting for the entire order to be ready.

20.description: I love the lentil soup and the falafel sandwich (make sure you put their salsa on it!). The service is friendly and efficient. I've never had any of the meat dishes.

36.description: We found this place by accident on a Monday night looking for a place to get some fast food. We found a hidden gem instead. The menu is very simple. You pick either a salad or wrap and your choice of meat. We had the humus, falafel, steak schwarma Salad and chicken shwarma wrap. All of the food items were fresh and delicious. This was some of the best Mediterranean food I have had anywhere. The prices are a steal for the quality that you get. The only minor downside is the slow service, but they were slammed when we got there. Overall I give this place 5 stars for quality versus price.

14.description: Nice place, friendly cooks and good food that won't break the wallet. Had the stake wrap a d Falafels very good! Cook recommend I get the herd fries next time.

3.description: I left unsatisfied. While alcohol is available, it is often of middling quality at best.

1.description: When I leave Maria's and a person says "come on over " on yer way south you might be skeptical. But here it's utopian in a dot communist way. You will feel the vibe of random community and uncertainty. You will see tiki lights on the stoop . You will see mike, a beautiful human who wants people to visit his stoop and enjoy the night.Thanks mike

2.description: This has got to be the best stoop in area. Just find Mike and some alcohol and stay a while.

0.description: I never thought I would go out of my way to drink on a stranger's stoop. But Mike is no stranger.A++, would stoop again

12.description: Don't let the location fool you. Their breakfast has saved me in the midst of a hangover from hell. Their staff was really friendly (obviously knowing that I was hungover, they offered me some water while my food was being finished up). Go for the Fiesta Skillet or the B&G. Also, the first time I ever ordered delivery, the guy showed up with my food within 20 minutes!

7.description: Great food!!!.....and my favorite breakfast place ........ They have the best blueberry crepes!  The owner, Venera, and her workstaff are all great..... Kind and courteous! with wonderful waitresses especially Julie and Nancy.....not to mention the cleanliness!!!!

20.description: This restaurant "Harvey's" is new to this location. It replaced a 20+ year established "Stages" Restaurant. So let's compare: I was there for breakfast.  it's clean like Stages. The food was good and plentiful as before. The wait staff is mostly the same. The booths are a little less comfortable but ok. I'd recommend giving it a try. One Glaring difference is the lack of friendliness by the host. No warm smile or "Hello"  upon entering as before. He just looks at you and says "how many" . :(   Almost like he doesn't want to be there.

19.description: Walked in, guy in front was too busy on his phone to look up and welcome me. The soup was so thick it could be used as paste and very bland, salt and pepper did not help. The sandwich I got was on the wrong bread, dripping with grease and the meat was  so fatty I could barley chew it.  The waitress was very nice about, however I will not go back.

1.description: This place is next to a gas station so yes it's a hidden GEM. I like the great service from when you walk in the door. I have only did carry out.  But my breakfast is always just like I like it and I have all my condiments. And plenty of napkins.I sometimes have a cup of coffee  and it's pretty good. I really like the pancakes and sausage with hash browns with over easy eggs.But soon I will try other things on the menuSo if you are looking for breakfast on the go or have time to set and relax then this is the place to go. Happy Customer

2.description: I Have Now Only Ordered From, "Here",  Just a Few Times Now and Just Simply Put.  "Excellent Breakfast Food For The Right Price"!

9.description: We were staying in a hotel that had no restaurant but the girl at the front desk suggested Harvey's nearby. We are glad we went. My wife had a veggie omelette with a side order of apple, raisin pancakes. She says the pancakes were the best she has ever had. The omelette was enormous.I had a meat-lovers skillet. Again, it was very tasty and way more than I could eat. We both took doggie bags back to the hotel.We loved our waitress. She did the little things a good waitress does without us asking, like bring extra napkins, bring a plate of lemons for our ice water. We thoroughly enjoyed chatting with the owner, a young lady formerly of Albania.  She and her husband bought the restaurant a year ago and I sincerely hope they succeed. Next time we are in Chicago, we will look forward to a return to Harvey's.

6.description: Got takeout and the sausage gravy was cold. Bummer. Staff was nice though.

18.description: It just opened recently. My Moms been raving about it. The waitress needed some training. She asked if we knew the specials and either did she. My Mom asked for cream for her coffee. We didnt get it until after dinner came out. The steak sandwich was decent. Nothing fancy. Steak of course was bigger than the bread. Ordered it medium was more on the medium well side. Hash browns were good.  Owner came by and said hello to my Mom. He was very friendly and neighborly. I have mixed emotions about this place. Perhaps it will be better in time but it definitely was better than the old place that it replaced. Giving it a 3 more on the potential.

10.description: Don't expect good service here.  It's a neighborhood greasy diner that serves simple fare. Great for breakie.

13.description: If I could give zero stars for thievery, I would.So I placed an order through Grubhub for breakfast as I was home sick for the day, and I really wanted a piece of pie. (Pie cures all illnesses, amiright?) They called to tell me that they didn't have the pie, so I told them I wanted to cancel the order all together. When they originally called, I didn't make it to the phone, and the message I received was, "Rachel, we don't have pie. Call me back." Weirdest and least professional message ever. (No greeting? No mention of who's calling? No call back number?) But it's a diner, so whatever. When I called back, I told them (politely, mind you) that I wanted to cancel the entire order. The lady rudely responded with, "Over pie?! OH-KAY!" and hung up before I had a chance to say anything else. Yeah, bia, I wanted pie, you don't have it, so I'll order from elsewhere. No need to be rude and shaming of my personal pie decisions.Well, I followed up with Grubhub today because I didn't trust the lady with the rude, rude demeanor and I never received a cancellation message from Grubhub or the restaurant. Well, I guess homegirl "conveniently forgot" to let Grubhub know and decided to keep the money for Harvey's.Maybe this was, in fact, an accident, but given her unbelievably condescending and rude phone behavior to a customer, I question her choices.

16.description: This restaurant "Harvey's" is new to this location. It replaced a 20+ year established "Stages" Restaurant. So let's compare: I was there for breakfast.  it's clean like Stages. The food was good and plentiful as before. The wait staff is mostly the same. The booths are a little less comfortable but ok. I'd recommend giving it a try. One Glaring difference is the lack of friendliness by the host. No warm smile or "Hello"  upon entering as before. He just looks at you and says "how many" . :(   Almost like he doesn't want to be there.

17.description: Give them time. Was there last week. Kitchen was unorganized, fries were cold. Our soup came out and 2 seconds later our sandwiches did.

15.description: Best breakfast in town. Everyone is so nice and the owner is so sweet. Tried their steak skillet and it was amazing and pricing is reasonable. Tried them for dinner cause I'm sick of Freddie's and their short ribs and salads are incredible. I would recommend this to place to everyone. The hosts are sweet, the place is beautiful compared to what is was. Will see them a few times a week, there that good.

0.description: Great food and service! This place is priced right too. I will eat here again anytime I am in Chicago !

5.description: It's a good hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Located right in the gas station lot, this inconspicuous restaurant houses groups of people for breakfast throughout the day. I've had their pancakes which was delicious. I had to remove the huge scoop of butter though. I've also had their gyros with fries and soup. The soup will fill you up alone. The gyros were seasoned just right. This is my local breakfast place. It's great.

11.description: This place is horrible, the misleading recommendations or five stars ratings are not the best guides.  Simply try it for yourself, but start with a cup of coffee , if you don't agree that it tastes like water then proceed.  I had bad experience here, as a restaurant owner myself I'm not easily fooled.  I took my family and upon entry there was a gas smell, the owner said it was because of the  gas station next door.  Bad answer and lie, because if is the case  then  you'll  always taste gas as you eat.  It wasn't the gas station next door, from experience one of the gas hoses tore and leaked gas.  The coffee was more like water with coffee flavoring, service was as bad as these positive reviews.  There is more but I don't bore with details.  We ended up walking out but still charged $2/cup of crap coffee plus tax after a bad experience.

8.description: While my omelet was delicious, i didn't really like the way my food was delivered. It was warm when it got here, but the packaging was awful. My crepes were put at the bottom of the bag instead of in the box and it was squished. They also just threw rolls and english muffins into the bag with silverware and jellies. And seeing as how i got hashbrowns.. you would think they would add salt, pepper, and ketchup. Won't be ordering from here again..

3.description: This place is located next to a gas station, so at first, my friends & family were weary when I brought them here for breakfast.... they quickly realized what an excellent breakfast establishment this is!!!! We have been here for breakfast countless times now and every single person has loved their food and couldn't stop commenting about what a gem this place was. Before tailgating for Bears games, we now come to Harveys for breckie to fill our bellies with goodness before the game. We've had countless flavors of pancakes, waffles, and french toast. The omelets and skillets are to die for. The wait staff is always kind, the place is alwaus clean, and our bill is always so low compared to the amount of food eaten!!On lazy weekends, we sometimes order for takeout, and the experience is just as well. Always give us extra condiments and food is always still warm when we get home. This spot is a wonderful family restaurant & now part of a Bears family tradition :)

14.description: Visited for breakfast and glad we did! Friendly staff, hearty breakfast, yummy french toast and reasonable prices! We Will be back! Glad we tried the hidden gem by the gas station!

4.description: This place is a joke. I call to order my food and the person who answered asked me to hold, So she puts the phone down then hangs it up 2 minutes later. I call back and order my food and it took over an hour to get here and they forgot something on my order. Never again will i eat here.

58.description: I have tried many many pizza places in Chicago and Linas is by far the best pizza in the city.  Not a place to dine in but deivery or carry out can't be beat!!

56.description: Great place! Prime pizza spot for me in a city with a lot of choices. Great value and makes for the best cold pizza I've ever had.

29.description: I moved to Bridgeport approaching on a year ago and I haven't had the need to order pizza until yesterday when me and my boyfriend had a gathering at the house.  He advised me to find a 5 star pizza place (he's such a comedian). Anyway when I moved in my landlord told me how great Phil's was so my first thought was to order from there however after reading the reviews on Yelp I was quite skeptical.  I decided to try Lina's because 1) it was the closest to my house and 2) unlike Phil's they take CC payments.  We ordered a jumbo pizza, which is the biggest size.  We had Half pepperoni and sausage and the other half just cheese.  This pizza was delicious.  I think the sauce is what does it for me.  Generally my pizza limit is 2 slices but I had several slices last night.  My guest thoroughly enjoyed it too. I thought since the jumbo is pretty darn big that we would have extra slices for leftovers.  Nope! Not a chance!  4 people demolished that pizza.  Good job Lina's.  I look forward to doing business with you again in the future.

42.description: I love Lina's pizza.  I live right down the block.  It's delicious and they are always really nice.  Only one time my order was a little different than I ordered and right away they offered to make another pizza or give me credit.  It was no biggie, but great customer service.  The only reason I don't give a five is because my favorite pizza is Barraco's but they don't have that around Bridgeport other than that I love the cheeziness of Lina 's yummy.  Their thin crust is good.  I hate when places have too much dough and Lina's does a great job of making a nice crust without feeling super full (unless u eat tooo much).

23.description: eh.. i thought the pizza was just ok..there's much better choices around the area.. to me the pizza felt sloppy.. everything just falls apart  and i hate that... i do give it 3 stars because the service was great... really nice friendly ppl working there.ill probably come back to try their sandwiches or something nice time.

47.description: Absolute worst delivery experience of my life. Always thought there pizza was decent. But tonight, after waiting 1 hour and 25 minutes for a cold pizza and fries that were so uneatable I literally just put them right in the garbage, I find that the pizza wasnt even done right. After the lady says, sir we are extremely busy. If your too busy to put out eatable food from a restaurant it's time to rethink things.

8.description: New ownership? And/or new pizza baker's? I don't know, but there's been a change, still friendly and a great price, however the last couple of pizzas were too salty and saucy. The amount of sauce on it had the cheese sliding off. No one likes a dry pizza, but having sauce drip off the slices is too much. I guess I'll take a Lina's break for now and check back later.

31.description: I have enjoyed the food and service from Lina's for many, many years.  So it was a big surprise to the crappy service.It all started when I used grub Hub to place my order as I have many times before.  When picking up my order the total charge rang up 82 cents more than my Grub Hub receipt. So rather than honoring the price I agreed to when placing the order, they wanted to give me a two dollar credit for next time.  Sorry but I rather just pay what I own and go on my way, which in the end is what happen.The owner/manager that was there was "too busy" to come to the front of the counter to take care of a long time customer. And the kicker is that my order was not 100% correct. Not sure what has happen to this place but they have lost my business.

34.description: customer alert!! i just checked the web and the special today is the jumbo pizza for $15. i called and ordered a pizza and they are saying it is a web error!! the specials are changed for 2014 and they cannot honor pricing without owner approval and they cannot reach him!!!!! don't check the web check fb...............this must be a first!

16.description: I used to order pizza from here all my life I am 29 years old I grew up eating pizza from here about 2 weeks ago I had ordered a pizza and it was not fully cooked I called and explained to them what had happened they told me that they were going to put a credit on my account so I said ok at least they're trying to make up for it today I call to try and use my credit and they had told me there's no credit on my account and I haven't ordered pizza from there in over a year which was untrue i order pizza from there probably every other week I just find it that if you're trying to satisfy a customer I didn't ask you to bring me a brand new pizza I threw it in the oven and waited here at my house for it so I figured by you credited my account but that was okay because accidents do happen but when I call to place an order and use the credit that they told me would be put on my account it was not there the girl on the phone was very rude she didn't want to help me and I will no longer be going there

13.description: I went on a late night pizza run. You can order thin crust pizza by the slice or a whole pizza. The pizza is melty and cheesy. The tomato sauce is just right for my taste buds. The ice lemonade is creamy, and since I like sour things, I thought the ice lemonade was good. The staff is nice and the service is pretty good. I think it's good for late night cravings, drunken nights, or homebody nights.

11.description: Finally got around to trying this place out. I placed a to go order with their buy one get one half off deal.Sausage & Mushroom Pizza - The pizza was okay....and that was it. Wasn't great and wasn't bad. It was kind of bland to me. Didn't really even notice the mushroom in it. Cheese Fries - Nothing special.Breaded Mushroom - Crunchy and good.They had a little problem with the ordering, but they were so nice.Not my first choice, but I'll probably order again.

39.description: Don't judge Lina's pizza by it's storefront, it's quality pizza at low prices. Some co-workers and I had their pizza one day for lunch and it made a great meal. All the toppings we requested (pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, olives) were fresh and plentiful. Definitely a decent pizza option while in Bridgeport.

37.description: Why wouldn't you want tasty pizza for cheap? Got it through GrubHub and the stuff was delicioso! Can't wait to order more soon, and try more options on the menu. For non-Chicago style pizza, this place is almost as good as it gets.

0.description: MMMMMM!!! Great pizza, but the breaded steak sandwich here is the greatest in Chicago! It's delicious. Get that with the cheese fries. The staff is also very helpful, not to mention hilarious.

38.description: Lina's serves some of the best pizza in the area. I tried this place as I'm still in search of a go-to spot for my pizza needs considering my favorite closed down this year. The prices are dirt cheap considering the pizza you get. It's salty, greasy and everything I want in a thin crust pizza. The mozzerella sticks, a bit of an impulse buy, were amazing! I love it when an impulse buy comes through. The sauce was thin and really gave a nice flavor - I could eat those daily.The inside is a complete dive which is how pizza places should be. Eating in isn't really an option here. But I really liked Lina's and their mozzerella sticks. I'll definitely be ordering these again. I'm happy to report that Lina's and Phil's both serve tasty South side pizza. But I'm still in search of something more.

51.description: Lina's is great- love their pizza, good prices, fast delivery- good appitizers too! I usually just eat cheese pizza, but their Italian Beef/Cheese pizza is AWESOME!!!

27.description: Came here for lunch when I got a calzone craving. It's not on their menu but they will make one for you. I decided to spare myself a week's leftovers and go for a slice of veggie pizza instead. It came out to less than $4. I'm not very knowledgeable about pizza but I think it was thin crust. The slice was very large, maybe 1/6 of a 16" or 18" pizza. I thought the sauce to cheese ratio was a little low because I love me some pizza sauce. However, I was very impressed with how evenly the veggies - mushrooms and green peppers, maybe something else - were distributed, both over the pizza and in the cheese. I (perhaps alone) always found it frustrating to eat a slice of saucy dough, then the remaining pile of vegetables and cheese on my plate. The greasiness was actually tolerable on pizza terms, not running down my hands or anything. Service was prompt and not overly affectionate. I will return if I am craving pizza.

32.description: I absolutely love Lina's, the service is great the staff is always friendly! This pizza is the best in the neighborhood to me!!

54.description: Really, really good pizza. Now, in the interest of full disclosure: My co-worker and her husband own the place, but I'd never had the chance to try it.Today she had him bring in a few pizzas as a treat for our office, one of which was tomato, spinach and garlic. The ingredients all tasted really fresh, which made an impact on me. Garlic was paper-thin and sliced this morning; the tomatoes were fresh and ripe and flavorful. For me, what really made this pizza fantastic was the garlic. I don't know what the deal is with fresh garlic on pizza, but in my hometown the pizza places stopped offering it altogether (maybe it's the price, as I think a few of those take-and-bake places would add it if you brought it to them). The garlic on this pizza was so good, it's making my mouth water thinking about it. Not at all overwhelming, and with the fresh tomato slices it had the perfect balance. I also didn't ever really consider myself a big fan of spinach, so I'm glad he decided to throw these ingredients together on the pizza.I'm disappointed that we didn't know this place existed (at least, those in my old office), because I would have loved to have this instead of having to suffer through Connie's pizza for four years. I'm pretty pleased that it's near work, because now if I want pizza to take home it's a tiny detour on my way to the north side. In fact, I was craving pizza just the other day and beyond Gino's (deep dish gets old) or Barnabys (not a HUGE fan of pizza that thin), I'm not sure where is a good place so I just scrapped the pizza idea altogether.  It's also good to know there are one or two places in Bridgeport I can count on for a great lunch when I feel like heading out.

48.description: I had high hopes for Lina's after reading the reviews. This looked like a place where I could get a great traditional Chicago thin-crust pie. When it was delivered I was really excited-- it was packaged in a bag with the cardboard base just like all of my favorite South Side pizzerias. I thought I had found a local replacement for Just A Pizza. My anticipation quickly turned to disappointment. As soon as I opened the bag I knew this pizza was going to be awful. There was so much cheese that it was inedible. The sauce tasted like Contadina tomato paste. The crust was fine. I had two slices and threw the rest out. It was terrible. The only reason Lina's gets 2 stars is because it is not as bad as Taylor Made (although I'd never order either again).Until further notice, Salerno's is the king of pizza for the near west and near south sides.

44.description: We used to order every week from this place, but after experiencing the worst customer service - I AM NEVER ORDERING AGAIN. I can get a good pizza with better service at another place.

24.description: Go out out your way for their pizza!  Wow, sausage thin crust pizza was Really really awesome! Love the crust, nice and light and crispy, but not hard. Fresh taste, flavorful sauce, cheesy, and good amount of yummy sausage. This is BETTER  than the Lou Malnatis and Ricobene's pizza I've had.  My kids Had the fruit punch Italian lemonade... loved it! Great service from new girl Kristin! She was friendly and knowledgeable. I want more pizza now!Good for takeout, two tables for dining. They should make use of the front corner and put out tables and chairs.

7.description: Be wary of placing an order via ChowNow, the GrubHub-like service that's featured on their website from the "Click to Order" button.This evening, I ordered a jumbo pizza via ChowNow and, an hour after placing the order, felt a growing concern that my request never reached the restaurant, so I called to check in on it.The woman who answered the phone informed me that my order had been deleted from their online queue, thus they hadn't started cooking it. The natural follow-up question, of course, is "Why didn't you call to tell me this?" but the conversation was derailed as she explained how busy the restaurant is and how I could either get a full refund or receive my pizza in about an hour (this was after she promised they would "rush" the pizza to me).She then proceeded to say that they could place a "credit" on my account, without explaining what that means. I followed up on that idea, hoping she was trying to lessen my annoyance by offering a perk, but no, she repeated that my pizza wouldn't be ready for about an hour and pushed the idea that I could cancel my order if I'd like.Anyway, despite all of this trouble, I decided it would be more a hassle to cancel the order and find another nearby pizza place than to just let this happen.In the end, if all goes well (hah), the pizza will arrive roughly 2.5 hours after my original order.

49.description: LIna's Pizza is a completely no-frills pizza joint.  They serve typical Chicago thin crust ("Cal City style"), which will satisfy any pizza craving.  It earns extra points for being within walking distance from me.The sauce is a tart and slightly acidic, and there is always a generous layer of super thick cheese.  The crust is always crisp, but it still has a nice chewy bite.  It is not too salty or too greasy.  Definitely order it well done.  I would not go out of my way to order from here, but it is a perfectly good option for thin crust pizza in Bridgeport.

40.description: Finally tried Lina's after living in Bridgeport for 8 years.  Our favorite pizza joints have been the other two places near here and they have sufficed for our family.  My kids are growing though, and have acquired their own tastes now and are always wanting to try different places.  We ordered from Lina's using a Sunday special my husband found somewhere.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The crust was thin, like we all like it (less carbs), and the taste was delicious.  Two thumbs up from the family.

53.description: So out of a need to try, and find new pizza joint in Bridgeport, I ordered from Lina's Pizza.They are located across the street from Zaytune's on Morgan street. I ordered the regular crust, sausage and mushroom cheese pizza. The crust was very good and the sausage was amazing! I liked the mushrooms I cannot tell if it was canned or fresh mushrooms because I ate too fast to dry and figure it out.They are cheaper to me than Phil's pizza which is located close to our residence. I plan to order from Lina's pizza again really soon.

30.description: This place was great. The Italian Beef was surprisingly good. I was planning on only eating half and saving the rest for later, but it was so tasty and meaty that I couldn't stop. It was gone before I knew it. The staff was super friendly and the girl at the front counter was pretty cute too, it's a win win if you ask me. Definitely a good place to go after a few beers at Maria's. I would definitely go back to this place if I was in the area.

46.description: Great pizza but order it with easy sauce!Great service!Great Monday night special - Jumbo pizza $15 (up to two toppings)!

1.description: I've ordered from Lina's for about a good 5 yrs before moving out of state. Once we moved back to Chicago, the 1st thing we did was order a pizza from there. Unfortunately, it happened to be the wrong pizza, that was delivered. When I called to let them know of the mistake, I was treated so rudely as if it were my fault. We even offered to take the pizza back instead of waiting an 1 1/2 hrs for a correct order to be remad & sent back. Upon arrival, there were 2 boyish looking women who had no customer service training, whatsoever. That was the first incident.     The 2nd time we ordered from Lina's, it was for pick up. We pulled up, my husband went in to pay & get our pizza seeing I had just had foot surgery that day & was returning fm the hospital. I gave him my debit card to pay. He went in & they gave him the hardest time. No buggy I thought since I was right outside. Went in, paid & went home. Got home to open up our dinner & come to find out our pizza was extremely burned on the bottom. So burned that me, a person who loves burned food, couldn't even eat it! When I called to let them know, I again was spoken to as if it was my fault. As I explained to the call taker that we'd return the pizza for a better cooked one, I was told I'd be receiving my $ back instead. I wasn't going for that. So, we took the old pizza back & asked for the owner or Mngr. a boyish looking woman w/black short hair & 1/2 shaved head became annoyed by the request & huffed & puffed at us. She let us know that if we didn't like the pizza we could go somewhere else. I let her know, as I showed her the burned pizza bottom, that we like Lina's, that's why we continue being long term customers. But, what we didn't like was being treated poorly by the employees and having constant issues w/incorrect orders being delivered as well as burned food. Needless to say, we received our correct remade order. The unfortunate part is, every time after that we've ordered, we've always received ignorance along with continuous cooking issues.      Today, we place an order for their, buy a jumbo get a medium for $2, deal & an order of cheese fries. We actually were completely hesitant because of prior issues and also because we've discovered Benny's Pizza on 18th St. Has won our taste buds. But, we were starving & Lina's is close to home. We even picked up the order. Get home to sit down & eat & of course, our order is screwed up...again. Our pizza was supposed to be 1/2 pep, 1/2 sausage. It was wrong! We call & again, the call taker gets an attitude w/my young daughter. Seriously, how hard can a pizza call takers job be? Every single time that we order, something is wrong w/our order. And, to make Things worse, cheese fries are actually just an order of fries w/a tiny container of cheese. They even got that part wrong!!! What was supposed to be cheese, was really ranch dressing. When we went back for cheese, seeing that we paid for cheese, upon entering, we got a laugh in the face by the employees when we brought the issue to their attention. We walked out of there extremely unhappy, no apology, got our cup of cheese and a credit for their mistake. Not even our $ back, but a credit! They'll take our $, screw up our order & then tell us that there's no way to refund our $ back for their mistake of an absent ingredient. UNFAIR PRACTICE!!      Basically, they're unfairly forcing us to commit to another purchase. We'll actually only purchase sodas/our credit. And, we will NEVER place another order from Lina's again. Besides, their recipes change drastically anyhow, the quality of the pizza hasn't been the same in a little time, the customer service sucks donkey balls & those 2 girls in the front of the dumpy house, are ass bags w/no personality. Why the owners choose to have them represent their business, I seriously don't know. Because it ruins the business & chases customers away. I'd been ordering from there at least 1-2 a week for the past 10 yrs & now to be treated like this, is bad for them because Benny's will be the family favorite from now on. Lina's will NEVER get another dime from us again.

55.description: This place was average. No negative, no positive - just average.

9.description: Moving to Bridgeport last fall, I thought I struck gold having such a great pizza joint half a block away...Things have changed...no more happy chatty southsider lady at the counter who guaranteed I'd be back after first time ordering from there...and she was right! The sauce, the crust, the prices....everything was great!Until apparently they turned over ownership to another member of the family ...no more jumbo deal on Mondays...The last pizza I ordered had tomato TOPS ....kinda gross...but just picked around....Tonight. .sausage, onion, tomato and garlic pizza... this onion that pulled out from taking a bite was gross...at least 3 inch span and was the onion layer you throw OUT because too rubbery...but...hey! Let's put it on a pizza and not even chop it down in bite size pieces! \o/It's like they lost the passion...they don't care anymore....I am sadly disappointed in what Lina's has become.

26.description: Had an almost 2 hour delivery on a recent Friday. Not cool. At least call. My opinion of the pizza doesn't change though.

25.description: Just had a half sausage, mushroom half tomato and it was good. Yelped area pizzas and linas came up so we gave it a try because it had been 2 hrs waiting on this other place to deliver so we cancelled. Good choice cause Linas hit the spot. Sweet sauce which i dont care for but it was delicious. Give it a try it wont dissapoint. Will order again. Prices are very reasonable too!

12.description: Their fries are the best in the neighborhood.  I wish Hamburger Heaven Express would use their fries...I usually go there for slices only,  there are so many better pizza places in the neighborhood...Phil's or Ricobene's for whole pies.  Their slices are only good if they are super fresh.  When they are fresh they're delicious.  When they're not, they kind of suck.  The slice holder does not keep the slices hot and they don't put them back in the oven for a reheat.  Often they run out of slices and don't keep alot on hand.  And finally, their slices are not cheap.  For the price of two slices you might as well order a whole pie from a better place.  They should really rethink their slice department.  They are the only place in the neighborhood for slices and if they tried harder they probably could have a brisker business.  I have ordered their stuffed pizza for pickup and once it was delicious and twice it kind of blew.  I want to say something not nice about the counter help, but you can decide for yourself.

59.description: I've been ordering from LIna's from the day she opened.  I do remember Lina.  She was a very nice lady, who worked hard.  Her pizza had the magic touch.  You knew ithe pizzas were made with love and hard work.  The pizzas are still good, though not quite like it, when Lina was still making them (she passed away numerous years ago).  We still order from Linas.  Feel they are the best pizza place in Bridgeport and south side.   Will be ordering one for dinner tonight.

21.description: thought i gave them a trial the other day. normally get pizza from connies or phils in Bridgeport. read some decent reviews on Lina's so i decided to give it a try. first impression when i went to pick my pizza, the place isn't the best looking then i was thinking omg hope the pizza doesn't taste as bad as the place looks. Got home and dive into the pieces. Got the sausage and mushroom. First taste impression was mediocre. I thought it was ok. After 3 small pieces, I was just forcing it. The dough wasn't completely cooked...awful. Only satisfactory about the pie was they gave you plenty of toppings. Too much cheese and the middle section, the cheese was so thick, it wasn't completely melted..,again awful. I will never go back. Sorry Lina's ..,train your chef how to properly bake a pizza...pretty simple task...buy pizza it at Phil's or spend a little more at Connie's, at least you get consistency.

17.description: I moved to Bridgeport approaching on a year ago and I haven't had the need to order pizza until yesterday when me and my boyfriend had a gathering at the house.  He advised me to find a 5 star pizza place (he's such a comedian). Anyway when I moved in my landlord told me how great Phil's was so my first thought was to order from there however after reading the reviews on Yelp I was quite skeptical.  I decided to try Lina's because 1) it was the closest to my house and 2) unlike Phil's they take CC payments.  We ordered a jumbo pizza, which is the biggest size.  We had Half pepperoni and sausage and the other half just cheese.  This pizza was delicious.  I think the sauce is what does it for me.  Generally my pizza limit is 2 slices but I had several slices last night.  My guest thoroughly enjoyed it too. I thought since the jumbo is pretty darn big that we would have extra slices for leftovers.  Nope! Not a chance!  4 people demolished that pizza.  Good job Lina's.  I look forward to doing business with you again in the future.

10.description: Delicious. Delicious! Everything was great. Price, delivery and if course the za. Will definitely be buying from now on.

5.description: After spending awhile out of town and not having time to buy groceries, my fiance and I decided that it was time to check out local pizza places. We didn't actually go to Lina's pizza, but ordered in. We ordered a stuffed cheese pizza, and it was delicious. The sauce was delicious and they certainly didn't skimp on the cheese! The delivery person was friendly and arrived within the time frame, and the pizza was still perfect. I always worry about ordering delivery with deep dish and stuffed, because it could either get soggy or it could start sticking to the top of the box on the drive over. Not a problem with this pizza. Also, since we usually get the biggest pizza any place offers -- we love leftovers -- we were concerned as to how it would save if we refrigerated it for a couple of days. We both thought it was even better the next day cold from the fridge.We will definitely be ordering from Lina's again.

3.description: Always got good pizzas from Linas. Pick up or delivery.  Pizzas are best! Even better prices! Keep up great work Linas.

35.description: Amazing pizza but haven't had it in years! Going down this weekend to get some!  My dad used to work here when I was a kid (he was helping out the owners cause they were friends) I remember being a kid in the back Lina and carmine giving me Italian ice..... Everyone speaking Italian, it just felt like home.... Truth south side Sicilian! (Sicilians we are the best!) anyways my am always ordered Phil's which is amazing as well but my dad would always bring a Lina's pizza home on Friday nights after work..... The sauce was to die for! The crust was that perfect crunch!  Man I miss this place! Every now and then my dad will throw down in the kitchen and make a "Lina's" pizza and ill come over but it's not the same!!!! Lol  I highly recommend this place it's good south side Sicilian American comfort food.....

19.description: Lina's is slow as hell, it's not uncommon to be waiting up to an hour after the estimated delivery time- and I only live 8 blocks away! But I continue to order from them because the pizza is good and their minimum delivery total is only $10 as opposed to $20 from other places. So I can't really complain since I keep ordering from them anyway.

28.description: Overall a very good pizza. I have been eating here for years and have never had a bad order.  I haven't tried anything but the pizza and would highly recommend to all that want to try something new. This truly is one of Bridgeport's best.

45.description: My response to Steve of Linas Pizza:  You did not communicate with me, I called YOU. Your restaurant knew I'd been calling about my order and they didnt attempt to contact you and give me a call back? My phone was obviously working. You Never offered a new pizza and I recieved no refund or e-mail, I had to e-mail grubhub to get the refund and I have the transcripts of the conversation I had with the Rep. With the service you gave me I would like for you to at least have the courtesy of NOT calling me a LIAR.

33.description: Finally got around to trying this place out. I placed a to go order with their buy one get one half off deal.Sausage & Mushroom Pizza - The pizza was okay....and that was it. Wasn't great and wasn't bad. It was kind of bland to me. Didn't really even notice the mushroom in it. Cheese Fries - Nothing special.Breaded Mushroom - Crunchy and good.They had a little problem with the ordering, but they were so nice.Not my first choice, but I'll probably order again.

43.description: Lina's Pizza has quickly become the go-to choice for delicious, thin crust pizza in my office. The ingredients are always fresh, and the balance between the amount of sauce and cheese is perfect, which may be more important to me than to others, but for me, too much sauce can easily ruin a pizza, but the folks at Lina's have the balance worked out perfectly. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and  we have never encounter any difficulty in receiving our delivery order anytime we have ordered from this establishment. The food always arrives quickly and it is always hot and fresh. We recently used Lina's to cater a baby shower luncheon for one of our co-workers, and they were a pleasure to work with. We ordered their baked mostaccioli and Italian beef for the first time, and  it was great. Everyone really enjoyed the food. The restaurant has undergone some recent changes, including now being opened for lunch, which is great for me as I do not live nearby. Overall, this no-frills, mom & pop restaurant has the best pizza Bridgeport.  My favorite pizza to order here is with spinach, fresh garlic, mushrooms and onions. Makes me hungry just thinking about it!

2.description: The best pizza in the neighborhood. Their sauce is awesome and unlike a lot of pizza places around here they don't charge you an arm and a leg. It's got the classic Bridgeport charm-slightly dingy interior, Chicago accents a plenty. Their food is great, and its my go to pizza place now.

18.description: Go out out your way for their pizza!  Wow, sausage thin crust pizza was Really really awesome! Love the crust, nice and light and crispy, but not hard. Fresh taste, flavorful sauce, cheesy, and good amount of yummy sausage. This is BETTER  than the Lou Malnatis and Ricobene's pizza I've had.  My kids Had the fruit punch Italian lemonade... loved it! Great service from new girl Kristin! She was friendly and knowledgeable. I want more pizza now!Good for takeout, two tables for dining. They should make use of the front corner and put out tables and chairs.

41.description: This is going to be a short review:  It's not that they're bad, because they're not.  It's just pizza...kind of blah, and without it's own personality.  In short: they make pizza, not good, not bad, not memorable.I liked that the girl who answered the phone used terms of endearment with me, though; she kept calling me "Babe".

52.description: Best pizza in Bridgeport!

50.description: Lina's is so close to me that I wish I could love it. I get it every few months, in hopes that it has improved. Pizza is passable, but anything that involves their tomato sauce as a major feature (pasta, sandwiches, etc) is ruined by the flavorless, runny sauce. Pizza is relatively cheap and will do if I'm absolutely pressed for something close. It's not even quick- 40 minutes to pick up a small pizza on a thursday night! My advice is skip it.

4.description: I live really close to here, so it's very convenient for me. My roommate and I order from here all the time. The breaded mushrooms are good- I don't even like mushrooms very much and I like these. I always get a calzone and they are HUGE. Seriously, so big they barely fit in the box. They definitely don't skimp on the ingredients. They also always manage to get my roommate's weird, specific order right. Even chain places mess it up frequently but Lina's never has. Delivery is good and usually very quick. I will say that I wish they sold cans of pop. As of now they only have two liters. But still, very good. Definitely recommended.

6.description: Normally I have a picture to go with the review, BUT not this time.  I picked up a slice of sausage stuffed pizza and took it home like a gremlin.  It was HUGE and good.  The sauce is a little tangy and a little sweet.....really good and there were nice pieces of sausage.  Normally I do not like the crust on a stuffed but this was buttery - almost like there was a hint of cheese in it.  AND it was only 5 bucks!  Good deal.....

22.description: Delivery took almost a hour and a half. Their was a staple or wire in the pizza, I use to go this place a lot when I was a kid but never again.

15.description: Ordered a large sausage pizza. Was enough to feed 3 adults. Delicious sweet sauce but not as good as Palmero's 63rd.  Second best pizza place in Bridgeport compared to Phil's.

57.description: My husband and I were craving thin crust pizza last night and wanted to try some place new. We usually order from Rosatti's or Lou Malnati's and decided to try a neighborhood spot- not easy to find in the University Village-Pilsen area. Based on other reviews we decided on Lina's. It took about 1.5 hours for delivery but arrived hot and quite appetizing. The crust was very thin and crispy; just what we were looking for. The sauce was scarce and as a sauce hog I would have appreciated a few more laddles. They were generous with the toppings and possibly too generous with the cheese which as the pizza cooled turned rubbery. I thought the sausage was just OK and found myself picking some of it off and the green peppers were quite mushy. Despite all this we managed to nearly eat the whole pie. We were not disappointed nor were we thrilled with our choice. We are likely to order from here again but it won't be on our crave list.

20.description: Linas Linas why are you so yummy. When it comes to Chicago pizza of course everyone loves a good deep dish. But hey it's not all the time that you want Giordanos nor do you want to spend Giordanos money. Linas pizza is yummy, saucy and cheaper than ever priced pizza! Medium pizzas start at just 11$ and an extra large is 14$ how can you beat that deal? And wait just because the pizza is cheap doesn't mean it's not made with love!! It's delish!! $3 delivery and you'll still receive it hot and ready!! Just say YUM!

36.description: For the quality of my calzone, I would have given this 5 stars. However, that was the only great thing about my experience. I ordered a chicken parm sandwich, calzone and mozzarella sticks. My delivery time was 1 hour. However, an hour passed and I heard nothing. I called the restaurant and was told my order was on its way. I decided to wait another 20 minutes and my boyfriend called back. When he called, he only heard someone taking another order. At that same time our delivery finally arrived.My boyfriend ordered a chicken parm. Honestly, I'm not sure if there was any chicken in there. It was sloppy, soggy and stuck to the aluminum! We had mozzarella sticks which were good but not amazing. The marinara that came with them were a bit bland for my taste. The calzone though....AMAZING! It's really the only thing keeping this rating at a 3 instead of a 1. I'll definitely go back for another calzone and pizza, but I think I'll go pick it up instead.

14.description: Linas Linas why are you so yummy. When it comes to Chicago pizza of course everyone loves a good deep dish. But hey it's not all the time that you want Giordanos nor do you want to spend Giordanos money. Linas pizza is yummy, saucy and cheaper than ever priced pizza! Medium pizzas start at just 11$ and an extra large is 14$ how can you beat that deal? And wait just because the pizza is cheap doesn't mean it's not made with love!! It's delish!! $3 delivery and you'll still receive it hot and ready!! Just say YUM!

29.description: Where do you go when your five-year-old must have an R2D2 or for that matter a Punky Brewster action figure? Rather than keep the WONDER-filled eighties to ourselves my husband and I can safely watch any 70s or 80s show on YouTube (Luddites we have no converter box) without fearing we will not be able to provide our children the stuffed and [sic] plastiicized versions of TV characters we enjoyed. Quake has them. All of them, every last one....even ones I had forgotten like those knockoff Care Bears whose name escapes me now. Ten bucks get you the TV tray. For three dollars you can buy an R2D2 and  quiet a begging child with - that's the best bargain I have ever found!PSOn top of everything the owner threw-in a figure said five-year-old begged for. Right off the L too!

42.description: This place , I can really sink my teeth into. I am an uber toy freak , and am a hardcore child of all toys from the 80's. They have a tre' bitchin selection of older and newer Star Wars stuff , older and newer Transformers stuff , GI Joe and He Man stuff. If I had some more discretionary income , I would probably contribute greatly to the owners kids college fund. Sadly , I can't fathom spending a ton of cash on any 1 toy. They do have some cool bargain bins where if you are not too uptight about condition or missing parts and pieces, you can find some cool stuff. If you do have a need for a rare figure , and have a little cash to spend , you have a pretty good shot here.
