23.description: I don't even like action figures and I love this store!  I really don't even think YOU have to like action figures either to appreciate this place.  This store must contain every action figure ever made and then some...an action figure hoarders dream!  I may never buy anything from this store, but I just can't help going in there every once in a while...makes me smile.

47.description: I found this shop on my way to the Davis Theatre years ago.  They sell toys and collectibles, both new and used.  A lot of rare and vintage items make you feel nostalgic while you look around, a lot of items from 60's and 70's tv shows and movies can do that to you!

8.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE Quake!  Whenever I'm in Lincoln Square I always have to stop here even if I have no intention of buying anything.  My kids appreciate retro toys from my childhood and I always find cool things here that I wish or did have as a kid.  I haven't checked out their Schaumburg location yet but I'm in the West Suburbs so I will def make a trip there at some point.

31.description: The first time I went into this store I was on sensory overload. trying to take in every action figure crammed onto the shelves behind the register. A great selection of GI Joe and star wars figures. Don't be afraid to describe a toy you remember as a child to the dude there, he can usually point you in the right direction. For me it was starcom  miniature figures with magnetic feet that I was denied as a child.

34.description: Who doesn't love toys!!!  Especially if they bring back found memories before all of this pressure and responsibility of being an adult (ha!). I swear I get giddy when I walk in here and I'm like look at this and this and THIS!!! Then my friends are like shut up....and check out this and this.Quake has almost every single toy from the 80's & 90's for boys and girls. I want to by them all up but then I know that I would just be stuck with them in a box somewhere which is probably why my mean mommy threw them out to begin with. He-man, Thunder Cats, Transformers,  all of the ACTION FIGURES (not dolls) a boy or girl could want. Jem, Poppels, Rainbow Brite, all of the dolls a girl or... um boy could want. Every time I saw my Nana she always gave me a Poppel when I was little...I don't know why. But my G.I.Joe's would rip them open to get inside to keep warm like Luke Skywalker did and then they use to jump out as a surprise when Cobra was around......sorry sorry flashback. At least I didn't go into how my mother made me dress like Andy for Halloween one year from Raggedy Ann and Andy.So everything is really cheap here and owner is a very cool guy. Stop on by and have a blast from the past.

16.description: Amongst the many vices I collect, toys are pretty high on the list. I'm pretty eclectic in what I enjoy, but lately I've been having problems with a certain subsect of toy collecting - MIB/MIC - that's Mint In Box or Mint On Card.See, when I was growing up, my favorite shows were Batman The Animated Series and the original run of the Ninja Turtles. While there are tons of toys I'm more than happy to remove from their cards so that they can breath freely and move about on my shelves, action figures from those two shows tend to stay on the card if I can find them in such a condition - that is to say I have a hard time finding them in that shape at all.Enter Quake. Dave, the proprietor and sole guy on hand during shop hours goes out of his ways to accommodate requests (The Lady has a thing for mint on card figures from horror films - she requested The Somnambulist from The Cabinet of Doctor Caligari - Dave had somehow acquired it within two weeks and swiftly let us know it was in his possession and could soon be in her's). the Harley Quinn figure from B:TAS - the harder to find one - found it here. one of the Neutrinos from TMNT - here too.Dave keeps an exhaustive but well organized and well curated selection of toys and figures in his relatively small space - and he uses it well! The store is packed from literally floor to ceiling with mostly still on card or in box wares and for the more adventurous and less picky, he has large bins of used figures with scuffs and scratches for a couple bucks a piece.What I really appreciate though is Dave's particular attention to what each person who walks into his store is looking for. In my case, he knows my sweet tooth for anything from B:TAS as well as figures from the mid 80's Kenner produced DC Super Powers line (the holy grail of super hero toy lines!) and has made a point to set figures aside for me until I've been able to come in and pick them up.With service that personalized and selection that solid, how on earth can you go wrong? Besides being the only store of its kind and depth in Chicago (no other toy stores focus on vintage and out of production toy lines - just current stuff), it's just flat out a treasure to the city. Give this guy your business!

13.description: This place has everything. Action figures, games, collectible cards, all at reasonable prices (often better than eBay). The items are in great condition and new things come in all the time. It's easy to walkout of here with a toy or action figure you haven't seen since you were a child.

11.description: awesome is all I can say right now. Just go in and you'll see what I mean.  They guy who runs it even reminds me of the comic book guy in a way from the simpsons, you'll find all the old toys you remember as a kid and the owner should be the one on toy hunter,he's extremely knowledgeable

39.description: This is the greatest action figure and collectible store that i have ever encountered and i like action figures and collectibles so that is good. It is so stacked with magic that it is more or less a museum of good times and star wars figures. It also don't hurt that its in Lincoln Square and Lincoln Square kicks human butt. Take the time to dig through the loose action figure bins (4 for $10.00), for they can be a secret gold mine for overlooked toys of supreme importance to the world - i grabbed a Rocky III figure of the Fabulous Thunder Lips and an Over the Top stallone figure out of those bins and those figures are special and awesome and i like this store.

37.description: a time machine disguised as a collectibles store. every memory from your youth is stored here, ready to be reclaimed to replace what your mom sold at the garage sale or pitched to clear up space. but you're a big boy now, and if she never bought you that transformers lunchbox you wanted because brown bagging it was just as good, you can find it here and finally claim it as your own.

0.description: So many options for any budget. Huge variety. Spent well over an hour reliving my childhood and having a lot of fun picking out fun toys for my new desk. Will definitely be visiting here again and again!

38.description: I love this place. I cant go in without spending tons of money (thier prices are generallly reasonable compared to ebay and elsewhere). First time I walked in a Mazinga Shogun Warrior came home with me. I have a wall devoted to old toys at my house so this place is a haven. The guys that work there are real stand-up dudes, especially for a place where you would expect a snarky holier-than-thou comic book guy type. Just a little out of the way for me. Must plan a day to go and nerd out.

27.description: An eclectic kid-friendly toy and collectible store has something for everyone. Reasonable prices ensure that you will not only leave with something you like but something you can afford.The owner is nice to everyone who walks through the door and willing to let you touch and reminisce.Did I mention every inch of the store is covered in vintage and some modern toys? Check it out!

32.description: A lot of great stuff here. I love looking at the classic transformers. Sometimes overpriced but he gives you a good deal on a lot of things as well.

48.description: A fun stop.  As someone else mentioned, it's a little place, but it's packed to the rafters with action figures, dolls, lunch boxes, weird board games.... you name it.  Rainbow Bright, Welcome Back Kotter, Battlestar Galactica, M.U.S.C.L.E. Men.  I'm not a collector, so I don't know how it stacks up in that world, but I do know it's a fun place to duck into, have some nostalgic laughs and maybe buy something you used to have when you were a kid.

44.description: Great toy store. they have almost anything your looking for from old to new. I have known the owner of quake for years 10yrs almost and he by far has the best in toys in chicago.

24.description: What a fun shop!  I had a blast digging through the bins full of old, wonderful toys and seeing all the eclectic and silly things inside.  Definitely a wide variety of collectibles, but I was much more interested in the one-of-a-kind oddities.  The gentleman at the counter (the owner, I would imagine) was fun and polite and very cool.A lovely place - I'm glad to have stopped in on a whim. ^.^

7.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! I was working on a project which required a lot of toy guns and Dave (the owner) came through. Great guy. Great shop. A truly honest business. Lincoln Square's finest.

49.description: This store is one of a kind.  They have all kinds of stuff that most of us around 20-35 played with as kids, from GI Joes, to Star Trek to Star Wars action figures.  The store is fairly small, but it is well laid out to fit all kinds of toys and t-shirts inside.

40.description: Thanks quake for letting me buy-back the toys i blew-up all those years ago.  Jesus, I love this place.  I have to disagree with some reviews saying that the inventory never changes.  It always changes...people bring new items all the time, and take others away.  Thats why trips to this place are always different, always some old memory waiting.  I promise Quake, I will really try this time not to blow my toys up.  Too much.

30.description: went in and if I still blindly spent money on toys I would have been in heaven.  They had everything you could possibly want and not want from the 70's to today.  But it was really hard to find stuff in such a squashed location.  Cool store, but I don't if a trip out to Lincoln from Rogers Park would ever be worth it.

46.description: Quake Collectibles is the absolute embodiment of vintage. Nothing ever changes in this place from the proprietor's appearance, the selection of mostly old toys, the lunch boxes that line the highest shelves and even the one guy always sitting in the corner behind the counter surfing eBay. Always the same scene at Quake. I can't find it in myself to actually buy stuff here, I just browse and reminisce. They have all the classic GI Joe action figures as well as a surprisingly comprehensive Star Wars selection ranging from the old 80's Hasbro line all the way to the newer Power of the Force releases.   Another fun section is what I've dubbed The Island of Misfit Toys, basically a bin or two of action figures that have lost their way. Some are missing their limbs or head, others just a head without a body. If you ask nicely enough, the owner might just let you take a piece for free to complete that art school assignment of yours.

1.description: So what Matt W wrote nearly 10 years ago(wow it was that long ago), is accurate even today. Just one of those places I always forget about reviewing, but finally am now.I'm not a toy collector by any means, but it's fun to browse here just for the nostalgia factor of remembering toys from years ago. The prices seem oriented towards the toy collector's market, so I'm not sure if I'll buy a lot of things here if ever, despite that a few things tempted me if only I had more money. Owner is friendly, and they do sell random toy parts for whatever reason. I've never seen any other used/new/collector toy stores do that! Heck, I even saw vintage lunchboxes from the 70s-90s.I think Quake could use a slightly bigger storefront and maybe could expand into the storefront next door via knocking out the drywall between the neighboring storefronts, were the one next door ever becomes vacant? IMO, the aisles are a little tight to maneuver and felt a little cramped, due to the insane amount of toys I saw here. Otherwise, I enjoyed this store when I revisited, and dunno why I don't drop into here more often. That'll change, though. I'd also like to eventually visit their Evanston store(if not also Schaumburg, since that's more of a trek away for me), to see how it compares.

9.description: Don't go here when you're broke because you can get a lot of good, random stuff. The store is literally packed with old toys and collectibles. The good thing about this place was that everything was reasonably priced. Another bonus to the store is the great location. You're within walking distance of lots of cool stuff in Ravenswood.

26.description: This place is terrific..Its like being on a treasure hunt. If you take your time you'll fid something very cool at a great price. It is a little disorganized..but so much so that it adds to the charm. Go check it out!!

25.description: Where was this place when i was a kid?    It makes me angry that all the figures that i used to have are all here.  Plus, the ones that i wanted for so long were here!!!   Anyhow, I dig their selection of super-hero figures and their G.I. Joes.  The guy who was working there (is he the owner) was a very cool guy.  Tried to help me find some G.I. joes (Hahaha.. hey, there were a big part of my childhood), but his place was full of a lot of other stuff, that they were scattered around.   No matter, i had fun looking through my past figure by figure.   I am definitely coming back here again

12.description: Even if you're like me & you're not into collectible stuff, this is still a fun shop to pop into & look around. There was a case near the register that was piled with Star Wars action figures.

21.description: Amongst the many vices I collect, toys are pretty high on the list. I'm pretty eclectic in what I enjoy, but lately I've been having problems with a certain subsect of toy collecting - MIB/MIC - that's Mint In Box or Mint On Card.See, when I was growing up, my favorite shows were Batman The Animated Series and the original run of the Ninja Turtles. While there are tons of toys I'm more than happy to remove from their cards so that they can breath freely and move about on my shelves, action figures from those two shows tend to stay on the card if I can find them in such a condition - that is to say I have a hard time finding them in that shape at all.Enter Quake. Dave, the proprietor and sole guy on hand during shop hours goes out of his ways to accommodate requests (The Lady has a thing for mint on card figures from horror films - she requested The Somnambulist from The Cabinet of Doctor Caligari - Dave had somehow acquired it within two weeks and swiftly let us know it was in his possession and could soon be in her's). the Harley Quinn figure from B:TAS - the harder to find one - found it here. one of the Neutrinos from TMNT - here too.Dave keeps an exhaustive but well organized and well curated selection of toys and figures in his relatively small space - and he uses it well! The store is packed from literally floor to ceiling with mostly still on card or in box wares and for the more adventurous and less picky, he has large bins of used figures with scuffs and scratches for a couple bucks a piece.What I really appreciate though is Dave's particular attention to what each person who walks into his store is looking for. In my case, he knows my sweet tooth for anything from B:TAS as well as figures from the mid 80's Kenner produced DC Super Powers line (the holy grail of super hero toy lines!) and has made a point to set figures aside for me until I've been able to come in and pick them up.With service that personalized and selection that solid, how on earth can you go wrong? Besides being the only store of its kind and depth in Chicago (no other toy stores focus on vintage and out of production toy lines - just current stuff), it's just flat out a treasure to the city. Give this guy your business!

17.description: Probably my favorite store in the world. Dave the owner is friendly, funny, and very knowledgeable on all things from Star Wars to Strawberry Shortcake.   Quake is a store full of everything you had as a kid, and lost, sold or blew up as a teenager, with tons of vintage toys both loose and carded.

10.description: The store is packed from top to bottom with action figures.  I enjoyed looking around but I was really hoping to find more in the way of pez dispensers, lunch boxes and some stuff from 60's.

5.description: Seriously, the most awesome store ever!  I read a lot about this place and finally made the journey up there (I live in Pilsen).  My 3 1/2 year old son is starting to get into Star Wars (the original trilogy).  We picked him up a few figures before, but I wanted to find a vehicle for  the guys to go in.  I walked in the store and was blown away.  This place has everything you can imagine.  I told the owner what I was looking for and he pulled out an X wing fighter, with all of the parts, just like the one that I had when I was a kid.  He gave me a great deal, and gave me some Star Wars cards for my son.My son gets home tomorrow (he and his mother are visiting his grandparents in Portland, OR) and he is going to totally freak out!  Thanks Dave.  We will be back soon!

3.description: If you had a lot of toys in the 1980's or the 1990's then this place will be very awesome to you.  I had no idea that they still had toy stores around.  A friend told me about this place so I came in here one day to check it out.  As soon as I walked in I was amazed at how many toys they had from so many different years.  They had a vast selection from all the different toy lines.  Some of the action figures were in bins but a lot of them were hanging on the wall the way they were when they first hit the shelves.  Not only did they have a vast selection but they had some good prices.  The person behind the counter was also very helpful & knowledgeable about the poducts.  This store is also located in a convenient area.  Since I have visited this store I have also checked out a few others & none really compared to this one.  So between the good selection & the friendly service this is a great place to visit.

35.description: My Boyfriend dragged me in here. He loves this cluttered 80's toy haven.  All the toys he ever had/wanted/Mom wouldn't buy him from 20 years ago CHEAP! like 50 cents a pop cheap. I was making fun of him. Like laughing-at-you-fun-of-him, BUT THEN *lights, camera, action* I saw my childhood hero: Jem! Yes, Jem of the Holograms and 80's cartoons- Shut up- Jem largely influenced my total obsession for clothes (Preferably, new ones for each episode... I mean... day...) and cheesy "truly outrageous" storylines. I couldn't help myself. She went home with me along with some quirky Farrah Fawcett and 60's kitsch Batgirl refrigerator magnets. I outspent my boyfriend... again... and he made fun of me. Looks like Jem is gonna beatdown G.I. Joe, Mr, T and Luke Skywalker tonight! (Not He-Man though, he's going to help Jem decide what accessories to wear!) Showtime!

19.description: Propietor David Gutterman is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. He runs Quake with an obvious labor of love. He is always there. In fact, I've never seen anybody except David working in the store.And, all important: the inventory of superhero, movie, TV sitcom, comic book and action hero memorabilia, ROCKS. I am never here without finding something noteworthy, fun, and fun for big kids, too.Quake will bring your childhood back in a big memory rush.

28.description: Propietor David Gutterman is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. He runs Quake with an obvious labor of love. He is always there. In fact, I've never seen anybody except David working in the store.And, all important: the inventory of superhero, movie, TV sitcom, comic book and action hero memorabilia, ROCKS. I am never here without finding something noteworthy, fun, and fun for big kids, too.Quake will bring your childhood back in a big memory rush.

45.description: Matt W summed it up best for me. I love walking into Quake, but can't seem to find anything I must have. Everything makes me remember my younger self and GI Joe play dates at Albert Finn's house. I never liked actually playing with the GI Joe's - just setting them up in massive battle scenes and staring at the scene from different angles. But that's a different story.Quake has an immense amount, a crushing amount of toy goodness going on. It's not your standard toy store where the toy in the front of the rack is the same as all those behind it. If you're drawn to a place like Quake, then you'll have to physically peek behind each one to discover new things.

33.description: If I could marry a store, it'd be this one.

43.description: Took my boys here today after Spidey3 @ the Davis.Walked out with like 7 mostly complete transformers for them and a handful of very weird and cool patches I just had to have since they cracked me up. About 18 bucks total, SCORE!!!!!Loved seeing the stacks and stacks of craptastic pop culture.Owner is friendly.B.K. (before kids) I was too embarassed to shop here. . .not dignified enough, ya dig? Wow am I glad I got over that uptight attitude today. Thank you Quake! We'll be back for the dollar comics.

2.description: I had a great experience working with David to sell my GI Joe collection. He made it simple and fair. He definitely knows his stuff, and the store is chock full of about everything you can think of.

18.description: The owner should almost rename this place "Memory Lane". Almost every customer that came during my visit spat out every variation of "I remember that!!!" This man has toys, figures, dolls, cars, playsets, etc. from the last 40 years. Although you'd see mostly the popular lines from the 80's and 90's, there are some new toys in here too.For me, I felt like Ali Baba in the cave of treasures! The way one treasure was always right behind the next...just WOW! I had to pick up some of my childhood gems that were amazingly in mint condition.Gen X/Yers, run, don't walk to this treasure store.

41.description: Ah, my childhood. There you are! Everything in this place that isn't in its original packaging I swear I played with 20 years ago or more. A great trip down memory lane. I drop in from time to time to see if they've acquired any "new" Atari video game cartridges that aren't "E.T."

4.description: I found Quake by accident, but it was a great accident. Ive recently started collecting toys and this place is like heaven! Even toys I had forgot about I found here. Plus a certain figure I had been on a hunt for online, I found here in great condition with accessories and at a very low price (online prices were ridiculous). This place is definitely a Chicago treasure

6.description: sorry i knocked down everything in your store i was on drugs

22.description: I recommend entering Quake with an open mind and no expectations, because that's truly the best way to enjoy all the surprises it has in store. If you are looking for something specific, you might not find it, but you can still leave with an E.T. glass that was sold at Burger King or a Boba Fett statue that makes noises. Everything is well-priced, and the owner is clearly trying to showcase these forgotten treasures, rather than trying to turn a profit. Bring your childhood friends and reminisce about the toys you used to share.

15.description: Great place to go and relive your childhood and yes....get giddy from seeing all those toys you might've played and longed for and now you have money to buy them!!!! Hahaha...love it and enjoy my sons' eyes brighten with excitement over the same toys!!! Cheap prices on some toys and some are just worth the splurge!!!

20.description: The owner should almost rename this place "Memory Lane". Almost every customer that came during my visit spat out every variation of "I remember that!!!" This man has toys, figures, dolls, cars, playsets, etc. from the last 40 years. Although you'd see mostly the popular lines from the 80's and 90's, there are some new toys in here too.For me, I felt like Ali Baba in the cave of treasures! The way one treasure was always right behind the next...just WOW! I had to pick up some of my childhood gems that were amazingly in mint condition.Gen X/Yers, run, don't walk to this treasure store.

36.description: I wish I had not gotten rid of all my Star Wars, Gi Joe, He-Man and every other toys I had when I was a kid.Luckily Quake has kept them all for me to come and visit. I like to come here and reminisce. And once in a while buy something. If I had more money and space, I would just buy back all my old stuff.It's like the museum of my life, and probably for many other kids my age.

14.description: Fantastic I came form Phoenix just to see this place. GReat owner spent at least an hour just talking. GREAT PRICES I will return many many more times.

12.description: Don't come here expecting haute cuisine or cheap menu prices. Come here before the game if you don't want to tailgate, but don't want to enter the field just yet. Prices are somewhat cheaper than inside the stadium, so that's a plus!Ordered chips, guac and salsa as an "appetizer" to our in-stadium hot dogs, and I gotta say they were fantastic! The chips were seasoned and delicious, and I could have drank the salsa (even if it may have come straight from a jar). Don't expect much, it IS a bar right outside the stadium, but what are your other options to pre-game? It's a neat spot to relax before the game starts!

3.description: Came here before a sox game ofcourse. Fyi I'm a Cubs fan, and say what u want but wrigleys pre and post game environment is on another level . Besides tailgating this seems the the closet spot to grab a beer and some grub. The place is beautiful, modern clean, cool. Not cheap, no deals, but good food and fun atmosphere. One thing I don't get is they didn't play the sox game when we were there? They were playing the masters on every tv? That just doesn't make sense to me. But this place is legit, they need more places like this by us cellular feild

1.description: My wife and I came here before the Sox v. Toronto game earlier this year and I loved the wings, and she ordered some egg thing which she also said was really good!The place was decorated nicely in sports memorabilia, and the service was quite nice as well.I just wish they'd drop the super lame name.

2.description: Took FOREVER to get served. That's for every round of beer. We were constantly empty. Took over 30 min to get bill ... And it was incorrect. No Bud Light. $7 for 12 oz beers. Ridiculous. This place has nothing on Wrigleyville.

9.description: This sports-themed restaurant is now called 'ChiSox Bar & Grill' after having lost its Bacardi sponsorship, but the menu and atmosphere hasn't changed.  I came here for the unofficial grand-opening of the "new" place, and all food and drinks were comped because my old man and I have been season's ticket holders for the past decade.  So naturally, we dined like kings.  Had we been legitimate kings holding unlimited power, however, we would have demanded that the chef be tarred and feathered......Okay, maybe that's a tad extreme, but the food was definitely sub-par.  Considering the (over)prices, the quality was not good.  Keep in mind, everything I ordered was on the house--all patrons that evening drank and dined for free.~NOMS~I started with a "roasted" corn on the cob.  Late March is not the peak season for corn, and while I could tolerate the lack of yummy juicy corniness, I could NOT deal with the fact that it was served cold.  Like, less than room temperature, as if it just came out of the fridge.  This glaring oversight cost them a star, at least.  It's normally $4.  Bleh.I continued on with chopped brisket tacos (three of them, normally priced @ $9, so $3 per taco).  They were marginally okay.  There are two BBQ sauces on the table so you can slather on as much as needed for the less-than-flavorful dishes.From there, I placed an order for the chicken tenders (@ $9.75) and cheese fries ($7).  Tenders were served with buffalo and blue cheese dipping and tasted decent, but the fries were easily the best thing I had that night.  Something so simple, yet it outshone everything else.  They ran out of jalepeno cheddar bites, which I desperately wanted to sample.  Sad face  :(~BOOZES~A tall boy of IPA (read: good beer, not cheap domestic shit) will run you $8-9.  Cocktails are upwards of $10.  The margarita I got was STRONG, and while no where close to being worth $11, I'd get one of those before I even considered paying for a beer.~BOTTOM LINE~If it weren't for the fact that this "demo night" included everything on their menu at no charge and somewhat-attentive service, this would be 2-star review at best.  Yes, it's essentially ballpark food, but that doesn't mean you still can't get a decent meal.  The value here is appalling.  Point in case: for twenty-five cents shy of ten bucks, you get 5 chicken tenders.  That's it.  No fries and a side, no combo meal, nothing.  Just tenders.  Double-you-tee-eff.TL;DR--I ate and drank myself silly for absolutely no cost, and this place still gets 3 stars out of my easy-to-please self.  I'll probably wind up coming here to get the pulled pork nachos (without question the best thing they serve), but that's likely all I'll get.  What you get for what you're paying is in line with everything else at Sox park, Wrigley, the United Center, Soldier Field.....that's to say, ridiculous.  Wasn't too pleased, but I suppose it could be worse.  That cold corn, though......*shudders*

10.description: We stopped in for a bite to eat before going to the WhiteSox game. This place is a hidden gem. There were not a a lot of people but a fair amount enjoying beers before game time.We ordered the Beef Brisket Nachos and were they fabulous. They didn't just put all the good stuff on the top, after eating for a while we hit untapped chips..peeled them away to a fresh layer of toppings...warm and gooey.We loved the service and the price. Definitely will be returning.

13.description: We sat for quite awhile before anyone noticed us but once we got service it went well. The food is always quick and tastes good! It did take quite awhile to get the check though. We did love the excitement of a Sox win and half price appetizers. Not sure what the need for bathroom attendants is, I really don't feel it is necessary to tip the person that hands me paper towel.

16.description: Service was less than desirable. Bloody Mary's were straight out of the zing zang jar. Food selection is typical bar fare, nothing really great about this place other than it being across the street from the baseball field.

6.description: I am giving this place 4 stars, because this place has really changed since it was Bacardi at the Park. The menu was curated and designed by the Gibson's restaurant group, and they definitely have some unique and delicious options for ballpark food. Walking in, the bar is pretty big and spacious, with a sit in bar circling all the way around the middle area where the bartenders make the drinks, and then tables scattered around that. There are also outdoor seating areas in the front, and in the back lining 35th street.Our waiter was very nice and friendly and my brother and I both ordered Chisox Mules (moscow mules). They were pricey at 10$, but I mean, you're grabbing a drink at a ballpark so what do you expect? I'd rather pay 10$ for a well made cocktail than 7 or 8$ for a bud-light. My brother got the pulled pork sandwich and I got the buffalo chicken wrap. The prices are pretty much the same as you would expect from a regular restaurant. The pulled pork sandwich was 9.75, and they have burgers for 11$. They offer wines for 6$ and have a more than reasonable children's menu with items for 3$ and 4$. The portion sizes are fair and the food was good. Both our sandwiches came with a side of fries and coleslaw.I would definitely come back here to eat and drink before a Sox game if I'm not tailgating, as the prices are somewhat cheaper than inside the Cell, you can actually sit and enjoy your meal, and they have different menu items if you want something besides nachos or a hot dog.

15.description: I went here prior to the game on April 25th. I was able to get a seat right away, arriving about 90 minutes before the game. The food and drink selection is pretty good and different from inside the ballpark. It's a good place to go prior to the game if you don't want to tailgate, and if you get a decent server. The prices/quality are more consistent with a decent bar than with a ballpark. I'm giving it 3 stars, however, because the service was not so great. The waitress came by right away to get our drink order. It went downhill after that. The place wasn't that busy. It took about 3 minutes to come back with our beers, but we each also ordered a water (mine with no ice). The beers got dropped off and the waitress ran away like she had to go save a baby from a burning building, so we didn't get to follow up on our water that she was supposed to bring as well. We asked the waitress from the table next to us to assist. She went off to get our waters. 10 minutes later, our actual waitress came back and brought our waters. She forgot that I asked for mine without ice. Next, she took our food order. I was going to order a pulled pork sandwich. I asked if it came with barbecue sauce, and she said she can bring some out with the sandwich. Someone from the kitchen brought out our food, and there was no bbq sauce with my sandwich. I waited about 5 minutes for our waitress, who was helping the larger table next to us, and at this point was all but ignoring us. She walked away without acknowledging us. We once again tracked down the waitress from the other nearby table, and I asked her for bbq sauce. She said she would speak to our waitress to make sure she brought it out. Another 10 minutes pass.  At one point I saw our waitress just organizing stuff at the little waitstaff station, so I guess that takes priority over customers???  By this time my girlfriend finished her sandwich, and I haven't eaten anything because seriously, who eats a pulled pork sandwich with nothing on it. My girlfriend again tracked down the nearby waitress (not our waitress) who immediately told our waitress we needed bbq sauce. She brought it over pretty quickly after that. We again had to track down the second waitress to get the check. Our waitress wouldn't even look at us. We didn't give her evil glares or anything.  It seems like she just gave up on serving us to focus on her bigger table.  She got a 5% tip from me.  I was going to give this 2 stars based on the service, but the fact that the second waitress was nothing but helpful when we had to go out of our way to request her help bumped me to 3 stars.

0.description: I had the opportunity to try ChiSox again and they make improvements since the last time I was there. I ordered my favorite ribs again and to my surprise I was surprised, the box opened up with fries sticking out of them and a generous slather of sauce. This place is always busy with people going and coming from the game. Thank you ChiSox!

5.description: Still trying to figure out what does waitresses do? After you sit yourself and wait for about 5 minutes. They'll come by and take your drink order, then when they come back to deliver your drinks. You have to stop them before they leave so you can order your food. Food doesn't take long, but they do not deliver your food. Someone in the kitchen does. You see all the girls at the bar mingling and not worried about their customers. You have to be more then cute to be a decent waitress. With that said, atmosphere is great, food is OK. Very convenient since the stadium is across the street.

11.description: Just had the buffalo wrap.  Seriously amazing!! There are no wraps on the menu but one of the girls that worked here said she can ask the kitchen to make it a wrap.  Damn!

8.description: When looking at the map of the US Cellular field area, there is a lack of pre-gaming facilities. ChiSox it was for drinks and food before the game. It took a while to find a waitress. Then a while longer to obtain drinks. Then much longer to get our food.  Then another 20 minutes to pay the bill. I ordered a $13 chopped salad advertising sunflower seeds, a few other healthy toppings,and bacon. Even though the salad did arrive chopped, the toppings were lacking and the dressing was incorrect (ranch, instead of raspberry vinaigrette). I got the attention of our waitress and discussed the dressing situation. She guaranteed the chef put on the correct dressing, even though the color, texture and later taste proved otherwise. At that point, I put the fork in, and argued no more. I just wanted to eventually get to the baseball game next door. Looking back, it would probably be quicker and cheaper to eat inside the ball park.

4.description: This place is not great. They don't let you sample beer but will allow you to send back a full beer if you don't like it. Makes sense. The nachos came out with mounds of unmelted cheese. Weird. The server was good though. She saved our experience. And we were randomly kicked out before the game was over as the place surprisingly shut down for no reason. So we had to chug our beers and leave the bar immediately. So weird.

14.description: This bar is an amazing disappointment. Every time we come for a post game brew, we are rushed out the door. They offer half priced appetizers but the ability to flag down a server at the bar is nearly impossible before they announce last call. The food is decent but not sure it is worth the hassle. As a former northside resident, I am baffled by the lack of service and willingness to serve the patrons of the ballpark. This place is only open on games days and to be honest,  I'm not sure why they bother. This could be a great post game spot for southsiders wanting to hang out before going home but there is zero interest in developing any sort of relationship with this fan base.

7.description: There are not a lot of pre-game dining options near Comiskey Park (it will never be US Cellular Field to us ). We were very early so we decided to check it out. A pleasant surprise and would rate it 3 and 1/2 stars.Seasoned chips with nice salsa and great guacamole started us off. My husband had the 3 filet medallion sliders for $15 and they were very good and tender. Served with fries.I ordered the shrimp po boy. Having been to New Orleans over 35 times I know that there are none better. But I was feeling nostalgic amid our upcoming trip to Mardi Gras. It wasn't awful. 5 decent shrimp,  lettuce,  tomato and seasoned mayo. The problem is always the bread. This was decent but not quite right. Our waiter was terrific and creative in saving us money, refilling drinks, etc... We would come back again. They were very nice to us Twins fans.

58.description: I love this place! The ladies are super nice and they always try their best! The prices are cheap compared to others, $23 for a pedicure and manicure! Their pedicures and manicures are amazing! Their massages always put me right to sleep! They also have waxing and threading service for $8, and I always get my eyebrows done because they do a great job! Parking is available right outside and is not hard to find. Sometimes it gets a little busy, but if you make an appointment before hand, you'll get served first!

56.description: This review is ONLY for those interested in PINK & WHITE GEL and FRENCH pedicures!I am one to only read other reviews but never to write one. I have been here 4 times prior to writing this review, only to give them a chance to redeem themselves but surely no luck throughout any of the visits. There is only ONE lady, which is the owner, that does the pink & white french gel and she is absolutely horrible. She did not make the white gel even, so I had some fingers where the white was extremely thin, some fingers where it was way too thick, and some medium which I had originally wanted. I pointed out all the unevenness and she blamed my finger nails for not being the same length! I was extremely upset because at first she didn't want to fix any of the whites and so I showed ALL the other salon ladies and they ALL agreed it looked horrible and had to be fixed. This really embarrassed her, being the owner and all, so she tried to fix it but ended up hurting me and making me bleed on several fingers using the machine filer. She ended up shaving the white down, but then she didn't refill the white with some fingers so there were patches of my normal nail color that could be seen through the white. My girlfriend was with me and she just kept remarking on horrible it looked in front of the owner, but the owner didn't even care. The fingers where the white was too thick, she kept using a filer and filing down the white, which made my nail SO SHORT, she made my skin bleed and she didn't care. I WAS FURIOUS. Finally, she didn't file/shape down my nail so it looked like clunks of gel were on top of my nails, really really thick. On top of that, she charged me the FULL PRICE and wouldn't give me a discount, in which I am disputing now with my credit card! As for the pedicures, I have done several here with each person and I do not like how most of them do the pedicures. They do not use 2 coats of the white, only 1 coat so it chips right away. Literally, the SAME DAY. All the other pedicures I have done, they use 2 coats and they last for a long while. A few times I have asked the ladies to use 2 coats and they either said no we don't use 2 coats, or no and give me a nasty look like I'm crazy. There is one girl that does use 2 coats but she makes the white curve REALLY curvy when she shapes it so it looked weird. Lastly, for some reason they don't use a super shine top coat, so it gets dull after a day or 2. It seems like people rave about this place, but only for REGULAR manicures & pedicures. There's a reason why it's so cheap.

29.description: I wish I had a better review for this place. So, I went on a lazy Sunday afternoon. I wanted a pedicure and no-chip. I was excited cause they use Gelish, which I think is the best of the gel no chip polishes. They have A TON of colors. My pedicure was gorgeous. Perfect length, shape and color. And a really nice massage, nothing too hard or soft. The woman who did my feet used her time efficiently (took about 30 minutes) while still being thorough and careful, so I figured it would translate to my manicure. 1. The length of my fingernails was all off. She filed some too low and others were more squared off at the edges. Then, came the application of the polish. She put TWO layers of base coat on. I've never seen anyone do this before. So, I was surprised and a little worried. Then came the color. I kid you not, she went back and layered it on FOUR TIMES. Now, if you get no-chip, you know that the whole point is for your nails to look natural. Not in this case, they were thick and uneven and bumpy. because she kept going back and putting on more color, the manicure took TWO and a HALF HOURS. It was unbelievable. I was so frustrated and bored sitting there. I saw two episodes of Monk and that was torturous. Normally, after you go under the light for about 10 minutes or so, you should be completely dry. To my dismay, when I arrived home, I realized there were some streaks of color on my coat and on my sweats. There were big puddles of still-wet color in my nail beds.  So, I called to tell them I needed to come back and have them fixed. They were very nice and said I could come in the next day. Overnight, the color started completely coming off four of my nails. The color was bubbling and catching on clothing and just stripping off my nail. So, I figured I would go in during my lunchbreak cause if I went to see someone who actually knew what they were doing, it would take less time, right? WRONG. It took another 90 minutes for another very nice and seemingly competent technician to fix FOUR nails. She asked if I could stay to have all of my nails fixed but I just didn't have time. Again, she was very nice but she did seem to once again put two coats of base on and it took a REALLY long time to dry. It seems like that might be a problem? Anyhow, I'll not be back here, which is too bad because it's afforable ($48 for no chip and spa pedicure) and it's convenient. But minuses are: it's not super clean, it's kind of an ugly space and it took FOREVER. Sorry, no dreamscape. More like nightmare for the girl on the go.

42.description: My regular spot because the service is nice, massage chairs are awesome, and the nail polish lasts fooorrrrrreeeevvveeerrrrr.Sometimes they'll ask another co-worker who speaks English to help translate, but I've never had a bad experience here. They work really hard to make sure the waiting time is minimal, but they do get packed. This place probably ranks lowest on decor, many other nail salons in the South Loop and Bridgeport neighborhoods have beautiful decor. I would still rate this place the best manicure & pedicure out of them all.They offer a 45-minute foot massage for an additional fee, it helps turn an awful day decent.

23.description: TERRIBLE customer service at this place.   Save your money and go somewhere else.

47.description: This is place is not fancy but they do good work. No chip french manicure. Super pretty! Love it!

8.description: I went here since it's close to my house and needed a no chip manicure and regular pedicure. The young man did my manicure and pedicure . However, my pedicure and manicure are not the same color, for one, when they should be. Two, my no chip manicure is all uneven and you can see through it to my nail. They charged me for having my old no chip taken off as well, when half of it was already off. I feel like I got robbed since they didn't want to fix my manicure when I told them about it and they looked at it but still wanted to charge me anyway. The lady that did my eyebrows was good but I will NEVER go to this place again for a manicure or pedicure!! This place used to be good but they fell off BIG TIME!

31.description: Great price ! They do a good job and can always fit me in. Might wait 10-15 mins when you get there but I feel like that happens everywhere anyways!

34.description: Bottom line... for the price I paid for something that's supposed to last 2-3 weeks I'm disappointed. I definitely expected to get at least 1-1.5 weeks wear out of it without any issues. Alas, 1-2 DAYS later I've already had issues.I treated myself to a no-chip manicure here on Saturday. The result looked great and I was happy. Less than 24 hours later one of my nails chipped. Thankfully they are open on Sunday so I went back and they fixed it. Fine. It's now Monday and I can see the corner of a different nail on the verge of chipping. Seriously? I don't do manual labor so it's not like I've been abusing my hands these past 2 days so I don't know what's up with this! This place isn't the rock star, numero uno, best of the best nail salons so that's what you should or should not expect but it's convenient and reasonably priced. I've changed my rating to a 2 because I have experienced much better and overall the polish doesn't last long enough. Even my pedicure looks so-so after just a week. Frankly, I've been too lazy recently to deal with the traffic in Lakeview to go to my preferred nail salons up there but I might have to... this place isn't good enough anymore. With that said, I wanted to update my review to let people know NOT to expect superb quality here but rather a mediocre job done for a decent price.

16.description: Good spot for a quick no chip mani without an appt. Ana is a nice and good nail technician. Recommend this for a quick nail fix. Street parking is relatively easy to find. Only complaint is they don't have a good selection of no chip nail colors to select, so I had no choice but to walk out with the typical taupe or red color on nails.

13.description: I love this place. It's clean, it's big, and the price is right. I've come here many times for a no-chip mani and a pedi. The foot/leg massages rock my world. They also have a large selection of nail polish colors (even no-chip colors) compared to other places I've been. Crystal always does a great job! So glad I found this place.

11.description: I'd give this place 3.5 stars. It's clean and prices are pretty good- $30 for a mani pedi. They have a good selection of colors as well. I've never had a bad experience. The only reason why it's not a 5 or solid 4 stars is because I've never felt that the employees go above and beyond. It's just a good mani pedi or no chip nail salon that is clean, has nice massage chairs and a good selection of colors. Also I've only had to wait once (and I've been a lot!) for 10minutes on the weekend- you can get in relatively quickly.

39.description: As my previous review says, this WAS my regular place. What changed this? Well, about two weeks ago- my fiancee and I visited this place for our regular manicures and I was surprised in a good way, that they were not as busy as normal for a Saturday. All of that changed when minutes before I was seated for my manicure, I saw a mouse running around the shop!!! I screamed! It was horrible! The women in the shop (workers) did not seem surprised. If my fiancee had not already been in the chair, I would have left. It was a bad experience, the mouse kept coming out of I don't know where, and the girl did a bad job on my nails. I had to take the file and show her how to do  it, just silly!! I don't know about other people but, I do not enjoy the possibility of a nasty, furry, creature running over my feet at all, but especially not when I am trying to relax and pamper.

37.description: So I have been to this establishment twice.  I had drastically different experiences on each visit.My first visit I was very impressed with this little nail shop.  The only complaint I really had was that there is no free parking available.  I went in on New Year's Eve and was seen within a reasonable time.  The particular lady who worked on my feet still took adequate time to make my toes look pretty and took care of my feet.  I left with my nails and toes ready to party for the town.Okay, second visit was for my birthday.  This time the shop was barely busy.  I was seen in a decent amount of time, but definitely not quick as my first visit with more people in the shop.  Needless to say I was not very happy with my service.  My feet looked like they had cheese grater taken to them and my skin was peeling everywhere and looked like I never got a pedicure.  I think the moral of this story is that this place can be hit or miss.  I think if you go and get a good mani and/or pedi that you get that person's name and only request her.  If you leave it up in the air like I did, you may get a bad pedicure.  If my 2nd experience was like my 1st, I would have given this place 5 stars.

0.description: I love this place.  The prices are reasonable. Anyways i don't think it's open anymore. Every time i try to call there's nothing on the other end.

38.description: Chose this nail salon based on its great Yelp reviews--I definitely do not agree! The only positive for this place is the price, but you definitely get what you pay for. I had a regular pedicure and a no-chip manicure. The pedicure was ok, yet the no-chip has to be the worst one  I've ever gotten! It's thick and the color is spread unevenly. Most importantly, the salon doesn't look very clean. I will never come back to this place!

51.description: best eyebrow wax in the city. people will compliment my brows when I get them done here. Never had an eyebrow compliment b4 this place. LOLNot to mention, it's $8.00 and I never have to tell them what to do. They just do their job and it looks awesome.Got a pedicure here while pregnant, lasted forever and the ladies made sure not to make the water too hot and to give a poor, about-to-pop mama an extra long massage and soak.Nga was the best, so sad that she's gone! :-(

27.description: Just went here for the first time and got a mani/pedi from Angie. Friendly staff, no wait time, and a ton of great polish colors to choose from. She did a really good job cutting my overgrown cuticles on my fingers (not jagged at all), and once she found out I'm really ticklish while doing my pedi, she did it in a way that barely tickled at all (first time that's happened!) Best part is it was only $28 total for both the mani and the pedi. This is my new go-to place!

32.description: This place is pretty good. I got my first french manicure. The lady might be new (according to my sister). I despised cuticle pushing/ trim due to my first manicure experience a year ago at a different location.This place did it and two days afterwards I didn't have cuticle skin flying all over the place and trapping into my clothes when I dress. The lady was very thorough, though quiet. She made sure each of the tip is done right. She was fast as well. Though the nails weren't flawless (the only con is the regular layer of polish she added after the white tips.. they were uneven and spotted). It was still a great experience. Luckily we came in around 1ish so the place wasn't packed on a Wednesday.

54.description: I'd really give Dreamscape 4 1/2 stars. I went in at 4pm on a Sunday and there was one girl in front of me and all of the stations were busy. I waited about 15 minutes (which is nothing to complain about when you're a walk-in). There were about 5 girls working. The salon is super cute and super clean.  I had a french polish change, 6 for the polish change and 4 for the french. The girl took a really long time shaping the white, so I assumed she was new. The top coat she put on was not sleek and shiny, so I understand the point the other reviewer was making. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and will be going back. FYI, there is free parking on Parnell, which is half a block over.

48.description: LOVE this place! its walking distance from me and i always come here to get my eyebrows waxed. cost $8 . i think that's the cheapest in the southside. Usually northside places are cheaper ($5) but its too far for me. I rather pay three dollars more than waste my gas driving up north.*june always does my eyebrows ! shes super nice and friendly !

44.description: Took my bf here to get his eyebrows done! Great job! Very thorough. A little disappointed though that they advertise threading but would only do a wax.

24.description: Very affordable and convenient street parking!  A no-chip mani and pedi costs $48 which is probably the cheapaest I've found in Chicago.  My no-chip mani never chipped and my pedicure still looks perfect even after 3 weeks!  This is my new go-to spot!

7.description: So the place is nice and clean . I also like that they have a great variety of colors for no chip . I live very close , but only came here once before and never came back because of how rude and mean the nail tech was . This time around I needed an emergency fix on 2 nails and didn't have time to go all the way to place I normally go . She was fast and did a good job , but again this nail tech was a bit rough on my hands and  somewhat mean . This place is great and and very convenient cause it's so close to me  , but I'm a paying customer and shouldn't have get attitude with my service .

49.description: Y'all are the BOMBDOTCOM!I have loved this place since I was living in the area which is more than I'd like to disclose....Anyhows, They are cheap, they are polite, they are perfectionists, they are happy, they are efficent, they rub you down..... Need I say more?I go to diff places all the time, this is by far the only place I will take other people to and keep coming back. I believe it's $28 mon-thurs for a mani/pedi....So, no girl, you dont have the "cheapest place in the city" cuz Dreamscape is the cheapest, ooook?Keep up the good work and expand if you can!

40.description: Rudest Nail Salon I have been to in Chicago.I walked in literally 2 seconds after another patron and was told they were closed (yet the sign said open and the time was 7:30pm) I will never visit this shop again.

53.description: 3.5 stars-this palce has alot of potential and after reading the reviews I decided I needed a palce close to home for an emergency mani.  Got in right away, you will find a lot of local girls here (+1 star!)Colors are arranged neatly on the wall and large variety (+1 star!)nice hand massage and the technician took her time to trim and file (+1 star!)The techinicans  area is clean and they make a point of cleaning all the equipment and tools in the sanitizer between clients but there were some used towels on the floor  (+1/2 star!)sadly my mani did not last past 5 days (and I was not washing dishes!) compared to other places I have been to where the color doesn't chip or crack for a week.  *Note accepts CC $10 min

30.description: I found this place by checking Yelp! reviews and I'm so happy I came here. The employees were friendly and really thorough--I think my leg/foot massage lasted 10 minutes per side. My manicure is flawless and the mani/pedi together cost $30 (this may be a weekday deal because I went on a Thursday). So happy I found a place I love in my neighborhood!

46.description: Love this place. They were very nice

1.description: I'm going down to 3 stars... This has happened to me a few times, I thought I've learned my lesson, or trust my Dreamscape girls, but no. So I walked in and asked for a no chip mani. No pedi just mani, She tells me 15 mins. Ok. Pick out my color... Mind you it's a beautiful summer Saturday afternoon. All kinds of people are coming in... And somehow getting in before me!! When you say 15 minutes I'll hold you to it. If you knew you had appointments then you should have told it to me straight. It was going on 45mins and still not even close to being called. These girls who came in after me just wanted a color change, then this older couple said they wanted to be together for pedis. Well what about me?! This is ridiculous to treat your customers like this and to just wait. I have a life too. Just poor customer service. Their work is great... If you can sit down. So I told her, so I should have called you while sitting here and that would mean I'd have an appnt and be able to cut everyone who were walk ins?! Or don't tell me 15 mins. Like I said this isn't the first time this has happened when I walked in, they tell me 10-15, I wait... Wait wait wait. Super bad for business. And then I passed last weekend and there was a fire!. Guess it's just more reason to take my business elsewhere.

55.description: After reading all reviews about this place, I decided to check them out.. Pros: They do a great job.. They massage your feet and hands--it's aiiight.. Cons: Parking--SUCK!!!! I was so worried about feeding the meter that I couldn't enjoy getting a Mani and pedi.. Time: It took 15-20 mins to get serviced this was during the day.. :(Price: It's $22 for a full set of nails. That's not expensive but I'm used to paying $20 bucks for a full set of nails and not worrying about parking... BTW: The meter maids are out there constantly!!!!! The total: (This includes running to the meter) : $40 bucks!! NO THANKS!

9.description: This is a hidden gem in Bridgeport. The salon is clean and has a pleasant feel to it. I got a standard manicure and pedicure, both were well done. It was also a great deal $30 for the package. I recommend this to anyone who's in the area!

26.description: Very skeptical of Asian salons as they usually don't have the best of service, but decided to go here as being close to my home. Went on Wednesday around 1pm and it was quite busy already. Luckily, I was next to be seated. Janet did my no-chip mani ($30) which was absolutely perfect. Very impressed. My nails are extremely short and gross, which is why at other places even after cleaning up my nails, I still find specks of polish on my skin around the nails. However, Janet took a lot of time to clean my nails before and after and really made them neat and uniform. This place also had a larger selection of no-chip colors compared to other places I have been to. Janet was great and seems very straightforward. I could tell that she knows what she's doing, as she was teaching the other ladies (in Chinese) on how to execute certain services that they offer.

25.description: Let me start by saying I would have given them 5 starts if it wasn't for the awful and outdated decor. As far as ambiance this is bare bones, no fuss time travel to the 80's... however the quality of the mani/ pedi is excellent. Queenie did an amazing job on my mani, took her time to get rid of a previous no-chip   and did a perfect job. My other appointment was for a pedi, I don't remember the name of the nail tech but again I received a very thorough and good service.I will definitely come back here.

12.description: I like the way they do nails but please take ur time on doing my nails cause I'm not giving you money to make my nails look bad. Please take ur time!!!

59.description: Love Dreamsape!  I get my nails done here every two weeks - a french gel fill is $23.  The ladies in the salon do a great job and they are all really sweet and friendly.  This place has TONS of regulars and its pretty obvious why that is the case....great deal and quality service!   I would recommend getting there as early as you can on the evenings or weekends.  It gets super busy!

21.description: Good spot for a quick no chip mani without an appt. Ana is a nice and good nail technician. Recommend this for a quick nail fix. Street parking is relatively easy to find. Only complaint is they don't have a good selection of no chip nail colors to select, so I had no choice but to walk out with the typical taupe or red color on nails.

17.description: Tried this place today (Saturday) because I woke up with my boyfriend horrified by the look of my neglected feet & they were able to get me in right away (around 130). Everyone was very nice, the massage chairs might've been the best I've ever experienced & the foot massage Crystal gave me was great! Prices were average ($48 for a pedi & no chip mani) but there was no wifi (which wasn't necessary a terrible thing,  because I was forced to unplug for a bit- but hence the 4 star rating) I also saw a sign for a 30 minute foot massage + a pedi for $48- that'd be awesome! Maybe next time.

10.description: I have been coming here regularly for about six months. Last time I was here, the lights were out and the credit card machine was down. I was forced to go to the ATM and leave my cell phone behind in case I ran off and didn't pay.  Yet, the other customers were allowed to walk back home and pick-up their checkbooks. I refuse to support an establishment of this sort.

5.description: I was really glad to find a new salon, not too far from home where I can get my nails done on a Sunday. I was seen right away without appointment which was great. I got a pedicure, a soak off,  and a simple manicure. The young man did a great job on the pedicure. I have no complaints about that. The soak off went alright I guess, I haven't ever gotten one before so I can't speak on that. I suspect he might not have as much experience add the ladies there bc they were constantly checking up on him or what sort of seemed like fussing at him. He seemed very sweet and quiet and put in sincere effort,  but my manicure left much to be desired. When I left it looked... OK. Not great just... Yeah, just... Not great. I didn't make a fuss bc I know after getting nail extensions off my nails would be breaking off soonish, which is why I didn't opt for a no chip manicure like I normally do. However, it's been less than 8h and only one nail has broken, the rest just look yucky. My cousin gets white polish all the time abs it skates looks good on her, mine looks like he put white out on my hands. When that same cousin saw my nails today she was confounded. It's almost embarrassing.  I'm sad bc everything was right about the place, the location, the decor, cleanliness, but... If they can't knock the most basic service out of the park, what's the point. I won't be back.

3.description: I came here a couple of times to get my eyebrows done and I felt that they haven't been doing it the way that I'd like them to be. Eyebrow waxing cost $8 here which is not bad if they only did a better job. The first time I got them done here, the girl that usually does eyebrows cut them too thin. The second time, I asked her to not cut them too short but just make it look even and she did the same exact thing as last time. Needless to say, I never went back there again. I don't know if it was due to the language barrier or something but the staff weren't as welcoming; most of gave me dirty looks the first time I stepped in there. I remembered only one of them smiling and saying thank you.

35.description: I absolutely love this place. The service is great and the end product always turns out great. The place itself could use a revamp, but other than that, I love it. The other thing is that it is located in the city and I live an hour away. But, it's worth the traveling.

19.description: What's that saying? "Don't judge by a book by its cover."Pretty applicable to Dreamscape Nails.  Not even gonna lie.  This place looks borderline sketchy when you drive past it on 31st.  But, once you step inside, it's pretty welcoming...brightly colored walls.  The color combinations might not make any sense...nor does the decor (*ahem* random faux-chandiler and wooden benches...what?), but whatever.  The place was packed when I got there (4 pedi chairs, 3 nail stations). The woman finished my mani in like record time, I swear.  She did a great job shaping my nails and cleaning up those cuticles, but the polish job could probably been a little better. The color is fab, though (Lincoln Park After Dark, ya'll!).  Super friendly and, of course, played the 'What Ethnicity Are You?" game with me.  Classic.+Mani's are $12+Minimum on credit card is $10+Free street parking available on Parnell after 4pm

28.description: I was here one Saturday last summer, they weren't busy, but it took forever to get my pedi started. It took a long time and over all the color was chipped wihin a couple days.  Also they used the razor thingy which is unsanitary and I told her twice not to.  I had to pull both my feet back into the tub.  I went back today because I had to get other errands done in my area.  First off, They pushed the manicure as well which I didn't really have time for, but needed. I picked a color that ended up being a no chip- which they told me in the midde couldn't be done on my feet. The manager filed my nails while the younger employee was doing my toes.  She did a shoddy job on the filing, but I assumed it would be fixed when I got to the table. Once they decided I couldn't have the no chip on my feet she (the manager) offered to find a similar color for my toes so I would match or at least my toes and fingers would be close.  The color for my mani was a salmonish pink.  She came over with a dark purple gray.  Not even close.  I said no.  So they grabbed some crackily brown color which they started to apply and I said no again.  They apparently had no colors to match so I said I would just take the purple on both.  They tried applying the brown again.  I had to stop her twice.  During the pedicure, she tried to use the razor thingy again and I told her no a bunch of times  She also stabbed my toes several times an cut down one toe nail way to far and cut two of my nails uneven. After sh started painting my toes I told them that I wouldn't be doing the manicure, but I offered to pay for the manager filing my nails.  They asked me what the problem was and I said, I just feel that I wasn't being heard the entire time and I don't want the mani done anyway.  She painted my toes.  One coat. No top coat, and she didn't clean up the excess color she splashed on my toes or skin. She said ok, all done.  They had me sit at a drying table where they never turned the dryer on.  They tried to charge me for the no chip. And they tried to push me into bringing my girlfriends in for a spa party wih facials and mani/pedi waxing, etc.  There s no way I will let these people touch my faceThis place sucks.  Sucks.

45.description: Went to this place several times and they did a descent job... Nothing spectacular... Then went this last time for a soak off, pedicure and full set of pink and white gels... Well they managed to soak my nails off ok, and pedicure was ok, but it looks like my pink and white set were put on by an intoxicated 3 yr old... Absolute WORST SET OF NAILS I HAVE EVER SEEN!!!! I am embarrassed and they should be as well. I tried several times to correct the woman and show her how crooked they were and she would not listen. She was absolutely rude when I showed her... Will NEVER GO BACK!!!!

33.description: Not gonna lie - seems sketchy, but I guess it's sort of a hole-in-the-wall nail salon. I came here because I was in dire need of a mani-pedi on short notice and this is down the street from my place and I was lazy to drive to my favorite nail salon. Huge selection of color. They also wax/thread eyebrows. Easy street parking. BUT...This is probably the first and last time I'll ever be here. The woman who did my mani-french pedi was painstakingly slow. Had to pull my foot away a few times while she was doing my toes because she kept hurting me. She cut them too close and I even specified that I did not want that. Pressureless foot massage. And for my mani, she shaped them crooked! When I was seated by the lamps/fan to wait for my nails to dry, it wasn't heated - my fingers and toes were cold...Yeah, I don't think so... next time I'll just make the trip to wicker park to my favorite place.

43.description: What's that saying? "Don't judge by a book by its cover."Pretty applicable to Dreamscape Nails.  Not even gonna lie.  This place looks borderline sketchy when you drive past it on 31st.  But, once you step inside, it's pretty welcoming...brightly colored walls.  The color combinations might not make any sense...nor does the decor (*ahem* random faux-chandiler and wooden benches...what?), but whatever.  The place was packed when I got there (4 pedi chairs, 3 nail stations). The woman finished my mani in like record time, I swear.  She did a great job shaping my nails and cleaning up those cuticles, but the polish job could probably been a little better. The color is fab, though (Lincoln Park After Dark, ya'll!).  Super friendly and, of course, played the 'What Ethnicity Are You?" game with me.  Classic.+Mani's are $12+Minimum on credit card is $10+Free street parking available on Parnell after 4pm

2.description: this location is currently under some kind of new construction or just temporarily not in business.

18.description: Found this salon on a Yelp review and will definitely be back! Janet did a great job with my no chip. Good prices! An acrylic full set is only $22! Gave it a 4 because they weren't overly cleanly like some places, but nothing that really grossed me out.

41.description: Love these ladies!Professional, treat me like family, and are less-expensive than the normal Chicago-land prices!

52.description: Where have you been all my life???  I went this morning and got right in.  The girl I got was really nice and gentle.  She didn't scrape or file my feet and nails harsh.  The winter was hard on my feet and she took care of them.  Also I had the same girl for both!  It was awesome!!Pros:      Sweet, gentle, quick, clean, back massager chair for pedi and CHEAP!!!  Did I mention it only costs me $28 to get both done!!!Cons:     The girls do have some broken English but you can mostly understand them.  Besides it helps you relax!!Love this place!  Will be going back in two weeks to change the color!!

50.description: After researching for the perfect salon to do my nails I decided to step by  to Dreamscape Nails Salon and  get my mani. I did not make appointment I just step by and was attended in 10 min . No long wait. The person who took care of me was June, she did really great job, fast and professional, so I decided to do my brows too. I had to remove my old no cheapp mani and now my nails are very weak. June knew just what to do she used four coats of polish nail and straighter. I am very happy from results. It cost me only 17 $. My nails look great.  Definitely I will come back Thanks June :)

4.description: Had a great time nice place good service . Me and my Bff stop by in the middle of the day they took us right in . I will be back

6.description: Cute place and seems clean. But some of the girls that work here are so rude. They should be able to take care of the clients with a happy face and love what they do. I just had no chip done 5 days ago and already my nails are chipping. Came In a busy time for them and just to take care of my one nail that really chipped, had a snotty lady telling me someone will be with me 30 minutes later..still waiting and already disappointed in the place near home to me and my nails that could of been done a better job!

22.description: I'm torn. I've been here twice now, both for no-chip manicures. The price is right and the no-chip manicure lasts and lasts, so that's a big bonus. The first time I went, the salon was packed but I was able to get right in and get a great manicure. HOWEVER, this last time I went, I received some of the worst customer service and overall experience. I called ahead and asked how long a no-chip would take since I would be on my lunch hour, and was told 40 minutes. I went at noon and left at 1:10. 70 minutes?! I was the only client in there when I arrived and here's where the customer service went downhill. There were many employees without clients just sitting around. When I was seated for my service an employee sat next to my tech, and continued to carry on a conversation with her the ENTIRE 70 minutes, sometimes just glaring at me. She would sometimes awkwardly hover over my hands, but it didn't appear she was learning the process (they were speaking another language, so I can't say for sure). They were definitely having some sort of deep conversation and my tech was extremely distracted, stopping multiple times to carry on the conversation with her coworker (again, clearly not about my nails). Another employee sat in the client chair next to me watching loud videos on her phone for most of my service. I was right under the television and couldn't even hear what was going on due to the employees chatting and watching videos. When it came to paint the color, they tried putting a bright pink on which was not my selected color. Apparently the bottles were mislabeled. After 10 minutes and an overwhelming amount of employees trying to push other colors on me that I did not want, I settled for what ended up being a bubblegum pink (yuck). Unfortunately, I didn't have the time to change it since it was already 55 minutes into my "40 minute" manicure and I had to finish this up to get back to work. All in all, the manicure results and prices were great. If you want a relaxing, pampering spa-type service, this is not the place.

15.description: Very affordable and convenient street parking!  A no-chip mani and pedi costs $48 which is probably the cheapaest I've found in Chicago.  My no-chip mani never chipped and my pedicure still looks perfect even after 3 weeks!  This is my new go-to spot!

57.description: This is my favorite nail place of all time! Mainly due to the fact that once you become a regular, they treat you like family. I love looking forward to getting my nails done and I have been coming here for 3 and a half years. Nga always did my gel-fills AWESOME and now she moved out to Cali :( (if there was any way to make that sad face bigger, I would do it). I do not know who will do my fills now but I will continue to get my pedicures here. Anne does an AWESOME pedicure and lots of people agree. The prices are great and they are super friendly!

20.description: Tried this place today (Saturday) because I woke up with my boyfriend horrified by the look of my neglected feet & they were able to get me in right away (around 130). Everyone was very nice, the massage chairs might've been the best I've ever experienced & the foot massage Crystal gave me was great! Prices were average ($48 for a pedi & no chip mani) but there was no wifi (which wasn't necessary a terrible thing,  because I was forced to unplug for a bit- but hence the 4 star rating) I also saw a sign for a 30 minute foot massage + a pedi for $48- that'd be awesome! Maybe next time.

36.description: So, my friend and I went in here for manicures, pedicures, and threading the other day ... we were NOT impressed.  The lady told us that pedicures were $15 on the phone, then proceeded to tell us that they were actually $22 after she had done them.  Rude.Our feet were hardly buffed and one of my longer toe nails wasn't even filed down.  I got acrylics and my friend got the gel nails.  Her nails look AWFUL.  It looks like someone slapped some gel onto her nails and only smoothed out the part closest to the cuticle.  They are hideous.  In addition to that, I had to have the nail lady redo two of my nails, because she put the acrylic too high up, so there was a massive gap between the nail and my cuticle.The threading wasn't the best either.  Rather than going fast, the lady went super slow, causing you to feel a ridiculous amount of pain with every pull.  She didn't even brush the hair off or anything.Find a different place, and do NOT pay until the end.  That will make them want to do a better job. This place is ridiculous.

14.description: I hate this place. Here today out of necessity. They pay no attention to who came in when and take people out of turn. Very rude and unprofessional

3.description: Overall, my experience was very good.  I asked The Frame Shop to frame a large star/constellation chart that I recently purchased. The price was a bit much (especially since I used a Groupon), but I don't hold that against The Frame Shop too much because my experience has shown that the entire framing industry is overpriced.  In addition, my print constituted an "oversized" job, which added to the price. The employees were all very friendly. I had the opportunity of meeting the owner when I dropped my print off and he, along with a store associate, were very helpful.  When I picked the framed print up, I met another extremely friendly store associate who helped me load the piece into my car.The quality of the work is great, as well.  The owner's and store associate's recommendations work very well with the print. Very content with my purchase and the service I received.

1.description: Really great customer service and fantastic results at a competitive price. Really happy with the job they did framing my print!

2.description: I have had 6 pieces framed here. I had a canvas stretched and framed, a check matted framed with glass, I've had some other art work done as well. I got great guidance that help me choose the right style for the best price. I currently have another wooden sign being framed right now.
