Micah has gone above and beyond to help my art really look complete. You'll be seeing me often. Thanks guys.

5.description: Micah has been great with the service provided. A true professional and very knowledgable in all types of framing. My boyfriend and I have had 7 pictures/paintings framed all different sizes and they were all done within the week. If you want a more personable experience, I highly recommend it :)

6.description: Requested a simple frame for my marriage certificate. Very friendly and didn't try to upsell their more expensive frames. Would definitely come back soon.

7.description: My boyfriend and I wanted to like and support this business so writing this is disappointing. We just picked up two framed prints, one of which was put in the wrong frame and the other, a wooden frame, had areas that were scratched. Friendly suggestion: How about you use cardboard holders on the corners and not paper. Wow! When my boyfriend placed the order he had a good conversation with the individual working, but on the day the order should have been ready no one thought it necessary to call and inform him that one of the frames had a moulding that was on backorder so it would actually be another week. After another week passed my second call was to see if the order was ready. The individual working said he would call me back once he found out but never did. My third call, an hour before they closed, he said the factory had told him it would be ready this week but did not give him a specific date or time. He said he would call them again to get a definitive answer and call me back, and never did. An hour later I called a fourth time and he said oh! I just got off the phone and they said you can pick up the frames tomorrow. Having had lovely and professional interactions at April 7's, FoundRe, Foursided, and Lakeview Art Supply, I can say this was easily the worst craftsmanship and customer service I have seen and experienced in regards to custom framing. Pay extra and go somewhere else.

8.description: I had two prints framed at The Frame Shop and had a great experience. Prior to this I never had anything custom framed. I was very pleased with the help and advice I was given while picking out the frames. After placing my order, the pieces were finished in one week and I was beyond impressed when I picked them up!  The frames look amazing. Initially I was asked how important these pieces were to me. I responded that I just wanted something to hang on my walls. Now that the pieces are framed, I love the art even more!I am very satisfied with the price I paid, the product and the friendly staff. I am already thinking about what else I can have framed!

9.description: Great experience at The Frame Shop, had a special signed framed by them perfectly, came out better than i had imagined.  Would highly recommend and prices are good.  May seem far from city but it is worth the couple extra minutes for the quality and price.  Micah was a great help!

0.description: Great, friendly customer service and value for your framed treasures! I went to Michael's and they quoted me $365 for one painting where I got it for about $130 at The Frame Shop. Convenient parking and location too.

4.description: I just picked up my signed Hossa jersey.  I love it.  Thanks Micah.  Can't wait to have you frame my next jersey.

3.description: I cannot speak highly enough of both Kelly and her quality work! I LOVE my loft bed! I moved from CA and this is my first Chicago apartment. In order to be able to afford my own place I got a studio. Being a student it was important for me to have office space....and that is when I found Kelly! She was so great to work with, extremely helpful and so fast, She worked with me as I was finishing up finals week and moving into my apartment. I loved that I was able to choose the size loft to be built and the amount of weight it holds (two adults). I was shocked to learn that Kelly's custom lofts were not only less expensive than those cheap Ikea loft beds, but that they were far more sturdy and far better quality.Point of the story is that Kelly and her lofts are awesome! I have gotten so many compliments on my loft and I will continue to pass Kelly's information along.THANKS Kelly :)

1.description: Kelly is awesome! I bought a loft bed from her about a year ago, and I couldn't be happier with my choice!I had just moved into my new apartment, and my bedroom was tiiiiny. I did a lot of research on loft beds, and I chose Chicago Loft Bed because the structure seemed sturdier! I wanted a bed where I didn't have to worry about it collapsing under the weight of two people or squeaking under the weight of just one person and a mattress.She customizes the bed to whatever height you specify, which was perfect for me. I could comfortably stand up under the loft bed (granted, I am kind of short...) and still sit up in bed to read a book. Having that extra space under the loft was incredibly helpful for me, since I'm a graduate student and I spend way too much of my time at my desk doing schoolwork. It also serves the function of a bulletin board for my notes and memos being pinned to the wood. The steps on the side have been nice to use to hang clothes. Oh, and those over-the-door hook hangers fit under the loft, too ;)So really, the bed is an amazing space saver, and Kelly was really friendly and great to work with. She'll build you a sturdy bed in your small space and you'll love it. Getting the bed out later is a problem I'll just deal with later =)

2.description: Kelly is a real pro. She made my loft bed to my specs, painted the wood for me and shipped everything to me. She also made herself available to answer questions during setup. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. I'm enjoying my room so much because if this loft bed I've always wanted! Take the plunge

5.description: Had Kelly come in this past Saturday to bring in our awesome lofted bed frame (Because our place is SO TINY) She was super cool about the whole thing from the bazillion stairs to the small working space. The frame is an amazing space saver and unlike Ikea(and alike furniture store) loft beds this one can easily hold me and my boyfriend and doesn't feel like it will break in the middle of the night. Good Job!

6.description: kelly and Edward are absolutely amazing. my bed is not only exactly what I asked for, but they took the extra time and effort to change things on site once they were in the room - they made it work. my bed is sturdy, gives me a TON of space, and makes my tiny (7' by 11') nyc bedroom cozy with storage! after a long, long day of deliveries, they came to assemble the bed even though it was very late (I am always up late so this was perfect). I highly recommend ordering, for home or college - I'm sure kelly can make anything to your specifications. I had a difficult space to work with and things were changed after the assembly began - and I couldn't be more pleased. thank you guys!!!!

7.description: what more can you say when you get the perfect beds? They have the best customizable beds and they are very professional. Thank you soo much for the two loft beds:)

0.description: Kelly delivered and assembled my daughter's loft bed today and my daughter couldn't be happier.  Kelly was great - she was able to add a modification to the bed for the possibility of a future fitting (i.e. lower ceilings/clearance).  The bed is sturdy, functional, extremely affordable and a lot of fun for my daughter.  Before ordering, I researched and looked at a number of other options, but only Kelly's custom loft bed fit all of my specifications. The fact that it is sturdy alone is a good enough reason for me to order from her, but the fact that it was affordable and included additional add-ons like a desk, shelf and extra rails made it the only choice I could consider for my daughter.

4.description: I have the most amazing loft bed thanks to Kelly! I have a tiny apartment in Harlem  and a queen size bed not a great combination!  I researched a lot of options and Kelly's loft beds were sturdier  than anything out there!  She delivered on time and assembled the loft bed so quickly!  I now have more room and a beautiful new loft bed! Thank you Kelly you are the best!!!

58.description: This place is a legend.  I have been going there for years, although you have to pace yourself - it can't be good for you!Maxwell's is a 24-hr place that serves hot dogs, polish sausage, hamburgers, and my favorite, pork chop sandwiches.  These things are just simmering on the grill in a huge bed of onions.  Sooo good, just remember there is a bone in there, newbies!The place isn't much to look at, but they are really fast, and pretty inexpensive.  There is also a parking lot, which is a plus.  They don't have seating, but there are some high counters inside where you can stand up and eat in the winter.

56.description: This is terrible food...not good for you in ANY way...but man does it taste good, espcially when yer a lil drunk!

29.description: I wish I can give the hole in the wall 100 stars.I don't know why I loved it so much but it is so tasty and delicious. The guys that work there don't speak too good of English but they know how to mean a fantastic polish and cheeseburger Everyone loves the pork chops but my favorite is the cheeseburger You can eat like a king for $5.75

42.description: Southside of Chicago joint thats been around FOREVER!!! Always hits the spot.Unhealthiest food you can find but BOOOOOY,IS IT GOOOOOOD!!!!! Hell yeah,it is!!! I cant even pick a favorite.Sometimes Im in the mood for a Maxwell St.Polish.Other days its the pork chop sandwich.But ALWAYS with grilled onions,mustard and XTRA HOT PEPPERS.I just came back from running 6 miles along the lakefront.IDGAF!!!! Gimme a greasy pork chop sandwich wif fries!!!! Last time it was the polish.NEXT UP Ima go with the double cheeseburger.

23.description: If you're drunk but you spent all your money on beer and only have 4 dollars in your pocket. Guess what? You can have dinner at Maxwell's. Just make sure you get the burger or the hot dogs. Anything else, and you risk disappointing your taste buds.

47.description: this place is always open. I use to love going there when I lived in bport. Polish with mustard and extra onions with ginger ale. This place is for those moment where you have the a case of munchies lol, hangover food or if you want to ruin your diet. its absolutely worth it. Those dude in there are funny too.viva la maxwellcash only

8.description: Still excellent and cheap. Pork chop and rc $5.25. Hit the spot.  With fries.  No wait no rush  Great service as usual.

31.description: I used to go there all the time after working night shift. Go there and say "Pork Chop Sandwich with everything!"*bring cash!

34.description: Sometimes I forget how good this place really is.  Cheeseburgers are amazing and everything comes with fries (even the fries come with fries lol). Prices are extremely reasonable and they only accept cash.  You will know your close because you can smell the grilled onions from 2 blocks away.  Perfect 2am spot!

16.description: It's 24/7 cheap and always good place to grab a snack. The fish sandwich and the polish is a must try.

13.description: Pork chop was moist and tender (it did NoT have that cheap hog taste). Quick fast service. Flavor was simple but I only eat with ketchup.... Traditional style is mustard with grilled onions which my husband liked. Inexpensive for a good sandwich. $4Parking lot, fast friendly service, I will always come back!

11.description: Had a polish. Pretty good. Too bad they had mustard in food wrapping. What place doesn't have mustard packets? I guess that's my only negative.

39.description: It's a hamburger and hot dog stand stripped down to its bare essentials. They've got basically four things on the menu (hamburgers, hot dog, Polish sausage, and pork chop sandwich) everything comes with fries, and they make it blazingly fast. (On my last trip, I walked in and out with my food in about 90 seconds--and there was a guy ahead of me.) Zero ambiance, no seating to speak of, but a great value.

37.description: It's real simple: polish, dog, burger, or pork chop. Can of pop... yes or no? You can't go wrong with the polish and pork chop. Open 24 hours, even on days like July 4, when you really need a dog!

0.description: This review has been a long time coming.  This has been my favorite Maxwell street location since 1996 when I began attending IIT for college.  It was at that point I was introduced to the amazing, post college party, booze soaking greatness that is produced by the Maxwell Street Depot. Decades later, I still stop by when I get the chance.This location is located a few blocks West of the Dan Ryan Expressway, right next to a viaduct.  The first thing you see are the 55-gallon plastic drums that have been converted to garbage cans. Next, if it's summertime, you notice the customers lining up, and the yellow sign lining the top of the building. The first thing you smell are the onions.  The ever-present, wonderful onions that have been cooked as much as a thing could possibly be cooked. There is a parking lot, but often cars will park right in front of the business curbside, so they can grab their food to go.  This is a 24hr restaurant, and there is often great people watching to be had late night, especially on weekends.  I will be up front with you, this isn't the best food you will ever have.  Odds are you will still be tasting the onions  8-12 hours after you eat here. However, if you want to see and eat where real Chicago people eat for a good price, it's hard to beat. Hot DogsIt's a hot dog.  There is no snap to the outer casing, and it's probably cooked a little too long.  The bun is standard, probably the cheapest ones the owner could find.  The hot dog is topped with mustard and as many over-grilled onions as you can stand. Ketchup is optional, french fries come with it. Despite the way my review sounds, I love these hot dogs!  I eat 20-40 hot dogs from this location a year. Fast and cheap, you can eat these while you drive, walk, or work.  Ask for hot peppers if you want to spice up the dog.  These are not sport peppers, these are HOT peppers, be aware.French FriesNot the best you've had, far from the worst.  They are always hot and fresh.  French fries come with every item they serve so the odds of you getting old, or cold french fries is non-existent.  They give you a decent amount, and if you're really low on cash an order of Fries for $1 will keep you alive.  I once asked for grilled onions on top of the fries and had my own little animal-style (in-n out burger) party.Pork chop sandwichInconsistent, sometimes dry, sometimes juicy, bone in awesomeness. Cooked on the griddle, placed on a hamburger bun and covered with grilled onions (of course), the pork chop is a decent size and is the true star of the sandwich.. I still order these now and again, but because they are more expensive than the hot dogs, they have fallen out of favor with me.Breakfast SandwichThe great this about places like this is that they never change, so when they introduced their breakfast sandwich a few years ago I was skeptical.  That said, late night breakfast is one of my favorite things to indulge in after a night of drinking, so I decided to give it a try. The breakfast sandwich consists of 2-3 eggs scrambled along with roughly chopped bacon.  This delightful mixture is then placed atop a hamburger bun, where a slice of American cheese can be added (.50 extra). To sum it all up: you can still get an affordable,cheap, delicious (mostly) meal relatively quickly.  Of course the food, clientele and cleanliness isn't the best, that's part of its charm.  It is a Chicago institution, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

38.description: For all its supposed South Side lore I didn't find this to be that great. Cash only, good prices, you order and it's ready very quickly. Which is good and bad. Good cuz it's fast but bad because it's kind of pre-fab schlock. The Polish sausage itself was good but the stringy mess of onions on top was devoid of real onion flavor. The sport peppers were 2 inches long and soft smooshy canned stuff, not the small crunchy hot sports I'm used to at MY dog joints. Fries were good. Oh, and get this. Though they have hotdogs, they only dress them Maxwell style (mustard, grilled onions, [wannabe] sports)! What? You can't get a proper Chicago style dog here? Crazy. I had asked for my Polish Chicago-style and found out. This place will please yuppie Northsiders who think they're getting some gritty "true Chicago experience" by getting food on the ruff ruff Souff Syde.

51.description: I love this place.  I know if I ever have a heart attack it'll be thanks to this place.  Haha.I love their Double Cheeseburgers and their Polish Hot Dogs. I'm not a fan of Pork Chops or Fries, but all my friends and family who eat that stuff say it's the best here.Prices are great here too, so I do enjoy the cheap, but good tasting food here.  I'll be back when I'm in this neighborhood.  No doubt.

27.description: Important notes for strangers:- Cash only- There's bone in the porkchop sandwiches.- It is in no way healthy. You've got to approach each restaurant for what it is, and the Depot on 31st is hot, fast, greasy, cheap and open. Fries come free with your food. It's great when you need something on the way to a Sox game or when it's the middle of the night, approaching dawn, and your stomach needs filling.Some of my favorite memories when I was younger are of summer nights at the Depot, sitting on the trunk of someone's car and chomping down on a hot, messy Polish sausage with grilled onions and mustard.

32.description: We were being tourists last Sunday, and wound up driving down 31st street when wifey started yipping about being hungry.  I was feeling a bit peckish myself when we spied a crowd in front of Maxwell's.  Big crowds in front of walk-up windows are usually a good sign.  When we parked the car and opened the door, we caught a whiff of what the big attraction is.  Being unfamiliar with the local culinary customs, I asked the crowd what we should order.  They all cried pork chop sandwich en masse, so our decision was made.  Being pork chop sandwich virgins, we were warned to be careful of the bones, then we dug in.  Holy seared pig flesh, Batman, that crap is good. What have I been missing my whole life?  A pork chop, grilled onions and mustard on a bun. Who knew?  From now on, all future trips to Chi-town will require a stop at Maxwell's.  Thank you, Maxwell Street Depot, for broadening my epicurean acumen.

54.description: Somehow I picked up a Chicago accent with my polish sausage order at the Maxwell Street Depot.  It was a Chicago baptism.  They keep the menu simple, topping out at 6 lunch options here by my count.  If you're a first timer, like myself, I've heard the polish with fries is the way to go.  It was big, juicy and slathered with fried onions. Indigestion is on its way, but it's a necessary price you pay to experience an edible Chicago landmark.  The other price you'll pay, $3.50, is mere nominal damages.  You'll see Maxwell Street Polish offered on menus all around town, but from what I've heard, the Depot is the epicenter. It's the city's sausage home plate: get here, you're local. You'll sound like a Ditka superfan in no time.

48.description: Maxwell Street Depot, or "Depot," as most call it,  is the Holy Grail of late night food for drunk college students/young, and often belligerent, adults . For just over 5 bucks, you can get two cheeseburgers, two fries, and a grape/orange "pop." Be sure to get everything on it. There are very little things on earth that match the satisfaction of sinking your teeth in a pork chop sandwich in the wee hours of the morning. It's fast and cheap. Calm down foodies, sometimes it's the little things in life (like depot food) that make it worth living.

44.description: LEGENDARY.Any real Chicagoan will tell you this is da bomb.I was first introduced to it over 20 years ago and I still periodically go back for their pork chop sandwiches, extra onions, please!They've incrementally raised prices over the years but it remains a great deal. The sandwiches come with fries,. I've tried everything on their limited menu but I'd stick with the chop.It's fast, it's cheap, it's clean. And, nothing fancy about it.

24.description: What is there really to say about Maxwell Street Depot that hasn't been said about Johnny O's on 35th?  I do like this place, but it misses the mark on the neighborhood staple vibe.  Obviously it's amazing when stumbling back home at 3 AM in the public transit desert of Bridgeport, but I wouldn't go out of my way in the day to come here.  The plus side is they do have a small parking lot and because they're take-out only, things move quickly.  It's not much different from the other locations in the city. Beware of the grilled onions.  They're damn good but they cause issues down the road if you eat too many!

7.description: mmmmm mmmmmm mmmmm mmmmm the polish is awesome and so is the pork chop.  I honestly think I could make a sandwich out of the onions and be happy, they are so good.  Being the fact I live in the burbs and drive out here to get real polish should say something.  All the places in the burbs say that have Maxwell st polish and you never know what the hell your going to get, and no one out here knows how to do onions, it's unreal how they can't get it down.  Maxwell st depot on the other hand...awesome love it.  Get like 2 or tree polish, and couple chops wit cheese, and you'll be set baby.  Just remember cash only

49.description: The bar flies travel the city to come here for street level grub.Where the hell can you get OLD SCHOOL sandwich shop goodies 24 hours a day for pennies on the dollar? Even if you don't get down with the sausages, they cook up a very unique fish sandwich, which can be had with the usual tartar sauce and cheese, but with those uniquely flavored grilled onions.  The whole thing with fries comes to $3.20, tax included.

40.description: This place doesn't even need a review but I decided to leave one anyway. Its a Chicago legend. Pure unadultered Chicago late night drunk food at its finest. I've been visiting during the wee hours for four years after getting off of work. Always the same two Hispanic guys working through the night. Very friendly . very clean and very Chicago.

53.description: What do you do when it is 4am, you're inebriated from the previous night's happenings, you're hungrier than a hippo, and you have $5?Go to Maxwell St.What do you do when you want something greasy, there is a foot of snow on the ground, and no where else is open?Go to Maxwell St. Open 24 hours a day, 400 days a year, this place never closes.  The menu is simple- one thing to remember is that everything comes with fries.  Yes, even the fries.  If you order an order of fries, you get 2 bags of fries ($0.95).  A cheeseburger (my favorite- with extra grilled onions of course) is $2.40 and if you get two, it is a nice filling meal for under $5.The extent of the menu is as follow: hamburger, cheeseburger, double cheeseburger, polish, hotdog, pork chop sandwich, fries, pop (soda).When you order something with "everything" that means yellow mustard and grilled onions.  They have ketchup on the side, but you need to ask if you want it on your sandwich/dog.Overall this place is a college staple and is definitely on the cheap.

30.description: The pork chop sammie was terrible, but the hot dog was actually pretty tasty.  These two items both came with fries, and I bought a can of soda.  The total, with tip: $7.50.  This is absurd, so I'm willing to give Maxwell St. the benefit of the doubt since it is so freakin' cheap and open all night.  The "inside" of this place doesn't smell very inviting (how's that for the political answer) but the food is good enough to warrant a bad decision after a night out.  I won't be back, but I'm glad I checked this off of the life box!

46.description: The only thing that beats this is the original Jim's. Whenever here, always get the pork chop sandwich, which is a must. Fries come with! Burger and hot dog are not the best here. Their grilled onions I could eat alone. Open 24hrs. Cash only though! If you forget, there's a Citgo and Shell gas station nearby. The guys there are always so nice and sometimes give me free additional fries.

1.description: This place gets 5 starts because it's my hotdog stand. You might have your own place and think this one sucks. Good on you. Everyone had their's and this is mine. So if these guys mess up your order, i don't care it still gets 5 stars. The wait is too long, prices too high, food sub par. Doesn't matter still 5 stars.Why do I like this place so much, who knows, it's just the place I adopted when I moved to the area. If you don't have your own hotdog stand yet, try this one. Who knows, it could be your place too.

55.description: This is the real deal.  Best Polish sausage without a doubt.  Jim's Original and Weiners Circle's polishes don't hold a candle.

9.description: 4 stars because you get exactly what you expect. Good street food at a cheap price. I like getting the pork chop sandwich and I can never resist the greasy delicious fries.

26.description: I ordered a hot dog from here and you could tell that it was in the steamer a long time because the hot dog was mushy. The fries were too salty.

25.description: Never fails to deliver cheap street food that fills you up. Quite tasty porkchop sandwiches and fries. the peppers are too hot though. but if you feel like spicy then nibble on one. your mouth will be on fire! lol great joint! :D

12.description: For all its supposed South Side lore I didn't find this to be that great. Cash only, good prices, you order and it's ready very quickly. Which is good and bad. Good cuz it's fast but bad because it's kind of pre-fab schlock. The Polish sausage itself was good but the stringy mess of onions on top was devoid of real onion flavor. The sport peppers were 2 inches long and soft smooshy canned stuff, not the small crunchy hot sports I'm used to at MY dog joints. Fries were good. Oh, and get this. Though they have hotdogs, they only dress them Maxwell style (mustard, grilled onions, [wannabe] sports)! What? You can't get a proper Chicago style dog here? Crazy. I had asked for my Polish Chicago-style and found out. This place will please yuppie Northsiders who think they're getting some gritty "true Chicago experience" by getting food on the ruff ruff Souff Syde.

59.description: MAXWELL'S IS THE BEST! HANDS DOWN! If you live up north or have never been here, I feel sorry for you. I was recently introduced to Maxwell's, about 3 years ago or so and I have never turned back. This location has the best food of all of them. The staff is friendly, quick and you usually have your food before you finish paying. The menu is limited and so are the condiments. It's only ketchup, mustard or onions. Pork chops, polishes, hot dogs and burgers are all great here. Everything comes with Fries. You will smell like onions afterwards though so make sure it is a stop you make before going home to take a shower or something.

21.description: Soo in love with this place.. I've driven far out of my way more times than I'd want to admit, just for a Polish from here :) Inexpensive, quick, awesome food.. the fries arent anything special, but the polish & cheeseburgers are definitely worth the trip! :)

17.description: The Pork Chop is their featured food!!! Only $4 dollars for one Pork Chop,  fried chips and ''LaJiao''. Sometime I stop by and just bought pork chop only~~~

10.description: Being a tourist from Kansas, finding this place that serves street meat 24/7 was absolutely what we were looking for coming to Chicago. The prices were cheap and food was awesome. Highly recommended!

5.description: Maxwell is what you would expect from a place like this: fast, cheap, greasy. There is a parking lot and a window that you can order from. You can get your order and be on your way in less than five minutes. I usually get the sausage or cheeseburger. The pork chop is decent;  imagine a grilled pork chop with grilled onion between a hamburger bun. Fries have always been fresh.

3.description: Five stars, if you're drunk, high, or just really into the best greasy food ever. If you were there another time, you should really wait to review it until it's 2am! They're not trying to be anything more than that, and that's exactly what I want!

35.description: Who the hell would gripe about this place? The crew that works here is as fast as they get, the menu is pretty big considering the joint is 24 hours, and the fries are WHAT IS UP. Always hot and fresh, great burgers, etc. For when you gotta eat some junk, there's always Maxwell's.

19.description: The pork chop sammie was terrible, but the hot dog was actually pretty tasty.  These two items both came with fries, and I bought a can of soda.  The total, with tip: $7.50.  This is absurd, so I'm willing to give Maxwell St. the benefit of the doubt since it is so freakin' cheap and open all night.  The "inside" of this place doesn't smell very inviting (how's that for the political answer) but the food is good enough to warrant a bad decision after a night out.  I won't be back, but I'm glad I checked this off of the life box!

28.description: Whomp whomp. Since I reside in Bridgeport and get the craving for a Maxwell polish every once in a while it's easy for me to run to this place. Now no the polishes are no where as good as the polishes off of Roosevelt or the ones at original maxwell stops. There just alright. Make sure you request fresh fries. It's just alright

45.description: I want to give this place two stars but the fries I ordered were actually good. This place doesn't have barbeque sauce or hot sauce... I mean really? I couldn't eat the fries until I got home. I can't even wrap my brain around that. This is Chicago, get some sauces.

33.description: My wife use to come here when she was in college, and always talked about taking me here after we met, but never did until yesterday. We both work on the south side now, so its finally convenient to go.Both got a Double Cheeseburger with onions and mustard, shared a Porkchop, and a polish, both with onions and mustard.Damn it was good. I love burgers so much, and this was one of the best ones I have had in long time. I felt all my worries slip away while I was eating it, and in that moment, everyth

43.description: Great place to grab a quick bite!  Ask them for the pork chop sandwich with no bone!

2.description: I grew up in Bridgeport so Maxwell Street has been a good source of late night grub for a loooong time. And let me tell you, even though the ownership has changed the feel of the place has stayed completely the same. It tries to be nothing but a fast bite for people looking for something greasy and filling. They serve up classic for any "Maxwell Street" type of joints like pork chop sandwiches, polishes, burgers, and hot dogs. All orders come with grilled onions, mustard and a side of fries that are pretty good when warm but quickly become subpar once they get cool. There is a parking lot connected so drive by, get a quick order, and head out if you want. I've had everything but a hot dog here so let me give you my thoughts on some of the items:Pork chop sandwich - Probably the one item you need to get if you come here. There is a bone-in and a no-bone option. People are gonna hate on me for saying you should get the no-bone version, but what is a big piece of bone every doing in your sandwich? You gotta take the whole thing apart, it gets messy, and just isn't worth it. The chop is juice and tastes great with the mustard and onions.Polish - Good stuff here too. You get that nice snap from the polish casing. Can't go wrong. Not the best polish, but very doable.Double cheeseburger - Why do a single if you can do a double? Lots of cheesy goodness and a really health size. The cheese can overwhelm the patties, but that might not be the worst thing in the world, right?All in all, good place to great a quick bite. Opened 24/7! It's really greasy so I can only come here once in a blue moon, but I'm always happy when I come.

18.description: What is there really to say about Maxwell Street Depot that hasn't been said about Johnny O's on 35th?  I do like this place, but it misses the mark on the neighborhood staple vibe.  Obviously it's amazing when stumbling back home at 3 AM in the public transit desert of Bridgeport, but I wouldn't go out of my way in the day to come here.  The plus side is they do have a small parking lot and because they're take-out only, things move quickly.  It's not much different from the other locations in the city. Beware of the grilled onions.  They're damn good but they cause issues down the road if you eat too many!

41.description: Ugh..I wish I didn't like this place.  The polishes are so good, the order takers are quick, and the convenient parking lot makes it too easy to run in and grab a dog.  The major con about this place is it stinks up your car for about a week.

52.description: Nothing beats Depot for the late night drunk food, or hangover food the next day. Service is always fast and everything on the (small) menu is delicious, especially the famous pork chop sandwich and polish. Make sure you get the onions topping, it makes it all taste that much better!

50.description: 3 stars: A-OK.This place is cheaper than Express Grill/Jim's Original on Union.The menu is a bit simpler, if you can imagine that.They have a parking lot, which is kind of convenient. It's not exactly dirt cheap anymore, but it's still approximately McDonald's money.The pork chop here isn't exactly as good as the one at Jim's. If you eat them back to back, which I did, you will see that the onions are different and the sport peppers are kind of weak here.Also, the fries are garbage. Generic & flavorless.Not bad, but not my favorite.

4.description: If you like a good juicy polish, this is your spot! Their polishes are phenomenal! The one tip I will give you though is this, unless you really and I mean really like onions, tell them to put about half the amount as usual because they really load your polish with onions! If you're around for breakfast they actually make a decent bacon, egg,& cheese on a bun as well. However, they loose points for only having fries available to go with it instead of some kind of hashbrowns or oven Brown's. And besides the bacon,egg, & cheese, they don't offer any other type of breakfast sandwich. They do still serve polishes during breakfast hours.There is no seating, so plan on a carry-out order.

6.description: The other 24 hour hot dog stand in bridgeport (coupled with Johnny Ohs on 35th) this one is on 31st and more east, to serve the other side of the neighborhood. It doesn't have as wide a menu as Johnny Ohs, and doesn't take credit which sucked, but I got the polish and hot dog which were really good and may have even been better than Johnny Ohs, also the prices were pretty low too. If I'm ever out in that part of bridgeport again I'll deh hit it up

22.description: I'm addicted to the double cheeseburgers. My daily routine over the summer was to grab a burger here then walk to Scoops for an ice cream cone. I have no shame. The place is cash only and there's a walk up window. They're remarkably fast at getting the food out.

15.description: Many times, I come here on a whim late after work. This is my go to place for late night grub. Fast and cheap! The fries are crispy like the way I want it. The burgers are average but nevertheless fulfills an appetite for good ol' American food.

57.description: Aww man!!  The Chicago hot dog joint "go to" when I'm there. All of those other Chicago Dog Joints out there don't do justice to the meat shaped like a dingdong.  The Street's gone but the city was nice enough to open up a shack for these guys (heart breaking but good for the community renovation).....Pork Chop SanwichesPolish DogAwesome.  All you need on them is Grilled onions & regular mustard.

20.description: Five stars because I've been coming here for as long as I can remember. Literally all you need is five bucks in your pocket and you'll go home feeling like a champ. Pork chop and polish is the way to go and ask for hot peppers on the side. They also have an assortment of fruity pops. Personal favorite is strawberry fantA.

36.description: Polish Hot Dog: Great!!!!!   It is a hidden legend in Bridgeport area.It is 24 hour open. plenty of space to parking. And I will usually take some to the Sox games.

14.description: July 28th 2015.3rd stopHotdogs are generic regular bun, vienna, mustard and lots of grill onions. If your looking for dogs avoid as possible but they have amazing pork chop sandwich.

1.description: We ate here last year and I made the mistake of ordering something with mole sauce without asking what mole sauce was or knowing what mole sauce tasted like. Turns out - I don't like mole sauce. It was my fault and I feel really bad because my boyfriend and I kept joking about what an idiot I was, and I think our laughing might have come across to the waitress as mean-spirited, which was not the case at all. She was very nice and professional. Would love to try something else on the menu and update my review. My boyfriend's burrito was very good and we ended up sharing it and reading about mole sauce on our phones.

9.description: My friend and I came here for dinner this past Tuesday evening 6/16/2015. We brought a bottle of Jose Cuervo Margarita as it is BYOB. Our waitress was very kind and as soon as I put the bottle on the table she asked if we wanted glasses of ice for our margaritas. We happily said "Yes, please" Then she insightfully gave us more than a few minutes to decide what we'd like to order (again we appreciated the time because we hadn't seen each other in a while so we were catching up). We ordered guacamole and then I almost said "No, cancel it" because I cannot eat onions. The waitress told me they could make it without onions. I told her I still would like tomatoes and cilantro and she brought out a dish with avocado, tomatoes, and cilantro and I mixed it all together myself. I was so happy! I ordered the red mole chicken {which I LOVE!} and my friend ordered the chipotle chicken. We were both very happy with our plates and we both enjoyed the service.

12.description: Had lunch here Saturday (10/24) and it being my first time here too.  Over all experience was good, the server was nice. I ended up ordering the carne asada medium but most of the steak was cooked well done. However, it was still pretty good, but would have been better cooked medium.  There were problems with the corn tortillas. They seemed to have been re-warmed up in a microwave, as they were tough and chewy.

21.description: Excellent! Authentic Mexican menu. Nice to enjoy food just like my gram used to make.And BYOB.... What else can you ask for?!

16.description: Gio's Italian is one of my favorite restaurants, so had high expectations for this restaurant. Glad they met them as the food was excellent. The place isn't big but decent amount of tables and we didn't have to wait.As vegetarians there were enough options for dinner (had veggie combo and wife had stuffed poblano peppers). I also had the strawberry milkshake which was fantastic, fresh strawberry chunks made my day.

17.description: This was a tough one, we really love Gios Italian so we had high expectations. Went Saturday night around 8 and got seated right away. We got chips and salsa quickly but then nothing, not even drink order for a solid 10 minutes. Strike one. When someone noticed we were waiting they called the girl over for our order. I asked the difference between the carne asada and the mexican steak. Response was "carne asada is in the picture, mexican steak is the same thing just sliced up with peppers like fajitas". So we got one of each and quesadilla appetizer. Quesadilla was nothing special. When we got our food we were so disappointed. I wish I had taken a picture. The carne asada was about an inch and a half by 7inches! I saw the table next to us get theirs and theirs was more like a palm size. Obviously very inconsistent. Mine was thinly cut pieces of beef-NOT slices of carne asada. I'm talking about the kind you get in Mongolian beef or use for steak sandwiches. And it had this weird liquidy sauce that was the "juices and what it was cooked in". I ate it, it wasn't horrible but it wasn't good. I was hungry. The last piece barely made it down though and now I'm regretting it. I usually give new places the benefit of the doubt but they need to do a lot if they want to keep it up.

10.description: Friendly and attentive service. Very kid-friendly. The fried smelts with garlic sauce were awesome. Mole rojo was good, but not remarkable. Definitely too sweet for some tastes, but I liked it. Tacos were not anything to write home about.

5.description: THE BEST chicken mole tacos I have ever had, and this particular item is my absolute favorite food of all time so I consider myself a bit of an "expert":)  You HAVE to try them!  You won't be sorry!We ordered for the whole office, and everyone was extremely happy with their dishes as well (steak tacos, and a chicken dish on the bone).  Gios was ready on time and very easy for carry-out

11.description: I had the carne asada carry out and it was great.  The prices are fair and reasonable as well as the portions. I do plan on going back to try other things and hope it's the same quality. I will recommend this place as I have been looking for a good Mexican place in Bridgeport and this may be it.

3.description: Impressions of Gio's: they probably should have stuck with Italian.If anyone is similar with Gio's in Bridgeport, they know that they serve one of the best Italian cuisines out of a small shop in the corner of Lowe and 27th street. The Gio's Mexican cannot be compared to the Italian site however.  I came with a small group of friends during the weekday, and the restaurant was completely empty. Typically, not a good sign, but it is the weekday, so give them a break.  I ordered the chicken in mole sauce. The portions of chicken were huge and could easily serve 2 people. The chicken did not have much seasoning applied and the mole sauce was too sweet for my taste. It was good experience to try out Gio's Mexican. However, I am starting to feel like this location is cursed, since there has probably been three different restaurants at this location over the past 4 years.

0.description: I live right across the street and I order frequently. The food is always delicious (well above average), and the service is always friendly. My most common order is the steak burrito, it's on the high end of prices for a burrito but totally worth it. Delicious. I dined-in the other night and ordered the Carne Asada, and it was really, really good. One of the better steaks I've had any where of late. I've also had the Mexican style steak and the Tinga de Pollo torta, both were great I'd recommend them to anyone.There's a bunch of great places for food on 31st St in this area, but Gios is probably my favorite.

20.description: Gio's Italian is one of my favorite restaurants, so had high expectations for this restaurant. Glad they met them as the food was excellent. The place isn't big but decent amount of tables and we didn't have to wait.As vegetarians there were enough options for dinner (had veggie combo and wife had stuffed poblano peppers). I also had the strawberry milkshake which was fantastic, fresh strawberry chunks made my day.

19.description: Great food.   Wonderful owners.  Great service.  BYOB is a great option to save money on drinks.

2.description: Gio's serves basic Tex-Mex food that's not prepared terribly well.  I don't know how they screwed up a taco salad but they did.  Limp lettuce.  Flavorless tomatoes.  Dressing without any zip.  The carne asada was scarcely better.  The place lacks charm and the servers don't know the menu.  At least there's no corkage fee.Pros: BYOBCons: Food is not very good.

18.description: Just left Gio's!  This was my third time there.  First time was wonderful the carne asada was good.  Quality of food was average.  Went back a second time why not give it another try.....again food was average!   Thought maybe in 4 months menu may have changed.  One plus, they did have specials!!!  Thought why not?  Let's just say this was my last visit!!!!   Quality of food has gotten worse.   The steak tasted fatty and rewarmed I had the steak quesadillas.  My guest had the Milanesa torta.  The steak was so thin that the bread crumbs were holding it together.   And of course the topper,  on one of the hottest days of the year the air was hardly on.   I asked the staff on 3 occasions to please turn it up and nothing was done.  The thermostat was in view and I happen to be facing it!!!    Let's just say it was not a nice evening!  Will not be going back!!!!

13.description: I love Gios Italian so when I heard they opened a Mexican restaurant I had to try it. The place was a little busy, but not packed. Servers were very young and not very experienced. Salsa that came to the table was tasteless and it seemed as if it was just a broiled tomato that was smashed in a bowl. Entrees were not edible, the meat specifically. I got the Mexican steak and the meat was old. I could smell it the moment they put it in front of me. The beans and rice were out of the box and nothing to brag about. The "guac" was just a mashed up avocado. Move on to the charbroiled chicken. Portion size was good, but meat was tasteless. Pico de gallo was tasteless also and a true disappointment. I will not be back and I think they should not associate themselves with the other Italian location.

4.description: So far so good. The app is great, we ordered the torquitos and Guacamole, Mexican style steak and chicken with green mole... delish... love it. Just as good as Gio's deli.  I recommend

6.description: I'm a big fan of this place. Relatively new and absolutely delicious AND its BYOB!!!!Mole rojo - on point. Made here. If you like moles you need to try theirs.Carne asada (skirt steak) - beautiful cuts. Made to your liking. Serve it with grilled nopal (cactus). Throw some limón and salt into their homemade tortilla de maíz! Yum!Chilaquiles Rojos - one of the best (to compare - I also dig the chilaquiles from Pancho Pistolas & Lalos -26street).Service is fantastic. Their staff is amazingly attentive.Chef came out and is such a nice person. Music today on Mother's Day was Mexican trios, mariachi- "la música del alma" says my pops.Same owners as Gio Italian restaurant on 28th & Lowe. All around great food, owners, workers.Did I mention it's BYOB?!

15.description: Excellent! Authentic Mexican menu. Nice to enjoy food just like my gram used to make.And BYOB.... What else can you ask for?!

7.description: Our first experience has been great at this restaurant. I wanted to see if the second round would be as good as the first and I have to say that it was even better than the first. We ordered the mixed taco dinner plates with the guac appetizer. The steak, chicken, and the fish tacos were freshly made, and hit the spot. They were seasoned just right, but did not overpower the taste of the meat. The guac was extremely fresh, as if they just took the avocado and smashed it just for us. I am very impressed so far.

8.description: Ordered carryout from here yesterday.    Steaks tacos were great.   My wife had fish tacos that she said were excellent.    Best flan she's ever had.   Quick and easy pick up.

14.description: I was there yesterday with my family. We walked in and the waitress didn't even acknowledge us. We waited a little over 5 minutes and didn't even get served a glass of water. I'm glad we didn't get that waitress, we got Jaime instead. He was wonderful! Our food took some time because they were a bit understaffed in the kitchen, but Jaime kept checking up on us. The food was delicious and his service was great!!

0.description: A real sleeper in Bridgeport.  This store has been here for years as far as I can remember, and has a good selection of Levis, Dickies, and other work clothes, as well as a good selection of Nike and Reebok basketball shoes (even some jordan brand) that you'll find cheaper than you will at foot locker.  Great for accessories and shirts too.

3.description: I had high hopes that this would be a great place for smaller bands to play, but it turned out to be a total nightmare. The room is nice and decorated very well with trees and lights and swaths of gauzy fabric. We were told it would be cheap to get in, donation basis, and when we arrived it was $10!!!!  I understand there was food, but we didn't come for dinner, we came for music. I doubt the bands saw any of that money. They make bands turn down here. Don't even bother bringing an amp. If you want Christian ranting and interludes by a freaky new-age pianist comforting you with "the sounds of angels" come here. They also  got really mad when someone byob and told them to drink outside or in their car or chug in the bathroom and then come in and watch the music.There were several hippie girls twirling with hula hoops in the middle of the floor. Completely bizarre.If you want to be ripped off, chastised, interrupted by hula hoops and converted to Christianity, this is the place for you.

1.description: They used to host events every week, and now every couple of months.  There is something magical about this place.  How often do you go to a show and truly feel a part of a family?!  The variety of acts is vast, the food is homemade and excellent, and the people are so friendly.  A true all-ages experience, from kids to retirees.  The art corner is cool, with coloring and art supplies for anyone to use.I love this place, it's a creative home to many young and old.PS I dance with hula hoops and it's really fun :-)  just let us know if it is bothering you and we'll get out of your face---  I love how all types of dance can interact with the music here.  The dance floor is large and the people are non-judgemental.A great space filled with pure joy!

2.description: Definitely a great place to see a huge variety of local music in a unique atmosphere. More decadent than other venues of the ilk both visually and food-wise, the crowd here was somewhat diverse and seems to vary week to week. Donate and there's a whole buffet waiting for you (vegetarian friendly), and a sizable selection of teas. It's a pretty friendly, comfortable place to come and hang out on Sunday nights.And I gotta give them credit for being non-profit and completely volunteer-based. Oh, and I don't think there's BYOB: it's an all-ages venue.

5.description: I showed some work here a few months ago and the staff is the sweetest ever! I enjoy the artists and musicians they have weekly and LOVE the food!

6.description: Performed here once with my band and had a good time. There is a $10 donation to get in, but it's worth it to partake in their all you can eat vegan food. The chef named, "Spoon" is a great cook! The sound was okay. We were a loud noise rock band, and they had a little trouble getting the sound right, but our amps took care of it just fine. I look forward to seeing shows there and even performing again with my new band.

7.description: First off, this place hosted my art for a month, so they're awesome!  But besides the art, they have great music and food. The vibe is laid-back and artsy very trippy.  Everything the other reviewers have said is true.  This is a one of a kind spot - or at least in the alt. cultural space realm.

8.description: This IS a great place for artists to showcase their work and the food is amazing.  It's definitely an experimental place for younger crowds to come hang. All the music I've seen is fabulous. Just watch out for flying glowball and hula hoop dancers interrupting the music acts that you may be trying to enjoy! I wish someone would tell them to move aside. When the act is a solo piano player, it kills the vibe and if you look at faces in the audience, people are cringing.

9.description: Dear BYOB friend, can you tell me what church you go to that allows people to bring in their own alcohol? Then I won't have to stay home on Sunday mornings. The food is delicious, vegetarian friendly, and worth the $10 dollars, moreover, I am sure if you are too poor to afford it, they will let you in. Did you ask? I think if you spend $10 dollars on crappy food, games, smack, whatever you may be into, you can give $10 to an organization that is inviting you in, and creating a vehicle for artists to communicate there message through music, and by the way they have food, tea, and when I went delicious tiny cake piece treats. As an artist, its hard enough finding places to let you play, and I would be honored to play for free at a place like this to keep people coming in to support it.  I never saw any Hula dancers, or New Age pianist. What I DID hear between acts was hands down the best DJ I ever heard in my LIFE. I go to lots of shows too, of varying genres from hip hop to Lyric Op-era. He mostly played Soul, and experimental jazz, but I was in awe. I had to keep apologizing because I was constantly bugging him about songs. In fact I was looking online to see if he had a set list, or an email or something when I stumbled across these reviews, and happened to be logged-in, fancy that. I don't even think he was a DJ professionally, but his musical taste were SUPERB! If anyone knows who I am talking about let me know.

0.description: There is a need to keep these kind of places open, the underground venue, they are our cultural blood-bank, it is the centrifuge for creativity, where we share our synapses of a good idea before it's given a shallow grave. The Orphanage, is of course, above ground, in fact, on the third floor. Ten dollar donation gets you food, lots of DIY music that is welcoming to a new genre, lots of new interesting people, to talk to, to meet, which of course is the best part. It's on the near South Side (Bridgeport, aka, parking) and easily accessible. BYOB is the pathos, and the love of music is shared in the air. Killer floor to stand, millions of couches, clean, colorful, always fun.Be here now.

4.description: There was a concert there this Saturday night Aug 20 2011, it ran from about 6pm to 11ish. There were six bands and it was pretty good. Lots of younger hipsters, and also students from IIT and UIC- those two categories do overlap, lol. I'm glad that this place is open again!Event page: facebook.com/event.php?e…Their main organizing location: facebook.com/TheOrphanag…

3.description: Service was alright. The lady that did my nails seemed to be  in a rush. She did not even apply a base coat. My first n last visit.

1.description: The no chip manicure is nothing to write home about. Nails started to peel the first day. I did ask that top of the nail was painted, however I was chatting with a friend and did not think to check her work. Unfortunately this happened to my friends nails as well.

2.description: This place is cheaply priced, but that's reflected in the quality. I had a manicure done on Sunday and by Monday the polish was cracking and by Tuesday it was chipping off completely. I noticed the manicurist did not do a complete second coat on many of my nails (missed spots). Even though it's inexpensive and close to my house, I will not return. Waste of money.

9.description: Ladies if you are looking for great nails please go here. Ping does my nails and they are perfect every single time. She's fun outgoing and a great nail technician. I love love love my nails. Everyone there is so friendly and nice!! Great prices. Great people!

10.description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I was here on 11/12/14 to get my nails done with my friend getting married, another bridesmaid, and mother of the groom. They said they closed at 8 and my appointment was at 7. To begin I got there and was rushed to the chair without even having time to look at which colors I wanted just because it had been specified that I wanted no chip. She didn't really understand what I wanted with my nails and kept making a face when I asked her to do a little more to fix them. The brides nails started peeling after an hour of being there. The other bridesmaid got a french and didn't get a clear shiny coat over. Nothing but issues. I understand that they close at 8 but we didn't not have to be rushed. Fast forward a week later,  my no chip is peeling. No chips should be guaranteed for 2 weeks. I called them they claimed they couldn't give me a refund and I had to come in to for them to determine if they can fix it. Not even worth my time and money. If you want a great no chip with a 2 week or more guarantee visit happy nails in lakeview!

4.description: Pricey and no chip machines are out of date you think they would have qualify lights as well as gel polish

6.description: So I got my mani/pedi on Sunday 7/21 and here I am in the Turks & Caicos islands having the time of my life. But yet, 4 days after I get the NO CHIP mani and spa pedi - they are both chipped and nasty!! I am so upset with this place and the fact that I have chipped nails 4 days after the actual service while on vacaction. I'll add 2 pics. I would not return here and I recommend you not go either.

12.description: I took my mother there for mother's day a few days early and it was packed but they kindly made room for her.  My mother keeps on telling me what a nice and meticulous job Sue(?) has done.  She got the no-chip manicure and still raves about it weeks after.  I thought the price was high but it matches the sale price of other salons.  Very clean and nice people.   Call and make an appointment and you won't be disappointed.

5.description: Got my eyebrows waxed and while they did a great job, I noticed the technician reused the same application stick. I'm assuming this is a common practice and I'll likely not be returning for waxes due to the fear of what's in the wax and the cross-contamination from other, more intimate, waxes.

11.description: Love it here! I've been twice and really enjoyed myself the second time around especially. I went for a spa facial and manicure. I figured they would put us in separate rooms but was pleased when we were able to be side-by-side in one room. The ladies were very professional and made me feel excellent! Sue did my facial and manicure, and did a great job. She was very gentle on my face, yet was firm for the shoulder massage. I was disappointed during the roughness but appreciated it when it was over with. As for the manicure, it was perfect and I will certainly return. Sue even put my mom and I's jacket on as to not ruin our nails. A detail that I found to be very sweet.Finally, it's been two days since my treatment and my face looks fabulous!!! I will be back for both the manicure and facial...and probably even a pedi! ;)

8.description: Ping and her staff are so professional and friendly.  As soon as you walk in the door, someone will greet and welcome you.  Ping is the best manicurist I have ever met and so charming.  As the owner of the salon, she goes out of her way to make sure everything is perfection - hence the name - Perfect 10.  You will not be disappointed at this hidden gem in Bridgeport :)

0.description: I went to perfect 10 to get a full set of gel nails. First, they did acrylic with a gel overlay which is not the same as actual gel nails. The nail technician did take her time and the end result looked great. However, not even a week went by before most of my nails came off. Pros: Walk-in's, take their time, good selection of colors, and friendlyCons: Does not do actual gel nails, acrylic nails will fall off within a week, and semi-cleaned workstation/tools. Overall expierence=4If you want actual gel nails,  Izabella's on clark and fullerton is the place to go!

7.description: I have literally tried every nail place in my neighborhood and this is by far the best. Super super clean.They take there time and do a great job. The best thing to do is make an appointment.

58.description: Great coffee shop! During the school year, I'll stop by every morning for my usual. My day is not the same if I don't make my usual stop for the great coffee. Everyone has always been very friendly and very respectful. Only bad thing I'll say is that they run out of my favorite muffins too fast, which is not a bad thing. Perhaps I need to wake up 5 minutes earlier! :) Great people, great environment and great coffee!

56.description: 1. Good coffee and veggie wrap.2. Air conditioner doesn't work in both rooms.  85 and 95F temp. 3. Needs remodeling. Tables could be cleaned miter often. 4. Slow,  slow Internet with unstable connection.  Ping 30-130 and download 1.3 MBps.

29.description: The 2 mile run to get here was most definitely worth it. Bridgeport Coffee has an antique and almost home-y like feel. They're not going for the pretentious hipster vibe rather a cozy hipster one. They're not aloof or intimidating. They simply serve up fine cups of hot coffee--freshly ground and roasted in-house. I am such a sucker for independent coffee shops that source & roast their own coffee. A great cup starts from the source and it doesn't get better than the fresh stuff.Their Hardscrabble Blend is what they use for all of their espresso drinks. While I don't have the most refined coffee palette to characterize flavors profiles and point out nuances of this-and-that, I know what good coffee tastes like and bad coffee tastes like. I brought home a few bags of beans which ran about $13/bag. They have superb seating. Ample indoor and outdoor tables. They also have a back room if you prefer more privacy. My favorite aspect about this place aside the coffee is their elevated indoor seating area and tons of natural light. They have a '2nd floor' of sorts for their window seats. It. Is. Amazing. Major kudos to whoever decided this was a good idea--because it is. In additional to coffee & nice seating, they have a selection of usual foods to snack on: baked goods, sandwiches, bagels, etc. For breakfast, I went with a toasted multi-grain bagel with hummus. Not sure where they get their bagels from but it was good! Not a lame Sara Lee bagel from the grocery store that's for sure. :D 5 stars for Bridgeport coffee.

42.description: Waited an hour for a turkey sandwich; had to ask three times before they brought it.  Won't be coming back.

23.description: Bridgeport Coffee CompanyFood was spectacular - usually a bit skeptical with tuna. Fresh fruit option was superb. Internet is fast, and environment is very chill. I like the modern / contemporary feel. If only the person that took my order and served me was not acting like he had "trust issues" and assisted me by making a recommendation since I was so unsure on what to get. I mean, like "pulling teeth."I would probably be better off ordering  from the quit back room in the back.

47.description: This is what a local coffee house is supposed to be! Great coffee.  Great vibe. Yummy chocolate donuts. Go!

8.description: This is a small coffee shop located on the corner of Morgan and 31st. The design and characteristics of this building are really unique, on the outside and the inside. I really like their antique-looking ceiling.I had tea at their place and it's normal regular tea. There's not much you can do to spice up tea. I think I enjoyed the atmosphere and that's what attracts me to this place. It's quiet, intimate, and one of a kind.

31.description: I had a great donut and a vanilla ice latte. The atmosphere was the perfect mix of buzz and homework. Very nice!

34.description: Great spot. Plenty of seating, delicious coffee. As a non-hipster...this coffee shop is welcoming to all.

16.description: Super nice staff, delicious coffee, a make-your-own-wrap option, TONS of seating and free wifi. Great place to park for an hour or two and do some quality reading/studying/chilling. I dug it!

13.description: I like visiting local coffee shops and found myself in Bridgeport.  Like my normal routine in trying a new establishment I've never been before, I ordered the chai latte.  I was a little hungry, so I grabbed an apple turnover because it was the first thing I saw by the register.I'm fond of the chai latte.  The kick of "chai" had a good, strong punch and didn't taste diluted.  However, the apple turnover was just ordinary.  I know that the pastries weren't made in the house.  In addition, the selections were minimal.  I understand that since it was approaching to late afternoon, and they were the leftovers.  The front of coffee shop was quickly filled up by students, working professionals, and people who liked to chill and had a relaxing time chatting.  Regulars were then moving to the back for more seating.  There were outlets available, not plenty.  I was able to find one to charge my phone by the window.  Some yelpers mentioned the dysfunctional wifi access.  The signal was present the entire time that I was using my I-pad.  In other words, I didn't experience any technical difficulties.  The prices were pretty reasonable.  The most expensive coffee is under $4 for a large size (16 oz.).  They have sandwiches available, for $6 in average.  Southside hipsters apparently enjoy hanging out in here.  Take notes, Logan Square and Wicker Park: you folks charge WAY too much for stuff in general...please scale down on the costs.

11.description: The coffee is great but the Internet connectivity is just awful. This was my go to place whenever I needed to get work done and I didn't want to drive far.  I haven't been back here in a while and decided to comeback today just for old times and to catch up on some work.  I keep making the same mistake of ordering a drink before checking that the Internet works.  Now I'm out here with my coffee and unable to get any work done.  I've informed the staff before about resetting the router and they either have no clue how to do it or don't feel any sense of urgency with taking care of it.  In the past I've given this place 5 stars due to the great coffee, ample seating, and proximity to home.  But I have to give it to 2 stars because this place does not provide me with the experience I am looking for anymore.  Update:  the Internet is now working but I've just wasted an hour on my phone browsing the web and typing this Yelp review. Advice:  if you're here just to get a cup of coffee then this is one of the best places to go.   If you're here to get work done, I'd suggest checking the Internet connection before ordering and wasting your time and money.

39.description: Overall, this is the best coffee shop anywhere south of Madison and one of my top five in the city.  Their Hardscrabble blend espresso is to die for and is what I use at home.  The sandwiches, wraps, and bagels at this location are also very good and not very pricey.  The atmosphere here is great and is my go-to location to chill for a few hours with a good read or a friend.  My only beef with this location (they have 2 others) is the staff can at times seem annoyed to have to serve you.  I like the baristas over at Jackalope a little better just because of the love and attention they put into each drank.  Great work, Mike!

37.description: Small but homey coffee shop. Great atmosphere. Love their latte! Good place for studying, but sometimes it's hard to park.

0.description: Quintessential Chicago coffee shop.  Bridgeport roasts their own coffee, and do a darn good job of it.  The baristas know their stuff, and the breakfast sandwich options are solid (and customizable).  Bridgeport's space is cozy and very much what you'd expect out of an independent coffee shop.  They've also expanded over time to include other rooms/space in the same building.  Totally worth a visit!

38.description: This is a small coffee shop located on the corner of Morgan and 31st. The design and characteristics of this building are really unique, on the outside and the inside. I really like their antique-looking ceiling.I had tea at their place and it's normal regular tea. There's not much you can do to spice up tea. I think I enjoyed the atmosphere and that's what attracts me to this place. It's quiet, intimate, and one of a kind.

51.description: Hmmm, what can I say. Ordered a breakfast sandwich w/ ham, AMERICAN chez n NO veggies. Got it with turkey, cheddar n jalapeños.  Told the guy at the register and he told me it comes w/ jalapeños. Last time I checked jalapeños are a vegetable. He did apologize and said he would remember that for the next time. He had no clue on how to fix the problem and told me to yelp him, so here I am. Won't b a next time.

27.description: I've been coming to this place for a few years now. What can I say I don't like to give out of 5 star rating unless it's absolutely ,positively deserve and this place definitely deserves it. Great coffee, great food, outstanding service, a ton of space to drink your coffee or tea, eat your breakfast or your lunch. Free wifi and always immaculately clean. iIt still has a very old school feel to it while still maintaining  a hip modern atmosphere It's located in a very old corner store front. Outstanding job Bridgeport Coffee Company I will be coming back sooner than later.

32.description: They always have that amazing classical music!!! It is just sooooooo good!!! It is also a perfect place to study!!! Everybody is so quite.

54.description: Maybe because I'm a Bridgeport resident, but I just love the vibe this place gives out. It's homely and downright peaceful. The coffee is amazing. They really know how to roast their brew. This place attracts amazing and unique people with all sorts of background and ethnicity. Pros-The aromatic roast of beautifully grounded coffee beansThe people you seeThe large, extensive sitting rooms. Cons- I can't find a closer place to this coffee shop. Haha!

48.description: Friendly baristas. Fan of their mocha lattes. Free wifi. Street parking easy to find and free. There's a homey feel to this place and a large back room if no seating available in the front. I haven't tried the food, but their brownie is very good and rich. Go!

44.description: Bridgeport Coffee Company is a cozy coffee shop with a nice variety of food and drinks.  I came with a friend on a dreary Tuesday afternoon and it was pretty busy.  I ordered an agave soy latte and my friend had the coffee of the day.  Overall my visit here was pleasant but I do have to deduct some points because they forgot my drink and I had to go up to the barista to ask after I was passed up by everyone.  My latte was pretty good; it was a bit too sweet for my taste but had a nice layer of thick foam on top which I'm a sucker for.  I also liked that I could still taste the coffee in the latte unlike some of Starbuck's lattes which are overpowered with their 6 pumps of syrups (ok I'm exaggerating but you know what I mean).  Bridgeport Coffee Co has a laid back atmosphere and friendly baristas.  Check it out for a good cup of joe and then hit up Chinatown for some yummy food!

24.description: Order a breakfast sandwich and you won't be disappointed. So darn good. The hot peppers they include are a stroke of genius- I ask for double!I'm just visiting Chicago and working nearby so I will only have the pleasure of this sandwich one last time tomorrow morning. Good work, Bridgeport team.

7.description: Quaint and comfy decor, spacious, good music, good coffee, delicious sandwiches and wraps . Great establishment for the neighborhood, many coffee shops could take notes on how to run a coffee shop. The prices are also low compared to other coffee shops.

49.description: Wow! What a wonderful coffee joint. Great service. Some serious gourmet shit!

40.description: Great neighborhood coffee places. Free wifi and parking.  Great place to read and enjoy a great coffee.

53.description: I'd give it a 3.5 if I could. Bridgeport Coffee Company has a lot going for it - diverse, interesting clientele; very friendly staff; good, freshly made sandwiches and pastries; lots of seating, including outdoors; yummy iced coffee. However, they also messed up our order and, while waiting in line for the bathroom, overhead THREE other people checking in about orders that hadn't shown up yet or trying to fix orders that were messed up. As others have noted, it was also really hot inside on a temperate day...I imagine it would be cozy and comfy in the winter, but it was a little steamy in the summer. Luckily, we took advantage of the outdoor seating!

30.description: Love this place. Great coffee and staff. I've spent many hours working, visiting with friends and just relaxing here.

46.description: I like visiting local coffee shops and found myself in Bridgeport.  Like my normal routine in trying a new establishment I've never been before, I ordered the chai latte.  I was a little hungry, so I grabbed an apple turnover because it was the first thing I saw by the register.I'm fond of the chai latte.  The kick of "chai" had a good, strong punch and didn't taste diluted.  However, the apple turnover was just ordinary.  I know that the pastries weren't made in the house.  In addition, the selections were minimal.  I understand that since it was approaching to late afternoon, and they were the leftovers.  The front of coffee shop was quickly filled up by students, working professionals, and people who liked to chill and had a relaxing time chatting.  Regulars were then moving to the back for more seating.  There were outlets available, not plenty.  I was able to find one to charge my phone by the window.  Some yelpers mentioned the dysfunctional wifi access.  The signal was present the entire time that I was using my I-pad.  In other words, I didn't experience any technical difficulties.  The prices were pretty reasonable.  The most expensive coffee is under $4 for a large size (16 oz.).  They have sandwiches available, for $6 in average.  Southside hipsters apparently enjoy hanging out in here.  Take notes, Logan Square and Wicker Park: you folks charge WAY too much for stuff in general...please scale down on the costs.

1.description: Great coffeehouse in Bridgeport. Super coffee, really good sandwiches, and a nice vibe going on here. We sat in the far back underneath the world map. My friend says it feels like an old schoolhouse and I agree. It is a corner home converted into a coffee shop, and I love the  creaky wooden floors and different rooms that are separate enough to have totally different vibes - even different music. We listened to opera while we sat in the back room.This is a great spot to grab lunch and stay for a while. They serve sandwiches, flatbreads, bagels, a soup of the day, and have a bakery case.

55.description: Great coffee, large space with plenty of room for those planning to study or camp out for extended periods. Delicious chipotle veggie sandwich. Better than Jackalope in my opinion, which is more expensive and not as good.

9.description: If you genuinely love the taste of coffee, Bridgeport Coffee is where it's at! I love the versatile feel of this cafe, as I've studied here and met with clients as well. I recently moved out of Illinois and would do anything for their all-day breakfast sandwiches! Appreciate them for me, please! Their pasties are always fresh daily and I love that they carry alternatives to milk as well.

26.description: The coffee is great but the Internet connectivity is just awful. This was my go to place whenever I needed to get work done and I didn't want to drive far.  I haven't been back here in a while and decided to comeback today just for old times and to catch up on some work.  I keep making the same mistake of ordering a drink before checking that the Internet works.  Now I'm out here with my coffee and unable to get any work done.  I've informed the staff before about resetting the router and they either have no clue how to do it or don't feel any sense of urgency with taking care of it.  In the past I've given this place 5 stars due to the great coffee, ample seating, and proximity to home.  But I have to give it to 2 stars because this place does not provide me with the experience I am looking for anymore.  Update:  the Internet is now working but I've just wasted an hour on my phone browsing the web and typing this Yelp review. Advice:  if you're here just to get a cup of coffee then this is one of the best places to go.   If you're here to get work done, I'd suggest checking the Internet connection before ordering and wasting your time and money.

25.description: Great chai. Great tables and clean service. Why three stars? Because the gothic terrible punk music will bum you out. Just terrible. I don't expect a coffeehouse to have mellow music all the time but it's super disruptive. I had to increase the adderall dosage. Bring headphones. All the headphones.

12.description: I've been coming to this place for a few years now. What can I say I don't like to give out of 5 star rating unless it's absolutely ,positively deserve and this place definitely deserves it. Great coffee, great food, outstanding service, a ton of space to drink your coffee or tea, eat your breakfast or your lunch. Free wifi and always immaculately clean. iIt still has a very old school feel to it while still maintaining  a hip modern atmosphere It's located in a very old corner store front. Outstanding job Bridgeport Coffee Company I will be coming back sooner than later.

59.description: Interesting place, nice location and easy access. Unfortunately, the staff leaves much to desire.  On the morning I was there the young lady on the cash register was "high" and in desperate need of help. She was unable to give me the proper change. When I mentioned it to her, she gave me an empty stare which made clear that was not mentally there!? I had ordered a couple of bagels to go but after 20 minutes the fellow who prepared the baked goods who rocking to the music had not heard or knew anything about my order. I requested a refund for that part of my order and of course the young blonde cashier gave me the wrong amount back again at which point all I could do is give up and leave. Personally, I believe it is a shame I do think this is a very cool place with a staff that is really interested in doing a good this souls be a very good place.

21.description: Good place to study or just do some soul searching lol. I'm not actually a fan of coffee houses or coffee. Only in times of desperate needs. But this place is really relaxing. I would definitely pick it over Starbucks.

17.description: Wonderful atmosphere, amazing drinks and great place to get work done or just chill. Very homey and rustic style,awesome place highly recommend!

10.description: The 2 mile run to get here was most definitely worth it. Bridgeport Coffee has an antique and almost home-y like feel. They're not going for the pretentious hipster vibe rather a cozy hipster one. They're not aloof or intimidating. They simply serve up fine cups of hot coffee--freshly ground and roasted in-house. I am such a sucker for independent coffee shops that source & roast their own coffee. A great cup starts from the source and it doesn't get better than the fresh stuff.Their Hardscrabble Blend is what they use for all of their espresso drinks.
