While I don't have the most refined coffee palette to characterize flavors profiles and point out nuances of this-and-that, I know what good coffee tastes like and bad coffee tastes like. I brought home a few bags of beans which ran about $13/bag. They have superb seating. Ample indoor and outdoor tables. They also have a back room if you prefer more privacy. My favorite aspect about this place aside the coffee is their elevated indoor seating area and tons of natural light. They have a '2nd floor' of sorts for their window seats. It. Is. Amazing. Major kudos to whoever decided this was a good idea--because it is. In additional to coffee & nice seating, they have a selection of usual foods to snack on: baked goods, sandwiches, bagels, etc. For breakfast, I went with a toasted multi-grain bagel with hummus. Not sure where they get their bagels from but it was good! Not a lame Sara Lee bagel from the grocery store that's for sure. :D 5 stars for Bridgeport coffee.

5.description: In the last year, this place has gone way downhill. Getting a coffee is not just about getting a coffee, there should be some pleasant chat, a good morning maybe. It used to be like that here, but now there are all these annoying hipster bros who can't be bothered to do that, they're like "what do you want?" The food is terrible and they no longer bring it to your table. They just scream out an order and there is no way to know if it's yours. I ordered food at a time when there 6 other people there and when I didn't get up right away, they just screamed it louder. Then went back to standing around doing nothing after I got up to get it. I live right around the corner and I will be going out of my way to go to Jackalope or elsewhere just to avoid the rudeness. The comments box was removed at the same time that it was needed most.

3.description: Great place for coffee and hanging out! I really like the chill atmosphere and friendly staff! Both the food and coffee are great! They have a very rustic yet homey feel. I recommend it if you're in the area!

35.description: This was my home away from home. A wonderful study spot while I went to school close by. Best coffee in Chicago! They have some very beautiful staff as well!  They have little vases with fresh flowers on the tables which is super cute too.

19.description: Bridgeport Coffee Company is a cozy coffee shop with a nice variety of food and drinks.  I came with a friend on a dreary Tuesday afternoon and it was pretty busy.  I ordered an agave soy latte and my friend had the coffee of the day.  Overall my visit here was pleasant but I do have to deduct some points because they forgot my drink and I had to go up to the barista to ask after I was passed up by everyone.  My latte was pretty good; it was a bit too sweet for my taste but had a nice layer of thick foam on top which I'm a sucker for.  I also liked that I could still taste the coffee in the latte unlike some of Starbuck's lattes which are overpowered with their 6 pumps of syrups (ok I'm exaggerating but you know what I mean).  Bridgeport Coffee Co has a laid back atmosphere and friendly baristas.  Check it out for a good cup of joe and then hit up Chinatown for some yummy food!

28.description: Maybe they were having a bad day? I understand the flavors of a good dark roast but this stuff was just burnt. I tried the cold coffee but it tasted burnt as well. The apple turnover was blah. I've made it an adventure to explore as many coffee shops as I can in Chicago. I've never just given up and chucked my purchase before.

45.description: I like this coffee house and would go there sometimes after work or on Saturday. This is a cool place to hang out with friends or by yourself to just relax and unwind and do what u like. I know a quite of few of my friends like to go there. I never tried the food but like the coffee a lot. Would go there when I have a free time. It's in the heart of Bridgeport.

33.description: I live here on the weekend. I love the coffee here. Good smoothies too. Sandwiches are standard. (More veggie options please!) but I like that I can sit in the front window if I want good people watching and daydreaming opportunities while listening to the baristas music selection or I can sit in the back room & listen to classical music and get work done. Free wifi (but who doesn't have that now?) The only thing I wish it had was a few comfy couches for days I just want to read and enjoy my coffeeBut really no complaints here- love this place

43.description: Wonderful atmosphere, amazing drinks and great place to get work done or just chill. Very homey and rustic style,awesome place highly recommend!

2.description: I want to like it here, I really do. I normally frequent Jackalope as its a bit closer to me and I'm able to bring my dog in to order. But after a year in Bridgeport I wanted to give them a shot.My boyfriend and I each ordered an iced Black eye. I got mine with some flavored syrup.I was given a larger size than I ordered, so I already knew the amount of syrup I asked for wouldn't be enough to make this beverage taste good. But that wasn't even the issue. The fact that it tasted Sooo burnt was. Like undrinkably burnt. I also frequent Starbucks so I'm used to a dark, bold taste. And this was just in a whole different category. I plan on giving them another chance, in hopes this was just a fluke.

18.description: It was a cool fall day in Chicago and they had a huge fan blowing inside - a floor one that was blasting at the guests. That was strange. The chai latte was good though it came warm, not hot, and I had to have them microwave it.

41.description: Another example of why Bridgeport is a great neighborhood:  Had a really good cup of coffee and a delicious bowl of mushroom soup--all for $6.50-- while waiting 30 minutes for a new catalytic converter to be installed on my car by the good folks across the street at Car One Auto and Muffler.  Yeah Bridgeport!

52.description: Free WiFi, patio and free parking. You can stay here for hours to study without having to worry about meters. They have sandwiches, wraps, and snacks, as well as a strong cup of Joe.

50.description: The baristas know you by name and there is a large variety of roasts. Great place to get work done or hang out and talk!

4.description: Drinking coffee and waiting for laundry in the best damned coffee house in the neighborhood (Bridgeport).Let me clarify. My laundry is not at the coffee house. That would be strange. My laundry is at a laundromat a block away. The coffee house is merely an excellent place to get coffee to ease the process of laundry since most of that process entails sitting and waiting. It is much like installing software, which is another process that benefits from coffee. Many processes benefit from coffee. Except EKGs. Do not drink coffee while having an EKG. It makes the cardiologist nervous.But I digress. If you have a process that benefits from coffee, I recommend this cafe. And if that process requires wifi, excellent pastries, or breakfast sandwiches, more the better. If that process requires quiet, there's these secret sprawling hidden dining rooms off the main room. However, this is probably not a good place for cardiology exams.

6.description: This is such an adorable coffee shop with really good coffee & bakery! I couldn't eat too much because there were no gluten-free options but did have 1 bite of the brownie and it was amazing! What was more fun and unique is to just sit down for a conversation or to read a book in their quaint Coffeeshop!

22.description: Great spot for studying and getting work done. The staff is usually friendly and nice! It's a very laid back environment, like a good neighborhood coffee shop! The coffee is good there. I normally get the chai latte or ice chai since I'm not a huge coffee drinker... it's okay. Coffee's better there. They have smoothies too for non caffeine people. I wished they had more non-traditional coffee drinks. They recently took off the green tea smoothie drink that I loved there. :( They also have sandwiches and baked goods if you are hungry too. It's okay. The lemon bars are good though, yum!

15.description: I absolutely love this place. It has a good casual atmosphere that is perfect for meeting up with a friend or to work on school work or work from home. The patrons are very diverse from hipsters to older folks to the business man. Their products are nice and fresh. I prefer coming to this place over overrated Starbucks any day. The costumer service is great and the employees are very friendly and professional. I support small coffee shops such as this and if you get a chance to go you totally should pop your head in for a pastry and some hot cider.

57.description: A nice little coffee shop located on the corner of Morgan this coffee shop offers a different  variety of coffees as well as delicious lunch food during the day. I went there recently during the lunchtime hours and bought a tuna wrap which was to die for. They also have a nice little seating arrangement and offer Wi-Fi so if you want to go there with your laptop or iPhone you can use their Wi-Fi there very accommodating. Best bet in the neighborhood if you're looking for a place to just sit and chill and drink some coffee and maybe have a little lunch.

20.description: Oh how I long for the good ol' days when chips came with the sandwich. $10 for a small latte and sandwich (with no chips!) - no thank you! Chicken salad sandwich was decent, but not worth the price.

36.description: It was pretty crowded when we first arrived, but luckily a table opened up. It was a cute, quiet coffee shop with pretty solid coffee and good vibes.

14.description: Nice small cafe to go to in Bridgeport, I go to Jackalope more just cuz i live closer to there, and they have some more food options, but as far as coffee goes, both are high quality and i frequent each of them quite often

3.description: By the power of Greyskull, I was walking down the street minding my biz, doing my thing.When all the sudden something hit me. As powerful as a Hefty bag full of vegetable soup hitting concrete.I was in the presence of greatness.Looking up I feasted my eyes on the greatest collectible and toy shop I've seen.  Tons of cool toys and collectibles from the 70's until 90's. Star Wars stuff, Muppet, Strawberry Shortcake, Rainbow Brite, Vintage comic book hero action figure and old comic books, Alf stuff, Ghostbusters action figures and all stuff Ghostbusters (!), HE MAN and SHE RA!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and their respective castles and enemies, and so much more cool stuff!The owner's nice. I like small businesses with unique concepts and merchandise as well.It's basically a store for you to find something that resonated with you when you were younger or treat someone younger with something cool from the past. They'll probably love it too.I hope he gets a great Jem collection going soon.*Touches earring*"Synergy."

1.description: Walking into !Ka-Pow was like being time warped back to my childhood. To see all the toys, games and even comic books from when I was a little rascal, made me reflect back to a much more simpler time in my life. Parking here can be challenging and the store is a tight squeeze. But, the walk and interaction with the owner or the staff is totally worth it. They're all laid back and they know their toys. I won't comment on the prices as I didn't buy anything - plus, how can you put a price on memories of good times? I just know that your inner child, or the collector in you will find !Ka-Pow to be a pretty cool shop.

2.description: I wish I could reference another of my reviews in this, but I can't, so I won't. I will say this. Kapow has it's sh*t together in a big way. With thousands of vintage and contemporary collectible toys, I could have spent hours looking through everything. But I didn't have to. Why? Because it was ORGANIZED. Other similar shops could learn a thing or three from how they run their store. All their toy lines are grouped together for easy access. And the guy guy behind the counter was uber-helpful and very knowledgable. I asked him for a particular figure I'm hunting for and he knew right away what it was and that he'd recently sold one. Sad face. They didn't have it. But still, he knew. I don't have to write a lot about them because they run a tight ship. I like that. I might come back and bring friends. Great job, Kapow!Oh, and also? They don't have icky, chewed, gross toys that your little brother sucked on as a child. Their selections are curated so you'll find nothing but the best. I saw a USS. Flagg in great condition. A He-Man Sorceress that still has her feathers painted on, and a bunch of other awesome pieces. And now I've lapsed so far into nerditory that I may never be able to come back.

5.description: Great place to find vintage toys & collectibles, both loose and mint-in-the-package! Voltron, Transformers, GI Joe, Star Wars, He-Man, etc etc. They even carry some newer stuff, like MOTU 200x. The only downside to the shop is there SO MUCH stuff, that its hard to see what's behind some precariously placed Lion-O, and for fear of creating some domino chain reaction of a shower of toys, I avoid touching anything on the shelves. Needs a bit of organizing, but then again, its so much fun to dig through the loose figure bins.Any time I'm in Chicago on business, I always stop in to see what's new, and spend way too much time in there!

6.description: Great selection,low prices, friendly staff, no high pressure here browse at your leisure. If you do have a question the folks here do their best to give you an answer, Inventory runs the gamut. Try it you might find just what your not looking for. My favorite place to be.

7.description: I love Ka-Pow!! Not only does this place have so much awesome stuff, but the owner is amazingly nice and helpful. He posted a Facebook picture of an item I loved and I called and he was able to hold it for me over the weekend until I got back into town. Great local business, Lakeview needs more like this! Go find that childhood toy your parents threw away and maybe even that super expensive one they could never get you for Christmas! :)

8.description: What a cool little place! Found it randomly walking down Belmont. All kinds of memories came flooding back seeing toys I haven't thought about in years. Kinda small/cramped, slightly disorganized and the shortest business hours in the history of mankind, but it all adds to the charm of this place. I totally agree with the last reviewer, how can you not have any Jem stuff?? In general, a lot more male-friendly toys than female ones, but maybe the owner can change that? Girls want to nerd out too!

9.description: Walking down Belmont, you will happen upon a magical place where the toys of your childhood are all around you. You'll see Teddy Ruxpin standing next to Voltron, who stands guard over Strawberry Shortcake and Jem. Its not something from your dreams, its !Ka-pow!! Collectibles.My friend took me here a few months ago, after he had bought a working Teddy Ruxpin from the store, and I was very much impressed with the amount of collectibles displayed in this shop. As you walk in, you immediately are presented with a giant GI Joe diorama to the right in the front window, and a ride-able Battle Cat from Masters of the Universe. Shelves line the store, four or five high, and you are unable to see the walls due to the amount of action figures or dolls on them, both loose and in package.The prices are reasonably affordable for most things (there is even a $3 bin smack dab in the middle of the store, where you can find a multitude of awesome toys) and understandably pricier on the true collectibles -- you'll be able to find anything from a $3 Power Ranger action figure, all the way up to the $550 24" Mattel limited edition Voltron.The guy who owns the shop is always in and super knowledgeable about pretty much every line of toys from the 1970s to today. A collector himself, he is honest and really cool to just talk to -- he's even pointed me in the direction of online toy stores when he didn't have the products I was looking for. And I just gotta point out the attention to detail taken to ensuring that all the right pieces go with the right toys -- I was in once and they had just received a huge amount of loose Masters of the Universe toys and little weapons; the guys working that day had out the old 1983 catalog and were going piece by piece, making sure everything lines up correctly! That's dedication!I also enjoy the fact that alot, if not all, of the toys they have are from donations. Its really cool to think that these old toys that we get have basically been saved from either staying in a basement somewhere, or saved from the trash.All in all, the only thing I can knock !Ka-pow!! on is the fact that they have SO MUCH stuff, I can never see everything, but that is no knock at all! This place is inner kid heaven, and I dare anyone to look in the window and their face not light up! I hope this establishment becomes a Lakeview geek fixture, right up there with Chicago Comics and People Play Games -- only !Ka-Pow!! is leading the pack! A wholehearted recommendation indeed!

0.description: The USS Flagg aircraft carrier. The vehicle Voltron from Matchbox. The Shogun Warriors Godzilla.These are but a few of the Holy Grails of toy collecting that have found their way into this tiny store and into the hands of individuals desperate to relive their childhoods and find a cheaper alternative to therapy.After several failed attempts to make it out here, I finally found myself with a free afternoon to marvel at a tiny space packed to the gills with toys of all shapes, sizes, and conditions, from several decades before I was even born to the hottest imports from Hong Kong.It's enough to make a child (or man-child) weep with joy.Romeo Magdaluyo, the owner and proprietor, is a terrific guy who really knows his stuff. It was a pleasure not only to drool over his collection of vintage Star Wars vehicles and import Transformers, but to debate and discuss the merits and drawbacks of articulation on DC Direct figures. It's an amazing way to stroll down memory lane and possibly score yourself that rare piece that will complete your collection or simply grace your desktop at work.He's always on the lookout for new inventory, so if you've got a collection that you're looking to unload at a competitive price, stop in or make an appointment by email.I wonder if they accept kidneys as payment...

4.description: Amazing collection of vintage stuff, I was blown away!

3.description: I'm not sure what others come here for, but I come here for a quick bite and go on my way. I've definitely experienced better at other locations!I came in to order a BLACK FOREST HAM SUB (I never talk with my mouth full so I'm not sure how they can give me turkey ham instead). They gave me a turkey ham!! It was my first time order black forest ham so I had no idea how the meat looks. I didn't know until my sister pointed out to me that the meat was turkey. I'm not a fan of turkey ham at all. The guy messed it up completely and when I asked he said turkey ham sandwich. I said I ordered Black Forest Ham. He made no attempt to change it for me... stood there like an idiot for a few minutes so I just paid and left. I ordered it around 10pm. Steer clear in the night unless you're regular enough for them to remember you. Maybe I should just not pay for the sandwich and leave if they do this next time? Pfft. I'm not even thinking of coming here for a next time....

1.description: Every time I have been in here, literally in over a month, as a paying customer, the bathroom says OUT OF ORDER. This franchise needs to get its shit together.

0.description: Mmm falafel at 3am!Quick, friendly and efficient service.... As a subway fanatic this is my favorite location ...I am a regular at this Subway and I just love when the sandwich artist knows my sandwich prior to ordering.  Aside of that, I feel like the staff is quick and very efficient.  The manager is attentive and personable.  There have been a few times, however, that the sandwich artist has been a bit sloppy (but that is only because they are new).  Overall still my fave!

2.description: This location is really coninient if you are with a car. I like this option so much. the food is good they have a standardized menu. However the staff shows great customer care culture. In a subway you can not expect a gourmet food. But the service is pretty good.

5.description: Einosa No longer works here. Last sub I got from here was borderline unedible, so this Subway is about is unremarkable as any other now.

6.description: OK It's a Subway, just like the thousands across America so let us get the formalities out of the way. My sandwich was very good, the place is kept clean, everyone here is friendly, it is close to where I work, the place is kept clean, they have a large dining area and it is open 24 hours. These are all positives in my book. On my most recent visit, the ends of the bread was starting  to get a little crunchy but nothing to get my panties in a bunch about.I must give special mention to a guy who works at night here. This guy is AMAZING to watch make a sandwich. I have never seen anyone make a sandwich so freaking fast. I mean this guy needs to win an award or something.  Not only does this guy fly but he still makes a neat, presentable, and fully -loaded sandwich. It is worth it to stop in here just to watch him work his sandwich magic!

7.description: My sister was a little disappointed when I initially gave this place only 3 stars. I felt that this was an ordinary subway and three stars was suffice. I wasn't bad mouthing it I just felt that's what it deserved. But recently I have found myself frequenting this location and my mind has definitely change. My most recent visit, I was a little annoyed/tired after a long day. The guy who helped me I think his name was Tahir was super helpful and friendly. He was patient with me and my 3 footlongs and their plethora of different toppings. And he was very courteous at the checkout as well. What really was cool was that he noticed my busy body 5 year old who he tried to engage with fun small talk. In the end he was super nice enough to offer her a cookie. I am not changing my mind because of the free stuff, I just wanted to note one of my excellent experiences. :)

8.description: In general I am not a fan of Subway, but because of the fact that I worked for them five or more years ago, I will get a random Subway craving three or four times a year. This location is ok. Not great though. They are often times understaffed and rushed, which sometimes makes them come off as rude. They are really good at moving the line though, which is nice because at least I know I will get my sandwich pretty quick.  As far as toppings go...they can be pretty skimpy...(but just about every Subway is because they have a really strict portion control policy) It just kinda bugs me when I have to keep asking them to put more banana peppers on my sandwich, Its the only thing I got on my meatball for fucks sake, so don't skimp me on my one topping 'kay? Oh yeah, and this location frequently runs out of those peppers. So meh, for my Subway craving it does it's job, but nothing spectacular about this location, just your typical Subway.

9.description: As a former sandwich artist (it was my first job), I am highly critical of all Subway franchises and have the highest expectations for my sub sandwich experience.This is my favoritist Subway ever. They are really fast and aren't stingy with ingredients. CK os the best sandwich artist of all time!Just beware of the evil parking lot.

10.description: This subway is now open 24/7 for those who wish to eat subway at 4am.

4.description: I usually don't crave Subway because I honestly think most of their sandwiches are below average or average at best. If I were to rate this place solely on its sandwiches, it would be a 2 1/2-3 stars tops! However, I am not writing my review base on the sandwiches, which are pretty much the same at any Subway. This place has the best service and friendliest employees that I have ever experienced at a Subway. They don't rush you through your order and they are always smiling. For this reason, when I ever have to go to Subway, this is the one I go too hands down.

58.description: What could be better than a large piping hot funnel cake topped with cold creamy swirls of soft serve? As if this wasn't decadent enough, try covering ALLLLL of that with a blanket of chocolate fudge, a liberal sprinkling of cookie dough, a few dollops of whipped cream and a maraschino cherry.  Excessive? Absolutely. Worth every calorie-laden bite? HELL YASSSS! There's no better way to find respite from Chicago's sweltering summers than by treating yourself to Sugar Shack. It's literally a shack with a few chairs and tables set up along the sidewalk, but don't let the unassuming appearance fool ya. This place is always poppin' in the summer so be prepared to wait in line. In addition to the ever so popular funnel cake sundaes that I dream about daily, you'll find an assortment of other soul satisfying sweets, such as Italian ice, smoothies, frozen bananas, milkshakes, blizzards, hand-scooped ice cream and more. The only problem? CASH only and they're only open during the summer. BOOOO. I'd totally make the trek out in Chiberia to get my paws on a funnel cake sundae!

56.description: Love this place only this time, my funnel cake was not cooked fully i got to the best part the end & it was doughy ,bad!! But other than that I'm happy that i found them

29.description: Lots of options. limited seating and long lines. I had the strawberry parfait. it has cake ice cream and strawberries in layers, so good. Punks has a bathroom if you must go.

42.description: This isn't too far from Ricobene's which makes this something to think about for dessert downtown. I have been here for many years, and I still come here. This place is famous for its funnel cake sundae, but they also sell Italian ice, blizzards (ice cream with one topping of your choice), and scoops of ice cream.I usually take the ice cream I ordered to go home because there isn't a lot of seating there. Before I tried the Italian ice, the service here was great. The staff are friendly, and they do my ice cream like they always do which is good. That's a reason I like this place. I liked the strawberry Italian ice. There was pieces of strawberries and it made more flavor out of the Italian ice.  The ice itself had a great flavor of strawberries. It felt like summer was already here. I will try this Italian ice again someday.All in all, I love this ice cream parlor. This place sells the treats that kids and adults enjoy. I will always come back here after a day in downtown Chicago!

23.description: I can't say enough amazing things about this place. I discovered this in an article that described the best dessert places in Chicago. After seeing that they had funnel cake I knew we had to check it out. Depending on the day and time there can be quite a wait. As in, blocks down the street from this little ice cream window. However, it's worth the wait. Don't wait until you go to a festival for an overpriced funnel cake because this is the best in the city by far. My Nutella funnel cake sundae with swirl ice cream was amazing. There's a generous portion of soft serve and the dough is piping hot, which is a requirement of mine. This ain't no carnival funnel cake. Come and bring your friends so you can share the calories!

47.description: This place was amazing!  I loved the funnel cake sundae.

8.description: I can't say enough amazing things about this place. I discovered this in an article that described the best dessert places in Chicago. After seeing that they had funnel cake I knew we had to check it out. Depending on the day and time there can be quite a wait. As in, blocks down the street from this little ice cream window. However, it's worth the wait. Don't wait until you go to a festival for an overpriced funnel cake because this is the best in the city by far. My Nutella funnel cake sundae with swirl ice cream was amazing. There's a generous portion of soft serve and the dough is piping hot, which is a requirement of mine. This ain't no carnival funnel cake. Come and bring your friends so you can share the calories!

31.description: I order the funnel cake and funnel cake fingers. They were just ok. They didn't have as much flavor as I would expect from funny cakes. They were also really soft. I waited for about 30 minutes to get this and I definitely will not do up again. It wasn't worth it.

34.description: Funnel cake so good and crunchy here! Make sure to try it here! Cash only! Outdoor seating only (first come first served)... Wish it provides more seats and indoor too so we all can enjoy our food, rather than eating it while it's humid and hot and flies all over the place. :(

16.description: Went here for my birthday after a late comedy show. You know a place is good when it has a line outside and there open until 11pm which I love.I have been thinking about funnel cake sundae since I got it for the first time and I'm hooked. The small funnel cake was just enough and I shared it with my cousin.

13.description: This place just became my favorite ice cream shop! Found a Groupon deal online and decided to stop by. Late in the evening, the line was super long, even with 4+ staff members working in the back. I decided to come another time around 5 in the afternoon and it was much better. For the sundae, you can get a choice of vanilla with two toppings with whipped cream and a cherry on top. I ended up getting cookie dough and Oreo which was delicious! The orange creamsicle had a perfect blend of orange sherbet and vanilla ice cream. Will definitely stop by again to try all the other wonderful desert combos!

11.description: Yum!!! I love all the fun ideas they had. I was craving ice cream one night and got the pumpkin sundae. I was so excited! We are new to the southside and to see how busy it was, was a good sign.

39.description: I absolutely love it! I'm hooked! And the fried Twinkie is the bomb! I get the same thing everytime and it always hits the spot. Well worth the drive from the south suburbs

37.description: I went there on lunch today, June 10th very nice sunny day, they have chairs and tables outdoors and no credit cards, cash only. My mini funnel sundae was good, I paid $4.95.

0.description: Oh Sugar Shack, how I crave you even though it's freezing outside. Your funnel cake was beyond amazing and I miss it so much. I want to try everything from their menu! I tried it back in the summer and had a wonderful experience. I can't wait to have more when they're open again. The lines are always long, but always worth the wait.

38.description: I had a late night snack and boy was it good!!!! I had a mini funnel cake sundae with gummy bears!! mmmmmmMMMM!!!  I didn't get a picture because it didn't make it to the car, lol!!!

51.description: Get there early cause late at night there is always a long line. Great neighborhood ice cream shop. Parking may be hard to find . Otherwise the sundaes,  blizzards and shakes are delicious. Well worth the wait.

27.description: Amazing! I had the mini funnel cake sundae and it was soooo good!!! Loved this place. will definitely be back

32.description: Holy cow! I know everyone else and their mother has already reviewed the mini funnel cake sundae, but I just have to add my two cents.I had one about a week ago and I can't stop thinking about it! Thank goodness this place is cash only and I rarely carry cash, otherwise I'd be going broke and having to be rolled down the street for eating so much creamy, fried and doughy deliciousness.I got the mini funnel cake sundae with nutella, bananas and pecans. Definitely worth the $5-6! And it was just enough - I see some other reviews that say the regular size is too much and the mini is just not enough, but I really think the mini is the perfect size. It gave me just the right amount of sweet, ooey gooey, fried and crispy goodness in my mouth, without leaving me bloated and hating myself for indulging. I can't wait to go back and get another one!

54.description: The best funnel cake ever! We got as many toppings as we could! My family loved it. The funnel cake orders take a minute but it is well worth it. You can order a mini cake or a large and they also serve other snack foods like nachos. Try it over the summer you won't regret it!

48.description: There aren't enough words to describe this place! On a beautiful day it is the perfect QT for couples or hanging out with the besties. The desserts are amazing!

44.description: Not sure why it's taken so long for me to stop by considering it's in my 'hood and all. We ordered nachos and a strawberry/chocolate shake, both of which were simply ok. I DO want to go back and try their funnel cake as I've heard nothing but great things about it. One thing I did notice was how long it took for people to get their orders. TIP: cash only.

24.description: Sugar shack has gone down hill! The crowd it attracts has made me look elsewhere for funnel cakes:( plus it takes forever to get your order! The line is crazy long! Not worth waiting over 30 minutes!

7.description: Funnel cake so good and crunchy here! Make sure to try it here! Cash only! Outdoor seating only (first come first served)... Wish it provides more seats and indoor too so we all can enjoy our food, rather than eating it while it's humid and hot and flies all over the place. :(

49.description: This place is DELICIOUS!! The only lack of star is for the number of bees that hang out directly outside. My friend is super allergic so we had to find somewhere else to eat our funnel cakes and ice cream. Classic strawberry mini is the best!

40.description: I love this place! too bad it's now infested with ghetto, disgusting, disrespectful MOFO'S that throw their trash everywhere and wear their pants so disgustingly low. I can't even enjoy an ice cream with my family in my neighborhood due to these punks dancing in line like they have ants in their pants or trying to cut in line. It's unfortunate that I now have to take my business else where.

53.description: Decided to check this place out after hearing so much about it and I honestly wasn't impressed. We went late on a Saturday night and after waiting 45 minutes ordered four mini funnel cake sundaes. It took another 15 minutes for the order to come up and I was extremely disappointed. Funnel cakes are supposed to be moist and chewy but these were hard and dry. Maybe it was a bad night but I probably won't stop there again unless there's no wait.

30.description: If it's summer in Chicago, it's time to head to Sugar Shack for some sweet, sweet funnel cake. I've tried a couple of other things on the menu (which are great) but you'd be a fool not to get the funnel cake. It's funnel cake with two big scoops of ice cream and two toppings. It's got the crunch from the cake and the sweet from the ice cream. It's pretty big so 2 people minimum for the full size, you fatties. Service is reasonably fast, takeout an option (you ice cream will melt by the time you find a seat on the limited number of outdoor seating), and prices are not bad!

46.description: I was very happy to discover 26th Street Sugar Shack this summer.My brother and I LOVE funnel cakes!!!! The walk up little dessert shop was perfect.  We both had piping hot DELICIOUS funnel cakes.  Reminded us of the State Fair.

1.description: *heart eyes emoji*Look no further for your dessert or sweet treat. The menu is large (funnel cake sundaes, Italian ice, ice cream sandwiches, blizzards, deep fried Twinkies, etc.) so you can always find something to tickle your fancy. On my last visit, there were a number of fall selections that included fried apple wedges with caramel dipping sauce, pumpkin funnel cakes and apple pie blizzards. Seriously?! I need to get me some of that ASAP.The workers are typically high school kids who are on point with dealing with customers and making the system efficient. There are four tables available, so you can snag one if you're lucky. Parking can sometimes be tricky.Unfortunately I have to take off a star for being cash only :( Prepare to wait in line, but I promise it's worth the wait.

55.description: The Sugar Shack in no way needs my 5 star review. Obviously it's doing alright for itself. I just can't not come and rave about how wonderful and delicious it was. I got the funnel cake sundae (obviously) with hot fudge and fruity pebbles. This is the way to go. It was delightful. Heavenly. Perfect. The line was long when we got there, but they moved people through quite quickly. Happy National Ice Cream Day to me!

9.description: This isn't too far from Ricobene's which makes this something to think about for dessert downtown. I have been here for many years, and I still come here. This place is famous for its funnel cake sundae, but they also sell Italian ice, blizzards (ice cream with one topping of your choice), and scoops of ice cream.I usually take the ice cream I ordered to go home because there isn't a lot of seating there. Before I tried the Italian ice, the service here was great. The staff are friendly, and they do my ice cream like they always do which is good. That's a reason I like this place. I liked the strawberry Italian ice. There was pieces of strawberries and it made more flavor out of the Italian ice.  The ice itself had a great flavor of strawberries. It felt like summer was already here. I will try this Italian ice again someday.All in all, I love this ice cream parlor. This place sells the treats that kids and adults enjoy. I will always come back here after a day in downtown Chicago!

26.description: Stopped by the Sugar shack for the first time  . I was greeted immediately.  The sundae funnel cake is huge ! definitely enough for 2 people to share. Ill be coming back . They even have deep fried twinkies. You can add topping to customize your sundaes ranging from fruity pebbles to hot fudge. I ordered my funnel sundae with cinnamon toast crunch and strawberries.

25.description: Cash only. But a very reasonable place to purchase ice cream Italian ice  funnel cakes etc. I had a groupon and decide to use it on today with the family. The line was kind of long but it went by kind of fast. There is an outside sitting area with only maybe 3 tables. Not alot of space with so many people standing around on the sidewalk. This must be a popular place for some sweets. So many people were getting out of their cars to stand in line.  Nice quiet area. However, it was in the afternoon so I can't even imagining how the line is at night.Great place to come and grab a treat when your yearning your having a sweet tooth. The deep fried twinkie was nt bad at all especially since I'm a very picky eater.

12.description: Line was crazy long but the customer service was good! The owner or manager walked up to the window while I was getting my food and asked "don't you want whipped cream on that Twinkie" she was nice. I also got a funnel cake so I got my fix I'm gone for the rest of the year! Lol

59.description: Run away! Lately there are large, rowdy crowds out front and violent fights keep breaking out. Last week I saw two men beating each other with metal patio furniture. I won't let my kids go anywhere near the Sugar Shack. I hope this place closes down- soon!

21.description: This place is very popular. There was a huge line but it moved very fast. The funnel cake was super delicious.

17.description: Finally , lines way to long in summer months , visited in October - had funnel cake and mini funnel cake sundae, with chocolate and whip cream , will be back just not in the summer , also. CASH ONLY

10.description: If it's summer in Chicago, it's time to head to Sugar Shack for some sweet, sweet funnel cake. I've tried a couple of other things on the menu (which are great) but you'd be a fool not to get the funnel cake. It's funnel cake with two big scoops of ice cream and two toppings. It's got the crunch from the cake and the sweet from the ice cream. It's pretty big so 2 people minimum for the full size, you fatties. Service is reasonably fast, takeout an option (you ice cream will melt by the time you find a seat on the limited number of outdoor seating), and prices are not bad!

5.description: What's in Bridgeport?  Some would say it was the neighborhood where lots of Chicago mayors and politicians came from, while some would say it's an extension from Chi-town Chinatown in the modern era.  Well, I would say "if you are looking for sugar, an excessive amount of sugar, look no further, my friend!"  Groupon obviously endorses the establishment of a "sugar shack."  At approximately 0400 hour this morning, we woke up and played with my i-pad mini.  I came across with the Groupon for "26th. St. Sugar Shack."  I made a wise decision to purchase the option #2: two (2) blizzards, sundaes, creamsicles, or avalanches for $5.  So some curious Yelp friends would probably inquire what the option #1 was: their infamous, sugar-coma-inducing funnel cake.  It turned out to be that option #2 was equally sugar-coma-friendly.  We went with the "Avalanche," which featured vanilla ice cream and a choice of Italian ice.  I picked the Hawaiian colors: blue raspberry and lime.  Wow, this entire cup was the real deal!  I've never had vanilla ice cream this thick in my 29-year life prior to visiting 26th St. SS.  Delicious that was, but the portion was so large that I wish someone took over my cup and finished it up for me!  I saw many giant funnel cakes come out of the pick-up window.  This place is really quintessential America: generous servings and sweet-until-you-see-your-name-on-the-grave.  I felt the staff did a good job at explaining the menu and how everything works.  As long as you're holding your green bucks tight, your eyes will open wide until the morning light.  It's the power of saccharide!  Whenever you're ready for the challenge, get off at the CTA Halsted Orange Line station and walk to the 26th. St.  Then head east until seeing the flashing lights.

3.description: My 100th review on Yelp! Yessssssss.....finally!Oh, sweet, heavenly Sugar Shack. There is something about this place that keeps me coming back despite the somewhat sketchy neighborhood. I'll risk it for the $1.50 funnel cake with powdered sugar.They sell other desserts, but you come here for the funnel cake. Six Flags has nothing on this place! The funnel cake is so fresh and has just the right texture. Everyone raves about the funnel cake sundae, but I haven't gotten enough courage to tough out my lactose intolerance for it yet. I will one day, don't you worry.Expect a line. Always. That's just how good it is here. You'll probably end up waiting 10-15 minutes, but it's TOTALLY worth it.

35.description: The funnel cake sundae just might be one of the best sweet dishes availble in chicago.  The dough is crisp and light.  It is fried to perfection.  Not greasy at all.  Combine that with the soft serve ice cream and toppings of your choice and you've got something amazing.  I wasn't expecting this dish to blow my socks off but the line of peoeple waiting were there for a reason.  I think I'll try some different toppings next time but the coookie dough and caramel were great additions.  Their sweet treats are so good that they may be worth braving Chicago winters to consume.

19.description: Love it! Had so many deserts to choose from. Deep fried twinkie will be my next treat there. Sugar overload. It would be 5 stars but it's to crowded and not a great spot for a group to go but we'll worth a visit. Great prices too!!

28.description: Funnel cake sundae was deelish but confusing. They have a huge variety of toppings. In this instance confusing is good. It is a cash only establishment,  the prices were very reasonable.  The only challenge for this business is seating. They have about five outside tables, it's difficult to enjoy ice cream while standing in a residential area but overall it was worth every bit.

45.description: Love this place!! Great funnel cakes; toppings are always fresh and funnel cakes are made on the spot.  I will surely keep going back!

33.description: This is a favorite ice cram place but the last visit was disappointing. The mini Sunday was not good. The vanilla scoop was yellow and grossly sugary, that hurts my teeth. I had the sherbet and funnel cake before and it was really good. I hope they make changes to the vanilla flavor.

43.description: The people in line can be rude and rowdy (they can't understand that they're standing in line and shouldn't be hogging the entire sidewalk), but if you can get past that, then you're in for a treat! For $4.45, cash only, you can get a mini-funnel cake laden with ice cream, whip cream, cherry, a dry topping, and a wet topping. I love strawberries and oreos as my toppings. It is heavenly! I also suggest you share this with a friend. It's too much for one person.

2.description: Delishy. Affordable. Tough spot. Saw no less than 20 cop cars during our 20 minute wait in line.  I thought it was worth it, my partner said no.  Good for when you are craving a funnel cake and are not near a carnival.  I wouldn't make this my new go-to just because I don't want to spend hours in the gym afterward, but it did make my mouth dance.

18.description: Sugar shack has gone down hill! The crowd it attracts has made me look elsewhere for funnel cakes:( plus it takes forever to get your order! The line is crazy long! Not worth waiting over 30 minutes!

41.description: Line was crazy long but the customer service was good! The owner or manager walked up to the window while I was getting my food and asked "don't you want whipped cream on that Twinkie" she was nice. I also got a funnel cake so I got my fix I'm gone for the rest of the year! Lol

52.description: Pretty good mini funnel cake just the right size for the right price be prepared to wait in a long line only and they only take cash!

50.description: This place is simply delicious and I'm so glad I found it last year.  The only thing I hate is I haven't gone as often as I would have liked this summer.Make sure you bring cash because they do not accept debit or credit.This is also a walk up restaurant and there are a few tables outside.  There are so many topping options to choose from and it took me a few minutes to decide what I wanted and even after I picked I was thinking man I could have gotten oreos....lolThe first time I got the regular funnel cake and that was enough for three people.  The last time I got a mini funnel cake and I wished I had more.  The next time I'm just going to get the regular funnel cake I would rather eat until I don't want anymore then eat it all up and wishing I had more.Everything is so fresh and just writing this review is making me want to head that way today.Please beware if you give this place a try you will be hooked...lol  I wish they were open all year long but they aren't and I'm not sure when they close up for the winter but just thought makes me poke out a lip but it is always great when they open back up so get there while you can and...Enjoy!!!

4.description: I think I have a new favorite ice cream place! I can totally see why The Sugar Shack more often than not has a long line outside. It's the best thing ever!!!Located in the Pilsen area, the menu had a ton of delicious options to choose from - Funnel cakes, dreamsicles, Italian ice mixed with ice cream, fried twinkies, and so much more. Even nachos!!! I opted for a funnel cake with vanilla ice cream, caramel, whip cream, and cookie dough! Absolutely sinful!!! The space to sit at outside is rather small so there are quite a few patrons that opt to eat in their cars. Other than that though, the place is great and reasonably priced. Go and see what diabetic inducing creation you can come up with!!!

6.description: Holy cow! I know everyone else and their mother has already reviewed the mini funnel cake sundae, but I just have to add my two cents.I had one about a week ago and I can't stop thinking about it! Thank goodness this place is cash only and I rarely carry cash, otherwise I'd be going broke and having to be rolled down the street for eating so much creamy, fried and doughy deliciousness.I got the mini funnel cake sundae with nutella, bananas and pecans. Definitely worth the $5-6! And it was just enough - I see some other reviews that say the regular size is too much and the mini is just not enough, but I really think the mini is the perfect size. It gave me just the right amount of sweet, ooey gooey, fried and crispy goodness in my mouth, without leaving me bloated and hating myself for indulging. I can't wait to go back and get another one!

22.description: Gosh I LOVEEEE THIS GEM!!!!! They need more of these in Chicago. The idea of a neighborhood sweet shack is so appealing and smart! First of all it's just a walk up window so be aware if you wanted a sit down. All of their items are very reasonably priced and made fresh to order. I got the strawberry cheesecake ice cream in a cup and my friend got the 3/$4 mini funnel cakes. The funnel cakes come with powdered sugar, which is almost perfect, but add a scoop of ice cream or other toppings and your tastebuds will be in heaven!! The strawberry cheesecake had cheesecake chunks inside too. Yum!!! I definitely would come here again and again!

15.description: Not sure why it's taken so long for me to stop by considering it's in my 'hood and all. We ordered nachos and a strawberry/chocolate shake, both of which were simply ok. I DO want to go back and try their funnel cake as I've heard nothing but great things about it. One thing I did notice was how long it took for people to get their orders. TIP: cash only.

57.description: Closest thing to six flags funnel cake without spending as much or driving to Gurnee. They have a wide selection of toppings and other sweets. They have a few tables available but it's always pretty busy. This place takes cash only.

20.description: Went here on a Thursday for a sweet treat while on vacation. This little spot is a walk up! So please don't go thinking you will sit down inside and enjoy your treat. They do have several tables out front, but keep in mind they are directly across from the line. Imagine street, tables, sidewalk, and line. So if you don't want folks close to your food...go sit in your car.They have a large menu with lots of options. Most sundaes come with a wet and dry option...one of each. Wet would be hot fudge/Carmel/strawberries and dry was cookies/Pecans/graham cracker crust. You can add more if you like for a nominal fee.The line moves pretty fast. Oh yes they ONLY TAKE CASH. So come prepared.I ordered the funnel cake sundae oh and let me say the MINI. The original funnel cake sundae is actually THREE of the mini funnel cakes...its sharing size. Mine had hot fudge, Carmel, pecans, and whip cream. I was not disappointed. The ice cream is REALLY good. I highly recommend them for a nice cold treat!

36.description: I visited this place around midnight during Memorial Day weekend and I wasn't really craving sweets in particular BUT once I took the first bite of the funnel cake sundae I was in heaven! It was soo good. The funnel cake by itself was yummy and warm and fluffy. The ice cream, caramel and nuts topping took the funnel cake to another level. I wish I had purchased my own instead of sharing it with a friend. Next time I'm in Chicago I will definitely be back for more.

14.description: This place is simply delicious and I'm so glad I found it last year.  The only thing I hate is I haven't gone as often as I would have liked this summer.Make sure you bring cash because they do not accept debit or credit.This is also a walk up restaurant and there are a few tables outside.  There are so many topping options to choose from and it took me a few minutes to decide what I wanted and even after I picked I was thinking man I could have gotten oreos....lolThe first time I got the regular funnel cake and that was enough for three people.  The last time I got a mini funnel cake and I wished I had more.  The next time I'm just going to get the regular funnel cake I would rather eat until I don't want anymore then eat it all up and wishing I had more.Everything is so fresh and just writing this review is making me want to head that way today.Please beware if you give this place a try you will be hooked...lol  I wish they were open all year long but they aren't and I'm not sure when they close up for the winter but just thought makes me poke out a lip but it is always great when they open back up so get there while you can and...Enjoy!!!

3.description: So while I haven't experienced the hair aspect yet. I am pretty faithful in my following of Joanne who does lashes, waxing, and nails. She does great work always makes sure you leave happy. The number of compliments from people is astounding. And these come from people in the industry such as make up artists and aestheticians. I admittedly travel halfway across the city to see her. I will have to try the hair services but the whole salon was spotless when I was there and everyone was very nice. Very modern and social.

1.description: If there was an option to give no stars I would. I came for a no chip and it was a disaster. The unwelcoming staff is always busy with themselves in the mirror and gossiping. Started my nail service with the nail tech not soaking my nails before trimming my cuticles, she just started cutting my cuticles away which made all my fingers bleed, this should've been a red flag. She then proceeded to put the polish on and it was all over my fingers. When I got home I had to peel away all the polish remnants on my skin. A few days pass by and the Polish started peeling off my nails!!! I truly wanted to like this place since it is so close to home but this type of service is unacceptable.

2.description: I actually really like this place. I am so happy to see a more hip and trendy salon in the area. It's exactly what this neighborhood needs. I have only used their nail and waxing services but both are awesome. They give you a really nice massage when you are getting a pedicure, not a fast quick one. They also take their time and my nails are always perfect. I go to Joann to get my Brazilians and she is a waxing rock star. 10-15 minutes and she is done, and it doesn't even hurt as bad as some places I have been. I am hoping to go in and get my haircut today so I can update my review, but so far so good! :)

5.description: I used this salon for eye lash extensions for weddings. They do a superb job and all of their staff are very friendly

6.description: When I seen that a salon, not just another place to get your hair cut, opened up on Morgan street.  Thought this was great, bring some more business to the area.  Went there, the salon itself is very nice.  Very moderen, maybe to much for the area.  Though I will not go back.  The man who was cutting my hair, was to busy talking and gossing with his friends.  To make the situation worse, it was all done in Spanish.  I feel if your working on my hair, I should have your attention.  The salon is not cheap and I feel like I deserve the attention.  The women who owns the place, offered coffee for those of us who were waiting.  Though as owner, she should of acted more like it.  Again, its great to see new business in the neighborhood, but they need to work on service to keep it.  The cut I received was average, maybe if he wasn't so busy talking, I would of been more impressed with it.

0.description: They always are able to get me squeezed in for a mani, pedi. They do a great rate at polish changes and it is close to my house.

4.description: I REALLY wanted to love this salon.When I walked in, I felt like I was inconveniencing the staff as they seemed very busy on Facebook and primping themselves. While waiting for my service I went to sit on the front couch and it was extremely dirty with hair, dust, and fish food all over it. (Tip: don't have a white couch in  a salon!)  As I went into the back room to get my eyebrows done, the employees were SCREAMING a conversation to eachother (not very relaxing).  I go to lay down and there's gum on the recliner. To top it off, the guy that did my eyebrows was not gentle at all and kept shoving my head from side to side.Not worth it.  Go somewhere else.

28.description: Well, I have to admit that I love bakeries.  However, this one is not my favorite.  I don't know what kind of fat or flour they use but it is not the same as other bakeries and the doughnuts actually makes me sluggish and almost sick.  Sorry, I love the name of the place and the folks who work here are so pleasant, just something about the goods that don't agree with me... and I have tried them 4 times !

1.description: I trekked down to Impallaria on a Sunday morning to try their apple fritter.  It was a long trip, but I do what it takes to serve my obsession.Turns out that it was a pretty good doughnut, but only a mediocre apple fritter.  It just didn't have any apples, and hardly any cinnamon to boot.  But it did boast that perfect fritter texture, soft on the inside and really firm on the outside.  Plus the sugar content was pitch perfect.  If they would only add some apples and spices, this would be a prince among fritters.Obviously I had to get more than one doughnut since I went all the way down there.  The coconut cake doughnut was very, very good.  Most places can't do a cake doughnut to save themselves, but Impallaria's was perfect AND did not leave that unpleasant film on my teeth like most do.  I also got a boston creme which wasn't very special but tasted good anyway.Prices are good here:  I didn't notice the exact breakdown, but my entire bill was $3.11.  Nice.

9.description: Stopped in here the other day mainly because I have been using my LevelUp app and I noticed this Bakery on the list of businesses with LevelUp in Bridgeport.The reviews here are spot on. I had a surprisingly delicious machine-dispensed latte and a scrumptious chocolate frosted cake donut. I think it ended up costing my boyfriend and I like a dollar each, which is right on target for my broke college student budget.My only negative comment is that there is no seating in the small shop, but I will be returning for Valentine's cookies very soon.

29.description: I can't vouch for the fact that this place is supposedly a deli, but I can vouch for the baked goods section.  I wandered in to this place on a lonely Saturday afternoon during a random walk around Bridgeport.The shelves were rather empty when it came to the donuts and some of their pastries.  Other pastries were readily available at one of the MANY counters/displays going on here.If this place has a fault, it's that it's trying to have so wide an array of baked goods.  But then again, this is a bakery - so is that really a fault?  I suppose it could be if the baked goods suffered, but what I purchased that afternoon (the last two apple fritters that were begging to be taken to a good home/belly) I can say that's not really the case.My one qualm is the entire giant display of Italian cookies.  There's just rows and rows of the little buggers, all the same except for differently-colored sprinkle toppings.  Does a variety of sprinkles really warrant an entire display case?  Do people really come in and say "Gimme half a pound of the red ones, and half a pound of the green ones, and a full pound of the rainbow assortment"?Well, I guess the next time I need a cheap cookie arrangement to go with a color-based party theme, I know where to turn.

23.description: I use to drive my two sisters too work right across street this place. I choose one day to drop by. I saw they had pizza. Took a chance not too bad I say They all so have great donuts. Try it let me know what you think.

5.description: This place holds a special place in my heart, my grandmother lived here for many years above the bakery before there was a fire. The smell of my grandmothers house literally was that of a bakery. Anyway, shout out to my gram who also made killer chicken soup. The bakery itself is clean and has a variety of goods including pizza and a a fontanella cheese bread. They are both really good. You must try their chocolate cake donuts and they make really reasonably priced quality birthday cakes. The apple and cherry slices are also a must have. Don't forget the coffee cakes.

31.description: I wasn't aware this place was a deli... I think it may just be a bakery.Their bread and pastries have always been pretty good.  Not the best, but I enjoy it for the 3 mile walk there and back.  The crescent cookies were awesome.  I have never had a cake here, and have never placed a special order, so I can't speak for that.I think it is a pretty standard bakery, nothing special.  If you live in Bridgeport, its worth checking out.

25.description: the cannoli's are great!

12.description: I had the apple pastry and focaccia bread. The focaccia bread was doughy and barely had any flavor. The apple pastry was on the sweet size and the crust wasn't that fluffy. I was a little disappointed coming here.

21.description: You get three doughnuts for the price of one here. They are MASSIVE not to mention awesome. The old fashioned butter cookies are also a hit. Clean, cheap, and polite service.

16.description: The chocolate glazed cake doughnuts are amazing! Best in the city! They are reasonably priced (83 cents, I believe, for a gargantuan doughnut that should be split, or else your pants won't fit later on) The goodies here are fresh, tasty and substantial. They taste like they were "made with love". The staff has always been very sweet.Also: for those going with young children, the entire wall opposing the counter is mirrors so the young'ins will stay occupied while you order. :-)

17.description: I've never had better donuts. They are the size of your head. Get one with a cup of coffee cause, take a note Dunkin, this is real Donut Shop coffee...the kind that tastes like it was brewed with donut crumbs in the grinds. Well done, Bridgeport.

10.description: Five stars!- Family owned.. and yes they are behind the counter helping you!- Good donuts- Delicious focaccia - All around feel good feelings!

11.description: The donuts at Impallaria and Bridgeport Bakery are the gold standard for classic donuts in Chicago. Impallaria's chocolate cake and glazed yeast donuts are as legit as any donuts I've had anywhere. These new jack trendy donut places need to fall back and bow down to the OG.Great donuts at a great price. Go here now.

26.description: So today was Fat Tuesday/Packzi Day/Pancake day. Even though I am not Catholic enough to fast for or even give up anything for lent, I always partake in a Packzi or two. I am Polish after all, so when every bakery in Chicago is selling these, how can I pass em up? A couple of weeks ago Aaron S. found out that this bakery, just a couple of blocks away from home were making them, I figured what do I have to loose in trying them out? I had a different but further away bakery in mind to try out, but once my work schedual came out for the week, I realized that making it out there during non peak hours wouldn't quite work out. I went in to pick up my order about twenty minutes before the time I gave them and I didn't have to wait at all. No lines. Awesome. The Packzi themselves? Really good. They have the right texture. Are the right size (BIG) and just almost perfect flavor. I was confused by a couple of things though. They were more like a Packzi sandwich. I guess they filled them that way to save time? It just confuses me when places do it this way because none of the Packzi's from my childhood were ever made this way. Also custard Packzi's traditionally have a chocolate icing/glaze on them, these did not. Very minor things really in the big picture. All in all I was/am a happy camper.

27.description: They do make a greast almond cressent pastries.  There not small.I feel there chocolate icing can be improved.  Will not order any type of donut that has chocolate frosting on it. When we have order cakes, they were good.  Much better then the typiclal store bought party cake.  The bread is typical, nothing special.Wish there were more varieties in the cookie section.

0.description: Great old neighborhood bakery.  Very good prices and an old school feel.

20.description: Best chocolate frosted cake donuts anywhere....!

19.description: I had a "dutch cherry" and a cupcake. The dutch cherry was awesome. This place is cheap and good. No reason not to keep coming back.

2.description: Very horrible service, the owner is very rude , he will never get a penny from me again

18.description: So today was Fat Tuesday/Packzi Day/Pancake day. Even though I am not Catholic enough to fast for or even give up anything for lent, I always partake in a Packzi or two. I am Polish after all, so when every bakery in Chicago is selling these, how can I pass em up? A couple of weeks ago Aaron S. found out that this bakery, just a couple of blocks away from home were making them, I figured what do I have to loose in trying them out? I had a different but further away bakery in mind to try out, but once my work schedual came out for the week, I realized that making it out there during non peak hours wouldn't quite work out. I went in to pick up my order about twenty minutes before the time I gave them and I didn't have to wait at all. No lines. Awesome. The Packzi themselves? Really good. They have the right texture. Are the right size (BIG) and just almost perfect flavor. I was confused by a couple of things though. They were more like a Packzi sandwich. I guess they filled them that way to save time? It just confuses me when places do it this way because none of the Packzi's from my childhood were ever made this way. Also custard Packzi's traditionally have a chocolate icing/glaze on them, these did not. Very minor things really in the big picture. All in all I was/am a happy camper.

13.description: Worst bakery ever .. Don't ever go there waste of money you will end up throwing whatever you buy. pathetic pastry.

4.description: So I NEVER go to the southside. I had to head down that way to get some quality white sox stuff for a special gift. I got down there too early and decided to be a fatty about it and get doughnuts. I didnt want the "fresh of the assembly line" taste of dunkin donuts so I looked for something original and randomly found this place. And let me say I am glad that I did.First of all the doughnuts are gigantic. They are $1 each for easily $5 worth of doughnut that taste like $1,000,000. The inside is old, rustic, but beautifully kept and smells so good you want to drop kick a puppy in celebration. Everyone in the neighborhood apparently knows about this gem but no one ever told me... jerks.

24.description: The chocolate glazed cake doughnuts are amazing! Best in the city! They are reasonably priced (83 cents, I believe, for a gargantuan doughnut that should be split, or else your pants won't fit later on) The goodies here are fresh, tasty and substantial. They taste like they were "made with love". The staff has always been very sweet.Also: for those going with young children, the entire wall opposing the counter is mirrors so the young'ins will stay occupied while you order. :-)

6.description: Impallaria reminds me of all the surprisingly affordable neighborhoody New England bakeries i grew to love when i was in Providence, that for whatever reason also sell pizza, calzones, Italian goodies, and seem to specialize in donuts but don't have any indoor seating.  LOVE their super early hours, and the fact that even when i'm there right at 5am, there are always people pouring in and out like the rest of Chicago isn't still sleeping for another hour at least.  obviously the donuts here are insane, but their cupcakes, zeppoles, and other desserts are also great--just not a fan of the sausage and bacon buns which tend to run a little dry.

22.description: Cute place, great pastries, very inexpensive. What's not to like?

15.description: It's an Italian bakery in a predominantly Chinese neighborhood. BY THE WAY, the hours are 5am-5pm on weekdays. Slightly different hours on weekends, I can't remember exactly what they are, but they're written outside the door.Pros: The donuts are a-freaking-mazing. Soft cake texture, and I found myself ransacking the paper bag for more pieces of icing. The coffee is fantastic. I'm not a fan of Starbucks, and Dunkincoffee is just mediocre for me. You can taste the slow-cooked flavor of this coffee. The prices are not bad, but Dunkin is slightly cheaper. Donuts are 98 cents each, and there are no "deals" here. But at least you know you're not stuffing yourself with preservatives at 8am. Also, this place seems like a one-stop-shop for your sweet tooth. They've got a great variety of pastries, cheesecakes, and cookies, as well. All of them looked good. Cons: No website, no brochure, and prices are listed in a semi-organized fashion in the bakery. I got an "apricot log" b/c I was craving rugelach, so maybe I was setting myself up for disappointment. It was dry and flavorless. I will be coming back here for the donuts and coffee. And maybe a cheesecake when I crave one.

7.description: The donuts and danishes are very good here. Anice place to go to right before you're going to work

8.description: The butter crust is really good with a quite low price , and the bacon bun is good too

30.description: They offer a pretty wide range of goods for a small bakery.  The bread is standard stuff, but the pastries really shine.  My favorites are the Italian cookies with sprinkles.

3.description: Like a few people stated, I don't think this is a deli. Just a bakery.I came in to inquire about cakes and decided to get two cannolis to try.They were fine, but I'll like to come back and try the donuts next time.

14.description: Don't get the Boston Cream Donut because you won't get any custard filling. Being 8 months pregnant, my husband was nice enough to go out in this freezing weather to get me that donut and it really stinks that there was hardly any custard. If you want a Boston Cream, find another place!!

0.description: Yaaaassss! Within an hour (mb even 45 minutes) of leaving the salon  3 compliments and counting. Kyra is a magician when it comes to color. She took my outgrown &  tired blonde highlights and warmed me up to a vibrant red,copper brunette blend. The whole process was pretty quick and my hair appointment started right on time!!!   The Salon is conveniently located & has $FREE.99 street parking. In addition to great stylists both Kyra & Daria seem like great people, I've found my hair coloring home

29.description: This place is sorta hit or miss. It's definitely more of your goodwill/salvation army/junk you would never wear and don't even know where people would buy this stuff. But then, there will be a random find in there that's worth it. So yeah.. definitely a treasure hunt! Since you've been warned.. you really do have to dig deep and have some energy to find some stuff here. Half price Mondays are the best way to go, even though it's hectic, and you might get jostled around a bit.

42.description: As thrift stores go, I consider the entire Unique chain to be just above mediorcre in prices but definitely out of this world in terms of the kinds of merchandise that can be found.  My best find ever at this particular store, and let me state for the record that I shop at thrift stores at least 3 x's a week..yes I am an addict and my closet reflects it, was 4 pairs of couture quality shoes. Two pairs of BRAND NEW Bruno Magli heels that were beyond beautiful.  One pair I still have not worn is a kelly green lizard slingback with matching kidskin leather surrounding, the other a gorgeous pair of navy suede 3" cone heels that can be worn year round...the other two were Joseph brand and custom made in Italy.  I feel bad to say that some woman that just happened to have a shoe fetish in my size must have died...but I was the one that was in heaven.  My ex-boyfreind had taken me to this store and given me a $50 limit as a belated birthday gift.  I got the shoes for about $6 a piece and spent the rest on items I can no longer recall.  These shoes were the best b-day present I have recieved in years.  So...guys for all you wondering what to get your lady for Valentines day...b-day...x-mas...when you are in the doghouse in general.  Here it is:  take her on a thrift store shopping spree you never know what she will find and remember for the rest of her life.  These 4 pairs of shoes are probably valued at least $200 a piece and I paid $24 bucks for all four pairs!   I love expensive items just as much as any other woman just like quanity and quality!!!

23.description: I have never found anything to wear at this store--and a quarter of my wardrobe seems to be from Village Thrift, particular the quarter populated by cashmere and stuff from Paris.  But on the sodden afternoon of 12/31/10 I walked in here off the street and forked over a few dollars for a quartet of clunky square ruby glass ashtrays with tasteful Campari labels on the bottom, and a three-quart Calphalon nonstick saute pan (sans lid) that makes reheating leftovers effortless, and which would have cost a hundred bucks new.  And I also revisited my lost youth in the process by listening to bad 1980s pop music that I had been exposed to long ago and had mercifully forgotten, while rummaging through racks of bad 1980s and 1990s clothing of a type that I had been exposed to long ago but had mercifully forgotten.  This part of the experience was worse than psychotherapy, but I was able to staunch the flow of traumatic memory a few minutes later and a few blocks south at Bernice's Tavern, where the enchanting Michael mixed me a manhattan and presented me with a free Lithuanian beer.   Vive Bridgeport.

8.description: I wasn't sure what to expect because that was the first Unique location I've been to.  There was a strange stench the moment I walked in, but thanks to olfactory fatigue, you don't notice it after a few minutes.  It was kind of a hot mess when we got there.  There were things strewn on the floor and on top of racks, but I don't really care about things like that since it just makes the hunt that much more interesting.  All the Unique stores have a store wide 50% off sale on Mondays so it was a pretty good deal.  The selection isn't all too amazing.  There are some mid-high brands that you run across, but for the most part it's a lot of random, junky tops, dresses, bottoms, etc.  I didn't find any gems, but I found some decent pieces that I can see myself wearing on a day to day basis.  They also don't have much in the way of shoes.  Warning: The parking lot is a headache.

31.description: A one star upgrade for taking credit and debit cards is well deserved.  The other reason for this shiny extra star?  The intense people watching mayhem that was caused by a crazy old man shouting "Where is my hat?!" and going completely psycho over a gross grey stocking cap that he had knocked off his own head.

34.description: I love coming here on a Monday morning for their half price special. If you can get here early enough, you can find some good grabs. Come later than 4 and get ready to fight for a parking space and then continue to fight inside.

16.description: In a small mall so it's easy to get in and out. The racks were surprisingly pretty organized when I dropped by. Pricier than other thrift stores, but the quality is prolly better too.The kicker for me though was when I was leaving and eyeing a $45 pink (and frivolous) "coach" purse behind the valuable loots counter. I asked a sales lady to help me look at it. She wouldn't let me leave the counter area to look at a mirror. That was Unique policy.But she more than made up for it. She got me a ridiculously small mirror and held it up for a better angle. Then she told me how that purse was gonna be gone in no time, cause so many customers were eyeing it. Then she did the favor of explaining to me how the purse was fake. And she would know cause her other prior purchases were fake. I was puzzled b/c it was so cute (pink!), and cause I know you could likely buy a new fake one for a similar price. Lol.Then I took a better look at the inside fabric, and noticed it was the wrong type of lining for a Coach purse.I just looked at her and said, "Thank you for taking the time to help me so much." (I meant to say thank you for not almost letting me pay full price for a used knock off!) She replied warmly, "You're welcome, it's my job to help the consumer, either way." I left Unique thinking, "wow..that was seriously classy."

13.description: Do not come here expecting great customer service. Do come here expecting great deals. I outfitted my  kitchen for less than $20 and managed to snag matching cups, plates and bowls. Parking lot is packed! Free parking but packed to the gills. Go ahead and pay for parking on Halsted. You are saving tons of money anyways shopping here. Save yourself the headache.

11.description: It's very organize other than Monday if you GO MONDAY and EARLY at 6 if possible. It can get pricey and they are nice condition. Also, they don't have a fitting room.

39.description: I am lucky enough to have Mondays off from work!~Why does that make me lucky, you ask? Because MONDAYS ARE HALF PRICE DAY at Unique Thrift. Everything, and I mean everything in the store, is half price! I get down and dirty in this store. Sometimes I finish round one, load up the car, and go back for more. Apparently there is a line when they open. These are the folks that want the furniture, lamps, artwork, and other big items. Me? I don't do early!Go anytime on Monday and load up with great deals that are of pretty good quality. Just don't blame me if you're arm is killing you from carrying all of those finds!!P.S. The parking in the busy lot can be a hassle. Be patient.

37.description: Working in Bridgeport this week so most reviews will reflect this.  Stopped in to see what they had.  Scored some new washable shopping bags here (tons of 'em/weird variety) for $.99 each.  The last bags I bought elsewhere were $5 each but for a good cause.  Well organized clothes and bric-a-brac.  Limited furniture.  Spied an employee playing with a new puppet before shelving it..."When she turned and saw she was being watched she laughed and said. "I must be getting tired!"Have to mention that a lot of thrift stores I've been too carry some pretty busted stuff.  Didn't notice so much of it here.

0.description: It went yesterday because .... why not? The store is nice sized and well organized. I found a 12 month shirt from Children's Place ($2), a Chicago baseball jersey ($3), tons of socks ($0.40 each) and some material ($3). When I took everything up to the counter, it turns out that it was half price day. Whoo hoo!I got all that and a few extra things for $7. I was just at the outlet mall in Aurora and saw a similar children's shirt for $16 full price and $6 at the outlet. I got mine for $1 in perfect condition.  =) I will be returning.

38.description: Best thrift store chain around. Mondays are completely insane, and your chances of finding good stuff diminish exponentially as the day passes.
