This location has a bit less both in terms of people and stuff, however.Their parking lot is ridiculous. Best to not drive or park on the street next to the park/baseball field.Finding cool, old (rare?) stuff is great. People smelling funny in close proximity to you isn't. Same goes for the store's taste in radio stations.

27.description: Compared to the other Unique locations I frequent, this one has to be the most unorganized and smelliest (most smelly?).  Not Village Discount smelly, but close.Still, I bear the crowds on most Mondays for half price deals.  And I've had pretty good luck.

32.description: I think that I appreciate Unique a little bit more than most simply because I avoid the clothing.  I'm a fat man who already knows it's impossible to find anything in my size, so once I look past that, every other section here is a veritable gold mine of discounts and nostalgia.80% of my purchases here are in the categories of books and games.  I once picked up practically the entire Peanuts collection of books for less than $3.  I magically found replacements for some of the Dan Brown books I'd lent to others (and let's face it, the man only has 4 books out - plus the new one that's not Unique-findable yet).  And the random other finds that came out of the book selection include Scott Adams (the guy who draws Dilbert) and some comedy books from Dave Barry, Tim Allen and Bill Cosby.  If you can wade through the scores of trashy romance novels, you'll find some good books in there.And the games!  I've found so many old games from my childhood, including Life, Double Trouble, 13 Dead End Drive, Clue, Trivial Pursuit (many varieties), Probe, Stratego, and so many more.  And they're so cheap!!  Only once have I purchased a game that was missing some of its original pieces - most of the time they do a good job checking that before they put games out to be sold.Same goes with appliances.  You're free to plug things into test outlets to make sure they work before taking them home.  We recently decided to adopt a $6 bread machine and several loaves later, we're in no way regretting taking the chance.  Their kitchen appliance section is nestled by the shoes for some reason, just to the right of the immense selection of cups and plates and silverware that had also led to some awesome finds.  My favorites are finding not one but TWO Gevalia-brand ceramic coffee-storage containers.  And my favorite mug that looks like a glass barrel with a wooden handle that reads "BELLY BUSTER" across it.Some of the electronics seem dodgy or not quite worth the price, but that's what 25% off and 50% off color tags are for.  Hit the right day and you can get it for half price.  Or just on a Monday - but I enjoy avoiding the crowds so I avoid Mondays here.Lastly, shop for the random things you'll find on top of the aisleways or scattered throughout some of the standing sections.  That's how I found my giant body pillow shaped like a catfish.  His name is Herbert and he cost $1.  He's my unofficial mascot of Unique Thrift Store, reminding me that anything can happen at Unique and you never know what you'll wind up coming home with.

44.description: Best Unique in the Bridgeport, McKinley Park, Brighton Park area. Keep going, there's bargains to be found. You have to be open to what's there, not necessarily what you need.It seems to me that the Unique stores are getting more expensive.

24.description: I'm quite certain the manager of this particular Unique Thrift is either 10 months pregnant and nesting, or has OCD. Read: It's more organized than some stores that sell new crap, like Target or Marshall's, or TJ Maxx. Now, I realize that isn't saying a whole lot...but if you've been to a few Unique Thrift's in your day, you know they can be a hot mess most of the time, jam-packed with mothbally sweaters and snot-laden children. This Bridgeport one, it's sparklin'. Organized by color, plenty of room to walk between aisles, CLEAN, and un-frantical. No crazy mothers screeching down the aisles running into people with carts. In fact, we sort of guessed this would be the case strolling in 10/30 around 2pm with last minute Halloween shoppers and it being a Saturday and all. But nope, quite civilized. However, this comes at a price. My goblin selected perhaps the ugliest combo of paisley shirt and rug-type glitter vest, and each piece was....$5.99!? Are they crazy!? This stuff is so ugly/dated, it should be about $1. No more! But, he was last minute and needed the makings of a hot Jan Skylar on the quick, so he wasn't as concerned about price, I suppose. Do note that it does seem a bit pricier than other UTs, but you do get a nice, spiffy clean place to shop, organized and easy to find whatever crap you may be seeking, and minimal crazies. They do have the classic UT deals with different colored tags, etc and of course they STAPLE the tags into the clothes (never understand that, it makes HOLES in them, people!). However, the parking lot is a HOT MESS. It's kind of narrow and disfigured and is shared by shoppers at Walgreens, McDonald's and a few other strip mall stores. Parker beware, you may be better off with the free street parking nearby...!

7.description: 4 stars for being a godsend in finding my last minute DIY Halloween costume!This location is far better than another UTS I have been to in West Rogers Park. The aisles are wider, it is more organized by comparison, and brighter (doesn't feel like a dungeon). The only downside is that the parking lot can be a big mess to get in and out of.

40.description: I was going to start my review out by saying I felt the quality of merchandise has gone from stellar to boring at this location in the past few years and I wasnt sure what the reason was.  Then I read the other reviews.  Now I know why - its too damn popular and everyone is getting the good stuff before me!!  Dammit.  There once was a time that the vintage selection of this store was bad-ass and I always left with two armfuls of stuff for like $25.  Now I go in here and its all shrunken Old Navy shirts and pressboard furniture of Wal-Mart quality.  But I have to give an extra star for the organization and clothes arranged by colour.  Thats awesome.  Now everyone please stop going here so I can have my store back.  Thanks.

30.description: I've never seen this much rack in one room in my whole life!This place is nuts.  It's literally a room full of rack with various crap piled on top.  I had trouble navigating that isles as the only thing I saw with any sort of signage was the boys clothes.  There was towels, sheets, jackets, coats, shoes, bags, housewares and jeans.  Oh the jeans....  I saw jeans in three or 4 different places with absolutely no sex or size labels in sight.  I didn't have the time to scour like I usually would but I did see a couple pairs of Apple Bottoms so consider this place A-Ok in my book.

46.description: a friend of mine made $400 on ebay by selling the stuff she bought from this store. There are so many good things worth alot of money. Everyone should go here atleast once.

1.description: I'm so spoiled by the half-Monday sale, so shopping on other days of the week just isn't an option anymore.  I was meeting my hubby since he was working on a call nearby.  He wanted to check it out this afternoon.  This is a fairly-clean and well-organized location.  The venue is much bigger than the one in McKinley Park by the CTA 35th./Archer Orange line station.  Thus, the shopping carts can actually pass through each aisle without too many "excuse me!" Perhaps because it wasn't a Monday, the store appeared to be peaceful and orderly.  Items were neatly hung on the hangers or clamps.  I can only imagine what a Monday will look like.  Rosa J. is a pretty skillful thrift-shopper, but she dislikes fighting with the crowd.  However, not being claustrophobic is beneficial, so she will get into a battle if she needs to.  Rosa J. still likes great deals, so she will act when her next available Monday comes by.  Hubby, on the other hand, purchased some kind of video game cable for $3.  He believes that it was a reasonable purchase.  On the side note, they play great late 80s/early 90s music in store.

9.description: Been going here for years!!! saved me when i was in a bind plenty of times.. i totally recoomend it

26.description: In a small mall so it's easy to get in and out. The racks were surprisingly pretty organized when I dropped by. Pricier than other thrift stores, but the quality is prolly better too.The kicker for me though was when I was leaving and eyeing a $45 pink (and frivolous) "coach" purse behind the valuable loots counter. I asked a sales lady to help me look at it. She wouldn't let me leave the counter area to look at a mirror. That was Unique policy.But she more than made up for it. She got me a ridiculously small mirror and held it up for a better angle. Then she told me how that purse was gonna be gone in no time, cause so many customers were eyeing it. Then she did the favor of explaining to me how the purse was fake. And she would know cause her other prior purchases were fake. I was puzzled b/c it was so cute (pink!), and cause I know you could likely buy a new fake one for a similar price. Lol.Then I took a better look at the inside fabric, and noticed it was the wrong type of lining for a Coach purse.I just looked at her and said, "Thank you for taking the time to help me so much." (I meant to say thank you for not almost letting me pay full price for a used knock off!) She replied warmly, "You're welcome, it's my job to help the consumer, either way." I left Unique thinking, "wow..that was seriously classy."

25.description: My first impression of this place is that it is jammed packed from top to bottom! Random items fills every crevice or in gigantic selections. Amazing, but hard to shop in.

12.description: I walk in, perfectly innocent and with no intentions to steal anything and the first thing I'm told is that I have to leave my backpack at the counter. This is nothing short of an affront. If they can't trust me not to steal their mostly crappy clothes why should I trust them not to steal stuff out of my back-pack? To compound the insult, it took close to ten minutes for someone to arrive at the counter to return my back-pack when I was done and ready to leave the store.Not only is this tactic an unforgivable insult, it discourages people from carrying their own bags which is something we should all be doing by now right?

21.description: Unique sucks, don't believe the hype. (You're being redirected from the better thrifts to the worse ones like this by thrifters being stingy with their mojo spots. Trust me.)  The prices are ridiculous for the quality of items. I wouldn't mind paying $7.99 for a used cashmere cardigan, but I do mind paying $7.99 for pilling, misshapen acrylic/polyester schmattes, which describes most of what's in here. If you are looking for odds and ends you may have better luck finding reasonable prices, but avoid the clothing, it's uppity. Accessories are even more ridiculous and the pricing seems to have no rhyme or reason. This particular Unique has shared parking lot so in theory parking is available, but the lot is small so you can't bet on it not being full, especially on sale days. Skip Unique & find a Salvation Army or a Village Discount.

17.description: This location is the first Unique Store I have found. I REALLY liked it because: 1) there is free, available parking (in a lot)2) the clothes are by sizes, not color like Goodwill seems to do3) they have deals by color of tags, and on their website they have TONs of sales on varying days of the week.4) books are uber cheap! I think it's something like 10 soft covers for 0.99? Great for kids books!5) the place was clean and was pleasant, and cool (in hot weather).6) TONS of shoe selection, it outranks Target and their shoes7) Their curtains and sheets were all hung up nicely instead of shoved on a shelf8) It's a pretty big store-though I've only been to 1 so far.Cons or Wish List: I wish they had shelving units for the office supplies, wooden knickknacks, housewares, all the 'other stuff' that I like to peruse. They currently  have them on the top of the clothing racks, which is a little under eye level for me.

10.description: I just came in here for a quick glance while my food was getting prepared (ordered at Triple Crown express in the same plaza). They had really cheap books that are in good condition. Moreover, everything seems to be organized though there are a little bit of everything. I got a bit exited over the fancy dresses (prom/ evening gowns/etc) that were at the far right of the store. They were second (maybe even more hands...) hands that are at a reasonable price. I didn't examine too closely, but they seemed relatively new to me. There are a lot of slim dresses. People might do well if they are in a dress emergency with an extremely tight budget. Who can tell that the dress was previously owned by someone else??

5.description: I'm quite certain the manager of this particular Unique Thrift is either 10 months pregnant and nesting, or has OCD. Read: It's more organized than some stores that sell new crap, like Target or Marshall's, or TJ Maxx. Now, I realize that isn't saying a whole lot...but if you've been to a few Unique Thrift's in your day, you know they can be a hot mess most of the time, jam-packed with mothbally sweaters and snot-laden children. This Bridgeport one, it's sparklin'. Organized by color, plenty of room to walk between aisles, CLEAN, and un-frantical. No crazy mothers screeching down the aisles running into people with carts. In fact, we sort of guessed this would be the case strolling in 10/30 around 2pm with last minute Halloween shoppers and it being a Saturday and all. But nope, quite civilized. However, this comes at a price. My goblin selected perhaps the ugliest combo of paisley shirt and rug-type glitter vest, and each piece was....$5.99!? Are they crazy!? This stuff is so ugly/dated, it should be about $1. No more! But, he was last minute and needed the makings of a hot Jan Skylar on the quick, so he wasn't as concerned about price, I suppose. Do note that it does seem a bit pricier than other UTs, but you do get a nice, spiffy clean place to shop, organized and easy to find whatever crap you may be seeking, and minimal crazies. They do have the classic UT deals with different colored tags, etc and of course they STAPLE the tags into the clothes (never understand that, it makes HOLES in them, people!). However, the parking lot is a HOT MESS. It's kind of narrow and disfigured and is shared by shoppers at Walgreens, McDonald's and a few other strip mall stores. Parker beware, you may be better off with the free street parking nearby...!

3.description: You've really got to look through the items here. Most of it is pretty lackluster. But, if you dig around, you'll find a thing or two. also, they hang all of their pants by the top corner. it's kind of strange looking and makes looking through them quite a task. no dressing room. dress to try things on in the aisle.found a great skirt, a great pair of vintage pumps and a cute scarf. just so happened to but again, i had to really search.

35.description: This location used to have some good finds, but lately it's a dump.  Not only is the merchandise sub-par, but there are always hangers, books, clothing and shoes on the ground over which it is impossible to navigate your cart.  Today I almost bought scarves but then decided that my money would be better spent at McDonald's Express a couple doors down.  And once my friend got her wallet stolen here and no, she is not an idiot who is just asking to be robbed.The one star is for the vintage Sunbeam mixer with mint condition bowls I found here once.  Who know that this Unique's one redeeming quality would be it's supply of great stand mixers?

19.description: I was pleasantly surprised at this Unique store (before I realized that all Uniques are pretty great) because the neighborhood isn't that great, and it's right by the train tracks and the parking lot isn't very well lit.  That said, they have a big parking lot all to themselves, which is very nice.I've only been once, but will be coming again the next time I'm on the south side.  We lucked out that everything we bought was 50% off, we bought about 5 games, 3 skirts and 2 shirts for about $10!  The guy at the cash register was really nice.  (this is the same as my reviews for the other 2 Uniques I've been to:)Check which tag colors are 25 or 50% off!  As with all Unique stores, everything is 50% off on Mondays (excluding shoes and jewelry I think).  Check their website or go to the store for more specials, usually around a holiday weekend, everything will be 50% off that Saturday and Sunday.  We went on a weekend AFTER a holiday sale, and it was totally not worth it, everything had been picked over and while there was still alot of stuff, it wasn't quality items. So far I've been to 3 Unique stores, and all have been pretty great in terms of selection of clothing, games & housewares.  I think the Unique stores are some of the best thrift stores in the city.

28.description: I seem to do the opposite of what most people do, I DON'T come for the clothes but come for the housewares & nic-nacs. Keep in mind, my inner interior decorator is 80 years old and 13 years old at the same time without any irony. The store is relatively well organized for it's brood, it's still sloppy drunk but it's organized like most thrift stores. The clothes are really unpredictable and it's hard to find something good, it's a good place for costume stuff on half price Mondays. I get all of the housewares here as well as the many plaques with quotes about friendship or a warm home. I tend to find awesome toys here, from my mini megaphone to my Disney chalkboard. The jewelery usually sucks and I'm not adventurous enough to look at the shoes. The books are relatively outdated and irrelevant unless you really are looking for the Da Vinci Code, children's books or cheesy romance novels.I also don't understand why people have to check their bags now. I'm sorry, but I wouldn't try to steal this stuff even if I were a kleptomaniac. I admit I have bought fabric and blankets here which my mom still thinks is completely absurd. I generally recommend this place to people who are into that hipster dirty look, not for people trying to find vintage Dior with little effort. You have to dig. Also, lots of strange materials for art students to play around with.Bring cash and survive the cashiers, that is my main advice.

45.description: This place is great. I think the best part of the store is the none clothing items. It is also a lot cleaner and nicer than most thrift stores. Prices are a little higher than at other places and the men's section is a little lacking.

33.description: Unique thrift store. *sigh* I have shopped here on several occasions. I especially like buying picture frames. Their pretty cheap. I have to say that this is just like any other thrift store. Mish mash stuff here and there in no particular order. I just went back to shop here last Sunday, and just yesterday of this writing. I have put together 2 Holloween costumes for my son. Both under 12 bucks! They have the used holloween costumes on sale too but I didn't buy those. No. I bought all the old clothes I could to construct a HULK costume, AND a LIZARD(spiderman's enemy) costume. Wow. Great. I don't really recommend for tons of people to shop here. Why? because unless you are into thrift shopping, then ok. I notice that stores like Target, and Walmart sell new stuff for just as cheap, or less. I don't shop so much at Walmart as I do at Target. Unique thrift store? it's pretty cool. This store is located in a little strip mall. It's actually built right on the very spot that was once a Dominick's supermarket way back in the 1970's. McGuanne park is right next to it. There is a Walgreens next door, a McDonalds, Little Ceasar's pizza, and other strip mall stores. Well, that is all for now.

43.description: a typewriter, a bowling ball, a vintage givenchy shirt and four orange le crueset pots for $40.  a good deal except it was half price monday and i got them for $20.  if you go on a monday be ready to throw down because it is nothing but insanity from 6am to 9pm.  prices are expensive for a thrift store, but lets not split hairs here.

2.description: Half off days at Unique are super addicting!  They have them every Monday and major holidays such as Memorial Day.  This location is high traffic, so I feel that you need to frequent often to find good stuff.  I've picked up a few items on the last few visits, but haven't had as much luck in the women's section as the other locations, but men's items have been decent!  We found men's American Eagle hoodies, and GAP/Club Monaco button down shirts for $4.99.  Since it is by Chinatown, there's been a few times where I spotted tea sets and silk qipao dresses for under $10.  Among my favorite finds is a pair of new Argo Tea mugs for only $0.49 after the 50% off.  Great neighborhood place to hunt for deals!

18.description: Friendly staff, great selection, you can find just about anything here. I'm addicted to this place,

41.description: Its a thrift store, just like any other thrift store. I live a few blocks away so I stop in at least once a week. Whoever makes up the random prices here isn't too insane, but there's the occasional $50 broken VCR. Got some great records and shirts here, and my prized thrift store find of the moment, a fully-functioning CD/LP/Radio/Dual tape deck-was-$500-in-1988 stereo system for $40. Better than the Unique near Archer and Damen. Nightmare parking lot, but hey, at least they have one.

4.description: BEWARE OF THIS STORE! STAFFS ARE SUSPECTED THIEFS.I was browsing through products in store and I left my bag on the cart next to me. While browsing, one of the staff strike a conversation with me to distract my attention away from my bag. Little did I know, my bag was missing after that conversation. When I begged for help, the staffs did NOTHING at all. They were selfish, inconsiderate and unhelpful. They claim to be "busy" but were doing nothing.

6.description: I often find some hidden gems here. Great prices, a different deal every day. (Pay attention to the color of the tags and the signs in the store! A blue tag could mean 50% off one day!) I've bought some really cute clothes here. I've also bought some not-so-nice things to make a costume with for really, really cheap. A lot of miscellaneous goodies could be found, as well. We're talking board games, wall decor, pretty pillows, bags of toys, costumes, etc.Only giving it four stars because a) there's no fitting room and b) the place is overwhelmingly disorganized.

22.description: I was pleasantly surprised at this Unique store (before I realized that all Uniques are pretty great) because the neighborhood isn't that great, and it's right by the train tracks and the parking lot isn't very well lit.  That said, they have a big parking lot all to themselves, which is very nice.I've only been once, but will be coming again the next time I'm on the south side.  We lucked out that everything we bought was 50% off, we bought about 5 games, 3 skirts and 2 shirts for about $10!  The guy at the cash register was really nice.  (this is the same as my reviews for the other 2 Uniques I've been to:)Check which tag colors are 25 or 50% off!  As with all Unique stores, everything is 50% off on Mondays (excluding shoes and jewelry I think).  Check their website or go to the store for more specials, usually around a holiday weekend, everything will be 50% off that Saturday and Sunday.  We went on a weekend AFTER a holiday sale, and it was totally not worth it, everything had been picked over and while there was still alot of stuff, it wasn't quality items. So far I've been to 3 Unique stores, and all have been pretty great in terms of selection of clothing, games & housewares.  I think the Unique stores are some of the best thrift stores in the city.

15.description: I quite like this location. Sure it can be a little jenky but I've grown up in the area and I'm used to it. There are some great finds here if you have to patience and time to look through it. I've gotten myself great tops and excellent condition purses here. Even my SO wonders how I can find such nice stuff at thrift store. Most of the time I have pretty good luck, other times I'll walk out empty handed. But all in all, not bad.

20.description: I walk in, perfectly innocent and with no intentions to steal anything and the first thing I'm told is that I have to leave my backpack at the counter. This is nothing short of an affront. If they can't trust me not to steal their mostly crappy clothes why should I trust them not to steal stuff out of my back-pack? To compound the insult, it took close to ten minutes for someone to arrive at the counter to return my back-pack when I was done and ready to leave the store.Not only is this tactic an unforgivable insult, it discourages people from carrying their own bags which is something we should all be doing by now right?

36.description: ok ok i'll stop updating this review.  i just wanted to gloat about my holy grail of thrift store finds here.  white kitchenaid stand mixer with lift up bowl including dough hook and wire wisk and also the roomba 530 series still in it's box.  Finding these here has saved me A LOT of money.  woo hoo!

14.description: I liked it better years ago before it moved to this location.   When it was down the street I used to find some really good upscale items at thrift store prices.  Now it's junk and greater than thrift store prices.  Generally items are over priced but I will go look on Mondays

3.description: Went there today and it was very nice . Decent girls and they are professional. Definitely a happy ending involved

1.description: This place got some nasty ass girls working here-- this lady gave my husband a fucking condom covered BLOW JOB that he paid $100 dollars for! Extremely unprofessional! Good job Ruby Spa on being a homewrecker, we have 2 kids ! Smh.

2.description: I just went to Ruby 's and the lady's are sexy and very helpful to their customer's a very clean place I will be going back and thanks to all the other reviews of this place and I think Xindy's went out of business they haven't been open since last September or October so Ruby 's will be my new massage parlor.

5.description: I was rather surprised to see that this placed was reviewed by women. Quite shocked really, because once inside it has the air of "house of ill repute," so to speak. I chose it because the lights were still on early one evening after doing some instense running. I was sore, stressed out, and wanted to just relax.The entrance was rather inviting; several Asian women were sitting around watching TV and the one at the counter related their price information. Pretty standard dollar a minute sort of deal. I agreed, and was led back to one of the rooms to undress. The table shower thing was pretty awesome. I didn't know how to feel being treated like a piece of dirty meat to be hosed down and disinfected for her petite Asian hands. For some reason she concentrated on my posterior assets and the divide. Did I offend? Did not know and by now wasn't caring, I was being showered by another human being. Felt weird feelings of regressing to infancy in the strong, confident hands loofa-ing me up.The massage itself was rather lackluster. It was quite "sensual" as one of the other women reviewers mentioned. Again, I was treated to backdoor antics and showered with compliments. Really know how to flatter a guy, these masseuses. My thighs and back were really worked on after requesting such work. I left feeling better, just not as relieved as when a 60 y.o. Asian lady did deep tissue and beat the hell out of me. I was reborn then, not at this joint. I left sticky, but not the good kind of sticky.I am of the same opinion that it is tacky to request to be tipped. It IS rude to demand a fixed amount. I experienced the same thing and was quite put off by their pushy demeanor. Even breaking into Cantonese and giggling to another masseuse between hasseling me for a tip. Blatant sycophancy and mediocre massage do not a good client relationship make. So, I tipped half of what she requested. Smarmy chocolate starfish loving diva that she was she had a problem with it. Yeah, even worse is when you purse your face into a vaggy resembleance of a smooshed ET figurine to give me the "stink" finger for lousy salesmanship. I've had better massages at more reputable places. Move on down the strip.

6.description: Effy or Mi-Mi. Effy is more methodical and reserved but Mi-Mi is definitely more outside the box. Either one is a go. 60 / 10 / 60 / 20 / 40

7.description: Ok, so I was dying for a massage - so many friggin workouts and no massage in a very long time, and my muscles are tight.  I cruised down Archer avenue, looking at signs, and saw Ruby Spa with a sign lit up that said 'open'.  I park my car, go up to the door - windows are tinted and door is locked.  I ring bell and some Chinese woman answers the door.  Two other Chinese women are lounging on the leather couch in their pajamas.  So the woman is showing me the prices for massage.  In the meanwhile, two creepy men came in separately.  I should have gotten a clue, but hey, I'm dying for a good, deep tissue massage.  We go into the room, and i strip down.  The woman comes back in, continuously rubs oil softly all over my back and butt.  No deep tissue massage here, just gentle, sensual (eeewww!!!) strokes up and down my back and butt.  And I'm telling you, she's about 1/2 inch from my privates at least 3 times.  Then she says 'you have such nice body'.  UGGGHH.  Ok, I will never visit again.  Obviously, she was attempting a happy ending on me.  YUCK!!!  I give them 2 stars though - she did tell me I have a nice body and she gave me a little bottle of cold water after.

0.description: Listen I had gone to this wonderful massage place not far from Xindy's down the block.THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC!!!!!!I was left breathless leaving the establishment. There is street parking and its not far from the Stevenson expressway.People were friendly and accomodated me fairly well.The chinese masseuse had rubbed away my back and leg pain. She was very courteous and friendly . I can walk much better after this relaxing experience.Thankyou RUBY SPA

4.description: There should be a statute of limitations on  yelp reviews: the only ones of this place I found were on 2010. Massage is a flowing business: peaking today, bancrupt (or jailed) tomorrow. So, forget what you read, and there are no MIMIs or EFFIs there.But YoYo is, and she is delighful, and she knows what to massage and how to please. It's a totally legit nice massage, masterfully performed by the womaqn who could be a movie star.The only true part is the lobby: it's still unpleasant and unwelcoming, with a table full of unfinished food and garbage bags on the floor. But hey, for a lobby experience, go to Hilton or Drake. For a massage, go to YoYo.

1.description: She NEVER called me back either. Zero stars. Business ethics like she's still in Africa.  In America we expect some professionalism.  I did however make an appt at Clems hair braiding in Uptown for myself and daughter the next day. This is my usual go to shop for any braid style.  We are very pleased as always with the outcome.  The only reason why I wanted to try Eva was bc of the location- within walking distance from my place & she had good reviews. In my neighborhood or not she will NEVER get any of my money.  Very BAD business for a new customer.

9.description: So I've been getting braids for over 10 years from different areas (FL, VA, NY, ...). I know the ins and outs of braidings, surprise charges, and anything you can think of.  Since I'm new to the area I tried Eva out because of the good reviews on yelp. Here are brief reasons of all the things that went wrong (this is really brief there is more detail to it) :1. She canceled my appointment that I made 5 days in advance the day before. And she did not call me to tell me. I called her to confirm. She agreed I was still good for Sunday. She called me back later and said can I change for next week. So I had to were my hair out for a week. 2. She quoted me $180 for small individual braids that reach the bra strap. I was very specific with her about what I wanted because I hate surprise charges when you get there. Sure enough that's what happened.The lady said it was $200 and up for what I wanted. I told her no Eva said $180 and never have I paid more than $180 for them. I called Eva and she did not answer. To avoid the hassle, I agreed to the 200. 3. They did not have the  hair color I wanted. I asked Eva what type of hair she uses and if she had the color I wanted. If she didn't have it, it wouldn't have been a problem I would have just bought my own. She didn't know what type of hair she used but was sure she had plenty of dark brown. I get there they only had black and light brown. They lady says they never order dark brown. 4. The braids were not done correctly. the lady doing the back of my hair kept doing it wrong. She was making them big. so the braid would start off fat and then skinny on down. Also, she started the braid off in plaits, so if you wanted to do a ponytail you couldn't make one. The parts were huge, so they can rush through it. 5. They kept talking about my hair and the whole price situation in their language. since it was of french dialect I understood a lot of it. They also said to do it bigger since I was only paying $200. 6. My scalp was itching for about 2-3 weeks. I have no idea why. 7. They left small pieces of my hair out. In different areas, also. 8. After 4 weeks, my hair is untangling, frizzy at the end, and a mess. I'm trying to make it to six weeks.  Seriously, since the day I got it done I've been keeping it in french braid because it did not look good out. Positives: the place is clean. I WILL NOT GO BACK. NOT WORTH IT. I wanted to keep this review short but that was impossible. Sorry.

23.description: I really really really liked Eva's.With a lot of hair braiding places, it's dirty, they're late, and unprofessional.  I didn't experience ANY of that at Eva's.  Her salon is easy to find, super clean, and set up very professionally.  Above all, she does an excellent job, my braids lasted over 3 months!  Her prices were pretty decent too.  It was average for microbraids (about $200).  You can find some places that are cheaper, but remember that you get what you pay for.  If I have to pay an extra $20 or $40 for a clean professional hair braiding experience, I think it's totally worth it.  You're sitting there for over 8 hours!  You should at least be comfortable.She really does deserve a 5 star review.  She is very sweet, and all that the other reviewers had to say is true.   I'm going to continue going to her as long as I have braids and live in the area.  I've finally found my "place" and that's Eva's.

5.description: I'm convinced that every positive review on here someone has been paid to write for Eva. Or Eva herself wrote it. This is how my experience at Eva's went :I made a call to Eva 7/25/14 to come in for a take down of my braids plus a re-braid. She said she would call me 7/27 to confirm . She did not call I called her the day of my appointment 7/28 to confirm. She asked I come in 30 minutes later than our scheduled appointment. I get to the appointment and we are ready to cute the extensions off of my hair so the un-braiding can begin. She cuts my headphones in the process. Instead of offering to buy me new ones she hands me some black headphones that are not apple quality and do not fit in my ears.  I gave them back . I don't complain I sit back in the chair to finish my appointment The girls working on my hair complains that it is taking too long and begins cutting my hair shorter." HOLD ON?? YOU ARE CUTTING MY REAL HAIR!!" I TELL HER. I tell her multiple times to stop cutting because that is where my real hair is. I even show her AND EVA a pic of my real hair before I got braids. SHE CONTINUES TO CUT ANYWAYS.   Now I have VERY LARGE chunks of hair missing from my natural hair style. DO NOT GO HERE!!!Then after all of my hair has been taken down, Eva tells me " You have to come back tomorrow to finish because you want small braids."........ We made an appointment for me to get them done today? So now I have to waist a whole day back in here tomorrow?OKAY? So I go back the next day. Eva is not there when I arrive. The ladies doing my hair do not do the first braid correctly. They argue with me about the braids I want. I'm paying them. Do not do my hair the way I don't want it. So she redoes the one braid, and then shows it to me. it is the correct width. DO YOU KNOW THAT IS THE ONLY BRAID SHE DID CORRECTLY? ALL THE OTHERS ARE THE SIZE SHE WANTED THEM TO BE.This woman tricked me by doing one braid the size I wanted so I would agree. Needless to say, my hair is not the length, width or style I want it to be. And Eva charged me  $270. I paid her because I know business. Everyone else says I shouldn't of paid her and I should've walked out. This isn't a rant, it is an awareness message for ANYONE wanting professional haircare. Eva is rude and NOT a professional. DO NOT GO HERE. I have to now pay more money for a legitimate shop to take my braids out and give me exactly what I want.

25.description: Eva is WONDERFUL!  I contacted Eva after reading the reviewis on Yelp and she was so nice.  She even let me come by her shop prior to making my appointment so I could discuss styles and hair types.  I was nervous about getting braids again since I have had so many bad experiences, but Eva was very professional, her shop was clean and she was patient.  I was running late on Saturday morning, but Eva understood and she waited. My hair looks great!  Eva picked out the perfect color and she took her time.I'm definitely going back and my search for a braider is over.  Thanks Eva!

12.description: At the risk of  them becoming even more busy by giving Miss Eva and Fatou a rating of excellence...I must. I must tell you how wonderful they are there. Very professional, clean and not a lot of riff-raff hanging around like there is in the typical Uptown/ Broadway St. braiding salons. Without saying too much...and believe me I can go on and on how wonderful Eva's is....if you want your hair to look good, last, and have a wonderful time dis be da place mon!  ...now I hope I can still get in when I need my hair pulled!

21.description: Eva's braids are amazing! I have straight, silky hair, and her braids stayed in for 2 months. Eva is professional, friendly, and was fun to chat with for the 7 hours I was there. She fulfilled my request of not getting extensions and found a solution that would ensure that the braids stayed for a long time, which they did. Her prices are reasonable as well.I would highly recommend getting natural braids at Eva's!

16.description: I've gone to EVA only twice now over the last 2 yrs after finding her on yelp (see profile pic-- these braides were atleast 2 months old here).1st experience: The shop is clean, and the staff is friendly. She listened to what  I wanted and ensured I had a good experience. She engaged me in conversation and allowed me to watch TV. Eva did my braids her self, but it took much longer than I would have liked. She charged me $180 for senegalese braids, and did them long (which I liked at first). After a few weeks I thought there were a little too long for me, and especially heavy on my neck. I knew the next time I went I would get them a "natural" length that will make it easier for washing and general upkeep. Also, she had a credit card machine which made it much more convenient. Positives: neat, meticulous, clean shop, decent pricing, credit card machine, braids lasted for about 5monthsNegatives: took over 7 hrs, braids were too long, I had to curl the ends myself. 2nd experience: Over the phone I was told that the same braids would be $200 now since they do them long, when I asked about adding color, she said she had the color I wanted. Since I didnt want them long, I asked if it would be less, she said yes. Upon getting there, and reminding her about the color, she brought out a auburn color, and not a burgundy red like I initially asked for! I didnt even know what the color was until they started towards the front of my head (my mistake) so I went with it anyway. At the end of the day it turned out nice, but I still wished it was a little darker. This time she also called in someone to help (thank God!) so that was a plus. She asked me the length and i said (like yours) at the time her braids were shoulder length. Not paying any attention, I noticed that they kept adding hair. She also told me the price would still be $200! WHAT! ok so now you are doing them long and I asked for shoulder lenght, and you are still charging me more.. hmmm!When it was all said and done, she curled them this time. Ok cool. when it came time to pay, I handed her my check card. She looked at me like I was crazy and said "we dont take that anymore, you can go to the atm across the street." Umm no, Im not paying a fee to take money out when you never told me you dont take cc until now! so I found an atm from my bank about a mile away and told her I wuold be back. She then asked me if it was ok if her helper would ride with me (ok what so now you think im not coming back, I would have left collateral). Fine! So I go to get the money and came back and gave it to the girl and dropped her off. WHAT AN INCONVENIENCE. Positives: Same service as before but faster, braids lasted about 4 months, clean shop/ bathroom. Negatives: braids were STILL too long. All and all Eva's still provides a great service, you just have to be VERY specific and VERY assuring of what you want and are getting. Suggestions are good, but dont do what you want when the customer did not ask for that! I'll go back, but with clearer and more SPECIFIC specifications next time! :-)

17.description: Eva is WONDERFUL!  I contacted Eva after reading the reviewis on Yelp and she was so nice.  She even let me come by her shop prior to making my appointment so I could discuss styles and hair types.  I was nervous about getting braids again since I have had so many bad experiences, but Eva was very professional, her shop was clean and she was patient.  I was running late on Saturday morning, but Eva understood and she waited. My hair looks great!  Eva picked out the perfect color and she took her time.I'm definitely going back and my search for a braider is over.  Thanks Eva!

10.description: Its taken me a while to write this but  Eva and her Sister and their Cousin and whomever else they have working there to help out are Fabulous!! I took my daughter in for hair braiding because she swims daily at summer camp. These ladies were Super nice and as I waited, I felt very comfortable talking about Life with them. the laughing and chatting along with their super fast hands helped the time pass by. They were all very professional. Their salon area was a decent size and it wasn't overcrowded. I can only imagine the cramping their fingers must have at the end of the day and it appears that some people forget to Tip.. Come on.. Tip someone who's giving you a great deal and great service. I will return ... I think I spent about $160.. but $175 for a tip  . total

11.description: The first time I went here to refresh a few of my Senegalese Twists was fine, I thought Eva was nice and that the price was fair and that she did a decent job. So I made an apt to see Eva again to refresh the front and back twists and it was weird from the get go. She said I was early even though I was only five minutes early and she left and said shed be back because she needed to buy some hair. Ok. She didnt come back quickly and instead a coworker came and said Eva told her to come see me, this was about twenty five minutes after my scheduled appt. I was hesitant because I only knew Eva was good, which was why I made an appt to see her, but let her coworker proceed to just make things easier. The woman seemed nice but took all the twists out that she was redoing at once which meant she would have no way of comparing the size of the originals with the new ones. When Eva finally came back she first ate dinner and then joined in (but left after maybe an hour and let the other woman finish the job). I wasnt uncomfortable as they were twisting and wasnt sitting in front of a mirror so I just trusted that they were doing a good job. It also took long enough for me to assume that they werent skimping and making the twists bigger than the originals to save time. Boy was I wrong! When they were finally done and I Iooked in the mirror I saw the new twists were noticeably bigger than the old. Awesome. I was told that this was done so that my natural hair wouldnt come undone like had been happening with the old twists. Since there was nothing I could do but try to make more of the hair match I asked if I could come back and have them touch up more for a better look. I was told thatd be fine but when I called I never got a call back. Funny thing is the twists they just did are already unraveling and I also now have tiny white bumps around the front of my scalp. This is why I never leave a review after going somewhere only once or twice, especially a hair salon. You never know what youre getting until youve experienced consistency, and clearly this isnt the place for that.

26.description: I went to Eva about a month ago to fix the ends of a bob that I had done two weeks earlier by someone else. Eva was absolutely amazing!! She was very, very meticulous and my hair came out looking completely different. It looked professionally done and clean!! She is indeed very talented, fast and has a nice and clean shop. I am definitely going back to Eva for my hair braiding needs!

22.description: I am beyond pleased with my results and will be going back again!If you are in search of a friendly braider who is on time and inside of a clean place then go to Eva's

0.description: Eva's hair braiding was such a great environment. I was more than please with my Senegalese twist. I defiantly would recommend going to Eva's. She also was really nice about squeezing me into the schedule last minute. (thumbs up)

20.description: I got my hair done at eve's last weekend and I must say, I LOVE IT!!! Eva did my braids and the process was the fastest and best results I have ever had. My hair has that wonderful look I have been craving. I requested a better quality of human hair and she provided it with no problem. Her shop is pleasant and other than the music selection (80/90's soft rock) it was a great time.

19.description: Eva and her crew did an exceptionally fantastic microbraiding job on my long and thick hair. The staff is professional and very nice. They also offer more than braids (twists, weaves, etc.) I highly recommend if you want a professional, nice, and clean experience to go to Eva's.

2.description: I had been going to Eva once sometimes two times a year for the summer time for a couple of years. At first I had a very good experience. They had reasonable prices, a clean work space, and different styles. They were usually late but their service made up for that and I just began to arrive later. Last year I began my journey to healthy hair after a lot of heat damage and  did twist out styles mainly. About a month ago i decided it was time for my big chop and wanted to do protective styles for a while so my hair could grow more. The day after I cut 70% of my hair off I go to Eva. When I got there, We would always discuss a little before on the length I wanted. Then some other lady, who is not as skilled as Eva, started on my hair. She didn't ask me what length I wanted (I also forgot to tell her so its a fault on both sides) so about 1/5 of the way through I remember and say that I want the braids bra length. She then had an attitude (rightfully so). My mother and I offered to help take them out so she could start again but she just kept doing the waist length and ignoring all of our requests.Finally she finished my hair and it looked awful. The ends were terrible, they had little knots on the end (which i've never seen them do before), they were still a little longer than i liked but I didn't want to complain anymore. Right when I was about to leave, Eva walks into the store and I tell her about the incident. She tells me that if they unravel I can come back and she'll redo them no cost. Of course the next day they unravel, and I have to go back two days later. When I go back they redo the front and back and did it very roughly. The hair still didn't look good when they redid it because they braided it halfway down and the other half was straight because they wanted to save time. I ended wearing it in a bun for about a month and a couple weeks. I am not going back! I would recommend Amen's.

18.description: I went to get cornrows braided into a Mohawk! She did an amazing job, and at a very great price!! I'm going to be a returning customer!! They are all very professional!! 5 stars for you all!!

13.description: I got my hair done back in January and even when I'd gotten it done, I knew there were a lot of things done wrong when the person was actually braiding my hair. The person who was supposed to do my hair arrived late, which I would have been fine with if my hair had been done well. I repeatedly said that I didn't want my hair braided too tightly because I had experienced  SIGNIFICANT hair loss in the past from braids that were done too tightly. I said this repeatedly and I had indicated that I wanted the hair to go just slightly past my shoulders. None of this was heeded and, as a previous reviewer mentioned, the braids aren't done evenly. They're made to be fat at the beginning and skinny towards the end. Maybe this is a style and the stylist didn't know what I meant when I said that I'd wanted box braids that were a little less then a pencil in diameter. I used to get my hair braided back in the 90s before some of the newer styles came in and I'm not familiar with all the things they do these days, so I really tried to give the hair dresser the benefit of the doubt.When I mentioned  the uneven size of the braids to the person doing my hair, the lady at first tried to deny it but then added more hair to the length as she went on. So by the end of the sitting I just wanted to be done and out. She trimmed off the stray hair (which wouldn't have been necessary if the hair length had been uniform) and she went about it very vigorously so I was terrified that she had cut some of my natural hair. At this point, I really was just tired and wanted to get out so I paid 200 even though I was quoted 180 and just got out of there. So now, here I am 3 months later (I've been busy with work so I couldn't take it out sooner) and low and I'm finding cut out bits of my curly hair mixed in with the braids. I'm kind of really upset but it's too late at this point to do anything. I just wanted to share this with you all so you could be aware of what can happen.

4.description: I went to Eva's two weeks ago to get micro braids.  I was there on time, but they got started a little late, about 40 minutes.  My braider was pretty fast.  It took about 8.5 hours.  They came out beautiful.  They are super easy and make life easier.   I would recommend Eva's.  I like how they are conveniently located.  Eva did not do my haor but she was there and very friendly.

24.description: I've had micros done before at numerous other shops and they were always just okay....until now. Eva's shop is very clean (HUGE PLUS) and comfy. My hair looks great and she's very friendly and an excellent braider. I have had my braids in for 3 days and have gotten tons of compliments. She even "created" a custom color blend for my braids. She's also very meticulous.....even after 13 and a half long hours of braiding my hair (did I mention that I have a LOT of hair.lol) she didnt do like a lot of other braiders at the end and try to make bigger braids or try to skip the finishing touches on my head. My hair looks excellent and I have definitely found a braider for as long as Im in chicago.Thanks again Eva. I'll be back in a few months . :)

6.description: I'm in the military so I've been all over to get braided. Eva's by far is the best. They put up with my shenanigans this morning I was running late I had to move my car charge my phone and iPad and even had to wash my hair. Very professional, very patient, and very sweet people. They did an amazing job and it was not normal for me to get up from my chair after six hours! And it was not so tight that I couldn't think! I DEF WILL BE GOING BACK!

15.description: I've gone back at least a few times and seen improvement. I wasn't charged extra for thick hair or long hair the last time I went, so that's a plus and my braids have lasted longer than they used to. However, I think I'm allergic to the hair that's supplied because my scalp was itchy for 2 weeks following. I may bring my own hair in the future but I do recommend Eva's to my friends.

7.description: So I went to Eva's again to get my twist done.  This was a pretty bad experience compared to the previous visits.  I had two women do my hair neither of which I have seen before.  One was okay, one was bad. She was too heavy-handed, kind of rude to me, and made slick remarks ( I studied french for 3 years so I picked up on bits of what she said.)  My twist also are not that well done.  Some of the twist are way to thin at the end which means she was too lazy to add hair as she braided down to ensure the twist were off an even size.  Overall not too happy this time.  I am not sure if I will go back.  If go back I will make sure to request Eva herself or Aisha the others so far have not been that great at braiding nor that friendly.To top it off I was over charged.  I got my twist twice the size as last time, I actually have 1/2 as many twist but paid the same price.. go figure.

8.description: My first time getting my hair braided in over 10 years and I called Eva to hook me up due to her great reviews. She did just that!!!! I loved the atmosphere from the moment I walked in she was warm and inviting. She wwas concerned with what I wanted and not what she wanted me to have. I love it!!!! She laid my hair out!!! My individual braids look wonderful and she was not super expensive. I was in at 930 and out at 230pm that was one of the reasons why I was a little hesistant about getting my hair braided because I really didnt want to sit there but it didnt even seem like that long. She and another young lady braided so fast it was crazy. I am so super impressed that I cant even wait to get my hair done again!!! I look super fab! Eva thank you so much I am definitely going to be passing your info around!!!!!!!!!!

3.description: Excellent! This is my second time trusting Eva with my daughter! Great job both times! First time she got Senegalese twist, which lasted almost 3 months. This time, box braids. I am pleased. I love great service, especially if my money is being spent!

14.description: I really really really liked Eva's.With a lot of hair braiding places, it's dirty, they're late, and unprofessional.  I didn't experience ANY of that at Eva's.  Her salon is easy to find, super clean, and set up very professionally.  Above all, she does an excellent job, my braids lasted over 3 months!  Her prices were pretty decent too.  It was average for microbraids (about $200).  You can find some places that are cheaper, but remember that you get what you pay for.  If I have to pay an extra $20 or $40 for a clean professional hair braiding experience, I think it's totally worth it.  You're sitting there for over 8 hours!  You should at least be comfortable.She really does deserve a 5 star review.  She is very sweet, and all that the other reviewers had to say is true.   I'm going to continue going to her as long as I have braids and live in the area.  I've finally found my "place" and that's Eva's.

0.description: I was so surprised to see that no one's reviewed Shinnick's! If you're looking for a place to head over to after a Sox game within walking distance, definitely check this place out (Screw Jimbo's. There, I said it). Club Shinnick's - as my friends and I fondly call it : ) - is a great local bar with a younger crowd that is packed before/after Sox games.  It's not the biggest place, but with cheap drinks, friendly people, and a lot of history, it's always a good time. They usually have bags set up outside, and if you get hungry you can always head over to Bev's across the street for a tamale or hot dog. Bev is a Bridgeport icon that sells THE BEST hot dogs right out of her own garage.And yes, I said her garage.

1.description: It was around Christmas and I needed to get my brows threaded after a year later. My brows have become very bushy..and this place was opened. There's only one lady who works there and she locked the front but opened when I was there. Service was quick.. although she threaded my brows very thin.. For the first week I was not happy because my brows were the thinnest it's ever been! Remind me of when I had a line in high school, so now I fill them in with Benefits EyeBrow to make them fuller. They look decent now though, but without the brow to make them fuller it looks very thin. I probably will come back because it's quick and they're normally not too busy when I drive by.. and theyre convenient for me to go. As long as I fill my eyebrows in, they look pretty nice. Only thing is they do cost more than what I'm used to. It's $10 and I tip $2. I used to go to the Threading Salon on Taylor , but Nikki left and the newbies there aren't as good. Plus I don't want to wait an hour to get serviced for 5 minutes so that's why I came here.

9.description: I came to this location a few months ago only because it was a close threading location for me. I had hoped that the older woman would be available because she seemed knowledgeable about threading. The other person that I got was very friendly (all staff are friendly) and  although I explained to her exactly what I wanted because she seemed a little nervous, my eyebrows came out uneven and she took out too much especially in the places I specifically told her not to. She also threaded some of my forehead which was weird. My eyebrows were uneven, too thin and she missed some clean up in some places. Nice place/staff but I wouldn't come here again.

23.description: Good and quick place to go to.

5.description: I go every month since they opened .the ladies do a great job every time .the older gal knows me skin and eyebrows and gets them right every time

25.description: Brows threading, despite having a lack luster appearance from the exterior, is a wonderful little salon.My eyebrows have looked good both times I have gotten them done here, and I have no complaints. I have never had to wait more than two minutes.$10 is a reasonable price, although I am always tempted to make the journey to Devon for a $5 threading.

12.description: I go in every month or so to have my lip threaded.  I went in as usual last night and requested my lip be threaded.  I have pretty light colored hair, so it's not a major ordeal, just a clean up.  The girl started with my lip and then worked on a part of my chin.  I was thinking - Yay!  Bonus!  I don't have much more than blond peach fuzz on my chin anyway.  I went to pay, and she charged me for the lip and chin ($5+$5).  I said, no I only asked for my lip.  She giggled and said she did my chin too.  I said I would only pay for my lip, and she insisted I owed $10.  I turned to the woman who I think owns the place, and she couldn't be bothered to get off the phone (to be fair, she was speaking a language that I don't understand, so I couldn't tell if it was a business call or a personal one - still she wouldn't stop to help).  So I paid the money and left.  The worst part of all - I had to go home and pluck the part of the lip AND chin that she had missed.  She was not thorough at all, so I was overcharged and got poor quality work!  Bottom line - I lost $5, but they lost a consistent customer.  I hope it was worth it!If the business would like to correct this, please do write back.  I would be happy to stop and pick up the $5 I was cheated out of and remain a customer.

21.description: Someone finally got it right! It was my first time there and the girl who did my brows was great!  I'd always complain about the shape of my brows, and she did a nice job reshaping them.  Will definitely be going back!

16.description: They cut my eyebrow on Sat Feb 14, then denied it they said they didn't do that I  was uphalled no stars

17.description: Threading and eyebrow tinting. Best services. I refuse to let anyone but the women at this shop touch my brows. It's worth the travel. :)

10.description: Nice ppl, left my eye brows un even. I posted up a pic, please see. I will never return here. All i needed was a clean up. They have pics of eye brows in the place that make it seem like they got it down. Nope. Go somewhere where they know about threading. I think this lady just learned how to thread. Nice ppl but don't risk messing your brows up. They also removed my picture from yelp so u can see how un even they are.- The picture I originally posted was taken down by yelp which is bogus. The owner apologized and said I could receive a full refund. I do not recommend anyone to go here.

11.description: Starlight, starbright, how did you get my eyebrows so right? Yes, that's how I felt when I left this place. Soo I did a quick search for some brows because my other place disappeared.. Hmph!  I also wanted something that was easy to get to from a driving/park standpoint. So I happened across Brows Threading that had a whopping 6 reviews, but pretty good reviews. Normally, I wouldn't DARE trust my face to something with 6 reviews, but I decided to take a chance.I called ahead to see if there was a wait and it wasn't. I was in enroute. I was glad that someone told me to NOT judge a book by it's cover, because yea.. the area and it's storefront didn't lend itself to something I wanted to give a try. However, I walked in to a quaint little no frills shop with two threaders. Jamie/Jessie (I am drawing a blank on the name) was an older woman took me right away. We talked about what I wanted and she got to work. A few minutes later I was set and in heaven. I think I found my new spot. It was $10 in and out around 12 or so on Saturday. Now with that, there were a ton of people who came in after me, so I can see the wait getting long. Advice: Call ahead and make sure. Also, there is some free parking on the side streets, so take a look for that.

26.description: I would like to be the first to review Brows Threading in Bridgeport. I usually go far north  to my threading salon which I still love. However, It is a hassle for me to get there and search for 30 minutes or more for parking depending on the day. I passed by this salon a few times and decided I would finally go in. I visited Brows Threading on this past holiday and got my eyebrows Threaded. The lady there was very nice and she asked me how I wanted my eyebrows, which I told her I like them clean but to stay pretty thick. She took care of me right away since there was no one else there at the time. I was very comfortable, the salon is beautiful and clean with a nice atmosphere to go along with it. It is right next door to an ice cream parlor and the neighborhood is very safe and extremely easy to find parking. I recommend visiting this salon and the cost was very reasonable as well. I paid $10 for my brows which is average since I pay 7 dollars for waxing elsewhere. I prefer brow threading over waxing because my eyebrows look beautiful and it definitely last longer. One day I will try getting a henna tattoo. They look beautiful and a lot of fun. Go by Brow Threading in Bridgeport and it will become your only brow threading salon.... : )Kimberly D. Chicago, IL

22.description: The outside may not look like much, but the inside is clean and beautiful. I went last week for the first time and they took me right away. The woman who did mine was very professional and quick. She was very considerate and if your eyes were watering a lot she would stop so you could use a tissue. It's 10$ for eyebrows. I'll definitely be making this my biweekly spot!

0.description: I love that I can walk in anytime and have never had to wait more than 10 minutes for service. I have learned to only go after noon because the older woman who works then gets it right every time. On a couple of occasions when I didn't have her, my brows turned out uneven, but luckily they grow back fast. Definitely recommend.

20.description: Starlight, starbright, how did you get my eyebrows so right? Yes, that's how I felt when I left this place. Soo I did a quick search for some brows because my other place disappeared.. Hmph!  I also wanted something that was easy to get to from a driving/park standpoint. So I happened across Brows Threading that had a whopping 6 reviews, but pretty good reviews. Normally, I wouldn't DARE trust my face to something with 6 reviews, but I decided to take a chance.I called ahead to see if there was a wait and it wasn't. I was in enroute. I was glad that someone told me to NOT judge a book by it's cover, because yea.. the area and it's storefront didn't lend itself to something I wanted to give a try. However, I walked in to a quaint little no frills shop with two threaders. Jamie/Jessie (I am drawing a blank on the name) was an older woman took me right away. We talked about what I wanted and she got to work. A few minutes later I was set and in heaven. I think I found my new spot. It was $10 in and out around 12 or so on Saturday. Now with that, there were a ton of people who came in after me, so I can see the wait getting long. Advice: Call ahead and make sure. Also, there is some free parking on the side streets, so take a look for that.

19.description: Brows threading, despite having a lack luster appearance from the exterior, is a wonderful little salon.My eyebrows have looked good both times I have gotten them done here, and I have no complaints. I have never had to wait more than two minutes.$10 is a reasonable price, although I am always tempted to make the journey to Devon for a $5 threading.

2.description: I walked in this place today.And walked out so happy with my service. This was just my second time at this place but because I really likes how my eye brows turned out I said the next time I'm going to let them put on my eye lashes. Wow I'm so happy that I did she took her time. And when you not rushing that is a good thing for me.I have to say that this was the best service. I have been to other places and by the time I got home I was taking them off.Well not this time.I feel like a princess.Thank you so much for  the great service on today.I will be back again.This place has plenty of street parking, no appointment is needed. Very nice and clean place.Keep up the good work.

18.description: Sign says it opens on 10am. It's 1015 and still not open . So much for trying this place out.

13.description: I love this place. This is the only place I'll go to get my eyebrows threaded and to get my waxes. The staff is very friendly. I love it here.

4.description: I am very picky with my eyebrows, but I trust these ladies 100% with my eyebrow grooming. They always take their time sculpting your eyebrows to perfection when they thread. I am very happy to have found a place on the SSide that does knows brows! No worries ladies, you will not walk out of here with angry or "sharpie" thin eyebrows ;-).

24.description: The woman who did my eyebrows was quick and friendly (she assured me that my tears and sneezes as a first-timer were normal), and the salon was clean and well-decorated. I got in as soon as I walked in (Thursday afternoon), and the brow powder is affordable and high quality. This will be my regular spot!

6.description: I was going to be in the neighborhood to run an errand and really didn't want to have to head to another part of town to visit my go-to threading place. I normally wouldn't try some place new for such an important thing like my eyebrows but there I saw a 5 star rating from a fellow Yelp Elite and that was good enough for me. PLUS it was literally 2 blocks from the place I was going to. How convenient?I had an okay experience... nothing special though. For $10 I have no complaints. They were quick and my eyebrows were neat when I left. If I'm in a pinch and in the area like I was on Saturday, I might stop in again. Maybe.

15.description: This is the only place I go get my eyebrows done at. I always walk in looking like crap and leave with perfectly arched eyebrows. I love that I never feel like she has taken too much off, always perfect!!

7.description: Love love love my eyebrows after being threaded here. They haven't looked so great in a long time . I live very close so decided to check it out one day , and very happy with my service . They open early and offer different services from henna to eyebrows and eyebrow tinting . The lady  who did mine was very fast and friendly . Def coming back !

8.description: Quick service! I was in and out of there within 10 mins. The older Indian lady threaded my brows and did a pretty good job. There were a few thin hairs that she didn't catch but it wasn't too noticeable. Very friendly staff as well :)

3.description: If you want uneven eyebrows this is the place to go. Ugh! Glasses all week! The cost was $10 and the service was okay. I definitely will not return. Someone please guide me to the right direction!

14.description: Came here hoping to find a threading location closer to where I live. It was nice to walk in and not have to wait to get in a chair, I think I was in and out in 10 minutes. However, the threading job was less than par. The experience was pretty rough and after getting home and taking a closer look at the job that was done the lady who provided my services didn't get any clean lines/arch and my brows were uneven (I could feel that was how it was going to be just from how she was pulling the thread). I'll have to touch up myself and let them regrow back out to get my arch back in my right eyebrow. It wasn't awful but I don't plan on returning.

3.description: You know your business is old when it has the first phone number! Seriously: 268-0001. Well, I don't know if that's the reason they got such as awesome number, but seriously, they've been here for a while.The place looks pretty much like you'd expect an ancient hardware store to: wood paneled, a little stale, walls covered from floor to ceiling with stuff, and filled with people that know their hammers. Their location is in the middle of an old residential neighborhood, and so their main business seems to be in paint, window repairs - stuff like that. Despite the small size, they have almost anything you could expect a hardware store to. My favorite part, though? It breaks a law of the universe: they sell stuff cheaper than Home Depot and it's mostly American-made. How's that possible? Haven't figured that out yet. I try to buy American-made stuff when I can, though. Our economy can use all the boosting it can get.

1.description: Stopped in here yesterday to get an extra key made. The guys were really friendly and I had a copy made right away. They seem to have a lot of basic home hardware supplies and a large paint section.They do have a $10 limit on card purchases, but I expect that from small businesses.

2.description: This place promotes itself as the "Pro-shop" - owner is a golfer.  They know there stuff having dispensed how-to advice for like 50+ years.  Pricing is good and even better when you consider the price-less one-on-one advice.

5.description: The service was perfect. It is great to have helpful, knowledgeable people so close to home.

6.description: This place is awesome. The guys at another hardware store that shall remain nameless recommended we come here to get latex floor paint, and I'm super glad we did. They spent a bunch of time with us picking the  best paint for what we needed  - and remembered us later when we came in to get another quart. Really great experience. Also picked up some other stuff while we were there, just because it's really hard not to. Everything was really reasonably priced, too. Can't say enough good about this place. Also a really fun location/old building.

0.description: I really enjoy shopping at this hardware store. Bill is always really helpful. Whether it is recommending the right tools for the job, eyeballing a paint match from a sample, or providing qualified local referrals for the more complicated stuff this is the place to go!

4.description: The service here is the best ever.The guys are unbelievably helpful, even with the curve balls I would bring in while I was a gallery director.This area is exceptionally lucky to have a hardware store so close, I always run here for smaller jobs and forgotten parts or pieces.

3.description: This GameStop is great because it is very convenient and unique. They have all the games you can think of, new and old. You will notice it very easy because it is not in a big plaza. This is a great GameStop!

1.description: The location isn't the best, but the employee I had was nice and friendly. Beside, this one is the closest one to my house and they have all the same stuff as any other Gamestop despite it being smaller. The parking lot is mostly packed and it can be a hassle depending on when you go. I like the one on Canal and Roosevelt more as well, but this location is convenient.

2.description: This is absolutely one of the worst, most inconsiderate Gamestops I have been to. To describe my first and LAST experience with them, I called the store 3 TIMES ahead of time to reserve a Nintendo 3DS XL. I informed them that I was en route to the store, and they assured me that the system would be there upon my arrival. Once I got there, they had the sheer audacity to tell me that the 3DS that I specifically taken all of the measures to place on hold had been sold mere moments before I arrived. The manager even had the nerve to have a nonchalant attitude about the situation, telling me "you snooze, you lose." I was shocked and appalled at this behavior and attitude about the situation, and have proceeded to make sure that corporate heard about this. If you would like someone to be more considerate in terms of how important your patronage is, please make haste to another Gamestop.

5.description: This Gamestop is decent despite being cramped and very easy to miss. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly, the selection is pretty good and its a hop skip and a jump from my house. I like the one on Canal and Roosevelt but this one is closer and just as good. Definitely stop by!

0.description: Been to this location a few times. I'm not much of a gamer these days, so I turned to the staff for recommendations. Anthony (I think that was his name) set me up with a game that I am really enjoying.

4.description: This Gamestop is so small, you might miss it if you weren't looking for it - of course if you weren't looking for it in the first place it really hasn't been missed...That aside, this location's only downside is its smallness.  The staff have always been helpful and friendly to me, even when I've been in my lookie-loo phases of checking out every used game trying to find something entertaining but also under $10 - which can happen, but it's rare now that I've gobbled up all the crappy sports games from 6 years ago that were selling for $2.99.  I'm not a sports person, so I don't care who was on which team - I just want to hit people with baseballs, foul basketball players and tackle some people.  Or start a hockey fight.And they are helpful, too.  They'll assist in choosing the right kind of game if you know what you're looking for.  They'll chat with you about the MMORPG you're playing because you're a big nerd and Gamestop recognizes that and appropriately hires other big nerds to satisfy customers and their needs.  You just need to make sure you've got the right flavor of big nerd - identify which are the RPG (role-playing game) players and which get off playing an FPS (first-person shooter) and you'll be more-easily helped.Anyway, my point was that before the "new generation" of consoles, there was enough room for the current generation of consoles and room left over for old-timey awesome stuff to be put out.  My favorite memory of Gamestop was the day that there was a bin full of used NES merchandise with ridiculous clearance prices.  Add the buy-two-get-one-free sale and 10% off used games with a Gamestop membership card, and I walked out of there with a NES system, TWO Duck Hunt guns (even though the system only lets you use one at a time) and SEVEN copies of Super Mario / Duck Hunt.  In case 6 of them broke or had an impenetrable layer of dust that couldn't be blown out by standard NES gaming practices.(Yes, I wandered around my home with two Duck Hunt guns in holsters ready to quick-draw any offending ducks or roommates - because I was simply that awesome.)Nowadays, the new consoles have taken over.  The PS3 cleared out all my PS2 viewing section down to where the PS section used to be.  And now there's no Playstation-classic games to rummage through.Maybe it's just that my era of gaming is over and I have to accept that gaming stores had to clear my era out to entice the new "whippersnapper" demographic in so they can turn a profit.They just need to enforce the posted time limit on the test systems so the whippersnappers can give "Old Man NES" a try at his 15 minutes of Guitar Hero fame...

3.description: I ordered for delivery a sweet and sour chicken dish with crab rangoons and after a good 60+ minutes of waiting I asked for an update to which the restaurant replied that they sent their driver already. Overjoyed I continued waiting until 40 more minutes passed and I was unable to continue waiting and receive the food as I had to leave for work. 1 hour and 30 minutes should be more than enough time to order and receive food but alas I was unable to try the food. Such high hopes shattered by poor delivery. Fml

1.description: This is my usual place to eat when I don't feel like cooking at home. It's close by and convenient. I like the food, it's delicious and staff friendly.

2.description: I gave them 3 stars because I'm too nice......& because they were fast and friendly. Like other reviewers noted, the interior is cute. This was the first time I've seen granite tabletops in a Chinese restaurant....but I digress.Anywho, I'm a tad bit upset because I drive past this place everyday and finally decided to give them a shot after a Hennessy filled night. I ordered the Mongolian beef lunch special and for $6.11, you get a pretty hefty portion with a coke.The cons? The chicken fried rice AND the egg roll it came with were bland. It ain't worth the calories. However, the Mongolian beef was DELICIOUS....as all heck; the beef is what saved my meal.
