If you're adventurous like me and decide to brave this place despite my review, ask them to put your beef ON TOP of the rice. And then thank me later.

9.description: Quick & friendly service. I wanted to try out this new restaurant for take out, as it's only been open a few weeks. It does have a few tables if you'd like to eat there as well, very clean & brand new. I ordered the Mongolian Beef lunch special, it comes chicken fried rice and small egg roll. Delicious! They did not skip on the beef or chicken or the portions. I also ordered a strawberry smoothie, yum.

10.description: However, to set the record straight.  I order pickup from here about once a month.  The food is always ready for pickup on time.  The food is always hot, the ingredients fresh and not over cooked and the serving size ample.  A bonus is they include a can of pop with their lunch and dinner specials.  The restaurant itself is clean, bright and friendly.  Compared to the other Chinese take-out places here, right on the cusp of Chinatown, Archer Cafe can hold it's head high, and you should definitely give them a try.So, I see Gina J is just a Yelp* troll.   You'll notice that she only gives one star reviews, so, she should be ignored, especially on this one.

4.description: Well my usual place was closed, so I thought I'd give this place a try. The "Meh. I've experienced better" description on the rating sums it up pretty well.Pros: Food was hot and fresh on delivery, portions are a good size. Vegetables are fresh.BUT, as someone else just reviewed, everything was so BLAND. Crab Rangoon was overcooked and tough like leather. Egg foo young gravy was watery. Generel Tso's chicken was flavorless.The fried rice was wet and oily (I'll play devil's advocate and hope it was just from the heat condensation in the box). I guess on the plus side is you know they aren't using MSG. Most likely will not go for round 2.

6.description: We always order delivery and it gets here vary fast. Portions are big and the food is good.

11.description: HORRIBLE! Food was taste-less and cold.

5.description: Came here just on a whim while looking for Chinese good near where I was.  Good was pretty good. I liked How everything was NOT greasy unlike many other local Chinese restaurants.  Also our meal came with a pop and crab Rangoon which was a nice touch.   I'd try them again next time I'm in the neighborhood.

7.description: Great local spot in Bridgeport for Chinese.         5stars because for what it is(small pickup/delivery place with a few tables), it is exceptional.  Delicious food, always cooked to order.  Veggies have a snap to them, never mushy.  Cheap.  Large portions.  Ready in 10 mins!       Extremely friendly staff, always make you feel welcome when you walk in.  Very clean, inviting atmosphere.  They remember their repeat customers too.          I recommend the General Tso Chicken.  I usually get the small order for $6.  Anything but small.  Comes with fresh steamed rice, but try getting a small side of chow fun noodles to go along with it.  Delicious peppers and pineapple chunks with the chicken, all covered in a mouth watering tangy/sweet/spicy sauce-glaze.  Drool.          You can also get the combo, which is entree, chicken-fried rice, can of pop, and eggroll.  (Awesome for hangover).  $7-8ish.        Been coming here awhile and thought I'd show some love for this fine establishment.         *Give it a shot!*

8.description: was feeling lazy to go to Chinatown to grab food so i decide to just go somewhere close for Chinese and archer cafe it was... it a small place with a few tables and chairs.. the place is clean and the people that works there is really nice..i ordered the Mongolian beef special which comes with fried rice and egg roll.. i have to say.. i was disappointed .. there's was very little beef and a lot of onions and was drenched in grease... the fried rice was pretty bland also... i have gave this place 2 tries and it was the same outcome...

0.description: The lady at the counter which I assume was the boss was extremely nice. Pro: extremely good service -The lady offered water even when we have soda -she told us to be careful of hitting our elbow on the chair ^.^ so motherly -a t.v to look while waiting for food -big portions!!!Cons: slow service but I heard they are trying to find another cook so it will improve I honestly think this is better than going to Chinatown for food. I saw that some yelp reviews said the food was too greasy here but that's every Asian restaurant! I think there aren't as much grease as Chinatown and a lot of varieties in one plate for only 6bucks! I got crab Rangoon, egg roll AND soda with my order of one dish. Cannot get a better offer anywhere else guys.

29.description: I cannot rank this deli high enough! I've been sick the last few days and had finally managed to get an appetite back and the only thing I wanted in my life was a turkey sandwich. Unfortunately, the cabinet was bare (as was my checking account) and I didn't have the willpower to get to the grocery store. So I jumped on GrubHub just on the chance I could find something to be delivered in my budget...and low and behold, Kathy De's was there to welcome me!With no minimum order charge and only $3.00 delivery, it was exactly what I needed. Honestly, I would have been perfectly happy with a soggy, month-old-toppings sandwich at this price. But the quality of the food I got could rival even the higher-end deli's I've eaten at! It was delicious and exactly what I needed! I got an 8" sub, intending to save half for later....but it was so good that I just had no restraint and gobbled the whole thing right up!Not to mention that the service was so great. The driver was incredibly friendly and chirped a happy "Heeeyyy, Angela! Lunch is served!" into my cellphone when he called to let me know food was delivered. I'm so, so sad I'm moving from this area soon and only just found this place. Ah well. I know who I will turn to on my moving day when all I need is a good turkey sandwich to drive the stress away.Thank you so much, Kathy De!!

42.description: I Love that they are open at 6:00A.  Fresh Homemade Soup every morning.  Kathy De's is a hidden tressure.  It's a must try. Big variety. Friendly Family owned business.

23.description: Just as everyone has said before, the cajun chicken sandwich is prob the best sandwich I've ever eaten.  I've been coming to Kathy De's for a while now but finally decided to write a review because of the amazing service I recently received, but their service is always great.I walked in after a long day of moving and it was very obvious that I was exhausted.  The owner (at least I think it was the owner) noticed and grabbed my order quickly from the back.  "Fresh out the kitchen" he exclaimed.  As he rung my order up, he tossed in a side pasta salad "on the house."  And let me tell you, that pasta salad was one of the best I've had.  His friendliness was the highlight of a long day.

8.description: Awesome deli hidden in the city!

31.description: Best Italian subs in the neighborhood, the other sandwiches are great too. Great soups and pastas, waiting for the hot dog cart to come out. They have got the best polish, with hot peppers anywhere.

34.description: Excellent little deli in Bridgeport. I randomly found it on Grubhub and decided to pick-up an Italian sub on a french roll.  I got a foot-long sub for $6 plus tax.  The sandwich was very well made but could use a bit more deli-meat (like at Bari) but for the price, the ingredients are excellent quality.  Don't expect to dine-in and no credit cards but you can order on Grubhub and pay by credit card for pick-up.  The staff are very, very friendly as well.  I want to try the Cajun Chicken next after reading some of the reviews.

16.description: Wonderful people. Everyone who works here deserves ten stars, as well as the food. I got the Cajun chicken sandwich and it was delicious! I just started working close by, and I know I'll be back in as often as I can. And even if you don't live in the area, I'd recommend going just for the amazing food and the outstanding service! Oh yeah, and no only are their prices extremely reasonable - the portions are huge.

13.description: Just moved to the neighborhood in April. My sister came in town from VA and we were exploring the hood, I've always seen this place and we figured to give it a shot. They were so friendly and accommodating. I got the turkey burger and fries, my sis got the Italian sub and my daughter got a cheeseburger. Out of this world fresh. This will become a staple for our family!

11.description: OMGawd. I think I just died and went to heaven.. Background: My office just moved in area and I was really depressed that we didnt have much food selection like we did in loop and now NO more... this place left business flyers and I was meaning to visit but with the weird winter we have had, I hadnt.Today I went and I immediately regretted that I didnt go sooner..  Soup, sub, chips and peach tea all for 11 and it was large portions..

39.description: I'm a local and I appreciate having a place to walk to in the neighborhood. Great sandwiches made to order. Soup is always hot and homemade. Haven't tried the hot food, but I'm sure it's good. Just a neighborhood stop worthwhlie if you're in the area and looking for a quick, good lunch.Some seating outdoors on sidewalk, weather permitting.

37.description: Kathy's is definitely a good deli. Love the sandwiches here. Love that you can get any bread that you want with your sandwich. My coworkers love the soup and swear by it. Go to Kathy's. It's fresh, it's great and you won't regret it.

0.description: Yummy in my tummy! Hey it's a Chicago's Best Place. I always call my order in, hey if you want Kathy De's get there early because they close at 3pm daily and cut there grill off early too. I get the regular, Cajun chicken sandwich with fries. Oh my my my, this sandwich is so refreshing. The fresh cucumbers, tomatoes and Cajun sauce will have you coming back for more and more! Get there and get there early!

38.description: after watching Chicago best and seeing the Cajun char chicken... i just have to try it for myself because it looked very good on the show haha... i was going to try this place out months ago but due to them closing at 4pm weekdays and closed on weekend, i just couldn't make it due to my work schedule. but i finally managed to come here on one of my days off! friendly service so that's a plus. got my Cajun char chicken and i hurried home because i was hungry and i really wanted to see how good it was haha... took a bite out of it and boyyyyyyy it was good! it was full of flavor and was juicy! the fries was awesome too! the meal was delicious and its a must try if u haven't yet. i will definitely come back on my next day off! hahaha

27.description: Just another fast food storefront  in the sewer known as Bridgeport. Surly service from the old lady (I believe "Cathy d" herself). Ordered a sandwich from one of the girls, old lady made it, and made it wrong. When I called her on it, she blamed me, the customer. Food is hit or miss. Never going back, to many better places to eat without the abuse, although you'll have to go outside Bridgeport to avoid the attitude.

32.description: Was great but now they've changed their bread so not as good.  Also they are stingy with. Condiments, especially lettuce on sandwiches.

44.description: What makes a good Sub Sandwich? - Great Meat Quality- Fresh Bread- Fresh VegetablesKathy De's has it all... Excellent quality. Excellent sub!I had a 12 inch (which was much bigger than a foot) Italian sub with their Homemade Hot Giardiniera (could be hotter for my taste) . All for $5! Subway can't beat this deal. I still can't understand why people would even choose a stale "$5 foot long" when they have Kathy De's in the Bridgeport Area. Great job guys.

24.description: Seen them on Chicago's best with Ted Brunson. Had to check it out. Food is great and looks even better in person that it did on the show. Tried Mario's Cajun chicken and it was excellent. Staff was very friendly. Even got to meet kathy. Normally when you pay less for food you'd expect to get what u pay for. But they use all top quality meat. No clue how they are able go sell it at 5.95. Will definitely be back

7.description: Went for lunch, this place is very busy.  There was an organized chaos behind the counter, which is a sign of good food in my eyes.Had the Cajun chicken special, came with fries.  The sandwich was great, chicken was tender, and the portion was big enough for two meals.  Only down side I would say is the seasoning.  Didn't taste very Cajun to me, and that is why I chose it.  Just didn't have any heat.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back for something else.

40.description: Kathy has great food at even better prices.   We send all of our out of town guests there and they love it.     The soups, sandwiches, and daily specials are fantastic.    Bob

30.description: Halfway through an Italian sub and I had to check my pulse to make sure I haven't gone to heaven. Excellent sandwiches for a great price, I'll be back again and again!

1.description: When its your lunch time then this is the place to go or call for a delivery. In the summer months you can relax outside.I love the friendly staff and the at home feeling you get when you walk in the door you can always find a spot to park in the front. The soups are so good you will be saying I should have order 2 bowls. The sandwiches are made right in front or you.And you have to try the salads. If you need party trays this is the place.The Price's are wonderful and you can even pick up a few other items at the store as well.This is a family owned place with a happy to have you feeling.Thank you for having great service and good food.As for me l just love the corn beef, soups and you just have to try the Cajun chicken salad. Its sooo gooooodHave a great day Happy yelping

9.description: Fast Delivery, only about 20 mins for my food to get to the South Loop. Salad was fresh and crisp. Sub was great and so flavorful, you can tell the meats were sliced there. Definitely will be back here!

26.description: Great deli!  Their cajun chicken sandwich is unlike any other chicken sandwich you will ever have. Portions are great and everything is homemade and fresh. A huge plus is the people. Everyone there is friendly and treats you like family.

25.description: Awesome little place.You get a ton of food for a low price, the staff is super accommodating and friendly, and the food is fresh and hot when you get it. Never had a bad meal here! It's a super casual little place, like eating your sandwich in a grocery store or deli. There are no indoor tables but the outdoor seating makes for a nice place to eat with kids. Side note- I ate here alone with my preschool aged son last week and we sat outside. A random older drunk man who was leaving was asking for my sons left overs and Mario came out right away to be sure we weren't being bothered and everything was ok. I really appreciated that! We were fine, pretty sure the drunk guy was just looking for a free meal (it was a little annoying but I didn't feel my safety threatened at all), but it was nice to see a staff member who cares for the customers!! I was impressed.

12.description: I ordered the double cheeseburger with fries. And the burger was a good size patti, good flavor, fresh lettuce and tomatoes with a butter bun.

21.description: Went for lunch, this place is very busy.  There was an organized chaos behind the counter, which is a sign of good food in my eyes.Had the Cajun chicken special, came with fries.  The sandwich was great, chicken was tender, and the portion was big enough for two meals.  Only down side I would say is the seasoning.  Didn't taste very Cajun to me, and that is why I chose it.  Just didn't have any heat.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back for something else.

17.description: Been going for almost 2 years and let me tell you its awesome! everything I get is fresh, they have never messed up any of my orders and I go here 1-2 times a week and now they finally got a credit card machine which makes everything so much easier..

10.description: Glad I found this gem! The owner and her family are very friendly and attentive.  Delicious and fast service.   My new favorite spot

5.description: Great place to grab a sandwich for lunch! I got the Italian sandwich and was very impressed. I also bought their homemade hot gardenia peppers which are SO GOOD. Very friendly staff. I didn't see a place to sit down and eat but this was a perfect place to pick up lunch on my break!

35.description: Best Cajun Chicken Sandwich around!!  But that's not all - they have several great soups-of-the-day and many additional entrees.  Cheeseburgers are pretty awesome and their fries are top-notch.  Try a sub or a salad - the Cajun chicken salad rocks.  The owners and staff are super friendly and you can even pick up a couple lottery tickets while you're there.  Late day/early eve they pull out the hotdog cart and do up the dogs properly with celery salt, etc.  Don't ask for ketchup on your hotdog in Bridgeport, BTW.

19.description: Cajan chicken sandwich! Very taste and affordable.

28.description: Just ate the Italian chicken salad!!! It was excellent. Great portions of chicken and everything was so fresh. Make sure to get the red wine vinaigrette dressing!! I'm for sure coming back for this salad and it's very reasonably priced!!

3.description: Got the Italian delivered and the ingredients were fresh and delicious.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the wings and onion rings as well.  Look forward to exploring the rest of the menu and ordering again.

33.description: I saw this place a while back on Chicago's Best ( I miss Ted Brunson by the way) and have wanted to try the grilled cajun chicken sammy.  So we headed to this place from beautiful downtown Frankfort.  We got off at Pershing and headed west.  Parnell does not go through so we had to drive around a bit to find the joint.  Took a left on Parnell and low and behold.  Kathy De's Deli was in my sights.  There was parking on the street but no lot.  Its a small place where you can purchase some groceries as well.  Plenty of tables outside to eat at.  Prices are incredibly cheap.  We ordered cajun grilled chicken sandwich, an Italian sub and a ham sub.  All were good but the cajun chicken sandwich stood above the rest.  The Italian sub was solid and super fresh.  My kids liked the ham sub.  They  were busy with catering orders and lunch orders, but our  food came out fast.  This place is a must stop if your in the area or heading to a Chicago White Sox day game.  They are only open during the day.  Cash only.

43.description: I can't believe that noone has reviewed this place. A great little deli.  It's tucked away in Bridgeport at 3642? Parnell.  I'm a fairly new customer I just went in here for the first time two weeks ago.  I had gone to Freddies on 31st  & Union a couple of weeks ago for an Italian breaded steak sandwich.  A friend told me to give Kathy De's steak sandwich a try.  I did and I loved it.  I actually liked it better than Freddies and I like Freddies sandwich. Kathy De's steak special is a 6" sandwich and fresh cut fries for $ 5.49. It was outstanding.  I've also had the soup there and it's very good.  I now have another favorite spot in Bridgeport.

2.description: Delicious is an understatement! The cajun chicken sandwich is my fav but I've tried a few different options and am always pleased!! You just can't leave without a brownie, they're the best in the city!

18.description: Just as everyone has said before, the cajun chicken sandwich is prob the best sandwich I've ever eaten.  I've been coming to Kathy De's for a while now but finally decided to write a review because of the amazing service I recently received, but their service is always great.I walked in after a long day of moving and it was very obvious that I was exhausted.  The owner (at least I think it was the owner) noticed and grabbed my order quickly from the back.  "Fresh out the kitchen" he exclaimed.  As he rung my order up, he tossed in a side pasta salad "on the house."  And let me tell you, that pasta salad was one of the best I've had.  His friendliness was the highlight of a long day.

41.description: This is a grocery store deli that has great hot sandwiches. Open for breakfast/lunch the food is always fresh and the prices are reasonable. Since it is family owned you get the extra TLC with your order. Very clean and the food is good. Highly reccomended!

4.description: Burgers are so good! Walked in on a whim because we were looking for something halfway between the museum of science and industry and downtown. Ben was so hospitable! We didn't know they didn't have seating and he asked us if we were eating in our car and we said we were going to walk to the nearest park. He told us there was no reason to go out in the cold and brought out two tables and chairs from storage so we could eat in the warm store. Unbelievable! He also told us he plans on adding seating soon. As for the food, it was just as amazing. I had a cheeseburger and fries with a Coke for a reasonable price but the quality of the food vastly surpassed the price. After learning that this was our first time, Ben told us we HAD to try their famous chicken sandwiches. So he went to the back and made us two, then cut them into five pieces for us to try. Soooo good. This was an unforgettable experience. For great hospitality and great food. Go here.

6.description: I was really disappointed that it took me so long to try this place.  Tried this deli for the first time.  It was better than I would've guessed.   Only drawback, that it closes early.  Ordered the Combo and the Cajun chicken.  Delicious.  Will definitely be going here more often.

22.description: 4 stars because of the hours and only taking cash. I feel they close too early, so we can only enjoy it on the weekends for lunch. This is one of my favorite neighborhood restaurant. The prices are fair, food is great, and service is top notch.

15.description: I happened to be in Bridgeport for work and I looked around on yelp to see if there is any good place to eat and I came across this one,I saw everyone talking about their cajun chicken so I ordered it. It turned out to be the best cajun chicken I have had in years. The staff were friendly and nice. I would go back again very soon.

20.description: OMGawd. I think I just died and went to heaven.. Background: My office just moved in area and I was really depressed that we didnt have much food selection like we did in loop and now NO more... this place left business flyers and I was meaning to visit but with the weird winter we have had, I hadnt.Today I went and I immediately regretted that I didnt go sooner..  Soup, sub, chips and peach tea all for 11 and it was large portions..

36.description: I have since returned because if this immense CRAVING I had for the breaded steak. Red sauce, Giardiniera and BAM! All in my belly!Aaaand I got the Cajun Char Chicken and it is pretty splendiferous. The cucumber makes it. And I'm not a cucumber fan, but the way it all comes together with the mayo sauce is ridic. Aaaaand I'd like to take a bath in that Giardiniera.Fries are also quite good. I just give them to my 2 year old because I'm a terrible parent, but whatever, he was hungry and I had fries I wasn't eating. It's worth a trip out if your way, but just remember, you're eating in your car or taking it home. No chairs, no credit cards. Great people!

14.description: Great food, cheese burger was amazing and Italian beef super yummy. I ordered delivery through Grub Hub and unfortunately the delivery guy was a real jerk, yelling in the lobby of the building I work in about how far he had to drive, etc. I called the restaurant and spoke with Marisa,  she was great- so nice and apologetic, and offered me a free sandwich next week.  So great food awesome service.

0.description: I hired Soto's Kitchen HVAC and Plumbing to install a new furnace.  The attention to detail, professionalism and value for what I was charged were extremely poor.  I was treated very rudely by their project manager, Dan, who never once showed up to check on the work as it was being done.  I would avoid using this company.

3.description: By far, THE best menudo. This place has been around for years and is essential to the community. The family are wonderful people. Excellent place for carnitas too. Too bad they have to deal with the gang bangers that have nothing better to do.

1.description: Martinez is the best corner store in Bridgeport! Great selection of produce and grocery essentials. They also have a butcher shop in the back that churns out Mexican specialties like carnitas, chorizo, tacos, tamales, and deli items. Only complaints are that I've had issues with my AmEx credit card in this store (though they claim to accept AmEx), and they don't seem to carry low-fat milk options. But for the convenience of a family owned, well-run convenience store, I'm happy to buy 2% milk with a debit card. Keep it up, Martinez family!

2.description: This little corner market's tacos are delicious and better than the ones at La Mexicana around the corner on 35th. They're slightly more expensive, at least if you get them with everything on them (which is the only reason I'm giving them four stars instead of five), but they sure are tasty.

5.description: I'm giving this market 4 stars based purely on the tacos they make on the grill in back.  There are soooooo many taco stands in my neighborhood and none of them can even compare to Martinez.  When you order food from the grill the cooks take the ingredients right from the grocery stock.  I love the fact that I get to see what the steak looks like before they cook it because I know that it's fresh and of good quality every time.  The carne asada is always perfectly seasoned and comes with the perfect amount of onions and cilantro and for only $1.95.  They give you two sauces with each order; The green is to die for!We've also ordered the super nachos with steak several times.  The portion is HUGE and it's only around $6.  It could easily feed two or three people.  As for the grocery store itself,  the staff is super friendly, the produce is always fresh and the prices are decent for a corner bodega.Sure you might see a gang banger or two hanging out on the corner, brick in hand, but who really cares with tacos this yummy?!?!

6.description: Best tacos in Bridgeport. Mama Martinez will also make  trays of tamales and chile rellenos when you pre-order, although they often have these items individually as well.  She  kindly offered to make me chile rellenos with rice flour since I have celiac; such a sweetheart! I absolutely love their red salsa and guacamole. Great selection of Mexican spices and vegetables. They have individual serving packs of Chia, which are perfect for Chia fresca. They also stock a large selection of herbal teas and health remedies.

0.description: Chorizo Here "is the best Chorizo I have ever had in my life".. made very fresh with "NO" vinegar/preservatives like the store brands.Chorizo has a meaty flavor.. I get mild because honestly the hot is too hot.CARNITAS ARE THE BEST HANDS DOWN!!They sell already cooked food that had an amazing restaurant quality.Love this place.. I've moved over 1hr away but I find time to make the trip back..TAMALES ARE ALSO SOMETHING WE BUY IN BULK AND FREZZ AT HOME.. YOU WONT BE SORRY!! I WISH I COULD GIVE THEM MORE STARS BECAUSE I WOULD.

4.description: I have been to the mountain top, and this is Mount Everest. In the back of this small and unassuming supermarket, Chicago's best tacos are made.

12.description: Staff friendly and knowledgeable. ESP Katie.

7.description: I'm extremely pleased with my experience for watch repair at Oscar's. I needed the bracelet of my watch with ceramic links put back together after dropping it more than a year ago. It was in so many pieces I didn't even know how many links would be required to fit my wrist again. Thanks to the entire team for being extremely patient with me. Great customer service!

3.description: I found this place via yelp and ventured in minus the 3.5 star review. I was a little apprehensive to get a watch battery & some links removed but I figured that it's such an easy procedure that I could risk it. Am I glad I went? Yep. I was greeted by Oscar himself and 2 of his friendly employees, and they managed to take care of my watch in less than 20 minutes (my meter didn't run out so that was an added plus lol).I hear they are known for making custom pieces so I'll be back from my upcoming birthday.

1.description: Oscar's carries Pandora, which is a favorite of my mom's and sister's.  I can always come here and get help picking out just the right charm or piece of jewelry for them (or me).  They are a "Gold" store, which means they have a large selection of the Pandora collection.  They also carry "Hearts on Fire" diamonds.  My husband got a great deal on some earrings for me from that collection.  Well, actually I got the great deal and made it easier for him.  They have great sidewalk sale deals and will also offer Pandora sales.

2.description: When shopping for my engagement ring, I took my time and did my research. I went to every big box store, ever little shop, and visited many stores on Jeweler's row. After being drained from the experience I came to Oscar's on the advice of a friend who bought his engagement ring from there.It was the not only the best value but the best experience I have ever had during any big purchase. They make you feel like a friend and not a customer. They answered every question, they helped me find exactly what I was looking for. Every time I call or go into the store, they know exactly who I am. The entire staff is incredible, and I highly recommend using this store if you are shopping for jewelry.On top of all that, the ring was custom made and it is the most gorgeous ring you will ever see. My wife gets compliments on it every single day. People ask about it constantly, the photographer and videographer at our wedding even want to feature it in some of their pieces.Thanks to all the staff for all their hard work and dedication. I am more than happy that I have found a place that I can put my confidence in and continue to do business with moving forward.

9.description: A REAL GEM ON THE SOUTH SIDEOscar is absolutely the BEST MAN to help you pick out an engagement ring!  His personality shines as bright as the rocks he sells in his shop.  Oscar was really patient in answering my questions and explaining the diamond buying basics (the 4 C'S).  I came in with an idea, and he helped me design a ring that my fiancée loves.  Compared to the other jewelers that I visited, Oscar was the most helpful and reasonably priced.  We are definitely going back to Oscar's for our future jewelry needs.

10.description: This place has been in Bridgeport for ever !!! And its simple Great Custumer Service.   Oscar and his staff always takes the extra step to make sure everything is perfect . And your always greeted with a smile  . Very professional and outstanding quality of Jewelry and Watches .

13.description: I  brought in a dimond ring with larger stone surrounded by small ones, yes, my ring is older and I had to bring it in because the larger stone fell out, luckily I was able to find it.  I also brought in a watch with a scratched glass to be replaced. I picked up my jewelry and within two weeks my ring  lost two small stones and the glass on my watch fell right out.  I brought my ring back and the stones were replaced, I paid for this and my watch was agan fixed free of charge.  Again, I brought home my jewelry and now three stons fell off my ring within several weeks and the watch fell apart again.  My problem with this whole thing is, I would think that they would have taken a good look at the ring all together to ensure the stones would all be secure and made recommendations when I picked it up.  And to have to bring my watch in 3 times to repair the same simple thing, I found this outrageous.  After leaving various messages to Oscar, I was finally able to reach him and he apologized and asked that I bring my jewelry in for the fourth time.  At which time I became too busy to even bother and I finally gave up on them.In terms of customer service, when I came in the store I stood around for at least 15 minutes looking for service, came in my work out cloting and was not taken serious, I had to ask for help and the girl at the counter was rude and appeared to not be interested in showing me any jewelry, I'm thinking she may have thought I could not afford to make a purchase there or something, needless to say from a sales standpoint, I was baffled.  Shortly thereafter, I had a great accomplishment in my life and wanted to gift myself with a piece of jewelryand I usually prefer to support my local business' but there was no question about it, oscars would not be getting my business, if they can't do a simple repair, then I will not be returning there at all.

16.description: Took my watch there a couple of times to get the battery replaced. Took a few days each time which isn't that big of a deal. Then I decided to try and get the crystal replaced on it because it had a small scratch on it. That took several weeks to get my watch back. A couple of days later the crystal they put just fell right out. I took it back and the girl told me "oh we didn't know the watch had to be sealed". How do you not know a water proof watch has to be sealed? So they said they are going to take care of it for free. A couple of weeks later I get a call from them saying it's going to be $45 to fix it. I explained the situation (why would I pay to fix something they broke?). So again they tell me they will take care of it. A few weeks later I get my watch back and once again a few days later the crystal they put in it falls right out (this time breaking in 3 pieces). What a waste of time and money.

17.description: I recently purchased a beautiful engagement ring at Oscar's Watch and Jewelry.  I worked with several members of the staff and the experience was truly memorable.  The staff works diligently to assist you in finding whatever makes you, the customer, happy.  Oscar, the owner, helped me pick out the stone.  He is one of those rare people that you meet and instantly feel like you have known your entire life.  He has a very, very kind demeanor and a great sense of his customers needs.  He also had a laser like focus on what I liked, and what I was not so crazy about.  I want to recommend anyone with Jewelry needs to ABSOLUTELY choose Oscar's Watch and Jewelry in South Chicago.  I was referred to him by an old friend and customer of his who raves about how many customers he has satisfied over the years.  He was right, the product/service offering was outstanding and I could not have been happier.  More importantly, my new fiance CAN'T take her eyes of this flawless diamond!!  John FinnTinley Park, IL

15.description: I went there to get my son's gold necklace cleaned and they STOLE the original necklace and replaced it with another. When I complained they lied and insisted it was the same necklace. The necklace had sentimental value to my son because it was given to him by his uncle who died. I should report them to t he State's Attorney's office with a written complaint. HORRIBLE PLACE to do business.

0.description: Brought my watch in for repair. They fixed it super quickly and for an extremely reasonable price. The staff was very friendly will recommend them to my friends. They also adjusted another watch band while I waited. Super Cool!

5.description: My family has known Oscar for a very long time. So when it came time to look for engagement rings my parents insisted we go there. We first went to some big name places and downtown. Some places were very helpful and we even found the ring I wanted at one. Before we settled we decided to go to Oscar. Thank god we did. He custom made the ring of my dreams and put the most beautiful diamond in the most amazing setting. Yes you can tell I love my ring! He did such a wonderful job and even helped my fiancé surprise me a little by not letting me know when it would be finished. I recommend him to anyone that has an idea what they want because he can custom make anything!

11.description: I did not purchase any jewelry here but I did come here to get my engagement ring resized at the new location (still on Halsted but opposite side of street).  It was $40 and I got the ring back a day and a half later.  Two women helped me out and they were both extremely helpful and lovely.  They also both gave me some information about how to care for my ring.Highly recommended for resizing and jewelry.  Lots of pretty things will catch your eye!

8.description: Updated! 6 months after I first go the ring, I am officially without a ring and we ARE going to a different store entirely. After the first 2 diamonds fell off, they told me that the reason was because the setting/band was weakened during the resizing process, and they had a new band made in my size.10 days after they had given me the ring back, completely remade with a new band in my size, ANOTHER diamond falls off. So, clearly the resizing had nothing to do with it, and it was just badly made. This was the final straw (count it - that's 3 total diamonds falling out within a 6 month period) and we took back the ring, got our money back, and are going to try again at a new place.Would not recommend Oscar's to anyone after this - truly, truly awful experience. :(

4.description: Super nice and helpful. I had a ring sized for a very reasonable price. Also. the Jewelry was priced very reasonably.

14.description: One of my favorite shops in Chicago.The staff is friendly, courtious, not pushy, fun, and knowledgable.  They will give ohnest opinions in an attempt to insure that their customers are happy.  I know generations of families that have gotten their marriage and engagement rings from Oscar's. They stand 100% behind their work, and produce great work that I beleive outshines the major chains.Go to kay jewlers, look at their selections, and the staff people who only know how to calculate commision. Then go to Robinson Bros. you will find THE EXACT SAME SELECTION, and the same sales people, then go to Rogers and Holland, you will see THE EXACT SAME SELECTION and the same sales people, then go to Jared and you will find THE EXACT SAME SELECTION and the same sales people. (Trust me I did this)Then go to Oscar, actually find what you want and it won't be a cookie cutter Chinese imitation (or even better, custom made), and the price will be better, and the same salesperson will wait on you at the sale, the fittings, the rework, and the maintenece of your item, for years to come. SUPPORT LOCAL BUSINESS

6.description: If you are looking for Pandora Jewelry this is the place to go. The. Staff are very Knowledgeable and friendly. I will continue to shop there because they are worth the visit.

1.description: Chicago's premier lamb and veal processor. Been around for 4 generations, I think they are doing something right. And that last "review", if you don't know anything about the business, don't review it.

0.description: It is a great business! It is not a drug front! Don't review something that you know nothing about!

1.description: My mom and I have had our hair cut by Maria. We highly recommend her. Great service!!

0.description: Maria does wonderful men's haircuts! She is the best. Super friendly and professional. Clean place and the prices are very affordable. I'm done spending $40 at other places nearby.

3.description: These guys are the Best !!!  They know how to take care of their custumers . Been in Business forever and theirs only one reason why the name says it all  Henry's .  I been going here since I was a kid and I always will .  I love these guys !!!!!

1.description: I LOOOOOVE Henry's Bait Shop!!! Theres so much to look at.They pretty much cover everything.Im a kayakfisherman and they even have rod holders for my kayak and lifejackets.Live bait,crankbaits,spoons,YOU NAME IT!!!!!! Can get a little aggravating when its busy but I OVERLOOK IT.I NEEEEVER go fish the lakefront without first stopping at Henry's on the way.Its like my ritual!!!!

2.description: Before I get into my review, I just want to bring up the fact that Henry's is one of the only bait shops in the Chicago area, so we don't have many options when stocking up before a trip.With that being said, I do like Henry's...most of the time.  They give you a good count when you buy minnows and do have some good reports come in. They also run a few fishing derbies which is never a bad thing, especially when kids are getting involved in fishing. What I don't like is the fact that bucketheads (a.k.a. guys who keep anything and everything they catch) frequent the place and you can run into some bad service at times.  I've had times I've gone in the place and the workers were super friendly and I've had times where I've wanted to correct them on all the false information they were relaying.Bottom line is if you're short on gear and need to stock up (and don't live near a Bass Pro), Henry's is a good option.  It doesn't hurt that they're also a stone's throw from Maxwell Street Station either.

5.description: The "gentleman" who answered the phone at this shop is one of the rudest people I have talked to in ages. I was attempting to help a guest of mine find some fishing reel rod or something. Well, clearly I know little to nothing about fishing. Unfortunately my guest was from another country and had a hard time explaining the item to me.MR. IMPATIENCE had no time to help us, basically blew me off, said he would not be "willing" to help me, and practically HUNG UP on me. It's too bad because he was referred to me by another sport shop and it is VERY possible I could need his services in the future.I don't care if you are the only "real" fishing shop in town, you don't treat potential customers like that!

6.description: Henry's is great! I have been there three times over the course of the last 2 years, and each time they have been friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. I think it is a blessing to have a small, local fishing shop right in the city not be forced to travel to the suburbs to shop at a big box store.

7.description: The crew at Henry's is very knowledgeable regarding midwest fishing especially Lake Michigan. They can tell you when and where the perch are biting and have a well stocked assortment of live bait and popular fishing tackle. You can get your Illinois fishing license here and unless you call during the weekend morning rush, they will spend a generous amount of time talking in person or via the telephone.

0.description: I've been coming here since I was old enough to crawl! Love the staff here at Henry's as they're very knowledgeable about fishin, and the conditions/where to go on Lake Michigan. While they don't have the largest selection and variety, this store provides awesome "big fish" stories and you can't pay anyone in a big chain store to tell these awesomely authentic (while sometimes fabricated) stories. Rest in Peace Henry....you're missed!

4.description: Henry's is ok if you need something and don't want to travel to the big box guys in the burbs.I had a good experience with their reel repair.  It was reasonable and they got the job done.Their bait is ussually good and they give out fishing reports as well

3.description: I recently moved to the Bridgeport area and I came across the Co-prosperity Sphere . My friends told me this place was very cool and sometimes would have events open to the public. So when I walked into the place there were several staff standing around . I said "hello" they completely ignore me for at least 30 seconds. Then one guy approached me and asked me  "what do you want in here". I simply responded, I would like to know about your events . His response was," There is no events ..we are not open to the pubic this is only a radio station". However, the following day , there was a punk rock music event and of course it was open to the public.lol . What a douchebag  Perhaps I was the wrong color .

1.description: This place is really interesting. I've never been here during an art event, but I've visited while they had the WLPN music events. Co-Pro is now the home of the online radio station, WLPN or Lumpen radio (lumpenradio.com) which is an online, independent, interesting and eclectic  radio station that is trying to raise enough funds to get their stuff on the actual radio. I attended their fundraising finale where they had some interesting electronic performers and also got to witness a friend's DJ set that was live on the radio.What little art they had on display the two times I went was interesting, but I love the atmosphere of this place. It's really a great space for events and has a sort of humble hipster vibe. I'm not sure if they rent out the space for events, but I'd be interested in attending other events here!

2.description: I've been to this gallery several times, and they're never open during normal gallery hours.  Out of 5 visits, I've been in once.  Typeforce 4 a couple years back.  Cool show.They don't have hours of operation posted anywhere, and they don't answer the phone.  Guess you need to go there on opening nights of shows only.  Not really worth it to trek to this place to see if they're open or not.

9.description: Not so much a review as a correction... the co-propsperity sphere is firmly in BRIDGEPORT.   bridgeport is bordered by archer to the north (although theres a little pocket that goes two blocks north round loomis/ ashland to the west/ the dan ryan to the east and pershing (39th street) on the south.  Pilsen is to the north of bridgeport-  Mckinley Park is to the West- Canaryville and Back of the Yards is South - Bronzeville and the IIT campus is due East.I know this may seem petty to many, but these neighborhoods still do have clear boundaries and specific cultures/styles/constituencies (sp?).  I think its important to note the facts...  I apologize if it comes off as rude.Anyway, its been a while since Ive hit up CPS, but its a pretty phenomenal space.  Its cool to see people work to rational and sustainable space after building fantastic things that were destined, determined and assumed to be crushed to dust.

10.description: What a cool space the Lumpen crew have created down in Pilsen. It's sprawling and they have made and are making all kinds of improvements to the space. They OWN this space. It's so impressive to see that they have come so far. They are turning the basement into a music space. We went here on Saturday to see the current exhibit since they have Saturday viewing hours. It was called Radar Eyes: A survey of hallucinogenic print making. Seripop curated part of it. It was really amazing to see all of the poster art in one space. It was kind of like walking through a nightmare since there were tons of visually and mentally shocking prints. Good job! When I was talking to Edmar, he said they too were also looking for volunteers.

4.description: Co-Pro is the artist space owned by Ed Marszewski, who also owns Maria's down the street. I went there for Over the Influence, which was a beer-art show. I honestly had a great time there and I think the space really gave an opportunity for all the art to be displayed, especially the sketches for local beer labels. There was even a weird, alien beer bong which attracted a lot of attention and a keg bottle opener thingy.The space seemed small with a lot of the tables next to each other but it was easy to try everything and talk to the brewers to. The only downside was the line for the bathrooms-which was probably the longest line there.

6.description: I hit up this spot for VersionFest 08 with my art school gal pal, and co conspirator in owing hundreds of thousands of dollars to an institution which has given us zero career options, yay art school.  We saw a few old classmates, gallery contacts, and current co-workers all while shit talking about the WP hipsters who are totally colonizing this area while I quietly sleep at night.  Loved the space, loved the art, and I love Lumpen in general.  We enjoyed some Grolsch, checked out some possible haircut options, and avoided a few nemeses (sp) all while having a great time viewing our colleagues work and chatting in our own social anxiety disordered wallflower way.  Hellz yes for getting Pit R Pat for opening night and on closing night, which I may find my way to, they'll be hosting Brilliant Pebbles and Aleks and the Drummer.  Yay party time in my neighborhood.  Yes I am tipsy and that is A-OK

12.description: Part of the Lumpen media juggernaut, the Co-Prosperity Sphere  is an unadorned gallery space with aggressive and eclectic programming.  I just saw a very singular exhibit documentening abandoned mental asylums throughout America, mostly on the east coast.  There were photographs, logbooks, and actual instruments used in these hospitals, creating a palpable sense of sanitary insanity. The photographer was there and answered all sorts of wacky questions I had, and the crowd was a pastichey mix of cool kids, arthounds, and elegant slummers.  Nice!Ther are lots more exhibits on the docket, and they come and go fairly quiclkly, so be sure to check these guys out regularly.

5.description: My friend's punk band played here.  For a show I think the punks were respectfully un--rowdy, there was no moshing, partially because the audience area was really horizontal/crescent shaped instead of vertical.  There were also movable walls that people were maybe scared of tipping over? Regardless it was a blast, in addition to the beer they served behind the counter people brought in their own from Maria's down the street, sparklers were lit, twerking was done on the walls of the store window, and my friend had an allergic reaction to the smoke machines.  Also the event organizer that night was this super nice guy wearing a spaghetti-stained tank top, dress slacks, and motorcycle jacket. I'd be really interested to see what it's like with art on the walls.Aesthetically the place has awesome color panels on their skylight level windows and is very clean--I appreciated the courtesy candle in the extremely overused single bathroom stall.  I feel really really bad that the black dye on my pants came off on one of their white wooden seated areas. That was not a co-prosperous move, and I apologize! There is a my-butt sized black mark tarnishing this place now.

11.description: Ed and his Lumpen crew have a fantastic space down in Pilsen.  It used to be a department store, then a pinball gallery, then a junk-storage space.  I've been there twice and I'm glad i went.  They also just redid the floors and it really looks great.  You should go just to see the architecture.  The first time I went, a neighborhood guy sang opera for the crowd.  The second time, I caught the poster show Radar Eyes and was very impressed.  Good show.The Co-Prosperity Sphere is going to be a player on the scene.  Go now and you can say "I used to go when NOBODY else even knew about the place."BTW: don't get this place mixed up with other Co-Prosperity Spheres...there are others.

8.description: Awesome local art gallery with a nice rotation of art from local artists. They host great events and are very open. Bridgeport needs more places like this.

0.description: Really more of an event space than an art gallery with regular gallery hours, which seems to have misled a couple of previous reviewers.  The events here are absolutely unique, excellent values, and highly recommended.

7.description: The Co-pro is  a giant room that they fill with stuff in the hopes someone like you will come out, have a good time and not snake the cash box.  Rather, this places facilitates the merrily drunk and reprimands the manchildren that frequent the party scene here in Chicago.  Honestly, sometimes it's pretty boring.  But it's better than paying $20 for some q101 rock bull shit at the metro when you just want to have a good time.They host a myriad of art crap while once in a while giving into your not so average rock shows.  The space hosts anything from Mahjongg  playing way too long to black metal bands that play way too long.  The space is for hire, so if you want to throw the best party ever, cough up the cash, charge at the door and you might be remembered late into the following Sunday evening.  No guarantees, though.  Even I already forgot who you are.

58.description: The other day I needed, yes needed a gyro. It was on New Year's Day so not much was opened for delivery but thankfully this was. They were quick and affordable which was nice. The fries were really good. Fresh cut which I absolutely adore. The gyro wasn't very good. Seasoned strange or maybe just a strange meat. Just didn't have a good flavor to it at all. Thankfully I'm going to attempt to avoid fried foods for awhile while I try to detox so I wont need to be ordering from here again.

56.description: Delicious cheeseburger and super fast and friendly delivery. Fries were a bit limp and kind of cold, but were somehow still delicious.

29.description: Not impressed. Ordered from here via grubhub, a Denver omelette with a side of grits. & for a friend, a cheeseburger with fries. Burger was okay. However, all the food arrived cold. And instead of cold grits, I got cold hash browns. Even though I specifically selected grits for my side. Burger with fries probably would've been alright if it had arrived warm. Also, was disappointed the only cheese made as an option was american & swiss for the omelette.  (I can't stand melted american cheese on anything aside from a burger).  Will not be ordering from here again.

42.description: The triple cheeseburger burger was huge and cooked to perfection! Delivery was pretty fast too. The only downside was that the burger was a little plain tasting, but with ketchup and or mustard it was still great

23.description: The pancakes were very bitter. Either it was spoiled milk or too much baking soda. So the cook says it taste fine to him just made the batter this morning. Then they said it must be my taste buds. What a waste of my cheat day. #ShouldhavegonetoIHOP

47.description: Everyone who is complaining on here is confused and needs to go downtown to a high class burger place for their bougie taste buds. This place is delicious. I'm originally from NC and we have the shittiest hot dogs you can imagine--this place has polish. I was sold. Their fries and hamburgers drip with grease which is exactly what a location called, "Hamburger Heaven" should deliver. Haven't tried the breakfast or milkshakes yet but I am excited to do so due to the positive responses on Yelp. Will go back again. Over and over again.

8.description: Had a burger & fries from here. Ordered through grubhub. Only complaint is it took forever but the burger was juicy and quite large. The fries were warm & handcut. DELICIOUS.

31.description: This is based solely on delivery of an order.  Ordered online, estimated delivery 45-60.  As I sit here and wait, it has already been 2.5 hours.  I have called numerous times and have not received any justification/apology.  Won't be returning for business.

34.description: Absolutely terrible. My friends and I placed an order around 12pm, we got our food at 2:30pm. We called them twice and all they would say was that it was on its way. The food was cold, ice cream was melted, and they missed one of our orders. We managed to get a $10 discount, but we're definitely not ordering food from this place again. Don't recommend it all

16.description: First time ordering Hamburger "Heaven"....Yikes. More like "Hamburger Hell"Burger had a nicely charred piece of wax paper on it. So...soooo  mouthwatering..trust me...when I only had yogurt and coffee today. Thank you cook that hates his job and wanted to leave. Sorry my hunger kept you open during business hours.Since I have not ordered here before, I thought to be smart and order a 2nd ittem in case first item was bad - so I opted for the chopped steak sandwich. It looks like burnt meatloaf with clear plastic - except that clear plastic is actually mozzerella cheese. I'm not kidding. DISGUSTING.Plus the chili cheese fries looked like they fell on the floor as the box was open and cheese was pouring out of it.Will NEVER order from here again.Glad the impersonable and rude driver got a $4 tip for shitty food. Yay him, sorry you shook your head because I couldn't hear you when I picked up the phone when you showed up outside. Yes, I was at the door when I saw you shaking your head pissed off because you couldn't hear me when I answered.Look, GrubHub didn't inform me you guys were closing - IF that is what this was - don't take it out on the person who is starving - I would rather you CALL and say HEY - we are closed - than send me disgusting food.A refund would be nice as the "cheeseburger" is in my oven right now and the chopped "steak" I'm thinking of handing over to my dog. Seriously. I haven't had THIS shitty of food in a LONG time from a place on GrubHub.I would be ticked if I was the manager or owner of this place.

13.description: Very bad service horrible customer service when I called to complain very rude and ignorant people. The establishment is very crappy and the people who work there do not represented well they speak very improper and very rude to their customers I ordered a hamburger order fries and a hot dog special and they did not give me a drink with that and when they delivered it to me they charge me $18 for a hamburger and a hot dog which was very unsatisfying just wish they had better communication skills and proper customer service to deal with problems instead of a lady yelling at you.

11.description: Gave 2 stars because the food was pretty good. I had delivered short stack pancakes and chicken parm. I will not give more than 2 stars because I've never experience such a rude and lazy delivery guy. Calls me twice the moment he left the restaurant, basically saying to me he wants me to come outside my appt to get the food and kept asking where am I. He then continued to just talk about nothing. It's not easy for me to go outside but whatever, I did and decided it's fair not to tip. Minutes later I'm getting multiple calls from him. Said they needed their ticket on the bag back bc they can't reprint. I refused to go back outside and he doesn't want to come upstairs. Stalemate. Not my problem. Will not order again. Should've read the reviews here first. That was my ignorance. Ugh.

39.description: Ok, SO ordered form here for lunch, through grub hub. Waited 3 hours for my food. Then when my food came it was ice cold. They had lots of attitude and refused to give me my money back. When grub hub called them to negotiate on my behalf they refused again. I will never order form this place again.

37.description: I ordered through the phone for a pick up last time and they had gave me the wrong order, but I did not realise till I got home. I placed the order online this time, hoping that my order would be made correctly if it was stated in print. I live a few minutes away by car, but I decided to order for deliver since it is difficult to find parking around my house. However, it took about a whole hour before my food came. I ordered a medium rare skirt steak dinner with a side of cheese, but my steak was very well done and they had even left out my cheese. I'm giving them two stars because their fries are delicious and so are their burgers, however, the service there really ruins it. I have been coming here for a few years now, but now the service has been horrible. Needless to say, I will not be ordering from them again.

0.description: All the negative reviews are kind of baffling. I've probably eating here a dozen times in the past year or so (both delivery and pick up), and every time it has been a fine experience. Average wait times, and no one was ever rude.Dunno what people are expecting from a restaurant that has a menu that would make Gordon Ramsey cringe. It's just good, cheap, greasy food.

38.description: Ordered food at 10:30 it didn't get to me until 12. Delivery driver flicks cigarette out of his hand as he gets out of car. That explains why the entire bag and wrapping of food smelled like smoke.Food was ice cold and strawberry shake tastes like Benadryl. Will never order from here again.

51.description: This is my favorite hamburger, fries and shake place. I always have it delivered and their delivery is fast and food is hot. I typically use the Eat24 app for delivery and ordering but have had great results with GrubHub, too. Everything is a bit greasy, but that's why you order from this place. It's also pretty cheap. I would never get a fast food burger now that I've found this place. I love it and it's my favorite place in the world when I'm feeling like hell and watching Scrubs or Parks & Rec on Netflix.Get the cheeseburger, get the fries, and definitely get a shake (it's ridiculous how good it is).

27.description: "Family recipe made the same way for the last 25 years and cooked to perfection." Your family should stop making Italian Beef, this is one of the worst I have ever tasted.. or not.. Absolutely flavorless. Sad.

32.description: Thanks GrubHub. I ordered my breakfast through GrubHub, my order of French Toast, ham and coffee were ready when I arrived. They poured my coffee as I waited, to ensure that it was hot. My food was hot, flavorful and fantastic. I would definitely order from here again.

54.description: One of the few places in Chicago where you can order burgers and hot dogs and shakes for delivery. Just be sure to put any special instructions in the notes section when ordering online so nothing is missed (i.e., straws, ketchup, etc). Overall a good delivery spot. They are quick and satisfying.

48.description: Oh hell no.First time here (7/8/14) because of the reviews and on suggestion of fellow Instagramer. Never. Again. I paid $16.04 for a gyro sandwich, breaded mushrooms and a Lg Milk Shake. Let's start with the milk shake. It ain't bringin' no boys to the yard unless they like lots of milk, Too much milk, no vanilla flavor and I found some foreign fried object in it after a couple of slurps. $3.75 wasted. The breaded mushrooms. Cost $4.95. Got home and opened the box. Found 7. That's right S.E.V.E.N. of them. That works out to be .71 cents per 'shroom. Nah. The gyro sandwich $5.75. Man, the grease that leached off this thing within 3 mins of getting it was unbelievable.  Good thing for brown bags, right. Nope. Dayum grease got on my car seat. But the saving "grace" was there was a LOT of meat. This is suppose to serve one person. I hate to see the gyro platter which is suppose to serve two (which means it serves four). This was so disappointing that I'm actually taking personal.

44.description: Ordered and the burger was tasty but nothing special that I couldn't find anywhere else. Fries were fine, mine came hot and were mostly pretty soft but still somewhat tasty. Would have appreciated adequate condiments to come with the burger and fries. Shake was pretty good, mostly liquidy but that's expected with delivery.

24.description: customer service that I experience today was awful. The order taker was very rude when I call  to complaint about my order. The food was cold and very dry, so of the items I order was missing. the time for delivery was change twice and the order was still late. I wanted them to pick the order back up and return my money. I will never ever order from this place again. I work for a major hotel in the downtown area. We will not recommend this restaurant to our guest.

7.description: Something must have changed because I ordered a burger there, recently and it was not the same as when I was there months ago.  The burger was dripping with grease and they didn't make the burger as requested.  Will not go back.  Hopefully, they will change the burger meat as it is not the same...

49.description: I'm embarrassed that I had high expectations for a place that I was ordering junk food from at 11:30 at night, but I did. None of our food had seasoning on it. I felt like I was ordering food at an elderly home. No salt, pepper, or any seasoning at all everything tasted like hmmmm... rice, but I didn't order any rice. :(

40.description: It took me about 7 years, living in the neighborhood, to finally try this place.  My husband and kids would come home with burgers and fries,  but I always opted out.   I'd drive by the place often and it never really piqued my interest.   It looks like a little shack in the corner with bad looking parking.   My very picky daughter would rave about their chicken noodle soup, so i finally broke down and tried that and a hamburger.  ok, ok.  I'm hooked.  The soup looks and tastes homemade.  I see we can order through an app and get it delivered.  That's even better.

53.description: best delivery I've ever received. it's crazy how fast and fresh the food was. i ordered breakfast and it was hot like someone just brought it from my kitchen. definitely going to order from them more often!

30.description: I order from these guys once in a while on GrubHub.  VERY fast, one of the fastest delivery places to go on GrubHub!  Cheeseburgers are good, gyros is decent...   highly recommend their Root Beer Milkshakes!  I used to order these when I was a kid at Janson's on the southside.  Happy this place makes them just like I remember.  =)

46.description: If u Lik messy greasy food this is your joint..the burgers were good but not as good as ReggiesIf you live in the area the price is the same for here as Reggies. The onion rings were good if they were separated, not just one blob. Delivery was fast.

1.description: There is nothing heavenly about this place, nor do they understand the concept of "express."I made the mistake of ordering breakfast delivery. As I sit here typing, my food is 1.5 hours late. The first time I called I was told my food was on it's way and they were busy. Fine. Stuff happens. I get it. 45 minutes later I called back and was told as soon as the driver was back mine would be the "first one out the door." So not only do they not prepare food in a timely manner, but they're also liars. Also, I'm officially starving and hopefully I wont be dead before I finish this post... Never again with this place. Never. Sorry, Hamburger Hell.

55.description: I've ordered from here a couple times, both in person and delivery. The specials they have in-store (in shack?) are absurd. Two Italian beef sandwiches for little more than pocket change, for example. Delivery is always quick, and done with smile. They respond to specific requests added in the "Special Instructions" spot on Grubhub. I worked at a 24 hour diner for years, and I can say that packaging eggs to go is a NIGHTMARE. It has a failure rate of about 120% but somehow, they manage to do it without any issues. You need greasy spoon food without getting off the couch? Order right now.

9.description: I was weary of this place in the beginning because visually it is not very impressive but holy shit the burgers are so good.  Not only are the burgers good but everyone there works SO HARD, I always wish I had enough money to tip them all.  Everyone moves with A sense of urgency/busts their asses and the two women who usually work the counter are so very awesome, way better than a lot of the employees of high end downtown restaurants!

26.description: Never order the ribeye steak with egg whites you will get one egg when its suppose to be 3 egg whites.  When I called them on it they are like its very small eggs.  Im like are jelly bean size because this is crazy the slice of cheese was larger then the egg. which is suppose to be 3 eggs GET REAL!!!!!!!!

25.description: I've eaten bere several times, little pricy but good fresh fast food. The 2 stars is due to the fact the delivery point blank BLOWS waited 2 hours for food that showed up cold. I dont make bad reviews but I've had this problem several times with these guys. sorry kev but you guys need help in the delivery department.

12.description: I've lived in the Chicago area for three years and a friend turned me onto this place. This is honestly the only meal I've had worth the price outside of Al's. Beef combo was amazing I could barely finish it! And the shrimp dinner my wife got was amazing too she raved about it all night. Will order from here anytime I'm in south side!

59.description: This was hot dog stop #1 for me that night - I was leaving Chicago the next day and my cousins wanted me to try the hot dogs. I can't remember the exact menu name... but I got a hot dog and fries and didn't think I'd finish it, but I did.... The food was ready really quickly (which is actually kind of necessary, there's not much standing room), the speed felt like fast food service but the meal tasted beyond that. I like that this truly seemed like a hole in the wall place.  And I'm seeing now that they deliver.... always plus points for this.

21.description: I did not check Yelp prior to placing my order and I wish I had. Not only did it take them 2 hours to deliver, but I am pretty sure the hashbrowns were bad. We ordered a Denver omelette, pancakes and the ribeye steak and eggs. The omelette and pancakes were ok, but the hashbrowns tasted sour. I am almost positive they were bad, so we just threw those out. I like to give places more than one chance, but I won't be ordering from here again.

17.description: Not so much.   Food took an hour and a half to be delivered.   Hamburger was way over cooked and was nothing but ground beef haphazardly  thrown on the grill.  Onion rings were soggy.  Mozerella sticks were decent but likely only because mozzarella sticks can still be good when they are lukewarm.

10.description: Delivery was about 90 minutes.  The patty melt burger  was ok.  Everything i ordered was drenched in oil . I ordered a patty melt,fried ravioli, onion rings, shrimp basket,fries and a reeses breezie. The fried ravioli was hard and old . Onion rings oil leaked through 3 hard paper bags that's how oily they arrived i couldn't even eat one. Shrimp was breaded and also very soggy. The fries were soft and falling apart from all the oil. The reeses breezie which is a shake . Since my order took so long it came to me as melted ice cream and a few large chunks of reeses.  Never again.

5.description: Used to come here a lot when I lived in Bridgeport. Decent food but the prices have gone up in the past couple years...with no difference in what they're serving. Totally not worth it anymore. There's really no reason to come here when Johnny O's is down the street. Also 24 hours, similar (but better) fare, and better prices.

3.description: as first timer at this place, and reading the reviews--i had little expectations. I had a taste for a burger and this is the closest place to me. It's bigger on the inside than it looks on the outside. I was VERY pleased with my food! It was a big juicy seasoned angus burger, and I could tell the fries were fresh cut (the kind that has some potato skin still on it).  I got the special which includes fries & drinks for 8.15. That's not overpriced at all so I don't see what the huff & puff over price is about. it was worth my 8.15. I also really liked that it was cooked to order. I will be retuning back to try their Grilled Chicken breast next.  Boyfriend and I are satisfied Customers and will be returning.

35.description: Food was over an hour late and arrived cold and mushy.  Driver called from around the corner and seemed annoyed when I asked if he could bring the food to the correct building.  Would not order again.

19.description: Ordered food at 10:30 it didn't get to me until 12. Delivery driver flicks cigarette out of his hand as he gets out of car. That explains why the entire bag and wrapping of food smelled like smoke.Food was ice cold and strawberry shake tastes like Benadryl. Will never order from here again.

28.description: Screwed up again... I gave them another chance because my growling tummy needed to eat... I worked 9 hours today, to come home and relax a couple hours before needing to have dinner. I figured, I'll try something else, maybe they'll  nail that. NOPE. Quite frankly, I'm  sick of the "cooks" not caring what kind of food they put out. I'm IN THE INDUSTRY... I'm a bartender for many years. If someone orders whiskey and I give them vodka, I hear about it and I fix it. ON TOP OF THAT, if someone orders Grey Goose and I serve them crap vodka, they are aware and I must make up for it.  But I would NEVER DO THAT. I CARE ABOUT MY JOB AND BEING IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY, I CARE ABOUT MY CUSTOMER. PERIOD. BOTTOM LINE. The cooks in this place are nothing but assholes. Follow instructions. It's simple. You are not running Weber Grill or Wildfire.

45.description: Tasty burgers and great service! Definitely a hole in the wall but hey it's a shack with a kitchen what do you expect.  Love that's it's 24/7!

33.description: Great place to get a beef sandwich and home cut fries for a excellent price cant get a beef sandwich of this size that they give you here for the price anywhere else day or night

43.description: Went there today for the first time and I just want to say what a terrible first impression.  There was a women there that looks like she was ready for her afternoon drink because of the horrible mood she displayed and then when I told her instead of saying sorry she blows me off and tells the next customer that I don't have a sense of humor.  When dealing with the public take a look at how you act because it's a reflection on who you work for and if you think there's nothing wrong, recap.  Not everyone is having your day and there's no need to infect everyone with yours.

2.description: i had to change my review on here.Ive always liked Hamburger Heaven and i still go there every once in a while, but very rare now.THIS PLACE IS EXPENSIVE!!!! What the heck happened HH?The food is decent, dont get me wrong, but this is supposed to be a carry out Chicago fast food joint! For 1 hot dog and a fry its like $6! $6?! come on guys thats almost an insult.I no longer make any special trips to get food from here. Only if its very late and im right on Archer will i stop. Bums me out because i really like this place.

18.description: Honestly shouldn't even get a star because of how poor the customer serves. Didn't even get my food and when I call the place the rude lady started swearing. I would not recommend this place to anyone

41.description: Burger was great; cheese fries were wonderful! I recommend carrying out because there aren't many places to sit (in fact, I saw a bar with 3 stools). They accept credit cards!

52.description: Cook like An Asian Mama Here!When I'm not cooking in the house for my family and friends I like to take a bite to eat somewhere affordable and the taste of food is not comprised by my tight wallet.  My husband and I decided to stop and pick up some food from Hamburger heaven. We ordered two items with friends none of which sad to say were their hamburgers.I had a craving for a chili dog and he wanted a gyro. We loved their fries we think it is fresh cut and fried right then and there. I didn't love my chili dog but I didn't hate it. I would like to try their hamburgers next time. My husband liked his gyros. We were happy with the food but not amazingly impressed. But why would we be I mean it caters to the masses and it fills your tummy up for around $10. It's a cheap eats type of place and the workers are nice people.

50.description: This place may have the best burger in Bridgeport. They have a big menu but I usually stick with the cheeseburgers w/ grilled onions, fresh cut fries, and home made onion rings. And open 24/7!! They deliver too. The people are down to earth and get it right. This place is fantastic!

4.description: The food is pretty okay used to be a solid 4 stars. The prices have skyrocketed with no improvement to the product.  The quality of service has dropped as well. I can't speak to say it is new owners but I suspect so. This has been the case for several months. I wouldn't suggest the Groupon  as it barely evens out the cost in a comparable setting. It's too bad that this used to be a great place to go any hour of the day, at a fair price. Again they have a decent product but seriously out of the price range for what they offer.

6.description: If you're desperate go here. We got fries before and they were black from old oil. Tried them again later and black again from old oil. CHANGE YOUR OIL!! Quit being cheap. I also got a pizza puff and it was the darkest puff I've ever had. Anything else we've tried is completely mediocre. Save your money and go elsewhere.

22.description: I see there are lots of bad reviews on here, stick with the cheese burger, hot dogs or italian beef, and you won't go wrong...get your fries somewhere else tho.  This place gets four stars for their hamburgers and shakes.  Amazing stuff.  One thing about them though is their fries really blow.  I just don't understand why their fries suck so bad.  Brown and greasy, my coworker wouldn't even eat his.  I have had their gyros, the meat is decent but the tzaziki(sp?) disappointing.  I used to phone order on my way home but now that they are on grub hub, you have to give yourself an extra five minutes to phone in an order...Their chocolate shake is delicious.

15.description: This place is right down the street from me and is a good spot for walking to when I'm drunk or it's a holiday and nothing else is open. The service is VERY dependent on who's working at the time, and I've had some really friendly, prompt service here before. However, after last night I don't think I'll ever go back. I got off work around 1:00 AM and took a cab to Hamburger Heaven, figuring I'd just order food and get back to my apartment a block away. It's very important to note that my foot is broken so I'm on crutches, meaning it pretty obvious I was walking back (I have a boot on my right foot) and that my carrying options are limited. I usually snag chili cheese dogs here, but it's way cheaper to get a two hot dog combo and I wanted to go cheap, so I ordered my combo and was ready to pay when the lady asked what kind of drink I wanted. "Oh, nothing." "Well then you can't get a combo.""I'm sorry?""The combo comes with a drink, if you don't want it, it will be more expensive.""Why?""Hold on..." (looks at menu) "It will be [whatever the price was] for two hot dogs.""I am walking home, I can't carry a drink.""OK.""OK.""So I have to charge you for two hot dogs."I just paid because I was hungry and it was late. And yeah, I get it, my story is boring. But seriously, being told that you have to pay more than someone else because you're on crutches and can't carry a drink is weak.

57.description: Okay, so I was searching GrubHub to find a Burger spot close to home to get delivered some vitels and happened upon this place. Long story short, I got a timely delivery of my dinner and was pleased with this favorite from this spot, the Double Cheeseburger Special.
