I was pleasantly surprised to see that it wasn't a processed beef byproduct frisbee, but instead was a fresh, hand packed burger. The fries were good too. If you're counting calories, don't get this burger, but if you want a really tasty burger that rivals 5 Guys...holler at Hamburger Heaven!

20.description: Honestly shouldn't even get a star because of how poor the customer serves. Didn't even get my food and when I call the place the rude lady started swearing. I would not recommend this place to anyone

36.description: First time ordering Hamburger "Heaven"....Yikes. More like "Hamburger Hell"Burger had a nicely charred piece of wax paper on it. So...soooo  mouthwatering..trust me...when I only had yogurt and coffee today. Thank you cook that hates his job and wanted to leave. Sorry my hunger kept you open during business hours.Since I have not ordered here before, I thought to be smart and order a 2nd ittem in case first item was bad - so I opted for the chopped steak sandwich. It looks like burnt meatloaf with clear plastic - except that clear plastic is actually mozzerella cheese. I'm not kidding. DISGUSTING.Plus the chili cheese fries looked like they fell on the floor as the box was open and cheese was pouring out of it.Will NEVER order from here again.Glad the impersonable and rude driver got a $4 tip for shitty food. Yay him, sorry you shook your head because I couldn't hear you when I picked up the phone when you showed up outside. Yes, I was at the door when I saw you shaking your head pissed off because you couldn't hear me when I answered.Look, GrubHub didn't inform me you guys were closing - IF that is what this was - don't take it out on the person who is starving - I would rather you CALL and say HEY - we are closed - than send me disgusting food.A refund would be nice as the "cheeseburger" is in my oven right now and the chopped "steak" I'm thinking of handing over to my dog. Seriously. I haven't had THIS shitty of food in a LONG time from a place on GrubHub.I would be ticked if I was the manager or owner of this place.

14.description: I used to go here for years and loved the hours and the cheeseburgers. Within the last six months they jacked up their prices. It is insanely expensive now. Sorry they got greedy and ruined a wonderful business.

3.description: Yes, this place is generally the kind of dive-y neighborhood bar that I would seek out to be my local - especially considering the fact that it's only about 2 blocks from our home - but I will never do business here again.  We went down here to watch a hockey game during playoffs because we didn't have cable, and found the service to be terrible on a virtually empty night.  I think it basically boiled down to an 'us v them' sort of thing (something that I rarely experience elsewhere in the neighborhood).  The one or two people that were actually in the bar clearly were the regulars and friends of the staff by the way they capitalized the bartendress's time, ordered little, and stayed long.The final blow to Shinnicks was the lingo.  Clearly some of the old racism Bridgeport was (and still is among my non-white friends) famous for is alive and well in little pockets where 20 somethings employ daddy's slurs like 'spook' and 'shine' in casual conversation - looking over shoulders to see my reaction.  My reaction?  Put down my beer and walk out.No thanks - I'll take my business to Mitchells, Berniece's, or Schaller's where the beer selection is better, the vibe more pleasing, the staff is friendly, and the bigotry isn't right on the surface.UPDATE - cheers for the threatening message/compliment I received within 5 minutes of posting this.  You must be one of those lovely regulars I spoke of.  Yes, I will definitely sell my home and move because I don't like your ignorant townie nest; thank god I rarely run into trolls like you in real life in Bridgeport. (Which, registered in 2009 with no posts or friends, you most likely are). Yes, by all means forward my review to Shinnicks - I'm sure it'll really mean a ton when weighed against all the other 5-star reviews.  I'll give the slightest benefit of the doubt that on game days when the crowd is more mixed in with randoms that it may be a good place to hang, but I was not interested in the vibe on a non-game night when the regulars felt more free to talk as they normally would; this is a reflection on them, and less directly, the staff present who chose not to correct their friends.  Shinnicks could be the most fantastic bar in the world, but I refuse to give a place a second chance after a first impression like that.  I don't need a pre-game bar because I have free beers at home, blocks from the park.  What I want is a year-round local that feels comfortable, which I have found, easily, 2-3 times over elsewhere in Bridgeport.  Anyway, Shinnicks is clearly better off without me, and I without them.

1.description: I just moved into the neighborhood and was so happy to come across this place. It's a true neighborhood bar and a throw back to yesteryear. What better place to get together with friends and kick back a few cold ones while watching the hawks game.

2.description: Okay. I'll admit it. I was a bit lost in this neighborhood. After all- who would think that on a residential street, just down from where Mayor Daley used to live would be a bar like Shinnicks Pub. For me- it was love at first sight. First of all- this place has been here since the 1880's. When you walk in the door, your eyes are immediately drawn to the huge mahogany bar. It is spectacular! With it's huge columns, ornate crown molding and being at least 12 feet tall and 18 feet long- this back bar is amazing just to behold. The bartender told me that it is an original Brunswick Balke-Collender bar. Now to many of you who are not antique buffs- this may not mean much- but Brunswick went from making billiard tables in the 1880's to making these amazing back bars right here in Chicago. This one, and most others like it had to be built on site as the scale would be such that it would never fit through the door.. They were made of ornate woods and included specialties like stained glass, silvered mirrors and other ornamentation. An absolutely stunning piece of history. The walls and ceiling in Shinnicks are the original tin. And those walls are covered in old photographs of the Shinnick family and their friends, including past politicians. There is even a small sign that dubs this place "little city hall" making me think about what kind of politics went on in this place over the years. The bartender, Joanne, is a Shinnick, whose family has owned this bar since 1938. She is quick with the drink and on this busy Friday night was amazing as she served her friends and neighbors (and me) cheap beer and shots. This is not a fancy place so if you go- know to order a beer or a shot as those "cosmos" have no place here. Drinks are cheap, beer is handed to you in a bottle (or can during the Sox games) and cash is king at this place so also remember to leave the credit cards at home. And the people? They are so friendly. Within minutes I had run into someone I knew, met a woman who had just opened her new business and invited me to stop by, and had another person ask me if I was new to the neighborhood. I am always blown away by the friendliness of the south side. A bit hard to find but once you are there- you will be welcomed like you have lived in the neighborhood your whole life. Now what can be better than that?

5.description: A nice looking small pub that I would hardly call a dive. This place has nice decor and ceiling despite its evident age. A classic neighborhood pub that you don't see everyday in the middle of a residential street. The beer was cheap and came from a bottle,tap, and a can. I love having these three choices. The bartender though ..again bad service as he was way too interested in the video bar games than serving his patrons even on a dead night.

6.description: I love coming here after soxs game! The bartenders at this place are awesome, and always make you feel right at home.

7.description: I wont go here after a cub/sox game(too crowded/insane), but it's a fun spot for a drink after Sox games. Especially if you have an elusive neighborhood parking pass and can park near it any time.

8.description: This a great local bar. Before or after a Sox game you can usually find some rowdy fans looking to have a good time. Cheap canned beer... just the way I like it. Don't go looking for some kind of specialty drink list... cause you're looking in the wrong place. Weekends are always a good time, especially saturday nights when the juke box plays til the wee hours of the morning.

9.description: This is a great place to grab a drink before or after a Sox game, as it is in walking distance.  Cheap drinks and beer (no tap).  Don't come expecting anything fancy.  If you ask for a cosmo, you'll probably get laughed at.  Jukebox, Golden Tee, and darts provide entertainment, as well as outdoor bags games in the summer.

0.description: What a great place.  Friendly neighborhood joint.  If you are lucky and Tom Shinnick is there, you can hear him tell you he is responsible for the rise and success of Wisconsin Badger athletics.Great place for Sox fans to drown their sorrows.Historical Bridgeport tavern.

4.description: My neighbor grew up on the South Side and has always spoken warmly of Shinnick's. When a friend and I found ourselves with free Sox tickets recently, we decided to head here for a couple drafts before finding parking (ALL street parking is permit only during games). We were welcomed into this unassuming local tavern where drinks were cheap (compared to our North Side usual haunts) and service was friendly. The vintage Brunswick bar was stunning. The bartender immediately asked us if we needed a parking pass for the game. A huge plus for us as we were parked right out front. When the barkeep was caught in a conversation down at the end of the bar and kept us waiting a minute longer than usual for a refill, he offered us each a shot of Jameson's on the house. Wow, what a guy! We'll definitely return on our next trip down South!

1.description: Just walked out, bar was closed and no signs of intelligent life inside. Do people work at this shit hole? Why be open if noone is going to greet people or do anything? Not to mention these plebians left the paper on the step looks like noone even works here! Maybe i came on the wrong day but leave a damn sign that the bars closed and the place will be filled with children. Left after awhile of walking around and getting dirty looks from whatever kind of idiots were inside. Bad exp was bad.

9.description: I've only had drinks from here but it's been pretty good. It really depends on who is making your drinks because I've had some terrible coffee before.Pricing is fair, people are cool, and very convenient whenever I'm at the studio.

23.description: The art is the attaction at the very well appointed cafe. However, they've recently installed a full bar, so stick around for some coctails, and some sushi fusion.

12.description: There are not many places to grab a healthy (and arguably hip) lunch in Bridgeport. (The birthplace of Chicago politics obviously does not lend itself to becoming a health food hotspot)But, dear friends, this is a pillar of hope.Warehousey-loft gone studio-cafe, Zhou B cafe has character. The rotating art exhibits and designer shop (fiscal sustainability aside) are a great diversion. And the bar/cafe is open yet intimate.The main bar dude is always there with his own brand of charm - and if you are lucky, you can often catch a unofficial showing of star wars at lunch when he is bored. The menu selection is limited and changes on availability, but the  salads are reliable. I have yet to come for happy hour - this will change soon.Pros:-Space-Local flavor-Bar/Cafe-Salads!-STAR WARS-Friendliness-Prices-Potentially awesome venue for a get togetherCons:-Mustard often too strong on the grilled cheese-Premade soups and unremarkable bread-Not convincing my boss to start happy hour earlySuggestions:-Perhaps show shorter shows for the lunch crowd (Arrested Development, Office, etc) -Homemade soup/better bread/ and COOKIES!

21.description: There was a free film presentation here when I went on a Tuesday a few weeks ago with my cool artist friend.  I think the Tuesday movies are going to be a weekly thing. . A lot of fun for a northsider to adventure to Bridgeport, find a charming space, very welcoming people and free. I didn't try the food but had a glass of very acceptable wine.

16.description: Came here for a Latin Dance night event, it was pretty awesome. Good DJ's, good bartender and very nice venue. Very nice space, next time I'll have to check out more of what's inside!

17.description: Love Zhou B Cafe because its open, comfortable, and free wifi. Also it is a great alternative to sitting crammed up in Bridgeport Coffee. I'm not sure why pple don't just walk 5 minutes south to Zhou B. For now its my little secret. However, I do have to deduct a star b/c more than once they really don't have food items consistently.

10.description: Neat location but horribly unprepared for service. Arrived at an empty location (one other person) with a party of five and had a awful experience. Drinks and food were late. The two staff  there were arguing consistently over how to write down orders and prepare food. The food was ok and we all left interested in coming back at night for wine and art. It's when the two employees left for a smoke and we were left in charge that sank it as a return lunch spot.

5.description: Well let's just say, I could've made the food at home. It had a nice vibe to the cafe, and it really for artist types, I guess not for me and the kiddies.This place is nothing special, you are better of going to Jimmy Johns or the food court for a sub sandwich and chips.

11.description: My wife, some friends, and I were attending an art showing at the Zhou B Art Center, and we decided to meet for dinner at the Zhou B Cafe. As soon as you come in you will notice that the decor of the cafe is inspired by the culture of the center, one example is that part of the drop down ceiling is shaped and decorated like an artist palette. It is a very cool atmosphere.They have a full bar, though the physical bar is pretty small and it seems designed more for ordering and taking back to your table or wandering through the art center. Without looking at the menu, I ordered a regional microbrew, and they had it on tap. Their drink offerings are pretty extensive and impressive for both those that enjoy alcohol and those that don't.The food was excellent. Though most of their menu consists of different forms of sandwiches, they do have some soup and salads. The sandwiches are fresh, tasty, and well-presented. It is the perfect fare right before attending an art show. It is light, fast, and simple to eat. This would be a great place to come for a light snack and drinks, dinner before a show, or a place to come to unwind after work. There is street parking right in front of the building and despite going there on a Friday night while a Sox game was playing, I was able to get parking half-block away. Overall I was very happy with this place and would go back again. My only complaint is that I do not often get to Bridgeport, and so this location is slightly out of my way. For those of you that are in and around Bridgeport often, this would be a non-issue. I encourage everyone to check it out and attend an event at the art center.

22.description: The couches seem disappointingly non-soft, but that's all the negatives I can come up with.  Being in the Zhou B Art center is an obvious plus, being quiet, attractive (obviously, since it's in the Zhou Brothers' building), and having free wi-fi means I'll be here a lot in the future.  Full bar, surprisingly long menu for a bar/cafe (sandwiches $6-10), and magnificent art work all around.

0.description: Eclectic four story art mecca with interesting and edgy art.Beware of non air conditioned room, but embrace the credo of unrestricted creativity.Loved the jungle living room. Will be back.

20.description: There are not many places to grab a healthy (and arguably hip) lunch in Bridgeport. (The birthplace of Chicago politics obviously does not lend itself to becoming a health food hotspot)But, dear friends, this is a pillar of hope.Warehousey-loft gone studio-cafe, Zhou B cafe has character. The rotating art exhibits and designer shop (fiscal sustainability aside) are a great diversion. And the bar/cafe is open yet intimate.The main bar dude is always there with his own brand of charm - and if you are lucky, you can often catch a unofficial showing of star wars at lunch when he is bored. The menu selection is limited and changes on availability, but the  salads are reliable. I have yet to come for happy hour - this will change soon.Pros:-Space-Local flavor-Bar/Cafe-Salads!-STAR WARS-Friendliness-Prices-Potentially awesome venue for a get togetherCons:-Mustard often too strong on the grilled cheese-Premade soups and unremarkable bread-Not convincing my boss to start happy hour earlySuggestions:-Perhaps show shorter shows for the lunch crowd (Arrested Development, Office, etc) -Homemade soup/better bread/ and COOKIES!

19.description: There was a free film presentation here when I went on a Tuesday a few weeks ago with my cool artist friend.  I think the Tuesday movies are going to be a weekly thing. . A lot of fun for a northsider to adventure to Bridgeport, find a charming space, very welcoming people and free. I didn't try the food but had a glass of very acceptable wine.

2.description: Awesome place... I was there for a wedding so the atmosphere was extra special. Next time I go hope to be there during regular business hours.

18.description: The Zhou B. Cafe is a unique little place to visit when you have company and want to show them a different side of Bridgeport. Fun decor, tasty sandwiches, a studio next door to wander around in. This place has its perks but like mentioned in other reviews it is small and I have only ever seen one employee working at a time. Because of this your food will take awhile.The service isn't slow on purpose but it just can't go much faster without more workers. So be prepared to have to wait in thier cool looking but not super comfortable chairs for awhile. That or spend the time by taking advantage of there being an art studio next door. When my wife and I go we make sure to look at the sculptures and paintings after we order. It's part of the experience. It also prevents us from having to sit in an empty resturant watching the guy make our food. If you go towards the evening be ready to be the only ones in there. This place is nearly abandoned by dinner time. But don't let that be a testament of the quality of the place. It's a cute little sandwich cafe spilling with artsy charm that has many reasons to visit. It's just too bad it doesn't have enough reasons for me to come back on a regular basis. P.S. Their name Zhou is pronounced "Joe" like Joe Montana. So it would be the Joe B. Cafe. I thought it was something different too but was instructed by an employee the correct way. Yes. Knowledge is power.

13.description: 2hou B brothers? Really? They are just not there, they may never be. There are so many of these contemporary followers today that attempts to make an impression. Zhou B may have made it to the States luckily... but presents freshness only to those who don't really understand the social and culture within people like the "Zhou B" brothers. The design, the package is extremely cheap.

4.description: Because it is Beautiful, because the Zhou Brothers came to my  Principal's Scholars program at UICC, and did I say because it's Beautiful! Yes, I had a sandwich and a glass of wine with an artist at the Cafe, I can't say if it was great, all I know is the whole place is beautiful and worth attending and I recommend it to all Chicago, it is a great experience.Yeye LynvonneWCSU iHeart radio

6.description: I really liked the place but I will note that my company of 4 other co-workers were not as impressed and tried to sway me to a lower star rating on here. We got there around 5:15 on Thursday and there was one table of people and a screaming baby... and I mean screaming. My first impression of the place was totally tainted by this fact. After a few minutes the screaming monster baby and family finally decided to pack it up and leave us in peace...thank you, lord. The place is a small cafe located in an art gallery... I liked the atmosphere a lot and that it's 5 minutes or less from my work also helps with the convenience factor. There was a single employee manning the entire place all by her lonesome... right off the bat we were told that they were out of all their soups- boo! Then when I tried to order a salad we were told that they're also out of all salads, then after the table ordered a few sandwiches we were told that they were out of tomatoes, and then when one friend wanted to order one of their sandwiches that touted both fruits and veggies, we were told that they were out of fruit and they didn't have that many veggies... so our menu options were VERY limited. We inquired about drinks or drink specials and the girl said that pbr was $2 and :::looks at the tap with finger moving from side to side while she decides what to call the special for the day::: Fat tire pints are $4... score! I'll take that. The sandwiches took a while and we all got them one by one since the lone girl was the only one working. It turns out that the only veggies they had were lettuce, green pepper slices, cucumber, and onion... so my veggie sandwich with cheese looked a little plain but it tasted phenom. The bread it was on was tasty and hearty, the cheese was thick and cooked just the way I like it, and the Dijon mustard layer killed it (in a good way). My sandwich with just cheese and mustard was $3.50 and it cost $1 to add the veggies and it came with delicious spicy paprika chips... I loved it. For the price and the area, I don't see how I couldn't give it 4 stars or higher... besides that they're out of almost everything. I'll defo be back, I just hope the next time they have a few more 'in stock' menu options and maybe 2 people to man the ship. Note- the server, was really nice... I don't want her getting a bad rap just because they were out of everything.

15.description: Went here for the Yelp event last night and thought it was a really nice space.  From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but the inside is all open warehouse.  Very industrial-looking with some cool sculptures and paintings. I would definitely come back here to check out the art or consider renting it out for a private party.

7.description: It was a nice venue that I visited because Tech Crunch was having one of its get togethers here. It is a little difficult for me to access given that I do not have a car and that the surrounding neighborhood is pretty scary. I would be interested in coming again at a slightly different venue and see how things go.

8.description: Zhou B. is very urban and contemporary, in it's location and the layout of the building. I recently attended the 2011 Sneak and Eat event on this past Sun.  There is rearing parking and street parking available. Once inside, you'll find there are multiple floors where you can roam through.I haven't been here to try the cafe out, but I shall return. Especially to try out some of the coffee I've been hearing a lot about.  I think this is a cool location to rent out for special celebrations and events based on the size and free parking.

3.description: This is a fantastic venue.  This building has multiple floors that house artist studios, work space, exhibition/gallery space, open floors/areas perfect for private parties, a cafe, parking lot, and more.  I've been to the Zhou B. for various art exhibitions in the past, as well as for other special events.  Third Fridays are festive and fun here - artists open up their studios, inviting the public to see their work; larger exhibitions also hang in the spacious first floor gallery space. The venue is ideal for private parties - providing open, versatile, space for any number of events (fun, casual, clubby (lights/dj), or formal).

14.description: Came here for the Yelp event and fell in love with the space. There's a cafe which is awesome and tons of amazing art on display. The best part, every 3rd Friday of the month you can hang out with the artists and see their space. I learned this talking to some artists who let me see their studio. How amazing to hear the story behind a piece of artwork from the source!

12.description: Today was my first visit to Bliss Nails; the staff are very friendly and professional. I love my no chip manicure, and I will definitely come back. The price is not bad, and they did a great job by making sure that everything is perfect (i.e. removing all of the dead skin near my cuticles, using multiple coats of polish, etc.).

7.description: I visited Bless Nails & Spa at 3343 S Halsted st and got a pedicure and the staff's are very polite and welcoming and they get the job done. It is a very clean environment and I recommend everyone to go there and enjoy the respect and work that they give.  Coachgreeno.

20.description: I visited Bless Nails & Spa at 3343 S Halsted st and got a pedicure and the staff's are very polite and welcoming and they get the job done. It is a very clean environment and I recommend everyone to go there and enjoy the respect and work that they give.  Coachgreeno.

19.description: I had excellent service at Bliss Nails. Even a shoulder massage comes with my manicure/pedicure. How good can it get?

1.description: I went back and forth with myself about whether or not I would rate this place 3 or 4 stars. I really do not like my nails, but the service was pleasant and everyone was super nice, so I definitely think they are worth checking out. Pros: Fully staffed, short wait to be serviced, extremely nice, affordable prices.Cons: No free parking, slow service, not good at shaping nails, only 1 tech spoke and understood English, had to translate for other techs.Explanation of Pros: I came in at 6pm on a Wednesday and asked for a full set and a pedicure. I waited around 7 minutes before I was seen by someone. Every single tech was kind and spoke to me with respect. I mention this because at other discount nail salons, I have been spoken to very rudely and harshly, for no apparent reason. Customer service is definitely the difference here. The salon is also clean and the tools are sanitized.Explanation of Cons: There is no free parking near this salon, which is fine, except some of the staff moves very slow. My pedicure took an hour to do, so by the time I was halfway done with my nails, one of the techs had to run and put money in the meter machine for me. This is not an in & out, quick service place. I also hate the shape of my nails. One tech started them and she didnt understand English, so another tech translated what I wanted. She still didnt really understand, so the other tech had to come finish the job, right after working on another client. There seems to only be one tech that really knows how to do nails. The others might be still learning. All in all, I will definitely consider coming back to this salon. I hope the staff can get up to speed and produce better results. Everyone is so nice and pleasant and it made for a good experience.

2.description: This was my very first time getting my eye brows waxed and my pedi and mani done at Bliss Nails. The salon is managed and run by this lovely lady name Ice. Yes her name is actually " Ice." The ladies are friendly and they do a thorough job of the pedi and mani's. I'm really happy this place opened up by my house.I did a no-chip manicure for the first time with them. So far the nail look great! I'm look forward to returning there for my services. I also would like to recommend anybody who in the Bridgeport area to check out " Bliss Nails."A No Chip Mani with a regular pedi cost $52. I would have to save up my little pennies to come here probably once every three months. I can't afford it. But for those who can than I guess that would be bliss nails for them.

9.description: Great quality service! Ladies are always friendly and remember your name. Ice and the staff always took good care of me. No complaints! Love it here and it's close to home. They also have color warranty 5 days for manicure/pedicure and 10 days for no chip. Reasonable prices. Place is clean, cozy and big and love the classical music. Great place to relax and spoil yourself. Thanks girls!

6.description: Visited this nail salon last night.  This is the third manicure I've ever had in my entire life and I am pretty satisfied.  Really cheap at $12, which I'm not sure if that's a typical price; I don't even think that the price justifies the service.  It should at least go for double the amount, but I'm not complaining.  Aside from the whole manicure, a hand and back massage was also offered.  I don't like massages, but it was included, so why not?  Everyone at the salon was friendly and they even included coupons for the next visit.  I would definitely come back if a special occasion comes along and I'm around the area.

18.description: I am so happy to see a new nail spot open in Bridgeport! The staff is friendly, welcoming, and warm. The salon is open, bright, and clean! Their polish is new and they have a guarantee on their services! How much more can you ask for?!

10.description: i'm so happy when i was got there.because I need to work at 10:30am ,and i need to made the gel full set with design . I know they open at 9:30am,but we can't use 1hour to make it done,so the lady said she can open early to help me do the nails at 8:30am..because me?!?! OMG ,they are so nice and sweet !!!

13.description: Nice, clean, new nail salon in Bridgeport! I visited yesterday morning and was able to walk right in and get a pedicure ($25). They have a special 10% off right now, and you get a card for any mani/pedis you get so that if you have 10 you get the 11th free (like your coffee shop card). This shop was opened by a former Dreamscape Nails technician, and the new tech who worked on me was VERY thorough with my cuticles. Her massage was also very good! She will probably need to learn to do cuticles a little faster, as it took about an hour total (I'm used to more of a 30-40 min pedicure process). That would be my only complaint, though. I'll definitely be back.

16.description: Very chic looking nail salon. Only went in to get my nail repaired- but I they are very attentive. The jobs they did did on the other woman who were there looked great!

17.description: I am so happy this place is in Bridgeport! The prices are reasonable, the services offered are plentiful, and the interior is clean and bright. The staff is earnest and friendly; they're very approachable and kind, and work with high attention to detail. I walked out with a big smile, and a perfect no-chip mani, regular pedi, clean eyebrow/lip wax. Will definitely be returning.

15.description: Love this place.  Got my no chip manicure and pedicure with Jenny. Service was great First time customer and so close to home. Thanks again Jenny.

0.description: I really like Bliss Nails salon. The nail technicians really go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and to make sure that you are a satisfied customer. The first thing I noticed when I walked in the salon was the open space floor plan and the warm lighting. The space was organized and not cluttered in any way. It was very inviting and made me feel relaxed and at ease.I had informed the nail technician that I would like no chip french tipped nails and eyebrow/lip waxing. As the nail technician prepped my nails to be painted, I noticed that the equipment used for my nails were sealed in a package. It indicated to me that they take cleanliness very seriously and I like the fact that they sterilize their equipment between each client. The nail technician was very gentle and did not rush the process. She took care in pushing back and cutting my cuticles. She made sure that I was satisfied with the tips of each nail before curing them under the UV light.Afterwards, she had brought me back to get my eyebrows and upper lip waxed. She made sure that all stray hairs were plucked and that my eyebrows were perfect before I left. She made sure the wax was not too hot. She was very quick and made the waxing painless.Overall, I had a great experience and will visit this business sometime in the future.

5.description: This is my second time coming in, I got an acrylic set and came back for a fill in 2 weeks later and Ici did an amazing job! The ladies that work there are so nice and take their time so your nails can come out as you want them. They have some great colors to choose from as well!

11.description: I love going here! I have been here a few times and I've worked with different technicians and they're all brilliant. They do a beautiful job.

8.description: From the very first time I started going here the woman are so sweet and take their time with your nails and toes. They know me by name and I am faithfully a happy customer of them!

3.description: First time here and I loved it I'm definitely coming back. The service was great... they guarantee their no chip polish for 10 days... they gave me a hand and back massage for free.

14.description: I've been to this place twice now and have walked out a happy girl each time! Ice does a fantastic job and listens to what you want. The first time I got an acrylic fill and the second time I got a new set out on along with a pedicure. She really took her time and made sure my nails looked perfect! The pedicure was the best one I've had in a long time. My feet felt so nice after, no dead skin, etc. I will continue going back to this place anytime I need my nails done and would recommend it to anyone!!

4.description: This was my first time here & I loved it! They were so nice & they did my nails really well! They did my nails exactly as how I wanted them! I couldn't be happier!!! I also loved the fact that after they finished my nails, they massaged my hands as well as my back & beck! I'm definitely going to be back!!! I love it!

28.description: went here for dinner with gf & kid a few weeks ago. we all got a burger & fries & we're all happy with our orders. the place is small but our waitress was very nice. there was a mistake on our bill & she fixed it with no problem. we had a gift cert. to use but we may come back again jus because its close to the crib & the food was good.

1.description: Good food. Fries were yummie and the spicy pasta I got was great. good size portions. Owners were nice enough to hold on to my credit card when I forgot it there.

9.description: Been here a few randoms weekdays for some beers, food, and sports games. Place in itself is quite chill. It's small venue with I'm assuming neighborhood folks.Beers: good selections for draft beers. Plenty for the small bar.Foods: the pizza rocks. Thin crust with just the right amount of sauce / ingredients. Garlic fries are DELISH! Highly recommended. There are food specials nightly so call in for options. I would try there other stuff also.Service: it's decent. They aren't hovering over you but not 100%attentive either. Have been friendly. No complaints.The bad: I cannot highly recommend a place when their bathrooms are cold. Sound petty? I just don't like going pee and being cold! Also, they have a door in the middle of the place as well as the comer- they should really lock that middle door in winter. At every opening you have to put on your jacket. Again, not a big spot so you do feel that draft.Would I go again? Definitely. Good time to go with a friend or two and also a date.

29.description: Came here for lunch after coworkers suggested it. I didn't even know it existed.Very small place, definitely go on off-hours and on non-game days. Ordered a burger, since it was what coworkers recommended. It was fantastically cooked, on a pretzel bun and had all these delicious fix-ins (you could add stuff for an extra charge).I asked for a side of their Parmesan-garlic fries and the waitress accidentally gave me their normal fries. Normal fries were still really good. She gave me a free giant basket of the garlic fries after I pointed out. Lately, anytime I have to correct a waiter/waitress for a misplaced order, I get them snapping back at me for me not ordering something or not ordering "correctly". First time in a long time waitress apologized and corrected the mistake without any issues. I really appreciate that.

23.description: Hat Trick!!!! Great Staff, Place and Food!!!!! Highly Recommend the Italian Burger and Garlic fries!!!!

5.description: Dropped by here on a Friday night for dinner then stayed for drinks.  The food was good and the bar itself was pretty cool.  Probably would've given it four stars if not for our bartender Eric.  He was on top of his shit and made sure we didn't have to wait around for drinks (something I don't understand why other bars aren't better at).  He was also a funny guy and by the time we left felt like he was one of our buddies.  If you go there, find him - he had a bunch of tattoos - and he'll make sure you're taken care of.

31.description: We stopped in one evening and the place was not too crowded and they only have about 20 seats in the place.  After reading about how good this place was on the reviews I thought it would be packed.  We sat down ordered a beer and some food.  The beer came and shortly after the food came which was also cold.  And no I didn't order cold food.  The bartender wasn't very nice when I brought this to her attention.  I waited and finally got what I ordered at a proper temperature.  Needless to say my experience here was not a good one.  The person I was with said their food was just ok kind of bland.  I think I'll stick with the place a block west of here (Cork & Kerry).

25.description: Popped in here for a drink one Saturday afternoon.  The bartender was a little salty, but I kind of like that!  He was super accommodating to me and my partner because we were 2 of the maybe 10 adults in the place.  The tables by the window were full of youngsters.  Like 12-15 year olds.  The bartender was not happy about this but also had no 'reason' to ask them to leave.  On a positive note I asked if they allowed dogs in their outside seating and he told me that they did as long as they were not too busy.  The menu looks good, but I've not yet tried the food.  Standard bar fare with some Italian additions.  I will be back.

12.description: All five of us ordered the " house-made burger" served on a pretzel bun with the garlic parm fries.(shout out to a nice lady walking along us on the sidewalk after the very last red socks game of the season.) we sure were happy we asked her if she knew about any good restaurants close by the ballpark. Because the flavors in this one pound hamburger were amazing and the pretzel bun put it over the top. I have to talk about the fries because they were like eating potato skins with the skins still on and atop them (if you choose) was garlic and real grated Parmesan cheese.everything was delish!our meal was served to us outside by our friendly waitress Lynn who went out of her way to give us some ideas about other great restaurants and shops to go check out while on our family vacation here in Chicago. Lynn let us know that they have $5.00 burger night on Mondays if or should i say when you go to "turtles" please tell her hi from the Webers of Las Vegas.* warning these burgers could be highly addictive!

21.description: Awesome.  Try the Meat bowl, it's my favorite.  My kids also love coming here after a game (during the day) across the street at the park.  They have a variety of foods for them that they enjoy.  Turtles is a great neighborhood bar/hangout with friendly waitresses and owner.  We've been here for lunch, dinner and for evening drinks.  It's also a great place to come to for drinks after having dinner downtown.  The outdoor patio area is great in the summer.

16.description: I was originally going to just amend my original post but seeing as how it was so brutal I figured I would just delete it and start over.My first experience here was pretty bad.  There was nothing but country music playing, the place was void of drink specials and the service was cold.  I swore I'd never come back.Fortunately I have a very good friend that lives a block a way that likes to frequent the joint.  She convinced me on several ocassions to give it another shot.  Not only did I give it another try but at this point I would consider myself somewhat of a regular at Turtles.A lot of things really turned me around here.  I've had some of the best service since my first experience.  A personal favorite bartender is Mario.  He looks just like Mac from Sunny in Philadelphia which is awesome in itself and is always up for a chat and a joke.I've eaten here a few times and the food is pretty good.  They usually have drink specials (unlike another bar down the street) and the service is always friendly.  There's a real family/neighborhood feel at this bar which keeps Bridgeportians like myself coming. All in all Turtles is a great bar!  I'm actually headed over right now!

17.description: Great daily specials. The $5 burger is soooo bomb! Buffalo chicken egg rolls are a must have! Parm n herb fries are so good. They have a vodka sauce for the pasta that is not normally on the menu but if u ask, they may have it! If they have it, get it! It's so delicious! Portions are a good size! Great for hang overs or b4 a sox game. Just beware that they are not a fully stocked liquor bar. They never have rumpleminz which makes me a lil upset. Just a standard beer and shot place but you will be blown away with the food and how reasonably priced it is!

10.description: They offer an outdoor patio that obviously opens when the weather is permitting great little place to go and sit down after an exhausting day in the office. Food is absolutely wonderful garlic parm fries, Italian grilled chicken sandwich, buffalo chicken egg rolls are fan favorites everything on their menu is awesome that's why I'd give them 5 stars! Now let's get to the service its god awful; slow, the waitress are miserable and take 87 years to get you a plastic cup of water. Water in a plastic cup what has this come too? But yet every time you see them they are always laughing and goofing around with each other and 14 year olds that are sitting at the bar! I don't know what's going on. Also their bartenders look miserable as well every time I go in there, and they take forever to get me a miller lite especially the bigger bartender everyone calls "Meech" I mean first things first is he even old enough to be behind the counter? He's always on his phone, and yelling at the servers also he doesn't know much about the products on the menu either. Overall if they had a little prep talk about customer service before they started everyday and how to speak to paying customers this would be a great place to become a regular! But ayyy turtles your doing great on your food, let's spice up your service! Cheers!..

11.description: Me and my girlfriend went here a couple of weeks ago and the food was delicious. Now this bar is pretty low key if you ain't from 'round here (bridgeport). I've mentioned it to my boys and they hadn't heard about it either. anyway, We came for beer and food and that's what we got too. I ordered a cheeseburger and it's got a big beef patty. It came with mozzarella cheese, lettuce, onion, tomato and a pickle. Now I went with the extra and got some bacon to make my burger better. And guzzled it down with Stella Artois. My girlfriend ordered pasta with meatballs. It was a big plate filled with pasta and sauce but the meatballs were just huge. Each meatball had to be 6 oz. each. The wait staff was good and attentive. Good experience.

26.description: It's not a very attractive bar. But the staff is nice, prices are ok, and it's right by the ballpark. It's a good low key place to grab a beer while waiting for the crowds to thin after a ball game. Have not had the food. Yet.

27.description: I'm afraid to write this review. I want this place to be my secret. This place near the Sox home field is small and unassuming. There is only room for me. But, it  deserves a great review. So, I am going to try to be unselfish and write one. When I come with my buddy, a resident of Bridgeport and the one who introduced me to this joint, the waitresses are always super friendly and the food is delish. I usually get the bow tie pasta with italian sausage. Mmmm! It's not fancy, but not simple tasting either. Just the right amount of olive oil, tomato and spices. Well, just plain good...like a-mama used to make! The wings hit the spot too, but I don't crave them like I do the pasta. My mouth is watering now as I write this.Haven't been here during a game or on the weekend but you can usually find a seat on a weekday. It looks like it's just a little bar but suprisingly they have a kitchen. Highly recommended.

35.description: So this place is apparently brand new - they JUST got a sign put up in front.  My buddy and I stopped in for an early dinner.  At 4pm on a Friday, they had one table just finishing a meal, and several other people scattered around the (tiny and obviously newly remodeled but still very cute) place.The waitresses were excellent (a little slow but very cordial and welcoming), and the owner came by twice to meet us and see how everything was going.  I had the pulled pork mini burgers (slightly spicy BBQ sauce, $9) which I thought were quite tasty, the buns were almost like pretzel buns which I am quite fond of!  My friend had the Italian sub - it was ENORMOUS, he ate half and half the fries and barely fit the rest in a take-out box.  (He said it was really good, also $9.)We each had a Corona, they don't have any imports or a tap (yet? not sure if they're going to get one).  The waitress thoughtfully asked if we wanted limes.  I know some people don't like them, so I appreciated the question.  The limes were the perfect size, too - not too big of slices!  ($5/ea)We came here on a recommendation and will definitely be back!

0.description: Small, cozy and totally a neighborhood bar. Couple craft beers not a big selection. Staff was helpful and friendly.

20.description: I first went to Turtles about a year ago, the only major complaint I had then was that they did not have enough pork on there pulled pork sandwich.  Well now they do.  Have had it a few times and yes they added more pork to there sandwiches.  The employeees and owner do try to go out of there way to make you feel comfortable.

19.description: Popped in here for a drink one Saturday afternoon.  The bartender was a little salty, but I kind of like that!  He was super accommodating to me and my partner because we were 2 of the maybe 10 adults in the place.  The tables by the window were full of youngsters.  Like 12-15 year olds.  The bartender was not happy about this but also had no 'reason' to ask them to leave.  On a positive note I asked if they allowed dogs in their outside seating and he told me that they did as long as they were not too busy.  The menu looks good, but I've not yet tried the food.  Standard bar fare with some Italian additions.  I will be back.

33.description: Cool little joint outside of the Cell.  We had some good food and drinks here before the game. This place is new and very clean! Neighborhood bar attitude with cool people. Stop by if you go to Chicago baseball games.

2.description: Had Monday's half price cheeseburger.  Excellent burger.  Also, got the Parmesan hand cut fries.  Highly recommend this joint...

34.description: Stopped in to Turtle's Bar and Grill on the first night it opened and found it to be a very warm and welcoming place in the neighborhood.  It is cozy with a lot of nice finishes.  The food was very good and the waitstaff was on their game.  The best thing about Turtle's is the prices...very reasonable!  The owner greeted us and went out of his way to make sure we were happy!  Needless to say...we will be back!   Welcome to the neighborhood Turtle's !

32.description: I had to double check the address of this bar a few times, because I could have sworn I was in Wisconsin. No doubt. Turtle is a nicer alternative to (rest in peace) Jimbo's. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but if you're looking for a place to grab a drink after the Sox game you should give them a try. They have a small beer list, which does not include Guinness. South side Irish FAIL!! The food menu is decent. We didn't eat but we did oogle someones garlic and parmesan french fries, which looked and smelled phenomenal. On the Sunday that we were there this place was heavy with football watchers. They had about 6 televisions broadcasting 3 different games. They also have a jukebox which someone loaded with country music. Like I said, it felt like Wisconsin (not that there's anything wrong with that.)

18.description: Walking distance from where I work I have come back a couple of times now and am always full. Great lunch spot and they have a nice little patio area too where some colleagues and myself gathered after work on e evening. The food is very tasty and I love their fries. Really nice lunch spot and seems to be a great neighborhood bar.

13.description: I really like Turtles. This is my mid-week destination when I need to come up with dinner on my own. The beer is always cold, the food is really good (the meatball sub and parm. fries are my favorite) and the bar tenders are attentive and remember you.Turtle's also has a patio facing the park for those nice days along with multiple TVs to catch the game. Those in Bridgeport appreciate the food and drink specials (unlike another bar a block away), and I personally enjoy the community events and atmosphere.5 Stars from me.

4.description: We had a school dinner thing for dressdown and i went along with the kids after a long day at work to see people waiting for their orders. Turtle employees were overwhelmed with phone orders as well. The wait staff was very sweet and honest about the times.We ordered Buffalo chicken sliders, chicken sandwich and placed an order for another chicken Sandwich over the phone which they got wrong and made chicken tenders. Food was fairly decent but nothing over the top which is expected of bar food. Will try going back on a not so busy day.

24.description: Walking distance from where I work I have come back a couple of times now and am always full. Great lunch spot and they have a nice little patio area too where some colleagues and myself gathered after work on e evening. The food is very tasty and I love their fries. Really nice lunch spot and seems to be a great neighborhood bar.

6.description: Was treated like crap by an Old Geezer bartender on Cellular Field's Polish Heritage night. Was wearing my Polish Mafia shirt and this wannabe gangster starting flexing his sagging muscles and ignoring my drink order. My old lady snapped his geriatric butt in line and ordered our beverages. I hate Turtles because of this Old Geezer. He needs to take his Geritol and wash it down with arsenic.

22.description: Very comfortable and enjoyable establishment.  Owner is on the premise frequently and all employees are friendly. Food is authentic italian food, great place to lunch   Calamari with giardiniera is delicious.  Pizza new on menu is really great.

15.description: Awesome.  Try the Meat bowl, it's my favorite.  My kids also love coming here after a game (during the day) across the street at the park.  They have a variety of foods for them that they enjoy.  Turtles is a great neighborhood bar/hangout with friendly waitresses and owner.  We've been here for lunch, dinner and for evening drinks.  It's also a great place to come to for drinks after having dinner downtown.  The outdoor patio area is great in the summer.

7.description: The locals clearly have an inexplicable soft spot for this place and it's mediocre service and menu. Because the options within walking distance to work are incredibly slim, and it's convenient for  the occasional Sox game, I've returned at least 3 other times in the past 2 years since I reviewed it the first time and gave it two stars.I keep seeing the positive reviews and I think, gee maybe I just got them on a bad day. I'll give them another chance. I also secretly hoped they'd read my previous review and step it up a bit on the service.

8.description: The hamburger sliders were tender and juicy. The calamari is just ok. Tasted salty and chewy mostly. The waitress didn't seem to be very friendly so it was really tense. No drinks menu according to her. Ordered a 312 and it was good.  Just glad at least one thing turn out well.

30.description: I was originally going to just amend my original post but seeing as how it was so brutal I figured I would just delete it and start over.My first experience here was pretty bad.  There was nothing but country music playing, the place was void of drink specials and the service was cold.  I swore I'd never come back.Fortunately I have a very good friend that lives a block a way that likes to frequent the joint.  She convinced me on several ocassions to give it another shot.  Not only did I give it another try but at this point I would consider myself somewhat of a regular at Turtles.A lot of things really turned me around here.  I've had some of the best service since my first experience.  A personal favorite bartender is Mario.  He looks just like Mac from Sunny in Philadelphia which is awesome in itself and is always up for a chat and a joke.I've eaten here a few times and the food is pretty good.  They usually have drink specials (unlike another bar down the street) and the service is always friendly.  There's a real family/neighborhood feel at this bar which keeps Bridgeportians like myself coming. All in all Turtles is a great bar!  I'm actually headed over right now!

3.description: The food there is really good. I got their chopped salad there during lunch and I was amazed and how many ingredients they threw in there. I also have tried their Parmesan garlic fries. Those are great too.One thing that ruins it for me is the service. I think the bartender and the waitresses are rude, cranky, unpleasant. This is true for all of the times I have been there. You see them smiling and joking with high school kids (they may be in college but look young), but then they come to our table and get cranky. My co-workers go here after work in the summer because it's one of two bars nearby. We like sitting outside. However, when we need more tables or drinks, it takes them a really long time to get these things. We see them attending to the table next to us promptly. I'm not sure if they have something against us, but I don't think we've done anything to make their jobs harder. We ask for the same things/service the customers next to us ask for.

14.description: Great little neighborhood sports bar. Great food at a good price. Welcoming to travelers. Lynn is a great hostess. Drinks never empty long before she was bringing another. Recommend the Italian Combo w/garlic fries. The Buffalo Chicken Egg Rolls were delicious.

3.description: "Monica Lewinsky's ex-boyfriend's wife for president" - One of the unique/clever t-shirts advertised in the window (I pass this store going to and from work everyday).  This is not the average tourist shop.  They have a more unique selection of items and high quality sports apparel/ fan memorabilia.  I have never seen so many witty t-shirts in one place!  This store is fun just for entertainment purposes or killing time before catching the train.   My favorite part of the store is their sports apparel. With my boyfriend being a big Bears/ White Sox fan, I know where I'm getting all his gifts from now on...I give this store 4 starts because they are a bit pricey, but not outrageous.

1.description: We were walking around Michigan Avenue a few years ago enjoying the summer when the items in this story caught our eye.  Lots of cute and unique items geared towards Chicago and another nonsense stuff.  I ended up getting a Chilly Willy t-shirt from here. I love it! Prices here back then were a bit high probably since this store is located on Michigan Avenue. Havent been back since we were last here, but I'm sure they still have fun stuff here since that was their specialty!

2.description: Agree with the previous reviews that this WAS a great store.  Unlike the dozen or so generic tourist t-shirt shops that line Michigan Ave., this store provided great deals on quality merchandise.  Sadly, that is no longer the case.  I went here today to stock up on Hawks post-championship swag, only to find that this space is no longer Where the Buffalo Roam, but rather a generic shop blaring loud, crappy music.RIP.

5.description: This is a really fun store!  They have a wall of hilarious tshirts... you could easily spend a lot of time in here getting gag gifts for people!

6.description: This is a very cool gift shop.  It's right across the street from the Art Institute. Alot of wacky t-shirts and Chicago memoribilia. Alot of tourists probably stop here.

7.description: Considering that it's not a huge store they have quite a nice selection of t-shirts and jerseys and similar things. They have Soccer tees, I got an Italian one there. It doesn't fit me already though, but I don't think they run small, I just eat too much. Well it's a combination of the two things probably, heh. So I need to go back soon and get a XXL one. They of course have lots of Cubs stuff which is neat. They have Capone shirts, funny shirts, and even a Thundercats shirt! They had other little touristy things but all I cared about was the shirts.

8.description: This place sells mainly t-shirts and sweatshirts, most with tourist-oriented Chicago-themes (including our sports teams) and some racy/rude shirts with slogans about such topics as smoking leaves and having your pickle held.  They also carry gag gifts such as Gummi Boobies.  That should give you a pretty good idea of the markets to which they cater...

9.description: the shirts here are hilarious. i am proud to say that i have my collection of crude remarks...they'll run u about 17 bucks tho but to me its worth every penny

0.description: No, I'm not a Chicago tourist and I also don't roam the plains with buffalo.  BUT, I do need the spontaneous sporting shirt to wear (I mean, I can't be caught in pictures in the same gear).  So, 'Where the Buffalo Roam' fits my needs.  The store is small, but they carry all of the Chicago sports teams' items.  As an added bonus, there's even a dressing room (with a door).  That's kinda' a big deal at these type of stores, just sayin'.One thing to note, the store changed its name to something else, but it's still and always will be "Where the Buffalo Roam."

4.description: I like the tees. If I don't feel like dressing up I put one on with a pair of jeans heels and designer bag & sunglasses.They have good normal day to day stuff here.

0.description: Really a great place for work clothes for the big man. The owner is really a great guy.

58.description: Great place for sandwiches, soups and salads.  Meat is included on all of the sandwiches but they will be happy to make vegetarian accommodations.  They have a theme menu; which resembles a lineup card for The Chicago White Sox.  Their sandwiches change in accordance to the visitor's team.  I had minestrone soup which was hardy and made well.  It was seasoned just right.  My date and I were able to share the Caesar Salad (without chicken) with plenty to take home.  So, the serving sizes are huge.The bar is fully loaded with domestic and foreign beers on tap.  Cork & Kerry's is newly remodeled.  I really loved the look of the place.  You have to check out the two collages made by the owner's mom.  Really nice touch.  The service was awesome.  The server made sure we were happy and she was very quick.

56.description: I had a horrible experience here this weekend.  Stopped there after the SOX game.  It was only 9:30 pm. I was with a few friends.  The waitress came to take our order and they were out of what I selected.  So she puts our friends order in and says she'll come back for mine since I have to pick an alternate.  She comes back and tells me that she got our friends order in but the kitchen was closing and its too later for me to order.  So first they don't have what i want and then they only serve half our party.  How can the kitchen close at 9:30 after a SOX game?  And how can the place serve half our table but not the other half?  The waitress herself was nice enough but this place sucks and I don't intend to go back.

29.description: The place is a small neighborhood bar that my friend and I came to in order to try their burgers. Unfortunately, the kitchen closed before we could do so. In exchange, the management allowed me to use my discount coupon towards drinks.  I didn't like how big the cups for cocktails are because when I asked for a Vodka and 7up, it was about 1 oz vodka to 7 ounces of soda. There was a party going on here, so the management apologized as well because it seemed like we'd walked in vintage taping of the show "Cheers".  I felt like a party crasher. Since this spot is near my friend's home, we're gonna give it another try, but we'll have to go early because I think food service ends at 9p or 10p.

42.description: Cork & Kerry at the Park is a Bridgeport, Chicago personal haunt!Obviously & perfectly located directly North of US Cellular Field, Cork and Kerry is ideal for the baseball season - but when the Sox are not playing, it is a lovely neighborhood spot. Not too crowded, great drink selection, awesome bartenders & waitstaff.I might be a little biased, but Cork and Kerry at the Park is stationed in my near-to-my-heart Bridgeport; close enough to walk to & from my apartment. I enjoy the undoubtedly South-Side Chicago Bridgeport feel of the bar. Cool, kind staff all-around. Nice people from the neighborhood always in & out. I also cannot turn down a perfectly-poured Guinness adorned with talent and a shamrock. I must note that their menu is excellent. I enjoy a sandwich with that Guinness on occasion... ;)

23.description: They have the Best BLT wrap ever.  I had to say that first because it is true.  As for other pub grub, it is very good compared to similar places.  Cork offers great burgers and a diverse menu. Kitchen is fast. Not a place for beer snobs but it has enough to get by for sure.  Good place to watch a game if you want to avoid the big and boring places since this will give you a great neighborhood feel. If you like their facebook page you often get messages about daily homemade specials which is a nice touch.

47.description: I really enjoy going here during the off season, when drink prices and crowds are down. Im sure its a great place to grab a few drinks and some bar food before and after a game but if im not attending a game, im gonna stay far away from that scene.iIn the off season it usually stays pretty quiet with a good mix of people. The bartenders are always attentive and friendly.Try the Irish Burger. Nice juicy burger with Irish bacon and egg served on a pretzel roll. One of my top 5 favorite burgers in the city.The Irish Egg Rolls are great too!Side note: There was a 50% off check in offer which they didn't offer claiming it was old.

8.description: It was good.  Nice staff. Group of men there with too much cologne on, but that's not the bars fault. Owned by same guys as cork and Kerry's on western in Beverly.

31.description: Sunday morning Bloody Mary's are a good way to watch the game. Their homemade mix is delicious.

34.description: I like this place period.  Honestly, had NO idea this place was here.  We've come to the  'cell a few times this year and got stuck at that other joint.  After a little search found this place and I said it couldn't be true...well it is.  Great bartenders with a good neighborhood crowd..  Welcome you in with smiles even when you're in a Tigers jersey!  Cater the specials to the visiting teams town, bigger bonus!  Food was the average bar food but still plenty and a better deal than inside. Will let you valet the car for $15 during games!  Even bigger bonus!  See you next year when the Tigers are back in town!

16.description: HORRIBLE! WORST EXPERIENCE! If there was an option to give zero stars I would. For all that are reading these reviews please note pattern of the horrible service, and discrimination that is happening. Despite it being 2015 there are horrible POS people who get off on treating people badly. The owner eye balled us since the moment we walked it. No one wanted to serve us, and the waitress took a while to decide. Some of the regulars at the bar hackled us and then assaulted my boyfriend. After this horrible experience we got kicked out. Despite doing NOTHING wrong. The manager stated he was "the law", since he didn't want to kick out his "friends". He proceeded to  tell me he was married to a Mexican to make me feel better for being kicked out. The police where called on us. Other people from the bar came out and harassed us, saying racial slurs. Police didn't do anything to help us, obviously knowing the owner of the bar. This was one of the worst experiences of my life. Steer away from a place that discriminates against anyone who isn't privileged to be like the owner.

13.description: I've been here a few times for the drinks - always a nice spot to toss a few back. The other day I came in and was feeling hungry, so I ordered the Latino. I don't think I've wished I ordered three or four additional burgers more than I did after taking my first bite. I definitely look forward to returning.

11.description: Terrible, rude service. I've never been so belittled and disrespected. Do not patronize this place!

39.description: Came by here before a game and the food wasn't bad.  I had the chicken sandwich on sourdough and tater tots which was delicious.  The place was pretty empty for a game day but chalk that up to it not being a big opponent in town.  The only gripe I had was that when we were about to pay, we showed them our Yelp check in deal and they said they didn't honor it anymore.  Well if that's true why would it still be on there.  They did give us a discount that was less than the 50% dinner deal so that kind of made up for it.  But either them or Yelp need to correct this problem soon because I know there are Yelpers out there that are less forgiving with reviews.

37.description: Went here with a few friends for my birthday.  The bartender was great (Jake).  Had a great time playing music, and catching up with friends.  Good time!

0.description: Wonderful food, my burger was perfect, the staff very nice, and my order came out within 10 minutes. Will definitely tell my family and friends. I will be back

38.description: Stopped by on a Saturday and it was slow. Understandably so, the Sox were in KC for a 3 game series and it was early in the PM.The decor is standard pub fare however the large open windows overlooking the park had me feeling relaxed before even ordering a beer.  Our food was pretty good. The burger was def. the highlight. The beef was not so memorable but OK.   I found the service to be very polite and attentive. Inspite of working through some mechanical issues, they took good care of us.  Lunch for 2 people and a couple of beers for around $20. I couldn't complain.I would come back again and I am planning on it next time I score Sox tickets.

51.description: I work near this place. Gone their on several occasions but one day the bartender/waitress was their talking to her friends and ignored me and my friend. If your a person of color (Black) this is not the place to go. They forgot that money was green and can only see Black. As much as I would like to think things have changed just a bit. This place brought me back to reality.

27.description: Worst nachos ever.So we ordered the BBQ Chicken nachos. We got a basket of dry chicken over salty Costo chips. I'm, talking no salas, no cheese, no sauce, no flavor. How do you call something without cheese nachos?They have no specials on game days and I have no incentive to return. I paid 6 bucks for a Crispin' which is 7.25 for 16oz at the beer fo the world tent inside the Cell. This bar has no personality, no competeive pricing, and no reason to visit.Skip!

32.description: Stopped in before Xmas with a friend who's from the neighborhood and what a great time we had...Bartender was cool, talkative, and everyone else was buying us shots...Outgoing crowd, fair prices, and great beer selection!

54.description: Love it.  US Cellular has needed a great place to grab a drink nearby after the game.  Now they have it. Great staff, good beer selection, good set-up.  What else can you ask for?

48.description: The cheese fries were good, but the rest of the food left much to be desired.  I get the impression that the food here is most enjoyed after 4-5 beers.  Otherwise, mediocre.

44.description: I've been here two times. And both times the food has been excellent. Cant say enough about how hard the irish egg rolls rock.The burgers are top notch.Beer prices were decent, and I cant comment on the hard stuff, as I didnt have any.It's nice that the bar is less than 2 blocks from the Sox entrance. Non game days there are no parking restrictions, so I would recommend going then, unless you plan to come here before/after a game.

24.description: Went for a fundraising event, open bar, fairly decent live music band belting out popular requests and of course the gracious owner who was so nice. Will definitely go back after a Sox game or before. Do check out this family owned Bar if you are in the neighborhood.

7.description: Worst bar ever!!! We were the only Mexicans there, and everybody was eyeballing us. Didn't care about that, service was decent. Another guy in the bar in the bar started yelling and wanted to fight me and my girlfriend and approached us and said Irish only and wanted to fight me. This was the owners friend because right after they sat him down and they told us "to get the fuck out" The management was a privileged kid who said the owners were his parents! This bar bar is a complete joke if you're anything but whit Irish (p.s. This was during Cubs vs sox, the guy at the bar was a Cubs fan.) I hope no one ever goes to this bar again!!!! Even the cops on stand by told us this was a normal thing, that we should go somewhere else. This is 2015 people!!!! These types of places should not exist!!!! Lawsuit coming soon... A COMPLETE JOKE!!!!DO NOT ENTER!!!!!!RACIST ESTABLISHMENT!!!!

49.description: There are a few redeeming things about our experience at Cork and Kerry, the beer, the Irish fries, and the service. They don't have a huge selection of beer, but it was fresh and served nice and cold.It was very loud in the restaurant. It could be that the patrons were just that loud, but it seems that the acoustics add to the effect.We had the Irish fries. The cheese sauce was delicious and the fries were perfectly fried.I had the fish and chips but substituted coleslaw and salad for the fries. The fish was not fresh and terribly over-fried. The beer batter, although there was far too much of it, had a nice flavor, but it was hard to taste because it was so over-fried. The coleslaw wasn't just ok. The salad was the absolute minimum to even be a salad (lettuce and tomato with oil and vinegar).Our server was polite and attentive without being overbearing.Despite a few good points, I can't say that I would go back again.

40.description: Only been here a couple of times since it's just a stone's throw from where I work. I have been here once for lunch and most recently for an after work happy hour. I recall having a good meal when I went for lunch and quite a hefty serving.When I came back on my happy hour it happened to be on the night of a Sox game. We were served in those little plastic cups instead of the regular glasses. The prices however remained the same. I don't think the glass v plastic conversion was consistent and probably should have been corrected in price as well. The bar was a little slow. I give credit to the guy being the only bar tender and tending to about ten people walking in after work, but I question whether they would have extra staffed on a game day for just that reason.  We were there for mostly beer and appetizers...which there wasn't too much an assortment of. If you do like apps as a meal then still consider this place because they had a several slider options.Not a bad place to hit up after work or when I'm in the mood for a burger. I hear it's what they do best.

53.description: Nice lookin' place.  A big improvement over the previous tenant. Decent looking menu.  We had the Irish Fries, which seemed better in theory than in execution.  Dubliner just isn't a cheese that's meant to be melted.  The crowd was older and friendly.  Not a lot of loud, pushy drunks.  Overall, a decent experience and I look forward to going back.One thing that bothered me...I checked-in and discovered there was a Yelp promotion.  50% off lunch or dinner if you check in.  "Great!" I thought.  I showed the bartender and she said she wasn't aware of the promotion, but immediately dismissed it, claiming it valid on game days.  Makes sense...but there was NO small print on the promotion indicating that.  I was a little peeved that she didn't even check with the manager...since she didn't even know it existed before dismissing it.  Since we just ordered two beers and fries, I didn't feel like pushing the issue, so I dropped it.  But as time goes on, it annoys me more.  Wish I has said something to the manager.

30.description: We finally visited Cork and Kerry at the Park-they had a Groupon deal going.  The place was clean and very nice.  It was too dark, had a hard time reading the menu.  Service was very disappointing, we just sat down and the waitress was right there asking what we wanted to order to eat-asked for a few minute and she went to my parnter and asked him what he wanted.  Food was average,not bad.  Will we go back, if we see a Groupon and are in the mood.

46.description: When folks come over to my side of own, this is my first choice to go for a drink. However, there are other places popping up in the area, so there may be some competition.What I like: It's a really nice place, casual atmosphere, lots of windows that are open during warm weather (which I love), rum and coke's are relatively cheap (its my drink of choice), and there is often a diverse crowd.What I don't love: The servers/bartenders aren't always attentive. I did have a few great experiences with a server, but often my friends and I have to literally wave down the bartender, even when it's not busy. Not sure if it's because I don't know them personally or that I'm not there every night. Also, the food is ok. Not great, given the prices. Finally, the beer seems to be a little on the pricey side. You'd expect those prices on the north side, but not down here. I think it's because they have fancy White Sox plastic bottles. I'll check next time to see if there are non-fancy options. Good think I'm a rum and coke drinker.In conclusion, it's a great addition to the area and I like it.

1.description: Clean south side joint. Standard bar, near Sox park with surprisingly cheap drink prices. Recommended before a base ball game. Hm. That's all I got. GO here!

55.description: It seemed to start very well and then it went downhill fast. Firstly let me qualify this by saying it wasn't the food, it was a service issue. Guess what, please bring back using a little pad to write stuff down because if you can't remember it, getting the order wrong doesn't cut it.Our order, for starters an order of cheese curds, from the starter menu. Italian fries, from the starter menu (asked to be served later with out burgers)Two burgers, medium rare we picked the side salads instead of fries since we had our special fries coming with the burgers.So it seemed to be taking awhile for the curds, I see one order go by, then another dropped at the bar and the another two tables over. When I flag down the waitress to ask, she says that she's waiting for the fries to come up with them. I asked why, and she said well the fries are on the starter menu and you get fries with the burger. I said, huh? You get fries and the side salad? I thought it was a choice. She then says, oh yeah that's right. Then I remind her that we asked for the fries with the burger.She runs off to check on things, and comes back with our Italian fries, and then informs us that they are out of the cheese curds. Okay WTH? If they weren't served to three other tables first and as our "starter" which it should have been. Then my husband points out that our fries will be cold by the time the burgers come. A bell rings in the distance and she says, that has to be your burgers. Well with that logic then what are these fries, not really the starter she thought to begin with.The thing that really tics me off more than them being out of the cheese curds and the order getting screwed up, was the way she tried to finagle her way out of screwing up the order, first she ignored that we did ask for the fries to be served with the burgers and did it again when she didn't know the menu, since you don't get fries and a side salad. Or did she forget we ordered the side salads. She tried to make me think I didn't know what and how we ordered. As someone that did the job for years, I know how to move things around on a menu. Matter of fact I don't think this is a big deal at all.It's simple, we all make mistakes, I used to be a server and I've had to do the hold your breath,  apologize, admit making a mistake, and make it right. She did none of this, I even pointed out the logic of it as we went along. No apology or even let me get you a beer for the order being so screwed up, my guess is doing this would alert the manager that someone was very dissatisfied with the service. We had a Groupon for the meal, we didn't even use it, we just wanted to get out quickly, she must have wanted the same. We did ask for the check and I wanted to finish the last of my beer, that glass was whisked away along with the basket of fries that my husband was working on.The burgers were ordered medium rare, mine had a tiny bit of pink but my husband said his was well done and even a bit brunt on the end. He went on to say he would have sent it back if all the other stuff wasn't going on. He also thought that they really weren't out of the curds, he thought they'd have to start the whole thing over again to make it right, which would mean ditching all the other food.Really too bad, I was looking forward to making this a regular spot, it's so close to home and I have two unused Groupons. Maybe I'll try them again some other time months from now, maybe she'll have moved on by then. But otherwise, once with this server was enough.

9.description: The closest bars to the IIT campus is Cork and Kerry's and Turtles. They are literally next to each other.
