Out of the two, Cork and Kerry's has the friendlier bartenders.Jackie is so cool. She knows l like fruity drinks and she'll make sure she has pineapple and orange juices on hand. Before, she wouldn't have any, so now she is prepared when she knows I'm heading there.The one thing is that this place never has the  liqueurs that you need. They have like generic or cheaper brands and the drinks do my taste the same. They'll go run down to their cellar and come up empty handed. Cork and Kerry's need to up their alcohol stock.

26.description: Attended a 2 yr old's birthday party held on a Saturday at noon.  About 30 kids and adults.  We basically had the whole bar.  The service was excellent: friendly, efficient and helpful.  The selection of food is a bit beyond typical bar food and was outstanding.  The key was that it was all very tasty and prepared well.  We had a variety of items including Italian beef, Italian sausage, pulled pork, cheese curds, boneless wings, wings on the bone and deep fried twinkles.  My only negative was I thought the twinkles would be sweeter.I will plan to go back for a bite to eat and a beer.

25.description: I tried to email them directly......Only to have all my email returned to me undeliverable. How nice...........I tried 4 times..........Guess that says it all........They do not care about their customers here in Bridgeport. Fine.......I hardly care about you either and have advised all my friends and family NOT to waste their time or money on you. maybe you should have stay on Western Ave.....

12.description: $6 dollars for a summer Shandy in a 12oz. plastic cup. Those are close to ball park prices

59.description: Ahhhh, happy hour in Bridgeport.  My coworkers decided that we needed to head out to one of the nearby establishments to 'support local businesses'.  Good choice on the part of my coworkers, I must say!  Pros:+Great corned beef and cabbage eggrolls+Yummy wings+Friendly, fast service+Hot cops galore+PBR and Old Style tallboys+Easy parkingCons:+They were outta the funnel cake+It wasn't that crowded on a Friday afternoon+A lil too dark for that early in the nightCome down to visit this place, Northsiders!  Since baseball season is over, no 'feuding' necessary!

21.description: Can't believe I have not reviewed this place yet, go here often for a great burger!!!!! My bf and I always share the Latino burger and Irish burger they r both amazing , burgers come in pretzel buns. There wings are also delicious bartender suggested the smokey BBQ with a side of blue cheese and buffalo sauce!! Amazing! The Irish egg rolls are also a must try !

17.description: Great food!!! Quality pub food and you don't have to go far to get the quality and texture of fine food:) Satisfactory in my books and I'm picky and for me to write a review should say how Happy I am to find good pub food close to home. Great place and service as well!  With a touch of chocolate chip cookies for dessert on the house should I say more....

10.description: It is unfortunate that the manager was belligerent enough to tell my friends and me that we should write a review based on our experience instead of actually trying to have a conversation. But nevertheless, this is the venue to which we were resigned. We went here after the wipeout run looking for some food and some cold beer, but were met with despicable service after waiting over 45 minutes to an hour for our food (there were 9 of us and we all ordered burgers...I think of anyone of us have been to a cookout you would realize that is an extraordinary amount of time to wait for burgers). After expressing our frustration a few times, we finally received or food, the majority of which was wrong. Then only a few minutes after receiving it, the manager returned to our table and demanded that we provide a credit card to hold our order and essentially assumed that we would leave without paying. When was the last time you were seated at a restaurant and then asked to pay for your food after you took the first bite? I won't go into the details, but every rational conversation we tried to have after that about the service we received was met with angry remarks and unnecessary condescension. We did not want to leave gratuity, (and there was nothing on the menu or signage stating that it was mandatory for large parties) but did so after the manager hailed down the cops. We had no choice since we were powerless. I live in Chicago, but am not from here so this experience has taught me what many have warned me about. It's a city of segregated neighborhoods and if you go into a neighborhood business outside of your normal jurisdiction, you will likely be met with hate and disrespect depending on the color of your skin. We were not welcome there and so will obviously never go back, but this is not the way it should be. We were a group of young, black, educated men and women who only wanted what everyone else in the restaurant received. But honestly...we never stood a chance. I have to say the tater tots were amazing, so maybe if we go back all the staff can where blindfolds so they don't know what we look like.

5.description: I've never felt so unwanted in a restaurant. After receiving slow service and no assurance that this was an irregular occurrence OR that they were sorry for the long wait time, we were then chastised for being "difficult." They chose to penalize us by subjecting us to an unfair billing policy. Nowhere on the menu do they stipulate the gratuity charge. They also TAXED the gratuity!! I also want to stress that they did NOT ask anyone in my party for their ID. No one in that group was underage BUT, aren't you supposed to ask for ID for anyone that looks younger than 30?!To sum it up, please NEVER bring your business to this restaurant. There are so many better places to spend your hard earned money. Don't spend it at a place who won't respect you and will find ways to get over on you.

3.description: WORST EXPERIENCE IN YEARS. My friends and I came here for a well deserved lunch and drinks after running a race at US Cellular Field. It wasn't even a packed house, but tables were filled. Service started out good..pitchers of beer were flowing and the food orders were in. Then things took a turn for the worse...1. Food took close to an hour to come out with no update on when we'd get it. We only ordered burgers and tater totts and a couple of chicken wraps. When asked for an update, the response was "well you guys placed a big order..." No apologies, no time estimate, no customer service. I've gotten faster service at an outdoor family barbecue. 2. More than 3 orders were messed up. 3. 1 order was forgotten altogether. When we told her about the missing order, she never brought it out. It was only after asking again about the order did our waitress (long hair, fit, dirty blond with glasses) bring it out. And was after 8 of my friends had finished their meals. And the burger came out in less than 5 minutes. Do they make burgers one at a time?4. Midway through the meal the manager came out an asked for a credit card because we had a large party. Correct me if I'm wrong, but are you supposed to open a tab for lunch? And we weren't seated at the bar.5. The manager, (bald and heavy set) added a gratuity to large party and TAXED THE GRATUITY. YES THATS RIGHT HE ADDED THE GRATUITY ABOVE THE SUBTOTAL AND CALCULATED TAX ON THE GRATUITY. The manager (bald and heavy set) was nasty with our party. When we complained, he explicitly told us to write a comment on Yelp if we have a complaint...So I did. I won't be back and you should consider other options if you come here.

35.description: I went  here for a couple beers and a burger.  The server was super friendly and suggested a beer that I absolutely loved!  The burgers were one of the best I ever had and I also had tater tots, lol.   We also tried the irish eggroll w/ thousand island (which is how the waitress suggested it) which was pretty yummy too.  Overall, we had an awesome experience and will definately be back!!!n

19.description: Can't believe I have not reviewed this place yet, go here often for a great burger!!!!! My bf and I always share the Latino burger and Irish burger they r both amazing , burgers come in pretzel buns. There wings are also delicious bartender suggested the smokey BBQ with a side of blue cheese and buffalo sauce!! Amazing! The Irish egg rolls are also a must try !

28.description: Friday afternoon Sox playing the scrubs and not one TV showing the game. No thanks.

45.description: When Cork at the Park first opened I would sing their name from the top of the smoke stacks. It happens to be walking distance from my house and quickly became my favorite bar in the neighborhood.  Since then our relationship has considerably soured.Don't get me wrong, the space is fantastic.  I love the openness that is hard to find in the neighborhood, the large windows, the ample seating that could easily accommodate a large group and the little front patio in the summer.I also can't say enough about the burger here.  It's definitely one of the best burgers I ever had EVER!  They are super juicy and flavorful and always cooked to the correct temperature.  (I usually have an issue getting my medium rare burgers to come out any less than medium well anywhere else.)  I like the latino which has pepper jack, chorizo and avocado piled on and finished with a pretzel bun.  Seriously, you MUST try this burger.Those two things aside, I have lot of problems with Cork. The main issue I have is that they NEVER have ANY specials.  I realize this is a bar near a baseball stadium but their competitor a block away manages to offer daily specials on drinks AND food. The beer here is ridiculously overpriced as it is and to not ever cut anyone a break is outrageous.  Those of us that live in the neighborhood and give Cork and Kerry our money when there's not ridiculous crowds from the games take this very personally.  We're the ones that keep this place running the other 284 days of the year. Show a little appreciation.The service is hit or miss.  A couple of the guys there do a great job but a lot of the staff is  misinformed, lazy and inattentive.  They also run out of liquor a lot.  Who's doing the inventory over there?  On several occasions I've ordered a round of shots to find out half way through them pouring it that they're out of a key ingredient.  Not everyone solely drinks Patron and Jameson guys.  Some of us like a variety.And the Yelp offer?  You can forget about it.  I was told once by a bartender that Yelp is a scam and not to trust them.  Um ... wha?????I still go to Cork quite a bit because of the convenience, the burger and the fact that I can pack a ton of my friends in there together comfortably. On an average night I definitely choose Turtles instead.  Get it together, Cork.

33.description: Ordered the irish fries which are soggy fries covered in nasty cheese and bacon. I would have given it 2 stars but its okay because its a sox bar. Go Sox!

43.description: Went to Cork & Kerry on a Groupon this summer. The food is above average comfort food.  I had a pretty decent nice sized cheeseburger.  The bar is very clean and the server was very nice with a pleasant personality.On one occasion, I took my kids here because it was early afternoon and they were raving about the char dogs.  I didn't let them sip on my beer so I can't really share their review on that.I'd definitely go back with or without kids.

2.description: Literally the worst bar in the history of bars. I wish I could give it 0 stars. I cannot believe that in this day in age there are people that call themselves decent human beings while being blatant, bigoted assholes. The owner of Cork and Kerry and his cronies seated at the bar are these people. I went there about a year ago and had mediocre food and service. But recently, my friend had one of the most humiliating and terrifying experiences of her life, simply because she is a Mexican-American that decided to eat there during a baseball game. The cops were even called on her and her boyfriend for doing absolutely NOTHING WRONG!!! And I can see from many of the other reviews below that she is not alone in this experience. Whatever race you are, and especially if you are white, do not support this disgusting excuse for an establishment. If you do, you are supporting a racist place that does not deserve good people's business. And you are validating behavior that is unacceptable from anyone, particularly the owner of a business.We can do better than this, Chicago...

18.description: Pretty bad customer service...especially for someone who lives in the neighborhood.  Thanks Jake. I'll never be back again! Now I know why everyone goes to Turtle's.

41.description: This place is beautiful though i was not impressed by the food.  I will try it again though.

52.description: Found this by accident when parking for a Ballgame in lot A (usually park in "F" lot). Had been to the Western Ave C&K many a time. Stopped by on Memorial Day. Sadly the kitchen was closed, but we had the place and the Jukebox almost to ourselves. Clean nice place with some of the best bathrooms you'll find in any bar in or NEAR Bridgeport. Tap selection was great, though when I ordered a Guinness, the keg had run out. The Barkeep bought us a round for our inconvenience (5 minute wait), a classy move. We'll stop back when the grill is open and update this review.

50.description: HOLY SHIT...this was Jimbo's!??  You'd never know it.  Growing up on the South Side I am all too familiar with Cork and Kerry so I was stoked when I heard about this location opening.  The inside is small but very nice and cozy just like a typical Irish bar.  There are lots of historical pictures on the wall which I enjoyed looking at.  The bartenders are friendly and attentive and they have PBR tall boys!  The menu looks fab and the bartender said the food was really good.  Unfortunately we had just eaten so we couldn't take advantage of the food.  This is a great place to pre-lube before the game, especially because you don't have to pay 8 bucks for a beer.  Next time I'm going hungry!

4.description: I will never go back to this establishment and neither should you! Never have I felt so disrespected by bar/restaurant employees. Not only was the service horribly slow but the staff was rude. 45 minutes after placing our order, I asked how much longer the food would take and was told "I honestly have no clue". She went back and checked and then came back and said "yeah, we have no way to guess". When we continued to ask questions, the waitress simply walked away without answering. When the orders came out nearly an hour after we ordered, most were wrong and one was completely forgotten about, even after asking several times.  Given the rude behavior by the waitstaff, we determined as a group that only a small tip would be given. After we had eaten our food, we were told that due to our party size, the tip would automatically included but no where on the menu or written in the bar was there a mention of a mandatory gratuity charge, which is legally required. When we tried to talk to the manager, we were given no sympathy for the horrible service and told that we had to pay. Upon receiving the bill, we noticed that the gratuity was MANUALLY added to the bill (above the subtotal line) therefore making at apparent that this is not a normal charge. I have gone here as a group before and even recommended it to others but never again will I go and I will make sure that anyone I know never goes here either.

6.description: Dear Cork and Kerry (and Jake C., the Ill-informed Drum Major of Foolishness),As a member of this 7/25/15 party, I think you're funny... for thinking that terrible operational planning on the part of the proprietors of this establishment (having one server for a packed restaurant is a) not the customers' fault or problem b) displays a lack of operational skill that goes hand in hand with bad service).. being charged for terrible service where 8 of 10 placed orders were incorrect.. took over an hour to receive the total our order (and we're talking burgers and fries here)..realizing that the transaction is going downhill and in the middle of our exorbitantly long wait, proceeds to ask us for a credit card to hold for the bill (at a TABLE where we were all sitting for the duration).. an improperly applied service charge policy that was not displayed.. and the bill was paid with the exception of a fee that is directly associated with a satisfactory level of service. Oh, and the food was mediocre, at best.Gratuity, and especially not 21% gratuity, is not required for bad service. It is actually, by definition, a reward for satisfactory to exemplary service.As a customer service professional, I would be appalled to learn of customers of mine having such an experience.It's funny that you're ignorant to the fact that disparate treatment due to race and stereotypical preconceived notions is something that actually happens in real life. It's not your fault.. maybe. Please take a look at my picture so if you ever happen to pass by me on the street, then you know what I look like, you can wave at me, and know that I'm not hiding behind an internet persona.. and let's be frank, you wouldn't have the paid it, either.. sit down.

22.description: Owner Mike and server Sarah were excellent.  We left feeling like we made new friends.  Drinks were priced great and delivered cold and quickly.

15.description: Worst nachos ever.So we ordered the BBQ Chicken nachos. We got a basket of dry chicken over salty Costo chips. I'm, talking no salas, no cheese, no sauce, no flavor. How do you call something without cheese nachos?They have no specials on game days and I have no incentive to return. I paid 6 bucks for a Crispin' which is 7.25 for 16oz at the beer fo the world tent inside the Cell. This bar has no personality, no competeive pricing, and no reason to visit.Skip!

57.description: I went on a Saturday afternoon to this bar down the street for lunch with my brother.  There were few people there, so the one server was more than able to give us the attention we deserved.  Everybody enjoyed the food - burgers and wings went around the table and all were full.  I had a 1/4lb hot dog (not Chicago style as it was the visitor's menu) which delivered a delicious punch.  Great presentation as well.  Not a place I would travel to, but a good option within walking distance of home.

20.description: Nice place to have a beer before a game. The burger was good, I didn't care for their wings. Some of them were undercooked and the dressing they were calling blue cheese was not real blue cheese dressing....

36.description: Before I even get started I am going to tell you that you must order an irish eggroll.  They are small, they are tasty.  When it's just the two of us, one is enough to split.  For me it is the perfect bar-food appetizer... and I don't even like cabbage.  Now that I've said that, I can give you a more standard review.  I am not a fan of sports bars, per se, but I do love good bar food.  I rate sports bars based on certain criteria:Food - Outstanding.  Great burgers, with creative toppings.  You will need an extra napkin.Sides - Ok.  Good fries, but not exciting.Service - So/So.  I have gone from excellent to terrible service in the same visit.Beer - Cold and wet, but not much to choose from.Vibe - The music is too loud and generally terrible (modern pop and rock) and I've never really been when there has been a crowd so I don't know how that is.Restrooms - Clean, convenient.Value - Average.Funny story, one afternoon we walked over to the bar a few hours before a Sox game.  The place was not full (yet) so we had no problem getting a seat.  As we are sitting there having our burgers a local came up to try to sell us parking.  We explained that we lived nearby and did not need parking.  He insisted that we take his number anyway... whatever.  The server later came upto the table to inform us that he did not work there and was not affiliated with the bar.  I asked the obvious question, "why is he allowed to approach your customers."  Her answer, "I don't know."

14.description: This place is the perfect stop before a Sox game. Or just a nice friendly pub to eat at. The burgers are amazing. And the tater tots were perfectly cooked. I asked for a medium burger and it came out nice and juicy perfectly cooked. Friendly staff and reasonably priced for the area.

1.description: I bought something from them on eBay and they stole my money.  Item was not as described and they had me file a claim with FedEx.  FedEx paid the claim, but they told me FedEx denied the claim.  When I confronted them, they refused to refund money and wanted me to pay to ship item back.  Worst online experience I have ever had.  Be careful.

0.description: A really unique shop with super nice people. Stock is never the same twice!

58.description: In an area with a ton of Mexican places - this one stands out. Quality food - not greasy at all and fresh ingredients.Friendly people. Clean and large area to sit in.Fast and great food!

56.description: I'm confused. I've read a lot of these reviews and most of them are pretty awesome. Are we all talking about the same restaurant? I don't see it. My wife and I come here maybe once a year. It's not a tradition or anything but we like to support our neighborhood and it just takes us about a year or so to want come back to this place to give them another chance to improve and get better. They never do. Their meats, not mattering which one I choose, are always underseaoned and pretty flavorless. I think the Al Pastor torta I had one time was the closest thing I had for something to be okay but nothing that had me craving to come back. In general their meat, beans, and rice, in whatever vehicle I choose to put them in, are always bland and plain. Putting on their hot sauce they give you at the table doesn't really help much either. The blandess just burns more. Yes, their eating area is well lit and clean, employees are nice enough, and they do serve RC cola and Cherry RC cola in fountain form which is fun, but those qualities don't really mean much when the food is so forgetable. Maybe I've been eating at Chipotle too much but I've just gotten accustomed to my mexcian food having flavor. But what do I know? They're many reviews here that rave about this place so I'm probably just a little confused. Or not. See you next year Tacos Erendira.

29.description: Great place... food is consistent and inexpensive.   I usually order for delivery and the food comes quick.   At times the food can be a little dry but after putting some green sauce on it... perfect.  Nice Bridgeport restaurant that I definitely recommend.

42.description: this restaurant is close to where i stay at and i do eat mexican food quite often... i have just finally gave this place a try since most of the time i go to san jose down the block.. taco erendira is pretty big inside compare to most mexican restaurants i went to.. oh and the place seems pretty clean too.. the service was average like most places..i ordered a taco dinner and the fresh limeade.. the limeade tasted bitter! ain't it suppose to be sweet and sour?! the taco dinner was a little below average i must say... the meat was lacking in flavor.. i basically only enjoyed eating the rice and beans from my meal...i will stick to san jose for mexican food around the area.. this place is more expensive and doesn't taste as great..

23.description: Oh Taco E, how I love thee. Quality delicious food is what you get here every single visit. Carry out, dine in or delivery it doesn't matter it's always wonderful. The steak quesadillas are my absolute favorite. I'm also a huge fan of cheese, and this quesadilla isn't like your run of the mill quesadilla. This is on corn tortillas, the size of a taco and just filled with wonderfully seasoned steak and the cheese along with tomatoes and lettuce. It's amazing. Their chicken is always so moist, never dry and packed with the most wonderful kick. I don't have a single complaint about this place. Just love. I've tried it all. I've been here hundreds of times and can't imagine why anyone wouldn't want to eat here.

47.description: Since moving from Pilsen to Bridgeport, my taco options within walking distance from my apartment drastically decreased--a problem which continues to tug at my heart strings.  In any case, after trying a good majority of the taquerias in the Bridgeport, I have come to the conclusion that Tacos Erendira is THE place.  Their menu is fairly standard: tacos, tortas, burritos, tostadas--just pick your meat.  I've had the carne asada, which has the yummy caramelized ends that are essential in a good taco.  The option that I have discovered to be unique is the addition of the chile relleno as a filling.  Chile relleno torta?  Yes, please.  They sear the chile, so the cheese oozes and gets a nice crust on it.  Amazing.  Chile relleno tostada?  Don't mind if I do.  There are some misses on the menu: the horchata can be a bit watered down and the tamales are not as flavorful as others.  However, this will be my new go-to taqueria.

8.description: Alert.....Price increase. Co worker went to pick up and cost increase dramatically!!Chile relleno taco, previous cost $2.50 and now is $3.50. Burrito was $6.00 and now $7.00. Beans and chips went up $.50. And it's not cook to order. Go elsewhere. Not returning!!!

31.description: Very good food!!  I would go there more often if they took credit/debit cards, because I am not spending $2.00+ on ATM charges every time to take out cash to pay.  Also, I wish they offered vegetarian refried or whole beans.  Nevertheless, I definitely recommend this place. Yum!

34.description: anyone who says san jose is better then erendira is puffin crack.  san jose is filthy.  erendira is the polar opposite, clean and sanitary.  plus, the sheer amount of real estate speaks for itself.all the usual suspects (tacos burritos etc.) are executed well, but the highlight of erendira for me is the chips & salsa.  the salsa is sooooooo fresh.. every time.  i basically could drink it.

16.description: I think this place is pretty legit. I always get the quesadilla dinner and love it. My boyfriend likes the cakes they have for dessert too. Fast and friendly service.

13.description: Eh not great but not terrible either. A bit pricery. My dad and I ordered 2 tortas and it was 17 dollars... The tortas were okay lacking a lot on the meat side and heavier on the fillers. I asked for avocado and they didn't have any. I probably wouldn't go back there. We went because it was open

11.description: Not a bad place for good greasy tacos. I tried the chicken enchiladas (really chicken tacos with cheese melted in) and they were pretty tasty. I can see coming here late at night for a quick bite to eat.

39.description: This place is the worst. It is totally overpriced and not good at all. My son left his entire torta because the meat was too tough to even bit through. After a year of disappointing trips, we are really done with this place. Go to San Jose or get tacos in the back of Martinez store.

37.description: The bad news? Their refried beans are not veg friendly (lard) and they are cash only. The good news? It's cheap and you can still get avocado tacos or burritos if you are vegetarian. Not fancy,  just regular iceberg lettuce and corn tortillas, but yummy and fast. The avocados are always fresh and ripe. Tacos Erendira is on my Mexican food rotation in Pilsen/Bridgeport. I don't know if it's worth the drive if you live far, but it's definitely a "if-you're-in-the-neighborhood" place. Also, though it's metered, parking is always available when I go.

0.description: I need to start this off by saying that my experiences with Mexican food are very limited. So if I seem confused by certain things, that's why. I have been to Mexican restaurants occasionally, but I have a lot of trouble telling the difference between things. It all seems to be "flour tortilla filled with stuff." I am not culturally insensitive. I am just inexperienced.Tacos Erendira is a Mexican restaurant that probably serves genuine Mexican food. But I don't have enough experience to say that it really is genuine.First of all, the place is cash only. Which bugs me. But maybe you don't care. They do have an ATM inside, but I had cash, so I don't know what kind of fee it carries. I ordered the combination plate. It consisted of three things. One was an enchilada, one was a tostada, and one was a tamale. At least according to the menu. It also had refried beans and rice. The rice was good and well cooked. That I can judge. I know good rice. And the meat and various innards of the foods were tender and flavorful. Everything was very good. One of the things - according to my research, the tamale - came wrapped in what was clearly a corn husk. This is not something I knew was a thing. So, be warned that some items may be contained in inedible matter. Fortunately, I had a good connection on my smart phone and was able to research whether I was supposed to eat the corn husk. If you have an unreliable internet service provider, you might want to give this place a pass or do some research beforehand about what parts of what foods should not be eaten. In addition to my plate of food, they also brought me two bottles. One contained green fluid. One contained red fluid. I don't know what those are called, but I can say both are spicy. The red one is less spicy. The green has no flavor apart from being spicy. I did not care for either one, but I'm not as tolerant of spicy foods as I used to be. Call me a wimp, but I've gradually come to the conclusion that I don't want food that hurts my mouth to eat.Long story short: if you are looking for food that tastes good and includes meat options like steak and chicken and ground beef and includes flour tortilla and various vegetables and sauces, you'll probably like this place. Especially if you like occasionally being surprised by some of your food being hidden inside inedible stuff like a birthday present. And if you like red and green spicy fluids, you'll probably also like this place. But, if you're looking for an authentic Mexican food experience, I really don't know how you'll feel. So maybe check another review by someone who has eaten far more Mexican food than I have.Oh, side note. This doesn't detract from the restaurant at all, but it's an odd detail I have to mention. There is a LOT of space in the restaurant. I mean, half the place is filled with slightly mismatched furniture that looks okay together. But there is also a lot of open, unused space in the middle of the restaurant. It seemed weird. And the hallway in the back that leads to the bathrooms is also really long and passes A LOT of doors. It just seems like the restaurant is way bigger than it needs to be. If you are slightly agorophobic, you might prefer a cozier experience.

38.description: My wife introduced me to this place years ago and it's our "go to" for tacos in Bridgeport.  We typically order the taco dinner which is 3 tacos, rice and beans.  I can't say enough good things about the chicken, steak and ground beef.  The green sauce that comes with it is very HOT...which is exactly how we like it.  The chips and salsa are very good as well and worth ordering.  Haven't really ordered anything else from here as we just stick with the tacos.

51.description: Yet another restaurant in Chicago that takes only cash and doesn't have a sign up that says they only take cash. They have signs up for just about everything else...their 40th anniversary, where to order, and a sign up for their sale of the world's finest chocolate. Posting a sign gives me a choice as to whether or not i want to use your ATM that charges me a fee versus placing my order and having to walk over to the ATM and back to the register.I was not too impressed by their tacos or tortas either.

27.description: Good, solid Mexican restaurant.    Family owned, so the service is good.   Reasonable prices for quality food.   FYI, they only do cash and no credit cards.

32.description: Pretty tasty and reasonably priced. Not a lot near my workplace in Bronzeville but luckily they deliver. I stopped in once and the dining room was large and very clean. Right across from the Disrtict police station on Halsted in Bridgeport, there's lots of metered parking nearby, but if you're taking out a quarter or two should do ya.

54.description: Best taqueria in Bridgeport, hands down.Why go to Taqueria San Jose when you can go to Erendira? Their taco dinners are awesome, as are their burritos. I've yet to have a bad meal there. My friend got some enchilada thing once also (I think it was an enchilada... She just asked for the best vegetarian dish and that's what they brought her) covered in cheese which was delish. The chocolate cake is alright too. A little dry, but the frosting is fantastic.Anyways, it's your cheap, local taqueria. With awesome food. And lots of seating! And they're really quick to bring out your meal.Two things I would change: the salsa verde is SPICY. I don't do spicy. They should have a milder option. Secondly, they should be open til 4am like San Jose so I never have to eat a crappy taco dinner in the wee hours of the morning...

48.description: If I were to describe this restaurant in one word I would say, awesome. Of all the Mexican fast food restaurants I've tried in Chicagoland this has been the best. The food is out of this world and the restaurant is extremely clean. I will be back sooner than later. Thanks to previous reviews or I would have never found this restaurant.

44.description: The food is decent and fairly priced. I came here ritualistically mid-dog walk once a week for about a year until, just recently, I was told that I would have to wait outside. I have a 10lb papillon with service dog tags that I simply carry with one arm, and I am literally just picking up a carry-out order rather than eating it inside the restaurant. But despite me telling them that it is illegal to refuse admittance of a service dog, AFTER I paid for my order, I was told to wait outside in the rain for it to be finished. I'm not the type of vindictive dick to actually report them and watch them go under because of a 6 figure fine, but I've taken my taco money to any choice of the 10 other places within a 4 block radius.

24.description: The food is really good. The beef tacos are my favorite! Prices are a bit high but you pay for quality. All around great family restaurant. I eat here all the time. Highly recommended! Go get some yummy food!!!!

7.description: Ate tacos here last week and paid $1.75  per taco. Ate here today and same order was $2.50 pet taco. I'm boycotting this place again for an indefinite period. Ripoff

49.description: Tacos Erendira, is located close to our house, so we naturally want to try the local eats in our neighborhood. We did take out. My husband had their tacos, and I had their enchilada entree. My husband said he did enjoy their tacos, but he found the food to be rather pricey for Mexican food.As for me I found my enchiladas as a whole to be tasty but bitter. I wasn't able to finish my meal and I left the table feeling hungry. If i wasn't bitter I would've enjoyed it more but yeah that did it for me. Sorry not the place for us, we will be searching else where for good enchiladas and tacos.

40.description: Quesadillas.  Something about Erendira quesadillas.  Ground beef quesadillas at that!  Why rave about a quesadilla, you jest?  Because they have the perfect layer of grease on the outside, not some floury bulls*it with a smattering of conservative cheese.  These quesadillas rock!  For the dainty "I hate grease" peeps, this isn't your place.  But if you want flavor and some of the HOTTEST green sauce you may ever experience, this is your place.  And I mean HOT!  And I love HOT sauces!  Peace.

53.description: The last time I went to this place , I hate to say the Taco was dry, unlike an authentic Taco it was like someone is trying to remove the oil from them. Not a good move.

30.description: Still good, however be aware no more loading zone parking in front. It's feed the meter time.  Apparently the other restaurant's clientele were using the spots.

46.description: I love this place!  They have great food at a reasonable price.  My husband and I have been coming here for years and have had only great experiences.  My one complaint is that they only take cash (which for a small business, I completely understand), but there's no indication that that is the case until you have placed your order and try to pay.  They really should post a sign on their exterior facing window or at the very least, on their cash register.

1.description: Name me a restaurant which makes Mexican food and it's ALL great and I'll retract my 5 star rating.  Trust me, I won't be retracting my 5 star rating...  we all have different tastes and some restaurants just make certain dishes better.... Been coming here since I was a little kid when their location was on 35th Street.  Go-to dishes include: pork toastada, chicken enchiladas, chile relleno taco, chicken taco, beans and chips with a little extra chili powder added, rice with pork sauce or rice with chicken juice - ALL excellent!  Amazingly consistent throughout the years.  There was one time when the fat on the pork wasn't being trimmed away - I mentioned it to one of the owners - next time I went and since then, no longer an issue with fat on the pork.Definitely a recommended location for excellent Mexican food.  Friends of mine have gotten trays of their food for their kid's parties and the consistency was there - excellent!Keep up the great effort Tacos Erendira!

55.description: Had the Steak Taco dinner. Comes with 3 tacos with rice and beans. I've been here about a dozen times in the last 4 years. Can't complain, good food, good service and Clean.

9.description: Really great food, fun atmosphere, not expensive. Also, they take credit cards now!The Carne Asada (steak) taco was juicy and lean, and everything was tasty.

26.description: 1 flauta is not 7.25..how much for 1 flauta

25.description: I would give this place a 0 star if I could. I asked for three avocado tacos.  Instead I get an avocado taco with some steak in it.   As someone that's been a vegetarian my whole life, I'm very fucking mad. But that's not were it stops. I call to let them know of their error. Obviously, I'm mad. The girl on the phone, however, raises her voice at me and starts giving me attitude telling me how I should speak to her and how I should feel.  I would've liked it if she just apologized and found a solution for the situation. She should not be working in a restaurant.  All I know is this place does not care bout people's food preferences. Do not recommend to vegetarians/vegans/people with allergies. Customer service (rate: 0)Food preparation sucks ( rate: 0)Food (rate: 2)

12.description: Came here with some co-workers and was  pleasantly surprised with the quality of tacos & chips and salsa.  You could easily miss this place as the sign is not very visible from the street.  I ordered the chicken tacos and they were fantastic with the hot salsa and guac.  For $2.50 a taco you really can't go wrong.  You also get a choice of hot or mild salsa to put on the tacos which I highly recommend.The food came out very quickly during the lunch rush also.  One key thing to note about this place though, is that they absolutely do not take credit cards.  I was not prepared for this as I basically never carry cash, and one of my co-workers had to spot me.  Oh well.  Anyways, I'd definitely try this place out.  Two tacos for lunch is a good amount, maybe three if you're super hungry.

59.description: I have been going to this restaurant since they was on 35th st. Not only is the food grrreat so is the customer service. I moved out of the city and the travel here is like a mini road trip,but well worth the trip. I love the rice w/ pork gravy,enchiladas,nachos, and etc lol. You never know what local celebrity you may break bread w/ here (First 48 missing detectives for example). Once you get a taste of this ethnic food and loving family establishment you'll be hooked!!!!!!!!!!

21.description: I went back to Tacos Erendira on a recent visit to Chicago. I used to eat there regularly 30 years ago. They have moved into a much larger location on Halsted that has a sit down dining area. The food is much like I remembered. It is simple Mexican food but very tasty. The corn tortillas are very good and the shredded chicken tacos are wonderful. The tastes I remember from years ago are still going strong in Bridgeport. I will definitely stop by on my next visit to Chicago!

17.description: I like to try new things, but the chicken quesadilla is so good! Horchata is available, good food, good service and good for groups. Not sure if they take reservations, but I've never had a problem getting a table.

10.description: I've been going to Taco's Erendira since they opened when I was a teen. That's many moons ago and I've already loved it. I have since moved out to tinley park so once in awhile I go out of my way to get some food to go from there. Always good and just the same reheating on the micro till this time. I went and doesn't $30 on myself to take home good food and I'm disappointed. The chicken want the same, v the pork want the same and the tortillas were hard. So unusual. Meant was dried out, I've always loved the flavor. Not sure what happened here. New cooks or something?

5.description: I been coming to this place for over 30 years and I never been dissapointed. Most of the time I order to pick up but sometimes I do stay and eat there.Tacos are great. Burritos are delicious. Food is not greasy and the flavors have been the same since I was a child. Everything is always clean and they make your food fast. Will keep coming for 30 years more.

3.description: An overcooked tamale and very dry enchiladas made my first taste of Mexican food in Chicago kind of a bummer. Next time I'll try San Jose Taqueria just down the street.

35.description: I live in Bridgeport so this place is convenient and affordable.  The burritos are a good size for dinner.  I always get the steak burrito.

19.description: I was disappointed. I visited Tacos Erendira and bought 4 different tacos: al pastor, steak, chicken, and fish. The chicken taco was the best, but none of them tasted fresh. The fish taco tasted like a processed gortons fish filet. The al paster was not off of the spit grill as it traditionally is. The steak was bland and nearly dry. None of the food tasted well salted/seasoned. Unfortunately, I will not be returning.

28.description: The pork stew tacos are the Bomb!! Very unique, super tasty.

45.description: Simply put, I am not impressed with this place and have never been a fan throughout the years.  I recently tried them again with two others dining with me and again, not impressed.  The place is clean  looking.  The staff seemed very bored with the ordering process.  The first young woman that helped us was okay but clearly was not aware of how to be more attentive.  To be fair, when I went back up to the counter to get another can of Diet Coke, the second woman that helped me was genuinely engaging and nice.  I ordered a chicken burrito dinner.  Nothing spectacular.  The beans were good and the rice average.  The disappointment was with the chicken - tasted boiled and that's fine but the additional lettuce, tomato, onion and cilantro did nothing to excite it further.  The hot sauce that they gave was your standard hot sauces.  The lack of chips and salsa as a complimentary item (and the cup of soup that a lot of places also give) really kind of surprises me.  The prices are higher here and I would think that they would be able to do that.  The presentation of the food is boring.  La Mexicana on 35th and Halsted at least puts a little effort into making it look like they cared about what they were serving you.  My sister had a steak burrito and the lettuce and tomato that she wasn't sure she received (the girl asked me what I wanted but neglected to ask my sister), was added very sparingly.  She did say that the steak was good enough to make up for it being a total disappointment.  My father head three steak tacos and he basically stated that it was average also.  It was his idea to go there so...  :}The soft drink selection was sub-standard.  I mean, if you like RC Cola and Diet Rite as the major cola options.  To get the Diet Coke, you can't get it from the fountain like the other drinks, you have to buy a can.  Minor quibble, I suppose and the fact that, if you like those drinks, you can get more from the fountain, that may please some people.  At most other places in the neighborhood, you have to buy by the can also and no fountain option at all.  I know a lot of people seem to like this place but I cannot figure it out.  So, I will let them eat there in peace and avoid coming here in the future.

33.description: Good, authentic, Mexican food. Super reasonable prices too!!!

43.description: I started writing this review a while ago but got distracted and never finished.  What I do remember is a clean and spacious restaurant with pretty decor and unremarkable food.  Nothing really had any flavor and none of it was good enough to come back for, much less recommend to anyone.Spend your money somewhere else.

2.description: Tacos Erendira serves pretty generic Tex-Mex style food in a bland restaurant that is accented by quirky knickknacks.  I generally go for the taco salad.  The steak is well seasoned, but the tomatoes are flavorless as are the refried beans.  A bit pricey for the quality, but it's convenient so we go more than we should.

18.description: Great spot! I'm absolutely obsessed with the enchiladas. Wish I lived closer so I could go more often =/

41.description: Good tacos fast delivery, but only takes cash, that's inconvenient!!

52.description: 4 1/2 stars!!!Best tacos in Bridgeport. The chicken tacos are amazing. The al pastor tacos are the best. Flautas are big, 2 tortillas 1 flauta, yum! And the steak quesadilla are cheesy. Try it you'll love it.

50.description: Tacos are good here...not as good as they used to be before they moved to their current location...but still good.  The tomatoes arent always desirable (even in season) and the guacamole could be fresher.  Otherwise, pretty good tacos.

4.description: A bit pricey. We ordered the burrito dinner. The steak was very well seasoned and very tender and had a great taste. The chicken burrito was very disgusting both of us did not like it. The chicken reminded me of canned chicken that you find in a grocery store or maybe boiled,  but it had a very weird taste and did not belong in a burrito. We also ordered some horchata which tasted water down. All of this was $20.

6.description: Love this place! I don't know what they marinate the chicken in but it is awesome! Every time!

22.description: The tacos are really good for the price, I dont usually order stewed pork but did based on the reviews and they were tasty! It was a good choice.The pico de gallo (salsa) is great! Be careful of the green sauce if you dont like spicy.

15.description: I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. You have to pay before you get your food (an unprofessional practice in my opinion, but fine). But then the difference between quality and cost is staggering. I would at least steer clear of the $6.50 nachos.$6.50 is a fair price for nachos, to be sure. It is not a fair price for eight chips covered in a 1 mm layer of beans (that are as hard and dry as the chips) covered in a layer of what appears to be Kraft singles. Then canceling the order isn't really an option if you already gave the place your cash.It is also worth mentioning that when you order water - as people tend to do in restaurants - you are provided with a cup hardly taller than a standard pepper shaker. You'll either need a much taller glass to wash down the food or have to make many trips to their water cooler.

57.description: Chicken quesadillas are amazing!

20.description: I was disappointed. I visited Tacos Erendira and bought 4 different tacos: al pastor, steak, chicken, and fish. The chicken taco was the best, but none of them tasted fresh. The fish taco tasted like a processed gortons fish filet. The al paster was not off of the spit grill as it traditionally is. The steak was bland and nearly dry. None of the food tasted well salted/seasoned. Unfortunately, I will not be returning.

36.description: The chicken tacos are awsome! And the caldo de pollo (chicken soup) definitely hit the spot on a cold winter night

14.description: Very disappointed. The chicken was soggy and taste like water. The steak was overcooked and not seasoned. Every bite was disgusting. Never going back

28.description: Good food, good prices.  Gotta love it.

1.description: At one time, the stretch of Halsted St between about 32nd and 35th St had at least 3 good old fashioned burger joints. The economy and gentrification have forced out all but one: George's. That's no coincidence. Not only is this place one of the last remaining neighborhood burger joints in a city over run with national chains, it is one of the best. Between the amazing food, more than fair prices and even friendliness of the staff and "we're all friends here" environment you feel after about 5 minutes of being there, I can't recommend this place enough. Burgers, hot dogs, gyros, you name it and they can serve it up with the best of them. There are plenty of other places in Bridgeport to get a burger but this one will always be my first preference.

9.description: The girls think they are so cute. They don't write your order down...then get it wrong...you don't realize till you get home. It's so you gotta check your order before you leave.

29.description: Great food, fast! Great job!

23.description: nothing special about this joint.. the food is just eh, but i got to say that their gyros here is pretty good and is the only thing probably worth ordering. the meat pattys in their burger is horrible, taste like the frozen ones that you can buy at jewels. when i went in there, the tables was dirty and sticky too so i just brought it home and eat instead. i dont think i will come back here again unless im around the neighborhood and craving for a gyro or something.

5.description: Awesome Gyros and I do mean awesome.

31.description: I really like Georges. I have been eating there since like before my son was born. They were located a just a little north down the street then. This hot dog place gives you alot for your money. Besides that, they also serve really great soup and salads. Not to mention breakfast. The gyro plate is HUGE! And it's served on a fancy dinner plate, not a plastic basket, or a styrofoam plate. Their chicken sandwich special is great. and cheap too. Theor grilled chicken sandwich is even better. The people who work there are very nice, hardworking, and they make the food so extra delicious and fast that I have never had to complain about and order ever. My son used to go to his Tae Kwon Do classes with Georges granddaughter. They also have some video games on the premises which my son likes. If you want salt or kethup on your fries, there is a nice platter of huge salt shakers and huge plastic ketchup bottles up front. Just grab them and go. Too cool. I recommend this hot dog place to anyone even if you don't live in the neighborhood. Remember, order the Gyro Dinner plate. you will not leave hungry.

25.description: Love the soups, every day they have different ones. The only problem is sometimes they run out. The girls that work there are great very family oriented, good girls. I go out of my way to go there, prices are very low as well!

12.description: Ordered the gyro sandwich and fries, big on portion.Never a disappointment,  all the specials are great. Burgers, hot dogs and etc.. Staffs are very friendly.

37.description: The place is a basic fast food place/burger joint/pizzeria. But you get a lot for a the low prices here. The portions are really good too!Everything here is about better than average for a fast food/greasy burger place. Its all prepared quickly and properly. If you need food in a pinch, stop by here and if your hungry enough. You might even have left overs!

21.description: After moving back into Bridgeport, I decided to check out some of the local places that had a reputation for having good food.  Also, for the places that I remember fondly, it has been interesting to check in on those that are still around to see how things have fared.  George's is one of those places that always had a good reputation.  Now, understand that this is fast food.  We are not talking about any culinary masterpieces but, that said, I am going to discuss it within those realms as a lover of all types and levels of cuisine etc.  So, I decided to try the gyros sandwich because I have heard they were very good.  I had a craving for one and since Johnny O's, my fave fast food place in Bridgeport, does not have, I decided to call an order in to George's to get a gyros with everything on it and an order of fries well done (I specifically asked this of the nice woman that took my order and explained I like my fries crispy}. I was pretty excited as this was my first "cheat" meal at a fast food place in awhile.  When I walked in, I noticed the place was clean looking and a straightforward looking place.  Menu items posted neatly and clearly.  The staff, from the moment I called and spoke to the woman on the phone, were nothing but courteous and nice.  I was pleased and was really looking forward to the sandwich.  After paying and heading home on this first day hovering around 100 degrees, I opened the bag so that I could plate the meal.  I was surprised at the lack of "heft" to the sandwich and originally a bit disappointed at that.  However, that was more me being in "glutton-mode" most likely.  Though I do maintain the sandwich seemed small, it was certainly enough to get a good feeling of having eaten enough.  The sandwich fixings were meager.  One tomato and a few onion slices.  The sauce was sparing and the meat did not include any crispy edges.  After eating my first piece of the meat, I was underwhelmed by the flavor.  It seemed almost non-existent.  I continued to eat it and the taste was not bad, it just did not seem distinct like gyros meat normally does.  It is hard to explain but it was not satisfying at all.  I had an issue with my fries, however.  I made it a point to ask for the fires to be "well done" etc.  The portion was generous but the fries were half sort of well done and the other half were nowhere near being.  Considering this was a "cheat" meal, I was really looking forward to enjoying.  I was kind of surprised, since we talked about it on the phone, that this detail was grossly overlooked.  You know, I am not sure when my next visit will be but based on the reviews that I have read here, and because the service was nice in terms of my interactions with the staff, I will give them another try in the future.  I will make sure to get those fries well done, dammit!  :)

16.description: Love this place.. Budget friendly and big portions!!! Yummy food.. only right around the corner from us so we always just call ahead for pick up and convenient to where we live..and the employee's there are friendly. . My stepson loves this place.... and so do we!! Must go...and eat!!

17.description: Great price and people are friendly. They have a ton of specials and they just remodeled. Clean restaurant to dine inn. My kids love the hotdog special. Comes w 2 hotdogs n fries $4 if u want a soda it's about $5. There's parking but it's meter parking. Food is also made fast.

10.description: I've only tried the chili and I hated it, chili taste like something you buy at the corner store out of a can. I wouldn't go back and try anything else on their menu.

11.description: I went with the two burger and fries special. I paid less than 7 dollars. I know this was back in 2008, so I'm late to reviewing the spot.Good, cheap greasy food. I would definitely recommend heading here before a Sox game to save money and get a good meal.

26.description: Great greasy joint to head to if you have some time to walk before a White Sox game! YUM!

27.description: George's does dish out large portions, but it isn't the great bargain that some make it out to be.  A gyro plate with a 20 ounce soft drink will set you back almost $8.75 including tax, and when you leave a small tip for the staff, you're at an even ten dollars.  That's not much of a deal for a frumpy diner in a more affordable part of town, friends.The space is kind of down-at-its-heels, but the hardworking staff try to keep it clean.All things being equal, I doubt that I'll make a return trip to George's.

35.description: I lived a few blocks from this place a few years ago and I can't say anything but great things about it. George's beef and pizza puff stand out among the handful of similar restaurants in the area. A great place to get quick, cheap and delicious food. It's never too crowded to sit and eat there if you want, but it's perfect for take out too. The staff is super friendly and the place is clean. If you're ever in Bridgeport, make it a point to stop in.

8.description: I just moved to Bridgeport in December with my boyfriend. He's from the neighborhood and loves the place, especially the Gyros! I ordered a burger and it was yummy! The ladies there are so sweet! Great food and service!

0.description: This place is awesome! A double cheeseburger meal at George's costs less than the same thing at McDonald's, but tastes ten thousand times better! The fried pickles are also great with a grilled ham and cheese. The Italian beef could DEFINITELY be split between two people, they put SO much meat on that sandwich. The employees are all very nice, the restaurant is very clean but comfortable and casual. Very fair prices for great quality food. Highly recommended, one of the best places in Bridgeport for sure!

38.description: When in Bridgeport, do as my friend, Angelo. Mangiare, mangiare (fate grosso, if you're me and not careful!)Yesterday, "Ange" called and asked if he could host me for lunch; if I'd come down to Bridgeport. It was a gorgeous day, so I said I'd ride down along the lake (and hop off at 31st Beach, and it's 2 miles or so west to Halsted from there).George's was the pick of the day, for lunch. It's been there 35 years or so. And damn, I haven't had Italian Slurp n Burp this good, ever.My Italian Beef & Sausage combo arrived completely grease free, piled high on a non-soggy sausage roll. I ate every bit and want more, soon. Damn good thing I had biked 13 miles to get there and had to bike 13 miles back. Otherwise, I think I'd still be metabolizing that lunch, and this is almost 24 hours ago!

20.description: Cheap and quick service. Friendly atmosphere too! :)

19.description: Wow, I totally forgot about George's.  Shame on me!Small, quaint, local, dive-y - that's George's.  It's a Bridgeport neighborhood establishment that has been satisfying my pizza puff craving for years.  I used to live a few blocks away and there's not really anything bad to say about this place.  The service is always friendly and they will come to recognize you if you're living in the 'hood or a regular customer.  Food is insanely cheap and insanely delicious.  A giant pop costs $1 (refills are free!) and almost every meal combo is under $5.  Great Italian Beef, pizza puffs, hot dogs - you name it, it's good.  Food is made when you order it so everything is piping hot and delicious.  If you chose to dine in, the seating is kind of old and uncomfortable but it's almost all booths so you can't go wrong.  There's a small bar area if you're more inclined to watch the cooks in action.  I love this place for a quick dinner or a before/after Sox game stop.

33.description: best tasting and largest portions for you hard earned dough. I'm working my way through the menu and have yet to be disappointed. I also have yet to spend over $5 bucks but am always full. Trust me, I'm a live to eat kinda gal. Certainly not the other way around. The reason it's shy that last star is because my gyro was lacking in the sauce dept and when i stopped in on saturday my tshirt was stuck to me due to the lack of a/c on a classically muggy spring chicago day.

2.description: I'm going to go five stars for the neighborhood feel here, I've only been here a few times, however you could see the camaraderie between some of the customer's and the worker's. The haven't seen you in a bit... How's work... etc.It's a busy place and the service is upbeat and organized. I ordered a chicken pita, and some of the fried pickles, husband had a fish sandwich of some sort. Since the chicken takes a while on the grill, I was asked if I wanted the pickles as an appetizer, to which I thought was an excellent idea and usually a reserve for a regular sit down restaurant and not fast food. Which brings up a good point, they do serve up the standard fast food menu, hot dogs, beefs and all that, however if you're looking for a real good fresh salad or a chicken pita down up right, George's does that.Come hungry, portions are ample, they serve breakfast too. I'd call this place a fast diner, it's more than your typical fast food place.

34.description: Wow, I totally forgot about George's.  Shame on me!Small, quaint, local, dive-y - that's George's.  It's a Bridgeport neighborhood establishment that has been satisfying my pizza puff craving for years.  I used to live a few blocks away and there's not really anything bad to say about this place.  The service is always friendly and they will come to recognize you if you're living in the 'hood or a regular customer.  Food is insanely cheap and insanely delicious.  A giant pop costs $1 (refills are free!) and almost every meal combo is under $5.  Great Italian Beef, pizza puffs, hot dogs - you name it, it's good.  Food is made when you order it so everything is piping hot and delicious.  If you chose to dine in, the seating is kind of old and uncomfortable but it's almost all booths so you can't go wrong.  There's a small bar area if you're more inclined to watch the cooks in action.  I love this place for a quick dinner or a before/after Sox game stop.

32.description: This is the best bang for your buck! Hits on the all the important hotdog stand food points - it's quick, price is great, quanity is substantial, quality is fresh and taste is fantastic. This place has never left me down and it continues to deliver. It is the very best hotdog & hamburger place you can ask for and always consistently hitting high marks across the board. Although their food is great, it's their Gyros that keep me so in love with them. They are much better than anything I tried including all the stands in Greektown. Family owned and ran for at least 40 years. You won't be disappointed.

18.description: Was a big fan of George's especially the Greek Salad BUT! The quality and amount of  ingredients have sharply deteriorated. I would always recommend this salad BUT not anymore! Christmas is ruined boys and girls.

13.description: This place has the best Gyro in Brideport!The hot dogs are good too. The burgers are neither here nor there.Shakes are delicious here. This is a low key place. The people are very nice, down to earth, neighborhood folks. Prices are reasonable. Highly recommended!

4.description: Let me preface this by explaining that I am a native New Yorker. I only moved to Chicago two months ago. I went to George's to get some hot dogs. And I am still confused and a little frightened by what happens to hot dogs in this city. Personally, I am used to a naked hot dog to which I add one or two condiments at most. Mustard, for example. Or chili. Or, if I'm feeling very saucy, chili AND cheese. I don't even know if this city HAS chili dogs. My point is, I got two hot dogs "with everything." And they were good, but they were still alien to me and I have no baseline for comparison. They were well-presented and all the ingredients appeared to be fresh and everything was cooked to the right consistency, so objectively, they were good hot dogs. But subjectively, I have no real baseline for comparison. I can't say how good or how bad they were compared to other hot dogs that have been buried under a pile of vegetables and condiments with an entire dill pickle spear in there to keep it company. So, take my opinion of the actual hot dogs with a grain of celery salt. Which, by the way, George's didn't seem to include. But, as I understand it, there's a big debate as to whether celery salt is necessary for a proper Chicago dog. And I don't even know what celery salt is. So I just mention it as a fact. If celery salt is a vital ingredient in your hot dog, I don't think they included it.What I can say is that it's a spacious, clean restaurant on south Halstead with a friendly staff. They make the food to order, they are quick, and they bring it to your table. The French fries are not amazing, but they are tasty enough. The hot dogs, I am not sure about, as I mentioned in the previous paragraph. And they have a whole lot of other foods available too. Burgers, tacos, gyros, the usual grilled fast-food made-to-order fare. It is also within convenient walking or biking distance of my apartment, but I realize that's probably not a useful quality for anyone who doesn't live in the same building as me. But maybe you live on a nearby street and this is helpful to know. The best part though is the prices. The food is really affordable and good value. Two hot dogs, french fries, and a can of soda or pop or whatever you people call it in Chicago for $5.50. Their other prices seem to be in the same ballpark. So a person can eat a good meal for under $10.

24.description: Best Gyros in the City and very cheap. Try a Gyro here and you will find that it is better and cheaper than any that you can find in Greektown. Everything else is great too (soups and Greek salads). For under ten bucks you can eat like a King or Queen.

6.description: I love little family owned diners like this...places that obviously haven't changed in years(and that's a good thing). The food is your typical diner fare but it's made with love and is super cheap. It's a nice spot to grab a coffee and read the paper or sit and have lunch.

22.description: Good prices and food. Cooks/servers were nice.

15.description: After moving back into Bridgeport, I decided to check out some of the local places that had a reputation for having good food.  Also, for the places that I remember fondly, it has been interesting to check in on those that are still around to see how things have fared.  George's is one of those places that always had a good reputation.  Now, understand that this is fast food.  We are not talking about any culinary masterpieces but, that said, I am going to discuss it within those realms as a lover of all types and levels of cuisine etc.  So, I decided to try the gyros sandwich because I have heard they were very good.  I had a craving for one and since Johnny O's, my fave fast food place in Bridgeport, does not have, I decided to call an order in to George's to get a gyros with everything on it and an order of fries well done (I specifically asked this of the nice woman that took my order and explained I like my fries crispy}. I was pretty excited as this was my first "cheat" meal at a fast food place in awhile.  When I walked in, I noticed the place was clean looking and a straightforward looking place.  Menu items posted neatly and clearly.  The staff, from the moment I called and spoke to the woman on the phone, were nothing but courteous and nice.  I was pleased and was really looking forward to the sandwich.  After paying and heading home on this first day hovering around 100 degrees, I opened the bag so that I could plate the meal.  I was surprised at the lack of "heft" to the sandwich and originally a bit disappointed at that.  However, that was more me being in "glutton-mode" most likely.  Though I do maintain the sandwich seemed small, it was certainly enough to get a good feeling of having eaten enough.  The sandwich fixings were meager.  One tomato and a few onion slices.  The sauce was sparing and the meat did not include any crispy edges.  After eating my first piece of the meat, I was underwhelmed by the flavor.  It seemed almost non-existent.  I continued to eat it and the taste was not bad, it just did not seem distinct like gyros meat normally does.  It is hard to explain but it was not satisfying at all.  I had an issue with my fries, however.  I made it a point to ask for the fires to be "well done" etc.  The portion was generous but the fries were half sort of well done and the other half were nowhere near being.  Considering this was a "cheat" meal, I was really looking forward to enjoying.  I was kind of surprised, since we talked about it on the phone, that this detail was grossly overlooked.  You know, I am not sure when my next visit will be but based on the reviews that I have read here, and because the service was nice in terms of my interactions with the staff, I will give them another try in the future.  I will make sure to get those fries well done, dammit!  :)

7.description: This is my favorite restaurant at the moment.  Food is inexpensive, great taste,  and once you go there enough the staff know your order and name! The best thing to get is the hot dog special for 5 dollars.  It comes with 2 dogs, frie, and drink.  You have to try it.

36.description: A nice little restaurant/diner with some friendly servers.  The prices are good and the portions aren't anything to sniff at.  The food isn't as greasy as you'd think it would be, given the menu of items to choose from.I have to say - the gyros are rather good and one of the few places to find a good gyro in Bridgeport.  I love watching the lamb on the roaster/spit and watching them shave off your meat fresh for your gyro when you order one.Plus, they've got the stool area for the real diner feel, booths and tables for a restaurant appeal, and the old-school video arcade games in the back that appeal to me!  I'll come in for a pizza puff and a gyro and drop a quarter or two in a Pac-Man machine and then enjoy my grub!My only concern is that there's usually a group of neighborhood kids being loud and rowdy whenever I'm in there.  I don't know if it's a coincidence (that I'm 6-for-6 on George's and rowdy kids at a booth) or there's just always a group of these kids in there, but I can't fault the place for their customers.

30.description: His gyro was good. My cheesburger had that rubber-patty feel to it, I didn't like it.  But I ate it 'cause I was hungry. Umm, don't think I'll be back.

3.description: The seasoned fries were hot and crispy, just the way I like it and it took them pretty quickly to prepare. The chicken rice soup was not bad, just needed a bit more chicken. Nice staff.

14.description: This place is not fancy or snobby in any sense. Good food at good prices. Very friendly service from the ladies who run the place. Ordered a gyro with fries and a soda. Exactly $7. Fries were good, not too salty and the gyro? More gyro meat than I knew what to do with! Other gyro places should take pointers from them (I'm looking at you Athenian Express in Phoenix). Happy that this is in my neighborhood.

3.description: Xindy's is a great place to recieve a "massage."

1.description: Xindy has a lot of New lady's workingI had the Manger Cindy she is great every time I had her for a massage.

2.description: This place was pretty cool before they got busted...the lady walked on my back! Lol

0.description: I had gone to this fabulous massage place. It offered me everything what I needed. The girls were fabulous and friendly. When I left the establishment, I felt I can breathe alot better than usual .My back pain had faded away and muscles felt soothing relaxation.The place is very reasonable and its chicagos greatest massage place.

3.description: Not the greatest bar in the history of mankind, but the best place around Comiskey to pre-game.  Prices are reasonable, it's well within walking distance of the park, and you can generally park around the bar on game days without any problems.  Cozy little place, perfect home for a Sox fan!

1.description: Now I like dive bars but this one didn't have anything aside from a bar and a couple of televisions. It is in the heart of Bridgeport and they need to add some more stuff aside from the lone pool table in the back. Just a few bottle brands are available here and this is a type of bar that has basically disappeared along with the middle class in the city of Chicago.

2.description: Where do you go when it's a rainy Saturday in the off season, you have a yearning for some cold Miller Lites and you're on the South side? Well you may just find yourself at First Base. "First Base?", you ask. "Never heard of it". That's because it's just a corner bar in Bridgeport where the bartender still smokes behind the bar and the place smells like some odd combination of smoke and floor cleaner. But if you can get over that smell (I'll give them a break- they had just opened so the floors were freshly mopped) they have what makes a bar OK in my book. Cheap beer, good service, pool tables in back, plenty of TV's and a jukebox that seemed to be loaded with 80's music. It also looked like it had been remodeled recently with slate like tile on the floors and shiny metal bar stools (getting ready for Sox season, perhaps?). The patrons themselves are interesting. Some screaming at each other-others talking to themselves but everyone knowing each other- kind of like a big family. (I think they thought we were lost as everyone kept looking over at us- that or they thought we were going to bust them for the smoking inside thing!) Whatever. I drank my Miller Lite and waited for the rain to let up adding another bar to my ever growing list of Bridgeport hang outs.

0.description: Great neighborhood bar. Very friendly staff, fun music & a nice place to watch a Sox game (not crowded! Close to the park!)

4.description: This is a nice little hole-in-the-wall.  Exudes that famous Bridgeport charm.  (Or whatever it is.)I went down "dere" to Bridgeport on a boring night with nothing going on.  I sat down at the bar and ordered a Lite (do they even serve any non-domestics in Bridgeport?).  I asked the gruff-looking guy next to me if the seat was taken.  "If A.J. gets a hit, then we're cool," he told me menacingly.  I'm generally not afraid of assholes, so I sat down and didn't think anything of it.  A.J. Pierzynski popped out.  So my friendly neighbor then beginning to scream curse words at the top of his lungs until the bartender told him to can it.Other characters included the drunk "generic South Side guy" hitting on two overly-tanned women at the same time, a few younger Sox fans, and a couple of REALLY meaty-looking guys with shirts that said "Cubs SUCK".In all, if you don't mind a little profanity, vulgarity, Miller Lite, and White Sox fans, you would probably feel right at home in this Bridgeport bar.

12.description: I have been getting my eyelashes done by Lesley for over two years now, and she is absolutely the best hands down.  I would not go anywhere but Doll in a Dash.  Before I went to her I went to another place and they destroyed my lashes.  Lesley is meticulous about the work she does, she is a perfectionist- making sure your lashes are as perfect as possible and she never cuts corners like some places do.   I get so many compliments on my lashes, and when I tell people they are extensions I am always told they look so natural and not fake like other extensions people have seen.  Lesley is also always up on the latest products and keeps her workspace very clean.  Lesley is also one of the nicest people you will ever meet, I always look forward to my appointments.  She makes you feel very comfortable and relaxed, and you know you are getting the best!

3.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. Lesley is a miracle worker. I was super skeptical about eye lash extensions and did hours of research for several places in Chicago. I asked about every possible question that could be asked and ended up going to Doll in a Dash out of the 50 places that I researched.Let me say that I am SO glad that i did! I walked in and Lesley was welcoming and got right to work. She made sure to educate me on what to do etc. Best part, my lashes look phenomenal. They are natural but give me that exciting kick that I needed. They are more full and the length is perfect. I have big eyes so she knew the exact length to make them look just perfect. Thank you Lesley!

1.description: Lesley did a phenomenal job with my lashes. She knew exactly what I wanted after maybe a minute of talking. Not is she very talented and detail oriented, she's so much fun! Most fun I've had while getting my lashes done thus far! Love her!

2.description: Lesley is awesome!!! I'm a perfectionist in some ways (crazy I know) and what I love about Lesley is how particular she is about her work. Not only is her work fantastic, but she really makes you feel relaxed and genuinely cares about her clients. It's also an added bonus she has a flexible schedule (on top of being very responsive) so you don't have to book 3 months in advance to schedule time. I would recommend Lesley to anyone in the city; worth every penny

9.description: Doll in a Dash is great! I always have wonderful experiences there! Lesley is so attentive, polite and helpful. She is very knowledgeable and patient and make sure you are aware of what you are getting so that you are sure to have the look you desire. My lashes come out so full, long, and natural-looking every time!! It is quiet and relaxing in the service room...a.k.a. my nap time. Haha My lashes last a month! Definitely check out Doll in a Dash if you want awesome nails & compliment inducing lashes.

10.description: I LOVE my lashes!! They last for three weeks and look so natural! Lesley is just a gem! She's so great at what she does and she has an amazing ability to connect with people. She helps you find the perfect lash length to suit you, but will also go a little longer if you like. Very accommodating and very relaxing. I highly recommend her!

4.description: I am hooked on having my lashes done at Doll in a Dash (and I'm in my 70's). Lesley is a great technician and a real perfectionist. She treats you like she would treat a friend and makes you look simply beautiful.  She NEVER makes you feel like she is just there to get the job done as fast as possible and move on to the next client. My lashes often last for a month. Lesley really knows and loves the business and also keeps up on the latest lashes and lash products....so you know you are getting the best. I have had to go to other technicians while on vacation or out of town but nobody has ever done as wonderful a job as Lesley. She is also conveniently located downtown so you can have your lashes done at lunchtime or after work...very convenient!  If you are thinking about getting lash extensions or are not happy with your current technician...give Leslie and Doll in a Dash a try. You won't regret it.   Carol S
