6.description: I agree with all of the posted reviews! Doll in a Dash might just be my favorite Chicago find. Not only is Lesley Herbert brillant at what she does, she is personable, reasonably priced and maintains a flexible schedule. I have tried several lash spots in Chicago and they were either too expensive or the quality was just too cheap. Lesley solves for both of these issues and her location is great! Perhaps against my more selfish desires, I continue to sing Lesley's praises  to my friends and because a gem like this is so hard to find, I couldn't help but share on Yelp.

0.description: I had another amazing experience at Doll in a Dash with Lesley! The main reasons I love coming here is :1.) She is a professional. For a service at this price point, you want someone who knows what they are doing. Extensions is what she does all day every day of the week.2.) I did my research, and this beauty boutique consistently (over many years) has happy, repeat customers--myself included now. She has an excellent track record for good quality hair extensions that last and look natural. 3.) I leave looking like I have celebrity hair! It's not too over the top (very natural. In fact, no one has ever suspected my hair was not my own in the 10 months I had them on).My most recent experience: This was my third application of a klix hair extensions with Lesley. I came back after enjoying my full head of beautiful hair extensions for a little over 3 months. I originally decided to get hair extensions because I wanted more volume and and a dramatic change in length. I love that these extensions do not use glue or tape for application, which has caused extensive damage to my hair in the past.  I also love my klix extensions, becuase I can treat them as I treat my normal hair....I wash them regularly, dye them, and get them blown 2-3 times a week.Removal is a breeze; . After removal, which took maybe 20 minutes, my natural hair looked great still (healthy and as full as it was before I had extensions, what a relief!)! I had a new set of klix extensions applied, and I love them!Lesley is the BEST hands down! She's extremely experienced, does such an amazing job, and truly knows her stuff. She's smart and detail-oriented. I am soooo happy to have found herMy advice to those who try extensions, make sure you take care of your hair investment! Brushing and caring for them will let you enjoy them for a long time and your natural hair will not be damaged from matting/tangling! Mine definitely will last longer this time around now that I'm experienced with caring for them.*******************************************************************************************************************I see Lesley for hair extensions....which is why I decided to go for the eyelashes too!That's it...I will say it...Lesley is the eyelash queen!!!  I will be with her for the long haul!It was my first time getting eyelash extensions and was a little scared on the whole process. She was so patient with me and explained the entire process and gave me tips on how to keep my lashes in great shape. The application was so relaxing too. She has done a great job with making her space so comfortable, clean and welcoming. Lesley as a person is so sweet, considerate and a true professional in her craft. If you ever have any questions or concerns all you do is send her a quick email and she responds right away. Same goes for scheduling.  She has a super efficient online booking system that makes booking a breeze as well as the fact that she has the best and most accommodating hours i have foun dyet!My lashes look so natural and beautiful. It is one of those things where you know something is different but it is not a crazy change. She can customize a look for you too just tell her exactly what you want. Compared to other places I have researched, her prices are beyond reasonable for the quality of work she does. I really would not go anywhere else, happy to have found her!!

5.description: Lesley recently did my hair for a boudoir shoot and she was incredible!!! So professional and thoughtful and quick and on top of everything. She made sure not only to do a beautiful job on my hair quickly bit she also did changes and touch ups for 2 other outfits and kept the whole show running smoothly and made me feel great!!!! Lesley  is outstanding at everything she does!

13.description: I cannot even explain how much I love Lesley and Doll in a Dash! I get stopped on the street so many times that I should permanently promote for this company! Seriously, I love the attention to detail, how long they last, and of course spending time with Lesley. She is such a wonderfully sweet, knowledgable, and kind hearted gal that does a fantastic job with lashes as well as hair! I get my lashes done once or twice a month and I am truly hooked. She cut my extensions for me and also did an amazing braid for me on my birthday and they looked fabulous.  I always leave looking and feeling like a princess.

11.description: Lesley is the sweetest, most friendliest person ever and you should definitely get your eyelashes done by her. She is amazing at what she does and super accommodating and welcoming. I felt like I was going over to a girlfriend's house, but you could also tell that Lesley is a professional and knows her stuff. This was my first time getting eyelash extensions done and Lesley made sure to educate me about them. The hour and a half of application flew by because we were chit chatting away - Lesley just makes you feel relaxed and at ease. If you're thinking about getting eyelash extensions, just DO IT and make sure you go to Doll in a Dash!  I promise you will come out just as satisfied as I did. I hear Lesley also does special occasion styling and hair extensions so I may try out those services as well in the near future.

8.description: I love Doll And A Dash. I used to get my eye lashes and hair extensions from Lesley. My hair extensions lasted 8 months. Which is unheard of. If I did not move away I would still be going to Lesley. She's great at what she does! I highly recommend

14.description: Lesley has been doing my eyelashes for over a year and a half and I can tell you that every time we get done I am VERY satisfied. What I love about her, is that she works very carefully, uses great quality materials, has great prices, is very flexible and super friendly. Also if one day you would like to change things a little, tell her, don't hesitate, as she always tries to do her best so that you feel beautiful and fully satisfied with your new amazing eyelashes! Highly recommend!

7.description: I've been getting my lushes lashes done by Lesley for the past 3 years. I'm in love with her and her ability to make my eye lashes look fabulous. No matter if I'm at the super market or a party, I'm always getting compliments on how beautiful and natural my eyelashes look. I'd love to tell people they are real but I've got to give Lesley the credit. I was totally nervous about eye lash extension when I first went and now i'm hooked. Highly recommend Lesley.

1.description: I always love this store.It has exactly what I need.Rev. Stitch is an excellent man who helped me  with his knowledge when I purchased an excellent statue there.It has an incredible selection of candles etc.I can hardly wait to go back!

9.description: Great place. I'm glad to have a place like this on the south side.  Crystal was extremely helpful and was very positive.  They have a ton of incense and some great books.  They also offer classes which I plan on taking! I would recommend more unscented votive and pillar candles although they have a good selection of candles already oiled up and blessed.  I think the prices are a tad high but still a wonderful spiritual store. I will definitely go again.

23.description: When I lived in Bridgeport, I was pretty much a staple in this store. I loved the book selection, the unusual statues, the candles and the pleasant & positive people who worked there. Most stores of this nature tend to be 'weird' and a bit "New Age-y" but this store feels very calm. No one pressures you to hurry and purchase something. I highly recommend this store.

5.description: I come here for incense and sage, but often find myself checking out books, stones, and other goods as well. The vibe in the shop is comfortable and makes you feel welcome to hang out for a bit. Stitch is genuine, funny and up for conversation on any topic you could imagine. People like him make Augustine's a special place to be.

25.description: I'm not sure where all of the rivalry started between the original location that was called Augustine's Spiritual Goods and the new ownership of what is called Augustine's Eternal Gifts, but the store that exists now is a pretty good store if you're looking for spiritual/occult items.  I can't compare it to "the original" because I never went there when it was "the original".I have been in this store and it does have a huge selection of candles, oils, herbs, charms, amulets and a large library of books of a spiritual nature.  I don't know that much about the stuff so I can't vouch for the current owner's knowledge of the genre, but the selection speaks volumes for me.  Not being into crystals and candles, I can at least say that they've got a good selection of tarot decks and information, as well as a little spot for voodoo dolls and lucky charms.You can never have too much good luck, in my opinion.  And as for the voodoo dolls . . . let's just call it "wishful thinking"!

12.description: Really cool store. Get all of your pagan and witchcraft supplies here!  :-) Very cool people, and a fun place to just look around

21.description: What a fun shop. First, they have Rev. Stitch who is one of the most interesting and caring people you will ever meet. While the book selection is better at Alchemy Arts, they do have a good selection of stuff- candles, amulets, bracelets, etc. They also have rune reading and do classes. If you are in the area, I would definitely stop by and say hi to Rev. Stitch!

16.description: I'm not sure where all of the rivalry started between the original location that was called Augustine's Spiritual Goods and the new ownership of what is called Augustine's Eternal Gifts, but the store that exists now is a pretty good store if you're looking for spiritual/occult items.  I can't compare it to "the original" because I never went there when it was "the original".I have been in this store and it does have a huge selection of candles, oils, herbs, charms, amulets and a large library of books of a spiritual nature.  I don't know that much about the stuff so I can't vouch for the current owner's knowledge of the genre, but the selection speaks volumes for me.  Not being into crystals and candles, I can at least say that they've got a good selection of tarot decks and information, as well as a little spot for voodoo dolls and lucky charms.You can never have too much good luck, in my opinion.  And as for the voodoo dolls . . . let's just call it "wishful thinking"!

17.description: I love this store and will make the trek down there from the NW side of Chicago when ever I need any insence, candles or stones. The people there are always helpful and will give recommendations on anything you might need.  They also offer services outside of the shop, which is nice.If you have not made you way to this great little shop in Bridgeport you should, it is one of the best occult shops around.

10.description: I purposely sought out this shop. I love to see different Occult and New Age shops. I saw a lot of candles and Incense and Oils, But I prefer to make all of those myself. They had a very small book selection and I chose the pictorial key to the tarot by waite and bought it for 13 something. I leave and take the price sticker off the back and the publishing company's price was 9.99 or 10.99... The publishing company sells it to them for less yet they marked it up again? I know Chicago's full of illiterate assholes, but is it that bad that you have to gouge me?

11.description: Augustine's has a good selection of candles and incense. I would say that it's best if you'd like to stock up on candles and similar supplies. I find it's my go-to place if I want a well made, unique candle for my altar. The space is small and so while the books they do stock tend to be good, there isn't much room to have a larger book selection. Still, I've often been able to find some cool books and often wind up doing an impulse buy that invariably brings me a lot of enjoyment,

26.description: The coolest store in Chicago. Love rituals, candles, herbs, charms, amulets, books - spiritual stuff of all kinds. UPDATED TO ADD: This is not the original store that used to be on Halsted, sadly. It's got much of the same merchandise, though.

22.description: I love this store and will make the trek down there from the NW side of Chicago when ever I need any insence, candles or stones. The people there are always helpful and will give recommendations on anything you might need.  They also offer services outside of the shop, which is nice.If you have not made you way to this great little shop in Bridgeport you should, it is one of the best occult shops around.

0.description: YASSS. I love it here! The employees are very nice and they have a very wide variety of things to choose from and from a variety of different belief systems. I've bought some candles and a deck of Gypsy Witch cards from here and loved all of it. Would definitely recommend!

20.description: I agree, Rev. Stitch is a great guy. So genuine and friendly. Great assortment of items for you to choose from and he is very knowledgable in a variety of spiritual paths. I have been there 2 times and when I get the chance and am in the neighborhood I will definitely go back.

19.description: I was a patron the the old store on halsted and then the owner and his wife retired and moved to michigan and it was under new ownership.  The new store is twice as big as the old one and has more products and services to offer.  Scotty and the rest of the staff are very helpful and is a pleasant place to visit.  I must say if I am feeling sad or out of sorts I just pay them a visit and I am feeling all better when I leave.  Thank you Augustines

2.description: I am always happy and content going here. There is always something I'm looking for and if for some reason I'm not to sure what it may be as far as salts or candles I ask the staff and they are happy to assist me in whatever question I may have. I go here often for my spiritual needs and am never disappointed.

18.description: The coolest store in Chicago. Love rituals, candles, herbs, charms, amulets, books - spiritual stuff of all kinds. UPDATED TO ADD: This is not the original store that used to be on Halsted, sadly. It's got much of the same merchandise, though.

13.description: Awesome place, love the older guy working there (down to earth dude) Go check it out for yourself! :)

4.description: So this place is super creepy, but they know their stuff. I came here just to get some incense, but the store has a HUGE selection of candles, lotions, potions (yes, actual potions), books, crystals, incense holders, and all things mystical. The store even grows many of the herbs that are in its potions and lotions. The store has a whole wall full of glass jars filed with various concoctions. The woman working in the store was super creepy, but she was nice enough to tell me and my friend about the store and to help us find what we were looking for. I steered clear of anything voodoo like and bought two boxes of incense and a bunch of sage to burn around the house. Both smell fantastic. I'll be back for more incense, but I plan on wearing my cross for protection just in case.

24.description: This is one of my favorite "occult" shops in the city. I go here when the typical oil from a botanica will not do. The staff will custom blend any oil you ask for using essential oils. They also make their own spiritual baths. Many are available on the shelf but they are more than happy to custom blend any bath you ask for. This place has a wider candle selection than some of the botanicas I've been to. They cater more to "new agers" but they also have a decent selection of Wicca and hoodoo items. Not many Santeria items but they do carry a few hard-to-find lithographs that are out of print. They are usually busy but if you are patient, they will give you their undivided attention.

6.description: I've seen my fair share of new age stores and this one kind of falls short. They did have quite the collection of oils and incense, but I wasn't crazy about their candles. The prices seemed a little high. I wanted a couple oils, but they were $10 and in small bottles. I did pick up some bergamot incense for $4 that I'm super excited about burning when I get home. The man working (I'm assuming based on other reviews that he's the owner) was ridiculously personable and funny. I greatly enjoyed all of his literary references. I would consider come back here if I lived in the area...if only to chat with the owner :)

15.description: If I could give this shop zero stars, it would still only get one and only because Rev. Stitch works there. Him and his wife are genuine people and the owner of this place is lucky to have him. The store is over priced you can get the same candles and better and cheaper down the street and a bigger selection at Authenian Candle Company, they employ kids that don't know crap. The oils are garbage, and based on mixed cheapo Anna Riva oils that do not work. You have to pay to park on the street, but you can always find a spot.

7.description: This shop is a hidden gem. The employees are knowledgeable and always ready to help. I'm new to the 'arts' so it's nice finding a place with people who are happy to share their knowledge and wisdom. A few other similar stores I've visited in Chicago have had employees who seemed to talk down to me just because I didn't know the properties of certain stones and oils off the top of my head. The employees at augustines are nothing like that. I feel comfortable to ask questions and if I'm looking for something specific they're always ready to help explore all options that fit my inquiries. They have a ton of potions and oils as well as a nice little book selection. They also hold small workshops and classes and offer cleansings for an extremely cheap price. Their prices are about the same as other similar shops on the city however they constantly have different deals and specials to take advantage of plus they'll occasionally throw in special little freebies here and there. This shop has become like a second home to me and I am definitely a loyal customer now. Their location is very convenient. You have to pay for street parking but you can usually find a spot almost right in front of the store. This is a special place filled with people who I could chat with for hours. Every visit I end up leaving with beautiful new products and tidbits of new knowledge to aid me in my spiritual journey. Great place to find unique gifts and beautiful one of a kind jewellery. It's worth checking out. Have a blessed day.

8.description: I'm torn on this place. While it's a great location to get very specific items I need, some of the prices are down right laughable. A vial of oil that has always been priced at $8.99 will suddenly have another price sticker put on top of the usual one marked as $12.99. Yikes. Guess I didn't want the patchouli that bad. Sometimes the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful when it comes to finding this or that or recommendations. But then there are other times when an older gentleman will keep bothering me by incessantly talking about himself (his collections, his alters, his experiences, his powers). Then there's a younger gal in there who is sometimes great and other times on her iphone and irritated that you're interrupting her. I'll still go in there, but only if absolutely necessary. There's got to be a better place to acquire spiritual goods in the vicinity.

3.description: This place is AWESOME!!! The gentleman behind the counter is really helpful, and is attentatve and caring toward each of the customers.. I'm so happy this place is open on Sunday.  Drove here from Indiana and was so excited when I walked through the door.  Great selection of oils, candles, books, gems, incense, and stones.

14.description: I came in here looking for a specific saint card and other info on this saint for my kids project at school.  I left with a bag of cool stuff for the project and for myself!  They have neat  candles and oils.  I don't believe in the "potions" spells and things like that, but the candles and oils smell good and they also have Christian items if you're looking for that and don't want to drive further out to Wadras.

1.description: Bought a groupon and wanted to try this place since it's close to home. When I called the restaurant to place my order, the staff said I can only use the groupon for dine-in only. Ok fine, so I went there with 2 of my friends. The place was really dark and they got these really weird chairs that are attached to the tables and they were weird to sit on, definitely not comfy, also you can only sit 4 people at a table. If your party has more than 4 people, they do not have extra chair to sit you, which was what happened to a party of 6 who came after us. The worst part about the sushi was the rice was under-cooked! We told the chef and he ignored us and said the rice is fine. Excuse me? I have been eating rice everyday for the past 30 years and been to tons of sushi restaurant, I know what is cooked and what is undercooked, and never in my life I have eaten under-cooked rice at a sushi restaurant! Cooking rice is the most basic skill to making sushi, how can you serve under-cooked rice to your customers and not even try to apologize! So even the rolls contained under-cooked rice, we just ate all the fish and left with an empty stomach. And guess how much it was? $100 for bad quality sushi which I could've gone to an ayce sushi place and they make better sushi than this place!It was my first time there and will be my last time!

9.description: I hate to write a bad review, but this place should not be open.  Disgusting sushi, exposed cables, makeshift office in dining area, unsanitary conditions everywhere.  Do not visit.

12.description: I am writing this review without ever having eaten at Sublime Sushi Too.... I am writing it because since 06/22 when I purchased my Groupon, I have been trying to go there for dinner after work, and it's always CLOSED! I live a few blocks away and a couple times I have checked the hours online, it says OPEN, then I create my order, get excited for sushi, give them a call.... and no answer! Try again... no answer. Other times I have walked past the restaurant after getting off the train, and although the website says OPEN, the CLOSED sign in the window says otherwise. My Groupon expired in October, how am I ever to use it when this place does not have real set hours??? I am a sushi lover and would love to have a good place this close, but I am upset that I set my expectations far too high for this place. :(

21.description: I think this is the 2nd location for this restaurant.  The vegetarian maki I had was very good.  The decor is great, the service was very nice- they were just closing for the night but were totally accommodating.  And it's BYOB!  This is a great addition to the neighborhood.

16.description: Sushi was delicious and very affordable. Definitely worth every penny. Service was also great... Just a bit slow. It's a brand new place so hopefully as business picks up they have more people working there. The server was so nice and apologetic so it's hard not to like him! Will definitely stop by again soon.

17.description: I purchased a groupon and am always down to try any sushi places. Apparently they close on a Tuesday so we came back again on Wednesday. I had to try calling a few times as the phone line was busy to make sure they were indeed open. They are located in a remote dark street. I would not have ever noticed this place if I didnt buy a groupon. We were the only party there. The food was fair based on the price of their rolls. They are a BYOB place which was a plus. The place seems more of a take out place than a restaurant. Overall decent but not impressive.

10.description: I ordered "Godzilla" Fresh and yummy GodzillaI'm suprise that they open late night in southside area. Also do delivery too.

5.description: I love to come here for my sashimi craving! It is great quality! I had the summer roll and the lemon grass flavor is great! Not the greatest with big group. They have awkward chairs. I came for quick dinner date and the atmosphere is good.We had trouble with undercook rice before but they fixed it. Their miso soup is salty and not that great. But those are minor. Great place for fresh and quality sashimi!

11.description: One of the best sushi places ! My favorite dish sushi and this place made feel more than satisfied. Sometimes when i need fhem the most they are not open which is not a good thing Thats why i gave 4 stars other than that you wont regret trying

3.description: No. This is not sublime sushi. More like fishy sushi with no service. Also, this place is called "Sublime Sushi Too" as there is another location up North.Came here for dinner on a Thursday night, and there were only two workers, both of which were pleasant but not hospitable. We were a party of five but the seating only allowed for a maximum of four people per table.Service was almost non-existent with no napkins or chopsticks provided until after our food was given to us minutes later.In terms of the food, this was not a pleasant experience. The sushi felt like it came out of a freezer and thawed a few minutes before being served. I understand raw fish is served cold, but this was colder than it should have been delivered to our table.The sushi rice was not prepared well. It didn't have the right mix of vinegars, sugar, and salt. It was almost undercooked.The fish itself (e.g., tuna, superwhite tuna, yellowtail, and salmon) was fishy and unpleasant. It was cut nicely, but something was just off in taste.Lastly, why is it more expensive to dine in than order from grubhub? Seriously, $4 more for a large sashimi entree in the restaurant than ordering online??If you've read this far, nothing has changed. If you want better sushi in Bridgeport, go a little further South on Halsted to South Kawa. You can thank me later.

0.description: On our perpetual search for sushi places open later than 10PM, we came across sublime sushi (the one up north and this one on the south side). Our experience at the sublime sushi up north was pretty mediocre, so we weren't expecting much from this place and it ended up being better than expected!Pros:-There was a groupon for here, making it inexpensive-Because of the location, the place doesn't seem too busy so our service was attentive and quick-the sashimi was very good-the rolls weren't mindblowingly good, but they definitely satisfied the sushi craving. unlike other reviews I didn't have any experience with undercooked rice or poor quality fish.-the crunchy spicy makis are a real bang for your buck imoCons:-The pricing on the online delivery menu is cheaper than the in-house menu so just be prepared in case you looked it up beforehand-It's a relatively small location, so I could see it filling up during peak hoursVerdict: Better than the other sublime sushi. If you can get the groupon, definitely come here. If not, I would say only come here if you're in the area and craving sushi, it will definitely hit the spot.

20.description: Sushi was delicious and very affordable. Definitely worth every penny. Service was also great... Just a bit slow. It's a brand new place so hopefully as business picks up they have more people working there. The server was so nice and apologetic so it's hard not to like him! Will definitely stop by again soon.

19.description: Good stuff! Myself and my friend were the only people there. Friendly service and food was out quick. We got a the Hawaiian, Spicy Tuna Deluxe, and Summer roll. They were all very tasty and very flavorful. The prices are very reasonable. BYOB. Very nice decor, kind of a light hipster industrial, but casual feel, pleasant atmosphere.

2.description: My fiancé and I purchased a Groupon (which was a great deal). We went out on a Friday night around 7:30. It's a relatively small location, with tight seating. Maximum occupancy must be around 20 people. The service was ok at first, but as more people arrived the service slowed down considerably. We received 3 out of 4 rolls, but had to wait approximately 15 minutes later to receive the final roll. Quality of the food was great though! The spicy yellowtail roll was impressive as well as the orange dragon.Paid parking right across the street (only $1/hour)!Overall 3/5 stars due to the poorly timed service held up by the quality in flavor of the food.

18.description: I've been to the original Sublime Sushi on Damen many times and this is like a lovely cheaper version of it. I recommend the vegetarian Godzilla roll and their sweet potato maki.

13.description: When I think sushi, I think fresh, firm fish, sitting atop soft, sticky rice that melts in your mouth. That is NOT the case here. The sushi rice was not fully cooked and was literally crunchy - to a good thing in a sushi restaurant. The pieces of Yellowtail I got were tiny, and tasted "fishy." I called about the rice, and the "manager" just said, "Ok if you are not happy" instead of even saying "I am sorry - let me fix this." Nope - not on my Chicago sushi place list AT ALL.

4.description: I am sorry but we didn't like sublime sushi. Okay I get it when we eat sushi suppose to be expensive and a treat. But this place was anything but a treat. We ordered a sashimi set for $24 it came with sushi rice and miso soup. The sushi was so small portion for $24. We ordered small sushi set for 16 for our kids. It was okay. We also ordered gyoza for our toddler. We were the only customers in this place. Okay one lady walked in for a to go order and somehow the prevented the person in charge to serve us cold rice and mildly cold gyoza. Total disappointment seriously. Sad face here.Miso soup was way too salty and it was coldSushi set was $24 for few pieces of sashimiSmall sushi set $16 looked better with California rolls. It came with nirgi which was fishy and I spit out one of the white fish out cause it tasted fishyAlso the seating is not welcoming at all! I hit my leg on their metal bar chairs. It hurts. Not coming back unless it has major changes of improvement. Customer service was super lacking too.

6.description: Thinking that this location would be perfect to try out since it was close to home, I did some research and came across a Groupon, which I thought was a score! I bought it and went within the first couple weeks of its opening. The service was horrible! Because it was empty, I was seated fairly quickly. I sat for a good while waiting for 2 other people in my party to arrive. I was pleased that business was starting off right for them since they received a lot of pick up and delivery orders while my wait. I was sitting for a good 30 minutes with the menus that were provided. As soon as my party and I were about to order, the waitress came up to the 3 of us and said that they are no longer taking dine-in customers! At the time I wasn't even upset about the Groupon, I was upset with the business's distasteful etiquette. I tried to reason with the waitress and the Itamae (sushi chief), but did not want to cause a scene, so my party and I had decided to leave. Because the Groupon was still new, I figured I'd try some other time. However, every other time I had gone, it was closed! Their hours are so unpredictable! Their hours of operation claim 4pm-12am, which is between the times I had gone, yet the storefront was continuously empty and dark. The restaurant is on my route home, and even when I wasn't interested in going, they were closed during their hours of operation. At this point, the Groupon is expired, and I don't ever see myself having a reason to go here. The drive up north is far more worth it than dealing with this disgrace of etiquette. Overall, horrendous experience on multiple accounts!

15.description: I've yet to dine in but BYOB is awesome and the delivery I've gotten has been tasty. Delivery fast (yay) but Seamless/GrubHub don't allow for a pick up option during certain hours, which is weird. I guess when I'm on looking for food on Seamless or GrubHub I'm probably too hungry to go out in public, so whatever. Problem is, looking on Seamless and biking by multiple times in the past week or so I have noticed they very often aren't open during their posted hours! It's in a part of town that could use more late-night food options, but if they want to close at 9 or 10 like everybody else, it's okay to admit it.

7.description: My boyfriend loved his sushi.. I couldnt stand it. We have ordered here one time before & it was amazing. But I dont know what went wrong last night. I like their prices, they're reasonable. The one thing that was great both times were the chicken dumplings.

8.description: I live right around the corner from this sushi place and my bus goes past it everyday. One day after it opened I stopped off and ordered a summer role with tuna, salmon, avacado, jalapenos and cilantro. It was sloppily put together but tasty and I would order it again....if this place was ever open. Pro: Decent and well-priced sushi. Con: Unpredictable hours. Its not always open for its posted hours.Update: 12/12/15After ordering online a few times, I bought a dine-in only groupon. Their hours says they will be open until 2 a.m. today but they are closed. Tried calling at 10:30 p.m. to make a reservation and no one answered. Went past it at 11:00 p.m. on my commute home and they were closed--the lights were off and the chairs were put up. I changed my rating from a 3 to a 2 because I can't believe how unreliable this restaurant is. They need to update their accounts if their times have changes or at least record a voice mail saying what their hours are. I will probably contact Groupon and try to return my voucher.

14.description: After one visit I'm addicted. Everything was prepared to perfection and very fresh. The salmon avocado and rainbow trout maki were the standouts to me.

58.description: My bestie has been raving about how we needed to come here. She has been several times and has recently relocated to the BP neighborhood. We attempted to go to dinner last night. Guess they were closed for the night? No lights on, no signs. And it was a Tuesday...weird.

56.description: Four of us dined at Han 202, a particularly inviting Chinese restaurant.  The decor is striking, the staff is quite accommodating, the food is creative and delicious.  BYOB is a plus as is the the fixed price menu.  The three carnivores in the group liked all four of their courses. The vegetarian liked her cucumber/seaweed salad, tofu mousse and bay leaf ice cream but not the Chinese Delight vegetable entree.  Even wit two spicing levels, it was a major disappointment. Why isn't one of every day's numerous entree choices vegetarian?  We had phoned a few days ahead to be sure there was something a vegetarian could eat so at least she did not go home hungry but, at the restaurant it was clear that the (frozen?) uninspired brown-sauced usual vegetable assortment was Han's standard solution to that particular dietary choice which is a disincentive to return.  Also, the women's rest room needs a grab bar.

29.description: Got a gift card from my parents for my birthday and we finally got around to using it. WOW! The food was fabulous. The atmosphere is somewhat casual but it is nicely decorated. The tables are somewhat close to each other so if you are not so into communal eating, you might not like that if it 's a busy time. We got a couple bonuses from the chef--hand cut fries with truffle oil and then later in between courses, a small slice of steak tartar. I had Mongolian Trio as my main course and it was how I have been wanting my Mongolian beef to taste for a long time--spicy, sweet and salty all at once. The beef and chicken were tender and the shrimp was fresh and flavorful (The Trio). I also enjoyed the beet and lobster salad that was the starter, I think. The second course was shrimp toast which was super-yum, the tempura shrimp that came with it was good but pretty standard. I had a really good time there despite the annoying guy next to us with at least six beer cans on the floor next to his table. I will definitely do this one again. Soon. ASAP.

42.description: Fantastic food at reasonable price. Great service! I will come back to this place.

23.description: This place u might miss and pass thousand times but never get in. But yea, give them a try u will surprise yourself. How come this place not get any Michelin star yet? I'm asking myself.The scollop with white chocolate sauce is amazing. The best I have ever had in my life. Scollop is very juicy and tender, can't feel too strong about the white chocolate taste, but it gave this item very nice balance of favor.The shrimp toast? So dame good!!!!!! Crispy out with sesame seeds and soft bread for the bite with tiger shrimp. Everything are good here, I don't usually say that besides I did once by the hotel restaurant by Las Vegas.I tips $131.00 for me and my wife, that show my respect to the food and the chef who made the food. And the great service as well. I will go back for sure!

47.description: I liked the intimate feel of the restaurant and the ambiance/sound level was appropriate for a dinner to catch up with a group of friends.  We ordred from the $35 prix fix menu.  I ordered the salmon water crest appetizer that was very good, and so was my 2nd appetizer - quail.  My main entree, monkfish was not that great, neither was the cornish hen my friend ordered.  My other two friends had the chilean sea bass and steak which they enjoyed.   The apple tart w/ cinnamon ice cream was the highlight of my night!  I did ask for coffee with my dessert and although the coffee was good, I was charged $6!!  I think that is WAY too much for coffee.  I wouldn't object if friends wanted to come back here again, but for $50+ that i spend after tax and tip I might venture elsewhere.

8.description: Second time here.  An absolute pleasure and amazing value both times.  One of Chicago's fine dining gems.

31.description: I really enjoyed the first course of tuna ceviche. Here's why this meal went downhill for me after. I am pescatarian because if I eat beef, poultry, or pork I will be ungodly sick for two days. While we were chatting away awaiting the second course, I looked to my right and saw the chef grab my friends course of meat to plate then move on to plate my agedtofu. Because there was no cleaning of hands/gloves between the platings, I knew I was entirely screwed. The cross contamination I witnessed wasn't limited to touching of meat to seafood or tofu.It was really difficult to enjoy the meal at this point because I knew within a few minutes I would start feeling ill. This review really only applies to those with dietary restrictions, be cautious. It's truely unfortunate I'm still regretting this meal 24 hours later.Also edited to include, it is $35.

34.description: Surprising find in Bridgeport. Sleek and modern design. Went on a Wednesday night without reservations and we were seated right away. To be honest, the restaurant was rather empty. The food was delicious. The only option was the prix fixe menu for $35. It was 4 courses plus a small appetizer before our first course. Food was delicious with many options for each course. I would recommend this place as a great spot for small dinner party. BYOB is always a plus. Paid Street parking all around the restaurant made it an easy destination.

16.description: Our night at Han 202 featured:Quiet eleganceExquisite prix fixe 25.00 mealPlus time spent with fabulous Yelpers!What a magnificent time, I can't wait to come back.  My hubby and I sank into the comfy seats rather than the bench seating and were immediately comfortable.  The room was small and understated with an easy noise level so we were able to converse freely.  The service was divine, they even immediately fixed the soap dispenser when I mentioned the pump wasn't working.  And the food, glorious food!  They gave us a complimentary plate of french fries with truffle oil and chopped onions.  They also provided wine glasses, a bottle opener and a bucket of ice for our champagne plus fresh glasses when we switched from wine to champagne.  (Cheers!)I chose the salmon for my appetizer which was pleasant but I didn't finish.  I followed that with the Shanghai steamed dumplings with a delicious plum sauce.  I ate all three!  With glee! My main course was the General Tao which was thisclose to the outermost range of my spiciness range.  I really enjoyed it and ordered the not included brown rice to accompany it.   For dessert I had a cunning little mini cupcake which was just perfect.  I added their full bodied French press coffee and walked out of there satiated in a most content way!Thank you so much Yvonne B and M who introduced us to the divine eatery. They are delightful dinner companions and really know their restaurants! I cannot recommend this sanctuary of civilized eating enough.  I will lead by example and make reservations for a return visit very soon!

13.description: A very interesting place.    My wife and I went there for our anniversary.    It is an expensive restaurant, but I think the food and the presentation was worth it.    A small restaurant so you get plenty of attention from the staff.    I would definitely recommend reservations if you plan to go.   That will ensure that you have a dining spot.

11.description: Is it possible for a place that is listed in Michelin's Bib Gourmand to be under-rated and a bit under the radar? When it comes to Han 202, I think the answer is yes. I am absolutely shocked that this placed isn't packed night in, night out. A friend had been here for a wine dinner a few months ago, and from that visit several of us have been chomping at the bit to come here. So, knowing that they are BYO, a bunch of friends and I came down here for a wine dinner.We all started off with a piece of Tuna sushi. This was cut beautifully and was a great little amuse bouche starter. After the starter, we got into the real fun. I chose the lobster tail with red beet and star anise mayo. This was an excellent starting dish with a lot of  subtle complexity to it. My next two courses were the shrimp toast and duck breast with sichuan hot bean sauce. The shrimp toast was one of those dishes that has left me thinking about it days later. It sounds weird as shrimp toast is normally just an appetizer that is deeply fried at a lot of Chinese restaurants. Instead, this was turned into a real delight and stand alone dish. The duck breast was just as innovative and wonderful. The heat from the sauce was just right and the duck breast was beautifully done. I ended things with the walnut tart and ice cream. This had just the right amount of sweetness to it and was a great way to end things. I can't speak highly enough of Han 202. The experience was a home run at every point. Add in that it's BYO, and you have a real winner. I can't wait for my next trip here.

39.description: Yelp has made my life better.  Through Yelp we met Yvonne B. and because of her, we were introduced to Han 202.  We've eaten at this BYOB twice and the second time was even better than the first.Both of our visits were on Saturday nights when reservations are a must. I would suggest that you make yours for an early time because the restaurant does get quite loud as the night goes on.  It only takes one person who is loud and the volume in the whole place goes up.  (When two such people joined the table next to us the room got extremely loud.)Here's the new system which was different for us along with the updated decor.  They have a prix fixe of 35.00 with no upcharges.  The old system was ten dollars less but had many extra charges for items such as rice.  I like this new system much better and I think the portion size increased.We were served a treat from the chef of crab and pork belly which was delicious.  (I preferred this to the old system of the fries.) This inspired me to have major meat in every following course.Meaty appetizer - steak with apples that was really unique and tasty.First course - short ribs with mashed potatoes. I was continuing my meat quest with unequaled taste success. Main course - My meat objective was derailed by the shrimp and scallops options. I have a scallops whenever possible vow which trumped the meat quest. It was so flavorful and fabulous that I didn't mind the derailment.Dessert - Chocolate souffle which belied my claim of not being a chocolate person. Now I have to say I am a chocolate souffle person.We left with coupons and a pact to return for the third meeting with Yvonne and M at Han 202. I honor pacts and plus I have a meat quest to try again.

37.description: Decent food, okay service. Far from being an authentic Chinese restaurant, but, a nice area and good for a casual dinner.

0.description: This place is easy to pass up if you don't know it's there -  I just happened to see it while stuck in Sox traffic and am so glad I did! Went here twice with friends - once for lunch and a few weeks later for dinner to take advantage of a discount coupon they provided.  Oddly, we were the only ones there the entire time we were there for lunch, but when we entered, we were chastised for not having reservations. That was kind of weird but we didn't let it spoil our experience.  Both times, the food was wonderful - it tasted fresh with wonderful flavor. We had the crispy calamari, General Tso chicken, noodles, dumplings, Mongolian beef - nothing was a disappointment  The price was reasonable, the service very pleasant and it's very conversation-friendly.  We will definitely go back!

38.description: I love Han 202. A 4 course gourmet meal for prix fixe of $35 is perfect for any night of the week. BYOB is always a plus if you do not mind planning ahead for your wine choice. Husband and I work late on Wednesday nights. We just moved to South Loop and plan to make Han 202 our new regular spot. (sorry Gaetano's in Forest Park ). Excellent food: creative, amazing flavors with good portions. GO! Just don't go on Wednesday nights. We want to get a seat!

51.description: I would have given this place 4 stars the first time I went but the second time was so bad I'm knocking it down to two.I understand this place is BYOB but you cant even open the bottle of wine for me? Ok I moved past that but the food...there was something wrong with every course I ordered.First off you have to go early to avoid a reservation which we did both times we went.  But, because there aren't many people at dinner at 5 pm the servers just stand and stare at you.  This can be awkward!They brought out some truffle fries to try as you are ordering but there is no dipping sauce. The website states you have a soup course but they have eliminated this course and still charge you $25 for the prix fix menu.  Maybe the fries are the substitute. They have also added a few items that are an additional charge.For the salad- I had the stir fry beef with green apple and Parmesan cheese.  I swear I had some cheese that had mold on it.  The previous time there was no cheese on this dish...maybe they should go back to skipping out on the moldy cheese.For the appetizer- I had a beef short rib which was actually jiggling from all the fat as they set the plate down for me.  The actual two bites of meat were delicious.  I wish there was more of it.   The previous time I had the walnut shrimp which was good I wish I hadn't been wanting to try something different.  For the entree- I had a shrimp and scallop and spicy brown garlic sauce.  This wasn't horrible it just wasn't what I was expecting based on the description.  This says nothing about vegetables and yet the dish is mostly various odd vegetables.  I previously had the general tao chicken which is good but I wanted to try something I couldn't get from my local Chinese take-out.  My date got the duck breast which he said was good.  You have to pay extra for a side of rice seriously?And for dessert- I paid an extra $5 for creme brulee that was ice cold in the center.not sure if I'll be back but if I do I will go with my original choices and not try anything new!

27.description: Can't help wondering why some residents in Bridgeport or any where else would even think the food here is anything but mediocre. Originally from Bridgeport, saw Han 22 on Check please, was excited to go back to the neighborhood. Took my daughter, her husband and my wife for my daughters B-day. The excitement soon faded. We all ordered different courses and tried each others food, sadly I didn't fine any of the dishes even remotely good. I've been wondering after moving up North some yrs ago if my taste has changed from when I lived near there? The bill was over $200.00 w/tipand I had that feeling of being ripped off. After leaving, I asked my daughter and her husband what their opinion was, they tried being polite but I felt a little unease in their answer. So, Bridgeport people, I think you have to broaden your horizons, head out North, you just might strike Gold.

32.description: I'm completely baffled by the scores of positive reviews of Han 202 as I was thoroughly disappointed with my meal. The menu has a very weak theme of "Chinese fusion", which in reality is a hodgepodge of traditional Chinese offerings and classical French/American dishes with the occasional Asian influence. The menu items are painfully conservative in nature and have no direction or vision. Execution is unacceptably subpar given the rudimentary nature of the technical errors. Unless you are fixated on the concept of prix fixe dining and don't want to break the bank, there really isn't much reason to go to Han 202.A quick summary of what I had:- "Tuna Sandwich" amuse-bouche: completely bland and the texture of the bread was between stale and toasted. I didn't see the point of starting the meal off with something so lifeless.- Smoked salmon salad: the salmon was far too salty and tasted like it might have come out of a package.- Salt & Pepper Calamari: the calamari was seasoned well and I enjoyed the onion/bell pepper garnish (despite my confusion with what the chef was going for here) but the squid was not cooked long enough and was visibly under-fried. Why not just leave it in there for another 30 seconds to make it golden brown?- Rack of Lamb: more issues with technique, as it was clear that the pan used to cook the lamb was not hot enough. No sear whatsoever on the meat, leaving a fatty and unappealing texture to the crust. The lamb was served at room temperature and the bonito plum sauce was a complete afterthought; I tasted neither components of the sauce.- Hot Chocolate Soufflé: this was the only satisfactory preparation of the night. Nice presentation as the soufflé rose quite nicely, and the dish was not overly sweet. A reasonably good ending to what was a disappointing meal overall.I will not be back for a second visit.

54.description: A group of us (6 people total) dined here on a Saturday a few weeks ago for dinner.  First I would like to comment on the food.  It was very good!  From the taste to the portions, I would say that it is really good Chinese food.  The quail appetizer I had was seasoned and cooked well and just sings.  The Peking duck was one of the most delicious duck I have ever had plated in a simple and elegant way.  The chocolate dessert was also good.  Also, this is BYOB so that is always good.Now let me comment on the service.  It was bad!  We had a reservation for 6 at 8:00pm and we were seated around 9:00pm.  This would have been fine except that there were a lot of empty seats for 2 or 4 people at 8:00pm, the time of our reservation.  A simple seating logistics excercise by the host could have easily rearranged the tables to accomodate 6 people and we would have been seated on time.  The wait staff did mention menu items that were already sold out when we were ordering so some of us had to make other choices when it was time to serve the original order.  On top of that, the wait staff were not that attentive.  We have to call their attention multiple times to come to our table for simple things like water.Now for the price.  This restaurant advertises their menu as prix fixe.  This is only kinda correct.  There were items on the menu that requires a supplement amount in addition to the prix fixe amount.  The entree items with suppliment was acceptable  but the dessert menu suppliment was rediculous.  Out of the 7 desssert item available, 5 has a suppliment.  Keep in mind that desert if part of the whole menu.  Why don't they charge just $30 instead of $25 if most of the deserts are with suppliment!  I believe people will still pay $30 because the food is that good!

48.description: We were looking for a new place to go and this place definitely fit the bill. $35 prix fixe and BYOB, we decided to give Han 202 a try. Its not your typical Chinese restaurant with all the colorful decorations with the typical menu choices. Its more of a French inspired upscale Chinese place with unusual pairing and a modern atmosphere. The service was very good and the food was flavorful and presented nicely. We had the green apple and steak salad along with the red beet salad for the first course. I really liked the green apple salad but didn't really like the beet salad, which isn't surprising because I don't like beets. Next we had the won tons and the crab rangoon and walnut shrimp appetizer which were both very good. For our main courses we had the fried noddles with scallops, shrimp, and sea bass in a sauce (I forgot what kind) and the red snapper in a garlic jalapeno sauce (I think that's what it was). They were both very good and the portions were just right. We finished off the meal with the hot chocolate souffle and this ice cream like dish with berries (sorry I forgot the name) which were both light and very tasty. All in all we really enjoyed our meal and service at Han 202 and will surely add it to the rotation.

44.description: Stopped into HAN 202 because of the TV show "Check Please." The segment they had on the show made us immediately want to try it. We called our best couple friends, and made a reservation for the next week. Boy, are we glad we did. It was a fantastic experience! Each course was delicious, and it was great to go as a party of 4, because each person got something different that everyone could try. I don't think there was a bad dish at our table. SO good! The complaints on here about it being "expensive," I do not get. $25 a person, and you get a soup, salad, appetizer, entree, and a dessert. Completely affordable and reasonable. And it's BYOB, which actually makes it even more affordable. We went on a busy Friday night, so service was a little slow, but once we got our order in, the pace of the meal was great. Five stars!

24.description: We really enjoyed Han 202 and their pre-fix options on a Mother's Day we went.  Will definitely go back.

7.description: I am making this review as short as possible. Listen if you are looking for a five star dinning experience then check this spot out. I was shocked by the price I couldn't believe that a four course meal of that caliber could be so inexpensive. I am not going to describe the food, trust me it is better if you just go and try it out.

49.description: In fairness, I can't review the food because I didn't have the opportunity to try it.  I'm giving a one-star review because Han202 very nearly ruined a trip to Chicago.  We had wanted to try Han202 before moving away from the city but didn't get a chance to, so for my spouse's birthday trip, I planned a surprise party there with about a dozen friends.  I started planning a couple months before the trip and was pleased with how responsive the manager was to my emails to set everything up and confirm all the details.  When I called a week before to provide the final headcount, I found out that they had forgotten to write the reservation into their books, so they would not be able to accommodate us.  The manager was not onsite when I called and never responded to follow up emails and calls.    This left me scrambling at the last minute to find a spot for a large group on a Friday night, which fortunately resolved itself.  But on lack of customer service alone, I have to give a one-star review.

40.description: I do like this restaurant - delicious food for a very reasonable price (prix fixe $35). But BEWARE -  I ordered an iced tea, which came in a very modest sized glass, and asked for a refill, and I was charge $8. My husband did the same so we paid $16 for iced tea - outrageous. It's BYOB, so next time, I'm bringing snapple.

53.description: Really bummed we wasted a Saturday night here. The menu looked inspired and interesting, but the food ended being bland and mediocre. Staff was very friendly but service overall was pretty bad from explaining dishes to food service to delivering a correct check. Obviously not going back!

30.description: It was an absolutely frigid evening. The snow fell as giant crystals, as I parked on a side street and walked over. I met my friend out front. The curtains were closed. Afraid that we had caught Han 202 on a night that they were closed, I pulled on the door. It opened.The host and waitress gave warm hellos and sat us down near the kitchen (per our request to stay as far away from the bitter cold as possible). Besides, I always like sitting next to the kitchen so that I can look in and see the artists at work. After warming up with some hot tea, we ordered from the $35 prix fixe menu. My friend began with an arugula salad, which he said was quite good. I personally have never been a fan of arugula, so I went with another option (there were three): Octopus Terrine. It was at this point that I realized how blended the cuisine was. The delicious purple arms of the octopus had been stuck together with gelatin to form a slice. The taste was a little fishy, but mostly it was savory. It was a filling appetizer that I would likely get again.Next came out the first entree. After explanations of the dish by our hosts (a little to formal for my typical yelp cell pictures), we chowed down. My friend received Shanghai Dumplings that looked mouthwateringly good. My own platter was less memorable...seriously, I can't remember it, and I ate there less than a week ago. With that said, I do vaguely recall it tasting good, so there you go!Then, it was time for the main course. Upon our waitress' recommendation, we both had their take on filet mignon. It was amazing. The sweet taste of the Chinese sauce mixed well with the caramelized onions and perfectly cooked medium steak. For those of you less in love with red meat, there were not one but two different fish options on the menu. Finally, it was time for dessert and coffee. Of all the good cuisines that I had at Han 202, nothing surpassed the decadent, yet light taste of my Hot Chocolate Souffle. I just couldn't stop eating this dessert until each and every crumb had been expertly slurped up. I also indulged in an organic French-pressed coffee. It was a little on the pricy side ($6), but after a meal like that I'll forgive that standard practice of the restaurant industry. Verdict: Han 202 ended up truly impressing me. In fact, I felt bad that such horrid weather had really put a damper on such a good restaurant. So next time you are in Bridgeport on a freezing evening stop by Han 202, and tell them Andrew sent you!

46.description: This is a great affordable date night. I can't give it more stars for a few reasons. Perhaps it was our fault. We had a 8p reservation on a Wednesday. We were the last party seated for the evening.   Our food was accurate to our order; decent portions; high quality & tasty. But our service and experience was lackluster. We had to ask for an ice bucket for our champagne. Our price fix courses were so rushed that we could not savor our courses. The staff was lingering and standing around so much that our conversations were frequently interrupted and if we were having a private conversation it would have been uncomfortable.  We are Southsiders. We will try again. But will likely only be attracted during peak hours-- as we believe the pacing would improve or we may not notice the flaws so clearly.

1.description: Honest review: best Chinese restaurant ever this restaurant is so good!! It is so cheap to only 35 dollars a person and now there is a coupon for 20% off if u come get for first course- lobster, second course foie gras and fries, entree lamb dessert tartlet u will thank me!! The service is great they are so nice like she is one of the best waiters I ever had. The parking is great there's a lot of street parking. The ambiance is really nice and romantic perfect date spot. They play really nice music like Andrea bocheliIt's a byob and no courage fee!!! But if there's more then 4 people just two dollars a person which is a steel!  More pictures in old review if u have questions on what to get u can message me! Read older review for my reviews on duck confit sald, lobster sald, foi gras and fries, lamb, and duck walnut tartlet, and cholate soufle Free course: they always give u a little free sample before every meal. Now it's a salmon tartar macaroon with a Kiki sauce this is the best thing I have ever eaten this would be my last meal it is so good. The salmon is supper fresh the sauce on it is so great idk what's on it but it's so good. The macaroon is really crisp and sweet the best macaroon of my life so good. Then the kiwi sauce is supper tart so it cuts through the richness and the sweetnessFirst courses: arugula with white truffle oil and Parmesan cheese this was really good because they put a lot of truffle oil and so much Parmesan cheese then there was so much arugula this was so delicious really was great don't be disappointed that there's no meat it is one of the best salads of my life a vegetarian would love this not to overdressed what I loved is there was a lot of truffle oil whenever u order something with truffle oil at another restaurant they only put like a little drop of it not here they don't try to skimp the customer out of anything.Norwegian smoked salmon with watercress and capers- this one has a lot of salmon like a lot and the smokey ness compliments everything so perfectly. The capers were perfect not to salty not to briny the dressing was perfect it went so well with everything nothing was overpowering really filling and delicious Second course- crab cake with chive and green apple: u have to pay an additional 8 dollars but that's okay because this was so good! Best crab cake I have ever eaten. It is so crunchy perfect texture and it's not greasy at all. There is so much crab meat in it like its all crab no filler. The inside filling is so good. The green apple on top was perfect because it's tart and it cuts through the richness of the crab cake.Diver scallop with white chocolate sabayon sauce. You have to pay an additional 8 dollars for this course. The scallop was supper tender not overlooked had great flavor. The white chocolate sauce was really good really sweet the problem was that this dish is too sweet it needs something spicy really acidic or something bitter to contrast the sweetness of the white chocolate because scallops are a little sweet on there own already so it needs something!Salt and pepper calamari with diced onion and bell pepper- I didn't get to taste this there was a lot of calamari like slot the bowl was filled my brother ate this in like two seconds n my mom got a bite n said she loved itThird course: miso marinated Chilean sea bass with root purée. You have to pay an additional 10 dollars. Every time I'm given to eat Chilean sea bass I do because it's supper expensive at the grocery store one of the best tasting fishes. The texture of the fish was perfect not over cooked supper tender. All the condiments on the dish went well with the fish nothing to over powering. The problem was the fish was a little to salty idk what it was maybe the chef added to much salt.Ribeye steak with red wine hoisin sauce. You have to pay an additonal 10 dollars for this course. I love steak I am a meat eater the steak was a high quality steak ahad alot of great flavor. This is the most tenderest steak I have ever eaten it was cooked perfectly did not even need a knife to cut it. The purees were great because there sweet and it goes great with the saltyness of the salt perfect combination. Only problem was it needed salt chef might have forgoten to season the actual steaklast course dessert:The crembule this was just a simple normal one nothing special about it I wish there was something special about it but there isnt I wouldnt get it again because you could get it anywhereChocolate Truffle with vanilla parfait: This was really good I didnt like the chocolate by itself but the icecream really made this really good there needs to be a wow factor thoughChocolate cake: Ran out of cheese cake so they gave us this nothing special it was good but no wow factor.For desserts I would just get tartlet and soufle this are the ones I liked the best

55.description: Maybe my expectations were too high after reading so many good reviews, but I didn't love this place.First, I ordered a small mackeral salad.  The mackeral was really fishy tasting and a bit mushy feeling in my mouth.  Another person at my table ordered this same salad and didn't care for it either.   For the appetizer course, I had a beef dumpling of sorts. It was OK.  My husband had a little bowl with three dumplings and he only ate one of them andhe rarely leaves food on a plate.  The entree was very good.  I had duck with a sechuan sauce.  It was spicy and flavorful.  My husband and another person at our table had a tasty sea bass that they loved.  Everyone was pleased with their entree.  My dessert consisted of, seriously, 1/4 of a scoop of coconut ice with two berries (really, two).  I am not a big sweets eater, so I didn't opt for one of the other desserts on the menu, since they were all an additional $7.00 up-charge. The rest of my table ordered the $7.00 extra desserts,  and they did look and taste good.  The coffee tasted a little like scummy water,  served in individual press-pots.The menu said it is a fixed price of $25.00, but it's really fixed price from $25.00 to  $42.00, since all of the desserts except for one were $7,00 extra, several of the entree selections were $7.00 extra, and to add brown rice to your meal was an extra $2.00. The coffee was $6.00, so a meal with no alcohol was still $48.00 for three of the people at our table.  I do expect a better meal than we got for $48.00.  We brought a bottle of wine, and there was no corkage fee, which was great.  But then they gave us this really cheap, hard to use corkscrew - the kind that doesn't have handles to push down, so it took us a long time to wrestle our wine open.  I recommend anyone who plans to come here to bring your own corkscrew with your wine.Oh, and the seats were really uncomfortable.  I sat on a wood bench along the wall could have used a cushion.    It was really hard to keep in a sitting position by the end of the dinner.

9.description: This restaurant is an interesting combination of Asian/Western influences, located slightly out of way from major restaurant clusters in the city (bonus: lots of street parking). The food was interesting but a mixed bag.The lobster, rib eye steak and pork chop were highlights, as the main ingredients were cooked perfectly (there was slight unevenness in steak doneness, but we had a large party and they only had two chefs in the kitchen so it's understandable). The scallop was a bit fishy and could have used a little bit of caramelization in a pan. The lemon cheesecake was delicious, but the chocolate souffle had no chocolate flavor and was very bland. It seems there's an attempt at creativity but some of the dishes really need a bit more work before they can shine.

26.description: The ambiance, food and service are exceptional. It's a true gem in the Bridgeport area. I first found this place on Check Please. And I second the positive reviews on the show.The ambiance is very clean and pleasant. The food is creative and delicious. And the service is also excellent.The prix fixe menu is highly recommended. Though we came for lunch, we were still able to order from that menu.

25.description: BYOB- absolute plus.So each time I've been here, it was empty. I'm not sure why they are empty because they food here is quite good. You can tell the chef has a deep passion for food and his work by the way presentation. For $35 you get like a 4 or 5 course meal. I honestly liked all of them. Unfortunately, it's been a few months since I've gone there so I don't remember the names of the food I ordered. Nonetheless, I will definitely go back.

12.description: This place u might miss and pass thousand times but never get in. But yea, give them a try u will surprise yourself. How come this place not get any Michelin star yet? I'm asking myself.The scollop with white chocolate sauce is amazing. The best I have ever had in my life. Scollop is very juicy and tender, can't feel too strong about the white chocolate taste, but it gave this item very nice balance of favor.The shrimp toast? So dame good!!!!!! Crispy out with sesame seeds and soft bread for the bite with tiger shrimp. Everything are good here, I don't usually say that besides I did once by the hotel restaurant by Las Vegas.I tips $131.00 for me and my wife, that show my respect to the food and the chef who made the food. And the great service as well. I will go back for sure!

59.description: Amazing five course meal for $25, BYOB, super considerate staff, a bustling but relaxed atmosphere (at least on Saturday evening when I was there). This is the kind of dining experience that stays with you and satiates you for at least three days.

21.description: Is it possible for a place that is listed in Michelin's Bib Gourmand to be under-rated and a bit under the radar? When it comes to Han 202, I think the answer is yes. I am absolutely shocked that this placed isn't packed night in, night out. A friend had been here for a wine dinner a few months ago, and from that visit several of us have been chomping at the bit to come here. So, knowing that they are BYO, a bunch of friends and I came down here for a wine dinner.We all started off with a piece of Tuna sushi. This was cut beautifully and was a great little amuse bouche starter. After the starter, we got into the real fun. I chose the lobster tail with red beet and star anise mayo. This was an excellent starting dish with a lot of  subtle complexity to it. My next two courses were the shrimp toast and duck breast with sichuan hot bean sauce. The shrimp toast was one of those dishes that has left me thinking about it days later. It sounds weird as shrimp toast is normally just an appetizer that is deeply fried at a lot of Chinese restaurants. Instead, this was turned into a real delight and stand alone dish. The duck breast was just as innovative and wonderful. The heat from the sauce was just right and the duck breast was beautifully done. I ended things with the walnut tart and ice cream. This had just the right amount of sweetness to it and was a great way to end things. I can't speak highly enough of Han 202. The experience was a home run at every point. Add in that it's BYO, and you have a real winner. I can't wait for my next trip here.

17.description: Absolutely nothing to brag about. The portions were tiny (of course). But it just wasn't filling. The food wasn't like omg, every penny worth, kudos to the chef, absolutely nothing. Nothing more, nothing less.

10.description: Shhhhhhh......I've gotta fantabulous Chicago SECRET!Han 202 is modern and clean yet very warm and comfortable. It was cool watching the chefs prepare our meal. The food was delicious and perfectly portioned. Since the menu is always changing, it won't matter what I recommend, but I sampled my girlfriend's plates and EVERYTHING was so tasty! BTW--The deserts are to die for!The lighting was perfect and the music was quiet and atmospheric. Oh, and the bathrooms were immaculate!. (I do have one complaint--that mirror in the woman's bathroom was made for a Philistine. Who's THAT tall, really? Short girls take note: Bring your own little mirror.)Aside from that, this is the PERFECT spot for impressing a date, in-law, boss, whoever...It is so 'off the grid', you'll feel in the know. The biggest surprise was the restaurant wasn't more crowded!BONUS: There are tons of metered spots available on the street  Hey, on a weekend this isn't a 'plus' you take lightly!It really hurts to say this, but, I'm getting that sinking feeling...this place won't be a secret for long. (Especially when BIG mouths like me start talking...)Oh wait!  Here's my shout-out to Lisa!  Thanks for the great service.

5.description: This is NOT CLOSED!  And it's very good. A great deal for a delicious dinner. Do try it!

3.description: Americans are so used to Chinese restaurants being fast and cheap and not very special. Han 202 is a wonderful exception, especially for the price. We did the PRIS FIXE MENU ($35 for 4 plates plus a bonus starter). We brought our own beer (a bottle of wine looks nicer in the ELEGANT, MODERN ATMOSPHERE, but we just filled up our large wine glasses and they took the beer bottles). My husband had: bonus starter egg custard tartelette, shrimp dumpling (he skipped the salad, and substituted this for $5 extra), the shanghai dumpling, the Mongolian beef, and the chocolate soufflé and poached pear. I had: bonus starter egg custard tartelette, smoked salmon salad, shanghai (pork) dumpling, ma po tofu (with ground beef), and the walnut tart.WE WERE VERY PLEASED WITH EVERYTHING! Everything was a surprise and a delight. Elegantly served and arranged too.Some comments: ON THE TWO TYPES OF DUMPLING: two men (one being my husband) liked the soy-vinegar-ginger dipping sauce on the shanghai dumplings so much that they drank the rest of it from the little bowl (including mine!). I thought it was really good, but would have preferred a less vinegar-y sauce. Obviously subjective.We both loved our entrees. IF YOU LIKE SPICY DISHES, those are good ones to get! (Mongolian beef and ma po tofu with ground beef--perhaps you can ask them to omit the ground beef (?) if you are vegetarian).We both REALLY LIKED OUR DESSERTS too, though I found it hard to eat the walnut tart with a large, thick edged spoon...I had to use my finger to get it on the spoon as it kept just sliding across the plate. The spoon was too thick to slide underneath the pastry. Perhaps an extra fork would have helped. My husband also loved the soufflé and pear, but I thought the soufflé would be more nicely presented in a little dish, rather than a paper cupcake liner (a minor point). The walnut tart by the way has a lot of dried fruit in it--the flavor is mainly dried cranberry, raisin and perhaps something like candied orange peel. Very good!THE SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT.

35.description: We have  been going to this restaurant since it opened and it only keeps getting better.  Chef Danny is amazing with his creations.  Everything is delicious and beautifully presented.  We drive in from the Northern suburbs once a week, we love it so much. It is well worth the drive.  The $35 Prix Fix coupled with BYOB makes it an unforgettable meal for an unbelievable price.  I almost always get one of the fish dishes for my main course because it is always so fresh but I'm always torn as his rack of lamb is the best ever.  Although many reviews call it a Chinese Restaurant, it is more of a French influence.  You won't be disappointed.  Be sure to make a reservation.

19.description: I went for a birthday dinner and got the 4 course pre fixe menu for $35. The food wasn't all that great; except for the smoked salmon which was really good. When we got to dessert I ordered the chocolate soufflé but when I tasted it, I though it was nasty and wanted to swap it out for the crem brûlée instead. The "manager" proceeds to tell me that I can't swap out my dessert for another and if I did she would have to charge me "extra" . Needless to say I won't be going back.

28.description: Expensive for what it is. At the price point, I expected a little more from Hans 202 (better prepared food, bigger rice portions?). My "rack of lamb" was charred on the outside and tasteless, the only accompaniment to it being corn. My friend's vegetable stir fry was soupy and resembled what you would find in a Chinese restaurant run by non Chinese. A plus about this place? It's BYOB. Take your $35 bucks and enjoy a nice dinner at Potsticker House, also in Bridgeport.

45.description: I'm writing this to refute reviews by other customers who have been seemingly educated in a cardboard box under the Western Ave bridge. It upsets me to see people vomiting false statements on their computer screen about an establishment that serves high quality food in a neighborhood peppered with Pall Mall smoking degenerates (I can say that because I live 2 blocks away.) Also, who gives a restaurant one star for not being open? Yelp needs to add a filter.My friend and I decided to do an early dinner here about two months ago. There isn't a parking lot but there is ample, or, INFINITE amount of street parking. Valet parking downtown is much more expensive then the $3.00 street parking - so fork up the measly $3.00. You're going to a fine dining restaurant and count your blessings for it not being located on Michigan Ave where no parking is available.We entered the establishment WITHOUT a reservation and was seated at a open table. You do NOT need reservations if you are there early enough, or, if there are no reserved tables - which isn't likely. I highly recommend getting reservations but they are not needed unless you feel like gambling on an open table. Again, not uncommon in fine dining restaurants.The BYOB is definitely an attractive quality so we decided to purchase a bottle of wine before our arrival. Our waitress proceeded to open the bottle promptly (no cork fee, no fuss whatsoever.) In fact, the waitress suggested pairings to the red wine we brought. I'm unsure of why reviewers state they won't open the bottle, and even if they just provide the bottle opener and do not open, it's not like you have to run the Iron Man triathlon. It takes all of 10 seconds.Onto the waitress, YES, they do stand at the far side of the room facing the tables - but they are not staring at YOU. They are staring at your tables to make sure you are comfortable or ready for your next course, refill of water..etc. I'm SHOCKED to hear people complain about this kind of service. This isn't a negative. If you're embarrassed about having a waitress or waiter see you cramming an entire duck down your gullet, then learn how to properly use your knife and cut your meal accordingly.
