My friend used the bathroom and left her napkin on the table so the waitress came over and folded it nicely and laid it back on the table then left. Curse you, fine dining!We ordered an appetizer, entree, our main courses and dessert. Each was equally good as the last. Some portions were small but rightfully so. I do not like my appetizer to be larger then the main course. My friend has a very sensitive palate and she concluded it was of very, very good quality. I personally thought it was spectacular. I'm sorry my detail isn't great but it has been a couple weeks and I can't seem to find the menu online (which would have jogged my memory.)I found the price to be reasonable, but after reading other reviews you'd think it's Alinea. You have to remember this is fine dining in a neighborhood used to pizza places and Italian beef stands - where apparently $3.00 parking breaks the bank. Expect to pay for quality food. That should go without saying.Overall, I'm very pleased by this establishment and look forward to going again. Be smart. Either go there early for a table or make a reservation. BYOB it. If you go all out with a party of two (appetizers, entrees, desserts) expect $90.00 bill without tip. Not bad for great food.

33.description: After reading many good reviews of Han 202, my friend and I decided to have dinner there last night. The evening started out with promise and we were seated immediately without reservations. The wait staff was pleasant and attentive and the food was good. The prix fixe menu price of $35 was clearly listed on the menu at the table and, though the reviews we read might have been older and touted the prix fixe at $25, we didn't mind the difference and stayed. We enjoyed our meal and when our server asked if we'd like coffee or tea with our dessert, we asked if they de-caf tea. Our server said they did not and offered de-caf coffee instead, which we agreed on. The coffee arrived a few minutes later, with each of us getting a one cup French press. The bill arrived and we each threw in a credit card and asked our server to split the bill and when we looked at the final amount on our tab, we had each been charged $45. Needless to say, we were surprised and wondered how a $70.00 bill became a $90 bill. I was flabbergasted to see that the coffee was $12!! Even Starbucks doesn't charge $6 for one small cup of coffee. (There was no price for coffee on their menu and all the teas were a reasonable $2.50-$3.00)I called our server over and asked about the charge (which was after our credit cards had been processed.) I explained that we were surprised by the price of the coffee and had we known we would be paying $12, we would not have ordered it. I was very nice to the server and I explained that we would like the owner or manager to remove at least one of the coffee charges. This is where the evening took a real dive for us. The server immediately shut down, stonewalling our effort to mollify the situation. She refused to adjust our bill, refused to pass along our request to speak to either the manager or owner and she said the owner was not there. When I asked who was the manager on duty, she said she was the manager. At this point, I was still being very reasonable and I explained that we enjoyed the meal and the service, and we didn't want to punish the waitstaff for the restaurant's issue. However, we explained that we would have no choice but to leave without adding a tip if the situation wasn't rectified. I asked one more time nicely and said, "if you are the manager, you must have discretion over this." She said the owner would "punish" her anyway. My response was an incredulous, "Really? You work for a guy that would be that abusive to his staff?" She got a glassy look  and started to walk away. Since there was a pen on the table with the bill, I wrote a note to the owner, explaining why we left without leaving a tip, which I felt bad about. And, suggesting that he pass the $12 on to the waitstaff and eat the couple of bucks it cost him for the coffee. It's unfortunate when an otherwise good restaurant has horrible customer service skills. In any establishment, a customer complaint should be met with compromise and there was nothing offered in this situation. In the end, they suffered far more than a $12 loss. First, because the situation drew attention from nearby diners. We warned them of the price of coffee on our way out and suggested they pay close attention to their bill before throwing their credit card on the table. We said the same thing to the dozen or so people who were waiting in line near the door. In addition, I am writing this review, which may dissuade some folks from going, and in the end, I will NEVER go back and I will only have a bad memory and a reason to diss this place. It all goes to show that bad word of mouth spreads 100X faster than good word of mouth....that alone is enough to give away a cup of coffee.The pros: Efficient Service, ample portions, tasty food and good location with plenty of parking.The cons: Very noisy with no sound dampening, inflexible management with a really bad attitude.

43.description: Definitely a twist to the Chinese food I grew up with - and about time! Chef really made a fancy display of Chinese food. We went with the Pre Fixe menu for my birthday and since it was the first time. Started with a beautiful lobster and beet salad with goat cheese. Lobster was fantastic and fresh!! Others included arugula and truffle oil salad, salmon salad, also fresh. Crispy quail, scallop and dumplings were the next courses. All very fresh. Main entrees were pork chops, red snapper and General Tso's chicken... Fish was delicious!!!! Dessert was pretty good. Blueberry tart.... Chocolate soufflé and crème brûlée hit the spot.

2.description: Han 202 one of the best restaurant I have been thus far.   I enjoyed the atmosphere clean and fresh!  Our host was very nice.  Every course was explained to me as to what ingredients it contained.  From my salad to to desert was an experience that I will not forget. I visited Han 202 I was explained the name of its restaurant what it meant a little history to gonwith your dinner

18.description: I went here with my girlfriend for the first time not to long after it open and I also saw this place on check please. Its located in the heart of the Bridgeport neighborhood. The restaurant is really nice inside with a nice decor. My girlfriend and I had the prefixe menu which was good. The only thing about is the portion is not big so if u are planning to be full, eat a snack before hand so you won't be leaving hungry. I like this place and it's good that I had lunch that day earlier cuz the portion size isn't enough for me but I would go back to this place if I am in the neighborhood.

41.description: Instead of the price fixe, I opted for two small entrees for the same cost. The snapper was great- highly recommended. Great sauce with it too. The chicken (like a generals) was not very good. BYOB was a plus too.

52.description: Great place for real Chinese food and not the Americanized version of what they call Chinese food !!!

50.description: Our night at Han 202 featured:Quiet eleganceExquisite prix fixe 25.00 mealPlus time spent with fabulous Yelpers!What a magnificent time, I can't wait to come back.  My hubby and I sank into the comfy seats rather than the bench seating and were immediately comfortable.  The room was small and understated with an easy noise level so we were able to converse freely.  The service was divine, they even immediately fixed the soap dispenser when I mentioned the pump wasn't working.  And the food, glorious food!  They gave us a complimentary plate of french fries with truffle oil and chopped onions.  They also provided wine glasses, a bottle opener and a bucket of ice for our champagne plus fresh glasses when we switched from wine to champagne.  (Cheers!)I chose the salmon for my appetizer which was pleasant but I didn't finish.  I followed that with the Shanghai steamed dumplings with a delicious plum sauce.  I ate all three!  With glee! My main course was the General Tao which was thisclose to the outermost range of my spiciness range.  I really enjoyed it and ordered the not included brown rice to accompany it.   For dessert I had a cunning little mini cupcake which was just perfect.  I added their full bodied French press coffee and walked out of there satiated in a most content way!Thank you so much Yvonne B and M who introduced us to the divine eatery. They are delightful dinner companions and really know their restaurants! I cannot recommend this sanctuary of civilized eating enough.  I will lead by example and make reservations for a return visit very soon!

4.description: EVERY SINGLE BITE WAS ECSTASY. It's the only way in my limited gastronomical vocabulary I can express what I experienced eating at this gem tonight.

6.description: Delicious food at reasonable prices. Each course was delicious and fresh. Great find :)

22.description: Fine dining in a comfortable atmosphere at an affordable price (BYOB).Thoughtful four-course menu with FANTASTIC sushi to hearty meats with flavorful sauces (duck breast is a favorite) to chocolate soufflé. All for $35. First visit was a party of two. Tonight was a party of 13 people. Consistent in quality. If you don't believe me, Google. The professional reviews praise Han 202 and its chef. And with good reason. Stop reading and make a reservation. You'll be very happy you did.

15.description: This is a wonderful dining choice in Bridgeport that is easy to find with plenty of street parking.  My party of four especially enjoyed it following a ballgame at the Cell. The atmosphere is modern with plenty of natural light and a spotless open kitchen. Host and servers are warm and welcoming.  The fixed price menu is well presented and reasonably priced. All food items were explained upon serving.  A complimentary amuse was a sweet little custard tart followed by four courses.  The sea bass, General Tso chicken, vegetables, dumplings, salad were all fresh tasting and beautifully presented. Blueberry desserts were delicious and not too sweet. The BYO policy also makes this very appealing.  Loved it.

57.description: Excellent!!!!Loved it! I live in Bridgeport and finally made it here! Service was great. Previous post mentioned a language barrier...have to say we had no language barrier at all. Presentation was beautiful. Taste was exceptional . Price point was extremely reasonable. Now 4 courses for $25. BYOB No corking charge. Fish, beef and chicken choices. Went with my husband and 12 year daughter who has a sophisticated palate.  Not for kids looking fit Mac and cheese. We all loved our choices.

20.description: Although I can't comment on the quality of the food, I'm giving it the lowest rating possible. Reason?  Went in there with a friend one day. The place was empty.  Not a single customer in there. We asked for a table, and they refused to seat us because we didn't have a reservation. We were told that they require a reservation in order to eat there. I asked why we would need a reservation seeing as how there is no one in there and there were obviously tables available. They said it's their policy and we would have to come back another time, and they refused to serve us. I can understand needing a reservation when the place is packed, but even when it's completely empty? The food could be the best in the world, but I have no way of knowing. They obviously didn't want our business that bad, and they won't ever get it now.

36.description: I had to pick a place for a party of 6 for a friend's birthday. My husband suggested Han 202 with the idea that a prix fix menu and BYOB combo would be easy for bill time since there is one non-drinker, etc.... We had been once before and I thought it was good. BUT --WOW! Things have changed at Han 202 - and all for the best!Their design immediately caught my eye. It has a new look - new furniture, modern vibe, clean lines and just enough warmth. Service was perfectly friendly and we never felt rushed. There seemed to be some confusion on pricing on past reviews. Their prix fix price is $35 for 4 courses - However there is one complimentary starter upon arrival not included in the 4 courses. We each ordered a variety of options from the 4 courses - some meat and some seafood and we were all delighted! If you are looking for a lovely night out - this is worth the visit! The value is amazing - especially for a group. If it's been a while since you've been here, check it out again. You'll be glad you did.My only tip would be - if their is a true vegetarian or vegan member in your party, this may not be the best option.

14.description: BYOB- absolute plus.So each time I've been here, it was empty. I'm not sure why they are empty because they food here is quite good. You can tell the chef has a deep passion for food and his work by the way presentation. For $35 you get like a 4 or 5 course meal. I honestly liked all of them. Unfortunately, it's been a few months since I've gone there so I don't remember the names of the food I ordered. Nonetheless, I will definitely go back.

3.description: Just got my nail and hair done today!!! Ready for the Halloween party. The place is nice. I like the people over there. For sure, I will have second time visit! :)

1.description: Loved they way Mai takes care of her customers. I got a manicure and pedicure spa and so far is great, (except for the temperature of the scrub and lotion, they were cold) they offered me something to drink, and sat me down right away. It only has one pedicure chair and one manicure station FYI. You should probably call before you come just in case. Mai took care of my nails like no other, she didn't stop until they were up to her high standards. She scrubbed my feet and removed callouses very efficiently. She's definitely great at what she does! I will totally come back to get my nails done again, because even though it's a small place, Mai does her best to go above and beyond to satisfy her customers. I definitely recommend this spot. I'm happy to finally find a descent nail salon in Bridgeport. Super awesome!

2.description: This is a really good place. I want cut my hair. Then Mai design and cute my hair with Bob style. She is so professional for that and I love my hair style so much. Then Anna give me a nail  design too with black color with golden shiny power. I give it a name, galaxy or milk way. This is most fancy nail design I have in my life. They have a lot appointments too everyday. A lot of people they like come here to do the hair cut. And their price is reasonable too, much cheaper than salon in chinatown.

5.description: I got my haircut here and would recommend this salon. The service was great, very friendly. Reasonable pricing and loving the cut. The place is kind of small but no big deal.

6.description: My 11-year old got a haircut today, and it was a great experience. It was a drastic cut, and her stylist took the time to listen to what she wanted, asked questions along the way, and afterwards made suggestions on different ways to easily style the cut at home. The salon is tastefully done, and the ladies are very nice.  We'll definitely be back!

7.description: Just cut my hair at Mai's salon, and I had a great talk with the owner. it is awesome to have such a family style salon in the neighborhood!!  Will be Back Soon!

8.description: I got my eye brom trimmed and nail done, it was amazing. Not only the services was nice but also the outcome is astonishing!  I would totally come back and do it again in this salon ! Love the environment and the people !

9.description: I wanted my hair to be short but a bit stylist and Mai's Hairport has done it quite nicely with reasonable price. Overall service is satisfying. For the parking, ask the owner for where to park free.

0.description: Love Mai and her niece is amazing at nails. My father and I just love going here. We are never disappointed everyone is so friendly it's like family! Before I started going there my nails had horrible ridges and gaps for years since going to Mai my nails have grown and are ridge free!! :) and Mai fixed my hair after a major hair catastrophe at Mario Tricoci.

4.description: I did my nail and hair at Mai's Hairport. The crews are really fun and friendly. The price is suppeer reasonable! My nail looks very nice and pretty now.  My hair after hair mask feels a lot smoother, lighter, and healthier. Mai knows what products are good and she knows how to provide value to the customers. Will definitely come back!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

29.description: Yum! We ordered delivery on a Sunday morning...and had the best verde chilaquiles...maybe even ever!  It's easy to do chilaquiles wrong, but these were everything right!  Perfect flavor and spice.  Of course the chips were a little soft, but not soggy. The steak burrito was huge for the price and the fajitas were also fresh and hit the spot. Now our new favorite Mexican takeout because the prices are reasonable for great Mexican food.  (Especially compared to other south loop-ish places like Carbon & Cantina).

42.description: This place has been up and down in terms of the quality over the last several years.  For awhile, I actually stayed away from the place for a awhile.  Fortunately, I learned through two of my sisters that the place has definitely been on the "good" side of things for awhile.  I absolutely crave the Al Pastor burrito.  The seasoning of the pork, mmmm...  Spiced just right and always cooked to perfection to my tastes.  I always ask for everything (minus sour cream and cheese) and ask that they also add onion and cilantro.  These are perfect ingredients to add on  and are a perfect compliment to the pork.  The rice and beans are good enough.  Again, nothing exceptional.  What can you really do to the beans to make them better?  Maybe a little bit more moist (but not super runny like at other places).  I usually put a dollop of their salsa in the beans and it becomes a total treat.  Speaking of the salsa, it's usually very, very good.  A nice combination of ingredients and a good amount of chunky onion and tomato to make it good (but not borderline on a pico de gallo type affair).   The chips that come with it are usually fresh but I'm not overly crazy about them.  They are simply okay (as opposed to the chips at Mama Nena's which are really fresh and good).  I have to say that I also enjoy their steak.  It's prepared very well, good flavor and you get a pretty fair portion.  So, if I find myself not craving Al Pastor (lately, that is rare), I will order a steak taco dinner on flour tortillas with everything plus that onion and cilantro add on request.    I am always deliciously satisfied with the dinner.  The chicken is cooked and spiced simply but it's very good.  Juicy and very pleasing.  I will sometimes order that in the form of a chicken burrito or taco dinner... again, with everything plus onion and cilantro. The tortas are a hit and miss affair, I must admit.  I think the bread was toasted nicely but the most recent one that I had was with their Milanesa (breaded steak) and I was not too impressed.  The sandwich was dry and the breaded steak was very unremarkable and borderline bland.  Now, the Al Pastor torta was a much better experience and the overall sandwich benefited from  it.   Because the pork is more favorable and moist, the balance of the toasted bread and beans was balanced out by it.  I enjoyed it.  The cup of soup they give you when you come in is standard but pleasing fare.  I jazz it up a bit by adding a couple of spoons of that great salsa and it's another treat I enjoy.  Right now, as I type this, I am enjoying their Horchata in a huge "to go" cup.  I enjoy it greatly.  It's got a nice smooth flavor and is my second favorite (Tio Luis is the champ in this category) in the two neighborhoods I go to for easy access meals when I'm not out and about.

23.description: So cheap, so much food, so good.yeeessss !

47.description: Taqueria la Mexicana is a little spot tucked into a building just west of Halsted on 35th. As you walk in- you are reminded of a diner with a short counter with a few stools and simple table, chairs and a few booths inside. On the night we were there- there were only two guys working the place, the cook and the "jack of all trades" guy who was the host, bartender, server and manager all at the same time. We were told to sit anywhere and chose a booth back in the corner. The menu has alot of options of menu combinations to single items to specials of the house with nothing over $10. Chips and salsa were put down in front of us and were replenished when needed. We also got some complimentary soup (sort of a pasta vegetable blend) all before we ordered. We chose simply; the Tostada combination for my friend and Tres Amigos for me (I wanted to try a little of this and that and this combo had three different items). We also ordered a beer and one of their highly touted margaritas. The food was quick to arrive and was just as quickly devoured. While tasty- I think we were both hungry enough that anything would have been quickly put away. As for the drinks? I say stick with the beer. The margarita had that overly sweet taste of a premade mix, and while strong and big (there are two sizes and the large is LARGE!) I didn't really care for it. This place is really reasonable. Dinner for two with drinks was only $28 and they take credit cards which is always a plus in my book! Since most of the bars down this way don't serve food- this will surely go on my list as a place to get cheap food fast on those nights when you need a little fill up!

8.description: This restaurant is down the street from my boyfriend's apartment and I love the food, the place is always empty, so I always get fast service. I have never eaten at the place, I always get it to go.

31.description: I love, love, love this place!Legit Mexican food at great prices, friendly staff & strong, delicious margaritas! (1/2 price on Thursdays)I typically go for tacos, quesadillas, sopes or burritos - no complaints here, I'm happy with my food every time. One Friday after a particularly trying week, I went to dinner with a friend & saw this drink & ordered it - thinking it was a regular margarita with 2 mini coronas... Not at all. It was gigantic & delicious!!! Since my friend doesn't drink, I was going it solo... Let me tell you, I've gotten more out of those $24 than I ever would at any bar. It's essentially 3 margaritas (in one fish bowl of a margarita glass) with 2 full sized Corona's flipped into it. It tastes like iced tea with lemonade. Yum! Careful, though, if you're not sharing, it will: Mess. You. Up. Trust me.I recommend this place for food and/or drinks 10/10 times. You just can't go wrong, especially not for the price.

34.description: $1 tacos on certain days of the week.  The best are carnitas tacos on Thursdays.  My husband really likes them and picks them up on his way home from work.  We've eaten at the restaurant only twice and the service and food is good.  We've carried out about 20 times.

16.description: I would give this piece of shit place 0 stars if I could. Their food is garbage...like straight trash. Their customer service is pathetic and they love to rush you when making an order. And by the way, don't make any mistakes when you dine in at this place because you will be undoubtedly punished for it. This is the only place in my 26 years of living that I have seen that will not make changes on your order without making you pay for another order. We are the customers and they are supposed to make us feel comfortable by accommodating us with anything we need. What a pathetic group of idiots that work there. Everybody that works there are morons, and prejudice. They do not like African-American people coming into their establishment. When you see this place run the other way!! It's not worth the hassle of being treated poorly. They are cowards and they are also unprofessional in person and on the phone. When I called to complain about the incident that happened at the restaurant the previous night they all had attitudes and were rude to me and my girlfriend. The owner even dropped and f bomb, threatened me and my girlfriend as well as telling us we are no longer allowed in their whack ass restaurant. I would never recommend this place to anybody. Avoid it like the plague, you can spend your hard earned money elsewhere. Fuck them! 0 out of 5 stars

13.description: So cheap, so much food, so good.yeeessss !

11.description: The way my meal started, I thought for sure I'd be giving this place 5 stars. Heard nothing but good about it and wanted to give it a try, so I stopped in for dinner.When I walked in, I was the only customer in there. The waitress came to me within a minute with a glass of water. She was really nice. I figured out pretty quickly I would want the enchilada dinner and a diet Pepsi. It came with 3 enchiladas, and I got 2 chicken and one cheese. The Pepsi was in a can, so no refills. (And $1.50 seems like a lot for a can of Pepsi) A few minutes after ordering, the waitress brought me some chips and salsa and a cup of some really delicious soup. Not sure if the soup came standard, like chips and salsa usually do, or if it was part of my dinner, like the beans and rice. But either way, I'm not complaining. Not long after, my dinner came out. That's when it started going downhill. The rice wasn't bad, but the refried beans left a bit to be desired. I love refried beans but didn't care for these. And there was something about the sauce on the enchiladas. It was different, and not exactly something to write home about. But even still, I ate until I was full, then was ready for a carryout box. I must have waited almost a half hour for my waitress to bring me a box, and that was because I finally found her to flag her down. For it being so empty, I thought it would have happened a bit sooner than that. But after I got my main dish, she never came back. Didn't even have my check yet. When she brought the box, I asked for a milkshake to take home. She was quick enough to bring my bill then. When I got my shake I finally paid my bill and left, and drank the shake on the way home. I bit into an ice cube while drinking it. I've since been told that shakes are sometimes made with crushed ice, which I didn't care for. I like them with milk and ice cream. It was average at best.Overall I was a bit disappointed. I'm not sure this is where I'll be going next time I want Mexican food, as there are certainly better places in the neighborhood.

39.description: We had no idea what to eat on a very boring, cold, dreary Saturday night, so we decided to stop in here, since we had always wanted to try it out.  I decided to have a sope de chorizo and noticed that they made tamales on the weekends, so I had tried one chicken and one pork.  My boyfriend had the carne a la mexicana (or something like that).  His meal came with rice/beans. etc  My stuff was a la carte.  This restaurant serves alcohol...but we both went the non-alcoholic route.  The complimentary chips were ok, nothing special...neither was the salsa...it was not hot, and there was really nothing to it.  More on the watery side...very tomato-ey.  meh.  We also received a complimentary cup of soup which was a nice treat, considering how nasty and cold it was outside.  It was tasty, the pasta was a little overdone, but what do you expect..it was pretty late, and I'm sure it was sitting in a pot somewhere for a while...but it was still pretty good.  As for the main food....the sope was really big!  The sope itself was soft, and I appreciate that.  some places they are hard like cement disks which means they are not fresh.  the flavors were ok, I kept wishing, however, that I had some aguacate, or guacamole...a little dollop would have been nice...I don't know it needed a little something.  It was good, it had beans, chorizo, lettuce, tomato, sour cream - I can't remember if it had cheese (it may have)...The stars of the show were the tamales...by far!  If for no other reason, I will be returning to this restaurant to get the tamales.  I usually only eat tamales once or twice a year, and even then I am really picky.  Maybe it was the nasty weather, but for some reason I ordered tamales, I figured if I didn't like them, my boyfriend would eat them....  well, that didn't happen.  Let me just say that I am also a meat snob and if I see even one weird piece of meat, I won't finish the rest of the meal... so the chicken tamal, was made with shredded meat that was perfect, not a fatty piece in there in a green sauce, but damn it was kick your ass hot!!!!!  But it tasted so good, I just cooled off with some of the sour cream from the sope and dove in again for the kill.  WOW so good!  Now I was too full to eat the pork tamal that evening...but the following day I had it and it was just as good...only it was shredded pork, in a mild red sauce.  SO YUMMY!!!!!  My boyfriend said he also liked his carne a la mexicana (or whatever it was called).  It was some beef strips in a red sauce and as he sat there with a runny nose, he announced to me that it was also hot as hell...The staff was very friendly.  No complaints in that department.  The cost for the meal was only about $20, but I ended up buying more tamales to go ($1.50 each) to it went up to about $27.

37.description: Not bad of a place to grab a quick bite. the taco's here are not too bad for the price, it is a little better than taco bell, but then taco bell is not really considered an authentic Mexican restaurant.Specials of the day's are usually posted by the front door, they usually have Tuesday $1 tacos (beef or chicken w/ lettuce and tomato - and it is tasty) that I take advantage of in this downward economy. There is plenty of metered and residential parking but be aware that when there is a White Sox game, you require a parking permit or you will be given a parking ticket.

0.description: YUM!! Why have I been walking past this place for 3 years!?  Chicken taco dinner was exactly what I've been craving. $4 Beef Nachos (with Guac!!) Amazing!  Awesome daily food & drink specials and just as good, if not better than those places down the street. I'll definitely be ordering from you guys from now on.

38.description: 3 lengua tacos & a coke to go at 4:46PM. Very fast, very good (could have used a little more salt), and exactly what I needed. I look forward to trying other menu items.

27.description: All of the employees are always friendly, and the food is good. LOVE the enchiladas mole!

32.description: I've only tried the Horchata and the steak tacos.  Both were good.  The Horchata is sweeter than usual.  Tacos were solid, but nothing special.  The owner chewed out the cashier (in Spanish) for offering me a plastic to-go bag.  Not a problem because they were already in a paper bag.

48.description: Another one of those reviews that for the food it's a real solid three star place, not anything to rave about but just a good meal.  However due to a friendly and very competent server you throw in the fourth.This is a simple but clean neighborhood place, not large and they have counter service with stools for a real quick bite or some local conversation with the cook, who also sent us off with a nice thank you as we left.We both ordered dinners, me the enchiladas with mole sauce, not the best mole but tasty. Mole sauce is subjective, I've had better, my husband tried it and like it more than some other places. He had steak tacos which he enjoyed served up with onion, cilantro and lime, in other words the right and proper way!  Plenty of food for the money, don't order apps unless you're real hungry. She also brought us a some chicken soup, nice touch.When we ran out of salsa, she gladly brought more and also brought the verde salsa out too. Our water glasses were kept full, service a was attentive without hoovering over us.I'd come back to try other things, they do serve alcohol and they had a sign up about great margaritas, didn't try one, maybe next time.Two things about the rest room, first it's a onesie so there is a lock on the door as you enter, use that one because if you close the stall door it's literally inches from the toilet, and I mean inches. Also please fix the heat, it was cold in there. The dining room nice and warm, then you hit the restroom and question, do I really want to expose my cheeks?All and all, just a nice place with good food and stellar service, best of all not run over with trixies, chads, and other weirdness. If you have to ask what I mean...please don't show up here and ruin the mood.

44.description: The service (for carry-out) was efficient and friendly. However, the food was underwhelming.The bread for the torta was dry. The chicken was good quality but not really flavorful. The steak in the tacos didn't seem like it was very high quality; I had to pick out several pieces of fat. Maybe they're better at vegetarian stuff? My companions got cheese enchiladas and the nachos and they seemed happy.It seems cute inside. On the small side, but with a number of tables plus a bar.

24.description: I think their veggie burrito is solid.  Not only that but they put an "array" of veggies (like broccoli, green beans, mushrooms) in their veggie burritos when most restaurants think they can get away with a slice of tomato and  a fist full of shredded lettuce, along with the old standby rice+beans. The guacamole is ok. Could use more of a kick but it's fresh, which is key. The staff is friendly.

7.description: DO NOT EAT HERE! The food tastes borderline rotten.  I ordered a Guacamole/chips order and when I received it at home it was basically black. The chips were so stale like they had been out all day. We ordered the chile relleno dinner and it was gross! The food is obviously not fresh which makes me question the food safety handling at this restaurant.

49.description: I have to Mexico 12 times in my life time and this is very down home type of Mexican spot. If you found it in a mid size town In Mexico, it would be the best place in town  to eat. Here in Chicago, we are very blessed with restaurants of all strip. This one was a great  find IHO.Having said  all that,  the food at this place is 3 cuts above most of the Mex spots I have eaten at in my 55 years in Chicago. After I placed my order, the server came by with the baskit of chips ,  salsa verda, and a reed sauce with a nice bite to it. Then came a boal of killer bean soup. This was a nice touch on a cold raining day.I ordered a carna asada burrito, with a side of beans. The meat was fresh, tender, spiced just right. It was smothered in a home made sauce loaded with onion, green pepper, galic, and the taste  was out of this world paired with the beef. The beans were 1st ratet with cheese and a nice sauce on the side . My wifes tacos were big,  fresh , and nicely garnished. The locals keep coming in for to-go sacks of food. I needed the beans like a new hole in my head.If I had 3 days I could never eat the whole plate. No filling , just meat. It reminded me of burritos I used to eat years back, in Denver Co. long before Mexican food was on every corner like it is now. The price for my self and my wife to over eat with a tip was abont $16.00. I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

40.description: The food is just okay, but the service is very good and the margaritas are outstanding.

30.description: Very nice Mexican restaurant with a small bar in the front. They have a chalkboard with a different dollar special for every day of the week. Of course, I went for my usual: burrito suizo and chips and salsa. The chips and salsa was pretty expensive, but then even the small size is giant! The food came out remarkably fast, and the portion size was so large I ate it over two meals (and I was VERY hungry!) The burrito was delicious, though the chips could have used a little salt and tasted like they came out of a bag, and the salsa was lacking jalapenos and was heavy on the canned crushed tomatoes.Overall, I was pleased and will be back.

46.description: During my college years in Chicago, I was a frequent patron of "La Mex", as we affectionately referred to it. While the other kids would do their studying at the library or coffee shop, we'd head to La Mex to get our school work done over chips and salsa and pitchers of strong margaritas. Rarely were there more than two tables with people. The waitress/owner would often be relaxing at the counter up front, watching her telenovelas on the TV. She'd usually turn down the volume so we could concentrate. The food at La Mex is just good, solid, tasty mexican cuisine. No fusion bullcrap, no stupid gimmicks. I usually ordered the enchiladas de mole which were delicious. I can't recall all the other items I ate there during my years in the neighborhood, but I was rarely disappointed.The staff and owners were always very friendly and I should hope La Mex has retained its quiet, simple, no-frills charm amidst the dangerous creep of glass-faced condos and ritzy apartment buildings.

1.description: Decided to stop by here with my friends on a Saturday night due to a recommendation from another friend. The funny thing is that I lived around here my whole life and probably driven past this place a million times. I don't know why I never been here, but this place is pretty decent. I ordered the steak taco dinner, which was good. Steak was flavorful and not chewy. We also ordered steak quesadilla and shrimp ceviche. Everything was pretty good and portion is big as well.

9.description: Best tip well. I tipped a dollar and .51 cent. Delivery guy told my son to thank me for the tip. You can walk to our house from the restaurant. He obviously dropped our bag. Food containers were crushed. Warning!

26.description: Very good food at good prices. If you eat in you usually get free soup with your order. The waitresses are all very friendly. Everyday they also have food and drink specials. My favorite day is half price margherita  day.

25.description: Not bad here I had the El Pastor tacos that were not too sweet so that means they cut the pinapple just right.  I also had a charizo taco which was really good.  I was not completely blown away here, hence, the 4 star instead of 5 star rating, but it was still quite good and very close to home

12.description: Worst food and service ever, TVE chiles rellenos madre me throw up, awful, inedible, rice and beans the worst I ever tasted, worst food I have ever had

21.description: Enchiladas verde was pretty good. Green salsa is hot as a mother *&%$#! And my boyfriend got a burrito that he really liked. Not the best steak I've ever had, will probably try the chicken next.

17.description: decent mexican food. I would steer clear of the seafood stuff as the camarones were pretty bad. The tostadas and enchiladas were awesome. Queso Fundido was spot on too.  They chill the beer mugs so the beer is ice cold, its perfect! Friendly wait staff. it is never really crowded when I go which is fine with me..

10.description: the chilaquiles were the worst. The beans were terrible the rice was bland... The steak tacos were ok

5.description: Ordered from Grub Hub delivery. Order was incorrect. Actually had the nerve to tell us to bring it back in for a refund. Wouldn't send driver back, even though they state delivery is till 10pm. They had no problem wasting our time to bring the food back to them in the morning!?!?!?!  Wow! We received our food at 8:30pm. They argued instead of making a correction. That's not how you run a business. Had to call Grub Hub to take care of it. Don't jump through their hoops people, YOU are the customer. Avoid. Also, they are located one mile from us. Really???

3.description: Stopped by about 10PM thinking it was still closed but was allowed I'm, I got helped out, paid and was out. As for the food, 5 stars all the way. Everything was correct and was quick to get out. Was expecting to pay more. AWESOME. :O

35.description: I sign up for Yelp just because of Taqueria La Mexicana! This restaurant is in my neighborhood and we have been there a few time, always left happy, full, and very satisfied. We use restaurant.com coupon so the price is nice, but even without the coupon the price here is very reasonable. The food is great. Spiced pork: awesome. Shrimp cocktail: cooked just right, not too raw, not overcooked, we kept digging and fishing out shrimps (a lot). Fried red snapper: super crunchy, freshly fried.Settings: very nice, deco like a small town eatery in Mexico. The kitchen can be seen from the tables.Staff: awesome: very helpful, smiled all the time. Feels like family. There was a boy in the family doing homework on the counter.

19.description: I ordered the chocolate milkshake and vegetarian burrito. What a bad choice! The milkshake was more like chocolate milk with ice and the vegetarian burrito was just stuffed with lettuce. They need to add some peppers and onions to their burritos. I would not come here again.

28.description: AMAZING salsa. I don't know what they put in it, but we buy the 32oz of it all the time and it's gone in two days. Delicious food. We've tried a little bit of everything at this place and have loved everything. It's cheap and delicious. The waitstaff is always friendly.The last couple times we've gotten food delivered there have been various issues (food actually falling out of the containers into the bottom of the bag, orders being wrong). Just go in--it's totally worth the trip.

45.description: Sorry, didn't care for this place! I ordered a torta de carne asada and it was just no good.The bread just completely fell apart and it was so messy!My boyfriend had the nachos al pastor and they were very greasy.They skimped on the meat too! We were just left completely unsatisfied.I swear, everytime I pass this place, whoever's with me always gets an ear-full!

33.description: This place has really grown on me. Great salsa. Great everything. The restaurant is immaculate. Dollar tacos on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

43.description: I'm sorry, but for being a total hole-in-the-wall the food here in amazingly good.  It's fresh, it's flavorful & it's cheap!  My absolute fav are the chicken enchiladas with mole.  There's just something about their mole - it sings!  I have had the pastor enchiladas as well, which were good also, but the chicken is particularly tasty.  My boyfriend is hopelessly hooked on their chicken tostadas, which he gets everytime.  The salsa is a perfect combination of heat, cilantro and tomato as well.  Not too much of anything.  We are starting to consider this our -GO-TO hole for fab, authentic cheap Mexican & WILL keep going back.

2.description: Solid mexican place in bridgeport, i got the suizo fish burrito, which was good and big for only 7.99, plus a $8 margarita which was fine, service was good, chips and salsa were fine, maybe nothing particularly special, but it delivered in everything i was looking for

18.description: Tacos for lunch from here for the first time. The tacos were authentic but not 4 star worthy. The carne Asada needed a little more seasoning. The chips tasted like old oil and they tortillas were soggy. I wouldn't mind going to the restaurant itself for a second chance, but would probably not try them for delivery again.

41.description: It's the Mexican food you expect from a place with an unbelievably compact restroom. With that established, Taqueria La Mexicana earns points with the complimentary soup and affordable knock-you-on-your-culo margaritas.Don't let my bathroom comment fool you, the decor is more stylish than the average hole-in-the-wall taqueria. Standard 2 TVs, warm, inviting colors, neon lights and a stocked bar with seating make this place a cut above some usual haunts. The staff have been incredibly cooperative. Once they packaged up the complimentary salsa to take home, another time they split a bill for 6 people despite all the trouble that goes on once the meal is finished (my friends need to learn to speak up beforehand!)The burritos, tacos and other standbys are good but give the dinners a try, you won't be disappointed.

50.description: where else can I go to get fantastic Mexican food and drink for $15!! (4 beers and entree with tip). I watched a Sox game here with a friend since we were hungry and most of the bars nearby do not have food. It was fantastic. The people who run the restaurant are really nice and make amazing food. Domestic Beer is $2.75 (or was it $2.25). When we went to pay the guy even cut us a break for the beer since we ordered what would be more than a bucket price. Alright!! They also take credit or cash so that was nice since we didn't have time to stop at the ATM before coming to eat.

4.description: I first started coming to El Tipicos back in 1985 when they were across the street. This place is truly the most underrated restaurant in Chicago. I love this place. they greet you warmly. the food is spectacular. I have eaten Mexican food around the country including. Santa fe, Albuquerque NM. even Hawaii. it's authentic and delicious. extremely fresh. the margaritas are 100% on point. the seafood, shrimp. perfect. I have never had a bad dish.. if you want great service, delicious food. The best fresh strawberry margaritas. This is the spot! A. Khan

6.description: I used to really enjoy this place. Salsa was on point, decent service and good grub. Lately they've been missing the mark. My past few take out orders were either not ready when I got there, and when I give extra time to get the order together, then my food winds up cold....I decided to visit today to eat inside. I wish I would have walked out when I felt how cold it was inside. It's 12 degrees outside and it feels like the heat isn't even on in here. I don't think patrons should have to eat with their coats on. Our complimentary soup, which is usually delightful accompanying dinner, was not hot - more like lukewarm. Yuck! Our order of carrots and hot peppers was slimy, as if they had been sitting open in the fridge for a few days. I can't really complain about the main course, it was what it was, but nothing to write home about.This used to be my go-to, but I don't think it's worth wasting my time or money anymore when there are too many options within a 5 minute drive from here. Giving 2 stars because the ladies who work here are usually sweet - management should take note however and not be afraid to spend a little money on heat and fresh peppers.

22.description: Tonight was my first time eating from Taqueria La Mexicana.  I found them through Grub Hub and boy was it a lucky find!  I had the Steak Burrito with Rice and Beans.  The Burrito was quite tasty, the salsa was fresh and the rice and beans were delicious.  It was as good as it gets for Mexican food, and I've had my share of Mexican food.  Bottom line, I will be giving this place another shot just to make sure it wasn't a fluke, but I was completely satisfied and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

15.description: I order the chilaquiles from the taqueria no less than once a week. They are consistently perfect. Doesn't matter if you go with red sauce or green sauce, they are both perfect, just make sure to a extra side of corn tortillas, as that helps them even more. The tacos are also usually great, though they could stand to throw less cilantro on them. The burritos are pretty great too. I'll wager they are the best mexican place in bridgeport. I have yet to dine here in person. Have to wonder if they are BYOB.

20.description: I was walking around and stumbled upon this place. That have great Mexican food. I came on a Sunday and their specials were the al pastor tacos for $1! It was awesome. The meats aren't over seasoned and the pricing was just right for the amount of food I got. This is my definite go-to if I'm craving any Mexican food.

36.description: Lovely people, quick and courteous service, they keep your water filled!!!BEST Horchata I've EVER had.Excellent food (except the beans and rice, which I--sadly--don't care for here).  Quick service.  Good soup.  Good flan.  LOVELY salsa and guacamole, good chips.Just a lovely, pleasant, friendly place with very good food for very good prices.  One of my favorites in th area.

14.description: Growing up in Bridgeport this used to be my favorite place to go get any kind of mexican food. So much so that even after moving out of the area I still used to make it a point to eat there whenever I was nearby. But this place, in my eyes, has PLUMMETED from grace. From charging you for chips and salsa (complimentary in 99% of other mexican restaurants) if you order anything they have on special to a couple of waitresses that seem bothered by your presence and having to take your order, I have run out of reasons to eat here any longer. But the very last time I went, I noticed they not only raised their prices on most things but on a few things the prices jumped by at least $1 or more, specifically their burritos. I'm sorry but I'm not paying $7 for a burrito just because one or two nearby places have decided to extort people with their prices as well and you think you are worth upscale pricing. I could go to countless other places (including one place just 4 blocks away), in much higher priced areas and still get a GOOD burrito for $6 or less. It's not even about the money, it's the principle. I know gouging when I see it. I think Taqueria La Mexicana has either begun to take themselves (and their food) too seriously and/or, they are on the verge of shutting down and are trying to pull as much profit as they can in the meantime. Either way, I think the owners should go ahead and give up that location and just stick to the diner on the corner (which they also own). Somehow they are not screwing that place up....yet.

58.description: I absolutely LOVE this place. It's really close to my home and they are open late which is convenient when I have late night cravings for Mexican food. The staff is always super friendly and the food is ready within 15 min or less. If you haven't tried already what are you waiting for?

56.description: LOVE IT! This place is cheap and delicious. The service is great and the portions are GIGANTIC!! If you like inexpensive Mexican cuisine, I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

29.description: The food is delicious and very authentic. I have tried the ceviche tostada, the guacamole, the tacos. Their portions are pretty big. They also squeeze fresh juice. I've tried the strawberry one and it was refreshing. The service is very slow though. You'll be waiting for 45 to an hour for your food. Don't be expecting a short lunch break.

42.description: Went here at 2 am after a few drinks. I ordered just one al pastor taco with cilantro and onion because of the generous offering of chips and dip upon dining in. Don't think the waitress/cashier was too happy about that. Given my tiny order, service wasn't exceptionally prompt. Everything was drenched in oil, especially the tortilla and chips. However, the taco filling was delicious and fresh tasting, though greasy as well. What can you expect for $2...Bottom line: great prices, not so great food, and I won't be returning unless I've had a few.

23.description: Worst service ever. They're so unorganized. I called for a pickup order for a couple tacos. I waited 15 minutes to leave my house. When I got there I still had to wait 15 minutes. It takes a half hour to make two tacos?? If it wasn't so late I would've gone somewhere else. And when you get there, they act like they don't know what you're talking about when you say you have a pickup order. Horrible service and their bathroom was disgusting the last time I went there.

47.description: Excellent mexican food, was starving after the White Sox opener went here and ate like a king, I had the steak taco dinner which came with brown rice and beans, my two drinking partners both got steak burritos, which they didn't complain about at all..will be back again...drunk I'm sure leaving a White Sox game.

8.description: It took over 1 hour and 20 minutes to receive our order. I even watched while the driver struggled, with what it appeared to be over 15 orders, to find our order. The food was more than cold; it was almost like taken out of the refrigerator. After we spent several minutes warning up our food, the taste was not even good, nor appropriate for a restaurant. If I wanted to have this kind of experience, I would have gone to a supermarket and grab something from the frozen food section. My advise, if you have a choice, dio not even think about ordering delivery from this people. I know, I will never order delivery again from them. Yes, the driver was educated and perhaps the experience at the restaurant may be better; but, delivery is horrible no matter how you look at it. Sad, very sad. I'm glad I don't own this restaurant.

31.description: This place is so cheap and has great food. I went here today for a quick bite. They were fast and tasty. I got three pastor tacos and guac and chips. It costed $11.70. So much food. My girlfriend and I split it all and were full for hours. Granted this isnt my favorite mexican place but it is a great pit stop if you are in the Bridgeport area [and looking to save some coin].

34.description: Outstanding authentic food and service. Veronica and the rest of the staff were very gracious to our party of 5. Highly recommend.

16.description: We dropped by here one late night after a recommendation from a friend to fill a mexican craving. This was located in Bridgeport Chicago and parking was pretty easy to find. The Mexican food was delicious and authentic. They were super busy even on a late night and their service was mediocre. They were very busy with just takeout. Would return again!

13.description: This is my go to Mexican place for home delivery. Their shrimp fajitas are delicious!My dine in experience wasn't so great. It was cinco de mayo and there was a ton of delivery orders it was hard to get the attention of the staff although there were only 2 other tables with customers.

11.description: Dined here a couple times and ordered the chilequiles with chicken and green sauce at the first visit and steak tacos at the next. The chilequiles weren't the best I've had but they were still very good and very filling. The serving was huge! The steak tacos were very tasty and you could tell that the steak had been marinated very well. I love a Mexican restaurant that has pickled carrots and cauliflower in a big container right beside you. I've also tried one of their juices; I forgot which one it was, but it was very good and fresh. For cheap and delicious Mexican cuisine that's open late night, go to Taqueria San Jose!

39.description: Love It!!! They have great customer service, friendly delivery guys, and all around great Mexican food. There are not many words except, Try it, you'll love it!!

37.description: Customer service is the best that's why I gave the stars, my husband loved the steak super nacho, but my chicken taco salad was not good at all. I absolutely hate shredded chicken with bell peppers as an entree, meal just becomes soggy with broth. Yuck! The servers are the best though;)

0.description: This was myFirst time trying this place, and i went thru yelp. My first experience was good. I tried the steak tacos & chicken tacos, with steak & chicken flantas. They both were good, but I enjoyed the chicken tacos & chicken flantas, because it had more flavor. There guacamole & chips was a perfect taste as well. They close late & will go again.

38.description: Good food and friendly service

51.description: My absolute favorite thing here is the al pastor tacos. So good. The prices are great and the horchata is huge and tasty. My husband and I often (ok, always) order the nachos especiales with carne asada. It is so unhealthy but so tasty. I don't think I have ever had anything here that I didn't like. Ok, maybe not the torta--the bread seems like a very stale jumbo hamburger bun, and I've had it several times. But it's not inedible, I've just had better. The table service is just ok but I don't normally have high expectations for places where you have to walk to the register to pay. Basically, I love this place. Al Pastor!

27.description: I ordered through GrubHub two days in a row and I promise it was like night and day!!!! I ordered the Shrimp and Garlic and Guacomole the first day and the shrimp was flavorful and had plenty of sauteed onions, garlic, and peppers. DELICIOUS! The guacomole was creamy and had lots of flavor. However, on the second order of the same entree, there was no sign of onions, garlic, or bell peppers in the shrimp although it was flavored. The real disappointment was the guacamole. There was SOOOO much onion that you would have thought I had ordered onion dip with a side of avocado and there absolutely no flavor. There must be two different chefs so I have to catch the right chef or I won't be ordering again. I really enjoyed my first experience but the second prder really soured my overall experience.

32.description: Pros: Cheap, open late, nice staff, online orderingCons: Lackluster food. The vegetarian burrito was basically a tortilla filled with bland rice. The interior has an interesting and slightly unpleasant aroma like mildew.Maybe it's due to growing up on the west coast and living in Arizona for a few years but I'd call this mediocre Mexican at best.

54.description: Great place for delicious and inexpensive Mexican! They are open late, it's BYOB the staff is very cool and pleasant and always helpful.  With tacos you get a choice of onions and cilantro, or tomatoes and lettuce,  and they come with complimentary carrots and 2 kinds of hot sauces, the verde is my favorite!  The meat that I've had (chicken, steak and pork) has always been tender juicy nicely seasoned and none of the nasty fatty chewy parts that sometime find their way into your 2am tacos at other joints. Maybe I've just been lucky, but then I'm really lucky because I've found myself here a lot in last five years!  Great smoothies too!

48.description: Tacos, guacamole and tortilla chips are amazing.  Love the lemonade!  You can not go wrong if your looking for great tacos; chicken and beef

44.description: The chips served during table service are legit. Fresh, tasty, and the salsa is on point as well. Really loved the tacos, reliably tasty food. And super cheap. No complaints at all.

24.description: The food was just ok.  The service was slow and pretty inattentive. Major points off for having a TV on broadcasting garbage talk shows. Isn't there a soccer game on somewhere in the world?  Did I go to San Jose on one of its off days??  Honestly, thought Taqueria Mexicana was so much better in terms of service and ambience--which isn't really saying a lot.

7.description: So I got take out from this place the other day when I was too lazy to make lunch. I got an order of the nachos and they were out of this world. Steak, Jalapeños, Sour cream. I got it to go and it was good. Do you know how hard it is to get Nachos to go and have them still be good?? I also had a steak taco which was great. I will definitely be going back and dining in

49.description: Simple Mexican goodness. Steak nachos have been a favorite for years. Al Pastor tacos are my newest addition to an order. Take out is quick & easy and ladies working are awesome & friendly. Now take debit/credit over $15.

40.description: Cheap eats; huge portions. It will take you a week to finish the super nachos.

53.description: Little pricey I think and did non not have updated menu

30.description: I really love Taqueria San Jose. It's a really relaxed environment with great hours--perfect for late night, impromptu, hangouts and dinners. The food is great, inexpensive, and filling--especially for vegetarians! Almost the best part, wonderfully, is the freshly fried tortilla chips and salsa, which are complimentary. Oh yes. And if a full and tasty Mexican food menu wasn't enough, San Jose's also features an entire freshly extracted juice menu. I've tried several and they're delicious, produced on demand. And of course, the staff are friendly and helpful. Good excuse to support a local small delicious. Chipotle has nothing on Taqueria San Jose.

46.description: I'd say that there are many better places to go for Mexican food, but my stars are for the fresh juice.  Pressed on order, choose one of their combos or make your own.  Very tasty. Staff is very nice, too.

1.description: I would love to give San Jose five stars... but their service sucks. Pick-up and delivery definitely take priority (this would probably be the way to go if you want to try their food), but if you choose to dine-in, be prepared to wait way too long for your food. The wait staff is inattentive and sometimes rude, and your order may even be forgotten. My last visit was surprisingly less accommodating than any other. The madness of deliveries and pick-up orders toward the front of the restaurant was unpleasant and actually distracted my waitress enough to leave my food waiting at the counter for about ten minutes (we had already been waiting 30+ minutes after ordering). My chicken fajita (usually to die for) had burnt onto the sizzling pan because it didn't get to my table in time for me to stir it up a bit. The two previous times I had ordered this dish, the serving size was double the amount, not burnt, and was served with a side of beans, rice, lettuce and some avocado. This time, though, the serving was pretty skimpy, burnt, and only served with the beans and rice (which are consistently amazing). When I asked the waitress about the lettuce and avocado, she just kept saying "Extra, it's extra," as if I was bothering her (probably from taking her away from figuring out what the heck was happening with the deliveries). Needless to say, I only tipped about 5% this visit. Although the food was abnormally horrible, it's usually fantastic and definitely worth the lack of service this place has to offer. I won't give up on it yet.

55.description: I love Taqueria San Jose. As a college student, this is definitive as the neighborhood grease spoon that's open late. The four of us go in and share the nachos supreme (I'm not sure if this is the name exactly) and it is a giant plate. Delicious, unhealthy, and basically cheese, beans, carne asada (choose your meat, I recommend the steak though!) on top of their homemade tortilla chips. I love their salsas that they keep in easy squeeze bottles on the table. The horchata is plentiful and vey reasonably priced. I've had the torta, which was only okay.

9.description: Food is amazing. The burrito is one of the best I've had. The tacos are pretty good too. I would highly recommend getting the tres leches cake on the side. Staff is very friendly.

26.description: i've ordered with them 3 times and each time there was some odd shenanigan with the order process. first time I was far outside the delivery zone (was notified after I processed the order) and I would need to give the driver an additional tip, second time same thing but they didnt require the delivery premium,the third time and last time I ever order from them, the order didnt come at all, I called the restaurant an hour and thirty minutes after ordering food to find out that my order was marked as delivered. TSJ reached out to the driver and said the food was delirvered to a woman (not a woman) and that there was nothing that could be done about it.I contacted the web portal I ordered with (eat24) and they refunded me my money because TSJ refused to do anything more that give me the drivers number (wtf?) so I could speak with the driver about who he gave my food to (again, wtf?) I will never, ever order from there and I would recommend no one else either unless you like receiving terrible service.

25.description: Dined here a couple times and ordered the chilequiles with chicken and green sauce at the first visit and steak tacos at the next. The chilequiles weren't the best I've had but they were still very good and very filling. The serving was huge! The steak tacos were very tasty and you could tell that the steak had been marinated very well. I love a Mexican restaurant that has pickled carrots and cauliflower in a big container right beside you. I've also tried one of their juices; I forgot which one it was, but it was very good and fresh. For cheap and delicious Mexican cuisine that's open late night, go to Taqueria San Jose!

12.description: This place is so cheap and has great food. I went here today for a quick bite. They were fast and tasty. I got three pastor tacos and guac and chips. It costed $11.70. So much food. My girlfriend and I split it all and were full for hours. Granted this isnt my favorite mexican place but it is a great pit stop if you are in the Bridgeport area [and looking to save some coin].

59.description: Random stop the other night while walking bars in the area.  Many of their late night patrons were also at the bars nearby.  It took about twenty minutes waiting on ordered burritos.  Two in hand and they were heavy!  In a drunken state, the burritos were pretty good.  The following day my cousin texts to tell me the burrito was excellent.  I wasn't as sure but you see my cousin (is the type that) doesn't believe there is a such thing as bad pizza.  If I say it's cardboard with cheese, he says it was okay.

21.description: This is my go to Mexican place for home delivery. Their shrimp fajitas are delicious!My dine in experience wasn't so great. It was cinco de mayo and there was a ton of delivery orders it was hard to get the attention of the staff although there were only 2 other tables with customers.

17.description: I'm giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons. They have your typical run of the mill food, buuuuuuut they also have some unique items. The masa quesadillas are something I've never seen before, simply delicious and inventive. Even better that they are made fresh and you can choose your filling. As a vegetarian, I'm always looking for Mexican restaurants to go beyond the zucchini taco. This place has potatoes, rajas and a few other things. They also have a fantastic juice bar and desserts. Will definitely come back.

10.description: I just ordered a taco dinner from here. For a  taco dinner and delivery was $16.00. The food came cold, and they poured hot sauce all over the food when I got it. I do not like hot sauce. The meat was sub par, and didnt have any flavor to it, and came cold. I was not happy with their food and would never order from them again. There delivery charge was 3.50 which i think is very high when most places are $2.00.

5.description: It wasn't good bad we had the tacos. I had the al pastor and chicken taco. I think their fair.

3.description: Pizza or Mexican? That's always the question, isn't it?!?! Well, let me just start with this I LOVE FOOD AND FOOD LOVES ME. I am a constant YELPER when it comes to trying new food. Running around hungry after the NLC-National FBLA conference award ceremony tonight I figured what would be open at 10:30 PM? I looked on YELP and remembered that I had bookmarked a Mexican Restaurant due to the reviews. When I called and asked if they delivered to the Hyatt Regency McCormick she checked with someone and affirmed that they did. She was very very helpful and knowledgable of the food items. She then made a few suggestions based on my food restrictions (no shellfish or red meat), just cheese and chicken. She quickly accommodated me with one of the cheese filled potato MASA quesadillas and a chicken tostada which were bomb.com insanely delicious! Now you have to understand something...I am from California and I am VERY spoiled with my mother's Argentine cuisine and the local Mexican restaurant where I live. Like I said I know food, so you can understand when I say food is good here I mean it is OUTSTANDING! The pico de gallo and guacamole were like no other Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. CHUNKY AND FRESH!!By the time I got to the lobby the driver was there at the concierge desk--he was quick concise and to the point. It was very nice. I've been to quite a few cities-- London, Buenos Aires, and San Francisco--and I can say that I truly love Chicago for visiting this first time and this restaurant added the cherry on the top!  Take my advice go for the Mexican if you're debating and forget about the pizza! Oh, all of it including tip and the BEST horchata I have ever had was $25.00. Can't speak for the dine in experience but man, this place ROCKS! See you soon, Taquería José!

35.description: The burrito is basically grease wrapped in a tortilla.

19.description: The food was good but I didn't get my tres leche when I ordered and I paid for everything before it was delivered

28.description: I'm giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons. They have your typical run of the mill food, buuuuuuut they also have some unique items. The masa quesadillas are something I've never seen before, simply delicious and inventive. Even better that they are made fresh and you can choose your filling. As a vegetarian, I'm always looking for Mexican restaurants to go beyond the zucchini taco. This place has potatoes, rajas and a few other things. They also have a fantastic juice bar and desserts. Will definitely come back.

45.description: Cheap and yummy. Steak Burrito was a bit greasy from the meat, but tasted great. I also got some tacos..lettuce, onion, cilantro and meat. Just how I like it! About $1.60 each? (I forgot). Friendly staff

33.description: I ordered delivery.took a little while cause driver got lost but staff was very sweet. Food was very traditional mexican. Was great and glad I gave them a try.chicken flautas were perfect.beans a little salty but very creamy.u get pickled mexican veggies with each order as well.

43.description: This is a good p lace to go if you are drunk and want to get drunker because you can byob here.  Have had much better Mexican Food .  It is always way to hot in there also.

2.description: Overall, not good.  Homemade chips were good.  Guacamole had too much lime and really no avocado flavor.  Queso fundido was oily as hell to the point where it almost instantly separated.  Tostadas showed potential.  Shells weren't doubled, and the grease saturated the single shell they provided quickly, too gross to even bother with.  I had no choice but to scrape all of the toppings off, tossing the tomato that I specifically requested they not include in the first place.  Asada and pastor had great flavor but the heaping pile I was left to eat them from left little to be desired visually.   The chilies rellanos tacos were a mistake, but for reasons I can't even begin to understand for such a straight forward dish.  Salsa was unmemorable.  Take a pass.

18.description: I really love Taqueria San Jose. It's a really relaxed environment with great hours--perfect for late night, impromptu, hangouts and dinners. The food is great, inexpensive, and filling--especially for vegetarians! Almost the best part, wonderfully, is the freshly fried tortilla chips and salsa, which are complimentary. Oh yes. And if a full and tasty Mexican food menu wasn't enough, San Jose's also features an entire freshly extracted juice menu. I've tried several and they're delicious, produced on demand. And of course, the staff are friendly and helpful. Good excuse to support a local small delicious. Chipotle has nothing on Taqueria San Jose.

41.description: I do not like the fact that I've had to ask for water and chips and salsa because the server was negligent. I love jalapeños and carrots but unfortunately they serve soft, less fresh ones here. I really dislike the chicken tacos- the meat did not have much flavor. It's always annoying having to wave down the server because my table was my checked on. I gave it 2 stars because I like that they offer fresh juice on the menu, and I also like its 24 hours and BYOB

52.description: This is my go-to for delicious Mexican food. The food is absolutely delicious (and greasy) with massive portions. HOWEVER, I have never had good service here. You practically have to beg for a refill and the waitresses don't even seem to like any of the customers.  Last time I was there I was asked to get up and pay for my meal right after I started eating. I wouldn't normally have a problem with this, but my waitress interrupted our conversation to ask us to pay. 5 star food, 2 star (at best) service. For a really long time I've been assuming that the waitresses are having an off day, but considering I've probably eaten here 15+ times, I just don't think that's the case.

50.description: first of all I cannot go 5 stars. That would be the best Mexican restaurant around.  2nd I can not go 4 because I feel this place can be better. I do love the burritos.  Good size, steak is cooked well.  But when I ask for one with extra veggies they never seem to understand what that means.  Extra lettuce and tomato ect ect... They seem to always give me extra meat. For some people that's not a complaint.  But not this guy, sorry.

4.description: It's pretty much become my go to mexican place, granted i did just move literally 1 block away, but it's good and quick and cheap, i usually just get one (or many) of their $2 tacos, ive had tripe, lengua, chorizo, carne asada and pastor, all good, and perfect for a quick snack, and also the chicken quesadilla is very good, and its BYOB! tho i havent had time to eat there yet, also the horchata wasnt bad either, im sure i will be returning often in the future!

6.description: The rice had Lima beans in it. Kinda odd. Everything else was just alright, nothing special.

22.description: Super nachos with steak are tasteless. The chicken quesadilla is flavorful. Wish I would have just gotten the quesadilla.

15.description: The food is delicious and very authentic. I have tried the ceviche tostada, the guacamole, the tacos. Their portions are pretty big. They also squeeze fresh juice. I've tried the strawberry one and it was refreshing. The service is very slow though. You'll be waiting for 45 to an hour for your food. Don't be expecting a short lunch break.

57.description: Ordered Huevos Ranchoes, it was great!

20.description: Late night food fare, tasty and filling just the way I like it. I didn't find it to be greasy as some people reviewed. I was very nervous after reading reviews. It was late and we had already sat down. It was priced pretty decently and I left very full. The waitress was very nice and very attentive. I think the only issue we had was that it was roasting like a fire put in there!! The waitress was roasting too and kept apologizing!

36.description: Since I've  been on an Al pastor binge I read the reviews and wondered what was up...I read the good and bad reviews and I try to disregard the bad to still try it.Ordered 3 al pastor tacos with cilantro onions lettuce and tomato by far the greasiest Al pastor I've tried so far AND there also was a bug crawling around in my food (like a fruit fly or gnat) the two bites I ate before the bug citing was pretty decent but the bug threw everything off Prolly won't go back

14.description: Their steak tacos taste like your below average taqueria.  taste like oil and is drenched in oil. My tortilla was soggy  from oil after 10 minutes. This really ruined steak tacos for me and i won't be eating them for a long while.Aside from that, their customer service is terrible! I told them i did not want guacamole on the side of my rice and the girl had a problem with it. She twas hesitant about taking it back and told me that guac is on the menu which i ordered over the telephone so there was no menu. she wanted to charge me for limes because she said they cost money, I asked her why limes are not on the menu like she said the guac was and she had no answer. she didnt even know how much they cost and NO TAQUERIA CHARGES FOR LIMES EVER! They purely wanted to rip me off. If you want good tacos try El Norte or Flash Tacos, not here.

3.description: I get my hair cut here, and I also take my son to get his hair cut here as well. The prices for the haircuts are not bad at all. I have never gotten a bad haircut here. I don't give it 5 stars because here is my gripe. This place is so popular with many men and women in the Bridgeport community that whenever I go, early, or later in the day, the place is always packed!  I usually have to wait for a customer or two that was there before me to be done before I , or my son can get our haircuts. But that's not really the salon's fault. This place suffered a fire a few years back. The place was remodeled  with the help of their insurance money I'm guessing. As for the women's permanents, hair dye, and haircuts? I really can't comment on that because being that I am not a woman, I don't get those things done. Neither does my son. I can say that I think it's not bad because whenever I frequent Antonia's salon, I usually see the same women getting their hair done. So i'm guessing they do good work. Well, that is all for now.I am updating this review. I went back today, 2-12-2010. I took my son and myself to get our hair cut. Once again Paco did a great job cutting my hair. I highly recommend that you visit Antonia's and ask for him to cut your hair. But all of the ladies there are great. If you want to contact Paco directly, here is his email , haircutzpaco@hotmail.com , Once again. Paco also cuts kids hair. : ) I have added a picture for all of you to see. : ) Please check it out.

1.description: This is a great place I've been coming here for most of my life and I have family has been coming here for two generations a great place everyone is welcome in prices are great and it is newly remodeled unfortunately Antonia died not too long ago but the shop is still open thankfully

2.description: I have been comin here for yearz and Collen does my hair and eye brows.  She is the best in da bizz.  Ask for her if you stop by..

0.description: I had the most arduous $10 haircut ever.I spent the morning getting hopped up on caffeine waiting for some car maintenance to get complete and I was thinking I should get a haircut.I have long stopped trying to get any sort of specific haircut.  I just say "cut the sides down to a '3' and thin the top."So you know when you think your haircut's about done?  You're thinking alllllright I'm ready for my glasses!  This happened about 6 times... and she kept clipping away.Mind you, I was seriously caffeinated so I was getting a little jittery.  C'mon.  At Great Clips, this would have been done with a couple zips with the clippers and a couple snips with the scissors and then boom.  Done.Not with this person.  She was intent on getting it RIGHT.Did it look better or worse than Great Clips?  No.  BUT IT WAS A HECK OF A LOT CHEAPER.She spent a good deal of time with the gel too.All in all, I was extremely satisfied with my haircut.  I thanked the lady, paid in cash (oh right, cash only), and proceeded to top my meticulous haircut with my bike helmet and was on my way.
