58.description: We decided to try them out for lunch. House Salad - Typical SaladBreaded Steak Sandwich - This was cooked nicely, but I thought it was a bit bland.Sicilian Pizza - I really like the crust on this and enjoyed it.Overall, the food was okay, but it's a bit pricey.

56.description: This place is AMAZING. Why amazing you ask? Well I just ordered delivery to cheer me up as I recover from surgery. No big deal right? Right...well unless you live on the 20th floor and you realize your elevators are out when the delivery arrives. ABSOLUTELY crazy. The moment they called to let me know my food was here they told the delivery guy the elevators were out. Once I was done yelling at the people downstairs for not letting me know I was just going to pay them and let them take the food back. I love this place so I felt horrible. All of a sudden the drivers (who I am so sorry I dont remember your name I was so frazzled and mad at my building) wife Andrea comes trekking up 20 flights of stairs to bring me food because I was recovering. Wow this was an amazing experience. The owner who I had called to sort things out said he appreciated my business and they didn't mind. I can't even believe it. I greeted Andrea at the door with some water and a good tip. I honestly didn't know awesome people like this still existed in life. I wish I could do more for her and her husband. They are awesome people and Mangia Fresca is such a caring restaurant. I pick food up here all the time. I will absolutely continue to do so much more frequently! You cannot beat this kind of service and people. I am still stunned this all happened. Oh and my food is awesome too :) Just like ALWAYS!! You cannot beat the portions, flavors and freshness!! I could eat their breaded steak and caprese salad every day but then I would actually need to start doing the 20 flights of stairs! Thank you all!!

29.description: Mediocre at best.  Super greasy and steady eating here will surely give you an undesirable beach body.

42.description: The super-thin breaded steak sandwich is $9.99, but hear me out before you think "WOW, that's a lot for a sandwich."  Actually they put two pieces of breaded steak on fresh, fluffy Italian bread, so it is like getting double steak on your sandwich! They are known for, and are famous for, their breaded steak sandwich which is paper thin and smothered in red marinara sauce. It is slammed open-faced on super fresh Italian bread. It is very flavorful, not dry and super tender. The steak sandwich was perfectly cooked. The marinara sauce (gravy) is not too sweet or salty -- perfection. If you want to add cheese there is an extra added cost. The sandwich is huge that I couldn't finish it. I took home the other half. Their french fries take up an entire basket. They are freshly cut fries. I am not a french fries fan, and rarely eat them. However, my niece ordered them and four people could have shared this basket of fries! Once I tasted them, I couldn't stop eating these fresh fab-u-licious fries with the skin still on.  We went on a Wednesday afternoon around 2:30 pm and the place was empty. We were the only customers in the entire place. However, during lunch time there are lots of Chicago Police Officers who eat here. Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives... I would describe this place as between a diner and a dive, but definitely more of a diner. It has additional seating on the the other side of the wall and a large screen TV in both the main area of the restaurant as well as the other side. This little joint is located next to the CTA bus station where the 62 Archer buses come and go and above the bus station is the Orange Line ("L" train) which reads "Halsted." The young lady behind the counter who took our order was very friendly. Also, she offered us extra marinara gravy (sauce) for our sandwiches at no extra cost to us.  Walk up to the counter and place your order, have a seat and they will bring your food to your table. They accept credit cards and debit cards. There is a parking lot next door to the dry cleaners which is next to the restaurant, but it only parks six or seven cars. The parking lot is shared by the dry cleaners and restaurant, however if it is full, there is additional parking for the restaurant across the street -- best of all -- parking is free!

23.description: Tried the breaded steak sandwich in the past which was good & the reason I went back. Recently tried the meatball sandwich which was dry and pretty disappointing. Bread was soft but hard to bite into, if that even makes sense.. I don't like their natural fries either, they were really greasy & soft.

47.description: Breaded steak sandwich was very good, but not the same sauce or bread as Milano's in Bridgeport.  I will forever compare every breaded steak sandwich to theirs and so far none have come close.

8.description: This is a good restaurant - the pasta is AMAZING! I especially recommend the pesto, grilled chicken breast, and the....what's it called olio and argelo? You know which one.However I do NOT recommend the olio one if you're in a relationship as the garlic used is very fresh and will stay on your breath for days!Also of note: the pasta portions are VERY generous. You can easily eat half and have the second half for a later meal.Oh, one last thing; I had the panini vegiano tonight. It was decent but too oily. I won't order again.

31.description: I've ordered here a few times, but I think I'm done. Tonight I had the chicken parm. Two breaded chicken breasts covered in melted cheese served over mostaccoli noodles in marinara. The cheese was the best part, the rest of it was just bland. It is a portion big enough for two, but I don't know how it will even reheat tomorrow :(. For previous orders I've had a panini - ok, the caprese salad - the tomatoes were barely ripe, and a very burnt pizza with very little toppings, and to be honest I agree with reviews on yelp about  the poor attitude of the service. They don't sound welcoming on the phone or in person. It's just "Hi, what can i get you?" I had better hopes, and kept trying. Oh well.

34.description: I've eaten here a few times and have had good experiences, the food's good and at times so has the service. But on 2 occasions, there is a very large female cashier that I received bad service from. She has greeted some customers and some she hadn't including myself. My food was brought up to the counter and she called it out, plopped it down and walked off. No thank you or anything else. If I go back, if she is working then I'll rather go to Freddie's, Punky's or Mariano's

16.description: Nope can't fool me. When you have Fresca in the name no matter how you say it, it means fresh. Ordered the pick your own pasta. So I had the bowtie pasta with vodka sauce and grilled salmon. The vodka sauce was a little thin for my taste and mediocre tasting at best and the salmon was in no way fresh or grilled. It tasted like the salmon you get at Walmart, frozen in those individual packs. And how can it be grilled and there are no grill marks on it but yet it was over cooked and dry. I'll stick to getting my italian fast food at Pompeii in Little Italy.

13.description: Horrible horrible horrible!!! Today I went in for a chesseburger , nothing complicated and it was to go I waited 25 min for my burger , I asked the cashier how much longer will it be ? She checked and the cook hadn't even started cooking it , I was so upset that I refused anything else but a refund. They said I had to wait for the owner to do the refund . Currently still waiting . Didn't get to eat anything for lunch today thanks to the disorganized workers .

11.description: I'm trying new places to eat and found this place on yelp. Today i tried the beaded steak sandwich. I must say i paid $16 for the sandwich drink and fries. Ouch!!! but i will say the sandwich was good.  The steak was tender and the bread was soft. There's alot of places with horrible chewy breaded steak sandwichs. The only thing i will do next time is bring a friend to split this sandwich. The place is clean and you'll feel safe there alot of cops eat there. ... lolI forget to mention they have fresh cut fries. I ate them before the sandwich.  May come back for a order of fries :)

39.description: We stopped here for dinner in hopes that maybe it could be an occasional substitute for Rico's or Freddie's. Never mind that idea. Service is politely frosty, not as friendly as the other two places. I was a little floored when I heard our total: $28 for a pasta dinner, sandwich special, and one arancini. I was even more upset and surprised when we got home and I found that my pasta "dinner" consisted of 15 (oh yes, we counted) gnocchi sitting in orange-red "marinara" sitting in a single layer that barely covered the bottom of a 9-inch aluminum cake pan. I mean, they charge approximately $3 more than Rico's for their pasta dinner, and serve significantly less. At this point, I think the redeeming factor for this place may be their fries. I can't believe how much we paid for prepackaged-quality food in snack-sized portions. Rico's and Freddie's for us after this.

37.description: The soup was great but Overpriced! Restaurant prices for a fast food type place. $4:50 for a cup of soup. Next time I,ll get soup and sandwich down the street for $5... sorry mangia

0.description: Again, food is awesome! Fettuccini Alfredo is a tad on the watery side but other pastas are great! 2nd time this week being here. And the counter staff are great.

38.description: It's hard to love this place because it is SO overpriced for the quantity and quality of food you receive. The service was decent but my breaded steak was dry, their marinara tasted canned and for nearly $15 it should be stellar. Gio's isn't the bees knees but it's far better than this place. The only good thing was the free drink with Yelp! check-in. The service was quick, but I think that played into why the food was forgettable. Back to Rico's for us!

51.description: We ordered Angel hair pasta with shrimp  and sausage and it was bland , not worth the price.

27.description: Stopped in for fried raviolis. I had such a taste for them. $6 for 4 undercooked, dripping, frozen in the middle awful raviolis. Don't bother! Never to return. Didn't want to give a star. Made me to post successfully.

32.description: I had higher expectations about this place. First off, I was a bit confused and displeased by the fact that they do not serve anything on plates. Everything gets served at your table in to-go containers. The marinara sauce is way bland, like Chef Boyardee bland and the noodles are over cooked. Quite frankly, for a neighborhood place, Fabulous Freddie's is far superior and at the same price point.

54.description: Spent nearly three days in bed sick after eating here. Bowtie special was undercooked the first time I ordered it. Customer service wasn't the best. Best thing I had was the fountain drinks.

48.description: I live right by here and I pass by many times, but I have never tried it. Word of mouth said this place has the best breaded steak sandwich in the neighborhood. Came here on a Sunday to give it a try and ordered the breaded steak sandwich with mozzarella cheese and sweet peppers and a turkey burger. The place was empty when we arrived and our order took about 15 minutes. The breaded steak sandwich was just okay. It was more on the dry side, but when my cousin ordered it a few weeks back, it wasn't as dry as mine. I guess it depends on who makes it? I will probably go back again to give it another try. The turkey burger on the other hand was good.

44.description: When I think of a "Turkey Sub" from an Italian place I expect something pretty specific and its generally correct: Provolone, Lettuce, Onion, Italian Dressing- with flaky white shredded turkey. This Turkey Sub? Every opposite of that. American cheese, Tomato, and Mayonnaise and pinkish turkey. What? I had to sub out everything to get what I was expecting would be standard. It was difficult to eat, the roll doesn't enclose the meat which, ya, is great in theory ("so much meat! great!") but in execution, I really couldn't eat it in public it was so messy and the bread was too chewy to tear through. I hope their pizza is better than their sandwiches!

24.description: I have eaten here a few times and enjoyed it. The pizza is thin with light cheese which is what I like. Make your own pasta is a steal of a deal. 4.99 for a plate of pasta and sauce (of your choice) that can feed a family of four.

7.description: A simple Italian restaurant that offers a good assortment of pastas, brick-over pizzas, salads, paninis, sandwiches, and even breakfast! We decided to stop by for dinner and ordered the lasagna, margherita pizza, and soups (chicken rice with lemon and a ravioli soup). Even though I was expecting the lasagna to have meat, it was still very good and filling. It would be great if an option with meat was offered. The margherita pizza was delicious with a slightly-burnt and toasty crust. The soups were a bit on the salty side. Overall, it was a satisfying dinner and I would visit again, maybe build my own pasta.

49.description: I have eaten over 4 times and lets say food is bellow average for the pricing. it's bellow level of olive garden. I ate every sandwich and salad on the menu it very much same bland taste owner is rude and arrogant so are his workers. I asked for some more lettuce and they made it a big deal. The soaps only have the consume or broth no vegetables or chicken ! You can get better soaps from a can and salads from shop and save are way better than this joint. I heard good thing about pizza and pasta is homemade.You have a better bet going to GIO'S who have mexican cooks or, Freddies,Francescas, Pampei, pot belly for soaps or salads. rather than canary ville hillbilly's who are wannabe Italian tough guys who don't know that a restaurant is based on customer and making customer happy! LOL

40.description: Overpriced. Mediocre food. No thanks.

53.description: came here a few times.. I've tried the breaded chicken, breaded steak, and a cheese burger..breaded chicken.. lacking in flavorsbreaded steak.. to me its a little dry and blandcheese burger.. your average burgermaybe I'll come back to give the pizza a try...

30.description: The breaded steak sandwich is amazing.  You can feed 3 with it.  Far better than Ricco's in my opinion.  The pizzas are good but they are skimpy on the sauce and basil.  The rigatoni vodka is very good.  Large portions!

46.description: The food at Mangia Fresca is very good. I like their pizza, pasta dishes, and sandwiches. It's a good place to eat at if you're ever in the area.

1.description: This place is located in a peculiar location next to the Orange Line station on Halsted and Archer. It's unassuming but does have a couple of parking spots.There are a lot of Italian places in Bridgeport and this place's menu immediately reminded me of Ricobene's which is just about a mile away. I got the breaded steak sandwich for a direct comparison to Rico's famed breaded steak. Mangia's breaded steak is definitely a cleaner version compared to Rico's. The breading is good, meat is tasty, much less messy than Rico's and mozarella and hot peppers are a must. However, I still strongly prefer Rico's breaded steak. You get a lot more steak, hot peppers, cheese, and overall food at Rico's. Plus, I think Mangia's is pretty expensive. $13 for a not-so-big breaded steak with cheese and not-so-many peppers. I'd rather get a king-sized Rico's breaded steak for that price.Mangia's food is definitely tasty. So if you're not a gluttonous pig like me and enjoy a smaller meal, try Mangia's for sure. But I'll probably be getting my next breaded steak at Rico's.

55.description: The worst lunch I ever had. First I ordered a vegetarian Panino It was $8.00 for a sandwich only. When it arrived 25 minutes later it was cold in the middle and the cheese wasn't melted. Tasted like soggy vinegar canned vegetables. I returned it and asked for the pepper and egg sandwich (Friday during Lent). Also terrible couldn't finish it, the eggs were overcooked, came right out of a warming bin, they were grainy with no flavor. It's like a really bad school cafeteria lunch only you paid $8.00 and didn't get milk and cookies with it.Oh yeah the staff, got to mention this. There were about 6 or more people behind the counter. The three girls that work the front wearing sweatpants and Pajama bottoms with dirty UGG boots. This was just gross and unprofessional for a restaurant.I will tell all my workers in the area and friends never to eat here.

9.description: Got an Italian beef and it was cold as my freezer. I tried to give them another chance so I ordered a veggie pizza. Horrible. To them a veggie pizza is tomato and zucchini. They only good part was the crust! Never will I go again. I've learned from my two mistakes.

26.description: I don't know how they can consider themselves an Italian restaurant. Portions were huge, pasta was undercooked and pretty sure the sauce came from a can. I had the red sauce and my boyfriend had the Alfredo and it was equally bland. He also ordered shrimp (which cost an extra $5) and came with four total shrimp. Don't waste your time coming here for good italian food, you'll only be disappointed.

25.description: So, in the last month I have ordered in advance to pick up.  I take the orange line to the restaurant and expect it to be ready and than jump on the Halsted bus going home.  All three times I have been told 20 minutes or so.  I get there and have to wait 20 more minutes.  The service sucks.  The attitude of the people behind the counter is horrendous.  I am tired of getting there and waiting.  Besides that the food aint all the great.  7PM and its sloppy and not worthy to stop anymore.  I do not recommend this restaurant.  Quality stinks.....works rude.......if u feel that I am going to skip out on the bill than get a deposit over the phone.  I used to like your restaurant....but I can go elsewhere

12.description: Stopped in for fried raviolis. I had such a taste for them. $6 for 4 undercooked, dripping, frozen in the middle awful raviolis. Don't bother! Never to return. Didn't want to give a star. Made me to post successfully.

59.description: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Bridgeport... the pick the sauce your the boss is so inexpensive at only $5, and you get a portion big enough for 2-3 people, and theres a great variety of sauces and pasta to pick from.There is a great selection of soups everyday- I am yet to go there and not have at least 4-5 options presented to me. The breaded steak and breaded chicken sandwiches are the best I have ever had--slightly expensive,  but well worth it considering the portion you get- and honestly pretty competitive with other spots in the area.I really enjoy their pizzas too- light and very tasty- you dont feel bloated after eating it because its nice and thin. Mangia deserves a 6th star because its the best!!!!!!!!

21.description: So I got off the train at Halsted and I had 12 minutes til my bus came I ordered soup paid and thought how hard is soup to put in a bowl ??? If it wasn't for the 4 cops that butted in front of me I probably would have had my soup in minutes but the counter girls were fawning over them. I was looking for my bus and seen it coming and told the girl to put in a bowl cold I will warm it up at home still no soup. so I ran for my bus with no soup. When I got home at archer and Loomis I called them and told them the situation and they said they couldn't do anything for me cause I left !!! Really ???? I just wanted to get my soup the next day or a credit and they said I can't do anything for you!!!!! Really ??? So I told her I will NEVER go back there and I will yelp you guys bad reviews!!! Then hung up. Then 2 minutes later they called back and said I can come  get my soup tomorrow I was like that's all I wanted when I called the first time but they wouldn't even credit me I had to say I was  going to give them bad reviews on Yelp for them To give me my soup!!!  I like this place but will NEVER go back !!!

17.description: Well for a while now we were on a trial separation, every so often I'd go back thinking things would be different and just like going back to an ex for a night when you shouldn't have, it wasn't good, but scratched an itch. Well at some point even that comes to end.We went in the other night and I tried to order something that in concept seemed simple, and I was willing to pay the higher price. They have a simple build your pasta, pick a noodle, and pick a sauce, easy enough. Well of course I wanted a sauce that was on the fancier side of the menu and it comes with tortellini, so I asked at the counter, can I have the pancetta  sauce on fettuccine noodles instead? The girl at the counter first starred blankly then blurted out a clear NO! Then I asked is it because it was pre-made, she said she didn't know and that I could ask the guys that cook. (This place has the kitchen area right behind the counter, so you can see them) However, she didn't move from the register to get whoever it was that I can ask. Well me being me, moved over a few feet and tried to get their attention, one guy went somewhere further back out of sight, and the other did a repeat of the blank stare and shifted out of sight. So much for asking.I would have been willing to pick something else out if we had just been able to find out why this couldn't be done, or clarify if it was just a pricing thing. I was more than willing to pay the cost for the fancier sauce, if that was the issue, I know I said that above but it merits repeating, I wasn't trying to get the fancy stuff for simple pricing. Done and done, I'm no longer tempted, it's over! I'm under no illusion that they'll be missing me either.

10.description: Wow. Shame on me. I tried this place again. Wont get me a third time. Over priced and not worth the trouble. Avoid avoid avoid.

5.description: Ordered a breaded steak sandwich. Looks great. Took a bite and a long hair was found. Took it up to the cashier and asked her for another one since I didn't order hair in my food. She asked for a receipt! Even though she just served me about three minutes earlier and still called the manager who really doubted that the hair was in my sandwich. Had to go back to my table and bring the other three guys up to prove that the hair was in there. another 12-15 minutes, got another sandwich. No apologies, no free fries or tiramisu or anything for waiting while my lunch friends were done with their meals. I will not recommend due to the poor customer service. *\****

3.description: I'm a fan of this spot. I've only had their breaded steak (which is a solid tasty steak) the roll it comes on is my favorite of any in the area including the mighty Ricobenes and at $9.95 you can't go wrong. My Aunt had the Panino Prosciutto , which I had a bite of and was very tasty. To finish we had homemade Canoli which the stuff in front of you. I'm a fan of this method as it keeps the shell crispy and not soggy. Wood fired pizza on site, easy parking lot and a great neighborhood spot over all. I'll be back Mangia Fresca!

35.description: The food here is very mediocre and way overpriced. Most or all the food is from frozen freezer bags. From the bagged cannoli filling, 4 month old frozen lasagna, frozen chocolate cake slices, the microwave heated arracini, bagged soup...yea it goes on. Why must you use a microwave so often? Super quick food ready before you can even take a seat is a red flag. Yes you get a lot of pasta, because it's boxed and cheap. Just like the taste. FYI DONT TIP ON YOUR CARD OR AT ALL, THE CASHIERS DONT RECIEVE ANY OF THE MONEY.

19.description: I had the fried ravioli, felt like a waste of calories but the sauce was ok. We got the garlic gravy bread which was pretty good! My husband had the breaded steak sandwich which was pretty good. Good for takeout or a quick stop, def not a date place! But would come back if in the area, wouldnt go out of the way for it.

28.description: Save your money! The food was plentiful but just average. Breaded chicken was thin and dry, like jerky.

45.description: Best breakfast !!  Who knew?

33.description: Definitely love ordering from here. The portions are really made for two so you get a bang for your buck, in regards to the build your own pasta. It is somewhat overpriced and the girls at the counter aren't always the friendliest. Good thing we order delivery.

43.description: This was my first time trying this place after 4 years of always passing by on my way to school I finally decided to stop by. I had seen the episode on Chicago's best, and this place is delicious! I ordered a pizza with wheat dough, sausage, and pepperoni. It was perfect because it was all for me & it wasn't greasy, too chewy, nothing! Perfecto! My boyfriend ordered a salad and a chicken sandwich and they were both good!!!! The girl that took my order was really nice and helpful as well. I would definitely go backl ASAP to try everything else on the menu!

2.description: I came here to pick up some grub to go since I was in the mood for some good pasta and Alfredo. I was surprised by the huge portion they give you for. Honestly, this would be enough for two people. I also liked how they separated the topping for you. I wouldn't say this has the best Alfredo but it's good enough to fulfill your appetite. My only complaint are the fries which were the WORST fries I've ever ordered. I asked for crispy ones and the cashier said they could be well done. Turns out, they were TOO well done; they tasted burnt and I ended up dumping them out.

18.description: Great experience.  Very friendly staff, orders are done properly, servings are huge.  Had the pasta dinner with meat sauce.  Plenty of off street parking and huge menu.

41.description: Move over Riccobene's your breaded steak sandwhich just got beat!The breaded steak sandwhich here is amazing! I had it on garlic bread with cheese and giardinera.  Oh my was it good and the sauce was subtle.  I ordered this with two other people.  Our total was about $50, for three sandwhichs with cheese, giardinera, and garlic bread as the bread, we also had three orders of the home cut fries, total was $50 and change.  Now, before we placed this order we were going to hit Ricobene's, right before we clicked "confirm" to offically place the Ricobene's order, that had tax and everything else calculated, my brother mentioned this place instead.  In a seperate window on the computer we drew up the same order at Mangia, shockingly Ricobene's wanted $1 more in total LOL.  Well I am glad we not only saved $1 but we got better quality than Ricobene's.  Here let's compare:Giardinera - At Mangia their Giardinera is fresh and just tastes better than Ricobene's.  Plus Mangias is not overwhelmingly spicey so you can taste it better instead of just burning your mouth.The sauce - is much more subtle and lighter and homemade at Mangia.  Ricobene's uses sauce in a can.The breaded steak is about equal to each other and the sizes are the same.  Mangia only has one size which is equal to the king size at Ricobene's.  The garlic bread - it did seem to taste a little bolder at Ricobene'sOverall Mangia wins this one, so they will now be my source for my breaded steak cravings!BTW - I see shitty reviews on here calling the breaded steak bland uuuuuuuhhhhh, well that is because your supposed to get it with sauce and garlic bread or else the breaded steak anywhere you go will be a bland item.  Understand that breaded steak is very simple that's why the garlic bread , cheese, and giardinera are neccessary...well maybe you can get away with no giardinera but garlic bread and cheese is a must ANYWHERE you go for a breaded steak, get educated before trashing a place.******UPDATE****** Oh man their meatball sandwhich is the shit!!!! This is one of the best meatball sandwhichs I have ever had!  Fresh meat, fresh cheese, it was damn good!  I am seeing more shitty reviews, and some girl called the sauce canned.....what!!!???.....Do you even have a clue what the difference between canned and homemade sauce is??!!  I can't stand wannabe foodies geez.  And I see people ripping on things like a veggie sandwhich, they only put that shit on the menu for whiny little weiners that are on some goofy diet, they do not need to put effort into a dull food item like that.  Geez, if you do not like the place, fine, everyone is entitled to their opinion, but do not sit there and act like a foodie expert when you are not, by saying this food is not fresh and tastless because now your review belongs in the garbage can because it is incorrect and not FACT.********UPDATE**************It is now June 2nd and I ordered for delivery on 6/1/14.  I am lowering my stars to 4 stars for this place because I need to talk about how bad their delivery service is, as I was wronged the two and only times I ordered for delivery.  The first time I kept being told the food was out when it really was not, luckily I got it and got it warm, but I did not appreciate being bullshitted about whether it was out or not.  Now this Sundat really, really pissed me off, I am still a little mad thinking about it.  We placed our order at 5:45P.M. At 6:45 I wondered about how much longer so I called in and asked.  The woman said the food left, I said don't you want my name to look it up she said you had the two meatball sandwhichs right?  I said yes that is me, so I was very impressed with the fact that she knew that, which shows she is on her A-game kuodos to her.  Too bad their moron driver was not on his A game, he was on his F- game.  Shortly after the woman said the food was out, we got the call from the driver on the phone, he said he was outside, cool, so we ran down to sign the credit card slip and get the food we were waiting an hour and 10 minutes for, accept, there was......nobody.....there, oooook.  We looked up and down the block and not a soul in sight.  My brother called this guy twice and he would not pick up his damn phone.  So that means he was standing in front of someone else's house on the wrong block and left his phone in the car!  To make it worse he stood in front of the wrong house for 10 damn minutes for crying out load!  We called in to cancel our order, they made an attempt to reach him, and they did reach him and he still claimed he was in front of our place, so we looked again and there was no damn driver!  We did not appreciate the games and not getting our damn food, we cancelled our order and the woman there apologized we said it is not her fault, they just hire morons to do their delivering.  Not only that, the fact that she knew our order without looking up our name says that they were not real busy, so why take over an hour?

52.description: This place is a total hidden gem.Located right next to the orange line, it's a great spot to stop in and get good Italian food after a hard day of work.The pizza ROCKS. Pepperoni is just right! They even make it in a brick oven right in front of you.The panini are fantastic too. Chicken basil and tomato is awesome.Very nice staff too.

50.description: breaded streak sandwich... best ive ever had!

4.description: I wish I could give 0 stars. Absolutely the worst food I've had. The so-called chicken Marsala was plain chicken breast (tasted like rotisserie chicken) over plain pasta over runny "sauce". Never mind that it took 30 min. and I don't know why. If you come Bridgeport go to Ricobenes instead. Plus they forgot our French fries.

6.description: Do not like this place at all. I had always seen this restaurant and decided to stop in one day. I order a basic ham and cheese sandwich and my wife got some breakfast platter (which was fine). Mine on the other hand ... Not so much!! I took a bite and it tasted funky.. I told my wife to try it and she thought the same thing. I put two and two together and the mayonnaise was spoiled!I brought my food up there and asked if I could either get a new sandwich or a refund. The staff was baffled and told me that the manager wasn't present so they couldn't say yes or no. How are you going to refuse a customer a new sandwich when the one you gave them was spoiled!?!?Anyways .. It took them more than half an hour and me asking a few more times for them to finally "budge" and give me a new sandwich. I don't think I'll be going back solely because of the unprofessional demeanor the company had.

22.description: Well for a while now we were on a trial separation, every so often I'd go back thinking things would be different and just like going back to an ex for a night when you shouldn't have, it wasn't good, but scratched an itch. Well at some point even that comes to end.We went in the other night and I tried to order something that in concept seemed simple, and I was willing to pay the higher price. They have a simple build your pasta, pick a noodle, and pick a sauce, easy enough. Well of course I wanted a sauce that was on the fancier side of the menu and it comes with tortellini, so I asked at the counter, can I have the pancetta  sauce on fettuccine noodles instead? The girl at the counter first starred blankly then blurted out a clear NO! Then I asked is it because it was pre-made, she said she didn't know and that I could ask the guys that cook. (This place has the kitchen area right behind the counter, so you can see them) However, she didn't move from the register to get whoever it was that I can ask. Well me being me, moved over a few feet and tried to get their attention, one guy went somewhere further back out of sight, and the other did a repeat of the blank stare and shifted out of sight. So much for asking.I would have been willing to pick something else out if we had just been able to find out why this couldn't be done, or clarify if it was just a pricing thing. I was more than willing to pay the cost for the fancier sauce, if that was the issue, I know I said that above but it merits repeating, I wasn't trying to get the fancy stuff for simple pricing. Done and done, I'm no longer tempted, it's over! I'm under no illusion that they'll be missing me either.

15.description: I was going to walk over and get a breakfast sandwich so I called ahead of time so it would be ready when I picked it up. They wouldn't take my order w/ out a phone number? Seriously!? I just want a breakfast sandwich, I don't want to give you my phone number, and I don't want to be "in your system" I just want a sandwich, I'm hungry. Just make my sandwich, stop trying to get all of my information. Anyway, the food is pretty good but its a bit overpriced and this isn't the first time i've had bad service. I've spent a lot of money here, and you just lost a good customer. Check out the other bad reviews. AVOID.

57.description: Best eggplant sandwiches in the city. The pizzas are oven wood burned type thin crust and are different but tasty. The sauces are good and it is conveniently located on Archer Ave by the orange line.

20.description: Nope can't fool me. When you have Fresca in the name no matter how you say it, it means fresh. Ordered the pick your own pasta. So I had the bowtie pasta with vodka sauce and grilled salmon. The vodka sauce was a little thin for my taste and mediocre tasting at best and the salmon was in no way fresh or grilled. It tasted like the salmon you get at Walmart, frozen in those individual packs. And how can it be grilled and there are no grill marks on it but yet it was over cooked and dry. I'll stick to getting my italian fast food at Pompeii in Little Italy.

36.description: Why did it take me so long to find out about this place? Mangia Fresca rocks!! Best breaded steak ever. Seriously, for $10.00 it feeds two people easily. Good quality meat and bread. Fries are real potatoes. They have so many menu options, lots of stuff for Lent, including a caprese panini. Limited parking lot, but street parking is available when it is not rush hour.

14.description: Great food with good service, highly recommend the breaded steak or a brick oven pizza

3.description: Sinai Kosher has a great outlet store & deli.  It is at the corner of 39th & Morgan.  They make great sandwiches, hot dogs & polish sausage.  I mean really good.  All deli meats like pastrami, corned beef, turkey, salami, etc.  You can buy bulk packaged foods to go too, like bagel dogs.    They open early as well.  You can buy chips & drinks too, so I'd go there for lunch & they have everything you need.  This is the best kosher stuff in Chicago.  I was there once & a bus load of old Jewish people all came in, so you know it has to be good!

1.description: looks like this phone number is disconnected. Maybe this place has closed?

2.description: I'm sure this place was really bustling during the height of the Back of the Yards stockyard era. I grew up coming here with my mom purchasing some of the freshest, top quality deli meats you'll find in the city. The beef jerky was so addicitve it wasn't funny. I had serious beef jerky withdrawl issues for a long time during my youth because of this place.

0.description: These are the best hot dogs made - of all store brands available!   But, these are harder to find now that CostCo (stabbed us in the back!) sells their own inferior brand hot dogs instead.

58.description: Perfect diner! Tasty food...friendly service...easy on the pocket book,All within walking distance from my front door. Who could ask for more!

56.description: Places like this are far and few between.  Something like a cross between a greasy spoon and a family diner.  I came in here before an afternoon Sox game, and the joint was packed, but I was able to find a seat at the counter.All I had was a piece of chocolate cake (excellent) and coffee (strong and good) but I was treated as if I had bought the entire menu.  The waitresses kept my coffee cup filled and constantly came around to check on me, amid what was one busy day at the place.Also, the customers made a difference as well.  Everyone in here was friendly, and I even struck up a conversation with the guy next to me who kept asking me to share his breakfast since it was way too much food.  All in all, a great experience for a quick cup of joe, and I'd look forward to eating a regular meal hear anytime.

29.description: I love this place. It's near my university and it has become weekend tradition to come here with my friends for their skillets. My friends love the avocado omelette or gyros omelette and I like the Denver and other meat laden skillets. One of my friends came here and he enjoyed their biscuits and southern fried steak skillet (it got his Southern seal of approval!) We like to eat here and take our time chatting and eating. Less than 10$ gets you two meals, one if you're overzealous and want to leave feeling stuffed and gluttonous. I also like how the bus stop is right outside for commuting convenience!

42.description: Great greasy spoon.  Cleaner now since the new owners took over and much busier since The Ramova closed!

23.description: Local diner, need I say more? There pancakes are yummy, and skillets are fine. I ordered the bacon and sausage skillet, it was good but had an overload of large sized mushrooms and onions. Next time I'll be sure to not to get neither added. If you want a big breakfast I say come here. Coffee is hot (as in temperature but it's just ok). I'll try their lunch food soon.But the servers are really nice and it's a good casual feel. Bathroom smells great too.

47.description: Excellent breakfast place on the Southside of Chicago. Stay with the Bacon or ham, forget the sausage.  Serving staff are great, and the coffee is what you need to start your morning.

8.description: First time being at this spot ON MOTHERS DAY!!!! lol I blame my sister due to this wasn't the place we wanted to end up on mothers day. To my surprise they have very fast and awesome service. They also moved people with great flow when it was packed on mothers day.Our server was so friendly and the food was just your standard dinner food but with great portion size and hot and fresh. I haven't been to this spot since 94 with my grandma but it was great to be back in a place I felt welcomed.

31.description: The food is very typical. What really ruined my experience was that I had bought a burger that came with a bowl of soup. The soup was good but more than I wanted to eat so I let my boyfriend finish it. We didn't ask for a new bowl or spoon but there was a charge for "Share" on our bill. I do not need to go to a restaurant that charges me for trying to not waste food I paid for.

34.description: Omlette I had was pretty good, nice friendly service.  Very good breakfast diner.  I deduct one star due to the nasty hashbrowns that came with my meal, how can they call those big sloppy cuts of potato hash browns!?  Maybe I order the wrong TYPE of hashbrowns since there was a kid near me having the good shoe string ones.  The menu needs to clarify the difference!  I loved the omlette, service, pancakes, and prices.  I will return again but I will questions them about hashbrowns first!

16.description: I've ordered delivery from here a handful of times and it's usually great, except for the last few times. Both times I ordered french toast, and both times I'm pretty sure I received a slice of plain white bread that had just been grilled on a frying pan - it looked like grilled cheese without the cheese. When cut, you can tell very little (or no) batter was used as it's completely white and everything was still the consistency of plain white bread. I took a bite and surprise, surprise - it tasted like I was eating a piece of greasy toast with syrup on it. Not sure if they have someone working nights that has no idea what french toast is or what. I'd ordered french toast from here in the past (several months ago) and it had always been good, so it's clearly an issue with whomever they have in the kitchen now.Also, $8 delivery charge? Seriously?!?!

13.description: The food has been great almost all the times Ive been there.Chicken Florentine, and Healthy options are great.The owners are a lil racist (whattya expect when the owners are hispanic and so are 90% of the waitresses/cooks). Rumor has it that the white ladies there aren't even allowed to serve their husbands/boyfriends.On the other hand:Jenny, Kathy and Danielle are the Creme de la creme of the place, with the best customer service.Tip for the owners, treat your employees right and maybe your turnover rate wouldnt be so high.

11.description: So happy that I live a block away from the Bridgeport Restaurant.  Their breakfast is always super filling, comes out fast, and oh so tasty!  I love their skillets and pancakes.I'll be honest, I've only ordered breakfast, but I need to try more, hoping that they put just as much love into it.

39.description: Consistency brings me back.Very fair prices, food is good.Most servers are friendly.Owner is usually around, either in the kitchen or just around.He is wearing a baseball cap and has a stache.Will be back, again and again.They have a Mon-Fri breakfast special, even though they raised the price $1, at $4.55 its still very fair.

37.description: This place is amazing because they deliver through Grubhub. For those of us who live in congested neighborhoods and do not want to lose a coveted parking space just outside the house to grab some food, this place is worth trying as far as delivery. The prices are decent, the delivery is fast and the food is good. As long as they continue to deliver I'll be ordering from them!

0.description: I have officially become a "regular" at Bridgeport Diner (as I like to call it). The first time in my life I have ever been a regular who gets the "usual" at a restaurant.Our regular waitress, Rihanna, is super friendly, with a smile always on her face and she now has my order down pat. I get the JB skillet with no chicken and Cholula hot sauce on the side. It is the best skillet I've had in Chicago! Love the poblano peppers, spicy salsa and avocado, and so much better than most skillets because it's not soaked in cheese. Bridgeport Diner has a family environment and they always decorate the place up for whatever holiday is coming up - Halloween, Christmas, Valentines, St Pats etc. All the staff are really lovely, it's cheap, they are efficient and they always keep your coffee mug topped up with hot coffee!Definitely love this place and will continue to come 1-2 times a months (more if I can swing it!).

38.description: 4's breakfast done right & excellent sausage gravy is reason enough, really.

51.description: Now that i discovered the Palace Grill, this place is done.I'm impressed this place still has 4 stars honestly.The place used to look dingy and a bit greasy but i loved that atmosphere and the food.Now it looks sterile, service is quick(there's your 2 stars) but every time i go there the food gets worse (or my palate better, who knows) and there is too much visible drama between the wait staff. I don't care about the drama, i just want better food.

27.description: This is a great neighborhood spot. Service is friendly, food is good and they have fresh orange juice. Food portions are a bit large and you can typically share an omelette.

32.description: I've only been here for breakfast. Service is good, food is decent, broad menu selection. Prices are cheap.

54.description: Food has no taste. Rude servers.

48.description: Diner food, all the usual menu items. Love going there for breakfast. I get the village omelete with spinach, mushroom, tomatoes and feta.  Good service.  Nice and easy as a neighborhood place should be.  All booths so there are no bad tables.

44.description: Good breakfast.  Bridgeport skillet is great

24.description: Great place to come for easy diner food. We went on a Sunday at 11 am and didn't have to wait for a table. The restaurant is clean and the food got to the table faster than the coffee! I had a skillet and it was delish! The portions were really large too, so it's a great place to go for brunch. I thought that since this was a diner, the food would be pretty cheap, but my meal turned out to be about $15. Not super cheap, but not too bad. I will definitely be coming back.

7.description: If I could give 3.5 stars, I would. Bridgeport diner is a typical greasy diner with large portions. So why the extra .5 stars?Well, their service is ptetty on point. Our waitress always had a smile on, and was attentive to my coffee level, which I always appreciate. Plus, the food was decent, the atmosphere festive but not garish, and their food is solid for the price (though the food is not exactly unique or special- it's breakfast diner food). If you want lots of coffee and a large portion of greasy, typical breakfast food served cheap  with a smile, bridgeport is for you.

49.description: For a diner...  This is place is great! The restaurant is clean.  I love breakfast here.  The food is fresh and tastes good.  The prices are very reasonable and service is prompt and courteous.  What more can you ask for from a diner?

40.description: Had lunch here today.  Have dined here before for breakfast or brunch and it was pretty good.  Today had the gyros plate lunch special, which was nothing special at all.  It was the blandest gyro I've ever had, although I did appreciate the pepperoni, olives, and cheese on the side.  The French fries were over-cooked and not good.  How can a French fry be bad? But the worst was the waitstaff.  Kinda clueless.  I had coffee but didn't get a glass of water until halfway through my meal.  I had another waiter come by to fill the salt and pepper shakers at my tale WHILE I was eating! Really?  Staff didn't acknowledge me while I was waiting at the register to pay.  They did slip in a quick, quiet "thank you" just before I got to the door.  Whatever!

53.description: This is the reason I love city diners. Great food and cheap prices.I order the most amazing breakfast item ever... The Haystack. What's that you say? Only a large order of biscuits and gravy over hashbrowns topped with eggs. So fattening, delicious and I loved it. What a great way to start the morning! Best part: breakfast for two with coffee cost only $15. Try finding those prices in the 'burbs where a meal like that will run you over $25.Nice place though they kinda get stingy with the coffee after the bill is dropped off. I need a cup for the road, c'mon!

30.description: This is a definite stop when I'm in the Bridgport area.  The service is great and the menu is very accommodating.  This is a plus when you have dietary restrictions.  My coffee cup always seems to be full even when they're extremely busy.I also love the vibe.  The customers are very friendly.  Definitely, a higher caliber clientele.

46.description: This place is just not what it used to be.A while back, I wrote a *glowing* review of this place, being one of my favorite spots in the city.  Alas, with renovation and new management, it has lost its charm.  The food isn't as good, the atmosphere feels like just a lame knock-off of the old, and the service isn't quite as personable.I know my opinion is being heavily influenced by what this place used to be, but it's the truth. Before, this place was stellar.  Now it's just okay.

1.description: First of all, I'm not a fancy person. I was out hunting for a good diner breakfast experience. And this place is a few blocks away. And that is exactly what it delivered. They have a good selection of omelettes. The first time I went, I tried a Hawaiian omelette, which I had never heard of and I'm pretty sure they made up. It had pineapple and ham and swiss cheese and the combination worked. I also tried a thing called potatoes O'Brien. I realize mixing Irish and Hawaiian might seem kind of strange. But I have two counter-arguments. First, macadamia nuts. Macadamia nuts, which now grow in Hawaii, were brought from Scotland by John Macadam. Now, Scotland is not Ireland. Not at all. But they are NEAR each other. So there's some precedent for mixing Hawaii with stuff from the islands north of Europe. Second, it's diner food. It's not like I'm mixing poi with blood pudding. It's an omelette and potatoes.Anyway, the second time I had a different omelette. It had spinach and feta cheese and roasted peppers. It was also good. The food is good. The coffee is good. The service is good. It's clean and pleasant. If you need a good little diner experience, that's exactly what is inside. Now, I have to call attention to one oddity. I am a native New Yorker and only recently moved to Chicago. So, maybe this is a Chicago thing. Or maybe it is just an idiosyncrasy of the the Bridgeport Restaurant. I don't know. Both of my omelettes arrived with this fist-sized, bright green spicy-hot pepper just sitting on the side of the plate. It was just there. I'm not sure why it was there. I am not even sure if I was expected to eat it or if it was purely decorative. I did try a piece and it was extremely spicy. It isn't for me. I've noticed that Chicago does have a habit of sticking spicy peppers on everything, so maybe it's not unusual. I don't know. I only mention it because it might be a selling point for you. If you've been looking for a good diner breakfast that also gives you a fist-sized, bright green, spicy hot pepper, this is it. You've found it. Go here. It's everything you want. If you don't care about the hot pepper, you can just not eat it. They don't seem to care. No one yelled at me over it.

55.description: It was an okay experience. I went with my brother for a quick lunch and the waitress was very inviting and made sure we were taken care of. I ordered a mushroom burger and it was pretty tasty. I will probably go back soon.

9.description: Local diner, need I say more? There pancakes are yummy, and skillets are fine. I ordered the bacon and sausage skillet, it was good but had an overload of large sized mushrooms and onions. Next time I'll be sure to not to get neither added. If you want a big breakfast I say come here. Coffee is hot (as in temperature but it's just ok). I'll try their lunch food soon.But the servers are really nice and it's a good casual feel. Bathroom smells great too.

26.description: We are from out of town, and just yelped a good restaurant for breakfast.  We were very happy with our choice!!  Great food and fast service!

25.description: A little pricey but its worth it! Everyone is so nice, the food is delicious and there is plenty of parking surrounding the area. Highly recommend.

12.description: Unfortunately there is not a choice for no stars.So I've passed by this place a million times for some reason or another while in Bridgeport. Always said to myself that when I have the chance I need to stop in. Typically the older the place looks from the outside the more I know I will enjoy.  Well that was not the case today. I walked in and received some of the worst hospitality ever. When I walked in, the waitress acknowledged me and I said I needed a table for 1. I was seated at a booth way in the back, and had no problem with it. When I dine alone that's perfect.  I received my menu. Took a quick glance and went to the ladies room. When I returned my items book, and headphones had been moved. I saw then at the dining counter and just thought the waitress had moved them for safety.  I returned to the booth with my items. The waitress approached me and stated that the hostess had told her I would not be allowed to use the booth as I was eating alone. I explained to the waitress that as she could see I had my school bag and my book and I would be spreading out to work as well as eat. She turned and was going to talk to the hostess when the hostess approached us. Well that is when things went wrong. She reiterated that I would not be allowed to use the booth as I was eating alone. Again I explained that I had my school bag and would be spreading out to work as well as eat. She stated that it didn't matter, I was not allowed. I stated well the counter is too crowded and I wouldn't be comfortable there. The hostess stated that they needed the booth for larger parties. I looked towards the door and there was no one waiting on a table plus they had other free booths. At that point the waitress gave me a look that said I would not win. So I stated that if I was not allowed to eat at the booth I would not eat there at all and I would take my business else where. The hostess stated "Fine" flipped her hand in the air at me and walked away. I will not be returning there. I did go on to enjoy my day and my meal by heading to a truly wonderful place in Hyde Park known as Salonica's. Salonica's has never disappointed.

59.description: My sister recommended this place and since we share similar taste I decided to try it. I ordered the steak and eggs which were good, but my hubby ordered something that had hashbrowns, eggs, and biscuits, all covered in sausage gravy.IT WAS HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH!!!Perhaps I was hungry but it was the best sausage gravy I had ever tasted. I ended up feeding him my food since I practically devoured all of his. Definitely try the biscuits and gravy, you won't be disappointed! :)

21.description: The food has been great almost all the times Ive been there.Chicken Florentine, and Healthy options are great.The owners are a lil racist (whattya expect when the owners are hispanic and so are 90% of the waitresses/cooks). Rumor has it that the white ladies there aren't even allowed to serve their husbands/boyfriends.On the other hand:Jenny, Kathy and Danielle are the Creme de la creme of the place, with the best customer service.Tip for the owners, treat your employees right and maybe your turnover rate wouldnt be so high.

17.description: What a great Omelette I had. Fast service, clean and well staffed restaurant. We are leaving Chicago today, but I have to go back for breakfast before  we leave.

10.description: racist/boring

5.description: been wanting to try this diner for quite a while now but was always lazy to find parking around that area since i know its not easy there.. but finally manage to come here when my cousin drove and they wanted to try this place out also..friendly service and prices is cheap!i ordered the country fried steak that comes with 2 pancakes, hash browns, and 2 eggs for under 10 bucks! what! now thats a deal!the meal was huge and it definitely hit the spot after.. everything tasted great too.. the service here was decent.. would come back here to try their other food items!

3.description: This place is close to house and I drive past it all the time, so my boyfriend and I decided to stop in. The biscuits and gravy are awesome. The staff is great. The place can get crowded, so arrive early.

35.description: This place is usually amazing, service is great, food is good (and not crazy expensive omg), but THE OWNER'S WIFE. She seems like a nice enough lady, but has NO IDEA what she's doing waiting tables. I watched as she tried to "help" on a busy sunday morning, and the waitresses were following her around, fixing everything she messed up. I had hot tea, she filled the half-full mug with coffee. Without asking. Just came by and filled it. I think the place would be great if you didn't have to play Russian Roulette with whether or not this lady's gonna be there.

19.description: A typical diner, I was surprised at the quality of my food. Some diners in Chicago provide you with a lot less for the same price but Bridgeport Restaurant appeared to go above what is expected of them in both their options and in their quality. They also give you so much food! I left very well-fed.

28.description: As mentioned, this is a neighborhood greasy spoon type of diner. To my surprise, the interior is actually nice, and clean- although quite drafty when the doors open.We had breakfast here and everything was fine. Nothing out of this world, but just decent food. I thought the breakfast was a little pricey at $10 per person, however not too bad.The service was adequate. They were very friendly with my son which is appreciated.I would come back

45.description: Ive lived about a mile from this place for the last 7 years, drive past it every day, and I finally stopped in for dinner recently.  It was good.  We had burgers, grilled cheese sanwiches, and a patty melt.  They were all pretty good.  The service was also good and quick.  The restaurant was clean and had that old family diner type feel to it.  The prices were very reasonable too.  The only thing i didn't like was the drugged out guy, rapping at his reflection on the glass just outside our window.  It was hard not to notice and it got the attention of the kids of course.  So I got to explain illegal drug use and it's effects on the way home from dinner.

33.description: This review is based on having breakfast here about 3 times in the last 1.5 months.  Each time the service and food has been very consistent, which is a plus!Each time I had an omelet with ham, cheese, onion and peppers and then hash browns, which was all really good. The omelet is really hardy and if you get ham, its very flavor and better than most ham that places use in their omelette's.  I ordered the pancakes as well (comes as side option). Each time I requested they come at the end of the meal, so they are hot when I eat them and it has never been a problem and always come out hot.Family who joined me were also pleased with their meals and would go back!Prices are reasonable, around $8/$9 then tax and tip.  You get a nice meal for a reasonable price, not bad in my book!!Service has also been very friendly, with some being a little more friendly that others.Will continue to patronize this business!

43.description: I'm not sure if I'm being a newbie about eating gyros but the gyro meat was spiked with a bit of lemon and I found that discouraging to eat. It reminded me of upchuck. This ended up being doggie bagged. I ordered the window special (2 eggs, potato, and toast). It was alright. Nothing remarkable. I have to say it wasn't crispy enough for my taste. I do enjoy how it isn't doused in oil though. The waitresses are attentive and helpful. The food is just not what it used to be...

2.description: For some odd reason I've never been here and Sunday was the day I decided to try it out since I'm so over the other places around my house. Got seated pretty quicklyFood was a solid goodService was good considering how busy they were... I would like to try lunch and see how that goes.

18.description: Great place to come for easy diner food. We went on a Sunday at 11 am and didn't have to wait for a table. The restaurant is clean and the food got to the table faster than the coffee! I had a skillet and it was delish! The portions were really large too, so it's a great place to go for brunch. I thought that since this was a diner, the food would be pretty cheap, but my meal turned out to be about $15. Not super cheap, but not too bad. I will definitely be coming back.

41.description: horrible customer service they messed up my order when i called they said they would be able to correct but i would have to pay delivery fee again!!! very rude will never eat here again!!!

52.description: They should have kept the old run down ambiance. The food keeps getting worse and worse.

50.description: Very quick. Great service. Decent food. Nice place to order & relax. Nice vibes. Easy parking.

4.description: This place is a comfort greasy neighborhood  diner. I came here with my toddler on a Sunday morning when I found out the wait at a popular breakfast place we wanted to go was 1hr 45mins. The food is okay as long as you don't expect anything fancy. The service is very friendly and pretty quick. The prices are very cheap. I made the mistake of ordering their special crab cake Benedict. It tasted okay, but at the price point of $9.95 for two crab cakes, of course it's not real crab meat. I really should have ordered their waffles as it looked amazing on my neighbor's table. I will be back again when I need a quick brunch.

6.description: It's a great diner. You get what you pay for and the menu is diverse. Exactly what I want from a diner.

22.description: Omelets aren't my favorite, and I was a little disappointed in the chopped steak. It just seemed like a pile of cooked beef, not at all what I'm used to. However, the service is fantastic, and the employees are a great bunch of people. The biscuits and gravy are awesome here. Overall this is a great place for some delicious food!

15.description: I wasn't too impressed with this place. For me, it was just average. I ordered a stack of blueberry pancakes to go. When I opened up the box at work, I thought the stack was small in size ( which is fine with me) but very flat. I are them anyways though because you can only do so much to a batter to make them different from other places. The blueberry sauce was not good. It was too sweet and the texture did not look fresh. It looked thick and old. I haven't back to that place since then. I am willing to give something else another try there though.

57.description: Yes, I'm a fan of the food, but not the prices after specials are over. While the food is good as home cooking, it is not good enough for the increased prices. For example a cup of coffee is $2. That's great for coffee drinkers, but a rip-off for those who drink only one cup  - especially since the cups are small. A bowl of oats will run you $2.95. At that price might as well make your own!So if y ou want breakfast, then get there early for their specials.

20.description: I wasn't too impressed with this place. For me, it was just average. I ordered a stack of blueberry pancakes to go. When I opened up the box at work, I thought the stack was small in size ( which is fine with me) but very flat. I are them anyways though because you can only do so much to a batter to make them different from other places. The blueberry sauce was not good. It was too sweet and the texture did not look fresh. It looked thick and old. I haven't back to that place since then. I am willing to give something else another try there though.

36.description: I've started coming to this restaurant as sort of a consolation prize for the Ramova Grill no longer existing. I've found a new friend to help me through the grief: The Haystack. You can bet that I'll be stopping by again when i'm biking through the neighborhood and need a couple thousand calories of coping. Just you don't leave me too, okay? I don't think I could handle it again.

14.description: This is a great little diner! The breakfast food is great and it comes out quickly! Make sure to get the lb skillet it is the bomb!

1.description: I'm sad my dinner ended up being from this place. Star Kitchen is a new Asian fusion place in the Bridgeport area and I thought I'd give it a try.Right when I walked in I was skeptical already. It was a Sunday night and the take out shop was dead. The one person that was working seemed so surprised I walked in--he really did jump a little when he saw me. This is more of a delivery place so I gave it a pass. Then I asked to see the menu and the guy didn't speak English. That was fine for me, because I speak Cantonese (which was what he spoke) but I'm not sure how they do business. I ordered a Combo A and tried to used the 15% off check-in that they offer on the Yelp. He quickly said that it was not valid and after a few times of asking why not, he called who I assume is his boss who finally gave him the okay. The food was made pretty fast, I guess.Combo A is supposed to come with an egg roll, hot and sour soup, chicken fried riced, and orange chicken. The serve gave me the food and it didn't have any soup. So I asked if I could get some soup, but the server grabbed a soda and stuck it in the bag. I again asked him for a soup instead of a soda, but he really used his hands and shooed me away like a little kid.I get home try to give the food a chance, but the food was 2/5 just like the service. Looking at previous photos, they have really started to skimp on the food. I got a total of 4 piece of orange chicken. They were actually not bad, but seriously? 4 tiny pieces? The egg roll might actually just have been fried flour with some strands of cabbage inside. The rice was tasty but it was all from the grease they put.Chinatown is a mile away and 1000 miles better than this place. I get it, they are the late night option. But no matter how late or hungry I am, I won't be coming here again.

9.description: Delicious kim chi fries!!! dont need to go that far for it. . close by home

23.description: Got home after a night of drinking at almost 4am & badly needed some food but none of my friends had an appetite. On nights like these we would normally go to Chinatown to eat but I didn't want to drag them there to sit and watch me scarf my food so I called star kitchen knowing that they are open late. Best idea ever! I ordered their kim chi fries & it was delivered to my location so fast like the delivery man had mario kart STAR power. Ever since my drunken night, I've developed an addiction to these kim chi fries & def. recommend them.

5.description: This place feels like another gourmet. Even though the place is small the food is good. The kimchi fries are super delicious. I would recommend coming here if you are craving for some late night snack.

25.description: Fast customer service, great quality kimchi fries, and fast delivery. Now a local favorite for late-time orders.

12.description: Good food good fortune good prices the kimchi fries were a little bit too salty but everything else was great I got combo a and combo C with delivery it was around $18.

21.description: Star Kitchen is meant to be a fast food Chinese/ Asian fusion shack. It literally a food take out place and it has Korean Kimchee fries and Pad Thai dishes. The only dish I was interested in was the kimchee fries.Star Kitchen gets a four star rating because their food is good but their customer service is even better. We ordered several combos and they forgot to include the items that belong to the combos the cashier, who I think might own and run the business, corrected the order and also deliver the food to our door and included an extra beef dish.The food is good but I have some suggestions about their food. While I feel everything had flavor it just one type of flavor. We ordered black pepper beef, mongolian beef and we had beef stew dishes. It all tasted good but it all made with the same sauce and the same vegetables, red pepper, onions and celery. I couldn't tell one dish from the other besides the texture of the meat. The kimchee fries had the Chinese dried up shrimps that I will ask to leave it out next time. I feel those little dried up shrimp things shouldn't be in the Kimchee fries it makes it weird and I don't like it. In addition to all the beef and kimchee fries dishes we tried the salted pepper pork and the sesame chicken. It was good! I really liked the flavors it was delicious.I would go back to Star kitchen, we would because the people work there are nice. I liked the young man in charge he is very friendly and customer service is good. It's hard to find a Chinese own and run eatery business that has good customer service. So I'm glad have tried Star Kitchen and  I would recommend this place to all those who are in the area and to check it out.

16.description: Just ordered delivery from here. Not feeling the modernized chinese food thing. At all. I ordered chicken wings and they came with some weird cheese fries. The chicken was too spicy and the sauce tasted weird. Fries were terribly greasy. BUT on the plus side, Orange chicken & my chicken/beef fried rice were delicious. Delivery late night so they get a star for that. Would I reorder? Not unless its a last resort.

17.description: I'm leaving one star because the egg rolls were the only thing that could be eaten. The rest of the food was cold and everything had the same flavor. The food tasted like reheated leftovers. My dog wouldn't even eat the piece of chicken that fell on the floor.

10.description: For delivery: Kimchi fries really seem that they are overrated I mean the food is okay. I can't say anything bad but wouldn't jump through a loop to eat there. They seem nice enough and definitely worth another try. I'll be happy to update this later, I'll pick it up fresh and have a second opinion on the new meal.

11.description: I haven't had any other situation when it would take a place so much time to deliver food and have no explanation why 2 hours after I ordered food I still don't have it. And they charged for delivery too!

26.description: Good food good fortune good prices the kimchi fries were a little bit too salty but everything else was great I got combo a and combo C with delivery it was around $18.

27.description: Definitely recommend the kimchi fries! Love them, people here are very nice also. Will be back

0.description: First time here! Ordered the combo b and it is definitely feeling!The appetizer kimchi fried were also very amazing and delicious! I finally have a go to spot if I ever crave for kimchi fries! Grub hub is also available & delivery!Owners are also very nice :) best part of star kitchen that it is open until late at night; 2AM if you ever want some late night Asian cuisine! Perks: street parking and outside patio to eat :)

20.description: Good filling combo for $6.5..  Tasty and spicy too.. He gave me and my friends a free Pop can.. The soup is extra spicy and super awesome.. The orange chicken here is not that sweet. So I like it

19.description: Great great food they sent me the Keimchi fries on accident and what a great accident !!!! Delivery took a little extra time but well worth the wait

2.description: New spot in the Bridgeport neighborhood prefect for my late snack cravings. Their Kimchi Fries are excellent and also my favorite after the beef sticks.Although I didn't have a chance to try out their new dimsum items yet, I am looking forward to trying that next time. $8 for 2 crag ragoons, soup, beef fried rice AND pepper steak. You can't beat that!

18.description: Good filling combo for $6.5..  Tasty and spicy too.. He gave me and my friends a free Pop can.. The soup is extra spicy and super awesome.. The orange chicken here is not that sweet. So I like it

13.description: Love this place because it is open late and it's right in the neighborhood. They even deliver until 2 a.m.!! The kimchi fries, chicken wings and beef stick are awesome. I definitely recommend and will return.

4.description: My sister and I were looking for a quick bite to eat for dinner one night and we decided to try out Star Kitchen.  The restaurant only consist of a kitchen and a open window for ordering.  In the front, there are 2 seating area for dining in.We decided to share an order of kimchi fries and a combo B which came with 2 crab rangoons, beef fried rice, black pepper steak, and hot and sour soup.  The kimchi fries were good, but it doesn't remind me of Korean kimchi fries.  It had more Chinese flavors to it: soy sauce, plum sauce, and sesame seeds.  The crab rangoons were ok, but was a tad overcooked which made the outside hard.  The beef fried rice and pepper steak had good flavor but was more greasy than I would like it.  Finally, the hot and sour soup was really watery which lacked flavor.  The value of what you get here is amazing.  I also appreciate that they open until the wee hours of the night.  But I wouldn't come here on a regular basis for Chinese food since there are much better options in Chinatown which is only about 5 mins away.

24.description: Love this place because it is open late and it's right in the neighborhood. They even deliver until 2 a.m.!! The kimchi fries, chicken wings and beef stick are awesome. I definitely recommend and will return.

6.description: After being very pleased  with my first time ordering delivery i was slightly disappointed with my second time around.I ordered the chicken pad thai which was unlike any pad thai I've had in the past. It was good flavor but super mushy and way too much onion. No peanuts.  Definitely not like my usual pad thai. Also the crab ththe pooke rangoon was hard as a rock. The chicken fried rice was pretty good . I dont know if ill be ordering from here again .

22.description: THE PEPPERED STEAK WASNT CHEWY!!!! The steak was perfect and the peppers were awesome. Wish there was more sauce but great late night dinner. Thanks guys!

15.description: food is not bad, but the problem is i ordered two chicken wings. And they just send me one. That delivery guy are just leave and didnt let me check.

7.description: Star Kitchen is meant to be a fast food Chinese/ Asian fusion shack. It literally a food take out place and it has Korean Kimchee fries and Pad Thai dishes. The only dish I was interested in was the kimchee fries.Star Kitchen gets a four star rating because their food is good but their customer service is even better. We ordered several combos and they forgot to include the items that belong to the combos the cashier, who I think might own and run the business, corrected the order and also deliver the food to our door and included an extra beef dish.The food is good but I have some suggestions about their food. While I feel everything had flavor it just one type of flavor. We ordered black pepper beef, mongolian beef and we had beef stew dishes. It all tasted good but it all made with the same sauce and the same vegetables, red pepper, onions and celery. I couldn't tell one dish from the other besides the texture of the meat. The kimchee fries had the Chinese dried up shrimps that I will ask to leave it out next time. I feel those little dried up shrimp things shouldn't be in the Kimchee fries it makes it weird and I don't like it. In addition to all the beef and kimchee fries dishes we tried the salted pepper pork and the sesame chicken. It was good! I really liked the flavors it was delicious.I would go back to Star kitchen, we would because the people work there are nice. I liked the young man in charge he is very friendly and customer service is good. It's hard to find a Chinese own and run eatery business that has good customer service. So I'm glad have tried Star Kitchen and  I would recommend this place to all those who are in the area and to check it out.

8.description: My first time here and I had the Combo A. Orange Ck was so juicy and mouth full of flavor. Chicken fried rice was perfectly cook. Order a side of kimchi fries and damn that shit was in point. This is the second time I'm here and I order something call the star chicken. Man they made the chicken juicy as hell and mouth full of flavor. This is the new spot for late night snacks.   New favorite item for me is star chicken and kimchi fries.

3.description: Kimchi Fries are amazing, the way the fries, sauce, and kimchi comes together is to die for.

14.description: Defiantly recommend the Kim chi fries ! The fries are so flavorful. The worker are nice and the order was quick! And they also open late always a plus

1.description: Soluri & Sons just popped up on Halsted, and I was excited to have a local italian deli close by. Stopped in and was greeted by the owner who was very nice. This placed looks like it has been here forever.Ordered an Italian sub to go. For $7, I was willing to give it a shot. Deli meat is sliced fresh right there, and everything is served inside a fresh italian bread (which is your typical hard bread). I enjoyed the sub, but wish it had more meat.While eating my sub, I couldn't help but think of Bari's sandwiches. Not only is Bari's cheaper, but more is provided and taste is comparable between these two establishments.If Soluri's was $5, I'd be here all the time. I'm all for supporting a good, local business, but there has to be some value too.On a side note, Soluri & Son's sells their own giardiniera (mild and hot), which I was tempted to try. Maybe next time!

9.description: Great Italian Beef sandwich. Got it fully dipped! Hot and spicy. Run down your arm delicious! Next time I'm in the area I will per take of their great Italian Beef sandwich again.

23.description: This is a simple Italian Deli that's straight to the point!  8 Sandwich choices painted on the wall/ Deli Case/ Pop Cooler/ Cash Register.  I had an Italian Sub that was definitely one of the best I've ever had.. better than Bari and JP Grazianos!  They also make "Homemade" Sausage and their own Giardinera.. real good stuff.. Give it a shot! gdd

25.description: Ok. So I love deli style sandwiches, and I am pretty picky. This place is amazing! The sandwiches have that freshly sliced near taste, the provolone was mild and rich, they also make their own hot pepper mix! The quality of meat was good as well, I bought a pepperoni stick that was AMAZING!  The service was great and I love that they are Mom and Pop owned! Why aren't you there right now?!

12.description: I love the subs and fresh made sausages to go. The food is really INEXPENSIVE for the quality and quantity.  I take the food to go so I have not had a bad experience with eating in.  Total Bridgeport tude and I like dat!

21.description: I should preface by saying I would definitely eat at Soluri's again under any other normal circumstance but my first visit here was anything but a normal circumstance which leaves me questioning whether or not it's worth it.
