My fiance and I strolled in here a couple weeks ago after recommendations from friends about how fresh the ingredients were and all the bangs you get for your bucks. Soluri & Sons set up shop in a great Bridgeport location which just so happens to be a few blocks from our house. "Win-win," we thought. And then the fiasco began ...The store front itself is really tiny. Ten people waiting in line would most likely cause you to have to stand outside. When we walked I noticed we were the only customers. There was a man (whom I assume is the owner) stocking the drinks in the drink case and a woman standing behind the register. Before we could even get any greetings out the man yells at the woman, "Take these!!!" and shoves some cans at her. "Seemed a bit rude ...," I thought. We finally decide on which sandwiches we'll get. I chose the American and he the Italian. The phone rings, the woman answers it, she hands it off to the man. The man immediately starts berating her about her telephone etiquette. Once he takes the order he starts shouting at the woman again, "You see this??? This is HAM! Hhhhaaaammmmm. Ham is LUNCHMEAT! Do you get it???" This goes on and on the entire time we are waiting for our food. Every insult shouted and condescension spat sent my fiance and I cowering further and further into the corner of the shop. We take our sandwiches home, eat them, and love them. They were big, fresh and made with quality ingredients. However, my dilemma about returning is a moral one. If the woman needed coaching or correcting in her job it should not be done in the presence of other customers and definitely not with the tone and anger that was displayed to us. I was humiliated and it wasn't even me on the brunt end of the harassement. I can only imagine how she felt. Either way, get it together Soluri! Learn how to treat your staff and respect other people. Your food could be the best thing on the planet but your employees need to feel appreciated and you need to be respected personally by your community for your business to flourish.

16.description: "One Star for an amazing Italian bakery deli style sandwich?"  you ask.  How could that be?  Well, the sandwiches are NOT the problem.  The problem is how the business is run.Well, read everything in Shannon S's review.  Its two months later, just as awkward, humiliating, disrespectful, etc. on my first visit here.  And depressing.  Who wants to eat a sandwich like this when it's not made with LOVE?Long story short the exact same thing happened to me a busy Monday lunch hour visit as what Shannon experienced.  Now, I understand how hard it can be to run a small business.  And find good employees.  But the sandwich making lady who was being berated by the owner... when he had said he was short staffed or that an employee hadn't shown up (maybe that was an excuse)... well I don't blame the lady who was working today if she walked out the door.  The guy I assume is the owner was a straight up jack ass in his verbal abuse.I also have some major issues with the fact that if you are the owner, and want something done right, then be part of the solution.  Instead of barking out orders and making disrespectful comments about his staff to justify why it was taking so long, he should have gotten behind that damn counter and started making sandwiches.  He was busy taking orders, but not the whole time.  He showed very little initiative to want to turn it out for his customers, but rather wanted us to believe it was "her fault" for the wait while he paced around and went back to the prep area only to mumble more inaudible jerkface comments to that poor woman.

Do you get it???" This goes on and on the entire time we are waiting for our food. I was humiliated and it wasn't even me on the brunt end of the harassement. I can only imagine how she felt. Either way, get it together Soluri! Learn how to treat your staff and respect other people. Your food could be the best thing on the planet but your employees need to feel appreciated and you need to be respected personally by your community for your business to flourish.

10.description: Haven't had anything bad here yet. Good sub sandwiches. Good Italian beef. Excellent breaded steak. They put forth extra effort to give you a quality sandwich.

5.description: I've been here a few times and always loved the sandwiches. If my ass didn't grow just from holding bread, I'd eat there more often. I live a block away.I popped in one day on the way to grab my kid from daycare. They were closing but said they'd still make something. Then I realized I didn't have cash and that they didn't have toddler sized sandwiches. They said not to worry about it and made my 4 year old an awesome little custom sandwich, perfect for a little kid and totally free. I love supporting locally owned businesses. F'ing Jimmy Johns never would have done anything like that. I really hope their business is doing well and that they stay open for a long time!

11.description: Just opened March 2013. Italian sandwiches, couple salads, deli, pizza, and homemade Italian sausage. Sausage comes Mild, hot, and extra hot to take home. Limited seating is 5 stools at a counter and cash only.  Large sandwiches, delicious and  reminds me of Boston North End.

22.description: Decided to try this place looking for an alternative to Bari's (which has great Italian subs).  The sandwich was good.  9" with fresh ingredients.  The downside, it's $1.20 more than Bari's and the bread, although from the same bakery, isn't as crunchy.

0.description: Best Italian sub in Chicago?This may very well be! I love getting food from Soluri & Sons. The Italian Beef sandwich was spot on and the Italian Sub is perfect. My girlfriend has tried the other subs here and loves em every time. Ive seen some comparisons to Bari subs and i thought the same thing, but, Bari has gone downhill as of recent. Bari no longer uses D'Amatos bread and is apparently in a feud with them! Now, Soluri does use that crispy and soft delicious D'Amatos bread AND they even sell D'Amatos slices of pizza! This sub shop rules. Plain and Simple. Best sandwiches in Chicago! Cash Only

The sandwiches have that freshly sliced near taste, the provolone was mild and rich, they also make their own hot pepper mix! The quality of meat was good as well, I bought a pepperoni stick that was AMAZING!  The service was great and I love that they are Mom and Pop owned! Why aren't you there right now?!

2.description: Probably the worst sub I've ever had. The bread was like crackers. I asked them to add onion to my sandwich. It turned out to be the only thing besides meat and cheese they put on there. Have you honestly ever seen a sub with only meat, cheese and onion? Disgusting. Why don't you make your overpriced under quality sub where everyone can see it? Instead of in the back. Even Subway you can see them make your sandwich. Will never go back here!

18.description: This is a simple Italian Deli that's straight to the point!  8 Sandwich choices painted on the wall/ Deli Case/ Pop Cooler/ Cash Register.  I had an Italian Sub that was definitely one of the best I've ever had.. better than Bari and JP Grazianos!  They also make "Homemade" Sausage and their own Giardinera.. real good stuff.. Give it a shot! gdd

13.description: This was my first time here.  Small neighborhood hideaway.  The owner seemed to know everyone who walked through the door, and that was a considerable number considering it was already 1:30pm.  I had the best eggplant parm I have ever had, bar none.  It was as fresh as it gets, with tangy tomato sauce, delicious sweet peppers and a gardenia that was just out of this world.  I'll definitely be back when I find myself in the Bridgeport neighborhood again.

4.description: Their Italian deli sandwiches are delish!  Very generous on their portions, but most of all... quality meat.

24.description: This place has the best Italian sausage, hot giardiniera and sub sandwiches I have ever had.

6.description: I live in the North side. My husband has brought me sandwiches from Soluri's and I have been very impressed with the Italian Sandwhich.  However, today I had the BEST Italian Beef sandwhich. Angie was very special to have the beef and giardiniera separate from their bread. She didn't want it to arrive cold.  I have tried several Italian Beefs from other great places. However, Soluri's beef was the best I ever had. It beats all the other places.  It was excellent, the beef was very much quality and lean and the seasoning made it delicious. The gravy was amazing. With perfectly steam red peppers. Their bread is the best bread. Then the giardiniera was fresh and very good. I was so happy. I did today what I have never done.  I dipped the small left over piece of bread in the gravy juice.  It was the bomb !!! Now I am so sad because I don't live by 35th.   If you try it you will taste the best as I did. Yummy!!

15.description: I love Soluri's so much! I love the turkey sandwich with hot giardiniera on it, with a side of mild to eat with a fork!! I enjoy the salad and olive salad. Simply the BEST submarine I've ever had. Oh, did I mention if you put the sandwich in oven for 7 minutes on 400 degrees, the bread is DIVINE!!

7.description: We had their Italian Sub and it was very good. It wasn't the best Italian sub we have ever had but it was good. We like it 10X better than Subways. I believe their prices are fair for a quality cured meats between to slices of white Italian bread. They charge $3.00 more for meat which I guess is okay but for $3 I can buy 1/2 lb of salami at Mariano's so not sure if $3.00 would sell me on extra meat for the sub. I'm glad this business is here in Bridgeport we need something like this in Bridgeport. I hope they stick around.

8.description: If you like your sandwich with huge bread and no meat this is your dream spot.I ate here once and had absolutely no meat on my sammich. Will never return. RIpoff

3.description: This IS Chicago's Italian deli.I hear the cries already.  "But...but...BARI?!"  Bari is good.  Bari is cheap.  But Giovanni Soluri and his team of sandwich slingers make the best, sorry!  The hot Italian is my personal favorite, but try all of them if you can!  I'm lucky the neighborhood laundromat is across the street so I can sneak over while my laundry takes a tumble.  They also have a wonderful drink selection and make many of their own products (Italian sausage, giardiniera, etc.).  One of the times I ordered for delivery, Mr. Soluri came to the door himself!  I'm always impressed by this place.  A well deserved 5 stars.Note: Cash Only

14.description: Coming soon breaded steak sandwich and eggplant must try there Italian beef and meatballs excellent. Best beef in Chgo

36.description: Very ImpressedLOVE the new location

29.description: I made an appt for partial highlights with a junior stylist ($55) and a blow dry($25). Did a great job on my hair but charged me 30$ more because they said my roots had grown out too long. What kind of place does that???? So if someone was coming in for the first time for highlights you would charge them more than someone who has gotten them before?  Totally shady. Crappy way to get more money. They should post their prices higher if that's what they charge.  Not going back there..UPDATE**: the salon called me 40 mins after I left and said they accidentally over charged me for the blow dry and styling.  They credited me the 30$ and apologized.  Thanks, I appreciate that.  I definitely will consider coming back.

42.description: Considering a new salon?  Go to BCS Hair Design if you want a Professional Cut, from "well" educated stylists, who will give you a modest trim, or a whole new you!Liz & Gus are hands on owners, with the utmost regard for you the customer, both as artists and owners.   The shop is warm, inviting, and yet very modern.  Love the wild hardwood floors, and the vintage ceiling tiles!I've been to high end & low end salons in my life.  I guarantee you will not be disappointed at BCS.  Highly Recommend.  Love my cut!Thanks Liz/Gus!BB

23.description: The salon is great.  Jessica is great with color.  She is the best.  She just has a great talent with hair.

31.description: I really wanted to love this place.  I went in yesterday for an eyebrow wax to check it out before fully committing to a haircut.  This place is very close me to and would be sooo convenient.  The salon is very cute and seemed busy at 10:30 on a Saturday morning.  Everybody I encountered was very friendly.  Evie did my eyebrow wax, she was so nice!  She took my apointment over the phone and knew it was my first time in the salon.  They do eyebrows in the shampoo room, which is fine with me.  I really needed a wax and I have to say that they are now under control and have a great shape.  Right after she pulled the wax off I noticed that it hurt a lot more than usually under my left eyebrow and it continued to hurt all day.  When I woke up this morning I had a scab under my left eyebrow exactly in the pattern that hurt yesterday.  I can't imagine that she burned me because the wax did not seem hot enough to burn.  I'm not really sure but I know that I have gotten my eyebrows waxed every 3-4 weeks for the last 12 years and have NEVER had this problem.I am hoping this was a fluke so I am willing to try them again.  I will definitely be going to a new person though.  I am hoping that it was a one time thing and not a sign of poorly trained staff, which does not seem to be the case from the other reviews!  I'll be back to update after my next visit.

34.description: I started looking for a place with a northside atmosphere but close to home, BCS is that!   I have been burned by north side salons refused to spend hundreds of dollars on a hair style that I hate.  Liz knew how to work with my hair and explained everything she was going to do.    Check this place out if you want a quality haircut that is trendy!

16.description: Well - took my son out of school a little early to make my 3:45 appointment with Gil.  By 4:05 he saw me waiting and just looked away.  By 4:15 I was out the door, a half an hour later and a quick "sorry" from the front desk personnel (including the owner, Liz, who had previously been so accommodating).  Gil is in very high demand apparently to be so overbooked.  If he doesn't want to do a children's haircut (even tipping at 20% after my last visit), he should let the front desk know and stop booking them.

11.description: Great first experience! Gil did a great job at retouching the ombre I had done elsewhere 6 months ago! He brought life back into my color and throughly explained what steps would be best to take to get the best result. I actually like it better than the first time around. His haircut technique is unique and added a lot of bounce to my very flat hair. Customer service was amazing! The young man at the front desk even offered to run out and feed the meter for me. I enjoyed my cup of coffee and the incredible head massage I received in the very tranquil shampoo room. I will DEFINITELY be back. Thank you BCS!

39.description: I love BCS but still getting use to pampering myself with a hair cut and hair coloring for $130 bucks :(  Its just not in my budget.  The people there are great, super friendly and the music is jamming!  Love the place but still kinda $$$.

37.description: Update 4/27: Monica is no longer there and when I called they lied about the fact that she moved salons.  Thankfully I had contact information and was able to locate the new place.  BCS will no longer get my service.I LOVE Monica! She is amazing and the only person I'll let cut my hair, it's a very nice salon in a very shady location and very far from where I live and work but it's worth the drive.

0.description: Jessica is amazing! I've been coming here for about a year now and I have always been very happy with the results (and I have long hair and a lot of it!). She is always very funny and sweet and the staff has always been friendly. Full scalp massage when they wash your hair.  Jessica is also very helpful with products and recommendations whenever I've had questions about what to use for my hair thought the year. Great place in Bridgeport to get a quality hair cut at a fair price.

38.description: I've been a loyal client since they were located on Leavitt and 23rd Pl. I cannot imagine getting my hair done anywhere else but BCS. Liz is great, always with new ideas for color and cuts. She knows her clients very well and will never do something that does not go with their style or personality.

27.description: After a pretty unfortunate coloring job at another salon, I've been skittish about the idea of trying color again, but I'm so glad I did!My colorist, Erandi, was super sweet and got my color exactly right. I brought in a picture that was the closest thing I could find to what I wanted, and she made it work perfectly with my natural hair color. One of the best parts was their shampoo area, which is in a separate room and is very zen. When the assistant, Jessica, washed out my hair she spent at least 5 minutes on a scalp massage, plus the room itself is filled with candles and there's nature sounds playing and footrests at every sink. So relaxing!I was especially impressed that after the rinse the stylist-in-training did a blow-dry and style for free. I don't know if this is standard practice, or I just got lucky that one of the stylists-in-training was free, but it was a really great perk and my hair looks extra awesome now! She even took the time to explain the techniques she was using so I can style my hair in a few new ways.Two words of caution: don't go on a day the White Sox are playing (you can't park on the street outside on game days without a permit) and be careful when coming and going from the salon: the neighborhood it's in is a little dicey.

32.description: Gil has been cutting my  hair for close to ten years now, and although I've tried other stylist/salons, I always come back . I love it. I can come in, give a general idea of what I want, and trust Gil to make me look beyond what I could ever have expected. The atmosphere is comfortable and always professional. It can be a little pricey, but for the service provided, completely reasonable.As someone who has gone everywhere from Goldcoast Salons to Haircuttery's, BCS is my most highly recommended establishment.

13.description: Paulina rocks!!!I've been here before but will now be coming back exclusively. I went in with something in mind and Paulina did a great job in guiding my way through it. I really like it when a stylist helps you because what do I know???I went with bangs and I totally love them! The staff here is super nice and offered me a beverage while I waited. This is a Paul Mitchell salon so all the products they use are, duh, Paul Mitchell products.

24.description: If anyone does it better...I don't know who it is or could be :) Best I have ever used not to mention the professional, friendly and very knowledgeable staff.  Kudos to BCS!

7.description: My friend recommended me this place.. my hair is curly but frizzzy... basically hard to manage. I've been afraid to get a haircut... but Gil was amazing. He explained everything he was doing, how to work with my hair, etc. Totally recommend it!

40.description: I wish this visit would have worked out.  I went in to have a cut and color, the very nice stylist tried to accomodate me however my hair did turn out a bit green after she attempted to color my hair platinum blonde.  She told me to come back in about 6 weeks for the final lift to blonde.  I can't wait, I am a professional thus, I had to color my hair red myself.  I was really disappointed because I wanted this to work out because it is so close to my home.  The lighting in the salon is dark and I was there on a evening so I really couldn't tell what color I actually had until the next day in daylight.  Unfortunately they don't have Sunday or Monday hours...I was offered an appt. about 5 days later to fix it, and I just couldn't wait.

30.description: Marco is excellent. I wanted super bleach blonde hair and he did an amazing job (because yes it is hard to get right!)! Additionally, he is great at short, edgier haircuts. He does a lot of work outside of the salon for different shows, bands, teaches, etc. and between that and the way he talks about his work it is clear how passionate and ambitious he is about his career! For the services the price is right! For a cut and color it is about the same price as one cut at the yuppy "upscale" salons on the near north side that don't give you half as good as service as BCS will!Additionally, all of the employees are welcoming and accommodating from the time you check in for your appointment until the time you leave. They are always sure to ask if you need anything like coffee of water (which is out for the customers to freely get anyways) which elevates the entire experience to the next level.Highly recommended!

1.description: I am weirdest Chinese girl because I love being a red head at least twice a year and this time around the Ombre' style has come onto the scene and I love that new trend. Gives  me a good reason to keep my roots black and my ends red. I like going to BCS salon because I love what Erandi's work. There is nobody else that can do what she does to hair and to my hair. It's been about a month since Erandi  ( my hair dresser) did my Ombre' red hair. And it's still a deep red and I love it. It she did a technique where the red will fade into an orange ensuring it will still look good as it fades a little bit until I see her again. I'm a very picky person to please when it comes to hair. She has been my hair dresses for about 3 years now I wouldn't go to anybody else. I will be seeing her again in January for  a touch up and I will try to remember to take picture of my hair to post next time.

9.description: Jessica Jennings is such a sweet girl! She is the ONLY person I will trust with my hair. She cuts its just the way I want it each time. And she also gives amazing shampoos that will put you to sleep! Everyone at BCS is very talented in their own way, but Jessica has an eye for detail and perfection.

26.description: I recently got my first haircut at BCS and I have to admit that the haircutting services are top-notch. The stylists know what they are doing and will talk through the process with you. It's reassuring as a hair customer, to say the least. However, the good haircut doesn't make up for its faults. I just thought it was way too pricy. I was used to getting $15 haircuts (and good ones!) on the North Side. As much as the stylists at BCS love styling hair, a haircut shouldn't cost you more than $60. There are so many more important things you can be spending your money on. I personally will not be returning. Another aspect of my experience that I found extremely bothersome was the pressure to buy more products along with your haircut. Shampoos. Hair Products. Etc. They just keep mentioning different things you can buy! They won't let you leave peacefully. I ended up buying a few products and ended up being very unhappy with one of the products. Yes, they said it would be a great hair product, but it ended being terrible for my new haircut. I just ended up going to Walgreens to get a decent hairspray for my hair. Go to BCS if you want a good but PRICY haircut.

25.description: I've been a client for over 10 years now and have seen BCS grow from a neighborhood type salon to what it is now, a very cutting edge salon. They are heavy on customer service and the stylists are all very professional. Shampoo head and neck massage is worth it alone. I probably pay a little too much for a men's cut, but the experience is worth it.

12.description: Change is hard, especially for me I tend to be a creature of habit. Years ago I used to go to Iffergan on Oak, after a few years of it not being convenient for me to get to I did find a new place close to home within walking distance, score! So I had been going to the same place for quite a few years now, and was very happy with them, but now I was faced with the same problem I moved and it's just difficult to get there, between my being on the other side of town and her being so popular I just can't seem to get there. So I need to make a change.As I said, change is hard and the first place I tried wasn't a good choice. I didn't review it since it would have been a one, maybe two star review and I don't think it would have been fair after one try, however I did sense that it wasn't going to work out.So here is the break down..The staff - Very friendly, being that I was in the area I decided to walk in to schedule my appointment, as I started to walk past the window (door is on the side) the receptionist and I made eye contact and she gave me a smile, at this point there was no way for her to know I was even headed in. Today when I came in there were different people at the front desk, but they were just as friendly.The salon - Clean and inviting, they did offer me a beverage, the place is well laid out.Liz - One of the owner's and my stylist today. Friendly and informative, she took the time to listen to what went wrong with my last cut, without being being judgmental, we even both agreed that it can take more than one time to get the feel of someones style.  Perhaps this is true, however I do think it's a listening skill, because she nailed it in one try, I had this same experience with where I used to go too. She did an excellent cut, I love it, better yet my husband loves it, since he has to look at it that's an important consideration to me. The color, she did a color blocking technique, also an excellent job. She made it look easy, that's the true hallmark of someone that has skills, people who are pros always make it look easy. Parking and the White Sox - I didn't find this to be a problem and my appointment was just about the same time the game started. Here's a hint, don't take 35th. all the way there, take Morgan and while you're on Morgan park south of 35th. and walk. There are no parking restrictions on Morgan, and south of 35th. no meters. Okay, so you have to walk two or three blocks, are you telling me that when you go to your Lincoln Park or Gold Coast salon you don't have to walk? If so you're living life right and have some good Karma going on.Area - Someone said "dicey or sketch" you're kidding right? You know you're in Chicago? Maybe you don't.  If you're worried about it CC is for you.Price/products- I didn't think the prices were out of line for the expertise. I'm a firm believer of you usually get what you pay for. I didn't feel pressured to buy anything, Liz showed me a couple of products at the end, and I explained that I have plenty now at home and I've been using Aveda products which she agreed that Aveda makes good stuff, there was no pressure.I'm very happy I gave them a try, and I'll be returning. Next time I'll walk or just bike down, today I needed my car for other errands after. So if you live on the south side, and want to support a local business give them a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

21.description: Paulina rocks!!!I've been here before but will now be coming back exclusively. I went in with something in mind and Paulina did a great job in guiding my way through it. I really like it when a stylist helps you because what do I know???I went with bangs and I totally love them! The staff here is super nice and offered me a beverage while I waited. This is a Paul Mitchell salon so all the products they use are, duh, Paul Mitchell products.

17.description: I love this place!   Liz always works her magic on my hair :)  I always come out of there happy with my results.  All the staff there are friendly this will always be my go to place

10.description: So happy with this salon right down the street! Professional stylists and staff, very knowledgable and so happy with my cut and color. Price is great too!

5.description: YOU! GET! WHAT! YOU! PAY! FOR! Period!!! I would recommend BCS to anyone who puts their money where their mouth is! If you want a "bargain" price for mediocre service / treatment then to each its own, however if you want above & beyond PHENOMENAL customer service then look no further.

35.description: Paulina is my stylist and I will never change stylists again unless she dyes my hair green without permission. I love how she changes your style with your future in mind, for example in my case, she decided on less layers because I will need my hair for up-dos due to a few weddings taking place in the next few months. She also knew exactly how to "fix" my hair when I came in upset from what my previous stylist did. I know it's a lot more difficult to fix an unsatisfied cut than to create something new. I haven't tried her dye jobs yet and can't wait to go for something drastic in the fall. Their new location has easy parking, is modern, hip and I love that the area for hair washes is soundproof that also has a very Zen like feel to it.

19.description: I have been with BCS since their days on Leavitt Street and will continue to do so until the end of time.  I have to admit through the years I have experimented with other salons, but have never been as satisfied as I am here.  I always come back and that has to say A LOT about this awesome place! They have great stylists on staff here but my number #1 is PAULINA! She is so awesome, my hair and I are in love with her.  From the moment she greets you at the front desk for your appointment she is so nice and genuine.  She is so dedicated to her work and focuses primarily on making sure you are happy with what you're getting done-whether it be a cut, dye, or both. I have come in here several times not really knowing what I want to do with my hair and she is extremely patient in explaining to me all the ways my hair can be styled.  Even if that includes her bringing out her laptop or phone, Paulina will do everything she can to best illustrate what she is going to do to my hair.  I ABSOLUTELY love that about her.  What I love most about her are her great people skills.  While sitting in her chair she will make genuine conversation with you not all that "uh-huh" "yeah, okay" fluff like other people.  I have even brought my mom to Paulina and she has fallen in love as well! And my mom is hard to please, but she's never looked better (and younger) than after seeing Paulina.The overall salon is a great place too.  Very chic and modern looking and everyone here is so friendly! They will make you feel right at home.  I really don't know why I have gone anywhere else. =)

28.description: This is my spot and always will be.  I have had so many stylists in my past and I have never been as satisfied as I am with the stylists here.  I have actually worked with three stylists, Craig, Cray and Gil-- they were all fabulous! Craig gives me an awesome and trendy style for my long hair, Cray is awesome with the curls and and makes me feel gorgeous when I leave, and most recently I worked with Gil. He was super friendly, genius with the scissors and it is evident that he is passionate about his craft. My dilemma - I have three stylists!

3.description: I like coming here because they use Paul Mitchell products. I have a very sensitive scalp & if cheap products are used on me I have a horrible allergic reaction. One of my favorite things is when they wash your hair and they give you a awesome massage. The washing of the hair takes place in a separate room where it is very soothing. There are low lights, candles burning, and the smell is very relaxing. The massage is one of my favorite things here. The stylist Liz is the owner. She is great. She knows how to use her scissors and how to cut a fantastic pixie.Color always comes out very nice, rich and glossy.They always use Paul Mitchell tools which are fantastic. I recommend coming here if you appreciate a good color, a good cut and a great massage while washing your hair.

33.description: Great place. Marco was a wonderful stylist. He really loves what he does and it shows. I plan to be a regular client!

43.description: I give BCS a five star rating, I been going to Liz for 12 years, I follow Liz from her previous location.  The location where she is at now is her own place, which is very trendy , ambiance is great.   I always leave this place satisfied with my haircuts and color!!!

2.description: I went to this place couple months ago to get done a hair color, and all I can say is that it was a bad experience and was not satisfied with the results AT ALL.

18.description: Liz the owner did a great job coloring and cutting my hair. She took her time and did not rush. She even analyzed my skin tone to help me decide on a new color. Loved the color and highlights she pickedThe place is a gem in the neighborhood. Very easy to find parking. There was a spot right in front.

41.description: Mr. Gil is fabulous!! I am usually hesitant when going to a new stylist but Gil came to greet me and was super friendly and I felt really at home in the salon. All of the staff were really great, gave me a tour and had some water while I waited (I was early). The salon itself is really nice; clean, pretty, welcoming. I want to go back for color now! I have really curly hair and left with a new amazing 'do!

4.description: BCS has to be one of the top Salon places to go to in the Chicago land area. I've been going with Jessica for awhile now,  and she always leaves me walking happy with a fresh haircut. As it's hard to find a stylist for a girl,  it can be difficult to for a guy myself. I trust her. The crew at BCS is always friendly, helpful,  and I would recommend anyone to try this location out.

6.description: Erandi is a very talented colorist as well as stylist.  I can be a pretty (perhaps very) difficult client at times just because I am so particular and Erandi, over the past years, has always been so patient and understanding.  She is also honest and will let you know if something will work or not,  we are so lucky to have her in Bridgeport!  Bring cash, you still cannot put tips on your credit card though.

22.description: I decided one Saturday morning that my hair was in serious need of a cut. I had been trimming my own hair (well the layers anyway) for a few years. I definitely don't recommend doing that yourself but in my defense, I do have my cosmetology license but I am not a practicing hair guru at the moment. Anyway, a friend of mine had mentioned this salon and I decided to call on a Saturday morning to ask if they had any openings. I assumed they didn't, especially because I called on the Saturday before Christmas!  To my surprise, they had an afternoon opening and the person on the phone, a nice gentleman whose name I didn't catch, was very friendly and accommodating. I was excited for my 1:00 appointment and decided to show up a few minutes early to check out the salon.The salon itself is really cute and has a modern and comfy feel to it. I was offered a beverage while I waited on my stylist and figured I should accept their glass of wine, I didn't want to be rude after all =) As I waited in the reception area I was told that my stylist, Erandi, would be out in a few minutes and I didn't mind at all. A few moments later she came and introduced herself to me and we talked a little about my hair. She said she would come back for me in a few minutes because she was still working on her previous client. Once it was time for my appointment I explained to her what I've been doing myself at home and I mentioned that I didn't want to cut too much from the length. Erandi convinced me that I needed more than just a trim and said that my curly hair (well curly on a good day; usually it's more like a ball of frizz) would curl better if it was cut a little shorter than what I initially wanted. Erandi was very friendly and I felt comfortable talking to her. Towards the end of my appointment I was feeling relaxed and was just observing the other stylists and their hair cutting skills. Everyone at the salon seemed very talented and had their own creative style going on. I was very happy with my hair cut and was happy Erandi convinced me to cut more from the length. I will definitely visit Erandi again. Overall this place is pretty cool. They have a good selection of Paul Mitchell products, the salon itself is cute and trendy, and the staff is fun and professional. The only reason I gave this place four stars instead of five is because I did end up waiting a little longer than a few minutes. I am not an impatient person and trust me, having worked in a busy salon on a Saturday I know that it can get pretty hectic. I think a client should be made aware if their stylist is running 20-30 minutes behind because it can help a client feel more at ease and not assume someone forgot about him/her. Again, this is not how I felt and I didn't mind waiting but someone else may not be as understanding. =)

I definitely don't recommend doing that yourself but in my defense, I do have my cosmetology license but I am not a practicing hair guru at the moment. I think a client should be made aware if their stylist is running 20-30 minutes behind because it can help a client feel more at ease and not assume someone forgot about him/her. Again, this is not how I felt and I didn't mind waiting but someone else may not be as understanding. =)

20.description: Change is hard, especially for me I tend to be a creature of habit. Years ago I used to go to Iffergan on Oak, after a few years of it not being convenient for me to get to I did find a new place close to home within walking distance, score! So I had been going to the same place for quite a few years now, and was very happy with them, but now I was faced with the same problem I moved and it's just difficult to get there, between my being on the other side of town and her being so popular I just can't seem to get there. So I need to make a change.As I said, change is hard and the first place I tried wasn't a good choice. I didn't review it since it would have been a one, maybe two star review and I don't think it would have been fair after one try, however I did sense that it wasn't going to work out.So here is the break down..The staff - Very friendly, being that I was in the area I decided to walk in to schedule my appointment, as I started to walk past the window (door is on the side) the receptionist and I made eye contact and she gave me a smile, at this point there was no way for her to know I was even headed in. Today when I came in there were different people at the front desk, but they were just as friendly.The salon - Clean and inviting, they did offer me a beverage, the place is well laid out.Liz - One of the owner's and my stylist today. Friendly and informative, she took the time to listen to what went wrong with my last cut, without being being judgmental, we even both agreed that it can take more than one time to get the feel of someones style.  Perhaps this is true, however I do think it's a listening skill, because she nailed it in one try, I had this same experience with where I used to go too. She did an excellent cut, I love it, better yet my husband loves it, since he has to look at it that's an important consideration to me. The color, she did a color blocking technique, also an excellent job. She made it look easy, that's the true hallmark of someone that has skills, people who are pros always make it look easy. Parking and the White Sox - I didn't find this to be a problem and my appointment was just about the same time the game started. Here's a hint, don't take 35th. all the way there, take Morgan and while you're on Morgan park south of 35th. and walk. There are no parking restrictions on Morgan, and south of 35th. no meters. Okay, so you have to walk two or three blocks, are you telling me that when you go to your Lincoln Park or Gold Coast salon you don't have to walk? If so you're living life right and have some good Karma going on.Area - Someone said "dicey or sketch" you're kidding right? You know you're in Chicago? Maybe you don't.  If you're worried about it CC is for you.Price/products- I didn't think the prices were out of line for the expertise. I'm a firm believer of you usually get what you pay for. I didn't feel pressured to buy anything, Liz showed me a couple of products at the end, and I explained that I have plenty now at home and I've been using Aveda products which she agreed that Aveda makes good stuff, there was no pressure.I'm very happy I gave them a try, and I'll be returning. Next time I'll walk or just bike down, today I needed my car for other errands after. So if you live on the south side, and want to support a local business give them a try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

8.description: I love this hair salon. They make you feel like a special customer with excellent treatment.I am a young male, and my cut usually runs around $20, which I feel is a good price for an excellent hair cut. My stylist Jessica is always great conversation while I am getting my hair cut, and she even lives in the area-- so knows all about Bridgeport! Not to mention, she is attractive and has a very pleasant personality.Couldn't be happier. :)

14.description: Jessica Jennings is the absolute best!!! I ONLY trust her with my color & cuts . She listens & 100% cares about the Health of my hair . I have been a client of BCS for 4 years. The whole staff is amazing & talented, Erandi, Paulina, Gil , Liz , Joel, etc.  As a fellow professional in the beauty industry it is refreshing to patron a community salon that truly cares. Love!

58.description: Finally found it! I got here late in the afternoon today but I was able to snag a few goodies. Cupcakes w/ whipped cream and a couple of danishes. Pretty tasty.The staff was pretty nice too. Prices were very reasonable. You can try lots of items and not break the bank.  I can't wait to return because I definitely want to try those bacon buns

56.description: Bridgeport Bakery is definitely my favorite bakery.  Besides having the best doughnuts on the planet, they have one of my favorite things - the salt stick.  Since Weber's is now only making the rye version, this is one of the few places I know of  to get  the white version and it is perfect.  The slightly chewy texture along with the kosher salt and caraway seeds - with a little butter you think you are in heaven.Their doughnuts are absolutely delicious - especially their bismarks - both the jelly and custard.  They are soft, flavorful and have absolutely no greasy taste.Their coffee cakes are also excellent.  The only thing I don't particularly care for is their bacon buns which they are well-known for.  They are ok, but I think they are an acquired taste.

29.description: Holy cow. CHEAP!Got 4 donuts and a cup of coffee for $5. It was a $5 minimum place after all.But I gotta say, the bacon bun wasn't allllll THAT great. It was fine, well it was good. Had they put more bacon in it, it would've been PERFECT. Didn't taste as fresh either despite being 9:30am. But I'll give it a pass. Maybe I'll try it again once I'm back in the area.It's a small grab and go place. A bit shabby/shaggy/sketchy looking place but it's fine! The snob whitewashed side of me was worried. But the Korean side told me that I just drove from Midway Airport and if I can drive through Cicero in one piece, this is no place to worry.

42.description: Great tasting bread, very fresh, definitely will go again and my son received two free cookies!

23.description: This is a superb establishment.  A very traditional bakery with great goods and fantastic service.

47.description: Oh Bridgeport Bakery, how do I love thee, let me count the ways.....I love thee for being open seven days a week! (Although thee close early on Mondays)I love thee for having the best carrot muffins I have had in my 26yrs on planet earth.I love thee for taking credit cards.I love thee for your low low prices. I have often walked out of Bridgeport Bakery with enough pastries to feed a small army for under $10.I love thee for your friendly/helpful staff, who are so sweet and have no problem explaining the wide variety of baked goods available each day.I love thee for the general awesomeness that is refined sugar/flour.I DETEST thee for the inches thee has added to my waist line.Love,Natalie

8.description: It's like DONUT Heaven. You must come early to receive certain specialty donuts. But even the non-specialty treats are delish!! This bakery has been on my to do list for some time now, so I was happy to finally make it in. It's a small family owned bakery shop that provides a lot of Bridgeport diners and businesses with sweet pastry treats. I got 5 donuts and one banana muffin for $5! Score double time seeing that most of the donuts are oversized. And lawdy knows I love oversized food lol. I'm such a foodie. LolThey have everything from specialty cakes, home baked pies, and even my ever so fave cannolis!!! Yum yum yum. It's definitely my new favorite treats spot.Double Thumbs up!!

31.description: This has been "my" bakery for fifteen years now.  They got me with their bacon buns.  I've had them from a few spots around the city, and no one makes them like Bridgeport.  But Paczki Day is another aspect of what we enjoy.   The paczki are the best here in all of the city, and I've had them from everywhere.   No one makes them as good as here.   The dough is the key.   It's yeasty, and light, not dense and oil soaked.  And the fillings are just right.  Not scant, not overfilled.   Our favorites are the strawberry powder suger, and the cheese.  Gotta have the cheese!

34.description: This is a good "Old School" Bakery/ You walk thru the front door and there's that "Smell" of goodness!  Pretty much no frills here, just great Donuts & Danishes, Etc.  Definitely using good ingredients here and not that crappy oil a lot of bakeries have gone to due to cost.  Very Cheap Prices/ Service with a frown! GTFJD

16.description: My friend gave me a bun one today and simply told me "microwave it" for 15 seconds. I took it out after 15 seconds and it was nice and warm. Little did I know....biting into it would change my whole view of buns. It was stuffed with bacon. If you know me, you know my love for bacon. It's like breakfast in a bun! Only thing missing was a side of scrambled eggs! I'm going to make it a tradition of going every two weeks after payday lol. If you haven't tried them. I highly recommend them! Also bought a glazed donut. Definitely give Krispy Kreme and DD a run for their money. Give this location your business. It's a Bridgeport staple!

13.description: My favorite are their cream puffs/horns! Their raspberry sandwich cookies are out of this world too!!

11.description: My torrid love affair with doughnuts and beer has forced me to have a bitter, married life with running.This place makes me have to run more, and for that, I love this place dearly, and hate it with a burning passion. Scorn ye, wonderful, cheap, hot and fresh doughnuts.

39.description: Truly amazing bakery. I mean this when I say so. They make fresh, chewy, and delicious home-made white glazed donuts. The large cookies are super large and soft. Although, these may be too sweet to none sweet-lovers, but it will cure a sweet tooth to those who love sugar! In terms of service, they are very warm welcoming! I enjoy coming to this place every time, although it is a little dark and small inside. In regards of price, this is the cheapest place you can find. Butter cookies are only $1.75 for a quarter pound(this is roughly 8-10 cookies)!I recommended this place to many friends and families with positive feedback. I would definitely come back here again.

37.description: Love is....Bridgeport Bakery.  I have driven by this place everyday for the past 15 years (even rolling down my windows to smell the fresh baking at 5 am in winter, I don't even like bread or sweets), but never went in.  This morning I finally did it!  It was was about 8:15 (election day) and they were nearly wiped clean. I bought some bacon buns ("I want to go to there" in the words of the beloved Liz Lemon). AWSOME!!!  Bought some sweets for my grandmother and a giant braided raisin bread for french toast.  My grandmother is in love as well. She's 83 years old and began to reminisce about when she first came to the US and.....  You know it's good when it has the power to take you back to a place when everything was right in the world and your bread wasn't made by machines. The prices are great. I'd drive across the city for this bakery, but I am fortunate enough to be 10 minutes away!  Lucky me.  Oh!!!.....and the people....as warm and loving as the baked goods they're surrounded by.    :)

0.description: Ordered a couple dozen paczki for Fat Tuesday. They were amazing. Each different flavor of filling was on point and the pastries were perfect.When I went in to place my order everyone behind the counter was friendly and super helpful with answering my questions. I also picked up a couple cinnamon rolls and bacon buns. These were also fantastic. The cinnamon rolls were simultaneously moist and flaky in exactly the right way. The bacon buns - when taken home and microwaved for 15 seconds - were soooooooo good! Would obviously recommend this lovely bakery - it's worth the trip!

38.description: Great bakery, forget Dunkin Donuts.

51.description: That early morning drive to Midway Airport calls for a secret weapon: donuts.This place is nearly underneath I-55, making it an easy stop en route to the airport.  At 6:00am, the small, red, neon "Bridgeport Bakery" sign is just about the only hint of life in the area, and inside they've got bacon buns.  That should seal the deal right there.  Along with the bacon buns, we picked up a couple cups of coffee, a frosted apple cinnamon roll, and a cream filled chocolate donut.  Total cost, about $5 and she threw in a motherly "thanks sweetie" for free.Everything was delicious, they're friendly people, and the shop is a textbook mom 'n pop operation.  I'll be back for Pazcki Day.

27.description: A-mazing! If you know what you want and what day you will be in, I suggest ordering it ahead of time. Since, I'll just run there on a random Saturday or Sunday, I just pick what looks goodI'm not a huge bacon bun fan (maybe there is something wrong with me), but the donuts are heavenly.Bypass that Dunkin Donuts and head to B-Port Bakery (it's worth the drive).

32.description: Bridgeport Bakery is by far the best place for pastries and other sweets ever.  Small, locally owned, cute old ladies handing you donuts and making suggestions.  They are so wonderful here I want to go back every day!

54.description: Two words: Pazcki Day!Amazing :)  I use dto work in McKinley Park and my co-worker and I would drop by often for coffee cakes and other yummies. Even in the afternoon, everything was fresh and fantastic. Oh..and the paczki! Did I mention that? Looking forward to Fat Tuesday!

48.description: I stopped by in the early afternoon to check out the goods.  The shelves, as aforementioned, were semi-bare.  However, behold the brownie.  It was frosted, which for me, is never a good sign.  Frosting is for cakes, not good moist chewy brownies in my world.  The price was right, however. 92 cents with tax.  Now for 92 cents, that's a bargain.  This is an old-school bakery, which is not what a type of bakery I would choose to patronize on a regular basis.  They had a variety of donuts and apple bars.  I would go back and try something else.  They had these bacon rolls that sounded kinda good, but since I am starting to tip the scale at my warning weight, I decided to only buy one thing.

44.description: Two Words: BACON BUNSI heard about this place from a friend who had pre-ordered and brought about 30 of them to a party. They didn't have a chance. 15 seconds in the microwave and it's like having them fresh. I also picked up a vanilla long john that was the freshest doughnut I've ever had. Staff is super nice and very welcoming. Can't wait to become a regular here!

24.description: My guy brought a dozen donuts home from here this morning. We had always heard good reviews and decided to give it a try. This place is amazing. The donuts are so soft and fresh. The glazed donut honestly tastes better than Krispy Kreme. The apple cinnamon roll and the cinnamon roll were so insanely most. We will absolutely be making this our new donut shop! I highly highly recommend this shop!

7.description: Great baked goods at rock bottom prices. Came to pick up an assortment of donuts for breakfast and was not disappointed. No place to linger indoors - more a place to pick up and go!

49.description: We came here for paczki and they were AWESOME! perfectly soft and glazed with lots of filling. I wish they make it all year long!

40.description: The homemade donuts are very fresh, but the strawberry shortcake must go! It was disgustingly sweet and the stawberry filling was jam. i guess that why's it was about $5.

53.description: We love this bakery.  Their food is genuine old world style and they have a great custard pie.

30.description: This place is FANTASTIC!!! But be prepared to get up super early to get any variety of donuts. The bf gets up at 5 just to get some of our favorite donuts. Yes, its that good, and the prices are great too! We like the fruit and cheese danishes, he likes the jelly filled and I like their cake glazed. Not a huge fan of the yeast glaze. Sometimes service can be slow or rude but the taste makes up for it (usually)!

46.description: a little birdie told me about this hidden gem.  While others are waiting in line for $3 donuts, you can easily find the same, fresh, decadant treat right here for less than a 1/3 of the price.  The donuts are made daily and in house. My personal favorite is the chocolate glazed.  A large, fluffy donut with fresh chocolate glaze or the powdered custard is a must for first time customers.  Service is fast and friendly!!

1.description: Maple bacon donut. I go through Costco sized packs of bacon in a month by myself. Which is basically a pack of bacon each week. I would say I have a problem but bacons pretty much my main source of protein so I'm OK with that. I came here on Friday afternoon and they were about to close in an hour or so. They still had a pretty good selection of donuts / baked goods left including the bacon donut I should have gotten two, or three, or all of them instead of just one.  We also got the chocolate french crueller, chocolate covered custard, chocolate covered cinnamon roll and 4 danishes. Since I couldn't help myself I ate the donuts in the car, my favorite was the maple bacon. They have a very generous amount of bacon on top and the topping is syrupy sweet. The french crueller was SOO MOOIST omg. Last time I had a sad french crueller from DD. We also got half a pound of Christmas cookies, which were light, buttery, and fantastic.  They had so many different ones to choose from that I had a reallly difficult time choosing. Don't be sketched out by the store front! The baked goods inside are super fresh , affordable and the people working here are accomodating and very friendly as well.

55.description: Great donuts and bacon buns.  Came here really early one morning for some donuts for a coworkers b-day.  They were fresh and really good.  They also had some fresh bacon buns!!!!  My hubby is Lithuanian and I love bacon buns.  They were a good size and very good...not as good as my mother-in-laws, but a close second.

9.description: Great bakery goods!

26.description: Sold! What an amazing find after 7 years living in the south-loop.  These guys have the standard donut selection, but the ones I tried were pretty good such as - almond sprinkled chocolate donut, chocolate long john, French curler and custard filled donuts.  Obviously, I ate them all in a span of one day, but nevertheless it was amazing....yes, I'm not ashamed to admit my weakness.  So I love donuts, please please please pray I don't get in trouble from my ecjb donut friend PAC since he is naturally failing from retaining the donut king title within the Chicagoland area, although he clearly gets the ecjb throne.

25.description: Ordered a dozen - 11 tasted awesome, 1 tasted old and was hard. 4 stars! Went early in the morning, my guess was maybe that it was sitting out from yesterday. I am a man that loves his doughnuts: good job. The ladies weren't too polite to but they might have still been too sleepy to function nicely.

12.description: Ron is amazing and made my wedding cake and it was absolutely beautiful AND delicious!

59.description: We heard about this amazing bakery in Bridgeport from others but we didn't know the name.  So we drove here and used Yelp to find it. The location is really cute and the smell is amazing when you walk in.  It just smells like fresh sweets.  Everything looks so yummy.  I tried the chocolate donut and it was really good.  The lady behind the counter was so sweet.  She found out that it was our first time here and she went out of her way to make sure we knew everything about this place. We learned that the chocolate donuts and the bacon rolls were the number one sellers.  There was also a large selection of Christmas cookies too.  The sweet lady behind the counter gave me two cookies on the way out and told me "Merry Christmas!". That was so nice of her.  I brought them home and my wife informed me that they were the best cookies she ever had.  She also told me that is all she wants for Christmas.  So my shopping is done. There were also only 6 Bacon Rolls left in the glass case at 11am and we were informed that all of them are usually gone by now.  I was so torn...do I get one or not???  We had just had breakfast and I was not even hungry.  I decided to not go for it and instead take my chances and come back again. I am sure that this was a major mistake on my part but I will worry about it then!!!This location is one of those incredible bakeries that just knows how to bake and deliver the goods.  We are fortunate to have a local bakery like this and I hope it is around for more years to come!!!

21.description: Great prices and very fresh baked goods. Stopped by on Saturday morning, after the Fat Tuesday paczki madness the bakery employees endured, and the woman working the counter was friendly and efficient despite the crazy week she'd had.  Definitely going back.

17.description: I normally don't have a sweet tooth. I'd much rather have another savory course over a dessert any day (I know, there's something wrong with me, lol). BUT, when I found out that Bridgeport Bakery sells maple bacon donuts, I had to go against my morals and values and give it a shot! BOY am I glad I did!The bakery itself is small, but the pastries and confections they're baking in that kitchen have some huge flavors! They offer so many sweets from cookies to donuts to buns and even sell paczkis, which are deep fried Polish pastries filled with a sweet filling. How can you go wrong with something that's deep fried and filled?! I went with the maple bacon donut and it was glorious. At first, when you look at it, it might seem like an ordinary donut with bits of bacon on it, but it's soooo much more! The salty bits of bacon covering the donut paired beautifully with the sweet maple glaze without being overpowering. I could've easily thrown back 5 of these bad boys. And the best part? It's less than a $1 - sucha bargain! Just a word of warning - make sure you get here early because they sell out fast! Happy eating!

10.description: Dope lil bakery with sum slayer meringue horns.  Also got sum old looking sludge sitting on the window sill (really adds to the texture of the joint).Take your xtreats outside, sit on the curb and stuff them in your face.

5.description: Loved it. Chicolate chip and Rainbow sprinkled Cookies were out if the box. Bacon maple donut was interesting. It Had a mixed sweet and salty tasting topping on a fresh donut. It took me a while to understand what was going on in my mouth lolBrownie was decent. I ate like entire bakery shop in 4 bucks :pI would go there again anytime.

3.description: 8/29- We could totally smell the fresh baked goods coming back late (early?) at night around 3am...Normally I'd be knocked out cold once I start sleeping after a good night on the town, but the thought of having a hot cinnaroll in my greedy little hands just totally nixed any chance of me going back to sleep. Call me crazy, but it's hard to beat warm cinnamon anything on cold, rainy morning at 7am. That's real motivation for me.The ladies working there are brisk and polite...in no time I was headed back out the door with an apple cinnamon roll and a bacon bun in tow. The roll was as fluffy and sweet as anything I could have ever wanted a cinnamon roll to be and the bacon bun was just the right amount of salty to balance out all that sugar. I was a little sad the bacon itself wasn't crispy, but I figure it'd be pretty dang hard to manage that *and* properly finish baking the bun around it to completion. Besides, with those prices, I have no complaints! Definitely will pick up goodies here in the future!

35.description: Believe the hype! I got a Hi Sweetheart and big wift of yumminess as I walked through the door which is everything on a Sunday morning. No bacon buns, I was advised to call ahead and they'd put one aside for me. It didn't matter because everything else was so good. I got the vanilla glazed, French crueler, and plain cake. Dat Donut is my fave but this is now a close second!FYI $5 minimum for credit card purchase

19.description: Love this bakery. There is a huge selection of cookies, doughnuts and pastries and they are so soft with just the right amount of sweetness. One of the best bakeries around. The prices are very reasonable too. A dozen cookies was only $2! My favorite are the cherry drop cookies and the orange creme ones. Yum!

28.description: I normally don't have a sweet tooth. I'd much rather have another savory course over a dessert any day (I know, there's something wrong with me, lol). BUT, when I found out that Bridgeport Bakery sells maple bacon donuts, I had to go against my morals and values and give it a shot! BOY am I glad I did!The bakery itself is small, but the pastries and confections they're baking in that kitchen have some huge flavors! They offer so many sweets from cookies to donuts to buns and even sell paczkis, which are deep fried Polish pastries filled with a sweet filling. How can you go wrong with something that's deep fried and filled?! I went with the maple bacon donut and it was glorious. At first, when you look at it, it might seem like an ordinary donut with bits of bacon on it, but it's soooo much more! The salty bits of bacon covering the donut paired beautifully with the sweet maple glaze without being overpowering. I could've easily thrown back 5 of these bad boys. And the best part? It's less than a $1 - sucha bargain! Just a word of warning - make sure you get here early because they sell out fast! Happy eating!

45.description: This bakery is great.  The prices are better.  And the bacon buns are even better than that if you can believe it!I've read other reviews talking about having a hard time finding bacon buns here.  I've gotten them on several occasions now (Hey! Give me a break! I go on Sundays to pick up donuts for little league practice.) and haven't had any instance where they weren't available. I usually show up between 10-11 and there are always enough bacon buns for me to buy one for myself, my boyfriend, any other of the parents I'm treating with plenty left over for you if you were to stroll in afterward.  Don't be discouraged people.  Get in there and get those buns!The donuts are excellent too.  My favorite is the cheese filled with the powdered sugar outside.  I have been known on a few occasions (every single weekend) to over purchase for the little league kids and "unfortunately" have to bring a bunch of donuts home.  After having a few donut eating contests with myself I am pretty confident in saying all of the donuts they offer are a step above the competitors in the area.  Thinking about going to the donut chain down the street?  Forget it.  DD has a dozen donuts for $3 less than Bridgeport Bakery but your getting much smaller, sadder imitations of what real donuts should be.  Don't do it. The right choice is B-port Bakery.

33.description: Looking forward to my 7th Paczki Day in a row here. Almost didn't want to write the review because I don't want to share this place with everyone else.The bacon buns are also to die for.

43.description: I try to avoid donuts and maintain a healthy lifestyle.  However, whenever  I go to Bridgeport, I almost always make a point of stopping at this bakery.  Their sugar twists are to die for.  Absolutely the best I have ever had.  Their chocolate cake donuts and apple slices are also wonderful.  I am glad that I don't live too close to this place, because I would certainly be carrying an extra 20 pounds on my frame.  But when I do indulge - it is worth every calorie!  Bridgeport Bakery - - live long and prosper.  You are one of my favorite indulgences, and I could not stand the thought of not having your wonderful pastries in my life.

2.description: About once a month, I would bring snacks to work and Bridgeport Bakery has been my go-to spot. It's about $10 for a dozen doughnuts and/or paczkis. Not a bad deal especially since these goodies aren't small. Paczkis are not an easy find in Chicago and I was particularly pleased with finding one near me. If you want to buy them in a bulk, be sure to call in advance and place an order for pick up. Otherwise, they seem to sell out pretty quickly and they do not make new batches as the day progresses. So far, I have tried the strawberry, raspberry, and chocolate with custard. The chocolate glazed paczki with custard filling has been the favorite among my friends.

18.description: We heard about this amazing bakery in Bridgeport from others but we didn't know the name.  So we drove here and used Yelp to find it. The location is really cute and the smell is amazing when you walk in.  It just smells like fresh sweets.  Everything looks so yummy.  I tried the chocolate donut and it was really good.  The lady behind the counter was so sweet.  She found out that it was our first time here and she went out of her way to make sure we knew everything about this place. We learned that the chocolate donuts and the bacon rolls were the number one sellers.  There was also a large selection of Christmas cookies too.  The sweet lady behind the counter gave me two cookies on the way out and told me "Merry Christmas!". That was so nice of her.  I brought them home and my wife informed me that they were the best cookies she ever had.  She also told me that is all she wants for Christmas.  So my shopping is done. There were also only 6 Bacon Rolls left in the glass case at 11am and we were informed that all of them are usually gone by now.  I was so torn...do I get one or not???  We had just had breakfast and I was not even hungry.  I decided to not go for it and instead take my chances and come back again. I am sure that this was a major mistake on my part but I will worry about it then!!!This location is one of those incredible bakeries that just knows how to bake and deliver the goods.  We are fortunate to have a local bakery like this and I hope it is around for more years to come!!!

41.description: Best bakery IN TOWN!!! Love their cinnamon raisin bread and everything else they offer! Plus, they have the most sincere sweetest owners and employees.. What all businesses should have!

52.description: Mmmm, fresh bakery goodies. I unfortunately made the mistake of coming here at 11am on a Saturday. So needless to say all the bacon buns, yummy donuts and other treats were gone. The only thing left was what looked like an ordinary cinnamon roll. Little did I know, it turned out to be an apple cinnamon roll of deliciousness.  It was so good, so fresh and completely kicked the ass of any donut found locally in the city or 'burbs. I loved it. My only complaint is I just bought two. I could've completely ate a dozen and not felt guilty about it. Hands down, one of my favorite bakery places and I'll definitely be back.

50.description: i come here once in a while since its a block away from my house. very friendly service! i remember the first time i walked in there and just looked around to see what looks good , the lady came up the counter and suggested what was good like the apple cinnamon donut. there was a few more donuts that i choose because it looks good but forgot what was it called.. all the donuts tasted very fresh and delicious! not too sweet but just sweet enough to enjoy. i cant wait to try the other donuts that they have which I'm sure will taste good!

4.description: Delicious and fabulous Paczkis I love them. I like the apple filled ones, the custard filled with chocolate icing is the best! I love pretty much everything they do there. I like their donuts in general but today we went to check out Paczki Day! It did not disappoint us. Keep up the great quality bakery goodies.

6.description: The only reason I give 2 stars is because so far every time I order over the phone I get a terrible attitude from whom ever answers the phone.  Word of advice if you want to keep your customers talk to them with some respect.  If you hate your job, you should quit! The customers ARE the reason you are in business!

22.description: They have really good paczkis here. On Fat Tuesday, they opened from midnight to whenever. There were like 16 flavors and not very sweet at all, which is why I like them so much. The best one I had was the strawberry whipped cream. They sell paczkis on normal days too, just more flavors on Fat Tuesday. I recommend if you are coming for Fat Tuesday for paczki, you should preorder before and go get them early like 6 or 7am. Avoid the crowd. The bacon bun was really good too but then again, bacon makes everything good.

15.description: Yesterday being paczki day.  I took wife and kids to bridgeport bakery to see if they had any left.  We figured they might not because it was late in the day and it would be reasonable to run out.  ISo we bought a coffee cake and placed an order to pick some up the next day.  While we were in there, there was this lady complaining that the bacon donuts she ordered at noon the previous day weren't available.  The ladies behind the counter didn't give a shit though so she left empty handed.This afternoon I stopped by to pick up my order at the agreed upon time and....they didn't have it.   So I left empty handed too.  The coffee cake we got the previous day was not as good as one you'd get at jewel.  Your better off going 5 miles up archer to Weber's bakery.

57.description: Best chocolate donut around.  I worked for this owner back in 1975 and their have remained consistent after all these years!  Nice staff, great variety in a small store, and decent prices!

20.description: I've ALWAYS looked to yelp for honest reviews but have never written my own.  However, after the service or lack thereof that I received today I felt compelled to write a review of my experience at Bridgeport Bakery.I'm a donut FANATIC!  I've tried donuts from all over Chicago and surrounding suburbs.  When my husband brought home a brown bag of maple and chocolate donuts from BB I was hooked!  I frequented the bakery on numerous occasions often bringing treats to share with co-workers who couldn't get enough of the sweet and fluffy goodness.  Sadly, my LAST visit left me with anything but a sweet taste.  Instead, I was left with quite a bitter taste based on the "service" I received.I pre-ordered 3 dozen donuts for my office the evening before to be picked up the next morning at 5:30am.  When I walked in, there were no other customers and one lady behind the counter.  She took forever to even acknowledge that I'd walked through the door.  Clearly folding boxes for the masses that had yet to arrive was more important than a hello or good morning to the one customer in the bakery.  When she finally acknowledged me, I gave her my name and told her I was picking up an order.  She continued folding boxes as if her life depended on it before going to grab my order.  When she returned with only 2 boxes I advised her politely that I'd ordered 3 dozen.  She then told me in a very nasty tone that I had only ordered 2 and she didn't know if she had enough for my 3rd dozen.  After she miraculously found enough donuts she took my card to settle the bill.  I waited for what felt like an eternityfor her to return with my card.  She came out, looked at the register and said the total aloud and went back to the credit card machine.  By then there were 4 people behind me.  She finally came back with my card & receipt and then barked "the first one failed."  I signed the receipt, grabbed my goods and walked away with the feeling that I'd done something wrong.About an hour after leaving, I checked my account and noticed 2 pending charges from the bakery for the same amount.  I called and explained the situation only to be told by the person "helping" me that she did NOT run my card twice but I'd have to come back in order for them to correct their error!  I advised her that I don't live in close proximity and it would be a huge inconvenience to come back to which she responded, "Well I don't know what to tell you."This type of service is completely unacceptable and will not be tolerated!  I asked to speak with the owner who came on the line immediately defending his employees lackluster service.  I expected to receive at least an apology at some point during our 4 minute conversation but instead got more excuses for incompetence on their end. He finally advised me that he could handle the credit card issue without my needing to return to this establishment which I had already initiated with my bank. All I wanted was a little acknowledgement that this type of service was unacceptable and an apology.  Sadly I received neither.Sorry BB, your products are good but they are not good enough to validate such disdain to a once loyal customer.  Therefore I've chosen to take my business where it's welcomed and appreciated not just tolerated.I hope BB will take my negative experience and use it to implement what's far more important than a product that appeals solely to the taste.

36.description: Another treasure in the land of Bridgeport, in my own opinion. Bridgeport Bakery has been around longer than I have been alive and they have an amazing and delicious selection of breads, pastries, cookies and the like. I really like their Ham and Cheese Croissants, but they are so popular that they are usually sold out by the time I arrive. Still, this is a classic old school bakery with friendly and courteous staff and I have never been disappointed with anything I've purchased from Bridgeport Bakery.

14.description: 1/2 dozen for under $5, you can't go wrong! Donuts were not the crazy gourmet kind like you'd get at Glazed or Stan's, but that's not what you go here for. You go here for an old-school bakery experience and good, solid, chocolate glazed cake donuts! Reminded me of my bakery back home.

3.description: Just stopped into this place for the final time tonight. Which is a shame because they do make an excellent thin crust pizza. While getting off of work I decided that a pizza would be nice. I stopped in and sat at the bar, as I have done many times before. This time the server, instead of taking my order, stood talking to some friends who were eating in the dining area. A full 20 minutes went by before she could be bothered to come over and ask what I wanted. I asked for a menu, she snidely told me that the kitchen was closed. My immediate thought was, had you greeted me and attempted to see what I wanted when I came in, either the kitchen would have still been open (it was about 9:50 PM when I sat down), or you could have told me sooner so I would not have wasted 20 minutes of life sitting in your establishment for naught. Dumbfounded, I left, vowing to write this review and never to return. Since they changed from Calabruzzi's to Thirty 3 this place has gone way downhill. They seem to attract douchebags and gangbangers now a days. I am a black man, who has lived in the neighborhood for nearly five years. Either this female server was blatantly racist, or just too freaking lazy to do her job. In any case, I shall not be returning, and I urge all people who value customer service and human decency to stay away as well, especially if you are black.

1.description: If you need a laxative disguised as food, then come to this place. I ordered a chicken salad and my boyfriend ordered the chicken parmesean. We both had the runs that night and it sucked. The bar in the inside was average, nothing special.

2.description: Hi, I'm a Bridgeport resident and I'm a little curious about the sign this bar has up on their front door that says "NO hooded sweatshirts; flat brimmed hats; facial tattoos." Surprising that a sports bar has a dress code. To the establishment of Thirty3: this is racist. If you aren't listing things that people of color wear in order to keep them out, take down this ridiculous sign. Because that's what it looks like, and the photo is circulating on facebook. Do you really kick out young white kids who wear hoodies? Are caps ok if the brims are curved? Like...seriously?

9.description: I literally created a Yelp account to write about how badly I hate this place. I live in the neighborhood and just wanted to grab a quick bite to eat after work. The bartender/server/only person we saw working was smoking right in front near the seating (ew) She was in no rush to come back in when we stood inside verifying our menu choices (we of course checked out the menu online first) We decided on the eggplant parm and a veggie burger. Rude, smoke-smell bartender didn't even look at us so we had to approach her, which was ...rude. (I'm articulate, I know) No eggplant parm "That hasn't actually been here in, like, ever." Well okay... this place has been open for 5 minutes and they already don't have an accurate menu. Whatever. I'll also have the veggie burger. "We don't have that either." lol. k. So we left. Hungry.

10.description: so I have a friend that comes here often and the first few time I stopped in it was just for drinks, and then I started ordering food. and everything ive ordered from the fried ravioli (which btw are to die for!) to the cucumber salad down to the pizza have left me wanting more! mixed crowd which I think is a good thing and the bar tenders are nice. when its nice they have an outside patio which is cool. parking in the back which in this city is a def plus

4.description: Worst place. Came here today. They have one person working this whole place waited 20 minutes for the server to come up to me and my bf thank God we were being entertained by the Bulls game. We ordered our drinks but now have been waiting for our pizza for 40 minutes.

6.description: Best night of my life. GREAT staff. So polite and attentive all the time. The managers are so sweet!

12.description: I come here with the wife every couple of weeks. It is not an extensive menu (mostly italian food) but what they do have they do really well.
