The italian sausage I believe they make in house. The pizza is excellent and they deliver too. Get one with the sopressata sausage. They also have a pretty good beer selection. The staff has always taken great care of us and we always have a good time here!

5.description: Boring. Booze is a bit overpriced and the service  was below average (the woman was a snot). My friend and I got a beer during last call, and the bartender turned all of the lights of not five minutes later. We drank slower to spite her.

11.description: This place opened up, not too long ago, and I had been meaning to swing by...so, on a snowy afternoon I checked out their website and they were advertising a $9.99 special on an XL Cheese Pizza.  My roommate and I decided there was nothing else going on, so we would finally see what's what.  First impression: it's a bar, done and done - not a lot of original personality, but I am going to give them the benefit of the doubt and say "they are new, that will come".  They were empty when we showed up, but, again, it was the first snow of the season and we chalked it up to Chicagoans being scared of what they know too well.  The drinks were regularly priced (Chicago prices) drinks - $6 for a Tito's and soda, with a $4 special on Bloody Mary's.  Again, nothing spectacular to grab my attention, then came the pizza.  There is only one pizza place in my neighborhood that I like (Phil's), and had been having trouble finding a backup, for those days that I want to stay in and order by credit card (since Phil's is cash-only).  Although it was only a cheese pizza, it is the best pizza I've had (outside of Phil's, and in Bridgeport) and if it is any indication of the rest of their menu I will most certainly be back.  Oh!  Also, the owner bought my roommate and I a round just for the sake of being nice, so, to recap:- Sports bar still developing its personality- Drinks that you will find anywhere else- Darn good pizza - which leads me to believe the rest of the menu is solid, as well.- Solid owners.- Bartender was a sweetheart who had just celebrated her 26th birthday.Give these guys a shot, they're across the street from Nana.  The only thing that could make this place truly better is a pool table or Golden Tee machine.

8.description: I am so unimpressed by this place. I grew up in Bridgeport so I was happy to see a new bar on Halsted, and it looked very approachable from the outside..all the better. This past weekend I was invited to go by a friend and ended up wanting to leave early, at midnight, rejecting to stay there until 2 and get a ride, choosing the 20 minute walk in the rain instead.While the price of drinks was pretty fair, it consisted of very little alcohol, and plenty of ice. As for the rest, I'll just list my disappointment factors instead of telling as a story.-Either much of the staff doesn't wear uniform or friends of staff are allowed to REPEATEDLY go in and out of the food service area.-Waited 25 minutes for a burger.....that literally tasted like nothing (I don't mind a wait for decent food)-Small place with lots of bodies, so it's really hot in there-Staff/friends of staff bogarting the Darts the ENTIRE night-Watching pre-Kentucky Derby show on all TVs rather than the requested basketball game . They agreed to change one tv but just never did it.I definitely wouldn't return.

0.description: Just stopped in for a drink today with a friend after brunch at Nana. This is a local bar in Bridgeport but one of the nicer ones. There was nobody there as the Bears were not playing. A good place to stop in to watch a game or on a weekend night. Open until 2:00 and 3:00 on Saturday only.The bartender Ashley was friendly as well as beautiful and the highlight of stopping in.

7.description: Calabruzzi's Cafe Closed and was replaced by Thirty3 Bar & Grill in the Fall of 2013. Thirty3 Bar and Grill is located at 3304 S. Halsted St. in the heart of Bridgeport.Our group of 9 came in hot this past Sunday afternoon to checkout the joint. Many of us have passed by but never stopped in to check it out. As we tried to walk in, the door was locked and the place was empty. They seemed shocked to have guests on a Sunday late afternoon.This place gives off an intimidating look because it doesn't fit the culture and decor of the neighborhood Bridgeport bars. It definitely is a step up from the old school flare of typical Bridgeport bars, which we all crave at times.Now, on to the liquor. They offer $3 draft and bottle beers! The owner greeted us with buying our group a round of Irish Car Bombs, which we quickly accepted the kind gesture. Noteworthy, they are only $5 on Sundays. The liquor was very reasonably priced and even at a lower price than other neighborhood bars.The restaurant largely serves bar fare like burgers and fried appetizers. In our opinion, pizza must be done well if its on the menu or there is no reason to have it on there. In an attempt to soak up the alcohol from day drinking, we ordered a party size cheese pizza as several people in our party are vegetarians. After waiting, they delivered a steaming hot sausage pizza. They quickly realized the mistake and instead of tossing the pizza out, they were nice enough to leave it at the bar for our meat-eating guests to enjoy while we waited for the cheese pizza. Shockingly, we all thought the pizza was above average bar pizza. Based on the pizza, we will be returning to check out some additional menu options.Karaoke starts at 9pm every Sunday. I'm not sure if this happens every Sunday but two of the staff members gave us a Coyote Ugly inspired performance on top of the bar, which was a nice touch to end of our Sunday FUNday.Bottom line, it was a great time at Thirty3 Bar & Grill. Its a nice atmosphere bar that is clean and friendly and will not cost you an arm and a leg to eat and drink there. We still have Bohemian Rhapsody and Pour Some Sugar On Me stuck in our heads. We will definitely be returning.Cheers,Jordan & Marks

28.description: The Zhou B Art Center was founded in 2004 by the brothers Shan Zuo and Da Huang Zhou. It is an art center located in the quaint Bridgeport neighborhood of Chicago where the Zhou Brothers have lived for more than two decades. The Zhou B Art Center is a private, non-government funded art center designed to facilitate the exchange of contemporary art between Chicago and the international art community. The 87,000 square feet art center offers innumerable possibilities for exploring the arts in a charismatic location and collectively form an extravagant art center fusing culture and creativity.

1.description: I attended an event here last night and I was happy with the set up. First off there is a parking  lot, so that made parking very convenient. Once inside I liked the layout of the space. Plenty of room to move about and I liked the idea of multiple rooms to go back and forth between.It's the type of space where you can decorate it to go for whatever look your going for. The event I was attending was a magazine/car event so there were a couple of cars located within the space. Really good time and no complaints at all with this event space.

9.description: The Yelp 12 Days of Christmas  (Chicago Event) was here last week. Zhou is really nice for a corporate party or  a reception. I enjoyed the up stair space the most. It looked very sleek (exposed brick, nice black flooring), technology appeared to be used more in this part, and it was a large space. Dancing, a bar, a photo booth, a lounge area, and table could all fit in the space. Just a little detail,  I love the front door stain window!My only improvement for Zhou is it would have been nice to know the theme of the exhibits in each area/room. I was confused in the main floor the themes, if any.  A little signage would be helpful.Overall, this was a nice space!

29.description: Recently held our wedding in this space and could not have asked for a better venue. The space is huge (17K square feet), open and very unique. Our family and friends at first had reservations about a wedding at an Arts center but were all pleasantly surprised and sung its praises. We did the ceremony and cocktail reception all in the same space. The opportunity to rent the cafe AND the large parking lot (with security) next to the space made the event more accessible and comfortable. The event coordinator was nothing but helpful and flexible for the vendors. We had 180 people and it never felt crowded. Getting married in front of a beautiful marble sculpture was truly awesome. Our guests voiced their appreciation for getting to partake in a traditional event in a non-traditional space.

23.description: Great space to transform into whatever your vision might be. Very fitting that it is also an art gallery because for an event that space is truly a blank slate with many capabilities. They have two huge floors of event space, parking isn't completely terrible (you can rent a 1000 car lot nearby if necessary), and not too far from the CTA red line station. If it helps, the smell of baked goods linger outside and i'm not exactly sure where this comes from but I like it!They provide the awesome space so you will need to provide anything else you'll need to make your dream space happen but they can provide a list of vendors for you to use. Definitely a place to check out for your next big event!

5.description: This place is one of the BEST art buildings in Chicago.   You see the artists' spaces where they create art and their work

25.description: Zhou B, pronounced like Joe B, is a really kewl venue for events.  It is an art studio located in a rehabbed warehouse. It has a great loft feel with really kewl art all over the place.  They have a cafe which duels as a bar/lounge. Zhou B is a great place to host a wedding if you had buku bucks. The only draws backs are that everything is a la carte as far as vendors for table, chair, food,  etc.., And its street parking unless you rent the parking  lot from the business next door They also have a "Hidden garden" for ceremonies a few block away.  If you have the money to burn, give it a try.The banquet manager and sales lady were very helpful and accommodating.  They were extremely friendly as well, just genuinely nice people.

12.description: I was at Zhou B Art Center for Yelp's annual holiday party. I had never been there before, so I didn't know what to expect. It's a great event space. The main level when you walk in is large and has a cafe in the front. There's also a large event space on the second floor. I think there's more event space in the basement, but I didn't go down there. The top two or three floors are gallery and studio space for the center's resident artists. Very cool! The neighborhood wasn't as bad as I had thought it would be. It's pretty gentrified and looked like a pretty safe place to visit. There was also plenty of parking in the lot behind the center. I think Zhou B Art Center would make a great unique venue for a wedding or some other type of big party. I'm not sure what the capacity of this place is, but it's very spacious, airy and open. Very cool place!

21.description: Wow!  Its been a while since I've been and the wedding I was at this weekend reminded me how incredible this space really is.  As an art driven venue, it should come as no suprise that its a big blank canvas but the functionality and the purpose driven design of the space really hit me over the head.  While not part of the design process of this particular event, my head was spinning with possibilities.   For a second, I even thought about getting married.  That's how awesome it is.Ample parking, functioning old school freight elevators, loading docks for vendors, clean (read: not musty) environment of beautiful exposed brick, timbered ceilings, crisp drywall and beautiful sculpture were the icing on this multilayered, ultra flavored cake. Bathrooms are impeccable which is always an oversight or value engineered out of a gallery space but the Zhou brothers did it right and made the restrooms both adequate and spiffy.Facility staff is above and beyond professional, helpful and courteous. While I didn't deal directly with their event staff, I can only assume they are an equally awesome reflection of an all around masterpiece.  Love this space!

16.description: Great space to transform into whatever your vision might be. Very fitting that it is also an art gallery because for an event that space is truly a blank slate with many capabilities. They have two huge floors of event space, parking isn't completely terrible (you can rent a 1000 car lot nearby if necessary), and not too far from the CTA red line station. If it helps, the smell of baked goods linger outside and i'm not exactly sure where this comes from but I like it!They provide the awesome space so you will need to provide anything else you'll need to make your dream space happen but they can provide a list of vendors for you to use. Definitely a place to check out for your next big event!

17.description: Zhou B, pronounced like Joe B, is a really kewl venue for events.  It is an art studio located in a rehabbed warehouse. It has a great loft feel with really kewl art all over the place.  They have a cafe which duels as a bar/lounge. Zhou B is a great place to host a wedding if you had buku bucks. The only draws backs are that everything is a la carte as far as vendors for table, chair, food,  etc.., And its street parking unless you rent the parking  lot from the business next door They also have a "Hidden garden" for ceremonies a few block away.  If you have the money to burn, give it a try.The banquet manager and sales lady were very helpful and accommodating.  They were extremely friendly as well, just genuinely nice people.

10.description: The Zhou B Art Center is an excellent venue that lends itself to the artwork.  With skyscraper ceilings, and white walls it seems like the best place for installation pieces. They have an enormous parking lot, and the pictures of events held here are absolutely stunning. The white walls and high ceilings lend themselves to uplighting and decorations.Unfortunately, however, a second look let me see the giant spiderwebs, boarded up windows, broken windows, and the desperate need for a paint job and better lighting.I was also a little disappointed to see that the Garden was at a separate location. The pictures of it are very intriguing.

11.description: We had our wedding ceremony at the Life Garden and Reception on the first floor in the Moongate room in the main center the second week of June 2013. There were several things promised to us and replaced with something sub-optimum or not delivered at all. In summary, the dealings with the venue was fine up until 5 weeks before the wedding. Out of the 8 vendors I worked with for our wedding I unfortunately have to say that this vendor caused the most stress and was the most difficult to work with 5 weeks leading up to the wedding including the day of the wedding. Pro's-Some guests accidently came through the cafe instead of the side entrance. The doors were locked, so they unlocked the doors and let guests enter through the cafe even though we did not rent the space. -There was not a convenient place for the bridal party to reside before making the grand entrance to the reception, so they opened the Spirit Space for us to use temporarily even though we did not rent the space. -One of the maintenance men (don't remember his name) and the day of event liason, Kenny, was very nice to work with.Issues1) We were told just 5 weeks before the wedding that the Venue was going to charging us $400 to use the ceremony site for the wedding rehearsal. 2 hour minimum was required. At contract signing, Donna (event director), did not indicate there was any charge and indicated that all we had to do was give them a week's notice. When mentioning what I recalled to her, she indicated she was talking about letting us use the reception site. I may be totally off, but I would think that a wedding rehearsal would be done at the ceremony site. Her reasoning for needing to charge us was that she would have to pay someone to open the gates for us because the venue was not open to the public. When prompting her further her reason was..."She is running a business!".  The delivery of the $400 charge was via email. I was very upset to say the least. We were stuck and had no choice. I had to entertain ideas of having the rehearsal done at a baseball field or someone's backyard, but luckily ended up doing it at the reception space. This experience with the Director, who was also our main contact at the venue, made all interactions leading up to the wedding more difficult. 2) A private room was not available for the bridal party to touch up prior to the ceremony When signing this venue, the event director told us that the Bridal party could use a room in the building next to the life garden (the old space of Cataleya) to get ready and touch up before the ceremony. Upon the wedding we asked how we can access this room, and the event director indicated that the only room available is the Foundation room which is the gallery attached to the garden. This building is the only air conditioned space at the site, has the only on-site bathroom, and is also open for guests to enter. Traditionally, guests are not supposed to see the bride before the ceremony. The was impossible given the option the venue suggested. Guests come in and out of the building to use the bathroom and shelter from the heat. The "powder room" they suggested is actually the bathroom in the Foundation gallery which is the size of a closet and as mentioned, is also a public bathroom.What made it worse, it my opinion, was the director's attitude. She made it seem like this has always been the case and that what they offered was more than sufficient. I mentioned that I remember the building next door would be available which then prompted her to say "well, Cataleya used to be there but has moved out since..." 3) The event director refused to give a day of contact to myself or my wedding coordinator. As you know, it is common practice to contact all vendors before a wedding and also to have a day of contact in case of any issues, and especially access to the venue etc.  At this point, I had almost given up getting support/information from the venue. Luckily a friend of ours stepped in to be the day of coordinator and after multiple emails and calls, we obtained a contact number the night before the wedding.  4) Guest Bathroom at the Life Garden: The bathroom was out of soap and didn't have a waste basket. My MOH luckily noticed this before most of the guests came and asked the event liaison to remedy the issue. They did promptly, however, these are bare essentials you would expect properly prepared for you. 5) We were also promised 2 security guards as part of the $350 rental fee of the parking lot next door which typically went for $500. My guests said they never saw security guards at the parking lot.To be fair, my rating is an average between 2 criteria. Customer service: Up till 5 weeks before wedding, it was a 3, but given the 5 weeks leading up and the many things promised but not delivered as expected, I give it a 1. The space itself, a 3 due to the character

26.description: It is a great building, but I must have gone on the wrong day. On a Saturday, they are supposed to be open until 5 pm. At 3 pm, I went in and found all the lights dim and none of the resident galleries open. It was a long and wasted trip. I will try again during an opening, but I don't expect much.

27.description: The Zhou B Art Center is actually a great venue to host an event...you can be very creative within this unique space. They have two floors for events and was just at a wedding last month that was quite beautiful and out of the box. I'm excited about my new art studio space too...can't wait to start creating!

0.description: Looking for something new to do on a Friday night? Check out the Open House, it is so fun! We went over last weekend and had a great experience. The only down side was public transportation. It is impossible to get a Taxi at the end of the evening. We ended up on a bus and rather confused. Check out Han202 if you are headed over, fabulous BYOB prix fixe Chinese.

20.description: We came for a gallery party on a weekend night, and found the place packed with young people. There were several floors with different "art" shows ongoing. I thought the shows were questionable as art, and I did not enjoy the experience.

19.description: Well, I totally forgot to leave a review for Zhou B, where my wife and I got married back in July. We were looking for a unique and fun space for our wedding - something that was both affordable and classy and that's exactly what we got with Zhou B. The space is fantastic and can really be transformed with different kinds of art and how you dress up the space for your event. When you walk inside the space with no installation on the walls it can feel a bit cold and dark but that's mainly because of the old industrial feel of the warehouse building. However, this is exactly what gives the space character and allows you to change the mood and feeling when you put up an installation or house your event there.Just on its own, Zhou B is a great gallery to see art from local artists that have studios in the building, to the Zhou brother's great works to other famous artists. I believe the Zhou brothers own 9 buildings in the area and have a hidden gem on S. Morgan and 35th: a smaller gallery with more of their own work with a beautiful and serene attached garden space that you can also use for your even.Back to the main building on 35th. This is where my wife and I held our reception and it was really great. The main floor has two great spaces (Moongate and Spirit) that you can rent and also a huge second floor that can house around 300 people. Since we had about 130 guests we only needed to use the Spirit room which is what you see when you walk in the front door. Also, be aware that's there a nice little cafe in side the building that you can visit while you are viewing the current installation.  Anyway, the Spirit space was fantastic for our reception and worked perfectly with our floor plan and the ambience we went for. Our lighting team really did wonders in the room and our planners helped make the space beautiful. The art installation that was on the walls was perfect for our event and every one of our guests raved about the space and the art.  They all thought Zhou B was so unique.As previously mentioned, the garden/gallery space on S. Morgan is awesome. We decided to rent two spaces for our wedding so we could have our reception outside in the garden. The space was perfect for our guests and for our ceremony. Everything was set up perfect and our DJ was able to hook up sound so our music for the procession and recession and then for the short cocktail reception afterward was on point.  The garden space really is something you can't miss.If you decide you are interested in hosting an event at one of the Zhou B spaces (weddings, fashion shows, party, charity event, etc) you will most likely work with Donna Bliss. She really is a fantastic person to work with - really organized and on top of things. She truly cares about your event and what you are looking to do and will always help you along the way.  Donna really helped us feel comfortable and come to the conclusion that this was the right place for our wedding.  In addition, her staff are also great and were responsive and helpful in our planning and on the wedding day.I also need to touch on one other thing. The pricing for renting one or two spaces is very reasonable.  As with a lot of unique spaces in Chicago, just be aware that you will have to rent all of your equipment (tables, chairs, silverware, plates, etc). Zhou B does not own any of this stuff. They do have tables and chairs for the main space that they keep on site but you have to rent them from Tablescapes for about $4 a guest (another company we worked with that is pretty good).Having this experience at Zhou B allows us to have lasting memories and know that we have a place in the city to come back to for a variety of reasons.

2.description: Another gallery/event space in Bridgeport. I came here for the Behealthful retreat- a one-day wellness and beauty summit. The first floor was packed with vendors showcasing their healthy wares, lectures, and even space for fitness classes (yoga, Pilates, HIIT). Getting here by cab was straightforward. On the way back I ended up taking the #35 bus and Red Line but could see that it would be difficult to get a taxi (not sure if Uber would be any easier). It looked like the parking is plentiful for those who are driving. Prior to this event I had only passed by the space and appreciated the sculpture outside. Between programs it was interesting to look around at the artwork- it appears there are permanent displays and rotating exhibits. I definitely felt the venue itself complemented my experience of the event, versus if it had been held in the caverns of McCormick Place. I found myself revitalized physically by the activities of the day as well as emotionally and spiritually nourished by the artwork and creative expressions around me.

18.description: The Zhou B Art Center is an amazing space and somehow still a hidden gem in Chicago.  I have held my company's annual charity event there each year since 2009 and really appreciate the helpful staff.  Its so gorgeous inside and the space has such great energy.  I highly recommend looking into the Zhou B if you are looking for a great event space.  Also, they have a beautifully artistic cafe that is a great alternative to Starbucks for sooo many reasons! The art, the fact that it is a million times more cozy, free wifi, a great menu.  If you haven't checked out the Zhou B Art Center (whether you are an art-lover or not) you are missing out.

13.description: First of all, thanks Yelp team for always exposing me to awesome locations for events.  You really do a good job of finding  impressive venues to host events.  This space is totally amazing and I love the way it flows.  It provides the ability to feel comfortable and not totally squeezed in with large crowds.  The open space allowed for many different acts to perform in the venue.  As a person that serves on a board, we are always looking for great places to host events and this place allows you to use a blank canvas and create your masterpiece.   It's hip and chic but gives off that loft appeal.  There's ample parking for guest without them worrying about their car.   The second floor held enough room for a screen projector and dj to bump music and enough room for 20 or so dancers to get their groove on.  I certainly can't wait to head back here for another event coming up in 2012.  Thanks Yelp for showcasing another dimepiece of a locationi.

4.description: I had signed a contract with Donna on 3/25/14 for use if the Zhou B Art Center's 2nd floor for a charity event in 2014.  Due to changes in our organization I had to push the date to 2/27/15 and they were kind enough to let me do so.  It was failure on my end to properly research the venue and costs associated with it, but not being a professional event planner, I did not know the questions to ask nor the exuberant costs I would be required to pay in order to host an event at this venue.  I was incorrect in assuming that Donna was trustworthy and kind enough to share all of this info with me up front, knowing that this is a charity event and that I was volunteering 100% of my money and my time to put this event together. As I was preparing for our event in February I continued to be surprised with things that were not provided by Zhou B and that I was now required to pay for myself.  Things like  the audio equipment, coat racks, and use of the projectors (that were already set up). Had I known that I would be spending $1000 for audio equipment, $500 for coat racks, and over $500 for use of the projectors in addition to the food, service, linens, decorations, lighting, etc... I never would have signed the contract.  With 100% of the proceeds from our event benefiting the American Heart Association, every penny counted. I made a phone call to Donna asking if she knew any companies that would provide us coat racks at a better price than $500 because I was very concerned about all the costs adding up for this event.  Her response was "I can't call in a favor like that to my contacts."  We did not come close to our fund raising goal for AHA and it was not at all a result of lack of effort.  One of the reasons we did not hit our goal is the cost of this venue and the lack of their support.In addition, Kenmare Catering who partnered with the Zhou B Art Center in May 2014 to handle all of their events failed miserably to provide the services I paid for.  See my review of Kenmare Catering.UPDATE - The co-owner of Kenmare Catering, Reid Tillinghast took the time to research the events that took place that evening with his team and refunded me for a portion of my cost for his catering and event services.

24.description: I LOVE this gallery. The permanent art scupltures are beautiful and the temporary art installations are always interesting. It is also a great place to host an event, plenty of room and such a cool vibe.

6.description: I attended a fundrasier event there.  Very interesting event space, upstairs and downstairs space with an old freight elevator, the kind you have to close the gate.The space is punctuated with large art work on the wall and you can use the space very creatively.Love supporting a small business formed by two brothers, who immigrated from China about 20 years ago, and have become leaders of the Bridgeport community.

22.description: I had my event here for the Jenny Yoo Collection.  It is beautiful! Donna is so accommodating and helpful in the entire process.  The owner and his nephew were there as well on the day of the event and helped me make the space more suitable for my particular event.  Everyone who came loved the space and I really recommend it for any events or future weddings!Thanks again Zhou B! :)

15.description: We came here for a friend's boyfriend's art opening. What we didn't expect was the scale of this location. I haven't seen such eccentric and beautiful, thought-provoking art space in a long time. We walked around for more than 3 hours and enjoyed every bit of it.The crowd was young, but not the young hip crowd that makes you want to throw up. They had music on each of the four floors and the artists had opened their studios for visiting. Most you could tell use it sparingly. Some you could tell moved in. One guy actually installs custom home theaters. Seemed out of place, but that stall was hoppin'.We ended up parking on the street but later discovered parking in the back. I believe this night they had valet. The bar in the front is quaint and although I didn't go, the drinks were rather pricey. Luckily many artists had bottles of wine. I imagine you could bring in your own hooch if you were so inclined.Definitely want to come back for another open house night. The artists were all so friendly. And one of these days when I can, I would really like to take a piece home.

7.description: One of my best friends Matthew C. Stone had his wedding reception here.  The installation gallery was made available exclusively to the bridal party for wedding pictures.  It is unfortunate that the rest of the attendees did not get to see the installation pieces as most of them were stunning.  The rented wedding space on the second floor was industrial by design, but the vendors my friend picked added decorative refinement.  I started a short nap due to my inebriation, while there was still light in the sky.  By the time I had awoken, the only brightness penetrating the wall to wall windows was that of the parking lot posts emitting the most beautiful light pollution I have ever witnessed.

8.description: I've only visited the Zhou Brothers' building once, as part of a gigantic Yelp event, so my impressions are inextricably intertwined between building and party.  But, focusing just on the venue: it's on 35th Street in Bridgeport, a neighborhood I've never walked through previously.  The area seems safe, even a bit more gentrified than I expected--I walked past several new loft condo buildings as I headed over from the Halsted bus stop.  But the Ramova Grill and Johnny O's Hot Dog shack keeps this stretch from being bland.The building is huge, several floors of open space with a working freight elevator and concrete stairways.  I'm guessing the building was a factory or warehouse in a former life.  The space is so open and malleable, it lends itself to any number of uses: art performances, art studio, galleries, a great party or wedding venue, corporate retreat, what have you.  The bathroom was much larger and had more style than I would have expected in a raw loft, so clearly there's some concern to making this place work for crowds.  There seem to be a number of different artists working/selling/living? in the basement level, so this is not just a monument to the work of the two owners.A very pleasant looking cafe sits at the front of the building on the entrance floor.  If I lived nearby, I'd be here daily.

30.description: A kaleidoscope of visual arts...Three floors of most eclectic visual arts you would find in Chicago. Regardless of your taste you are sure find something you enjoy. A unique environment where you would meet a very diverse group of people.

3.description: A genuine pillar of the Chicago Arts community, Zhou B provides a wonderful venue for artists and events.  Housed in an industrial building, it offers ample space for artists of various styles and formats.

14.description: Wow!  Its been a while since I've been and the wedding I was at this weekend reminded me how incredible this space really is.  As an art driven venue, it should come as no suprise that its a big blank canvas but the functionality and the purpose driven design of the space really hit me over the head.  While not part of the design process of this particular event, my head was spinning with possibilities.   For a second, I even thought about getting married.  That's how awesome it is.Ample parking, functioning old school freight elevators, loading docks for vendors, clean (read: not musty) environment of beautiful exposed brick, timbered ceilings, crisp drywall and beautiful sculpture were the icing on this multilayered, ultra flavored cake. Bathrooms are impeccable which is always an oversight or value engineered out of a gallery space but the Zhou brothers did it right and made the restrooms both adequate and spiffy.Facility staff is above and beyond professional, helpful and courteous. While I didn't deal directly with their event staff, I can only assume they are an equally awesome reflection of an all around masterpiece.  Love this space!

1.description: This tavern is actually fronting (without a sign) on Halsted. No hipsters when dropping by a couple Saturday nights ago, just some middle-age and olders. Lots of cigarette smoke and clearly serving as a local clubhouse for tobacco addicts. Cheap drinks, good-looking back bar, but no reason for a non-smoker to be there. Better choices north a block or three, or if you want Bridgeport history and to be welcomed, Schaller's Pump is just to the south.

2.description: I went to this place last week for the first time because we were in the area of Cellular Field. We entered this place and it seemed like we were walking into a movie. The patrons all looked at us like we were walking in nude. The smoke in the place was thick from all the cigarette smoking( I'm a smoker so I didn't mind but my wife hated it) we were there just about an hour and I had politely asked the group of 17 year old kids all drinking in the place that no my wife was nit the "stripper" entertainment as they said. They continued to throw remarks and insults until I finally walked over to them an lifted my shirt ad showed them my hand gun and then produced my sheriff badge. I explained that I was off duty but I didn't have to be so nice. The bartender then said to me, if I didn't behave myself I was going to be removed. I asked if he was kidding and then e said these "kids" pay the bills so if you have an issue with them "you'd guys" gotta go. We left ad went down the street to buffalo rings and wings and had a great rest of our night with an all 21 and older crowd. While we left we seen the same kids beating up 2 other patrons out front and the same bartender standing and watching this all happen. This place should be closed immediately.

0.description: There's nothing quite like trudging through an unfamiliar neighborhood in ankle-deep snow trying to fetch a buzz.  There's also nothing like trying to enter an open bar and finding a locked door.The barman sees us and comes over.  After a moment of hesitation, he opens the door and lets us in.  Several locals stare us down.  I'm not even talking old men, I'm talking people our age (20's) that act as if we've just violated some ancient south side law.The barkeep sits us at the end of the bar without any coasters.  As if our awkward appearance (read: no gold jewelry or leather jacket) didn't set us apart from the normal male clientele enough, my friend drops the bomb.  "$5 for the Millers," says the bartender.  "Five for both?"  says my naive friend.  I knew at this point, there was no going back.We uneasily drank our beers, noticing a few patrons smoking cigarettes.  No biggie, I understand that some places need more time than others to comply with the no-smoking reg (see the Two-Way).  You can't end a hundred years of tradition with a single pen stroke.  But the level of comfort usually common in these hole-in-the-walls after the initial shock of "outsiders" never developed.  One star for the 90's rock on the stereo and the cheap beers.

3.description: This is a nice family owned taco joint that is in the area. I have a personal favorite taco spot, but this place gets it done when I am chilling at my friends shop across the street. The lady that works there is really nice and friendly. My favorite thing about this place is that the tacos are made to order, which means your food will take a little longer. I also ordered a hot dog that came with fries and a drink. The price for everything was really reasonable. Honestly, the food here is pretty average...I would say 3-31/2 stars, but since the lady who owns the place is nice, I give this place a 4 stars.

1.description: Wasn't really impressed, given the strong reviews. Did not personally experience the supposed friendliness of the owners.I ordered two tacos on a Tuesday right before 1 PM. They were made while I waited, about 15 minutes. Total came out to just under $5. Besides meat, the tacos come with lettuce, onion, cilantro, and tomato. They were pretty dense, each the size of a mini burrito maybe.The al pastor tasted fine, nothing special. I couldn't finish it after encountering some weird crunching, which I suspected was cartilage or tendon. Not my favorite. The carne asada was slightly better, though pretty bland as well. At least it was just meat with no surprises. I had to douse both tacos with hot sauce, which was surprisingly good, since I hate tabasco. The corn tortilla was also weirdly soggy, not oily soggy but just wet.Finally, I suspect it made me a little sick. The tacos did not come with cheese, which is fine for a lactose intolerant like me. However, that evening I felt like I had eaten a ton of cheese, though there definitely wasn't any in my tacos! So I wonder what mystery ingredient caused that reaction. Since I don't really care to find out, I won't be venturing back. Especially since tacos are only $1.40-1.60 at Taqueria San Jose, though they aren't as large and don't come with as many veggie toppings. If I had a stronger stomach, I'd give them the benefit of the doubt, since Goodie Tacos has some faithful customers (my roommates among them). So if you're in the neighborhood and have a few bucks, why not give this local, family-run business a try.

2.description: This place BLOOOOOWS!!!! I HATED IT!!!! I was gonna just let it go until I WAS ROBBED!!!! $13 for a NASTY taco dinner.I swear I wasnt going to even review this place so I didnt have to give them a bad review.But $13?? REALLY??? YOUR RESTAURANT SMELLS!!!!!! I was gonna just cancel my order but I didnt wanna be rude!!! So I had to suffer and EAT IT!!! And then you want to ROB ME?!?!!! Thats ok.Because this was my first and LAST TIME.

9.description: I have gotten tacos from here many times! It is by far my favorite tacos in all of Chicago. The husband and wife are always very sweet and make their tacos with heart. The green salsa is the absolute BEST! I highly recommend it. It is a place to grab and go eat it somewhere else. Remember to bring cash since it is cash only. Everyone should come here at least once! I am drooling just thinking about my next steak taco!

10.description: Goodie Taco is a great place to hit for lunch...its a small family-owned business, and the mom makes great food! The specials kick ass and they make it the way you want it - although we have to do something about the ketchup on the hotdogs, come on, people!if you're in the area and want some good fast food this is the spot!

4.description: small little family owned restaurant across from a school.. there is a few stools and wall tables for you to eat there..... the restaurant has Mexican food and American food.. from tacos to burgers.. the service is really nice..the 2 times i ordered from here, i got the taco dinner (3 tacos, rice, beans)... i tried the steak and the al pastor.. the steak is decent.. i would say its about average... the al pastor was probably the worst I've ever had in any restaurant...  the rice was microwaved but wasn't too bad.. the beans was very liquidy? and very very bland...probably wont come back here since there are tons of Mexican restaurants around the area that is cheap and good...

6.description: Decent taco place.  I shared the steak torta with a friend.  The steak seemed to be pretty good quality, not fatty or chewy.  I'd probably go there again since it is right around the corner from me, cheap, and quick.

12.description: A nice little family run, Mexican-American restaurant. The prices are great for everything here. You have everything from burgers & hot dogs to burritos & tacos.I recommend the steak or beef burritos. It's a great place if your on the run. They make a very quick meal for you that won't be missing anything from flavor to portions. You get your money's worth here and then some.

5.description: The owner Raul and his wife are  really nice and friendly, and its a decent taco place, taco are not that great but not bad either, I got the stake and chorizo taco are they were ok,,had very little meat , Raul gave me a sweet tamale to try and that was delicious, very authentic. I was hoping to get some authentic pork tamales but they don't make any.

13.description: I personally think its really good. I've been eating burritos alot lately and this one is one of the best ones around the area. I usually get steak burritos so thats what i got. It was very fresh and the meat was delicious. I would definitely recommend it. I especially like it cause its close to my house. The lady there is really nice and friendly. I still have to try the taco's next time.

11.description: The perfect neighborhood taco joint. The tacos are fantastic, cheap, and taste fresh. The owners are really nice too. Best in the neighborhood!

8.description: The tacos here are delicious, especially the chicken tacos.  It's a little-hole-in-the-wall type place, but well worth stopping inside.  The gentleman who made our tacos for us was incredibly nice and even offered us fresh jalapenos to go with our meal.  I'll definitely be back soon.

0.description: Tacos are made to order, no steam table or quick serve. This is a small family run take out, they have burgers, hot dogs, ice cream, candy and Mexican food. Menus are 10 years old, with the old prices, I like the fact that my tacos were made on the spot and the way, I wanted them. Raul, told me that he cooks the food, the way the customer wants it and he listens to his customers. I had the chicken and al pastor tacos, they were very tasty, but the taco shell was over cooked. Over all, I would go back and try it again

7.description: As it has been mentioned, this is a family-run eatery with some tasty Mexican items on the menu as well as the standard "running a small grill" thoroughfare like burgers, fries and the like.Well, I headed in and was greeted by Sylvia, one of the owners in the family, and while trying to make up my mind I decided "this place is called Goodie Taco, so let's see how good the tacos are!"  I almost always go with steak as my meat of choice, and I always prefer soft tacos.  She was out of flour tortillas, though I was hoping for corn tortillas anyway.While she was cooking it up, we had a nice little chat about us moving into the area and trying to find new places with good food.  Sylvia seems very friendly, and was extra-quick assembling my foodstuffs.  I assume they get a lot of practice at speedy service here since they are right next to the Holden School and I imagine on a schoolday will get large crowds of hungry families on their way home.It would also explain the large amount of candies and snacks in boxes for sale at the counter - unless the Guzman family just has a large sweet tooth and needs to be near a sugar supply at all times.Either way, I got home and thoroughly enjoyed my taco.  I like any Mexican food establishment where "no cilantro" is an option and will be properly adhered to when preparing my food.The steak was excellent and the taco was a delight.  I will certainly be back, and I can attest to the "good tacos" at "Goodie Taco".

58.description: I heard so many things about this place and its meat pies and decided to give it a try. I ordered the premium steak royal steak, a scotch egg, and chips (their version of fries). The wait was about 10 mins and the cashier actually brought it out to our table. It was absolutely delicious. The pie came out hot. The chips were crispy and the scotch egg was to die for! Would definitely come back with more people.

56.description: Delicious meat pies and tasty specials. I've had all the pies, but like the chicken balti, because it has the most flavor with a hint of Indian spices that aren't too over powering. The meat and veggie pies are a bit bland. The cilantro chutney is a must for any pie you get, as it adds some freshness to these rich treats, and it also cools them down a bit, because they come out piping hot. I also recommend the buttered peas as a side. They're always cooked to perfection, never overdone and mushy.  They have really nice burgers on Tuesdays and you can't go wrong with their fries.  Best of all, they deliver the food to you next door at Maria's bar.  I like this type of business collaboration.

29.description: This is the place we take people who are visiting Bridgeport -- it's just the best. Their menu is fairly simple, but it's surprisingly good. The pies are amazing. My favorite is the chicken with the chutney sauce. And even though I know that I'm going to be full and not be able to finish everything, I always get a side of chips with it. In true British style, they offer vinegar for the chips as well. Andrew's favorite is the mushroom and kale, which I can't attest to because I don't like mushrooms, but he generally has very good taste.I've also had the steak and ale pie, which is very good if what you want is meat and potatoes. I wouldn't call it bland, but it's quite simple. Usually, I'm in the mood for a little bit of spice, which is why the chicken pie is perfect.One day, I'll try their fish and chips, which is apparently very good too, but I feel like I'm doing it wrong if I don't get one of their pies.As for the atmosphere, it's perfect. It's BYOB with a liquor store right next door, so it's a perfect place to grab a beer and hang out with friends for a bit. The inside is a bit small, but they have an outdoor seating area which is perfect for large groups on a day with mild weather.

42.description: Truly a Bridgeport gem, Pleasant House is a destination no matter what neighborhood you live in. Everything here is on point: delicious savory pies, excellent sides (minted peas are a must!), and much of the veggies used in the pies are grown by the owners. I can't wait for cooler weather so I can eat more pies! I've tried them all and you can't go wrong. Fish and chips Fridays are also killer. You can tell how much care the owners and team put into quality. This place is legit and not to be missed.

23.description: About a 3.5: While in the neighborhood, I was able to stop by the Pleasant House Bakery.  This little family-owned bakery and cafe is located in the Bridgeport neighborhood, offering a British-inspired menu of breads, Royal Pies (award-winning), pastys, desserts, and even daily specials.  I tried the Chicken Balti Pie (a delicious, flaky buttery pastry mini 'pie' filled with all-natural chicken, fresh-ground curry spices, tomato, and Nigella seeds - this had kind of a tomato-based Italian taste to it, and it was just okay; I did love the crust, though!); a Steak and Ale Pie (filled with all-natural beef, ale, carrots, and herbs); an order of the Deluxe Gravy Chips (perfectly-fried, bite-sized steak fries with chunks of skirt steak (tasted like pot roast!), gravy, and aged Cheddar cheese - these were quite addicting, and I could have actually done without the skirt steak; the chips were seasoned perfectly and were oh-so-addicting!); a Scotch Egg (I was actually pretty excited about this, but was the most disappointed with at the end - this was a perfectly boiled egg (yummy yolk!), covered with ground sausage and then coated with bread crumbs to be deep-fried; I did enjoy the crispy exterior, the sausage was just not flavorful and had an off taste to it - I was just not a fan); a mini chocolate stout cake (dark chocolate-like, but it heavily tasted like alcohol to me); and, a crispy laced oat cookie that was just so delicious (thin and crispy).  I'd love to try out their other pies, their daily specials, as well as their homemade sodas the next time.  Service was pretty efficient and friendly, and all the items ordered are heated up for you.  There's some limited seating inside where you can enjoy your treats or take it to go.  There's some free residential parking around the area, so do not fret!+great buttery crust!+Deluxe Gravy Chips+laced oat cookies

47.description: This place is probably my favorite thing about living in Bridgeport. We come here probably twice a month. The food is amazing, and so is the couple that owns the place. They don't seem to make a big deal out of it, but they're big supporters of urban farming and sustainable production. If you walk down Morgan street, you might see one of their little gardens, and they also have a kitchen at a place nearby that runs on a zero waste model. Sure the menu is small, but the quality is top-notch.

8.description: I happened to be in the South Side and normally book it home but I finished work earlier in the afternoon and decided to try this place out. The cashier was very nice and I received my order in just a few minutes. I got the steak and ale pie and it looked really small at first but then I finished the whole thing and it was actually quite filling. The crust was really flaky and buttery and the steak and combination of whatever else was in the pie worked really well. I can't wait go back and try the chicken balti pie, which is supposedly another very popular option.

31.description: Great pies! The chicken pie is so good and the Scottish egg. The egg is still runny and the sausage is well seasoned! It was so yummy. It is on the pricier side. The interior is not that impressive but the food is really good.

34.description: Some places are just hype and Pleasant House is one of them. I walked in for a quick bite after work/school with kids in tow... asked for coffee along with my meal and  was told they dont serve coffee in the evening however  I can walk across to Bridgeport Coffee and get one if I wanted. SERIOUSLY? ?? its ok to say they dont serve but to expect me to go across and grab one isnt a good idea especially since i had kids with me. Anyways the food, I couldn't attempt to take more than 3 bites of the chicken pie, nibbled a bit on the crust which had a butter taste(only plus).  The kids shared the chicken burger, which seemed ok and a ginger ale which was freshly made.Me staying away from this place.

16.description: Amazing, amazing meat pies. Definitely the best in America, and possibly the best in the world - though I haven't yet done extensive research in the UK. BRB on that.My boyfriend and I shared buttered peas and a Scotch egg - the yolk of which was a little runny (how do they DO that?!) and magical. We each got a steak and ale pie. Word to the wise: they look small, but you could have rolled me out of there after I ate one. The pies are, needless to say, delicious. The crust is buttery and flaky and cooked to where you'd almost think it was overdone but the crispy-ness is perfect. Only thing that wasn't stellar was that I think the AC was out (in August) and I think they had the back doors open because of it - aka there were more than enough flies tryin' to help themselves to my meal. But they're still worth 5 stars to me!

13.description: I'd give the food a 4+ and the service a 2.  The kale and mushroom pie blew me away (seriously, it doesn't sound good, does it?).  My British friend said things tasted just as they should.  We ate and ate and ate.  And apparently, bothered the employees, as the cashier finally said to me, "You're asking too many questions."  Gah!  Jerk!  This only endeared this place more to my friend, who declared the service "Perfectly English!"

11.description: Cute little bakery located near Comiskey Park. Ordered the Chicken Balti and Steak & Ale royal pies. The crust on the pies are buttery and flaky goodness, and the fillings are tasty as well! Wasn't a big fan of the Scotch egg, I thought the sausage could have used a bit more flavor, but the bite of the breadcrumb crust was delightful, and the egg was cooked to medium perfection. We also got an order of the deluxe gravy chips which came fully loaded with beef tips and cheese - wow, these were amazing! I think the meat was a bit over the top, but we were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed the chips. I got a chocolate stout cake (I thought it was good, but my sister definitely tasted the alcohol), and an oatmeal lace cookie which was very crunchy and delicious. All in all, a very solid spot, and sure to be popular for the cold winter months ahead!

39.description: Steak ale pie is really good. Fish and chips is good too. The truffle cake is amazing. Definitely coming back.

37.description: Pleasantly surprised! It doesn't look like much on the outside. I went here for lunch with my mother & sister. We almost didn't go in. Glad we did because food was great! We had the steak & ale pie, mushroom & kale pie, mash & gravy, and deluxe gravy chips. The gravy was REALLY good & had a little bite. The steak was super tender. We even got a couple desserts to go. Loved the cookie! Would come again to try the fish & chips. Oh, and the house made sodas were yummy too.

0.description: This place transported me. Their pies are better than most you will find in the UK (I lived there for eight years so have had my share of the real thing)I went here with my husband and we ordered two pies and the chips with gravy with sides of their chutney. This meal satisfied my entire being! Culinary perfection in the form of neatly packed pies and sides, and they've got proper ginger beer to boot! Homesick Brits have found their food Mecca in Pleasant House and should make regular pilgrimages. Anyone who wants to taste what real British food tastes like can save a few quid on flights and just pop over to this little gaff.

38.description: Hidden gem in Bridgeport! Pros: Gourmet style pies! Flaky crust and hearty filling!Cons: N/AFinal Verdict: Highly recommend !!Try Steak and Ale pie with mash and gravy.

51.description: Amazing, amazing meat pies. Definitely the best in America, and possibly the best in the world - though I haven't yet done extensive research in the UK. BRB on that.My boyfriend and I shared buttered peas and a Scotch egg - the yolk of which was a little runny (how do they DO that?!) and magical. We each got a steak and ale pie. Word to the wise: they look small, but you could have rolled me out of there after I ate one. The pies are, needless to say, delicious. The crust is buttery and flaky and cooked to where you'd almost think it was overdone but the crispy-ness is perfect. Only thing that wasn't stellar was that I think the AC was out (in August) and I think they had the back doors open because of it - aka there were more than enough flies tryin' to help themselves to my meal. But they're still worth 5 stars to me!

27.description: Unique!  Helpful staff!  Interesting part of the city with its own rich history.  We have had two of the pot pies, and both were fantastic.   Make sure to add the chutney sauce to the suggested pies.

32.description: My husband had been station in the UK duration his time in the service. Typically his dining out experiences were in small local English country towns eating these same meat pies. But, he wasn't happy because that's where the similarities ended. The crust was more doughy at Pleasant House than flaky as he remembered and the English pies where seasoned better. Go figure. Dining area is very spartan but worth trying once. You may like it, we weren't overwhelmed.

54.description: Being English and struggling to find good home style food. It was really nice to find this place. Great music, excellent food and just general great vibe. I had the fish and chips which were excellent and my husband had the steak pasty which he also said was amazing. Thanks for bringing some home comforts to this English woman.

48.description: The food here is so great. My favorite is the mushroom and kale pie, but the steak and ale is delicious too. On Fridays they have some of the best fish and chips ever. If you like fried fish you absolutely have to try it. The home made fizz drinks are very good too. It's a small place that doesn't necessarily look impressive, but I don't think it needs to, it has a cute atmosphere. The servers have always been very friendly too. It is quite expensive, but I don't think the prices are unreasonable.

44.description: Heard a lot about this place from friends.  So I was excited to try.  I think it's ok. The mushroom and kale pie is the better one.  The premium steak is not good.  It was way over peppered. I couldn't taste anything but pepper. And it was super dry.  The mint peas were different,  my husband liked it.  Overall,  this brunch was ok at best.

24.description: After my tenth time or so, it's always great. Art and Chelsea are outstanding proprietors in our community. Try their specials, don't underestimate the mushroom and kale.

7.description: Quick. easy. fresh. Quiet. I got the chicken Balti pie with a side of mashed potatoes and gravy, to say that this is the best and most fresh food I've put in my mouth in a while, would be an understatement. Two thumbs up from this foodie!

49.description: I'm terribly sad to give this place only ONE star because the food is PHENOMENAL!!!!!! On that note I'll give you two VALID reasons why they got one star. #1 We sat in the back on the patio and 12 of us saw a RAT run into the establishment and back out TWICE!!!!  Now you are on an alley in Bridgeport you can't expect miracles but they must do something about that if they're running about with twelve people talking on a patio!  While this place is certainly not posh by any means I can deal with that.  I CANNOT deal with rodents OR RUDE SERVICE which brings me to   #2 We had twelve people eating there which was well over a few hundred dollars. We all had our plates and I went back into the restaurant and said to the register girl, who had about 4 people in line,  we're missing a gravy.  She said you'll have to wait a sec. and then she proceeded to go outside with drinks. Came back in and continued to take more orders at the counter.  She clearly saw me standing there so why not say I'll bring the gravy out or SAY ANYTHING! I'm NOT going to stand there and wait for you to take all of your orders while my our dish is getting cold waiting for something you forgot!  So I just said screw it.  This is ridiculous.  I left. She came back out running past our table of twelve and never said a word like do you guys have everything, how is everything.  IF YOU WANT THE SERVICE OF A HOT DOG STAND that's what you get! AND THE SADDEST PART OF ALL IS THAT THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!  TAKE IT OUT.  THAT'S MY RECOMMENDATION IF THEY'RE NOT CLOSED DOWN BECAUSE I CALLED TO REPORT THE RAT WE SAW :(

40.description: It's all about those amazing savory pies at this tiny gem. My husband and I drove out here on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch and completely understand why this place gets such awesome reviews. We ordered a steak and ale pie, chicken balti pie with coriander chutney(of course!), mash, gravy, and peas. And don't let me forget the delicious ginger soda. It's a small space but it was easy to find a spot to sit and eat. The pies arrived steaming hot. I cut into mine with a knife, my husband went right into the top with his fork. There was plenty of flavorful filling in each. The crust was the most impressive. It was buttery and stayed crunchy. When we scraped the last little bit off our plates, we were full. We'll have to go back for more pies and a scotch egg next time!

53.description: i just came in for a pick up, Guy was friendly , he noticed my t shirt, order fish chips, pasty , chicken balti pie, 2 orders of gravy, food was great although i did not get my gravy, even though i asked him to check, and the balti pie was not a balti pie but was a veggie tomato pie?could not go back, i had travelled from the nside, love this place but..

30.description: Buttery, flaky, and delicious. Pleasant house bakery is everything. Before you go for a pot pie, I want you to erase from your memory the slimy chicken and vegetables of frozen pot pies in your past. Pleasant house gets it just right with an assortment of well seasoned ingredients, a delicious sauce, and a crispy flaky crust.  As an added bonus, get the "chips" which are jumbo crispy home fries, also well seasoned.  The combo will set you back about $9. They also have delicious looking croissants, and sweet rolls which I plan to try someday soon. They also have iced teas which sounded delicious. If you plan to dine in, don't come with a large group; sealing is very limited. The service is fast, so before you know it you'll have some oven fresh deliciousness in front of you.

46.description: Chicken Balti is wonderful.. Love the Fish & Chips on Friday but you better get there early because they'll be lined up out the door.

1.description: I really hate having to leave negative reviews for local places. But this is a place I've been to MANY times, and although the food never disappoints, the service often does. My brother and his girlfriend came to visit today, so naturally I try to take them to the local neighborhood spots to show them the charm that Bridgeport has. We walk in, we say hello, rude tattooed/pierced man doesn't respond.(nothing against his appearance, that's just the only description I have of him) My brother's girlfriend asked him what was in the salad, he answered "it's in the case you can just look at it"...I'm sorry but as her and I both work in customer service, that is NOT how you answer. So based off what she was able to see, she just assumed she'd like all the ingredients in it.We went to sit down and each and every table was filthy. All were crumb filled and stained. We cleaned one off ourselves and sat down. When her salad came, she was disappointed that he didn't just tell her what was in it, as she doesn't like blue cheese.Concept of the matter is that just because you have fantastic food and great business because of it, doesn't mean you can let customer service and appearance go completely down the drain, or in the end you'll be losing a lot of customers.

55.description: So I've never stepped foot in Pleasant House Bakery, but I did get to try a steak and ale pie and a chicken curry pie as take-out.Stuff (particularly, especially the crust) is serious business. Pop the bad boy in the oven for a little while, and out comes flaky crust-covered goodness.  The gravy and the chunks of meat seem nicely proportioned to each other and to complement the crust.  One pie might seem small, or even light on stuffing at first, but it ends up being a very hearty and delicious meal that disappears all too fast.A few of these were shared among my family and I will be taking some East coast the next time I visit, they seem that special.  I'm also looking forward to eating some fresh if I make it out to Bridgeport!

9.description: About a 3.5: While in the neighborhood, I was able to stop by the Pleasant House Bakery.  This little family-owned bakery and cafe is located in the Bridgeport neighborhood, offering a British-inspired menu of breads, Royal Pies (award-winning), pastys, desserts, and even daily specials.  I tried the Chicken Balti Pie (a delicious, flaky buttery pastry mini 'pie' filled with all-natural chicken, fresh-ground curry spices, tomato, and Nigella seeds - this had kind of a tomato-based Italian taste to it, and it was just okay; I did love the crust, though!); a Steak and Ale Pie (filled with all-natural beef, ale, carrots, and herbs); an order of the Deluxe Gravy Chips (perfectly-fried, bite-sized steak fries with chunks of skirt steak (tasted like pot roast!), gravy, and aged Cheddar cheese - these were quite addicting, and I could have actually done without the skirt steak; the chips were seasoned perfectly and were oh-so-addicting!); a Scotch Egg (I was actually pretty excited about this, but was the most disappointed with at the end - this was a perfectly boiled egg (yummy yolk!), covered with ground sausage and then coated with bread crumbs to be deep-fried; I did enjoy the crispy exterior, the sausage was just not flavorful and had an off taste to it - I was just not a fan); a mini chocolate stout cake (dark chocolate-like, but it heavily tasted like alcohol to me); and, a crispy laced oat cookie that was just so delicious (thin and crispy).  I'd love to try out their other pies, their daily specials, as well as their homemade sodas the next time.  Service was pretty efficient and friendly, and all the items ordered are heated up for you.  There's some limited seating inside where you can enjoy your treats or take it to go.  There's some free residential parking around the area, so do not fret!+great buttery crust!+Deluxe Gravy Chips+laced oat cookies

26.description: Saw this on 'Check Please', and decided to check it out. The Dude that rang me up was very short with me. Maybe he was having a bad day. I had the Ginger fizz- really good, but no straws, really? Next, the scotch egg- really good too, skip the sea salt drizzled on it. Thank you very much. Then the steak pastry- really salty, and bland at the same time. Not sure how they pulled that off. Other reviewers are right about the flaky crust. It was flaky alright, but also salty. Perhaps I was having a salty day. Overall, solid 3 stars. Bon appetit.

25.description: Cute little bakery located near Comiskey Park. Ordered the Chicken Balti and Steak & Ale royal pies. The crust on the pies are buttery and flaky goodness, and the fillings are tasty as well! Wasn't a big fan of the Scotch egg, I thought the sausage could have used a bit more flavor, but the bite of the breadcrumb crust was delightful, and the egg was cooked to medium perfection. We also got an order of the deluxe gravy chips which came fully loaded with beef tips and cheese - wow, these were amazing! I think the meat was a bit over the top, but we were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed the chips. I got a chocolate stout cake (I thought it was good, but my sister definitely tasted the alcohol), and an oatmeal lace cookie which was very crunchy and delicious. All in all, a very solid spot, and sure to be popular for the cold winter months ahead!

12.description: I came here around 11am on a weekday after dropping my car off to get my oil changed. Don't be fooled by the not so nice exterior of this restaurant! Inside is booming metal music, and a blunt interior, with dark grey walls, and steel chairs.  They have a large selection of sauces to choose from as well, mustard, horseradish, ketchup, cholula, etc. The guy taking our order was friendly, and courteous! It was pretty slow when we walked in, and there was only 2 other people in the restaurant but they left before we even got our food. We ordered a scottish egg, mushroom & kale pie, and the steak & ale pie. Scottish egg $4.50, and the pies were $8 each. The food came out in about 15 minutes,  the scottish egg was perfect! The yolk was melty and the meat was tender and so flavorful as well.  My mushroom kale pie was really a gem, when I pierced the pie the saucy deliciousness just spilled out.  The pie was soo creamy, and the crust was also perfectly flakey and buttery.  The steak & ale pie had delicious chunks of steak and a great tomato-ey flavor. I will definitely come here again, and won't forget to get the mashed potatoes & gravy next time!

59.description: I came here around 11am on a weekday after dropping my car off to get my oil changed. Don't be fooled by the not so nice exterior of this restaurant! Inside is booming metal music, and a blunt interior, with dark grey walls, and steel chairs.  They have a large selection of sauces to choose from as well, mustard, horseradish, ketchup, cholula, etc. The guy taking our order was friendly, and courteous! It was pretty slow when we walked in, and there was only 2 other people in the restaurant but they left before we even got our food. We ordered a scottish egg, mushroom & kale pie, and the steak & ale pie. Scottish egg $4.50, and the pies were $8 each. The food came out in about 15 minutes,  the scottish egg was perfect! The yolk was melty and the meat was tender and so flavorful as well.  My mushroom kale pie was really a gem, when I pierced the pie the saucy deliciousness just spilled out.  The pie was soo creamy, and the crust was also perfectly flakey and buttery.  The steak & ale pie had delicious chunks of steak and a great tomato-ey flavor. I will definitely come here again, and won't forget to get the mashed potatoes & gravy next time!

21.description: 1st time visit for a carry out and it was pure deliciousness even an hour later due to traffic. Was not a fan of that fried sausage egg, but everything else was flavorful.  The steak w potatoes and the mushroom and kale. Will definitely be back when in the area.

17.description: Buttery, flaky, and delicious. Pleasant house bakery is everything. Before you go for a pot pie, I want you to erase from your memory the slimy chicken and vegetables of frozen pot pies in your past. Pleasant house gets it just right with an assortment of well seasoned ingredients, a delicious sauce, and a crispy flaky crust.  As an added bonus, get the "chips" which are jumbo crispy home fries, also well seasoned.  The combo will set you back about $9. They also have delicious looking croissants, and sweet rolls which I plan to try someday soon. They also have iced teas which sounded delicious. If you plan to dine in, don't come with a large group; sealing is very limited. The service is fast, so before you know it you'll have some oven fresh deliciousness in front of you.

10.description: Love this for my meat pie fix. Friendly down to earth place. Would like a bit more meat in the pie that would be my only critique. Chips are  amazing and are little roast potatoes really. A little bit out my of the way for me but worth the ride!

5.description: Honest review: saw this on check please not trusting that show anymore lol the room is really tiny its a byob so bring ur own stuff they do make 2 in house sodas the ginger one was good. Its actually expensive i ordered like 5 things n the bill was 40 dollars. This is a hipster spot for sure only playing techno music i am really gonna avoid hipster places from now on the only things i liked were the chicken balti and the almond cake everything else is not worth it this is the second pie place i been to n it will be my last i am done with pie places it wasnt good n the whole maria thing with this restaurant is confusing no explanation or nothing Chicken balti: omg this was so good!!!!!!!!!! It has curry in it the flavors were out of this world so rich n different the chicken was cooked to perfect the pie dough was so flaky i was just eating the left over pieces the green sauce makes this even better adds a garlicky spicy tone that really enhances the flavor of this pie was the best pie we had Steak ale pie: it was good not great there was more carrots then steak in it jus it had no wow factor i wouldnt go out of my way to eat this wasnt my favorite Deluxe gravy chips: it needed salt n i didnt really like the gravy wasnt as delicous as it was made out to seem on check please theres alot of meat n cheese n fries it just needed salt n they could have made the gravy taste better Chocolate cake: i hate when theres a chocolate dessert n they dont say its dark chocolate its so bitter yuck :( plz say that it is dark chocolate so ik not to order it. Besides being bitter it was extremely dry like if i threw it at a window it would shatter it. also if ur gonna put frosting put alot not just a thin layerAlmond cake: omg this was really good i hate really acidic things but since the almond cake was really sweet the lemony frosting really cuts through the sweetness n the actual cake wasnt as dry but it was still dry though they need to add something to make their cakes moist

3.description: Incredible British pies--perfect winter fare. The crust is baked to perfection and the fillings are savory. The food is satisfying and hits the spot in Chicago's frigid weather. I would eat there every day if I could. The chicken balti pie is my favorite with mashed potatoes--so, so good!

35.description: Honest review: saw this on check please not trusting that show anymore lol the room is really tiny its a byob so bring ur own stuff they do make 2 in house sodas the ginger one was good. Its actually expensive i ordered like 5 things n the bill was 40 dollars. This is a hipster spot for sure only playing techno music i am really gonna avoid hipster places from now on the only things i liked were the chicken balti and the almond cake everything else is not worth it this is the second pie place i been to n it will be my last i am done with pie places it wasnt good n the whole maria thing with this restaurant is confusing no explanation or nothing Chicken balti: omg this was so good!!!!!!!!!! It has curry in it the flavors were out of this world so rich n different the chicken was cooked to perfect the pie dough was so flaky i was just eating the left over pieces the green sauce makes this even better adds a garlicky spicy tone that really enhances the flavor of this pie was the best pie we had Steak ale pie: it was good not great there was more carrots then steak in it jus it had no wow factor i wouldnt go out of my way to eat this wasnt my favorite Deluxe gravy chips: it needed salt n i didnt really like the gravy wasnt as delicous as it was made out to seem on check please theres alot of meat n cheese n fries it just needed salt n they could have made the gravy taste better Chocolate cake: i hate when theres a chocolate dessert n they dont say its dark chocolate its so bitter yuck :( plz say that it is dark chocolate so ik not to order it. Besides being bitter it was extremely dry like if i threw it at a window it would shatter it. also if ur gonna put frosting put alot not just a thin layerAlmond cake: omg this was really good i hate really acidic things but since the almond cake was really sweet the lemony frosting really cuts through the sweetness n the actual cake wasnt as dry but it was still dry though they need to add something to make their cakes moist

19.description: Some places are just hype and Pleasant House is one of them. I walked in for a quick bite after work/school with kids in tow... asked for coffee along with my meal and  was told they dont serve coffee in the evening however  I can walk across to Bridgeport Coffee and get one if I wanted. SERIOUSLY? ?? its ok to say they dont serve but to expect me to go across and grab one isnt a good idea especially since i had kids with me. Anyways the food, I couldn't attempt to take more than 3 bites of the chicken pie, nibbled a bit on the crust which had a butter taste(only plus).  The kids shared the chicken burger, which seemed ok and a ginger ale which was freshly made.Me staying away from this place.

28.description: Delicious! Saw this place on Check Please and everyone loved it, which never happens.  Thought we would check it out.  The mushroom and kale pie is the bomb.

45.description: I've been here since they first moved into the area and were trying to fix up the place that had been a former hot dog joint, but I had moved out of the area and only drop by once a year. I hadn't known they had a patio, so I enjoyed sitting outside for my late dinner. I had the bacon mac and cheese pie with the peas. I had eaten their fish and chips and tried all of their normal royal pies. It was pretty good. Inside with the macoroni and cheese were bits of tomato. The bacon was baked on top of the crust. Reviewers had mentioned that the pies are only half-filled. Which is true as can be seen in the picture I have, and is more discernible without a runny sauce in the way. The peas were cooked quite well without being raw or squishy. I also ordered their chocolate stout cake; the stout comes from those local brewery. The chocolate cake was so decadent, rich, moist, it was hard to eat down. The top coat of chocolate syrup was even smoother! It was honestly too much for me, and made me reevaluate labeling myself as a chocolate lover. Apparently I do have limits. I wasn't able to wash down the cheesy pie with water, so I ordered a ginger soda. It was most helpful with the stout cake. I like to come back to see how they continue to improve and update. I'm glad they are busier lately, which is a step up from it's early days.
