The Halloween roll was sooooo sweet. The other roll, Chicago Fire, was good and spicy but still had sweetness. There presentation is nice but ease just in the sauces on the plate. Perhaps that is what over did the sweetness but I couldn't pin point what it was.It was completely empty and parking right on Halsted was easy.

55.description: What a charming little place with gracious service, a pleasant atmosphere, and delicious food. Who'd have thought such a place existed in Bridgeport, a place better known for eating establishments like Ricobene's and Fabulous Freddie's?I dined here with a friend and we shared gyoza (ohm nom nom), yellow tail jalapeño (spicy goodness), and chicken yaki udon (noodles from heaven). We also were fortunate enough to be here during maki lunch special hours. Two rolls for $10!Everything was fresh and tasty! The timing of the food was spot on, and the waitstaff was friendly and offered great suggestions.  I will definitely be back if I'm in the area and am looking for good quality sushi, great service, and an environment that is relaxed and pleasant. All in all, a very good experience.

9.description: So glad I found an affordable sushi place that isn't in the north side. This place is small but the two times I've come at night it is not packed with people and I've gotten seated right away. The place is BYOB which is a plus since I did come to celebrate a friends birthday. Because they have a lunch special and the sushi is affordable and good  I'll be coming here more often!

26.description: Oh yes, how happy I am that this treasure is not far from where I live. I came here for my 22nd birthday this past Wednesday with 5 of my friends. We ordered 7 rolls and no appetizers but were given fried shrimp drizzled in two types of sauces which were delicious and complimentary with edamame as well. One of the sauces was sweet and the other was spicy. The rolls were made to perfection and quickly since we were the only table there. Then, service started to pick up as the restaurant filled. Customer service was great and the best part was that there was no corking fee. Mind you, we had about 3-4 bottles of wine that night. It was a great time and I'll definitely be back. Thanks Kawa Sushi!

25.description: This is one of those good news/bad news places. Since I'm a little bit of an ass, we'll start with the negative.The sushi is not very good. It's what I consider sushi buffet quality. There is nothing inherently wrong with that; there are days when I want to just pig out and have some all-you-can-eat sushi, but when you're ordering rolls by the roll (and paying for them by the roll), it really does not make a satisfied customer of me. If you'd like me to nitpick further, well here goes: the fish didn't seem all that fresh, the rice was cooked all that well, and the rolls themselves were quite small. I ordered a staple of any sushi place: the salmon skin roll, and I was very disappointed. Usually, the fried salmon skin provides a nice crunchy contrast to the bed of fluffy rice around it; here, the salmon meat was not filleted off of the skin enough and so you ended up with a somewhat awkward bite. Crunchy, yes, but also quite tough to chew through. Color me disappointed. Another negative was the special dessert offered on Valentine's Day. Though given to us for free, it really wasn't very good. Matcha frosting and filling on a yellow-cake cupcake? No, that's okay, but thank you anyway.And now on to the good news:Tonkotsu Ramen. 'Nuff said. Delectable pieces of marinated pork belly swimming in a pork broth with handmade ramen. Fantastic! Truly the star of yesterday's meal. Friends and all raved on and on about that fantastic bowl of noodles. If I were running Kawa, I'd make the ramen the star of the show; hey! it's popular now, anyway. But that's just me, and my four friends, and an acquaintance who recommended your restaurant to us. Also, Olivia. Great job, lady. You're a great server, and truly a valuable asset to the Kawa team. Well, that's that. Go for the ramen, eat sushi if you want to, skip dessert. Once again: TONKOTSU RAMEN. That is all.

12.description: The food is amazing. Truly fast service and the server was really friendly! Definitely will come back!

59.description: Awesome place. Love their spicy combo. My husband is picky but he loves this place. Yaki udon is of the Anazing!!!

21.description: Great food and great service.

17.description: I have lived in Bridgeport now for over 2 years, but when I moved here, one of my first concerns was: where am I going to get my sushi from now??? South Kawa; you have been a dream. I have tried almost all of their sushi rolls and I absolutely love them! I order delivery and for take out, mainly delivery,  and they almost always arrive within 30 min of my order and never once has my order been incorrect (I order about once a week). When I come in to pick up food, they are always friendly and kind and seem speedy in trying to get me my order so I can go home and enjoy my delicious sushi!! Some of my favorites include: Spicy Tuna, Halloween roll, Cherry Blossom roll, Sweet 16 roll, Sexy Mama roll, Sandwich roll, Mexican roll, Dynamite roll, Spicy Crab Cucumber roll, and Boston roll. The veggie tempura is also delicious, you get quite a few pieces for only $5 bucks. This is my favorite place to order from and I'm so glad my neighborhood sushi joint is this amazing; thanks South Kawa!! .... now I'm off to review the menu for the 200th time to order something new!!! Happy sushi eating!!! :)

10.description: Oh yes, how happy I am that this treasure is not far from where I live. I came here for my 22nd birthday this past Wednesday with 5 of my friends. We ordered 7 rolls and no appetizers but were given fried shrimp drizzled in two types of sauces which were delicious and complimentary with edamame as well. One of the sauces was sweet and the other was spicy. The rolls were made to perfection and quickly since we were the only table there. Then, service started to pick up as the restaurant filled. Customer service was great and the best part was that there was no corking fee. Mind you, we had about 3-4 bottles of wine that night. It was a great time and I'll definitely be back. Thanks Kawa Sushi!

5.description: Went here for dinner on a Friday night with my friends I was in the mood for some noodles. Pros: -We were promptly greeted and seated right away. There was no wait and it was around 8pm-Staff was friendly and courteous-Local neighborhood restaurant-You can bring your own bottle of wine, and they will uncork it...for a small fee of course  -Food came out quickly and it was piping hotCons:-Our server when asked questions about what vegetables were in the Udon Stir Fried noodles seemed a little confused-When I asked her how they tasted, she responded "They smell really good." Side eye . She then went on to tell me that, she would have to purchase herself so she just makes her own.-They bought out one entree for our two person party. The other one had to wait another 3-5 mins for the other entree to comeWe ordered Gyoza, Spicy Tuna Roll, Beef Ramen, and Chicken Udon Stir Fry.For the cost (which is very reasonable) you get a nice portion, quick service, and hot food. Just don't go here thinking you will be WOW'd or anything.

3.description: Amazing service & even better food! Miso soup was fresh and so yummy and the fried jalapeños are HOT but definitely worth the burn! We ordered the dynamite, Chicago, America eagle, Mexican special rolls! They were absolutely DEEEEEELICIOUS! Hidden little spot and great sushi! :)

35.description: I think it's a great addition to Halsted Street.. The Sushi was good and the portions were large.  We tried a few of their specialty rolls and they were delicious.  The service was fast and friendly.  I would recommend if you are in the area.  There is street parking.

19.description: I was going to order Ramen, but they only have fried soba today. So we ordered shrimp fried soba and beef soba. Beef was just ok.The IIT roll is worth trying....Best thing here is the red bean mochi ice cream!!!! Try it!

28.description: It has good lunch specials. You can get two sushi rolls 9 dollars or three sushi rolls for 12 dollar. Every lunch special order comes with miso soup. It's pretty filling. The sushi rolls for mixing and matching are plentiful. My favorite is the crunchy crab. Lunch takes forever though. If order online, good luck. If you order at restaurant, good luck. There have times when there are only two couples in the restaurant, and it still takes a while for the food to come. They are slow either way. I've tried ordering for dinner and they are faster in the nighttime than in the afternoon.

45.description: I tried sushi for the first time and I was quite impressed. The salad and the sushi was very fresh. I will be taking my next date here.

33.description: This is my second time going here and my husband first time. The restaurant is not to big but a nice size to dine in. The restaurant had great service and the food was delicious and fresh. We had the rock shrimp tempura with the spicy aioli sauce and the sushi/sashimi deluxe combo. It is located in the heart of the Brideport neighborhood. One thing about sushi is you never find it much on the south side since it's usually downtown or up north. I would come back to this place since it's not that far from where I live at. I would recommend this place to others.

43.description: Have been coming here since they opened, and everyone is super nice! Sushi is delightful and you can bring your own wine. Such a plus!!!

2.description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Chicago. Last winter there was a -20 night windchill, with tons of ice on the sidewalks, but I was craving Kawa so I walked the mile from the red line stop. It was worth it. Every bite is always worth it.Kawa's aesthetic is nice, simple, and relaxing. The Asian influences in decor do a great job of fitting the Japanese menu without transporting you to the tackiest corner of China town like so many other places do. The staff is always wonderfully courteous and are more than happy to share recommendations.Their specialty rolls are wonderful, especially the Fallen Angel roll. Around Valentine's Day they have a special Cupid roll and it's also awesome.

18.description: We went to this place because we had a group on. And wow! It is TASTYYY and affordable. When we walked in yesterday we ordered almos immediately and seriously, the waitress must of sent the over via brain WAVES because the 4 rolls were out in like 2 minutes. Dissss mak meeeee very happpiiiii. Here's the order people! Prepare yourself:// rock shrimp tempura - $6 - tempura fried shrimpys that have a great spicy sauce on top. And get this.. 6$ gets you 10 MOTHER FLIPPIN' pieces! Ha so basically. It's pretty filling. // spider roll - $9 - yummmmm i love spider rolls. Pretty standard but well made. And great! I think this one has soft shell crab in it and was huge! // shrimp tempura - $6 - pretty large roll and the shrimp was made very nicely. // UIC roll - $12 - WOO WOO REPRESENT SON' UIC ALL THE WAY. Actually in all honestly this roll was delicious. It was topped with white tuna/fish (can't remember) and a little tempura crumbs. With a bit of spicy sauce on top. So good. The fish was so fresh and would just melt in your mouth. Definitely get this one. // salmon avocado - $6 - standard roll. We always get it because the fish is so good. I forgot home many pieces come with each roll but they include it on the menu. Another reason I love it. You don't have to ask your waiter/waitress how many blah blah blah. You get it. Right? Oh and did I mention.. It is BYOB?! DOUBLE WIN! So yeah, if you are in the south side area I would definitely checkOut this place. They also have group ons once in a while. Alsoooo free edamame if you check in on YELP! Which I know you all will ;-) SYOY5 stars because pretty cheap, fast, delicious, and great service.

41.description: Sushi is decent, BYOB and it's also close to my home. My go to spot when I don't want to drive to any other neighborhood!

52.description: Our waitress Colleen is pretty awesome. Came here with my brother and she was really nice and attentive. The food was decent and the prices were okay. A tad pricey for lunch but it was fun. The green tea was a little cold when it was served, but I drank it anyway. The chirashi is different since it's not in a bowl but in a fancy platter with a ball of rice on the side.

50.description: Apologies for not updating since my last review!I came in here last spring around April 2013 with a girlfriend to indulge on mercury. Yay salmon and delicious fishes! This place definitely changed since my previous review. It is no longer a sushi buffet that it once was. However, they went onto bento boxes and lunch specials along with the Japanese basics. Streer clear if you were expecting the high end awabi.The prices are average and portions are good. Definitely try this sushi joint since it also comes with a romantic ambience. I had to say, I came in several more times prior to April and the chef had an oopsie with the miso soup. They  mistaken vinegar for the seasoning. Lol. The waiter and host was very apologetic and did not hesitate to replace when a fresh pot was made. Awesome service and smiles can be found in here.

4.description: I've past thru South Kawa many times and finally decided to dine-in to try their rolls. I ordered a couple of rolls that surprisingly were actually very good (Halloween and Seventeen). The restaurant for that day was pretty packed but the service did not fault and was prompt. TIP: If you pay cash, you get a 10% discount.

6.description: South Kawa is my FAVORITE sushi place. The food and prices are great and for the south side they are most definitely above par.We try new rolls every time and they never disappoint.The jalapeño poppers are an awesome spin on the traditional kind and the shrimp tempura is crunchy, light and delicious.We love this place so much that we always forget that there's coupons we could use.South Kawa is a must try!

22.description: The food is good. The service is pretty inconsistent. Don't bother giving them the free edamame coupon they put on here if you are not dining in. Petty. Last time I ordered take out, they honored it. Not this time.

15.description: I live in Bridgeport and just found out about this place not long ago.  Too bad it wasn't sooner.  Pretty much everything I have ordered there has been great, the serves too. People that I have taken there with me has also enjoyed their food.

57.description: The sushi is okay. The rice is kinda tasteless. They should work on that but the qualityand quantity, along with price is ok. Although I would probably only go there if I had a groupon deal otherwise, I prefer better.

20.description: I usually LOVE this place and it's our favorite date night spot, but we visited last night and things really seemed to have changed for the worst. The food was still good--I want to make that clear. The service, on the other hand, left a LOT to be desired. The usual waitress (Olivia) wasn't there, and while we ordered 4-5 separate menu items from the waitress taking our order, two of them just never came out. Additionally, we sat for 10 minutes without anyone approaching the table (it's a really tiny place) and even after the sushi was served, we were still missing plates and silverware. At the end of the meal, we were the last table in the place, and it took us forever to flag down the waitress for our bill. I love the sushi, and I love the place--especially the proximity to where we live--but they definitely need to improve upon the service.

36.description: Food that i ordered tasted pretty good. Miso soup, spicy scallop HR were good. Shrimp tem roll was bit bland and salmon was not really fresh. I'd give 4 stars overall about the restaurant and customer service (a waitress called to clarify something) but delivery guy asked me to go outside to pick up my order. If i needed to go outside i would do a take-out or pick-up, instead of delivery which in this case wants me to go outside to get it.

14.description: Excellent low key sushi place with amazing prices and artistic menu. If your looking for great sushi without the horse and pony show (aka jacked up prices) come here and support a Bridgeport spot. The menu has great fish and unique rolls with something for everyone (yakatori, udon, teriyaki). The fish is fresh and the white tuna melts in your mouth (like it is suppose too).

12.description: BOO!I called this place at 4:00 on saturday to make sure they had what I needed. They did, and said they were closing at 5:00. When I showed up at 4:40 they were closed.I hate liars - liars suck!

7.description: Great  store to stop in and  ..... let's be real why give Home Depot your money when you can support a small local business:)!  The owner was very cool and friendly, even staying open a few minutes late when I called ahead to see if I could get a key made.  They have a great knowledge of bicycles and sell a nice bunch at reasonable prices, not to mention the nice folks:)). Check it out!

3.description: The owner/ex-cop was not on-time and still thought he's a cop. highly recommend that they should make a poster outside, saying ex-cop inside and it's your fault that they are not on-time.Eek!!!ridiculous experience there.

1.description: Recently I had a leak problem in the basement and my contractor needed some plumbing parts.  On our way to the local Home Depot, we drove by this little hardware store, and for a moment I thought "Instead of going to the big box store, why don't we save some time and stop by to support a local small business?"  Thought that was the right thing to do, and boy was that a mistake!!!My contractor went in to buy the plumbing parts (less than $20) while I waited in the car.  Later we returned to my basement where he figured out a different way to repair the leak, so we ended up not using anything he had bought from Windy City Hardware.  Before leaving, my contractor left me with all the parts and the receipt so I can return them.  I went back to Windy City Hardware that afternoon to try to return the purchase, but as soon as I explained my intention, the shop owner, a middle aged man, told me that he would not process the return and that I should instead return the next day when his wife would be around to handle the refund.  Apparently his wife had been the one to sell the stuff to my contractor that morning, and according to him, his wife liked to give discount to customers so only she would know how much we REALLY PAID for the merchandise.  I pointed out repeatedly that I had the receipt showing the dollar amount, and he said that the receipt MEANT NOTHING TO HIM!!!   If this is not bad enough, it gets worse.  I  told him my contractor was from out of town and a first time customer, so there was no reason for his wife to give him any discount, and he said he wouldn't believe what I said.  Then I asked him to call his wife to verify how much we had paid for the merchandise if he had any doubt, and he said his wife was with her parents and he WOULD NOT CALL to bother her.  Then he went on to BLAME ME for NOT BOTHERING to make another trip to return the stuff despite I'd told him I had to work the next day. As you can imagine, the conversation was increasingly frustrating and aggravating, and when I finally let out a "WOW" at the ridiculousness of the situation, he said that was nothing to wow about, and "WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO ABOUT IT?"  At that, I finally left with the merchandise.Someone here pointed out that he was a former cop, so THAT EXPLAINS A LOT.  Turning your customers away despite they have the receipt solely because of some remotely possible "discount" which, if existed at all, should have been reflected on the receipt anyway, and then refusing to do anything to verify the existence of the said discount, and then rudely shifting the blame to the customers for not wanting to waste time on another trip, and then callously and arrogantly saying "WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO ABOUT IT?" is pure bad business.I am all for people spending a little more to support neighborhood mom and pop stores, but if this is the kind of "customer service" they offer, then I don't see the point.  If you are thinking about giving them your business, consider yourself warned.

2.description: I purchased a bike and had Jerry put it together.   He did a great job and at a reasonable price.  Returned to get a tune up on my bike.  Jerry and his wife are very friendly  and knowledgeable. I will definitely be going back!

9.description: After leaving my bike outside for about 4 months during the brunt of Winter, it was in pretty bad shape. I stopped by Windy City Hardware to get a tune-up and possibly replacement parts. The owner, Jerry, was both personable and knowledgeable. He provided a fair quote and after a few days, I came back and was pleased to see my bike fully functional again.  I highly recommend others to support this little neighborhood store.

18.description: I went in yesterday wanting to buy a cheap bike just to cruise around lake shore. I left 30 minutes later with a good lock, and cute  pink bike without spending a lot of money. Jerry, the store owners husband, was GREAT! He was funny, helpful, friendly and knew what he was doing. There was a slight problem after i bought the bike and wanted him to check it out. I brought it back and he fixed it the very same day! I will for sure come back here for any bike issues. It was fantastic experience! Must check it out!

10.description: I called Windy City a couple days after the blizzard last week to find out if they had any snow shovels in stock so I could dig my car out. The owner (the wife) gave me the prices of their shovels. I asked what time they closed & she told me 5. It was already around 4:30 & she asked how far away I was. I was still at work downtown so there was no way I could have made it there on time but I could tell that she was prepared to stay open late to wait for me. She gave the phone to her husband who asked when I'd be close and then he gave me his cellphone number and told me to call him when I was there and he would just meet me there and reopen the store. A couple hours later I met him (I believe his name is Jerry) in front of the store and he showed me what they had and gave me his recommendations. After taking his suggestion on which shovel to buy he gave me a deal on a one that had a little rust on it from a flood they'd had. The shovel worked the same rust or no rust and we both knew this. We chatted for a little while longer. We talked about each of our backgrounds and he gave me some advice on life. Then he had to get back to dinner with his wife across the street and I had a date with snow. It was by far the best experience I've had in a hardware store and as long as I live close to Bridgeport, they'll get my business. Thanks guys!

13.description: Not kidding. I live over a hardware store but I shop at Windy City which is 4 blocks away. FANTASTIC for bike gear and repair and good for everything else. Yes it's a mom and pop so sometimes maybe a product is out of stock or maybe a repair takes an extra day but they ALWAYS make up for it in price and niceness.

16.description: This place is great! Me and a couple buddies were riding our bikes all day on a saturday. My friends tire went flat and we were on Halsted so we decided to stop in Windy City Hardware. Met the owners husband Jerry, he did a fantastic job helping us. Talked a little while about his past and was very friendly to all of us. Replaced the tire and inner tube for a great deal! Then sent us up the street for a new rim. Had a great experience! Jerry and his wife are great people, loved the business!

17.description: The man who helped my family and me is a retired police officer who's wife had run the store for years until he retired.  We walked right in (as it was about to close) and have never felt so welcomed in a hardware store!  I wish I had gotten his name, but he is so genuine, and helpful!  Everyone is the store knows what they are talking about in terms of products, and what you need for a certain kind of job.  Like I said, he's very friendly and knowledgeable, and even has stellar bike service/repair for a good price.  This is one of the last mom and pop stores in the area and I will for sure be back to help keep them here!

15.description: This business is fantastic. Local and personal--they took great care of me. Now it's my favorite hardware store and bike repair shop!

0.description: I've been going here for a while. I love that Jerry acts like one of my old school uncles. Him and his boys sitting around the shop just shooting the breeze all day; it makes you think of some Archer Bunker Era TV show.I went in last year looking for a bike and instead of letting me pick, Jerry asked me how I use my bike based on that he pointed me to a '60s cruiser. I was a bit surprised but then he broke down why which gave me confidence in his suggestion. My previous bike had modern handle bars and I ride a lot. I would get tension headaches a lot too. With the bike Jerry sold me, they stopped. I've gone back several times for repairs, upgrades and such and he's really about customer service. He remembers everybody but has no clue what your name is. One big thing to remember is time is relative to Jerry. He opens when he feels like it, closes when he feels like it, and finishes when he feels like it. So just like with my uncles, I've learned to call him when he says he'll call, budget in extra time that he'll have my bike and call before I go to make sure he's there. The plus side of this is I've called that I can't make it by closing time and he's stayed late for me to pick up or drop off whatever.

5.description: I heard many people recommend this place to me, so I thought I'd give it a try. My bike was recently stolen, I wasn't too eager to spend money on a new one, and could barely afford one. I explained my situation to the owners, telling them that I only had $150 to spend. I wanted a women's road bike and a U-lock. Jerry (one of the owners) told me that he had the perfect bike in mind. It was a 1960's Schwinn road bike that used to belong to his wife. He and his wife took it out and showed me. Jerry noticed that it only had one brake and said he would put one on if I decided to purchase it. I was sold.Initially, they said that they could give me the bike alone for $175 instead of $190. Then they decided $200 for the bike and lock. It was a bit high so I asked for $185, we met at $190. I was able to get the bike and U-lock for $190 (a bit over my budget, but I still think it was a deal). After, they asked me how my bike was stolen and we had a conversation. They also gave me some advice on how to keep this bike safe, so I won't have to deal with another loss. The two owners are extremely friendly and caring. I would definitely go back.

11.description: Take your average Ace Hardware store and squish it down into a mom-and-pop tiny hole-in-the-wall store and that's Windy City Hardware.  They've got a rather decent selection of hardware stuff that's not available in many locations around Bridgeport without having to travel very far.The prices may not be that competitive with big chain hardware stores, but when I need a random tool or item for a home improvement project and time is of the essence, this place has had what I've needed.  The guy who runs it (I think - he's just been there every time I've been there) is also pretty helpful too and will help you navigate the cramped store (or just retrieve it for you).

8.description: My bike brakes were dead and i needed to replace them. I went around between this store and Blue Cycle a few blocks north. This shop had the best prices for the parts  (~$7) and tools i needed. They also had the best service!The owner of the store offered to teach me how to install the breaks myself so i don't have to pay for them to do it for me. and since i am a handy kind of guy i agreed and decided to do it on the spot with him guiding me.Really nice and really personal service! Considerably cheaper than Blue Cycle!

4.description: Just moved to the neighborhood and needed help with the hardware that came with the flower boxes we bought.  They didn't fit onto our railings.  Boy did Jerry hook us up!  He cut the metal for us in the store even though all we bought from him was a utility knife.  Small business owners like this one are one of the things that make this community so great.  So he closes a little early sometimes.  Who cares?  It's one of the only perks of owning a small business, and trust me, he's worth the wait.

14.description: This place is fantastic! Great prices and great service. It's such a great mom-and-pop shop in Bridgeport. I wouldn't go anywhere else! I came here last year for my bike, got a great deal and just went back for him to tune it up. Honestly, if you go somewhere else you will pay higher prices and you wont find the hospitality you get here. Have recommended all my friends to go here and they loved it!

6.description: This place is great for both hardware (for a small place they really have a lot of items that are well priced) and also bike sales/repair.Jerry took a look at my girlfriend's bike she purchased on craigslist and gave us a great deal on a tune-up and brake lever replacement. In all honesty though take a look at his bikes in the window too...because they are priced well for having Jerry tune them up prior.We even came in to pick it up earlier than expected and Jerry was kind enough to offer for us to bring it back in again for last minute touch ups. Mechanically, though, he did a fantastic job-- definitely knows what he's doing.He even took time to show us the workings of the bike (as we aren't too familiar to road bikes). He also gave us some tips on general care amongst friendly chit-chat...and some steel wool to take with us.  Thanks Jerry.

3.description: If you get a chance, you MUST visit Eleven Eleven Jewelry!!! It is so fascinating! The beads are spectacular and the jewelry is fantastic! You can see tremendous craftsmanship in every piece made by Dobrila Pintar! She is so ridiculously talanted! Most importantly, Dobrila is an honestly lovely person, of the rare ones - with a big heart!  You can see her enthusiasm and dedication in the way she works and treats her customers!!! Eleven Eleven Jewelry is a MUST SEE, MUST DO kind of place!!!

1.description: Dobrila Pintar is a great teacher and fun to be around. Take one of her classes and you will see just how cool she is. Her work is beautiful and she is extremely talented. I took her glass bead making class and loved it! I would definitely recommend this class to anyone, beginner or advanced. She is a great person and you will definitely go home with something cool that you have made.

2.description: A great friend bought us a Groupon to take Dobrila's metal charm making class. My friend made all the arrangements but I know she was super flexible and helpful. Her cozy studio is really cool, has jewelry on display that you can purchase and she even offered us a glass of wine! You'll want to call her when you get to the Bridgeport Art Center because it's a little confusing finding her space but the art center is awesome and you get a sneak peek at the artwork on display. We both made 6+ charms and I even made 2 key chains and will give some as gifts. I highly recommend checking it out. It was fun, easy and Dobrila is a great, sweet teacher!

0.description: My friend and I had such a wonderful time at Eleven Eleven! Her space is in a unique art gallery. We learned how to make necklaces, they turned out wonderful and she was a great teacher! not to mention it was BYOB :) would highly recommend and will be back again soon!

3.description: My favorites are Hanza's Bread and Health bread. Health bread is amazing, I like it better than Ukrainian bread I grew up eating. Several supermarkets in Michigan sell Bruno's

1.description: This is a hidden place you'd never know of unless you live in the neighbourhood.And I did years ago. If you're looking for dense dark bread this is your place. I've forgotten all about and I am so glad they're still there. This type of bread is hard to find. I wish it was closer to me now. I will go back when I'm the area.

2.description: Best bread: Bread worth eating.I buy the Hunza bread when visiting my daughter in Chicago at Gene's in Lincoln Square.  It is sold as far east as Barney's in New Buffalo so when I am in either area, I pick up a few loaves for the freezer. It is so flavorful and has no additives.  Wish I could buy it somewhere in southeast Michigan.  Will look into having it shipped.

9.description: This place rocks. I usually don't get all mushy over Polish rye bread, but this place has the best I've ever eaten. My mom is 100% Polish, so rye bread has always been in my diet. But seriously, until my husband wandered in there a few months back and bought me a loaf, I didn't realize it could be so soft and delicious. It was like it was a completely different bread type. I ate four slices one after,  I just couldn't stop. They also make a fantastic no sugar no salt whole wheat bread. My only complaint is they open after I go to work and close before I get home, which leaves me constantly jonesing for their bread.  Now I'm drooling, hope hubbie gets home before they close tomorrow or find out where these mysterious places around town they sell it.

10.description: They make good bread. Bread is ALL they sell. There are four or five types of rye. The shop has clearly been a going concern for years and years and years, a neighborhood holdout. Let's hope it continues to survive.

4.description: Rye's of all kinds, sour, Polish and so on. They also have wheat and a couple varieties of a health bread, one is so dense they warn you that it's hard to cut, and they don't offer it cut either.Good stuff! Easy street parking.

6.description: Great rye bread. Unfortunately they were suffering from a power outage the day I stopped in, but still ... great rye bread. Oh yes, and they carry Filbert's Soda too.

12.description: This place is what makes Chicago famous for those special ethnic foods.  The Polish Rye bread is fantastic.  The owner of the is bakery is great to deal with.  She will ship this bread to basically anywhere you want to send it.  We have sent this bread to relatives who have moved out of state.  Its hard getting bread like this, in other parts of the country.  Bruno's is one of those business that makes Chicago special.

5.description: I'm originally from Finland so whenever I went back to visit family I would return with a suitcase full of rye bread. After discovering Brunos in Milwaukee I no longer have to explain myself at the customs:) I now live all around US so whenever friends come and visit they have to bring a loaf along. Love all their brands but health bread is my favorite!

13.description: I really like Bruno's Rye.  It's really hearty and you can see the uncut rye kernels in the bread.  A favorite, for sure.  You can buy their bread around town, too.

11.description: Not only is this bread good to the taste, it is a survivor. We just got back from a 7-day trip to the Canadian wilderness, and this is the only bread of several we tried that looked like bread at the end. Not only that, it still tasted great! No spoilage, didn't dry out. They have the rye as noted below, and a good pumpernickel, perhaps others we didn't find. They also export to specialty supermarkets (we got ours at Sendik's in Milwaukee). Highly recommended, both for taste and durability.

8.description: I've been getting my Lithuanian Rye from here since I was a child. This bakery does bread only. As a child they made different Lithuanian pastries and I was always greeted with a smile a wink and an "angel wing" Not anymore. You'll find only bread here but GREAT bread - Always consistently hearty and flavorful. The bread is dense and substantial. Makes a great strong bread to hold up to a thick corned beef or pastrami sandwich. Also, wonderful when toasted and buttered or beautiful to dip in some hearty European soup.

0.description: The Hunza bread is amazing. My husband does a low-gluten diet and enjoys this bread without any problem at all, since it has a sour starter. The bakery hours aren't convenient for people in the 'burbs...just call them to find out if they deliver to a grocery near you, most likely they do.Nice job, Bruno's!

7.description: Walked right by the place the first time. It's small, quiet, and the sour rye bread is insanely good! Definately coming back soon.

1.description: I used August Bloom for my wedding.  The girls were inconsistent about getting back to me, sometimes almost immediately, other times it took weeks.  We had two very detailed meetings about what I wanted. I even brought pictures to show them.  But I am glad I checked the final order before the wedding, as they had written down that the bridesmaids were to have all white flowers, when I said I wanted all purple and little to no white in mine. On my wedding day, my flowers had white feathers when I asked for black (again, had pictures to show what I wanted).  They took out the white and replaced them with  black feathers. For that I am grateful.  The boutonneires were simply okay.  We gave them finger monsters,then they added one flower behind it.  It looked okay and was not put together well.They messed up the corsage order, in which I was stuck with 1 regular and 1 mini corsage for two girls.  There should have been 2 minis. I couldn't pass out either of them because of them being different sizes. Also, both the the corsages that were used fell apart either right before and during the ceremony.  Thankfully, we had a hot glue gun in with the decorations, so we were able to fix my mom's before she walked me down the aisle.

2.description: My cousin decided to plan a wedding in six months. As one of the coordinators, we knew the budget would be small but we were willing to invest in quality flowers. We heard about August Bloom's success with Essence magazine and decided to use them. After attending their anniversary event and reviewing their work, my twin sister and i were sold. An appointment was made with one of the owners and the bride. The bride provided specific pictures of what she wanted. On the day of the wedding, the flowers were picture perfect, delivered on time, and each one had extra bling on them which pleased us. We were so excited! I plan to continue using them for all of our family events.

0.description: As a wedding and events planner I have both local and out of state clients. Although I don't get bridezillas, my clients can be very demanding. One particular from Maryland had many requests and changes throughout the planning process. August Bloom never flinched and made sure that on the most important day this young ladies life her floral arrangements were on point....thank you AUGUST BLOOM fir your level of commitment and professionalism.

3.description: Full of disgruntle workers mistreated by their boss, the whole time I was getting my nails done I had listen to this poor Girl talking about how mean their boss is so mean and how they are not being paid well, jeez not what I was looking for

1.description: Not sure about other people but I had a pleasant experience here! I was not really considering this place as my friend wanted to get her nails done and i read previous reviews here. We came close to closing time so about 7pm. They still took their time with our nails and thats a plus for me. I had experience at other places that rushed on the nails cause it was close to closing time. The girls were nice and careful with their work. Although not everyone speaks english i didnt think it mattered. The place is kinda quiet with no music and it kinda look like a little house than a nail salon so it was cozy. All in all im satisfied with my mani/pedi! Everyone has different preference so this is my take on this place!

2.description: I can see why it's called Nail Beauty Mix because it's very mixed up. This place is SO dirty!!!! I'm so sorry it smells and even though the ladies are nice, they aren't that great. the smell to the place makes me want to throw-up. Okay the price for pedicure and manicure was cheap like $25 for both but yes you get what you pay for. Worse of all they somehow made their own drying nail booth that some how has hot light bulbs underneath where you put your hands to try off the nails. My question is, how do you try wet nails under heated light bulbs? Is this some new way to dry nails? Anyways SIGH it wasn't relaxing it was like getting a cheap job done when I was being cheap on myself. I wouldn't go back unless I was desparate seriously.

5.description: The truth is - you get what you paid for. When they are in a hurry, they don't seem to take their time to take care of you. So, this nail polish end up looking messy. I was not satisfied, job was not well done!

6.description: My friend called me up and asked if I wanted to get a mani/pedi with her. I had a crazy day so of course I was in. & 25 bucks for both a manicure and a pedicure! I'm not going to lie, I walked and wanted to walk out. It was semi "rinky-dink" but I would give it a chance. If I seen something gross I would leave. No toe fungus for me, please. I was happy to see they were clean and very nice. They sterilized everything. Awesome. They don't have too many colors to chose from, but they do have a good selection. The thing that bothered me the most was the place to dry your finger nails. It's a home made contraption and it will burn your hand if you're not careful. They don't warn you either. Though, I will go again. Another thing. I live in Brighton Park and in Bridgeport many(most) streets require a permit. They supply you with a temporary one, so I was parked right out front. Very niiiice.

7.description: This place was the Bees Knees! Small, cozy environment with friendly staff and it was empty on a Wednesday night. Prices were really cheap too ($37 for a French manicure, pedicure, and eyebrow waxing), And the guy gave me the best foot massage of my life! I'll definitely be going back very soon.

8.description: This place completely ruined my lashes. The tech dipped the cluster lashes into a "ball of glue." Then she laid them on top of my natural lashes and the "ball of glue" dispersed to all neighboring natual lashes. Now I have a clump of very potent glue holding several natual lashes to one clump lash. The cluster lashes are not made to be worn this way for this long. Also these lashes were obviously of CHEAP quality probably from the 99cent store, cut into pieces and glued on. Now my eyes are totally sore and red from the weight of the extensions, this stunted the growth, caused ingrown eyelashes and balding because the extensions started to rip off my natural lashes. This process of applying cluster lashes do not allow for the natural lashes to shed when they need to or allow the new growth to grow in normally!!! I'm so tired of salons offering services that they are not trained to do!!! I ended up paying $40 to get it professionally removed because there was SO MUCH GLUE!!!! AVOID.

0.description: The salon is shitty, but fairly clean. Pretty much what I expected when I saw the sign for a $25 mani/pedi.I made an appt but it still took them 15 minutes to see me. They did a good job on my nails but were visibly stressed which kind of ruined my ability to feel relaxed. I would come back, but only cause I'm a broke college student.

4.description: For the price, u get what u paid for. Just don't make a comment about a mistake on their part they will start talking in Chinese (talking about you). Pretty uncomfortable.

3.description: Important to note, it's cash only here.Let's Boogie is a dusty time warp shop that's fun to visit, be prepared to dig and you'll find something good. Majority is rock oriented, but there's a good amount of soul, funk, disco, new wave, etc. A limited amount of new vinyl that seemed to be mostly popular stuff and a little pricey.Prices do leave something to be desired, but not outrageous. Nobody's forcing you to spend $40 on 2 tapes and a record, guy... I spent the same and left with 6 records. Sealed LPs were mostly $10, which is a fair price for a mint record, even if it's $2-3 above average prices you see online. Yes there were a few $20 records I skipped right past. For the budget buyer there are dollar bins with "no refunds" signs, though I didn't venture through them. The owner was friendly and chatted with us for a bit. I'd go back if in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip necessarily.

1.description: Are you kidding? Best of Chicago?The records here are crap!I guess if you want an ELO tape, check it out!

0.description: In some of my other reviews*, I've bemoaned the fact that the classic Chicagoland record store in today's world (2015) seems to be fast becoming extinct. By classic, for me personally (a 39 year record collector who's been buying music since I was 11), I mean here places like Hegewish, Record Swap, Threshold, Rose Records, or the Crow's Nest. Other collectors who are bit older than me I know will use that classification for other places--Beverly Records back in the day, Val's Halla also back in the day, Rolling Stones back in the day, etc, etc. There just aren't many places left that have the "presence and feel" of those "classics." This is not to say there aren't still great record stores left in Chicagoland--Reckless, Dusty Groove, Dave's, Jazz Record Mart, and Oak Park Records are all fantastic shops, in my opinion, and do a wonderful job serving the record buyer community. But although that's the case, the "presence and feel" of those places is not like the others I mentioned above--each has it's own quirks and differences that make them unique, but not in that "special way" the older places I've mentioned were like.Let's Boogie, a small but great shop in the Bridgeport area, is one shop left in Chicagoland that DOES take you back to the times of those classic record shops, and does so with style. Unlike Val Halla's and Beverly Records, two of the stores I mentioned above which are still open, Let's Boogie maintains that classic "presence and feel" while also NOT being a vinyl graveyard. They have also weathered changing markets better than say, Rolling Stones out in the suburbs, which has now become a bloated dinosaur with far too many CDs racks.Because of this fact, they have maintained the "presence and feel" of the old shops, and they continue to offer selections on vinyl (as well as other formats) that aren't just the picked over, fair or good records sold as being better quality than that, selections you find at places like Val's or Beverly these days. Meanwhile, they offer the better quality LPs they do have at great prices. You will find deals here that match, or are better than, what you will find at the current crop of "great places" like Reckless and Dusty Groove, as well. Finally, the store's owner also makes the place worth shopping at--a huge music fan who is very knowledgeable and who seems to be generally more personable than clerks at places like Jazz Record Mart or Dave's tend to be.One downside is that the place only takes cash. So, as other reviewers have said, come prepared. Another downside is that although the prices are comparable with places like Reckless and Dave's, the overall selection of LPs here is more limited. They do a great job stocking classic rock, pop more generally, and stuff like soul, funk, r and b, and new wave, but are less strong in areas outside these. So I've docked them one star for these couple of issues.(*To get a better understanding of the comparisons and contrasts I'm drawing here with other stores in the area, see my 40+ reviews of other record stores located in the Chicagoland area here on Yelp.)

2.description: Great, old-school record shop.  The owner is a nice guy.  Some good prices on records.TIP:  no cards allowed!  Apparently it can be dangerous to pick up cash at the ATMs across the street, so come with some cash.Also, we found it open at 2pm on a Saturday, if that helps.  :)

5.description: Stumbled onto this joint, had an amazing selection of vinyl records. It was deserted when I first set foot in this place. Every other record store I went to last weekend (Wicker Park, Logan Sq) was picked over. This place had a better selection and better prices. Friendly service, too.Cash only.

6.description: Went once and loved it instantly. When I walked in, it felt just great, and when I started looking at the catalogue, I was amazed at all the records they had. I'm so glad I found this place

7.description: Quality establishment.  Glad to see a place like this is still around.  Neil the owner is great and has been friendly ever since I first started coming to Let's Boogie as a child.

8.description: One of my favorite shops in Chicago. I don't know how it stays in business, but I hope it does! There's hardly ever anynone in there when I go, which is often, so the owner plays close attention to you and what you're looking at. It can seem a little overbearing, but he's interested in his customers and what they're looking for. He remembers me every time and lets me know if there's anything new that I'd be interested in. Very thoughtful and attentive business owner, which I appreciate. I highly recommend this shop--too bad it's so far off the beaten path for most! Help support a small business.

9.description: This my favorite place in Chicago for both time travel and music purchases. This store has not changed one bit since I was a tween girl growing up in the 70's & 80's and it's wonderful to be able to get the same experience every time I shop there. From the original 70's posters on the wall to the 45's behind the counter it is nothing less than a wondrous living museum of music & pop culture of the 70's & 80's. You can see everything from a Steve Martin promo Stand Up album holder to band collectable flair buttons under a glass case. This is where you can go to buy mint vinyl 45's, 33's, 8 tracks, cassettes and CD's

10.description: When you can actually find it open, Let's Boogie is like a time machine back to the age of vinyls and 8-tracks and cassette tapes.  There's also an interesting selection of VHS tapes and collectable pins and accessories at the counter.  Me?  I was taken in by the E.L.O. posters...I wouldn't call myself an "old-timer", but I still have devices in my house that play cassette tapes, and this is one of the greatest places to find something I can use in them and rock out like I used to.Oh, and the guy who runs/owns the place really knows his stuff and also helps promote the local bands, so if you stop in, be sure to check out the fliers and material he's got at the counter and support the local bands as well!

4.description: Total ripoff. The owner charged me $40 for a 2 tapes and a common record. I guess it's because I was visiting from out of town. The selection sucks and he doesn't mind selling a scratched up record above market value. Save yourself a trip and just buy your records online or at Dusty Groove.

3.description: Awesome place to go for a tattoo. The artists there are amazing and just a good environment to be in overall. I had a tattoo on my back for years that I wanted to get covered up and a friend recommended that I check out artists at Hammerhead. I checked out the shop and one of the artists, Carlos Perez, personally designed a cover up for me then and there. And it was exactly what I wanted. Looking at other artists there and their work, I could have worked with any one of them. Each artist has a great attitude and all have great tattooing skills.

1.description: Great place overall.  Relaxed vibe, great prices, friendly artists, etc.   Carlos is great, he took my vague ideas and turned them into exactly the pieces I wanted. I currently have a half sleeve and leg piece from him, but will be back for more!  Other artists in the shop also seemed very talented and friendly as well.

2.description: New tattoo shop off of Archer and Halsted; Bridgeport/Chinatown area.. Right next to the Halsted Orange LineI love this shop!! One of the friendliest, most comfortable tattoo joints I've ever been in. Hammerhead Tattoo is clean and professional. The inside decor is really nice, the layout is set up well, and the overall environment is welcoming and relaxing. Each artist has their artwork on the walls; everyone here is extremely talentedI've been in twice now to see Carlos. He's super easy to work with and does amazing work! He is very open to my ideas, then works his magic.. Other shops I've been to have refused to do cover ups or finish the start of another artist's piece. Carlos has fixed many of my "bad" tattoos and is understanding and patient. He has a gentle hand which makes my experiences much easier, less painful.The owner is real chill, the other artist is cool, and the apprentice is helpfulEveryone at this shop shows true dedication and passion. They're a great group of guys. I definitely recommend this place and will be returning soon. Hammerhead accepts walk-ins, but I'd call or message them on social media websites for an appointment. They are reasonably priced for Chicago. There's a 'pay to park' box right in front of the shop. I'm from the burbs but it only takes me 15-20mins to get there, pretty convenient location off of I-55 (Stevenson Expressway)I'm very happy with my tattoos and can't wait to get more.. I don't think they're doing piercings just yet, but that's in the works? After all, the shop just opened a couple of months ago. :) Check them out!!!

5.description: Went in there with my mom to get her first tattoo and I had a great experience. Carlos worked on mine and Jeremiah worked on her. Both of us love the worked they did. Both fellas were super nice and it was great atmosphere. I would definitely go back.

0.description: The artists are super talented and friendly. Shop feels very welcoming and is conveniently located across the orange line. I have had work done by Christian (shin and half sleeve - left arm) and Ben (half sleeve - right arm). Both understood what i was looking for and both went above and beyond, definitely will be going back again!

4.description: Everyone there was friendly and the vibe in the shop was great. The space is clean, stylish and the walls are adorned with art by the different tattoo artists, which I dig. Julian was hilarious and I enjoyed talking to him while he worked on my piece. I look forward to going back to Hammerhead in the future.

28.description: The epicenter of Bridgeport trash! You can literally feel negative energy swirling around this dump. Why do I go? It is close and they are 24 hours. They sell cheap booze amongst other items. Just be prepared. You will be asked for change on your way in, hear a couple argue and a baby cry simultaneously, be knocked into by kids running around on a school night at midnight, wait in line with drunk wanna be thugs buying 24 packs of natural ice and be forced to over hear their stupid conversations. There's usually a line of 12 people and only 1 register is open. The guy behind you will keep complaining about the line. Some lady will swear at her hyperactive child and tell them to put the candy back. Some girl will be having a loud cell phone conversation. Then you'll get stuck in the line even longer because some old crackhead lady is arguing over the price of a 2 liter of Mountain Dew with the poor cashier. Then you will be asked for change on the way back out. The experience is typical.

1.description: Pharmacists too busy too check on Gluten issues for med they sell. Truly repugnant, " I am too busy to check or call manufacturers" as to gluten free for a diagnosed celiac. Called Walgreens on Halsted stated no problem, we'll check it out. Also Costco pharmacy at Ashland store they had info in minutes. New Pharmacy's for me Costco and Walgreens!

9.description: Old and dirty describes the inside. But they had what I needed when I was driving around looking for a pharmacy early in the morning before heading out of town back to Texas. So for my cold medicine I was grateful for them. I liked their self checkout. Also as a Texan I always love that you can get liquor at places other than a liquor store.

29.description: While there are a plethora of CVS locations in the city of Chicago, each of them have their specific ups and, especially in the case of this one, downs.So for this location in the strip mall at 31st and Halsted...Ups:- Good selection of beer/liquor, often at decent prices.- Very few instances of stockers with big boxes blocking aisles (common in most CVS locations)- The cashiers are rather quick, once you can get to them.Cons:- The CVS coupon machine has worked only 10% of my visits for various reasons (out of paper, unable to connect, etc.).- Very limited selection of snacks and energy drinks (what I'm usually stopping in for, only to find that they don't carry it or are completely out).- Atrocious check-out setup (more on that below).I don't really know how this CVS broke its check-out system so horribly, but it needs to assess and correct the situation.  One of my favorite CVS locations (downtown) has five registers in a row, two self-checkout registers next to them, and the photo section will sometimes open up to check you out as well.  THIS location has the photo section space, a large gap, two registers (possibly three exist there, but I've never seen all three of those open), a gap where the exit is, and then a floating island of two more registers.  Those registers are hidden on the left and you can see if there's someone being checked out, but a giant door to the island blocks your view of ever knowing if the registers are manned without them leaning over the counter to wave and shout another customer down.Because of this setup, the checkout line foolishly starts at the photo counter and extends back into the store, often blocking aisles with its length, rather than attempting to create several smaller lines near the actual registers (the ones you can at least see are open for checkout).  I place a good portion of blame onto the idiot customers (specifically the second person in a line who chooses to follow a pattern of idiocy rather than break it and create a smart second line in an appropriate location).  However, more blame has to logically be placed onto the cashiers who are supposed to know better and tell their customers how to NOT queue like imbeciles.And if you see the one irregular line far from the bulk of the registers and think you can circumvent the idiocy with your own line, be prepared for a barrage of idiot-linesmen yells directing you to the back of the idiot-line because they've been waiting __ minutes already.The last issue I have with this place is that 4 out of 5 visits, I'm harassed at the entrance/exit by a vagrant asking for change, or a child asking me to buy candy, or a vagrant child asking me for a donation to a basketball team.  Basically any combination of vagrancy, childhood and a list of ways to separate me from my hard-earned cash.  I can't fault the CVS, though, for what transpires outside their store on the sidewalk in the strip mall.There's plenty of other things I fault them for which take precedence.

23.description: This may officially be the slowest CVS in the history of Chicago.  The customer service here is absolutely horrid and unbelievably insane.  As a person who used to live in the neighborhood, this became the only place to go to pick up quick food or drugstore products because the Jewel on 31st closed.  That was really unfortunate because this CVS absolutely sucks.  Trust me, I worked here for like two days and had to quit because everyone was super mean.The store is relatively clean and organized when they don't have all of the items to be put on the shelves out in every aisle blocking everything (this seems to be the case every time I come in).  This CVS at least sells a good number of items, which sort of makes up for the messiness of the store.  Most of their employees look like zombies and you can tell they hate their jobs.  They're pretty slow about putting everything away, so there's usually just crap everywhere.I wouldn't trust taking my photos here, but that's just me.  I've experienced more than one angry customer chewing out the photo employees because they ruined something, so I would just avoid this area at all costs.  Or do your own pictures.  The pharmacy employees are alright - I never took any prescriptions here, so I wouldn't really know what's up back there.I guess I just feel like I've stepped into an alternate universe when I come in here.  The last time, the employee at the ONE open register was unreasonably slow and the customer being served was insanely stupid.  At one point she forgot something and had to go back and get it in order to finish her transaction.  She was gone for almost five minutes and then came back with THREE other things.  Apparently she had totally forgotten that she was in the middle of checking out and continued browsing the store for more items to purchase.  Of course, the lady ringing us out couldn't cancel that transaction, so we all just had to stand.  It was unbelievably annoying.  This is pretty indicative of every experience I've ever had in here ever.  Good thing they sell booze... otherwise coming here would be entirely useless.

5.description: I hate parking in this lot - overcrowded with inconsiderate people. Instead, park on Emerald and walk over. Something about CVS just doesn't feel right (the visuals, lack of sales associates, etc...). And maybe it's just me, but I just feel like they're always out of stock of things that I want. If it weren't so close to home, I wouldn't even go.

25.description: I just go here for booze.  As others have noted, it's good for that.  Management is better than the predecessors (Osco).Don't park in the lot if you can help it.

12.description: This may officially be the slowest CVS in the history of Chicago.  The customer service here is absolutely horrid and unbelievably insane.  As a person who used to live in the neighborhood, this became the only place to go to pick up quick food or drugstore products because the Jewel on 31st closed.  That was really unfortunate because this CVS absolutely sucks.  Trust me, I worked here for like two days and had to quit because everyone was super mean.The store is relatively clean and organized when they don't have all of the items to be put on the shelves out in every aisle blocking everything (this seems to be the case every time I come in).  This CVS at least sells a good number of items, which sort of makes up for the messiness of the store.  Most of their employees look like zombies and you can tell they hate their jobs.  They're pretty slow about putting everything away, so there's usually just crap everywhere.I wouldn't trust taking my photos here, but that's just me.  I've experienced more than one angry customer chewing out the photo employees because they ruined something, so I would just avoid this area at all costs.  Or do your own pictures.  The pharmacy employees are alright - I never took any prescriptions here, so I wouldn't really know what's up back there.I guess I just feel like I've stepped into an alternate universe when I come in here.  The last time, the employee at the ONE open register was unreasonably slow and the customer being served was insanely stupid.  At one point she forgot something and had to go back and get it in order to finish her transaction.  She was gone for almost five minutes and then came back with THREE other things.  Apparently she had totally forgotten that she was in the middle of checking out and continued browsing the store for more items to purchase.  Of course, the lady ringing us out couldn't cancel that transaction, so we all just had to stand.  It was unbelievably annoying.  This is pretty indicative of every experience I've ever had in here ever.  Good thing they sell booze... otherwise coming here would be entirely useless.

21.description: Generally speaking I like CVS better than most drug stores because the selection of hair/beauty supplies, cards and booze are fantastic and reasonably priced. The Bridgeport CVS is in fact the only logical place to purchase liquor since getting it anywhere else in the neighborhood would mean not paying your rent that month.  For this, I love you CVS.Unfortunately the experience of shopping there is every bit as horrifying as the other reviewers have pointed out.  Yes, you will be greeted by a homeless person almost every single time you visit this store, and yes you will encounter at least one act of domestic violence somewhere near the candy aisle.  The staff are generally pretty friendly but not very helpful and never very fast.  As other reviews have stated, don't be surprised if you're in line for 30 minutes especially on Friday or Saturday night.This CVS however is the only good option in the neighborhood aside from Dominicks for liquor and for that they continue to get my business at least once a week.

16.description: The Fifth Circle of Hell contains the river Styx, a swampy, fetid cesspool in which the Wrathful spend eternity struggling with one another; the Sullen lie bound beneath the Styx's waters, choking on the mud. This pretty much sums up how I feel about this CVS. The aisles are constantly blocked with huge boxes of inventory. The pharmacists aren't anywhere near helpful. There are no distinguishable lines to wait in so people just kind of mill about hoping that they'll be chosen next to be rung up. The cashiers are gruff and act like you should be happy they're even tolerating your presence. The parking lot is a complete nightmare. Once you finally manage to find a spot, upon entering and exiting, you will be harassed for your change by at least two people outside. The only redeeming quality of this place is that they sell booze at a decent price.

17.description: The lines here are nothing to die for... :( I loathe this place.

10.description: Hey! I saw a guy drive there car into the place and the cops gathered! Very entertaining.... and I saw a bunch of people getting arrested.. Anyhow - the pharmacist there is a fucking racist : ) Lets be real. I'm brown. I'm fucking brown. Its kool - I live with it and I'm proud of it. The pharmacist was a little uneasy around me and tried to avoid me as much as possible when I tried to ask her a question she was even laughing a little bit that I was sick. Well I went up front and asked to speak to the manager because they have a fucking racist working there, which isn't surprising though since my Father works for CVS and would always complain about being treated horribly. Also, I was there again with a friend and they didn't even bother to help me - I had to ask someone to open up the register but the guy up front was too busy socializing with the security guard cause he wanted to tell him how he finally reached 2nd base on his 30th birthday. I am very very happy I moved. I went there once or twice and I honestly feel like their souls have been invaded by rotting rat feces. Good Day,  Robbi Style

11.description: It's a CVS.  A very crowded CVS with a nightmarish parking lot.   But sometimes you have to come here for your normal drugstore needs but also because they sell booze.  And apparently they're the only place in Bridgeport that sells booze because if you try to come in here after work or on a weekend or (god forbid) anytime in the 2-3 hour window before a home sox game, you'll be waiting in line behind one of the 2 open cash registers run buy ridiculously slow cashiers for at least 20-30 minutes with all the other people buying booze.  If you really must come here, it's probably best to have already started your drinking.

26.description: OMG, can I just concur with Scott A's review? "The epicenter of Bridgeport trash!" LOL! I couldn't have put it better myself. I AVOID going here if I can, and I usually can.

27.description: Conversation between the pharmacist and me:Me: "So will this antibiotic compromise my birth control?" Her: "You should not be having sex while treating a Bacterial Vaganois infection..." Me: "Yeah I know but you know like for after I'm done with the treatment" Her : "No it won't effect it, but don't have sex while...." ME: "Ok" Do I have to point out the idiocy behind his conversation?

0.description: Yeah, it looks sketchy and they do have sketchy people hanging around sometimes.I don't come unless I have to which is usually when my sister comes. Pretty much you shop and just take care of checkout yourself.

20.description: It's a CVS.  A very crowded CVS with a nightmarish parking lot.   But sometimes you have to come here for your normal drugstore needs but also because they sell booze.  And apparently they're the only place in Bridgeport that sells booze because if you try to come in here after work or on a weekend or (god forbid) anytime in the 2-3 hour window before a home sox game, you'll be waiting in line behind one of the 2 open cash registers run buy ridiculously slow cashiers for at least 20-30 minutes with all the other people buying booze.  If you really must come here, it's probably best to have already started your drinking.

19.description: This CVS has been here after the Osco Drugs closed as well as the Jewel's on 30th and Halsted.They sell all types of stuff that their competitors might not sell. Occasionally you can find deals, coupons, etc.They have their own discounted card "Extra Care Card."Here's the information on their card. cvs.com/CVSApp/user/extr…Signing up only takes 3minutes.Staff can be a little inattentive at times, but overall they're very nice when I was talking to them.

2.description: The guy in front of me in line had 2 cases of Coors in a baby stroller, and then got into an old 80's Caprice with 2 other guys who were smoking crack and listening to Dream Theater.5/5 would go again.

18.description: Generally speaking I like CVS better than most drug stores because the selection of hair/beauty supplies, cards and booze are fantastic and reasonably priced. The Bridgeport CVS is in fact the only logical place to purchase liquor since getting it anywhere else in the neighborhood would mean not paying your rent that month.  For this, I love you CVS.Unfortunately the experience of shopping there is every bit as horrifying as the other reviewers have pointed out.  Yes, you will be greeted by a homeless person almost every single time you visit this store, and yes you will encounter at least one act of domestic violence somewhere near the candy aisle.  The staff are generally pretty friendly but not very helpful and never very fast.  As other reviews have stated, don't be surprised if you're in line for 30 minutes especially on Friday or Saturday night.This CVS however is the only good option in the neighborhood aside from Dominicks for liquor and for that they continue to get my business at least once a week.

13.description: This cvs deserves 0 stars, but that wasn't an option so I had to give it 1.By far the worst cvs I've ever been to. It's always a mess. When the staff are stocking the shelves, they take up like 80% of the aisle and get mad when ur trying to pass them, at a high traffic hour like noon. No one will help u here. When u say nice things like "good morning" or "thank you", you don't get a response. The staff either walk past you, shoot you a weird look or just stand there and stare like a child does.The photo staff are miserable, the pharmacy team is miserable. These people seriously must be abused when they're not on the selling floor because they act as though they're tortured.Maybe there is a nice employee here or two, but I've never had the pleasure of meeting them.Not to mention, all the scumbags, drunks and beggars that congregate outside to beg and just chill, all day long. I don't want to walk past them at all.I've come here a few times when walgreens (a block north) didnt have what I needed.  I won't do that anymore, I'd rather go to family dollar on 34th and Halsted, or else drive to target. Honestly, I'd rather inconvenience myself by  taking the train downtown and go to the cvs on state St than frequent this hell hole.Also, if you're going to have the majority of the payment occur at self-service kiosk (where you ring yourself up), why are there always store employees standing there aimlessly? If we really need that much direction on how to pay at the kiosks, or if there is that much theft going on, why not put an extra employee or 2 at the registers so they could ring people up, old-school style?My grandma won't even shop here because she's so inconvenienced by the self service kiosk. I know a lot of seniors feel that way, and frankly, i'd rather have her NOT shop here, because its a safety concern when a nicely dressed little old lady has to walk past drunks and scumbags to get in and out of the store.

4.description: My favorite pharmacy thus far since I switched over from Walgreen Pharmacy. They are fast and efficient. The store as a whole is organized and clean for the most part. I like their self-check out options it helps make the lines pretty much no lines ever.

24.description: If I could go lower I would. I wish that I had the strength to write an in-depth review slamming this place and this one particular cashier but I don't. I just left there and bought some toothpaste and got $10 cash back. I dropped my wallet on the counter while opening it to put my $10 and credit card in. I forgot to pick up the $10 and turned right around (less than 10 seconds) and the money was gone. I was the only one in the line. I asked the sorry-ass cashier what happened to it and she said I put it in my wallet. I told her I didn't and she said that she did not know then. There was supposedly no manager there to help and corporate was pretty useless because they said it was my word against hers, though they will talk to her about it. I am so mad.

6.description: I love CVS and much prefer to Walgreens but this store is the worst. The parking lot is too small and crowded. There are always sketchy people out front or in the parking lot. The Pharmacy has a distinct lack of customer service skills both in person and on the phone. It is just overall disappointing. They do have a friendly greeter which is a plus but no ATM (usually a Bank of America) which would be really nice. I hope to see improvements!

22.description: The Fifth Circle of Hell contains the river Styx, a swampy, fetid cesspool in which the Wrathful spend eternity struggling with one another; the Sullen lie bound beneath the Styx's waters, choking on the mud. This pretty much sums up how I feel about this CVS. The aisles are constantly blocked with huge boxes of inventory. The pharmacists aren't anywhere near helpful. There are no distinguishable lines to wait in so people just kind of mill about hoping that they'll be chosen next to be rung up. The cashiers are gruff and act like you should be happy they're even tolerating your presence. The parking lot is a complete nightmare. Once you finally manage to find a spot, upon entering and exiting, you will be harassed for your change by at least two people outside. The only redeeming quality of this place is that they sell booze at a decent price.

15.description: I'm pretty sure I'm the only person who likes this CVS. Maybe it's just because I only live two blocks away, but I can be found in this store no less than 3 times a week, and sometimes go simply to use my atm card at checkout to get cash back because i'm too lazy to walk to the chase atm at 35th street. My only real complaints are that they quit carrying vanilla coke way too early, and they quit selling large cartons of soy milk many years ago (only selling half galon boxes now). Oh, and the lines can be horrendously slow, but they just renovated the store last week, and now have like 4 self checkout lanes so you won't have anyone to blame but yourself when you take a long time to check out. The people who work there are people just like you and me. If you were working at cvs in the 40th year of your life, you would hate the world just as much as those people. But, this one time i was pretty sauced around like 4pm and i got into a conversation with this lady and i complimented her hair, and described it as bouncy. She might read this, and I just want to say that I would be happy to take you home some time if you are interested in that, assuming you haven't been married for the past 10 years. I don't think you have, but who knows, maybe your needs aren't being satisfied at home. If they aren't, I would be more than happy to lead you on over to my place at 31st & morgan to show you how a real man would ring you up, if you know what i mean ;)

7.description: If you're a small town kid intimidated by the big city, this place is not for you. You have to make your way through some of the sketchy characters that hang out just in front of the place between the cars parked against the store. Walking in one of them decided he was going to block the path as I was walking in, it was intentional. But I gave him the benefit of the doubt and said, "excuse me" he stood his ground, I then said, "move it" he still stood there, so I looked him in the eyes and moved forward only then did he get out of the way.Too much hassle for a gallon of milk. I only come here when I have to, sure I'd like to give them more business but they don't deserve it. Sure they did hire a security guard but what good is he if he just sits on his a$$ at the inside of the front door.I usually try to go to the Walgreens or the Cermak Produce on Halsted just around the corner, but they close at 10 p.m., it was after that so CVS being open 24/7 is the only good thing about this place.

8.description: October 20I like this place.  It hasn't let me down when I needed affordable bubblies and cold medicine.  The convenience of 24 hours really makes my life easier and extremely close to home (2 blocks away).  I'm a dude.  So, nothing really phase me.  There's always some kind of drama at CVS since every time I visit is around Midnight and you know how that is.The place does seem a bit shady, but it's decent in Bridgeport.  If you're not used to the area, you might think it's dangerous, but I have lived here for three-forth of my life and sometimes it's not as crazy as the North with people heads being blown off.  Therefore, I'm going to start generalize the North Side since people generalize the South Side in News Article.

3.description: If you need your meds filled, then the people here will do you right. Not really a long wait, and the pharmacists and technicians don't mind answering questions you may have about your drugs.It's a shame the parking lot is so crowded. It should be double the size with all the traffic that comes in and out of it.Rant: why in the world does CVS insist on printing out these ridiculously long receipts that run as long as a blanket even if you but one item???

14.description: It's CVS. If you spend more than five minutes there, you're an idiot.

1.description: Don't waste your time and money. They ruined my teen daughter's hair. BEWARE!
