0.description: Stopped in yesterday to get a buzz cut with a number 1. Easy right?!?  Guess not. My hair got butchered.  It's the easiest haircut there is. Got long hairs left, chunk missing and while I was getting my hair cut, there was another lady trying to sell me bootleg items.   One and done with this place.

58.description: Before I write this review, I should probably give a shout-out to the Chinese Kitchen staff's kids, all of whom I've probably put through college by now.Yea, so this is where it all began.  8 years ago, just moved to the city, just joined a fraternity and we (of course) had been drinking in the afternoon and it was time for dinner.  So the hands join forces in pointing to the bulletin board where the Holy Grail sits - the takeout menu for Chinese Kitchen.  I'm still willing to bet that they initially picked this place of all others as the Holy Grail because, well, the address is 420 (W 31st Street).  I was skeptical at first - but what convinced me was the fact that their "Lunch Specials" are done all damned day and night.The perfect amount of greasy meats in slathery sauce and a mound of salty fried rice with a gigantic eggroll steaming on top.  That's right.  And every single Lunch Special option is $4.95 or LESS.Eventually I became the designated Order Guy among a group of my frat brothers.  I was responsible for collecting the orders, calling them up and answering the door to receive the cardboard box of deliciousness that once held produce or something.  They knew me by name.And once I moved out of the frat house and into Bridgeport, somehow I wound up living just two blocks away.  Who needs delivery?  Now they can know me by my face.  And indeed they did.It's right about now that I have to indeed admit that they've been lacking as of late.  Once the glory days of youth pass you by, you start to notice the little things...  A few pieces of undercooked chicken.  A few pieces of beef that aren't beef at all.  And then they get shut down by the Board of Health.  For like a week.My problem is that AFTER they RE-OPENED after passing the second inspection, that's when I first got sick from their food.  It's only happened once aside from that, but it boggles the mind that they could have been filthy as heck for years and my food was awesome and I never got sick, and then when they "clean up", suddenly something's adversely affecting my tummy?But it's still a great place for Chinese - even if it's a stone's throw from Chinatown, and there's several other Chinese places in Bridgeport competing as well, this is my first choice and it always will be.  Their Governor's Chicken is my favorite.  The Sesame Chicken is a close third.  And for $18, my girl and I can each get a giant entree for ourselves, a large bowl of soup (wonton, please!) and two eggrolls to boot!Sure, you may never achieve my level of greatness that I can walk in and they know who I am and dash off to get my order - but it's worth trying a few times to see if you are willing to give it a go.  After all, the lunch specials are less than $5 and you can get 'em any time of the day!

56.description: Great delivery! Food is fresh and hot even though delivery time can be a little long during peak hours. I love their Hunan Chicken and Singapore Noodles - both are HUGE portions though! Makes for awesome leftovers.

29.description: 4 stars just for the Peking Fried Rice that my friend and I ordered every other night when in college. It was delicious and I have never had fried rice like that before (or after)!I have tried some of the other entrees - orange chicken and general tso. The spring roles are... well, spring roles. I've never been to the physical location, but I will have Peking rice delivered soon!

42.description: Cheap.Great.Out of the Way.OrMaybe because it's out of the way and cheap...that makes it great. I wouldn't go out of the way to visit but if you're in the area this is an option for great grub.

23.description: Quick inside service (and delivery), inexpensive and nice dish for a lazy Friday night.

47.description: Edible, cheap and fast. As a chinese fast food restaurant should be. Just wished the sodas were cheaper.

8.description: Went in and got my food to go. Was home eating and enjoying the food. Got ready to eat the pot stickers and there was a roach in the sauce for the pot stickers. Needless to say, I took the food back & I'm not ever going back.

31.description: And they deliver sushi. Their lunch hibachi specials are nice especially the steak and shrimp combo.

34.description: I came here to give it another go but was I wrong, the orange chicken was dry and not flavorful. The chicken and broccoli was a simple dish where they even messed up in.  Man I am just disappointed in myself for even going back there. I cannot believe someone can mess up on chicken broccoli, the broccoli was bitter for who knows what reason and the sauce was a tasteless. The only thing that really tasted okay was the fried rice which is sad. I will definitely not come back here again.

16.description: I really enjoy this place. They have REALLY good fried rice, Orange Chicken and Mongolian Beef.  The prices are unbeatable and they are fast.  Now the reason I gave only 3 stars is because they do not know how to cook Lo Mein. I ordered it and it was gross. Canned mushrooms (yuck) and a clear sauce that would be use for Chow Mein. I never had Lo Mein the way they made it and didn't enjoy it.  I wish they would learn to make it correctly. Even though this is my favorite place to go to,  they need to work on perfecting some of their dishes. All in all I still order from them.

13.description: This is the worst chinese restaurant EVER! The girl behind the counter is ignorant and rude!!! Screwed up my order 3 times, over charged me & started yelling at me in front of customers. Not to mention how DIRTY this place is - did me a favor by being a bitch - heard all stories about the bugs & rudeness - now I witnessed it all!! Do not patronize this restaurant!! Only gave 1 star in order to post this review. Deserves -10

11.description: This place ONLY gets a star so I can write this review. HOW is a restaurant CONTINUALLY out of food? Why do they deliver to your house 5 times then suddenly an hour after you place your order you're outside of their delivery zone...aka the driver didn't feel like driving the extra 3 blocks. This is complete and utter BULLSHIT. Customer service? Ha, that's a funny joke. I can't fucking stand laziness and lack of attention to detail. Fuck this place. Other than that, the food is moderately priced and ok.

39.description: Tried their beef and tomato over rice. Meh! It was saucy like I like, but the beef was cheap quality and the tomato wasn't very tender and too big of a chunk. Just go to chinatown!

37.description: Well priced for good quality, great tasting food. This is one of my fav take-out places for Chinese food. Great bang for your buck!

0.description: I like this place.  Second time here.  Came with a couple of friends.  Great sushi.  Good apps.  I just had the beef chicken shrimp in garlic sauce and I had them put it over pan friend noodles.  Very good.Lot parking.  Friendly service.  English not so good but the menu has pictures.  Point and order!  LolTwo large TVs with sound.  Great for monday night football.  Good prices also.

38.description: Food is pretty good for what it is, but I would pickup before ever ordering delivery again. They were rushing me off the phone without even asking if I was going to do cash or credit (i had my credit card) and were super rude after I told them credit.... NEVER ordering delivery again. That experience just made me never want to order from there again.

51.description: As a college student- sometimes you get desperate for nourishment.  As a tech school college student- this need pops up far too often.If you're looking for decent fast food chinese delivered lightning fast to the IIT campus, this is your place.  L29- sesame chicken, white rice instead of fried, and crab rangoon in place of the eggroll- go-to meal.Cheap,quick,good enough.  Sometimes it isn't real consistent, but meals at such a low price just need to be edible... sometimes.Never had delivery till college- this place is a real keeper. When I come to Chicago to visit, I will most likely have a meal from this place.

27.description: Horrible service. I placed an order through Seamless. I wanted to get a beef with tomato and Seamless gave me the option to add chicken fried rice for $3.00. When I called the rest. to make sure my order was received, the man who answered the phone said he was glad I called because the price was incorrect. If I wouldn't call, they wouldn't even let me know. I told the man that Seamless is offering that price, he wasn't willing to do anything, so I told him I would like my order to be cancelled, he said ok and hung up on me; very disrespectful. I called again because I wasn't sure who I had to contact to cancell my order since he didn't say anything. The man said I needed it to call Seamless. Just because of the man's rudeness, I will never try to order from this places AGAIN. I would not recommend it. Service is disrespesctful at least the man who answered the phone. I suggested to be helpful to customers as you get the income from us.

32.description: The food is priced very well and the Singapore noodle is the biggest I've ever seen and at only 5 dollars that's awesome. Why one star then if it's so awesome? Well, I don't know what they use for their sauce or whatever but it smells awful. It smells like bologna, sweat and musk. I ate about four forkfuls of it before I threw it away. Which hurt my soul. Because I'm cheap. I also got the vegetable tempura, which was not tasty. Ate one carrot and threw that away too. $10.54 down the drain. I know nothing was wrong with it because I have a very sensitive stomach and I would've gotten sick instantly so I don't know what that ghastly smell is.

54.description: They cook American Style Chinese food. Tastes are already changed for American customers (more sugar, more oil, more salt, adding cheese, a lot of soy is the features of this style, but it's not healthy and it's not original Chinese family made food style.) , so as a traditional Chinese food lover I only give them 3 out of 5. By the way, I highly recommend every one try their Chicken Corn Soup, it's great!

48.description: I'm personally not very  forgiving in my opinions, but Chinese Kitchen has been a staple of living for me for many years. The food is solid. Great consistency,  flavor, and portion size. The Chicken and Rice soup has comforted me in my darkest hours like no other. If you like Chinese curry, I don't know if you could have any objections. Its strong, pungent, and sure to make your closest friends weary for many days after you imbibe its deliciousness.Above all else, the owner is a Cubs fan, and in the heart of enemy territory, I pretty sure it doesn't get any better than that.

44.description: Excellent place and easy on the wallet. A little greasy and salty, but for $5 a person, awesome. The lunch specials are like $5.50 and you get an entree, fried rice, and an egg roll. Credit card minimum of $10.

24.description: My friend and I ordered sushi from here, it was great, considering the low price. The delivery person on the other hand was rude, and blatantly asked us for gas money. Who does that?!?!?!

7.description: Food has gotten worse, and the service got worse. They filled up the water glasses half way with warm water. We had to ask for ice... My daughter's noodle stir fry dish had no flavor at all, but at least yhey didn't make us pay for it. My wife's shrimp weren't even deveined.... This was my first really bad experience with them. SMH

49.description: Flip a coin, you have a 50/50 chance. This is what it is like when ordering at Chinese Kitchen, one day it is the really good and then the next it's complete undercooked mess of tough bone riddled meat The three stars are for the days that they get it right. The place is always quick and the store is really clean. I don't know what it is, but their eggrolls are not quite right. Sort of like the Buffalo Bills of the early 90's. Something wrong you just can't seem to figure out what it is.

40.description: i come here once in a full moon when i want Chinese food to go since I'm a few minutes away.. there is a parking lot so its easy to find parking.. the service is OK... the price is decent but the food is just average.. i usually order the shrimp with lobster sauce over rice since that's the most decent tasting dish I've tried over there.. but that again i am Chinese so my standard is a little higher for Chinese food..

53.description: Super cheap delivery for college students.   I don't even know what the restaurant looks like.  I think I feel better not knowing.  It's still pretty tasty.This place got me through some late nights of study.   It's one of the few places that delivers late this far south.  Food comes fast, hot and plenty.Don't expect authentic.  Expect the sauces to be thickened to gravy.  The first time ordering I didn't have the menu, just some number a friend gave me like a shady hookup.  I spoke in Chinese ordering some basic dishes and they replied "No we don't do that" and I knew what I was getting myself into.

30.description: Well, it started out better than my last attempt at ordering from here; at least I got my food this time.   I ordered through GrubHub this time, my order came in a timely fashion, and the delivery person was friendly and courteous. Unfortunately, that's where the good part ends.I ordered pot stickers, wonton soup, Szechuan beef, and pork fried rice.  I get the order to my desk, and notice there is a big puddle of brown liquid at pooled in the bottom of the plastic bag.  What happened, is that the little plastic container of sauce for my pot stickers had melted, then it escaped through a hole in the melted styrafoam of the container.  Actually, both foam containers had melted some from the steam.  So I started off with a big mess.The quality of the food ranged from downright horrible, to decent.  In the decent category: pot stickers, and fried rice (actually, I will say the pork fried rice was the best part; fresh and not too salty,) and the soup.  On the other hand, the beef was just horrible.  I ate about three bites, and just could not go any further.  The meat and vegetables were just unpleasantly soggy.  You could not tell the difference between the two.  The rest of the order found it's way to the trash bin.

46.description: I tried Chinese Kitchen today. I ordered the kung pow shrimp and scallops. Turned out to be totally inedible. The shrimp and scallops had no red peppers nor peanuts. Instead the onions, green peppers, and mystery veggies were floating in a red broth with maybe 2-4 shrimp and scallops. I give this place one star because my dad liked his Orange chicken

1.description: I had for the first time for NYE at a friend's house.  The Mongolian Beef was over-loaded with onions and was more like Mongolian Onions.  The shrimp fried rice was dry.  The eggrolls were decent.Overall, I've had much better Chinese food.  I'm glad I tried; but, Chinese Kitchen has not been added to my 'go-to' list in Bridgeport.

55.description: I really really hate to only give this place two stars, because when I first started eating here almost two years ago now, I actually really enjoyed it. The beef and broccoli was actually beef and broccoli and not beef and random veggies that I can't recognize and don't taste very good. The beef was actually tender and quite fresh in a thick soy saucey tasting sauce, now not so much. I swear, once we got a batch that tasted moldy. The last time Aaron ordered it for me, it was super watered down, and the water chess nuts had black spots on them. ICK! I don't get it. I don't get how they get away with that. Maybe I am an odd ball and can taste when food is bad and most people can't? I don't know. I also really enjoyed the governors chicken, with its thick sweet sauce and perfectly cooked chicken, until one day I got a batch where the chicken was in big chunks and it was undercooked. Um no thanks. Again how do they do that? Are they just trying to churn out the orders too quick.?Now I stick to the sesame chicken. Its nothing special, but it has a decent flavor, and the chicken is cut into thinner slices so I know it will be cooked through. Sometimes Aaron is nice enough to ask if I would like a won ton soup, which I appreciate every place has a saving grace and Chinese Kitchen's is the won ton soup.Its a tad on the salty side but in a good way. I don't know I really want to enjoy this place more than I do, so I go along with it when Aaron S. wants to order. He has been nice enough to not order from there too often though. Sorry Chinese Kitchen, but please go back to being tasty and fresh! (and please stop making me wonder if something is wrong with Aaron S's taste buds)

9.description: One of the best Chinese joints in Bridgeport. Definitely one of my go tos

26.description: Listen.  After having some beef noodle soup while in Toronto, I was hooked.  Unfortunately, my roommate and I have tried countless restaurants in search of the elusive beef noodle soup.Not Pho, some legitimate Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup.  We have had *horrendous* beef noodle soups.  We had all given up hope, however after looking to get takeout at 1 am, I noticed this gem.  At first, I was skeptical, a 3 star on yelp Chinese food restaurant?  Come off it.Man were we wrong, the beef brisket noodle soup was EXACTLY what we were looking for.  Not only that, but the broth was fantastic, and you can choose what noodle you want.  How much better can it get?  It always arrived hot, which is pretty important considering it's a soup, and the noodles are never soggy and mushy.We've ordered a lot of their rice boxes as well, which have been great.  Never dry, not overly salty and does not have that slimy texture.  Also, their noodle dishes are very solid.

25.description: this place sucks, i know it was a little my fault, but i should not have to do their job for them. i order my food while at work, thinking that i would have a great lunch. fri st the stupid lady could spell the street that i gave her, even after i spelled it out for her. once i order she appeared shocked that i wanted to pay with my card over the phone. then when i asked her to repeat the order she got it wrong three times. then she hung up the phone before she could get my name and phone number. when i called back to inquire why my food has not been delivered. they could not give and answer. now i was ensured that the driver would be there in a few minutes, silly me i said ok. but wait there is more the freaking place called me to tell me to go outside that the driver was there, so i go like a fool and guess what no driver no food and bullshit service. i any one continue to order from a place like this you have to be a little crazy. because place like this will not change they will continue to do things like this because people are to lazy to care. please for once do the right thing (sorry for the pun) victor w

12.description: Hi Stephanie? Thanks for getting back to me! I cannot describe him. But i ordered the delivery the first time from your restaurant on 12/28 (on Sunday) by noon. I understand that you guys have a third party delivery company, but i believe work is work. Thanks!

59.description: This place makes the best chinese food I have ever eaten! I think the generals chicken is phenomenal and I don't even like chicken! Every dish is so, so good! You can't go wrong with anything. It is a little unassuming, being so close to but not in Chinatown, and then also in a strip mall. Skip those fancy looking places and swing on over to Chinese Kitchen! Take note, it is carry-out and delivery only. I don't even remember seeing any seating inside.

21.description: Good and cheap. What else do you want from asian food?Plus, there's a parking lot! And free wifi ;-)

17.description: I always drive by but never came in for food. I finally had the courage after a good 10 years of coming by here. I trusted yelpers on their reviews so I came here by choice as opposed to Maxewells. I kind of regret it.I ordered my childhood favorite "beef stir fried with thick rice noodles" (comes with onions and scallions/ green onions). I specifically told them to go easy on the oil, but that didn't happen (I'm on a diet). My noodles were still drowning in oil. Usually this dish is a challenge to make since it requires enough oil so it doesn't stick to the wok and the art is to toss the seasoning evenly on the noodles and beef. I guess being the top 8 Chinese restaurant didn't help. (I'm guessing the food they made for the competition was different from what's served on the menu because I honestly don't taste it.) The noodles were still stuck together (from package) and were barely touched with sauce, this also contributed to an uneven taste; some of the noodles were salty and some didn't have any taste.My date ordered the beef with tofu (dark sauce). It was really salty in my opinion. I didn't taste anything special about it besides being covered in sauce. There were plenty of gnats and night fliers when we went in to eat. The person who took our orders were busy texting (face was literally glued to the phone for extended periods of time). I kindly asked for attention but the phone interrupted and I was not acknowledged.I doubt I will come back if my requests were to be ignored. Top 8 restaurants? I would agree, but I doubt that title was acquired by cooking what are currently offered on the menu.

10.description: Good and cheap. What else do you want from asian food?Plus, there's a parking lot! And free wifi ;-)

5.description: great portions and above average Chinese food. I'm mad i have been living here for 2 years and I find this place when im moving soon. *tear*Wife said to add a lil too greasy and great delivery service.

3.description: Really bad customer service. Skip this place!Tried to order for a delivery and had all sorts of problems.  Tried to call and check on my order but got all sorts of attitude from the girl on the phone.

35.description: the food here sucks for chinese food. literally had to wait for the clerk to finish texting on his cellphone before taking our orders. ricebox comes with a lot of rice, and little meat/veggies. didn't taste as good as the other chinese ricebox joints.

19.description: The food is priced very well and the Singapore noodle is the biggest I've ever seen and at only 5 dollars that's awesome. Why one star then if it's so awesome? Well, I don't know what they use for their sauce or whatever but it smells awful. It smells like bologna, sweat and musk. I ate about four forkfuls of it before I threw it away. Which hurt my soul. Because I'm cheap. I also got the vegetable tempura, which was not tasty. Ate one carrot and threw that away too. $10.54 down the drain. I know nothing was wrong with it because I have a very sensitive stomach and I would've gotten sick instantly so I don't know what that ghastly smell is.

28.description: Worst customer service. I placed and Order online when it arrived I noticed they messed up my order I called them right away the manager actually told me that's what happens when you order online let me give you my number so that next time you place an order you can call. Not to mention they did not fix the mistake I was out of $30 and no food to enjoy what a waste !!!!

45.description: Cheap and fast chinese food. I tend to be a picky eater so when I order food I go with what I know. I ordered the sweet and sour chicken lunch special. For the price it was more than enough food and it wasn't bad. It also came with an egg roll, which I would have eaten had it not been for the shrimp. I don't eat seafood and it would have been nice if they mentioned it contained shrimp. That lack of disclosure makes it 3 stars for me.

33.description: Came by for sushi since they recently expanded and added a sushi menu. The food was just ok.

43.description: Really, this place is just a two star place.  It gets an extra star for being cheap and an extra star for having awesome delivery.The foodI ordered sweet and sour chicken, orange chicken, and szechuan beef.  The orange chicken and szechuan beef were pretty good, but the sweet and sour chicken was heavy on the breading, leading to inconsistent sizes (same meat chunks, but some had a little bit of breading and some had a ton).  I ordered at dinner time, I received a fortune cookie and a small thing of rice with each entree, but no egg roll.  I didnt finish everything, except the sweet and sour chicken, and they reheated up well.The delivery/the billI called in my food a little past 9pm.  From phone call to arrival took about 25 minutes, and I live just about a mile away from there.  The guy was super friendly and genuinely appreciated the business.  There is a $2 delivery charge.  I ordered the three entrees, and the total with tax and delivery was $18, price per entree ranged between 4.45 and $5.35.The take home:If you want food that is cheap above all else, order from here.  Maybe stay away from the breaded items.  Order a lot of food, mainly because there is a $2 delivery charge - why get a $5 meal and pay a $2 charge and tip on top of it?

2.description: I appreciated their vegetarian options, quick preparation, and friendly staff. Recommend for your Chinese craving but wasn't so impressed that id go out of my way. If you're in the area it's fine.

18.description: This place deserves no stars the worst most unprofessional place I've ever attempted to order from I just ordered for delivery waited well over an hour and still didn't receive my food... So I call to check and they're going to tell me we called you 5 times and no answer our driver was there mind you it's very nice out so my fiancé and I were waiting on the porch no one came here no one attempted to call! So he tells me I'll send it out now... Another 30 minutes later I had to call the restaurant 10 times to finally get an answer and he tells me I'm waiting for a driver to come back for more deliveries do I say so now I have to wait a whole hour again? I'm good this is the second time I've had this same experience last time we waited two hours for the driver to go to the wrong house and keep telling me he was out front, I thought I'd give it another try tonight and now I regret it two hours later... Horrible service! Beware ordering from here!

41.description: This is our stand-by Chinese take-out place and it never disappoints!  We always get the Orange Chicken.  If you get delivery, expect it to be at your house w/i 5 minutes or before you hang up the phone.

52.description: fast cantonese...three stars in a very good way.  eat where the cops eat.

50.description: This restaurant has saved my life a number of times. Fried rice + steamed rice($7.5)  is a good & cheap deal for a crazy rice eater like me.Their non-veg items are equally good. This is a nice place for students to have food & watch the big screen(mostly watched by the rest. staff).The guy at the counter is friendly & never messes with any orders.One good thing about restaurants in south is free parking.

4.description: I went during lunch and ordered the salt and pepper squid. The food was ok but they are me little squid and so much rice. I barely ate the rice and so wasteful. The service was definitely slow. There wasn't a lot if people in the restaurant but it took awhile so I had to rush to make sure I didn't stay out too late for my break.

6.description: You had me at no MSG :-) when did this place get a dining room?? I have been a faithful Happiness on 34th & Halsted girl all my life... but I believe that has changed as of this evening! The Godzilla sushi was awesome *next I will be trying the Monkey Brains, simmer down- just one of the many clever names they have on the sushi menu.  I don't Yelp often but when I do it's because I either want a place to stay around for ever or to be destroyed. Eat here eat here!

22.description: The food is dirt cheap and its open late. The food isn't all that good. But the one thing I did like was the avocado salad.

15.description: Tried their beef and tomato over rice. Meh! It was saucy like I like, but the beef was cheap quality and the tomato wasn't very tender and too big of a chunk. Just go to chinatown!

57.description: A mecca for drunk/sober college kids.  The staff is very friendly and most of all FAST.  I ordered General Tso's and I got it inside of 15 minutes.  That's pretty good in my book for an order of food I COULDN'T EVEN FINISH.  Very tasty, great value, awful for you.  Everything that a (horizontally) growing fratboy needs.

20.description: Had been coming here since 2000 but since the expansion the prices have gone up & the quality has gone completely down! Food isn't as good as it used to be was reluctant to try a new place but due to the decline in quality i tried Nicky's in Hyde Park who has replaced them the food is 10x better!!!!

36.description: I always drive by but never came in for food. I finally had the courage after a good 10 years of coming by here. I trusted yelpers on their reviews so I came here by choice as opposed to Maxewells. I kind of regret it.I ordered my childhood favorite "beef stir fried with thick rice noodles" (comes with onions and scallions/ green onions). I specifically told them to go easy on the oil, but that didn't happen (I'm on a diet). My noodles were still drowning in oil. Usually this dish is a challenge to make since it requires enough oil so it doesn't stick to the wok and the art is to toss the seasoning evenly on the noodles and beef. I guess being the top 8 Chinese restaurant didn't help. (I'm guessing the food they made for the competition was different from what's served on the menu because I honestly don't taste it.) The noodles were still stuck together (from package) and were barely touched with sauce, this also contributed to an uneven taste; some of the noodles were salty and some didn't have any taste.My date ordered the beef with tofu (dark sauce). It was really salty in my opinion. I didn't taste anything special about it besides being covered in sauce. There were plenty of gnats and night fliers when we went in to eat. The person who took our orders were busy texting (face was literally glued to the phone for extended periods of time). I kindly asked for attention but the phone interrupted and I was not acknowledged.I doubt I will come back if my requests were to be ignored. Top 8 restaurants? I would agree, but I doubt that title was acquired by cooking what are currently offered on the menu.

14.description: Well, it started out better than my last attempt at ordering from here; at least I got my food this time.   I ordered through GrubHub this time, my order came in a timely fashion, and the delivery person was friendly and courteous. Unfortunately, that's where the good part ends.I ordered pot stickers, wonton soup, Szechuan beef, and pork fried rice.  I get the order to my desk, and notice there is a big puddle of brown liquid at pooled in the bottom of the plastic bag.  What happened, is that the little plastic container of sauce for my pot stickers had melted, then it escaped through a hole in the melted styrafoam of the container.  Actually, both foam containers had melted some from the steam.  So I started off with a big mess.The quality of the food ranged from downright horrible, to decent.  In the decent category: pot stickers, and fried rice (actually, I will say the pork fried rice was the best part; fresh and not too salty,) and the soup.  On the other hand, the beef was just horrible.  I ate about three bites, and just could not go any further.  The meat and vegetables were just unpleasantly soggy.  You could not tell the difference between the two.  The rest of the order found it's way to the trash bin.

3.description: I went in today, walked up to the counter, ordered my pizza and paid. As you can see from my picture this somehow earned me the label of 'Jackass'. Not sure why or how, but the good news is- you won't ever have to see my jackass face again, since I'll skip you guys next time I want cheap, shitty pizza.

1.description: Hot and Ready?  Absolutely not.  Stopped in for one of their Detroit style pizzas (which is supposed to be ready from 4-8pm), and was told it'll be a TEN MINUTE WAIT.So...if a person comes in at 7:20 and orders a pizza that is supposed to be hot and ready between 4-8pm, it's really not.  Sounds like false advertising or a location not doing what they are supposed to do.  With this location I think it's the latter. On top of that, when questioned about the 4-8 deal, the person behind the counter got an attitude and extremely defensive.Little Caesars has good food.  This location does not have good customer service. You've been warned.

2.description: Hot n ready, this is not. You WILL be waiting for your plain, sausage, or pepperoni pizza.The pizza and crazy bread are done right, but it's just too slow to get in and get out like you would expect. Even when it's not busy, you'll likely be waiting for your order.While I appreciate the employees apologizing for the wait, I wish there was a better run location.

9.description: When the pizza is fresh.....for $5.00 it isn't bad. I like how the pizza has a bit of crunch to it and isn't soggy.The breadsticks are usually fresh and good. My brother decided to try that Garlic butter - Wow, once I saw it and smelled it.........movie theater popcorn butter came to my head. I didn't like how it tasted either. I'll stick to the marinara sauce.Cheap and good when fresh!

10.description: I have never tried the pizza at this location. Then why am I writing a review? I hear you ask, Well it is for the crazy bread and the Buffalo Ranch dipping sauce. The crazy bread is always cooked perfectly and always warm, and the packets of Buffalo Ranch are so tasty and go perfectly with the bread. In fact I have been tempted to go in to just buy a bunch of those packets and try them on other things! Also the staff are pretty friendly, They don't bat an eye or frown when I make my small purchase of crazy bread and Buffalo Ranch, Hell one of the lady's even struck up a pretty long conversation with me.

4.description: This has been so far the worst experience. The employees really need to learn about crowd control. They literally chose to help people who were not in line first. A man was standing in front of me in line, in walks these girls, cut in front of everyone, they helped them first. I don't know if it was because of their skin color or because they just wanted to get rid of rude customers. All I can say is customer service here is terrible and I will no longer be buying from this store. I will drive 10 miles out of the way to go to a different one.  Also if I could give no stars I would.

6.description: You get what you pay for!!!!  $5 Pizza Pizza!   I went here today at 10:30pm now they close at 11.  I ordered one Pepperoni  Pizza.  The girl gave it to me and I opened to check it like I always do.  In da middle of da pizza it looked like somebody stepped in it.  The girl told me that is all they have left or a sausage pizza. So I asked to speak to da manager.  Da manager came up and told the girl to make another pizza.  So I waited for a fresh hot pizza.  Once it came out the girl said sorry and the manager came back up front and offered me a free can of pop for da wait .  Its only good pizza when you get it fresh.  But you ALWAYS need to check your pizza before you leave because if its in der to long it will be dried out and nasty.  Its cheap what can I say?

12.description: If you've ever been to a Little Caesar's Pizza you know what to expect. This location has the same basic menu the other ones do. $5 ready made pizzas, pepperoni, sausage and cheese. There is the $1 Crazy Bread and sauces. They also have Hot Wings.The pizzas are fine but the Crazy Bread here is rarely ever cooked properly. Its either overcooked or undercooked and usually they never season it right either. They get everything else right but this! I've been going here for years and its always been like this. But that is the only complaint everything else is recommendable.

5.description: Their wings are expensive and just have tasty sauce. I nearly choked on the winds because they are so small that I put the whole thing in my mouth. Never again!

13.description: I used to subsist entirely on little caesar's pizza, tallboy's of high life, and kit-kats.  Ah, those were the good ol'days.   I moved away from them though.  It was sad, but it needed to happen, anyways we're both a lot happier now.  I still go in for the crazy bread sometimes.  I like the ads in the store in spanish which tout it's "pan loco" though.  Be real and go eat it at Mcguane park.

11.description: Strangely enough, the four-star review I'm giving this place isn't for the pizza.It's for the hidden gem of the "Buffalo Ranch" dipping sauces that are sold for 2/$1.00 at this location.I don't care if it turns out they're available at every Little Caesar's or that they're made by some company and you can buy it online or in a local grocery store - this is the place where I made the discovery and they deserve the credit for putting them out in plain view, tempting consumers like me to consider these little cups of dipping sauce with interesting names instead of the marinara dipping sauce for my Crazy Bread.Buffalo Ranch is possibly the best dipping sauce I've ever encountered.  It's got a kick of spice and flavor from the buffalo part, but also the coolness of the ranch at the exact same time.  I've tried the two-flavor Dorito bags promising the same combination of flavors, but they failed.  This sauce was the perfect companion to my Crazy Bread.  Then it spread to me dipping my $5 pizza in it.  Soon, I was using the leftovers from these little containers on some of my french fries from other establishments.  It makes just about everything delicious.Yes, this store is quite clean, and the staff is friendly (also usually inexperienced working with a cash register and knowing what buttons to press, or I am just lucky enough to get a trainee working every time I visit).  The pizza is good, but they need some more practice making sure their Hot-N-Ready oven is stocked with hot and ready items, as it's customary here to have to wait for purchases to be cooked and prepped rather than plucked from the Hot-N-Ready oven where foods should be dished out instantaneously to the paying customers.But I forgive them, because they have Buffalo Ranch dipping sauce.Seriously - go there and buy some.  I don't even care if you don't get pizza.  Invest $1 on the Crazy Bread.  Invest $1 on two of the Buffalo Ranch dipping sauces (or $0.59 on one, or use the second choice for a different flavor - the Garlic Butter is EQUALLY AWESOME with Crazy Bread and pizza, but with few other things).Then come back to this website and thank me for opening your eyes and taste buds to these little containers of heaven.  I'll be waiting.

8.description: Saved me many times...$5 pizzas!  The kids played baseball at Mcguane in the past and when we were responsible for the snacks, we walked over to Little Caesar's and picked up about 7 pizzas.  The pizza is just ok, but kids are not picky and there was plenty to feed kids and parents.  It beat bags of chips and juice boxes!

0.description: My recent experience at Little Caesar's has taught me a few things.1.  Apparently Little Caesar's is 50 years old.  Does Don Draper like Little Caesar's?  2.  I am apparently too cheap for Pizza Hut and this is what I've been reduced to.3.  The slice of pizza with the biggest bubble in it is still the best.I'd normally give a Little Caesar's 3 stars b/c let's face it, it's the kind of pizza place that only charges $5 for a large, and forces teenagers and senior citizens to pass out fliers while wearing a bizarre little man costume on the hottest days of the year.  Days that are too hot to eat pizza, let alone wear a giant Caesar costume.  However, this particular location is never out of Crazy Bread, unlike many of the K-Mart ensconced outlets.  The lady working the counter (and cutting the pizzas) was actually friendly, and the Hot-n-Ready pizzas were actually a combination of ready and made to order.  No long wait, but no dried out crappy old pizza either.  Impressive for a rat hole in a strip mall.  I'll be back when I need to cheaply feed party guests or revisit the life and times of my 9th birthday.

7.description: They literally have the rudest and crappiest employees working there. My favorite thing about this place is the crazy bread. However, recently within the past couple of months, the workers there are so shitty that I would hate just walking there to order my crazy bread and pizza. They make you feel very unwelcome and not friendly at all. With employees like that I will just go to dominos instead.

12.description: I love Jimmy Johns, I started at the suburban  locations. But finally they brought a Jimmy Johns to Bridgeport. Not to far from my house, Fast Friendly Service! I love the staff here, everyone treats you great and with respect. My order never gets messed up here(or any Jimmy Johns I been to)!  I have yet to try there delivery yet and doubt I ever will so I can't review that! But if you want Jimmy johns and your in Bridgeport this place is great!!

7.description: Everything you can expect from JJ - quality and consistency, no matter where the location is! This is usually not that crowded unless its on days with a Sox Game I think. The staff if friendly, and quick with their service as JJ promises. Definitely a boon to that area as there are not many food options around. A caveat though... since I have only done in-store pick-ups I am only speaking to that and things have been great here.

19.description: the food is consistenly good.  i'll ding them b/c delivery is sub par. so now i just call ahead / pick up.  the lunch hour lady at the register can do a better job at greeting you.  she has a very serious or troubled face...all the time.  she's the "yes" / "no" type.  kinda curt.

1.description: I walked into this Jimmy Johns at 4:40pm today and as soon as I walked in I was asked if I was picking up a carry out order. When I said no the man sweeping the rug by the door stepped directly in front of me and rudely informed me that they were closing soon so if I wasn't picking up an order then they couldn't help me. Their hours say they close at 7 and even if they close at 5 I was still in long before then. Extremely rude and ridiculous, won't be returning to this Jimmy Johns.

2.description: I ordered for delivery expecting it to be around 15 minutes or less because this is half a mile where I work now. I clock out around 15 minutes waiting for my lunch expecting it to arrive anytime. I called at 25 minutes later where they said they're coming. 10 minutes later still not here and called again for them to tell me they run of bread? It took so long for my sammy to arrive that I only had ten minutes to eat it.

9.description: "There's a Jimmy John's in Bridgeport?!  NO WAY!"I headed over to get a gift certificate for a friend ASAP.  I walked into this eerily quiet and empty Jimmy John's ... "Hello?"  Scary man behind the counter lacks any facial emotion, not even a smile or a "Welcome!"  Oh well, I just needed gift certificates anyway."Can I get some gift cards or certificates here?"  I wait, he checks ... "Oh we don't have any."  *Grumble* .... so I asked where I can get some that's nearby.  The guy looks dumbfounded.  I slowly back away, like some awkward scene from Family Guy and Google'd the next nearest location (which was a lot more pleasant and friendly, might I add).

6.description: I think my star says enough.

18.description: subs so fast I'll freak?  Not so much, but they are pretty fast.  I like stopping in for a sub sandwich before I head over to my classes at IIT, as it offers a nice alternative to greasy fast food!  I also like stopping here as it offers a variety of options, and they put up with my picky eating habits.  Thanks JJ!  :-)

10.description: What a welcome addition to Bridgeport!This place is just like any other Jimmy John's except it is cleaner, friendlier, and faster.  The seating space is small and geared for twosomes, so it isn't a great place for three or more.

13.description: fresh sandwiches.....faaaast.

16.description: I just placed an order today at 12:19 and I didn't receive my sandwich until fifty minutes later.  When I called them to ask about the order, they said it was out for delivery.  What happened to "subs so fast you'll freak?"

17.description: I eat here 8 days a week and the service is unbelieveable !!  They are on it as soon as you walk in the door.  Everybody is smiling and nice, the food is ready before you get the change in your pocket.  This is a great place for a quality sandwich at a good price .  It is fast as they say and the place is really clean, unlike a lot of the options near by.  I have never had a bad experience and would recommend eating here.  Bring $7.00 and eat like a king !!

15.description: the delivery is not very good here...i ordered my three sandwiches at 11:30 AM and asked if it could be delivered by 12:00 PM for a meeting...it is 12:30 now and still nothing.  when i called they said it was coming.

0.description: Great place to get a sandwich, and quick. I have eaten here a plethora of times! This particular store makes some of the best sandwiches on the weekdays. On the weekends though, sometimes the bread is harder / cooked more and the product is not as enjoyable. I would never cease to enjoy food from this shop as long as the practices and prices stay the same. This store has also delivered to me in Bridgeport past their delivery zone, and they even sometimes recognize me when I walk in to order a sandwich. 4 Stars for consistency!

5.description: I'm sorry, Char O., but not every sandwich I eat for lunch can come from Potbelly.  I know I'm supposed to have brand loyalty, but my office is not close enough for that when lunchtime rolls around.  But then again, we're just outside of this Jimmy John's delivery zone, so me and the Lunch Crew hop in one of their cars and come here when it's sandwich time and the thought of Subway makes our stomachs churn (and sometimes it doesn't).And we wind up here, where parking is a bit of a nightmare (thanks to construction for the past few months), but we can get inside where it's nice and cool and get a sandwich, some chips, and a drink - then veg out and chow down and ignore the seeping dread that at some point we have to get back in the car and go back to work...I'd love to tell you all about the menu, but I really only order one thing: the Club Lulu with no tomato, add dijon and add onions.  Gimme the chips (BBQ Jimmy Chips) and a drink for the fountain (3 parts Diet Coke, 2 parts Sprite and 1 part Pink Lemonade) and let me sit down and enjoy.A few things I've noticed:1) We're weekday office lunching people, so I guess it's not unthinkable that EVERY TIME we come here, the same lady is working the register, the same girl is working the sandwich line, and the same dude is stuck at the end calling out orders as they finish.  The lady is always friendly and polite, but needs me to speak VERY SLOWLY when I say the "no tomato, add dijon, add onions" part so she can push those buttons, or else it comes out wrong.  The girl - has never said a word to me.  She's busy churning out sammiches "ridiculously fast".  The dude - I'm sorry that this is your job, but try not to call out my order in a way/intonation that lets me know how depressed you are and makes me FEEL sorry that this is your job.2) There is plenty of seating, but at tables designed for two.  We are a Lunch Crew of three, and this requires chair manipulation that may or may not violate fire codes and creates a table elsewhere now designed for a solo luncheoner.3) There are specific spots directly under air vents.  These are nightmare zones for wimpy skinny people who dislike "draftiness" and are known to comment "I should have brought a sweater."  These are miracle spots for people who are decent-sized men and tend to find themselves always feeling warm.  So yes, I grab those seats up to "rescue" the less-maniy in the Crew from the "nightmare" seats.4) The music selection here rocks.  There are few things as satisfying as busting out a chorus to a song you really enjoy hearing, even if you have food in your mouth.  There are also few things as embarrassing as having to apologize to the Lunch Crew for spitting sammich bits on them because you "really love that song".Aside from that, the place is pretty dern clean.  Food moves out at typical Jimmy John's pacing.  The food is Jimmy John's food - there's not much I can say about it.So yes, I'll keep coming back here with the Lunch Crew.  Unless Potbelly really feels like opening up in Bridgeport so I can truly be a brand-loyal boyfriend to Char O.

11.description: I would like to give this place a higher rating, but it seems like everytime I call or go in to order, they are CLOSED! Odd hours...also slow delivery.  Considering Jimmy Johns advertises "freaky fast" delivery, that is not cool.

8.description: Doesn't help that I don't like their sandwiches anyway. But once in a while I'll reluctantly agree to Jimmy Johns expecting mediocrity but at least expecting it fast. And even that much seems too hard for the Bridgeport outpost to handle.My office is .6 miles from here. I just google mapped it. And yet orders routinely take well over an hour. Yesterday they didn't show up for over and hour and a half--until we called and cancelled. When and if food does arrive, it is routinely wrong or accidentally mismatched with someone else's order, taking upwards of 15 minutes on one occasion to sort out. What's worse, no one on the phone seems to care whatsoever. Maybe this place is ok if you plan to eat in, but avoid at all costs for delivery.

3.description: Awesome service. Wasn't paying attention to what time it was and I showed up half an hour before they opened and they let me in and order a sandwich anyway. Thanks for accommodating!

14.description: A Sandwich place that delivers!!!! Finally we get something delivered in this neighborhood that actually can be healthy!  I always say its hard to review a national chain because they already have a set standard but....The place just opened and food portions are good. So hopefully they keep up the good work. Just picture Subway but better!!!I love this neighborhood now. I can get my newest movies delivered from The Video Strip and then get a good big sandwich from Jimmy John's both delivered. Talk about Dinner and a Movie!!!!!! WOO HOO!!!

4.description: We order delivery from this location, typically for a group of 3-5.  We've had a number of issues w/ this location over the past few months from completely wrong orders to significant delays in delivery - 1.5 hours in some cases and they are just 3-4 blocks away.Sounds like a staffing issue, but we also suspect that they stock all their delivery orders and then send them out w/ one guy, b/c they never can tell you a ETA on your delivery, except that the guy is 'in route'Fool us once......fool us a third time, strike three.  Will not be using them again.

1.description: GREAT PRICESLiving in the city can be a little tricky when it comes to filling up your tank. Prices can be anywhere from 30 to 60 cent higher then the outlying burbs and nearby states. I typically always pull out my Gas Buddy App and look at who has the best prices around me. This location showed up and was really low for being a city gas station.At first I thought it had to be a mistake because it was almost 20 cents cheaper then every station around. So I figured I was only 0.2 miles away and would do a price drive by. I was excited to see the low price and not the annoying sign that says price with car wash. Those should be illegal like false advertising. I pulled in and filled up. It was worth it to drive in when you are saving that much on a tank fill up.The location seems a little hidden. There is a store inside and I saw a sign for Subway, Dunkin Donuts and a Baskin Robins but did not walk in. So if you need a quick snack while you are filling up then this place is for you. Cheaper gas is the way to go in this $5 a gallon world we live in.

0.description: It's big, has a lot of fueling stations. They have a store in there. Also a dunkin donut and baskin robbins, and subway. So if you get hungry you can totally go into one of them. Parking on the side for customers. They have a air station too I believe and a car wash for sure.
